title: Vinted bags €340M, EIC Scaling Club welcomes 72 new members, and backlash to the term 'open banking'
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 45 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Munich-Based ExoMatter raises €1.7M to expedite materials science breakthroughs
author: Lucy Adams
summary: ExoMatter, a software for AI-driven materials research, has raised a €1.7M Pre-Seed funding round led by ZAKA alongside Vanagon VC, BayernKapital, 212 NexT, Bloomhaus Ventures, and four female super angels from encourageventures.

title: Fractile receives £5M from ARIA Scaling Compute programme
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK-based deeptech Fractile has £5M in funding from the Advanced Research + Invention Agency (ARIA) programme. Fractile is one of 12 projects to receive an award; ARIA is handing out almost £50M in total.

title: Yard Delivery bypasses sorting centre for more efficient, same-day deliveries
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: With the growth of e-commerce, various startups, including Sparqle, Starship Technologies, and Picnic, have been working to solve the last-mile delivery challenge.

title: Presto Tech Horizons Fund announces investment in three startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Presto Tech Horizons Fund has announced investment in its first three portfolio companies.

title: Last week recap: European tech companies raised over €774M, around 55% collected by 10 biggest deals
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €774 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: European tech fundraising dips in Q3 2024
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In Q3 2024, European tech companies raised €11 billion over 891 deals. Compared to the same period the year before, this number decreased for almost 60 per cent (€28 billion raised in Q3 2023), and around 50 per cent compared to Q3 2022 (€21.1 billion).

title: €4.2B invested in European tech in September
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: According to the Tech.eu database, European tech companies raised €4.2 billion over the course of September 2024 in some 347 deals.

title: European tech weekly recap: More than 65 tech funding deals worth over €1.1B
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €1.1 billion, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: The European tech ecosystem brought in over €1.3M in the last week of September
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: How General Catalyst plans to allocate its largest ever $8B global fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: VC firm General Catalyst has closed its largest global fund to date, raising approximately $8B of new capital across core venture capital and separately managed accounts to turbocharge its investments in key strategic areas.

title: Matteco raises €15M to lower the costs of green hydrogen
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Valencia cleantech startup Matteco has closed a €15 million Series A investment round.

title: Recyda raises €6.3M Series A for packing management platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Recyda has secured €6.3M in funding from Cusp Capital as lead investor, a prominent venture capital firm focused on early-stage investments in European technology companies.

title: Failed government talks lead to insolvency for eVTOL Lilium subsidiaries
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, German eVTOL company Lilium announced that two of its subsidiaries have decided to file for insolvency following unsuccessful talks with state and federal governments to solve its financial crisis. The company previously raised €1.4 billion in funding.

title: Moneybox and GoCardless join Revolut and Monzo in secondary share sale surge
author: John Reynolds
summary: A UK savings and investment app and a UK payments startup, two of the UK's brightest startups, are the latest fintechs to embark on secondary share sales.

title: AI platform Aether secures $2.5M Seed for rooftop solar panels
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Aether, the cutting-edge platform for rooftop solar, has raised $2.5M in a seed funding round led by noa (formerly A/O), with participation from Y Combinator, Collab Fund, Amino Capital, and Climate Capital. The funding will be used to accelerate Aether’s expansion and introduce a native solar design tool tailored for the European market.

title: University spinout numbers on the up after universities “drop” stakes
author: John Reynolds
summary: University spinout numbers are on the increase, prompted by universities lowering their stakes in startups, according to the co-founder of a deeptech startup spun out of a UK university.

title: Avenue Biosciences secures $2.5M Seed for AI-enhanced proteins
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Avenue Biosciences, a transatlantic biotechnology company specialising in novel protein engineering technologies, has raised a $2.5M seed financing round. Led by Voima Ventures, with additional participation from Inventure and US angel investors, the funding will accelerate the development of Avenue Biosciences platform, designed to improve the efficiency of protein production in the biopharmaceutical industry.

title: Fantasy tennis platform Fungiball secures €2.2M in pre-seed funding
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Fungiball, has raised €2.2M in pre-seed funding by a combination of private business angels including Adrien Dassault and Stephan Altmuller, with additional support from Cliff Capital and BPI France. The funds will be used to grow the tech team to scale the platform and enhance user experience, develop new features, including free-to-play modes and fiat payment options, and kick off Fungiball’s international expansion, starting  with a focus on North America.

title: Smart Green Shipping secures £1M from Drax
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Renewable energy leader Drax Group (Drax) and Smart Green Shipping are partnering to use innovative FastRig technology which could be used to decarbonise the shipping sector.

title: Picnic raises €355M: Edeka and Bill Gates Foundation Trust among investors
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Dutch online grocery store Picnic raised €355 million in investor capital as part of plans to expand its presence in France and Germany.

title: Jeff App's $2M funding boosts financial Inclusion in emerging markets
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Latvian financial marketplace operator for financial inclusion Jeff App, has secured $2 million in late-Seed financing

title: Indoor mapping app WYA secures £2.5M Pre-Seed for safer events
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Female-founded mesh technology platform Where You At has raised £2.5 million in Pre-Seed funding round to help make events safer

title: Insurtech Quantev raises €30M for medical claims analysis platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Qantev, an AI-powered platform transforming how health and life insurers manage claims, reduce costs and improve services –  has raised €30 million in a new funding round led by Blossom Capital, with participation from existing investors Elaia, Omnes and Raise Venture.

title: Nuclera raises $75M, 20VC's 3rd Fund soars to $400M, and EU push for a single pan-European startup entity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €774 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.  In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Lockall secures €155M, Syklo acquires Elastopoli, and the growing global gig economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €1.1 billion, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Atlas Metrics bags €12.2M to simplify ESG reporting and compliance
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: ESG platform Atlas Metrics has closed a €12.2 million Series A funding round.

title: Helsing raises €450M Series C for AI defence tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German defence AI company Helsing has raised €450 million in a Series C financing round led by General Catalyst. Elad Gil, Accel, Saab, Lightspeed, Plural, and Greenoaks participated. This brings the company’s funding to over $760 million.

title: French AI challenger Mistral AI raises €600M
author: Lucy Adams

title: HR unicorn Factorial raises $80M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Barcelona-based HR unicorn Factorial has raised $80M go-to-market investment from General Catalyst, wherein GC pays a significant portion of the cost of acquiring new customers.

title: Wheels, deals, and what we can expect from mobility this year
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: 2023 was undeniably been a tough year for scaleups in the mobility space. Companies like Clevr shuttles, Volta Trucks, and Uno filed for bankruptcy, while others struggled to bring their products to market or scale their customer base.

title: Tech.eu Summit London 2025 will take place on March 25th-26th!
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The 2025 Tech.eu Summit London 2025 will take place in London on March 25 - 26 at the Queen Elizabeth II Centre. It provides a critical means of fostering meaningful connections with Europe's most influential tech leaders, investors, and rising startups.

title: “We are accelerating our way” to profit, says GoCardless boss, who comes to work to relax
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO and co-founder of payments fintech GoCardless jokes that his work life is currently more relaxing than his home life.

title: Wayland Additive raises £4.2M to boost global expansion in metal 3D printing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK additive manufacturing company Wayland Additive today announced a £4.2 million fundraise to enable continued growth of global customers.

title: Revolut valued at a whopping $45bn following secondary share sale
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut has been valued at a whopping $45 billion, following an employee secondary share sale, making it Europe’s most valuable startup.

title: Keel Raises $6M to bridge the gap between no-code and ERP solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: London-based startup Keel has raised $6 million seed funding by developing a user-friendly platform for building custom operational software aimed at growing tech-enabled businesses.

title: Authologic raises $8.2M for unified e-ID verification platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Authologic, a global digital identity verification platform that streamlines KYC and AML processes with secure e-ID solutions, announced it has raised $8.2 million Series A.

title: Creative agency Poppins expands client portfolio with acquisition of Y2Change
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the House of Poppins digital creative agency announced the acquisition of award-winning specialist automotive and change management agency Y2Change for an undisclosed sum.

title: VARM raises €5.7M Seed to address skill gaps in building insulation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-based home insulation startup VARM has raised €5.7 million in Seed funding.

title: Oriole Networks raises $22m to reduce energy consumption of AI data centres
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Oriole Networks, which uses light to train Large Language Models with a lower energy consumption - has raised an additional $22M from leading investors to further scale its “super-brain” solution. The round was led by Plural with all existing investors – UCL Technology Fund, XTX Ventures, Clean Growth Fund, and Dorilton Ventures – reinvesting.

title: EGYM secures $200M, Mubadala acquires stake in Revolut, and the Hungarian tech surge
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.  In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Cult Mia's triple-digit growth leads to a $5M Seed Raise
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-based luxury retail platform Cult Mia announced the completion of an extension round, boosting its total seed raise to $5 million.

title: Techstar-backed Voovo reinvents learning with AI and €500K Pre-Seed investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Voovo, a Budapest AI-powered flashcard app designed to change how students and educators engage with learning content, has secured €500,000 Pre-Seed funding.

title: Berlin fintech bunch secures $15.5M Series A to transform private markets
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin fintech startup bunch has announced the successful closing of its $15.5 million Series A.

title: SoftBank acquires AI processor manufacturer Graphcore
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: SoftBank has acquired semiconductor manufacturer Graphcore. Under the deal, Graphcore becomes a wholly owned subsidiary of SoftBank and will continue to operate under the Graphcore name.

title: Spacetech alliance ICARUS secures €15M for rocket heat shields
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The ICARUS consortium - formed to develop inflatable heat shields to recover rocket stages from space and prepare for Mars missions - has received €15 million of EU funding.

title: Fintech Mimo raises £15.5M to develop financial management platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Mimo, a financial management startup that automates the admin behind B2B payments, has raised a £15.5M. The company is launching a new platform with this funding, which was led by Northzone.

title: Lumian's energy platform raises inaugural funding with a $3.2M valuation for energy optimisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week brings the recent news that energy platform Lumian has raised funds at a valuation of $3.2 million in its first funding round.

title: What happened at the Tech.eu Summit London 2024?
author: Gözde Ulukan
summary: The Tech.eu Summit London 2024, which brought together the global startup and investment community for two days, has ended.

title: French firm Qobra raises €10M to simplify sales commissions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French pay management company Qobra has secured €10 million in funding. The round was led by Singular and includes participation from Revenue Syndicate and long-term backer Breega who led Qobra's previous €5 million funding round.

title: Face.Match.Expert: Blazingly quick face recognition technology
author: Marcin Frej
summary: Not long ago, Tech.eu introduced Face.Match.Expert, showcasing its remarkable features, including an exceptional accuracy level of 99.98 per cent, the ability to handle 1,000 requests simultaneously, and a latency of just 0.1 milliseconds.

title: IoT of Animals: spacetech meets wildlife conservation with TALOS
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Wildlife populations are declining at an alarming rate, and scientists lack crucial data to understand and address this crisis.

title: Revolut finally gets UK banking licence
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut has finally secured its UK banking licence, more than three years after it applied with the regulators.

title: Finnish HRtech startup Workfellow announces shutdown amid challenges
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Finnish HRtech startup Workfellow has announced that effective immediately, the company is shuttering operations.

title: Mobility leaders Tier and Dott to merge, supported by €60M investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following months of speculation as to who the second party would be, today Tier Mobility and Dott have announced a merger. The deal will see both parties continue to operate under their brands, however, a shuffling of executive roles and HQ addresses is expected.

title: US/Polish VC SMOK Ventures leads €1 million round for Kyiv-based Finmap
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Kyiv's Finmap clinched a €1 million round recently led by SMOK Ventures, marking the US-Polish VC's first investment in a Ukrainian company.

title: Venturebeam launches free tool to help companies assess and improve their global impact
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Venturebeam, a VentureWave company, launched a proprietary ‘Venture Impact Score’, a free tool to help venture-backed companies determine and share their global impact.

title: Grosvenor UK invests in Europe's largest proptech VC noa
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Grosvenor’s UK property business has made its first investment in a property fund, noa.

title: Funding the future: Europe’s biggest cleantech fundraisers for the first three quarters of 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Cleantech companies play a crucial role in the European tech ecosystem by driving innovation and sustainability. They contribute to the reduction of carbon emissions and the transition to a circular economy, helping combat climate change.

title: Eleos raises €3.75M in Seed funding for digital life insurance solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today insurtech company Eleos has raised €3.75 million in a Seed round led by Fuel Ventures and Indico Capital.

title: Lakera raises $20M for GenAI security solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Zurich generative AI security company Lakera has raised $20 million in Series A funding, bringing its total funding to $30 million.

title: Fit 4 Start: New application round open for edition #15
author: Tech.eu
summary: Since its inception in 2015, Luxembourg’s renowned startup accelerator programme Fit 4 Start has attracted around 3,000 applications from various budding enterprises around the world ready to take their innovations to the next level.

title: Vsqared Ventures unveils €214M for European deeptech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Vsquared Ventures has closed largest European early-stage deeptech fund at €214M. The funding will be allocated to startups across AI, new space, robotics, energy transition, new computing and biotech.

title: JobCannon acquires Adsme to transform AI-driven job recruitment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ukraine-founded recruitment startup JobCannon officially announces its acquisition of Ukrainian startup Adsme.

title: GIN E-Bikes secures £510,000 investment for expansion and new models
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: 2023 was a challenging year for many mobility companies, but I wanted to share the recent news that GIN E-Bikes has raised £510,000 in investments.

title: Codesphere raises $18M for DIY software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Codesphere, a software provider that allows developers to customise existing cloud services, has raised an $18M Series A round from Creandum.

title: This startup has the solution to the Paris bed bug bedlam
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees news of a bed bug infestation all over Paris. And it's not limited to beds or even homes – bed bugs have been to the cinema and are riding high on national high-speed trains, the Paris Metro system, and ferries.

title: Plans for sandbox in Ireland welcomed but startups question why it has taken so long
author: John Reynolds
summary: The Central Bank of Ireland’s plan to launch a regulatory sandbox has been largely welcomed by startups but some are questioning why it’s taken the bank so long to launch it.

title: Impactpool secures $4M Series A to boost inclusive job opportunities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm HRtech platform Impactpool has raised $4 million in Series A funding,

title: Craft business platform Meisterwerk raises €6M for DACH expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The Berlin-based startup Meisterwerk App, a central operating platform for craft businesses, has raised €6M in Series A funding. Semapa Next, a venture capital firm that invests in European-based companies, led the round and was joined by I2BF, NEXXUS and existing investors Wecken & Cie, Speedinvest, seed + speed, Innovation Nest, Marcus Krüger Syndicate. Meisterwerk drives revenue growth and operating efficiency for over 600 craft businesses in the DACH region. The new funds will be used to further develop and optimise the company's digital solutions. The long-term goal of Meisterwerk is to become the central operating system for craft businesses in Europe.

title: Newcastle startup SQCDP secures £200,000 investment for manufacturing performance improvement
author: Dan Taylor
summary: SQCDP, a Newcastle-based startup focusing on the improvement of manufacturing performance, has announced that it has secured £200,000 from London’s Q Ventures as part of a larger, still open and ongoing funding raise.

title: Enifer secures €12M for first commercial-scale PEKILO® mycoprotein factory
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Finnish biotech startup Enifer was approved for a recycling and reuse investment grant of more than €12 million to build its first commercial-scale PEKILO® mycoprotein ingredient factory.

title: Berlin's Taxfix to collect rival Steuerbot from the latter's current owner Haufe Group
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: German publishing group Haufe is inching closer to a sale of its  subsidiary Steuerbot, a digital app for filing tax returns, to the unicorn value competitor based in Berlin: Taxfix.

title: Shopify of digital health, Huma, raised $80M Series D
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-headquartered healthcare AI company Huma has raised $80 million series D funding, bringing its funding to over $300 million.

title: Vytal raises €6.2M to expand reusable food packaging solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Reusable packing company Vytal has raised €6.2 million in a growth financing round, bringing the company's funding to over €18 million.

title: Kaspi.kz acquires majority share of Hepsiburada for $1.1B
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Kazakhstan fintech Kaspi.kz has announced it is acquiring the majority share of Hepsiburada for a sale price of $1.1 billion.

title: PURE EV and PDSL collaborate  to develop an electric 2-wheeler with a solid-state battery tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, PURE EV, Indian electric 2-wheeler scooter OEM, announced a joint venture with Pragmatic Design Solutions Ltd (PDSL) in the UK.

title: Irish analytics firm INQDATA secures £750,000
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Belfast headquartered data analytics startup INQDATA has raised £750,000 funding from the Investment Fund for Northern Ireland’s equity arm.

title: Dynelectro secures €11M for solid-oxide electrolysis technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sustainable Danish green hydrogen company Dynelectro has closed a  €11 million investment round.

title: Zeliq secures $10M Seed to automate sales management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Paris-based SaaS Zeliq has raised a further $10M to expand its operations into the US.

title: Finnish VCs raised well in 2023 as startups struggled
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Funding for startups in Finland dropped by half last year, new data shows, though venture capital firms had few problems raising for their funds.

title: The most interesting deals among the top five funded European countries in 2023
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: As noted in our 2023 Annual Report, the list of top funding countries across Europe is as expected.

title: €55M for European battery recycling, Accel closes $650M fund, and  Norwegian startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €426 million, and 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: How long should you stay in a new job when it's not working out?
author: Amanda Kavanagh
summary: Despite what your social media feeds might have you believe, not everyone is jumping out of bed in the morning and firing up their laptop with a beaming grin on their face.

title: Copenhagen-based startup Monta raises €80M to boost EV ecosystem
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Monta, a Copenhagen-based startup building an operating platform for EV ecosystem players, has today announced the close of its Series B round at €80 million. Now having accumulated €130 million since late 2020, the startup intends to invest further in R&D alongside expanding its partner network.

title: European payments giant Adyen reaffirms rejection of M&A, saying consolidation can be “very painful"
author: John Reynolds
summary: The Dutch payment giant Adyen today reaffirmed that the fintech was unlikely to pursue future growth through M&A, saying consolidation can be “very painful”.

title: SaaS Payt receives €55M from Partech for European expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Financial SaaS Payt has announced a minority investment from Partech, through its growth fund. Partech will invest €55 million in Payt. Described as a strategic partnership, the investment will accelerate Payt's expansion across Europe following previous expansions into Belgium, Germany, and the UK.

title: Scandi startup neobroker which changed its original name because it “sucked” raises $2.6 million
author: John Reynolds
summary: A Danish challenger neobroker, which changed its original name because it “sucked”, has raised $2.6 million in a funding round as it looks to replicate the success of disruptors like Robinhood and Trade Republic.

title: UK venture capital investment has been growing again as of H2 2023
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The 2024 could be the year of recovery for the UK according to the new analysis “UK Innovation - 2024 forward look” conducted by HSBC Innovation Banking and Dealroom. This conclusion comes as a result of the growth of venture capital investments in H2 2023 and the return of pre-pandemic levels.

title: Britishvolt finds new owner in Australian firm Recharge Industries, future of Northumberland factory uncertain
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Once upon a time, London-based Britishvolt had aspirations of championing sustainable, low-carbon batteries, and had a plan to realise a £3.8 billion manufacturing plant in Cambois, Northumberland. The factory was to be built on the site of the former Blyth Power Station, and would welcome some 3,000 jobs, particularly in an area of the UK that’s been relatively marginalised when compared to the South of England.

title: One Data raises €32M Series B extension for AI-powered data management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German Data management software company One Data, has raised a €32 million Series B extension round, co-led by leading European deep tech and software investors Vsquared  Ventures, Molten Ventures, and HV Capital.

title: Proxiad Health Tech: Driving Healthcare Innovation Through Digitalization
author: Tech.eu
summary: In January 2024, Proxiad SEE launched a new subsidiary, Proxiad Health Tech. A team of IT specialists and biomedical engineers is already working on various projects in the healthcare sector. The company's goals for this year include attracting new clients and further expanding its expertise and teams in this area.

title: dottxt raises $11.9M to enhance LLM interaction capabilities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: dottxt, an ecosystem and platform for interacting with LLMs, cannounced a combined raise of $11.9 million in funding, following the completion of both Pre-Seed and Seed rounds in just over seven months.

title: everyone energy raises over €1M to automate energy services
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based greentech startup everyone energy has raised a seven-figure seed financing round of an undisclosed amount. The round was led by High-Tech Gründerfonds (HTGF) and Cologne-based early-stage VC neoteq ventures.

title: More than six million Monzo customers have used open banking technology
author: John Reynolds
summary: More than six million Monzo customers have used open banking technology, according to Monzo’s head of payments.

title: Trail secures €1.45M Pre-Seed funding to enable trustworthy AI systems
author: Lucy Adams
summary: trail, a Munich-based startup, has raised a €1.45M pre-seed round for software that allows companies to automate governance workflows. The funding will be used to accelerate trail’s product development, expand its team, and strengthen its market position.

title: Spotify and Klarna top Scandi founder factory charts amid “talent war”
author: John Reynolds
summary: All of tech and beyond know of the so-called PayPal Mafia, luminaries such as Elon Musk, Max Levchin and Steve Chen, who went on to greater fame, setting up the likes of Tesla, Affirm and YouTube.

title: Nordic Bioproducts Group enters partnership to kickstart biodegradable plastic adoption
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Finnish Nordic Bioproducts Group (NBG) has partnered with leading bioplastics producer PTT MCC Biochem Co. Ltd to combine their expertise and advance development of high-performance, compostable bioplastics products.

title: The future of wireless charging
author: Roman Bysko
summary: In recent years, the surge in wireless adoption has captivated the technological landscape, positioning itself as the focal point for every battery-powered device.

title: Embedded accounting startup Ember raises £5m and lands HSBC deal
author: John Reynolds
summary: An embedded accounting startup has raised £5m and struck a deal with HSBC to provide digital tax services to hundreds of thousands of its SME customers amid the UK’s shift to a fully digital tax system.

title: 42Cap and Partech back scnd's €4M funding round for e-commerce solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French SaaS solution for services marketplaces scnd has raised a €4 million funding round. The round was backed by 42Cap and Partech.

title: Plural launches a new €400M fund to back world-changing startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Early-stage investment fund Plural announced today a new €400 million fund to back the most ambitious founders on a mission to change the world through technology.

title: Software sales platform trumpet secures $6.35M for US expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Software sales platform trumpet has raised $6.35 million Seed funding.

title: AimHi Earth secures £1M to provide employee sustainability training
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Climate and sustainability training provider AimHi Earth has secured £1M to "create 100 million nature-first employees”.

title: Guided Energy secures $5.2M for EV fleet management optimisation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Guided Energy, a Parisian startup focusing on the optimisation of EV fleet management, has raised $5.2 million in an investment round co-led by Sequoia and Dynamo Ventures.

title: Firsty raises €1.1M to faciliate cross-border mobile data usage
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Amsterdam-based startup Firsty announced a Pre-Seed growth funding of €1.1 million.

title: The questions founders should be asking potential investors
author: Talia Rafaeli
summary: European VC dealmaking failed to break through the €100 billion mark in 2022 as it had the previous year. While the estimated 12,000 deals still represented the second-highest year on record by a fair margin, the economic headwinds in the second half of the year changed the landscape for startups looking to build and scale their companies. That roughly $400 billion (€375 billion) of value from European tech companies was erased across both public and private markets in just 12 months was one of the sobering facts in Atomico’s annual State of European Tech report. It’s clear that the cash is not flowing as freely as it once was.

title: Cubbit raises $12.5M for geo-distributed cloud storage solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Geo-distributed cloud storage enabler Cubbit has raised $12.5 million in funding.

title: Vonovia and Founders Factory team up to accelerate affordable, climate-neutral housing tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Global venture studio and startup accelerator Founders Factory and German housing company Vonovia are developing a new venture studio that will deliver new tech innovations that support the scaling and availability of affordable and climate-neutral housing.

title: VidLab7's avatar-generating AI for sales raises €3.5M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI-driven sales software VidLab7 has raised €3.5 million Seed funding.

title: Danske Bank follows Citi and BNP to back United Fintech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based United Fintech has secured funding from the Nordic Danske Bank, its third institutional investor. The amount invested has not been disclosed to Tech.eu.

title: UK's global payments neobank Sokin secures investment from Morgan Stanley
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Investment funds managed by Morgan Stanley Expansion Capital have acquired a stake in UK-headquartered global payments Neobank Sokin.

title: Iconic AI raises $4M for AI game development
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Iconic AI, the London-based games studio which specialises in AI-driven game development, has closed its oversubscribed $4M Pre-seed round. The round was led by HodlCo, with participation from FOV Ventures, Interface Capital, Deepwater Asset Management, and scout funds from Sequoia and Atomico. Angel investors included former senior executives at DeepMind, OpenAI, Disney, Tencent and Microsoft.

title: Climate tech vorteX-io secures €2.9M for flood risk analysis
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Climate tech vorteX-io has raised €2.9M to provide hydrological data provider for sustainable water management during droughts and floods. The Toulouse-based startup offers businesses flood risk alerts and water resource optimization.

title: TaxDown raises €5 million to transform the tax sector in Spain and Latin America
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Madrid startup TaxDown, which is disrupting the tax sector in Spain and Latin America, has sealed a new €5 million round of investment.

title: The AI search wars between Google and OpenAI have begun
author: Frederik Pedersen
summary: Google has made a lot of changes to its SEO algorithm this past year. It’s no surprise to see the advertising and search engine giant doing so. It’s under huge threat from AI content and like any dominant party, it doesn’t take threats to its monopoly kindly.

title: Companion.energy raises €2.1M for real-time energy control platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Energy software company Companion.energy, has raised €2.1 million from international investors.

title: Zilch boss gives thumbs up to London as fintech startup hub
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO and co-founder of BNPL firm Zilch today gave a resounding thumbs up to London as a startup hub while deeming those fintechs not leveraging AI as “odd”.

title: TravelPerk secures $104M investment led by SoftBank Vision Fund 2
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Business travel platform TravelPerk announced today that it has closed an additional $104 million investment led by SoftBank Vision Fund 2.

title: Romania’s tech ecosystem: Growth and innovation in focus
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Romania, while not leading the region, has shown noticeable growth in recent years. A more interconnected support system has emerged, including accelerators, VC funds, and startup networks that foster collaboration nationwide. This influx of influential newcomers in the Romanian startup landscape highlights the country's potential to nurture entrepreneurial innovation and expand globally.

title: Infinite Orbits raises €12M to extend the lifespan of satellites
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Infinite Orbits, a French New Space In-Orbit Services company has raised its first fundraising round, a €12M round led by Newfund Capital along with the EIC Fund.

title: Dude, where's my green chemical revolution? DUDE CHEM raises €6.5M in greener pharma
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today green chemistry startup DUDE CHEM closed a €6.5 million Seed round.

title: Oxford Instruments snaps up France’s First Light Imaging in €19M deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oxford Instruments, a UK-based provider of technologies to industrial companies and scientific researchers has acquired French scientific camera specialist First Light Imaging in a deal worth up to €19 million.

title: It’s a konfetti party as the marketplace for local classes raises €2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based konfetti has raised €2 million in a seed funding round provided by Peak, Angel Invest, and the Atomico Angel Fund. The investment will be used to accelerate the startups’ growth as it aims to become the go-to destination for local classes and team-building activities across Europe.

title: Syntetica raises €4.2M to close the loop in nylon recycling
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Nylon recycling startup Syntetica has raised €4.2 million in Seed funding.

title: BrewDog’s James Watt says goal of his new startup is “becoming a unicorn”
author: John Reynolds
summary: BrewDog’s James Watt today said the goal of his new startup, Social Tip, is “becoming a unicorn”, as the startup doubled its crowdfunding fundraising target, hitting the £2m mark, in just over a day.

title: Belgian startup Timefold raises €6M for planning optimisation platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belgian AI software startup Timefold has raised €6 million from Lakestar and prior seed investor Smartfin, to accelerate the development and commercialisation of its AI-powered planning optimisation platform.

title: Using milk peptides to treat depression
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Research from biotech startup Lactocore shows that a short peptide named LCGM-10 found in cow’s milk could be used in depression treatment due to its with strong stimulatory effects that rival those of caffeine.

title: Traveltech Exotica secures €60M Series D
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Exoticca, a traveltech platform for multi-day tour packages, has announced today that it has closed a €60 million Series D round led by Quadrille Capital. New investors All Iron and ICF and existing investors 14W, Mangrove, Bonsai, Sabadell and Aldea also participated.

title: B2B Software microfund BOOOM to invest €17M in 30 European early-stage startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Newly launched microfund BOOOM today announced plans to invest €100,000 to €400,000 in approximately 30 companies in angel-only rounds or at Pre-seed and Seed stages across Europe.

title: Insurtech Continuity raises €10M for ML-powered risk detection
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Continuity, a software provider that provides risk intelligence for professional and commercial P&C insurers, has raised a €10M Series A round. Led by 115K and supported by historical investors Elaia and Bpifrance through their Digital Venture fund, the funding follows an initial capital injection of €5M in 2021.

title: Clyde hydrogen raises £1M for hydrogen production tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Scottish cleantech Clyde Hydrogen has raised over £1M for its decoupled electrolyser technology that aims to increase the production of hydrogen safely at scale and at low cost.

title: The top 12 biggest European tech deals month by month this year
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Wrapping up the year, here are 2023's biggest deals in terms of investment volume per month.

title: Harbiz secures €5M funding to expand fitnesstech platform internationally
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Fitness technology platform Harbiz today announced that it has closed a €5 million funding round to strengthen its international presence, focusing on consolidating its growth in the UK and German markets.

title: In memoriam — Cowboy’s Karim Slaoui
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's with great sadness that we share the news that Karim Slaoui, co-founder of Belgian e-bike company Cowboy, has died aged 36.

title: OctaiPipe raises £3.5M in Pre-Series A funding for edge AI platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, OctaiPipe, the end-to-end Edge AI platform for industrial IoT, has announced raising £3 million in pre-Series A funding and a £500,000 grant from Innovate UK.

title: Can the IOTA Foundation solve blockchain’s credibility crisis?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In the 2010s, IOTA was one of the most exciting European startups in blockchain tech — especially for anyone interested in industrial IoT like myself.

title: Last 3 days to the Tech.eu Summit London 2024!
author: Gözde Ulukan
summary: With just the last three days remaining until the Tech.eu Summit London 2024, anticipation is mounting for what promises to be one of the most influential technology events in UK and Europe this year. Scheduled for May 16-17 at the iconic Old Billingsgate, the summit will gather the brightest minds in tech to discuss the future of the industry and explore new business opportunities.

title: Romanian-founded Kubeark nets $2.8 million pre-seed to help software enterprises scale
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UiPath almunus Bogdan Nedelcov, who hails from Bucharest, co-founded New York-based Kubeark in a bid to "challenge the status quo" in scaling up software startups.

title: Syndicate One announces €4.8M initial close of its next fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, angel investment group Syndicate One announced the completion of an initial €4.8 million close of its debut fund after opening its capital to external investors for the first time in 2023.

title: Porsche acquires majority shares of Croatia’s Greyp Bikes, folds company into Porsche eBike Performance
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Founded by Croatian serial entrepreneur Mate Rimac, the one in the same as Rimac Autombili, as of late November 2021, Porsche already held a minority stake in Greyp.

title: doinstruct raises €7.6M for digital skills training
author: Lucy Adams
summary: doinstruct, a leading platform for frontline worker training, has raised €7.6M from Creandum to continue scaling its product and team.

title: $250M for food delivery giant Getir, new fund for dual-use tech, and parental support for founders
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €1.8 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: New CEO of Northmill Bank appointed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swedish Northmill Bank has appointed Julie Chatterjee as its new CEO.

title: Microsoft, NVIDIA, and Softbank invest $1.05B in autonomous driving company Wayve
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: British company Wayve has announced a $1.05 billion Series C investment round led by SoftBank Group, with contributions from new investor NVIDIA and existing investor Microsoft.

title: Talent2Go's HRtech gets Allygatr funding boost, empowering Dual Students
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin HR investor allygatr has acquired a stake in the startup Talent2Go — although the exact amount was not disclosed, the Berlin-based company is investing a six-figure sum.

title: Carbon compliance platform kolum raises €2.1M Pre-Seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based B2B startup kolum has secured €2.1M in Pre-Seed funding for its carbon regulation compliance platform. The platform helps EU companies ensure CBAM compliance and aids third-country manufacturers in calculating and sharing emission data accurately using the CBAM-specific calculation method. The new capital will accelerate product development and support more companies within and outside the EU.

title: ARX Robotics bags €9M to develop unmanned military vehicles
author: Lucy Adams
summary: ARX Robotics, a manufacturer of scalable robotic systems for mass deployment in both defence and commercial applications, has raised €9M in seed funding. Funding was led by the NATO Innovation Fund and supported by Project A Ventures and Discovery Ventures.

title: Enatom raises €900,000 for VR simulations of human anatomy
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German medtech spinout Enatom has received €900,000 to develop its holographic models of human anatomy, which give medical students with a VR headset the ability to study anatomical structures in 3D.

title: Climatetech startups to drive global change this year
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In 2024, sustainability (and cleantech and climatetech) startups hold unprecedented significance in leading innovation in the goal of net zero.

title: Virtual power plant unicorn 1KOMMA5° doubles its revenue
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees energy platform operator 1KOMMA5° announce its preliminary business figures for 2023.

title: French firm Nano Corp secures $4.2M for innovative network detection and response
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French cybersecurity firm Nano Corp has secured a $4.2 million Seed funding round. The round was led by G+D Ventures, existing investor Elaia Partners and includes participation from Cyber K1, and Inovia Capital Precede Fund I.

title: Morressier secures $16.5M investment to bolster fight for research integrity
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Morressier, a Berlin-based startup that provides publishers with workflows that ensure research integrity, has announced the close of a new investment round at $16.5 million. The company intends to use the capital to bolster go-to-market activities as well as evaluate strategic acquisition opportunities.

title: Hexarad secures €13M for radiology workflow software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: London radiology tech company Hexarad has secured €13 million in funding.

title: Start networking ahead of the Summit with the Tech.eu Events app
author: Lucy Adams
summary: If you’re gearing up for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 next week and are too dizzied by our extensive lineup of Venture Capitalists and founders to know where to start, there is an app developed by -you guessed it- Webrazzi Technology team.

title: TeamSystem snaps up Growens' email service platform in €70 million deal
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Italy-based TeamSystem, an enterprise software and training provider, has agreed a €70 million cash free, debt free deal to acquire the MailUp email and marketing suite from Milan-HQed Growens.

title: Credit building fintech Wollit targets Series A funding round up to £8M
author: John Reynolds
summary: A London-headquartered fintech backed by Spain’s second-biggest bank which has pivoted from providing financial assistance to freelancers to offering credit builder services is gearing up to raise as much as £8 million in a Series A funding round.

title: IVEX raises seed funding to help more auto OEMs create robust autonomous systems
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Belgian startup IVEX has raised seed funds to support its software development platform for autonomous driving and ADAS systems.

title: Czech home improvement platform Adam secures €3M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Adam, a Czech platform that connects tradespeople with customers, without the hassle of long wait times and confusing price lists, has raised €3M to expand beyond Europe and launch new trades.

title: Feather raises €6M to simplify Insurance for expats in Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Expat insurance startup Feather has secured €6 million in funding, bringing its funding to €10 million.

title: PFR Ventures invests €47M in 4 new Polish early-stage VC funds
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: PFR Ventures, Poland’s Development Financial Institution that provides capital to venture capital and private equity funds, has invested in four new early-stage VC funds: 24Ventures, Digital Ocean Ventures Starter, Hard2beat, and Tar Heel Capital Pathfinder

title: Meatly protein-free medium enables affordable, scalable cell-cultivated meat
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cell-cultivated meat company Meatly announces the development of a protein-free culture medium  — the first of its kind in the cultivated meat industry. This marks a significant step forward in the quest for animal-free, cost-effective cultivated meat production.

title: Inrupt's Data Wallet realises Sir Berners-Lee's data ownership dream
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: What do you do next after you invent the World Wide Web? You create the future of the web — one that is in line with your original aims.

title: Lithuania: Vibrant and rapidly growing hub of innovation
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Lithuanian tech ecosystem is a vibrant and rapidly growing hub of innovation, attracting attention from around the globe. Known for its strong emphasis on education and digital literacy, Lithuania boasts a highly skilled workforce, particularly in IT and engineering fields.

title: Italian Founders Fund launch debut €50M fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Italian Venture Capital fund Italian Founders Fund (IFF) has raised its debut €50M fund, which launches today. Its strategy is to home in on founders at the the pre-seed and seed stage both operating in Italy and abroad.

title: German startup Scavenger AI raises €1.1M for  its AI business consultant
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German data analytics and AI startup Scavenger AI has secured € 1.1 million Pre-Seed funding to enable companies to perform complex data analyses in just a few seconds.

title: Top 10 most-read stories this year
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As we draw a line under 2023, a year with considerable ups and downs, let's have a look at the top 10 stories you’ve been reading at Tech.eu.

title: Corporate fintech Neo says it can grow European business without external funding after hitting profit
author: John Reynolds
summary: Barcelona-based corporate neobank Neo has hit profitability and says it is unlikely to need external funding to grow its business in Europe.

title: Hamburg’s 1KOMMA5° has raised €430 million - and just became a unicorn at just 23 months old
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Hamburg’s 1KOMMA5° has raised a €430 million series B round, and has shot into the coveted a unicorn spot in just 23 months. The round was led by G2VP and Ben Kortlang will join the board as vice chairman.

title: Reel secures €5M for its industry-transforming  Power Purchase Agreements
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, next-generation electricity supplier Reel announced a €5M Seed investment led by Transition, with participation from existing shareholders.

title: Regulatory chief at top German neobank N26 to exit
author: John Reynolds
summary: One of the most senior executives at Germany's top challenger bank N26 is leaving the fintech after two years.

title: Corlytics acquires Deloitte UK's regtech platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Regulatory intelligence publisher Corlytics, which provides content and automated policy compliance, has acquired a digital regtech platform from Deloitte UK.

title: Oxford Quantum Circuits welcomes aboard a fresh £869,000, sets sail for Japan
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oxford Quantum Circuits, or OQC as us OG’s call them, has raised a fresh £869,000 in a new funding round. Only slightly less than their hefty $46 million Series A that was announced last July, the new capital is aimed at helping the startup ramp up expansion plans in Asia, specifically Japan, where the demand for quantum computers across multiple sectors, including financial services and pharmaceuticals is reaching a fever pitch.

title: Full Venue raises €2M increasing audience monetisation in sports and events
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today sports and events company Full Venue, secured €2 million in investment.

title: A dialogue with Ukrainian VC and PE association chairman Andrey Kolodyuk
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A year on from Russia's brutal invasion, Ukraine's VC community is calling for its European partners to continue stepping up to the plate.

title: Hey Savi secures £2.2M for fashion search platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK fashion search and recommendation platform Hey Savi announced today that it has secured £2.2 million in investment.

title: Tharsus Group Invests £8M  in VersaTile's warehouse automation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Robotics company VersaTile Automation has raised £8 million in Seed investment from Tharsus Group, and is today launching its automation technology platform to enhance productivity in UK warehouses.

title: Symphera Raises €2.4M for surgical tool-switching
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Munich medtech company Symphera has closed a €2.4 million Seed financing round. Symphera develops advanced surgical systems for laparoscopic procedures that automate tool-switching, making manual instrument changes obsolete.

title: Edtech Futura secures €14M for AI-driven personalised learning
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Edtech company Futura announced today that it has successfully raised €14 million in Series A funding.

title: Lead Ventures launches €100M fund for CEE startups
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Lead Ventures has announced the launch of its new €100M fund, targeting startups in Central and Eastern Europe (CEE), a region whose tech sector has been steadily growing in recent years.

title: Kipu Quantum acquires Anaqor's quantum platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German Kipu Quantum has acquired the German quantum computing platform PlanQK, built and commercialised by Anaqor AG. The move follows Kipu Quantum’s successful €11.4 million second closing of the seed funding round led by HV Capital and DTCF in late 2023.

title: Creandum launches €500M fund, Croatia challenges China and GenAI safety pays off
author: Lucy Adams
summary: This week our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €632 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours and related news stories across Europe.

title: 10 Dutch startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In 2023, startups from the Netherlands raised around €6.1 billion over 346 deals. As stated in our Annual Report, these numbers put the Netherlands in third place among European countries by the total raised amount.

title: The top 10 European AI companies of this year
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: As we highlighted in our 2023 Annual Report, the year behind us will go in the record books as the year the world sat up and took notice of Artificial Intelligence. Will the hype cycle continue into 2024, or will the dust settle? We're already seeing the emergence of power players in this new field, how will entrepreneurs, investors, and regulators follow suit? All this remains to be seen, but one we'll be keeping a keen eye on.

title: TrusTrace secures $24M for supply chain traceability
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Product traceability and compliance company TrusTrace today announced a $24 million growth investment led by Circularity Capital, a specialist investor in businesses that enable the circular economy, with participation from existing investors Industrifonden and Fairpoint Capital. This brings the company’s funding to over €30 million.

title: Workers now spending two days a week on emails and meetings
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: Workers like remote work. It offers them a myriad of benefits that go beyond the obvious: sure, when you work from home you definitely spend less money on pricey lunchtime salads and take-out coffees, and you generally have more time to yourself, as the commute is factored out.

title: Germany's ChargeX charges up for European expansion with €11.5 million in the tank
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German EV charging firm ChargeX is tackling the bottleneck of power grids and the shortage of skilled workers with what it claims is a plug-and-play type solution, requiring no installation specialist. It wants to tap into the predicted 76%-88% increase in demand for charge points in Germany by 2030.

title: Promethean Particles secures £8M for carbon capture materials production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Carbon capture materials company Promethean Particles has closed an £8 million financing round.

title: FabricNano partners with Veolia for more efficient carbon capture
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based biotech FabricNano and SaaS Veolia have announced the trial of carbon capture tech that has been enabled by their partnership. Carbon capture is a way to remove carbon dioxide from the atmosphere by capturing the CO2, transporting it and then permanently storing it deep underground.

title: ‘Business in a box’ service Jeff raises €90 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Valencia-based entrepreneurship-for-all startup Jeff has raised €90 million in a new funding round comprised of a mix of equity and debt. The new capital was provided by DXVentures, Clean Ventures, Stelac, Prism, and existing partners including Nalpa and Alcor, led by the company's chairman, Javier Rubió.

title: FLEXeCHARGE secures Seed funding for its  load and energy management services
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today FLEXeCHARGE, a supplier of load and energy management services to charge point operators and charging solution providers, closed a Seed funding round.

title: Ukrainian developer-led software company Aimprosoft shares its strategies for resiliency and future-proofing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's not every day I talk to a Ukrainian company where the CEO casually tells me that on the 24th of February last year, as staff were frantically on the move to safer places, the sales department was doing a deal from their car.

title: CORE offers athletes body temperature monitoring and heat score to prep for hot Olympics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: With the summer Olympic games just weeks away in France, there are concerns about a potential heatwave, which would significantly risk the health of athletes.

title: Transition VC to bridge 'gap between traditional tech, climate science, the corporate sector, and policy'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: There’s a new climate fund in town. Transition VC says it is ‘born out of London, with two pieds-à-terre in Reykjavik and New York’ – it knows no boundaries apparently.

title: Türkiye's tech boom: A golden opportunity for startup founders and skilled professionals
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: As an Australian migrant living in Europe, I am often asked where I would live next after Germany. While South East Europe is great, there’s a load of great opportunities beyond its borders and one of the countries to keep an eye on is Türkiye.

title: Nasdaq-listed Lilium raises $192 million in shares sale and matching contribution from Tencent
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following the company’s announcement of intentions to raise $250 million back in May, Munich-based eVTOL jet maker Lilium has hit the mark.

title: Syntropic Medical secures €1.1M for drug-resistant depression treatment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Medtech company Syntropic Medical, has raised €1.1 million in funding from The Austrian Research Promotion Agency (FFG) ​​ for its light-based brain stimulation device to treat drug-resistant neuropsychiatric disorders such as major depressive disorder.

title: Solar car company Squad Mobility receives €1.35M grant
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Dutch Solar car company Squad Mobility has been granted €1,35 million as part of a  as part of a €12 million tender won by the GIANTS consortium.

title: Danish BlackWood Ventures secures €14M  for early stage startups
author: Lucy Adams
summary: BlackWood Ventures, a network and technology-driven venture capital fund, announced today the 2nd closing of its debut fund, BlackWood Ventures Fund I, raising a total of DKK 110 million.

title: Sana releases its AI assistant for free
author: Lucy Adams
summary: B2B SaaS Sana has launched its chatbot Sana AI for free following a year when the product was under development and available on a paid tier.

title: Why OpenAI signals the start of the post-Christensen startup world
author: Patrick Murphy
summary: Microsoft hiring and un-hiring OpenAI’s Sam Altman last month was a bright red warning sign to entrepreneurs who hope one day to compete with Big Tech. As a venture capitalist looking to back future disruptors, this fills me with dread.

title: Julius Luehr appointed Partner at Munich's Acton Capital
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich’s Acton Capital has today announced the appointment of Julius Luehr to the position of Partner.

title: German start-up Cakewalk emerges from stealth with a €3 million fundraise and access solution for SMBs
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German start-up Cakewalk, an identity and access management solution for SMBs had popped its head above ground again with the news of a €3 million funding round. The round was led by Fly Ventures, with participation from Seedcamp, Possible Ventures, and angel investors.

title: German healthcare investor SHS Capital acquires majority stake in Dutch firm CAM Bioceramics
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German healthcare investor SHS Capital has acquired a majority stake in Dutch firm CAM Bioceramics to support and accelerate future growth. The investment, from the SHS VI fund, also included ING Corporate Investments and other co-investors.

title: MetaMask, Mastercard, and Baanx launch "world's first" crypto payment card
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today MetaMask, Mastercard, and Baanx (Crypto Life) launched the pilot of MetaMask Card — the "world's first" Mastercard payment card that enables direct spending from your MetaMask wallet.

title: Electricity Maps raises €5M for time-optimised energy usage
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Copenhagen-based climatetech Electricity Maps raised €5m to accelerate the data-driven decarbonization of the electricity grid. The investment comes from climate-focused funds Transition and Revent.

title: 3 European tech companies that are hiring right now
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: With tech layoffs coming thick and fast at the moment––this week both PayPal and HubSpot announced job cuts––the wider macroeconomic climate is having a knock-on effect on the stock prices and cash reserves of some of the world’s biggest technology firms.

title: €4M funding boost for einwert's real-time property valuation platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today real estate value management platform einwert signed a new financing round of over €4 million, bringing the company’s funding to over €6 million.

title: Inside Ukraine's N1 fintech fund
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Ukraine's fundraising landscape will take some time to get back up and running again, says Nykyta Izmaylov, an entrepreneur now helming the fintech specialised VC fund N1.

title: €40M first close by Greencode Ventures to boost Europe’s green startups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Helsinki-based venture capital firm Greencode Ventures has announced the first close of its fund that focuses on European startups that are accelerating the green transition. The firm's first close is nearly €40 million with an aim for a final fund size of €60-100 million.

title: Sewts secures €7M Series A funding to transform the processing of easily deformable materials
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Robotics startup sewts has successfully completed a  €7 million Series A funding round.

title: CEO of Lanistar exits amid report of winding-up petition
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO of a UK-based payment provider Lanistar has left the fintech. The departure of Jeremy Baber comes amid a report that Lanistar has been served with a winding-up petition by its London landlord over unpaid rent.

title: Norway’s Freyr Battery welcomes €100 million grant via EU Innovation Fund, presses forward with Giga Arctic project
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oslo-based Freyr Battery has received a €100 million grant via the EU Innovation Fund aimed at supporting the ongoing development of the company’s Giga Arctic project.

title: “Maybe some things got a little wobbly,” says Techstars CEO addressing criticism about its corporate culture
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO and co-founder of Techstars, the well-known US startup accelerator which has backed thousands of startups, has admitted that “maybe things got a little wobbly” as he addresses criticism over its corporate culture.

title: lemon.markets secures €12M for Brokerage-as-a-Service platform expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Brokerage-as-a-service platform lemon.markets has secured an additional €12 million in funding as it aims to open 100 million brokerage accounts.

title: Retail SaaS Dealt targets circular economy after €6M raise
author: Lucy Adams
summary: French SaaS Dealt has raised €6M euros to accelerate retailers' move towards the service and circular economy. Specializing in delivery, installation and maintenance for retailers, Dealt simplifies the shopping experience while offering new revenue streams. It now wants to expand towards the circular economy.

title: Veremark secures $3M for enhanced global background screening services
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Veremark, a UK global background screening company, has secured $3 million in a Pre-Series B round, bringing its funding to over $16 million.

title: Visma skyrockets with additional €3B, and over €6.3B for the European tech last week
author: Dan Taylor

title: Runnr.ai secures €1M funding for automated hotel guest engagement
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Conversational guest engagement startup Runnr.ai announced this week that it has raised €1 million in funding.

title: Marketplace and e-commerce management platform ChannelEngine acquires fellow Dutch competitor Vendiro
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Two Dutch marketplace management firms have joined forces as ChannelEngine acquires competitor Vendiro. Financials of the deal have not been disclosed.

title: A birthday, a milestone and a brand new CFO for IPO...it's all happening at Bolt
author: Fiona Alston
summary: It’s all happening at Estonian founded mobility firm Bolt this week. Just as it celebrates a birthday - ten years since founder Markus Villig started the company as a ride-hailing app - its brought in a shiny new CFO to begin its preparations for IPO.

title: Munich AI startup Voiceline secures €2.4M Seed funding to transform field sales
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Munich AI startup Voiceline has closed its Seed Funding round, securing €2.4 million in funding, bringing the company’s total funding to €4.2 million.

title: UK fintech Abound secures up to £800M to expand access to fair credit
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: London-based credit technology company Abound has announced a new financing round of debt and equity combined which in aggregate, according to the company, could extend up to £800 million, expanding total funding to up to £1.3 billion. In March last year the company secured over £500 million in debt and equity funding.

title: The Tech.eu Summit line-up keeps growing stronger: Here are the 10 latest additions to our list of confirmed speakers
author: Robin Wauters
summary: The place to be on 24 May will be Brussels Expo, where amazing speakers from all corners of the world will join us on stage to assess the strengths and opportunities of the European tech ecosystems, and offer ways to meet their challenges collectively.

title: Contents.com raises $18M for AI-powered multilingual content generation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Contents.com, a Milan-based startup that uses AI to offer multi-lingual content generation services has raised $18 million in a Series B round. The capital will be used to drive global expansion efforts as well as further develop the company’s offer, including orchestration functionality.

title: The experience of enterprise software during war
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: We talk to many startups here at Tech.eu, but I wanted to learn what the experience was like in a large corporate enterprise during the Russian invasion.

title: How Lisbon is turning into the next global tech hub
author: Cody Candee
summary: Our biggest news in the past few months has been the company’s relocation to Lisbon, from San Francisco. We still get asked a lot about why we decided to open our European HQ in Portugal having begun life in Silicon Valley.

title: Capita agrees to sell travel and events businesses to Clarity Travel in £36.5M deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Business IT services firm Capita has reached a sale agreement with Clarity Travel for Capita's travel and events businesses Agiito and Evolvi. The deal is said to be 'an enterprise value of £36.5 million on a cash free, debt free basis'.

title: Estonian Patchstack raise $5M Series A for open-source cybersecurity tool
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Estonian cybersecurity startup Patchstack have raised a new $5M funding round to further their mission of covering the entire lifecycle of open-source security to provide the fastest mitigation to the emerging security threats.

title: BoxxDocks gets £150,000 from British Design Fund to scale its collapsible box BaaS solution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based logistics start-up BoxxDocks offers a shipping solution which improves efficiency and reduces the carbon footprint. First off its smart shipping boxes, which are 100% recyclable and British-made, can reduce down to the size of its contents meaning you are no longer shipping empty space. Tags on the boxes turn this solution in to Box as a Service (just when you thought we’d found all the aas’s!). The tags, readable by any Bluetooth device, turn this into an IoT solution securely transmitting the data of the box so companies can mapping their entire supply-chains on the BoxxDocks cloud.

title: Plum smart money app raised £13.4M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK fintech Plum has raised £13.4 million in funding from institutional investors, bringing the compani'es funding to over £73 million.

title: AMD acquires Europe's largest private AI lab, Silo AI, in $665M deal
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AMD today announced the signing of a definitive agreement to acquire Silo AI, the largest private AI lab in Europe, in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $665 million.

title: Dataform Lab raises £1.1M for offsite construction via software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Construction tech startup Dataform Lab raised a £1.1M seed round which will be used to invest in offsite construction via its software platform. The round was led by led by Marathon Venture Capital.

title: Gilion raises €10M to fund growth-stage companies
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swedish financing platform Gilion — formerly Ark Capital — has raised a €10M equity funding round, bringing its total equity raised to €40M.

title: This week in European tech: Visma skyrockets, Delivery Hero regroups, and AI is not an inventor
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €6.3 billion, and over 25 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Camera equipment sharing platform Gearo closes down
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today brings the sad news that camera equipment-sharing platform Gearo is discontinuing on March 31, 2024.

title: Welsh fintech Mypinpad raises $13 million for its 'secure payments on the move' solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based Mypinpad, a secure mobile transactions software solutions company, has raised $13 million in a round led by Crossfin Holdings. The investment will fuel expansion of the SaaS offering and open doors to relationships with Crossfin’s other portfolio companies.

title: Cultivated meat and seafood tasting is coming to The Netherlands thanks to lobbying by Meatable, Mosa Meat and HollandBIO
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today it is a step forward for the future of food in The Netherlands.

title: Parking tech startup Wemolo secures debt financing from CIBC Innovation Banking
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German parking tech company Wemolo has received a debt financing package from CIBC Innovation Banking.

title: Dendra systems secures $15M Series B for reseeding at scale
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Oxford-based climate tech Dendra Systems has secured $15.76M in Series B Funding to develop its ecology platform which uses AI and drones to restore and rehabilitate huge swathes of land by reseeding.

title: 2023 and 2024 are set to become strong vintage venture years: here is why
author: Alan Vaksman
summary: The industry is rife with speculation over what the next 11 months hold for venture capital and the startup scene. The drop in valuations in 2022, alongside prolonged economic volatility, had led many to conclude that this will be something of a barren year. Though we are unlikely to see the “gold rush” madness of 2021 any time soon, I disagree that 2023 will be a year of doom and gloom for the venture industry. Quite the opposite. There is strong evidence to support the view that both 2023 and 2024 will be years remembered for exciting startups and landmark VC deals.

title: Whispp gives voice to people with speech impediments and raises €750,000 Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Dutch AI  startup Whispp, announced it has secured a €750,000 Seed round.

title: Zibra ai creates mesmerising game development tools for greater immersion in virtual worlds
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: We always hear about the potential for AI and machine learning to transform game development. But now one Ukrainian company is turning special effects like liquids, explosions, and fire into something spectacular.

title: In 10 years' time, fintechs won't be replacing banks
author: Jeremy Attuil
summary: In recent months, there has been a great deal of market speculation about the resilience of fintechs, their competitiveness in the face of banks, and their ability to stay the course or even survive in turbulent times. This debate always seems to resurface in times of crisis.

title: Swiss startup SAEKI launches with $2.3M seed funding for industrial micro-factories
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Swiss startup SAEKI has launched from stealth with a $2.3 million seed funding round to create fully automated plants with industrial robots using 3D technology to create anything from wings for aircraft to construction site installations.

title: Cybersecurity firm EasyDMARC raises $20M Series A
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Email security firm EasyDMARC today announced it has raised $20M in a Series A funding round led by New York-based firm Radian Capital. The investment marks a significant milestone for the company, as it continues to expand its operations and strengthen its position in the global email security space.

title: Going underground - Delta g raises £1.5 million to commercialise its quantum sensors
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based Delta g says that it can create a ‘Google Maps for the underground’ for ‘complex subsurface and unseen locations' and claims it has 'produced the world’s first field-proven quantum sensor for gravity gradiometry’. It says its sensors are 'highly transportable and inherently immune to vibrational noise, driving down the financial cost of surveys and enabling more rapid measurements with greater sensitivity' proving useful in 'preemptively identifying hazards, and unlocking measurements in complex or time-limited environments, even when dealing with variable ground conditions'.

title: Gcore secures $60M for advanced Edge AI and cloud solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Luxembourg Edge AI, cloud, network, and security solutions provider Gcore, today announced it has secured $60 million in Series A funding.

title: French misery compounded as relegated from fintech investment world top 10
author: John Reynolds
summary: French misery was compounded today when the country was relegated from a listing of the top 10 global fintech investment countries. Following Les Bleus’s exit from the Euros last night, in a defeat against Spain, France has suffered a further blow, being relegated from Innovate Finance's chart of global fintech powerhouses.

title: Slip raises £2.5M for digitised receipt system
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Female-founded receipt tech platform Slip has secured £2.5M.

title: Onum raises $28M in Series A for data observability and orchestration platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Data observability platform Onum, which gives companies control over their data, cost, and performance, announced today that it has raised a $28 million Series A funding round.

title: Dutch neobank Bunq like “dog with a bone” as gears up for UK relaunch and unveils GenAI platform
author: John Reynolds
summary: Dutch neobank Bunq is launching a consumer-facing Generative AI-powered chatbot, which will leverage the much-hyped technology to provide users with answers to questions about their financial life, such as spending habits and restaurants they frequent.

title: CurifyLabs acquires IP from Mehta Heino, boosting 3D printed personalised medicine production.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Finnish health technology pioneer CurifyLabs announced today that it has acquired significant intellectual property (IP) from Mehta Heino Industries Oy, a front-runner in 3D printing hardware development.

title: €100 million tech campus planned for Vilnius – Tech Zity to create ‘largest tech campus in Europe’
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Lithuania’s co-working and tech space company Tech Zity is getting a major upgrade, to the tune of a €100 million infrastructure project in Vilnius. When complete the new campus will be vying for ‘largest tech campus in Europe ‘ when it opens in 2024, standing at 55,000 sq. metres.

title: Easing Germans into a good night's sleep, sleep app eaze raises €1.7 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based health tech start-up eaze wants to make sure you get a good night’s sleep via its personalised sleep coaching app. Based on its theory that other apps are just not cutting the mustard when it comes to solving sleep issues long term, it is using the methods of cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) - the app delivers a data-driven treatment online by qualified sleep experts, which it claims is ‘highly-scalable’.

title: FRVR raises $12.7M for AI-powered game creation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: LIsbon-headquarted gaming distribution platform FRVR has raised $12.7 million funding, bringing the company’s funding to over $100 million.

title: Gen Z social network Superfy raises $2.2M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based Gen Z social networking platform Superfy has raised $2.2M in its latest funding round, bringing its total funding to $6.7m.

title: Scaling startups showcase cutting-edge Industrial tech at The Sixth Sense Summit
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's difficult for a startup to penetrate an old-school B2B sector like manufacturing. Even a company spun out of a university, with scientific validation and peer review cred, can still need help with challenges like building relationships with C-suites and end-users, not to mention the ability to create a product at scale that's the right market fit.

title: 8 startups you need to meet at CES next week
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Next week marks North America's biggest tech event, the Consumer Electronics Show (CES).

title: Mate academy shows how to run an edtech company during war
author: Cate Lawrence
