summary: Over the last year, thousands of schools, pre-schools and other educational facilities in Ukraine have been damaged or destroyed due to the use of explosive weapons in the war, including in populated areas. But it impacts not only school students but also adult learners, many of whom were already disrupted due to the last two years of COVID-19.

title: Forget gen AI for now: these are the martech trends you really need to know about
author: Dominik Angerer
summary: Generative AI has been one of the most exciting technological breakthroughs in recent years. The accessibility of applications like ChatGPT has captured the imagination of tech experts and laypeople alike. Such is the breadth of possible applications - for good and for bad - that it seems like generative AI is the only real game in town.

title: Fieldwork Robotics raises £1.5M in funding for AI-supported harvesting robot
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Cambridge-based Fieldwork Robotics has raised £1.5 million in an ongoing fundraise which hopes to reach over £2 million. The ongoing round is continuing as a Seedrs campaign which is looking to bank £600,000 in funding. The commitment of £1.5 million comes from Elbow Beach Capital, with Frontier IP, a family office and other existing investors following on in this round.

title: Parisian Akur8 secures $120M Series C round for actuarial platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Akur8, the machine learning-powered insurance pricing and reserving platform, announced today that it has secured $120 million in series C funding, bringing its total raised investment to $180 million.

title: French B2B lender Defacto shores up to €167 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian lender to SMEs by an API Defacto has secured up to €167 million in debt funding provided via Citi and Viola Credit. According to Defacto, the capital will be used to fuel additional growth as the company sets up a lending capacity of up to €1 billion. The funding is slated to have an initial size of €67 million, with increases subject to the lender’s approval.

title: 4 Spanish AI startups you need to know
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Spain is rapidly emerging as a powerhouse in the AI startup ecosystem, with innovative companies pushing the boundaries of technology and attracting significant investment. Here are some of the five most impactful AI firms from the Iberian region.

title: Granta Autonomy raises €1M for Ukraine-tested defence tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Defence tech Granta Autonomy, which specialises in autonomous UAVs for intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance missions, has raised €1M in Seed funding. Lithuanian ScaleWolf VC led the round, with participation from Brolis Defence and HFL holdings. The new capital will enable Granta Autonomy to accelerate the development and production of its lightweight surveillance and reconnaissance UAVs, micro gimbals, and digital Datalink software, which have been tested over Ukraine's front lines.

title: Norway's Sloyd secures €3M for 3D game design
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Norwegian Sloyd has raised a €3M seed round for its 3D game design software. Funding was provided by for  a16z, Antler, Skyfall and a strategic investment from Autodesk. Other investors include FreshFund, AceCap, Hartmann Capital and a number of high profile angel investors.

title: Investorflow acquires proptech Coyote Software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Investorflow have acquired London-based property tech Coyote Software, marking a sharp increase in their market share of cloud software for the property sector. Financial terms of the deal are unknown.

title: Dutch SME banking provider Finom says new FX offering will provide “nice revenue boost”
author: John Reynolds
summary: Finom, the Amsterdam-based SME banking provider, says its new FX service will give the fintech a ”nice revenue boost”, although it will face stiff competition in a crowded field.

title: QphoX welcomes €8M, the largest investment in a quantum company in the Netherlands to date
author: Dan Taylor
summary: QphoX, a Dutch startup working on critical quantum internet technologies, has raised €8 million in its latest funding round. Marking the largest investment in a quantum company in the Netherlands to date, the capital will be used to enable QphoX to bring its quantum modem technology to market.

title: Irish agritech StrongBó scales with €750,000 as it weighs in with a solution for the beef production sector
author: Fiona Alston
summary: StrongBó, an Irish agritech company allows beef producers to collect live data on the weight of their cattle with its hardware-enabled software solution. How do you get a cow to weigh itself? Put a bucket of food in front of it! The animal steps up on the platform for a feed, meanwhile the producer gets the data to get an idea of how the animal is growing.

title: From graves to grief: the deathtech startups changing the afterlife
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Death is inevitable but comes with many tasks and responsibilities at a time when we are clouded by grief.

title: BeTriton raises €80,000 through Crowdcube for electric amphibious RV
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Latvian mobility startup BeTriton has raised €80,000 from 150 investors through its equity crowdfunding campaign on Crowdcube.

title: Axmed secures $2M Seed  to improve healthcare procurement in emerging markets
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss healthtech marketplace Axmed today announced a $2 million Seed funding round

title: Investors pour €500 million into Powerfield's solar park campaign
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Powerfield, a Netherlands solar company that develops, builds and manages "virtual power stations", connecting solar farms to external storage and EV charging, has clinched a €500 million structured equity and portfolio financing (source - Silicon Canals).

title: The UK is home to nearly 3,500 active deeptech companies
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: At the end of last year Dealroom, Lakestar, and Walden Catalyst delivered their third annual report which noted that the deeptech was one of Europe’s most resilient sectors in 2023. By the numbers, between

title: IT Arena 2022 - Ukrainian tech braves the war
author: Chris Chinchilla
summary: This article originally appeared on Hackernoon on October 13th 2022 and is reprinted with author Chris Chinchilla's permission. Note that the events described in this post took place before the recent ramp up from Russia in the war in Ukraine.

title: Barking Up the tech tree: pawsome innovations on International Dog Day
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today is International Dog Day, which makes it a perfect opportunity to explore some of the most exciting developments in technology designed for pets, especially for dogs.

title: SumUp's $100M credit facility: empowering small businesses with advance payments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week global fintech company SumUp announced that it has entered into a US$100 million credit facility with Victory Park Capital, an alternative investment firm specialising in private credit.

title: Raylo upsizes debt facility to £125M and secures first-of-its-kind green financing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Circular device subscription platform Raylo has expanded its debt facility with NatWest and Quilam, increasing the value to £125 million.

title: Helping scientists untangle the yarn that is disease biology, Causaly brings home another $60 million in a Series B funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London’s AI/machine learning platform that puts all the preclinical discovery pieces together in a heartbeat, Causaly has raised $60 million in a Series B funding round led by Iconiq Growth. The company intends to expand commercial relationships and solidify its market position with the latest investment.

title: MiddleGround Capital launches voluntary public takeover of computer vision company
author: Lucy Adams
summary: MiddleGround Capital have finalised their takeover agreement with Austrian STEMMER IMAGING. The computer vision company's management board will remain in its current composition and will continue leading the company.

title: Switchee granted £5M to tackle mould in British social housing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: British startup Switchee has raised £5M for its technological solutions to reduce mould. Mould is a pressing and prevalent issue in the British social housing sector. This round, led by Octopus, follows Switchee securing in May 2023 a £6.5 million investment financing led by AXA IM Alts. Switchee provides warming devices and a communications platform for tenants.

title: VR design platform ShapesXR secures $8.6M for expansion to new devices
author: Dan Taylor
summary: ShapesXR, makers of a VR design and collaboration platform has raised $8.6 million in a seed funding round. The company, although now officially based in San Francisco, sees a significant portion of its team members hail from Serbia.

title: Keyloop acquires automotive SaaS ATG
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Car manufacturing tech supplier Keyloop has acquired Automotive TRansformation Group (ATG). ATG brings insights from its e-commerce platform for complex vehicle sales to Keyloop’s powerful data analytics capabilities and extensive customer base.

title: European tech startups kicked off the year with a bang at CES 2023
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Consumer Electronics Show (CES) is over for another year.

title: Bowmark Capital's latest fund attracts global investors and raises over £900M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, UK private equity firm Bowmark Capital announced the successful closing of its latest flagship fund, Bowmark Capital Partners VII, with total commitments of over £900 million, approximately 50 per cent larger than its predecessor.

title: Austrian digital therapy platform nyra health raises €4.5 million as its under goes a rebrand from myReha
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Vienna-based health tech firm nyra health (previously known as myReha) has developed a digital therapy platform for neurological patients. Its CE-certified app is used by patients recovering from the likes of a stroke or long covid – its rehabilitation exercises in speech and cognition also support dementia patients.

title: Notion Capital closes its fund for European business software and fintech firms at €300 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Doubling in size this time around Notion Capital has announced the close of its Notion Capital V SCSp fund at €300 million. The fund which supports early-stage business software and fintech businesses across Europe was ‘oversubscribed’, meeting its ‘hard cap’. In the past the fund has invested in firms like CurrencyCloud, GoCardless, Paddle and HeyJobs.

title: Female-founded Clearly raises $4.3M to climate compliance platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Female-founded Clearly has raised $4.3M in seed funding to help fleet operators be more financially and energy efficient.

title: Legaltech Definely secures $7M for AI-driven contract management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK legaltech company Definely, created to make legal documents easier to read, edit and understand, has successfully raised $7 million Series A funding.

title: Don't toss it, automate it: Recycleye raises $17 million series A
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: We don't often think about what happens when our garbage reaches the recycling facility.

title: Swiss AI company Scailyte sells Endometriosis diagnostic assets to Hera Biotech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees Scailyte, a Swiss company specialising in single-cell and AI-guided biomarker discovery, sign an agreement with US Hera Biotech, which will acquire the startup’s endometriosis diagnostic testing assets and associated intellectual property.

title: The business case: How Ukrainian startup Quarks is dealing with the war
author: Ivan Rolik
summary: February 24 is the day that once and for all changed the usual and understandable structure of the life of every Ukrainian, crossing out any planning, goals, and strategies. The whole country was faced with complete incomprehensibility and a huge number of problems for which it was completely unprepared.

title: This week in European Tech: SoftBank’s Arm prepares for IPO, Northvolt bagged $1.2B, and more!
author: Fiona Alston
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €1.9 billion. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 20 exits and M&A transactions.

title: £53.6M investment in Cornish Lithium is a boost for local sustainably sourced lithium
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cornish Lithium announced a £53.6 million equity investment led by the UK Infrastructure Bank alongside The Energy & Minerals Group (EMG) and TechMet this week.

title: Samp closes €6M round for AI-generated industrial digital twin solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI-digital twin solution Samp has closed a €6 million fundraising round.

title: Cowboy responds to the VanMoof situation with Bikey, an app to keep the VanMoof community riding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: As rumoured for several weeks now Dutch e-bike firm VanMoof appear to be in a bit of a sticky financial situation, resulting in it suspending payments and shutting down of its physical stores, temporarily. It has entered a type of Chapter 11 type agreement in The Netherlands - the company has confirmed to TechCrunch it 'has applied to a local court for an official suspension of payment provision after running out of money'.

title: Repurpose, regenerate, reimagine: startups leading the future of material innovation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Organic materials are rapidly replacing their synthetic counterparts across industries, from packaging to food science. Here are some cutting-edge examples we're tracking:

title: Index Ventures announces $2.3B in funds to back founders from Seed to IPO
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: VC firm Index Ventures today announced $2.3 billion in new funds.

title: Kavida AI secures $1.1M funding to enhance supply chain management with ChatGPT
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based supply chain company Kavida AI, which de-risks procurement by tracking, managing and resolving issues within the supply chain to keep businesses running smoothly, has raised a further $1.1m investment to add ChatGPT to its platform and enhance its offering. The funds will enable the hiring of top talent in AI and data science.

title: Proxima fusion raises €20M Seed to bring fusion energy to market
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Proxima Fusion has raised €20M in seed funding less than a year after its €7.5M pre-seed round.

title: Helping more creators find “riches in niches”, Creative Fabrica raises $61 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based social platform for crafters and designers Creative Fabrica has raised $61 million in a growth round, combining venture and debt funding. The new capital is aimed at further building out the platform’s designer network, an expansion of its creative generative AI toolset, and promoting a recruitment drive that will see the addition of senior talent on a global scale. Since 2019 Creative Fabrica has raised $68.5 million.

title: Barcelona's Remuner secures €2M for sales commission optimisation 3 months after launching
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today sees variable compensation platform Remuner announce the successful closure of a €2 million Pre-Seed round led by Silicon Valley-based fund Pear VC, just three months after launching.

title: 3YOURMIND and Phillips Corp. partner with US Marine Corps to enhance digital additive manufacturing capabilities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Berlin startup 3YOURMIND and Phillips Corp. Federal Division announced a partnership with the US Marine Corps System Command's Advanced Manufacturing Operations Cell (AMOC) to enrich its digital additive manufacturing capabilities.

title: As the UK faces a collapse of clinical trials, London-based health tech startup uMed steps up its game, raises £9.8 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based health tech startup uMed has raised £9.8 million in a new funding round that is aimed directly at combatting staggering NHS statistics that have seen patient access to industry clinical trials nearly fall off a cliff. The company reports that in addition to ramping up UK-focused efforts, a portion of the funding will be used to expand its presence in North America.

title: Collo raises €5M to optimise industrial liquid processes with IoT tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Collo, a Finnish technology company offering IoT analysers for optimising industrial liquid processes, announces today a growth funding of €5 million.

title: £10m injection into Accredit Solutions from Gresham House
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Asset management group Gresham House Ventures has invested £10M in SaaS platform Accredit Solutions.

title: UK digital pharmacy player Phlo nets £10 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Looks like UK same-day pharmacy delivery is catching heat. Days after first mover advantage was declared by UK-based startup Healistic, a London/Glasgow competitor has crowded in on its hype by disclosing a £10 million series A round for its same-day platform, Phlo Digital Pharmacy, also billed as first in category.

title: Piclo and the UK National Grid partner to faciliate provider access to direct access to low voltage flexibility opportunities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, energy software company Piclo announced a partnership with the UK National Grid Electricity Distribution to simplify access for Flexibility Service Providers (FSP) into local distribution Flexibility Markets.

title: Leading the way in knowledge sharing: Gathers.ai unites Europe's AI and ML professionals for ongoing learning
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Tech moves fast, especially in areas like AI and machine learning. While academics enjoy access to top-notch knowledge at a theoretical level, how do you keep your practical knowledge current as tech innovates faster than anything you learn at university?

title: Yescapa and Goboony set up camp together in merger deal and raise €7M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Caravan rental platforms Yescapa and Goboony have merged. The French and Dutch firms, respectively, have been hoovering up the competition in recent years with Yescapa’s acquisition of SHAREaCAMPER, AreaVan and locationdecampingcardeparticulier.com and Goboony acquiring assets from Camptoo, which is active in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Belgium. The pair have been priming themselves for a domination of the European camper rental industry.

title: Children's speech therapy platform Mable Therapy bags £3.1M funding and appoints a new CEO
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK speech therapy platform Mable Therapy has received £3.1 million in funding from Gresham House Ventures and bagged itself a new CEO - Oli White joins the firm from his most recent appointment as COO at Doc Adobe. Also, Andrea Carr, will also join Mable as independent chair.

title: Dubai's Expand North Star is a must-attend for Europe's startups, scaleups and investors
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When you want to go big, you go to Dubai. The UAE city has firmly established itself as the Middle East's fastest-growing ecosystem, with strong support for entrepreneurs, investors and SMEs and a robust funding environment. It also offers a gateway to new markets in the Middle East, Africa, Asia, and Australia.

title: Rostock-based insurtech hepster raises €10 million to focus on profitability and sustainable growth
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German embedded insurtech hepster has raised €10 million in a Series B funding round. Via its API it enables companies 'to integrate needs-based and individual insurance into their offerings', including mobility, electronics, equipment, travel, pet and accident insurance.

title: How first responders get instant aerial intel with Fotokite's tethered drones
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Emergency services are increasingly looking to tech to augment first-responders such as emergency dispatch software and early wildfire detection and monitoring. While drones are a common tool in emergency scenarios being used for  tactical intelligence, surveillance in the military, a  Swiss startup is making drones accessible to first-responders for use in situations like fires and search and rescue operations.

title: Hi-Tech Apparel acquires UK custom-clothing software company Unmade
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Custom-clothing on-demand software company Unmade has been acquired by garment manufacturing leader Hi-Tech Apparel.

title: Hunting for red flags: What does due diligence look like at pre-seed?
author: Martin SFP Bryant
summary: Due diligence isn’t a topic that gets a lot of public discussion, but it’s an important one. Once an investor is interested in doing a deal, they’ll want to do some careful checks to make sure they’re not throwing their money away.

title: Monkee's 'Save Now Buy Later' model gains momentum with new seven-figure investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Austrian fintech startup Monkee, a pioneer in the area of "Save Now Buy Later" raised a seven-figure investment and is expanding its reach to over 150,000 account holders through a partnership with Vereinigte Volksbank Raiffeisenbank eG.

title: Solar power systems provider Enpal charges ahead with another €215 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based photovoltaic systems provider Enpal has raised €215 million in a Series D funding round. The announcement arrives in less than one month since the company announced a hefty injection of €855 million in debt funding. In total, Enpal has now raised just shy of €2 billion in equity and debt funding since 2017.

title: Elaia and YCombinator back Phospho with €1.7M for GenAI application monitoring
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today product analytics and monitoring platforms developer Phospho announced a €1.7 million funding round led by Elaia and YCombinator.

title: DHH at Tech.eu Summit: A refreshing anti-VC take on building tech companies (video)
author: Robin Wauters
summary: David Heinemeier Hansson has achieved so much in his life already, from launching and growing 37Signals and Basecamp to creating Ruby on Rails, founding HEY, writing books, advocating antitrust action and making select angel investments in Danish startups to racing cars.

title: Silo AI and Combient Group join forces to accelerate Nordic industrial AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Silo AI, one of Europe's largest private AI labs, has announced a strategic partnership with Combient Group, solidifying its mission to increase European competitiveness by accelerating the adoption of industrial AI.

title: iBanFirst and SeedBlink partner for faster, efficient startup investments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cross-border transaction fintech iBanFirst is partnering with quity and investment platform SeedBlink, introducing a bespoke solution for fundraising startups and their private investors.

title: Oisoi Studio secures €450K funding for VR art tools
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: VR art studio Oisoi Studio, based in Ghent, Belgium, has announced the successful closure of a €450,000 funding round.

title: Estonia's VOOL hooks up another €1.7 million for EV charging fleet
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Estonian startup VOOL has closed out a €1.7 million seed round to extend manufacturing of its private property EV chargers into additional European markets.

title: Bumper secures €46M Series B funding to boost flexible car repair payments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Bumper, the fintech enabling flexible payments for car repairs, has announced the completion of a €46 million Series B to accelerate its growth.

title: Launching a business from a bunker - an interview with Grade University co-founders Oleksii Zinchenko and Maryna Gordiienko
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Grade University is a self-study platform for English teachers worldwide. The platform was developed and launched by Grade Education Centre – a 14-year-old Ukrainian business that provides educational services

title: Want an AI Job? These Are The Most AI-ready European Locations
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: Careers in AI, ML and computer vision aren’t the only career paths experiencing demand, but for casual observers, 2023 has undisputedly been all about artificial intelligence, and specifically generative AI.

title: SHS Capital acquires majority stake in life sciences robotics firm Essert
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German private equity firm SHS Capital, whose investments focus on European healthcare companies, has acquired a majority share in life sciences robotics company Essert - the fourth transaction from its SHS VI fund. This comes only a month after it acquired a majority stake in Dutch firm CAM Bioceramics.

title: $62M for biogas power plants, Atomico's new $1.24B funding, and Europe's competitive decline
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Belgium’s Amavi Captial acquires Sweden’s SF Ventures, doubles proptech portfolio
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Ghent-based Amavi Capital has acquired Stockholm’s SF Ventures, encompassing a full proptech portfolio of 11 companies, all having a Nordic investment scope. The move will effectively double the size of Amavi’s portfolio, now bringing the total to 22 companies.

title: $80M for Huma, Shopify of digital health, ZAKA unveils €15M Fund, and widespread Windows outage chaos
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €814 million, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: epilot raises €10M to help utilities and grid operators transition from legacy software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cologne Green energy transition platform epilot has raised €10 million from Expedition Growth Capital.

title: Green tech start-up Stabl Energy secures €15M for battery storage innovation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Munich-based start-up Stabl Energy is giving old EV batteries a second life while providing commercial energy storage. 'With Stabl Energy, battery modules of different states can be interconnected - no matter how heavily the batteries in the vehicle were stressed'.

title: Final Call: Grab Your Discounted Tickets for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 - Only 5 Days Left!
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Don’t wait! The countdown is on to secure a discounted-price ticket to the Tech.eu Summit London 2024, with up to 20 percent knocked off standard prices. Only five days remain to save £100 to join 2,000 attendees.

title: With 100 portfolio companies now under its belt, Co-Fund NI is fuelling Northern Irish innovation
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A Northern Irish co-investment vehicle has disclosed its 100th portfolio company.

title: CloudTalk raises $28M in Series B funding for AI-powered communication
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI-powered communication platform CloudTalk successfully raised a $28 million round, closing its Series B funding. This brings the company's funding to $36.7 million.

title: Game on for version 2.0 as Drest (cat)walks off with £15 million to bring fashion gaming product to the metaverse
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Mobile gaming studio Drest has raised £15 million in funding to launch plans for a global rollout. The round was led by Graham Edwards.

title: Silo AI launches SiloGen to build Generative AI for Europe’s digital sovereignty
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Silo AI is one of Europe’s largest private AI labs, building AI-driven solutions and products to enable smart devices, autonomous vehicles, industry 4.0, and smart cities.

title: UK AI startup Cosine raises $2.5M for its AI developer outperforming human coders
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-founded AI startup Cosine has raised $2.5 million from SOMA and Uphonest in a round that also included funds like Lakestar and Focal. In parallel, it achieved a breakthrough in AI-assisted software development with its artificial developer, Genie.

title: Octopus Energy’s valuation reaches $9BN
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Octopus Energy has been valued at $9BN, a 15% raise since its previous valuation, finally surpassing that of British Gas.

title: Unmind believes it's time attitudes to employee mental health were updated
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: It helps to talk about it. For years that's been the crux of the message from mental health practitioners, but it can be difficult for employers to achieve.

title: OASYS NOW is on a mission to connect patients with rare  and debilitating health conditions to clinical trials
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: For me, one of the hardest things healthwise for me moving across the world was the inability to access effective treatment for a rare medical condition.

title: This Week in European Tech: Slava Ukraini, Volocopter tops up Series E round, Euronext chases €5.5 billion Allfunds purchase, Cazoo sells off assets, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 105 tech funding deals worth over €824 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Lumen raises €1M in a day  on  SeedBlink  for smart glasses for the visually impaired
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Romanian assistive tech startup Lumen, known for its smart glasses that improve mobility for the visually impaired, has secured €5 million in funding. This includes a record-breaking €1 million raised in a single day on the SeedBlink platform.

title: Pistachio secures €3.25 million in funding for cybersecurity training platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Pistachio, an Oslo-based cybersecurity awareness training and attack simulation platform has raised €3.25 million. The company, formerly known as CYBR, times the announcement in conjunction with the official launch of its security training platform, and intends to use the investment as growth capital, explicitly targeting both European and North American markets.

title: Capital gains tax hike in UK a “hammer blow” to startup staff, warns top tech leader
author: John Reynolds
summary: A rise in UK capital gains tax would be a ‘hammer blow” to startup staff, according to one of the top UK tech leaders.

title: Wastefront says 'Ha'way' to VTTI in a deal that sees the Dutch-firm invest up to $43 million and the deployment of eight tyre recycling plants
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Norwegian End-of-Life-Tyres (ELT) recycling company Wastefront has received a boost to its Sunderland plant project as it entered a strategic partnership with Dutch energy company VTTI. The deal will see Wastefront receive up to $43 million investment which will be ploughed into the first phase of Sunderland build, and VTTI also has ‘an agreement to reach a final investment decision for eight (jointly owned VTTI-Wastefront) global sites within a five year period’.

title: Meridien Holdings acquires 27% stake in London fintech DKK Partners
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Meridien, a US holding company which specialises in the financial sector, will acquire a 27% stake in London-based fintech DKK Partners as it lists on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Icelandic Frumtak Ventures closes fourth fund at $87M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Iceland-founded early-stage investor Frumtak Ventures has raised an $87M fourth fund, named Frumtak IV. While being sector-agnostic, the fund has previously placed most of its investments in B2B SaaS startups at the seed or Series A stage.

title: Germany's Kraftblock raises €20M Series B for sustainable thermal storage technology
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German climate tech firm Kraftbock has raised a Series B funding round of €20 million in a round which includes Shell Ventures, Finindus, Moore Strategic Ventures, A&G Energy Transition Tech Fund, TechEnergy Ventures and Future Industry Ventures.

title: Alvar Pet acquires Verkkokauppa Kivuton to form pet health superstore
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Finnish pet food brand Alvar Pet has acquired e-commerce platform and pet health product supplier Verkkokauppa Kivuton. The enlarged company will form the Nordics’ largest online store for pet health.

title: Seeking in-roads into product management software, Amsterdam-based Reveall announces new strategy
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Looking to make its way onto the global stage from Amsterdam, the customer insights startup Reveall is pivoting to focus instead on product management tools with enough firepower to take the fight to emerging US product roadmapping players, think ProductBoard or Aha, that have successfully monetised in this area stateside.

title: Nokia to make €360M microelectronics and communications technology investment in Germany
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Nokia has announced plans to invest €360 million in its Ulm and Nuremberg technology centers specifically aimed at the development of microelectronic technologies supporting 6G and artificial intelligence while both increasing power and energy efficiency.

title: High-Tech Gründerfonds backs ATMOS Space Cargo in €4 million seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bavarian NewSpace startup ATMOS Space Cargo has raised €4 million in a seed funding round. The capital will allow the fledgling company to press on with its first demonstration flight scheduled for the end of 2024, during which it will return a microgravity experiment from low Earth orbit with its Phoenix return capsule.

title: Learneo adds LanguageTool to its stable of AI-powered writing tools and services, in its latest acquisition
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The German-based multilingual tool LanguageTool has been acquired by US headquartered business tools platform Learneo. Financial details have not been disclosed.

title: OpenText partners with Serica Energy to optimise oil and gas production
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Serica Energy, an independent British upstream oil and gas company with operations centered on the UK North Sea, has partnered with information management platform OpenText to efficiently control engineering information, work processes, and risk across the lifecycle of projects and operations, while accelerating operational efficiencies.

title: The fourth round of speakers for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024
author: Lucy Adams
summary: In seven weeks, founders, investors and enthusiasts will land in London to dissect another whirlwind year in tech and set the stage for what's to come.

title: Superlayer raises $1.3 million to "supercharge" sales pipelines using AI
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-based startup Superlayer  has raised $1.3 million in pre-seed funds to perfect its AI-driven sales workflow platform that enables deal pipelines to be qualified and deciphered in "seconds".

title: ISH strengthens position in Benelux B2B SaaS recruitment sector with Homerun acquisition
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based HRtech firm Homerun has been acquired by Invincible Software Holdings (ISH) for an undisclosed sum. According to a statement issued by the companies, Homerun’s founders will remain active in the group as advisors or employees.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five with Dan Taylor, Robin Wauters, and Dima Shvets - Episode 22
author: Dan Taylor
summary: On the one-year anniversary of the Russo-Ukrainian war Tech.eu has dedicated our coverage to the Ukrainian ecosystem. In addition to this week's news recap, we heard from Reface co-founder and CEO Dima Shvets about how the company has survived and is growing.

title: CarbonCloud raises €7.5 million to bring clarity on climate risks to food industry supply chains
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Gothenburg, Sweden-based climate SaaS company CarbonCloud has received €7.5 million in a series A round co-led by Cusp Capital and Peak, joined by its existing investors TS Ventures and Maki VC.

title: Germany’s deepset raises $30M to expand its embed LLM offering
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German AI company deepset, the enterprise platform for building applications with LLMs is showing companies just what to do with all that data they collect, and how to properly access it. It counts Siemens, Airbus and Manz amongst its clients.

title: Standing Ovation raises €3.75M for animal-free protein production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French precision fermentation company Standing Ovation has raised a €3.75 million extension to its Series A funding round. This brings the company’s total funds raised to €23 million over the past four years.

title: German autonomous driving tech provider ASAP Group acquired in $280 million deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Providing automotive engineering services including electrics/electronics, software, consulting, service testing and validation, and vehicle development Ingolstadt-based ASAP Group has been acquired in an almost entirely all-cash deal worth $279.72 million according to BSE filings.

title: SME account provider wamo secures $5M and E-money licence
author: John Reynolds
summary: A startup offering digital accounts for SMEs has secured $5M in a funding round and an EMI (Electronic Money Institution) licence.

title: Scaler raises $10M for real estate decarbonisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Scaler, a platform for decarbonising real estate with machine learning, ESG data collection and reporting, has raised $10 million led by Plural in Series A funding.

title: Two UK fintechs stay committed to the “hard” US market, despite exec exits and banking crisis
author: John Reynolds
summary: Two UK-headquartered fintechs looking to crack the US say they remain committed to the market, despite key US executive departures and a banking crisis across the Atlantic.

title: Pactio raises $14M in Series A for digital private market solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Digital architect for private markets Pactio has successfully raised $14 million in a Series A round led by EQT Ventures.

title: Invest-NL and FORWARD.one help invest €3.5 million in Enschede-based LioniX
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Enschede-based microelectromechanical systems startup LioniX International has seen its equity change hands following a €3.5 million secondary investment by four Dutch investors: Invest-NL, Universiteit Twente Holding, Oost NL and PhotonDelta.

title: Sky Engine AI raises $7M in Series A funding for synthetic data cloud platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Sky Engine AI, a London-based synthetic data cloud platform, has raised $7 million in a Series A funding round. The investment is aimed at supporting accelerated growth for the startup as it helps data scientists, machine learning, and software engineers working on computer vision projects.

title: Look Up Space locks down €14 million, commences pre-flight checks
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Only one year since its inception, Parisian space tech startup Look Up Space has raised €14 million in a seed funding round. The round is split between €7 million in private funding, which gives it the dubious honour of being France’s largest seed round for a space tech startup, and €7 million via the French Tech seed fund.

title: Latvia's FIS.solutions raises €250,000 for its no-code lending SaaS solution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Riga-based, IT services firm FIS.solutions has raised €250,000 for its customisable no-code lending solution. The investment came from Expansion Capital.

title: Ecosia partners with AccuWeather to identify heat islands and guide urban tree planting
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-founded not-for-profit search engine Ecosia is partnering with weather forecaster AccuWeather.

title: Hive raises €12M for distributed cloud model
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, distributed cloud provider Hive raised €12 million Series Al in a deal led by SC Ventures.

title: Re:course AI lands $4.3 million for healthcare's answer to AI flight simulators
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Billed as medical training's very own AI flight simulator, Manchester-based Re:course AI has locked down $4.3 million in seed funds to build foreign market share for its "generative AI" tuition product.

title: Mollie’s top commercial man likes a “bit of chaos” as Dutch payment scaleup spreads its wings
author: John Reynolds
summary: Ken Serdons, chief commercial officer at Dutch payments scaleup Mollie, says he can “easily get bored” and is “quite an impatient person”.

title: The third round of speakers at the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 has been revealed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: With regulatory and fundraising environments in flux, Europe’s innovation potential will be determined by our ability to have high-quality conversations. Tech.eu Summit is headed for London — the beating heart of startup Europe — to bring new analysis and exchange to the fore. Our 13 new speakers add to an expansive line-up previously announced.

title: Nokia to downsize workforce by 14,000 following Q3 2023 sales drop
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As part of its Q3 2023 financial results presentation earlier today, Finnish telecom group Nokia announced that it will be reducing its workforce by up to 14,000 by the end of 2026. Down from approximately 86,000 employees, this figure represents a 16 percent downsizing at the high end.

title: Danish learning platform LMS365 buys Weekly10 in €4.5M deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish learning platform LMS365 has acquired UK-based performance management platform Weekly10 in a €4.5 million deal.

title: Beebop raises $5.5 million for virtual power plant tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Beebop.ai has raised a $5.5 million Seed Round, led by Angular Ventures, with support from Contrarian Ventures. Beebop is already used by leading utilities and manufacturers across Europe, the UK and the Middle East, and expects to control more than 100K residential assets under management in the coming year.

title: CapVest buys UK-based SaaS ERP Kerridge Commercial Systems from Accel-KKR in $1 billion deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Accel-KKR owned enterprise resource planning software firm Kerridge Commercial Systems (KCS) has been bought by funds managed by CapVest Partners LLP, (CapVest) in a deal Bloomberg is reporting to be worth ‘more than £800 million ($1 billion)’.

title: UK legaltech Definely secures strategic investment from Raine Ventures
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK legaltech Definely today announces a strategic investment from Raine Ventures, the venture arm of US investment firm The Raine Group. The financial specifics have not been disclosed.

title: Infinite Reality acquires UK's Landvault in $450M deal to boost immersive tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Infinite Reality, a company making AI and immersive technologies for digital media and e-commerce, today announced the $450 million acquisition of UK-based Landvault, a tech company specialising in immersive technology and digital twins for Fortune 500 companies and government organisations.

title: Bactolife's €30M in funding to commercialise gut health binding proteins
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish biotech Bactolife develops Binding Proteins to help strengthen the gut microbiome of humans and animals. The Copenhagen-based company, which was founded in 2017, is boosting gut health at an affordable price, lowering the risk of infection and antimicrobial resistance.

title: HysetCo secures €200M to accelerate hydrogen refueling
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Clean hydrogen project investor Hy24 has joined forces with HysetCo, a company at the forefront of developing hydrogen-powered transportation solutions. Together, they have secured nearly €200 million in funding to speed up making transportation more environmentally friendly.

title: Marlin Equity Partners buys majority equity holding in Manchester's CTS
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Investment firm Marlin Equity Partners has acquired a majority shareholding in Manchester, UK-based Cloud Technology Solutions (CTS), a cloud services implementation provider tied to Google's cloud computing stack.

title: Berlin-based Everphone secures €270M for Device-as-a-Service expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Everphone, a Berlin-based B2B Device-as-a-Service platform, has secured €270 million in a Series D financing round. A significant portion of the capital will be used to integrate an additional 1 million devices into the company’s circular operating model.

title: Cyprus-based construction tech start-up buildbuild snags $1.25 million to build management software for construction SMBs
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Cyprus-based management software for construction start-up buildbuild, has raised a has raised $1.25 million Seed round after securing investment from Luxembourg-based company Lvl Group SARL.

title: 10 new speakers for the Tech.eu Summit: Leaders from Iris.ai, Atomico, Vivaldi, Partech, NeXR, Earlybird, Thomson Reuters and more!
author: Robin Wauters
summary: A little over 48 days to go before the next edition of our flagship event on all things European tech and VC, and the Tech.eu Summit is shaping up quuuuuuite nicely thank you very much.

title: Balderton Capital fuels European tech growth with $1.3B investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Balderton Capital today announced its $615 million Early Stage Fund IX and $685 million Growth Fund II, to back Europe’s most ambitious entrepreneurs from Seed stage through IPO.

title: European Hyperloop Center opens its doors for first tests
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: What will come first to Europe — a commercial hyperloop or eVTOL? Well, don't hold your breath, as today The European Hyperloop Center (EHC) announced the completion of its hyperloop test infrastructure and opened up for the first tests.

title: Goldman and Co. aren’t sweatin’ $110 million in new round for Fever at $1.8 billion valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Just over one year since hauling down over $227 million in a Series E round, one that saw Fever obtain a valuation of over $1 billion, New York City-based, but with strong Spanish roots live entertainment discovery platform Fever has ordered up a new ticket in the form of $110 million.

title: The biggest trends in fintech this year: What the experts say
author: John Reynolds
summary: 2023 marked another challenging year for the fintech sector, like 2022. Higher interest rates, a tightening money supply and other macroeconomic headwinds led to funding woes, layoffs, fintechs reigning in spend, and even some fintech closures.

title: EIC recommits to cargo airline Dronamics with €10M investment
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Bulgarian cargo airline Dronamics has received a €10 million investment from the European Innovation Council following its previous €2.5 million grant last February.

title: Skoon Energy secures €5M funding for AI-powered clean mobile energy platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI-powered software platform for clean mobile energy, Skoon Energy announced the closing of €5 million in Series A funding, led by North American VC Blue Bear Capital, with participation from Graduate Entrepreneur Fund.

title: Ecosia: the world's largest non-profit search engine launches eco-friendly browser
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Ecosia, the world's largest not-for-profit search engine, announces its global launch of its eco-friendly browser. Available for desktop via a download page and mobile via app stores, the Ecosia Browser extends the company's mission of environmental stewardship, empowering users to turn online browsing into real-world impact.

title: DELLI, the online marketplace for independent food, secures $6M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: DELLI, the online platform for independent food and drink has raised a $6 million Seed extension to capitalise on recent momentum.

title: Sweden's Heart Aerospace secures  $107M Series B for ES-30 hybrid-electric plane
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swedish hybrid-electric aeroplane maker Heart Aerospace today announced it has raised $107 million in Series B funding, bringing the company’s total financing to $145 million.

title: UK-based ethical research and AI-training firm Prolific has raised £25 million to create a physical presence in the US
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based Prolific provides ethical research and AI-training via its platform. The latter is another string to the bow of the company which originally set up to provide reliable ‘people research by providing fast and easy access to verified and fairly-paid individuals, allowing researchers to be able to focus on high-quality research supported by participants who are who they say they are’. The same can now be provided to companies training AI models.

title: NALA raises $40M to improve payments in Africa and beyond
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK fintech company NALA has raised $40 million in Series A funding to support its global expansion and enhance the reliability of payments to Africa by developing its payment rails. This is NALA’s second round of fundraising in 20 months, having raised $10 million in 2022, bringing the company’s funding to over $50 million.

title: Monetizr raises $4M for enhanced gaming advertising
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Latvian adtech company Monetizr has raised $4 million in a new funding round aimed at ramping up the company’s US sales team as well as fleshing out its European development hubs located in London, Riga, and Helsinki.

title: LandVault raises additional $3 million to expand metaverse offering
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based LandVault, a large metaverse builder, has raised an additional $3 million in an extended Series B funding round fuelling the growth of the company's commercial operations across Dubai, Europe, Asia, and the US.

title: 3L Robotics to launch central Europe's "first" drone helipad for automated parcel deliveries
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Despite Czech rules that currently forbid urban parcel deliveries by unmanned aerial vehicles, Brno-based 3L Robotics expects to launch the country's first landing helipad for drone shipments in 18 months time.

title: Malta's wamo bags $1.5M of Turkish funding from Finberg and RePie
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Malta and London-based SME digital business account provider wamo has raised $1.5 million in what it's calling a seed extension round. This additional funding takes wamo’s total funding to date to $6.8 million. The funds raised will go towards exploring new markets and also the application for its own electronic money institution (EMI) license in Finland.

title: DODO expands into Germany bringing tech-powered same-day last-mile delivery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today same-day delivery service DODO announces its expansion into the German market. It's a move that reinforces the permanence of same-day last mile delivery.

title: Tech startup tackles Ireland's housing crisis by connecting buyers with vacant properties
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Homebuyer's Hero is a start-up co-founded by Colm Casey and Dr Constantin Gurdgiev, committed to solving the Irish housing crisis. The company has developed processes, technologies, and algorithms to connect buyers and sellers and reduce property construction risks.

title: Gaussion secures $12M Series A for rapid battery charging tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Battery performance tech company Gaussion has raised  $12M Series A.

title: Alice & Bob and partners awarded €16.5M to slash quantum computing costs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Quantum computing hardware developer Alice & Bob and academic partners ENS de Lyon and Mines Paris-PSL today announced the receipt of a €16.5 million innovation grant, a France 2030 initiative operated by  Bpifrance, France's public investment bank.

title: Hydrogen startup HySiLabs raised €13 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: France-based liquid hydrogen carrier developer HySiLabs has raised €13 million in series A funds.

title: Danfoss boosts green energy solutions, acquiring ENFOR's district heating software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Danish engineering company Danfoss acquired ENFOR’s district energy software for an undisclosed sum. Danfoss has been a minority shareholder in ENFOR since 2020.

title: Twig founder launches “circular economy” startup — months  after previous "circular economy" startup shuts
author: John Reynolds
summary: A Forbes-acclaimed founder is launching a “circular economy” fintech called Wingpay.- just months after his previous “circular economy” fintech shut down owing millions.

title: Hospitality HRtech startup Slinger raises £500K  to make the CV obsolete.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today UK employment startup Slinger announced a new round of Pre-Seed funding of £500,000.

title: AI lie detectors in interviews: could it happen in the EU?
author: Amanda Kavanagh
summary: You wouldn’t believe how many people enjoy cross-country skiing. But only if you regularly review CVs and conduct job interviews, where embellished interests are plentiful.

title: A deep dive into the European 'buy now, pay later' (BNPL) market
author: John Reynolds
summary: “You shouldn’t be using BNPL to buy a pizza,” says the CEO of French 'buy now, pay later' startup Alma, taking a pot-shot at rival players in one of the hottest areas of financial services right now.

title: Planet A Foods' $15.4M funding boosts production of eco-friendly cocoa alternative
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Planet A Foods announced it has closed a $15.4 million Series A funding round, bringing the company's funding to over $43 million.

title: GET Protocol says its disrupting the ticketing markets as it gets $4.5 million in funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: NFT ticketing firm believes GET Protocol believes ticketing is the ‘ultimate onboarding mechanism for mainstream consumers into Web3’ and suggests this can be done through rewarding their fandom and attendance with a digital NFT-based collectible from the event.

title: Trustap bags $5.5M  Series A for its secure marketplace transaction platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Irish marketplace transaction platform Trustap has raised  $5.5 million Series A, bringing the company’s funding to over $9 million.

title: KetoSwiss raises $4.8M to drive development of migraine fighting food
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Ever heard the expression ‘feed a migraine, starve a fever’? No, neither have we, but food as a solution to migraine relief is exactly what Basel-based biotech start-up KetoSwiss is all about. Its product MigraKet, is a ‘dietary-preventive therapy’ which it says is ‘offering a clinically tested and patent-protected solution’ to your migraine issues.

title: Wondercraft raises $3 million Seed funding for the 'Canva of audio'
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI audiotech startup Wondercraft announced that it has raised a $3 million Seed round to scale its platform.

title: Gen Z-focused credit marketplace Prograd raises $2.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Prograd has raised $2.5 million in a seed round. The startup is out to help a younger generation understand finance, allowing users to establish financial goals and discover bespoke pathways to earning, saving, or borrowing their way to these goals.

title: Electron secures £4M with its approach to electricity flexibility and distribution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based electricity flexibility and distribution marketplace provider Electron gives electric networks, generators, and consumers and more control and flexibility over the power source. Optimising their use of both variable renewable power and network capacity based on time and location reduces network congestion, allows for a faster connection, and can reduce consumer bills.

title: Swave Photonics adds another €3 million to its Seed pot to bring the metaverse to life
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belgium-based holographic eXtended Reality (HXR) technology company Swave Photonics has announced it has secured an additional €3 million Seed extension which brings its total funds raised to €10 million.

title: LC AuxeTec makes a material that thickens when stretched and Northern Gritstone gets in on the funding action
author: Fiona Alston
summary: University of Leeds spin-out LC AuxeTec is creating a material that thickens and is raising a £2 million Seed round to commercialise it. Northern Gritstone have announced they have added funds to the pot.

title: €165M for EV chargepoint Powerdot, Eleport acquires TurboVolt, and winning sportstech startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 50 tech funding deals worth over €635 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Wobble Genomics' novel approach to RNA sequencing attracts £8.5M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: University of Edinburgh spin-out Wobble Genomics announced today that it has raised £8.5 million to help commercialise its technology.

title: Doctify, practitioner reviews you can bank on, now with another $10 million to spend
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Doctify set out eight years ago to bring patient reviews to the medical profession, serving up transparent feedback that's long been a consumer hallmark in the internet age.

title: Manina Medtech raises €1.75M for IVF efficacy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The culmination of 2023 saw Catalan startup Manina Medtech, raise €1.75 million in funding to support the effectiveness of IVF embryo implantation.

title: IPXO Reaches $14m Revenue and Unveils Expansion Plans
author: Tech.eu
summary: IPXO, a public IP address solutions platform, announced its achievement of a $14m revenue landmark in just three years, powered by its unique, U.S.-patented approach. The firm, which boasts a team of 70, has invested substantially into R&D over the last two years. It is now excited to unveil a significantly enhanced network automation service suite, extending its reach to over a thousand of its current clients.

title: Berlin startup HealthCaters raises $1.2M for the future of disease prevention
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Securing early intervention for preventable diseases and health conditions often proves challenging, given the lengthy waiting lists for doctor appointments in Germany and a hesitancy on the side of health providers to invest in diagnostic tests.

title: €103M to eVTOL vertiports, European climate leaders join forces, and a new supercomputer
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €962 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Dexter Energy raises €10.5 million to expand its AI-based renewable power generation forecasting markets and double its team
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch firm Dexter Energy uses AI-based renewable power generation forecasting for short-term energy trading solutions. It has announced it raised a €10.5 million Series B round to support its expansion into new European markets as it aims to double the size of its team by the end of this year.

title: Brno-based Kiwi.com announces layoffs impacting 18% of staff
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Brno-based traveltech company Kiwi.com has confirmed the layoffs of approximately 216 individuals, a number that reflects 18 per cent of its staff.

title: Rocsys refuels with €33 million to bring autonomous charging to EV charge points
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Remember the good (not for the environment) old days where you’d rock up to the petrol station, flick open your petrol cap and the attendant would fill up your tank? Well, Rocsys is bringing that level of pure comfort to EV charging stations. Using ‘soft roboctics’ and ‘AI-based computer vision’ the Dutch start-up is ‘redefining’ the charging experience and it says that with a bit of tinkering it can transform any charger to do the same.

title: European Investment Fund puts €350M into Kembara's deeptech and climate fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the European Investment Fund (EIF) announced that it has invested €350 million in Kembara Fund I FCR, a venture capital fund with a target size of €1 billion focused on deeptech and climate. The fund will operate at a pan-European level and is managed by Alma Mundi Ventures SGEIC (Mundi Ventures), a Spanish company.

title: Polish quantum dot firm QNA Technology bags $4M and eyes up ASO NewConnect application
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Wroclaw-based QNA Technology develops blue-light emitting, heavy metal-free quantum dots to be used in advanced display technologies. It also focuses on formulating quantum inks which contain quantum dots to enable the semiconductors to be printed on any surface.

title: No one is coming to save us from Big Tech
author: Alexandra Kubiak and Jon von Tetzchner
summary: This Sunday, January 28th, marks a little-known holiday called International Data Privacy Day. And while it’s unlikely that this Sunday will be markedly different from your other Sundays, you need only glance at a myriad of headlines, many written by this very publication, to see why we should be taking our data privacy seriously.

title: London's AutomatePro raises £5 million to draw more US customers to its ServiceNow-powered intelligent DevOps suite
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-based DevOps software provider AutomatePro has closed on £5 million in series A funds from UK investor YFM Equity Partners.

title: Austrian firm Metaloop raises a €16M Series A for scrap metal recycling software
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Metal recycling software firm Metaloop is making a dent in the scrap metal recycling industry with its all-encompassing software solution, from matchmaking, logistics and recycling to financing and trade discovery.

title: Claid.ai  turns your crappy photos into masterpieces in seconds
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Before generative AI tools like Mid Journey and Chat GPT were household names for techies, Let's Enhance used the tech to solve a real eyesore— crap photography. (Founders, we love you, but gosh, we see a lot of crap photos at Tech.eu.)

title: VivaTech 2023 announces its programme and flagship initiatives to meet the major challenges of tech
author: Guest Writer
summary: From the first floor of the Eiffel Tower, VivaTech officially launched the roadmap for this year’s edition which will take place in Paris from the 14th to 17th of June 2023, at Paris Expo Porte de Versailles. While they’ll be in the same location as years previous, VivaTech will be occupying 20% more exhibition space, including a Future of Sport dedicated space in a new hall.

title: Rcam's tactile surveillance camera receives $25,000 funding from Brave1
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ukrainian defencetech startup Rcam has received $25,000 in funding from Brave1.

title: Kurs Orbital secures €3.7M for satellite servicing and space debris removal
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Italian spacetech startup Kurs Orbital has raised €3.7 million in Seed funding to bring its innovative solutions to the in-orbit services and logistics market.

title: Car solutions provider ULU absorbs Dutch connected mobility player iMoto
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Netherlands-based iMoto BV, a connected mobility company, has been acquired by London-HQed auto IoT solutions company ULU.(source - Silicon Canals.)

title: Noventiq and Corner Growth Acquisition Corp file for Nasdaq listing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today digital transformation and cybersecurity solutions and services provider Noventiq and special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) Corner Growth Acquisition Corp filed documentation with the US SEC for a combined company to be listed on the New York Nasdaq.

title: Rocsys partners with Autocar to pilot hands-free tractor charging
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Netherlands-based hands-free charging provider Rocsys is partnering with Autocar to maximise the efficiency of Autocar’s electric tractor fleet by removing humans from the charging process.

title: Mondu successfully registers with FCA, launches B2B payments services in UK
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based B2B payments company Mondu has successfully registered with the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) and will begin working with 16 British clients immediately.

title: bValue closes new €90M growth fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Seasoned Polish investor bValue has closed its growth fund, BVG. bValue’s third fund has raised of €90M from LPs, exceeding the target cap of €80M. The firm drives the development of tech startups and scaleups across Poland and across the CEE region.

title: E-learning, business training, and performance management services startup Innential raises “close to” €1 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Innential has raised “close to” €1 million in a seed round that will see the company up its tech capabilities alongside strengthening its sales teams in what it’s calling both the Polish and European markets. The last time I checked, Poland was a part of Europe, but alas. The startup also says the funding will be used for “other things” as well.

title: Greenerwave raises $15M to deploy its electromagnetic wave control technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The product — designed and manufactured in France — is a transmitting/receiving antenna for Satcom that ensures on-the-move communication, even in dead zones with little to no connectivity, without requiring more land-based infrastructures.

title: Latvian fintech inGain secures €650,000 for no-code SaaS loan management system
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Latvian fintech startup inGain has announced that it has raised €650,000 in funding from Trind VC and Fiedler Capital, the Latvian Business Angels network, and several business angels.

title: Tracebit raises $5M for turnkey threat deception tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cloud threat detection and deception platform Tracebit has raised a $5 million Seed funding round to provide easy-to-use deception technology to enterprises everywhere.

title: Istanbul's Erguvan secures funding for carbon credit marketplace at $7.33M valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Erguvan, a self-described climate-fintech startup based in Istanbul, Turkiye has raised an undisclosed figure in a seed round via Emirates NBD and Deniz Ventures at a valuation of $7.33 million. The investment marks the first deployment for ENBD’s of a $100 million venture fund announced last year.

title: Privacy-preserving technologies are about to have their hockey-stick moment
author: Rand Hindi
summary: Deeptech startups that target critical global challenges like climate change, longevity, semiconductors, AI, etc. now account for 20 per cent of venture capital investments according to a recent Boston Consulting Group report. But what exactly is deeptech?

title: SME-focused insurance provider Superscript raises $54 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based insurtech startup Superscript has raised £45 million in a Series B round. The newest round of capital is aimed at increasing the company’s underwriting and broking capabilities while continuing to further develop its AI-driven offerings. Including this round, Superscript has raised $78.4 million.

title: Awell secures $5M to automate clinician workflows and targets US market expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Brussels-based digital health platform Awell has raised a $5 million Seed round. The startup, which automates clinical workflows, will use the funding to grow its team, invest in R&D, and further product innovation. Targeting a stateside expansion the company will focus on building relations with traditional care organisations.

title: Sequoia Atlas - empowering founders by revolutionising talent recruitment in Europe's tech industry
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In today’s world, having the skills to find information is beneficial, but all the more so if you have a go-to location where all the info you seek is already gathered. Quite often, founders struggle in sourcing and recruiting the best engineers.

title: Seenons raises €10 million to orchestrate a circular economy via its waste platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch start-up Seenons has raised €10 million in a recent investment round allowing it to make technological improvements and grow the platform internationally.  Some of the investors involved include Invest-NL, CapitalT, Tablomonto, Swiss Post and Shamrock Ventures.

title: ETCI commemorates first anniversary with €1B investment in European tech innovation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The European Tech Champions Initiative (ETCI) is excited to mark its first anniversary with close to €1 billion of investments aimed at mobilising up to €6 billion to drive Europe's digital transformation.

title: Civo Expands cloud-native offering with Kubefirst acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cloud-native service provider Civo this week officially announced its acquisition of Kubefirst open-source GitOps-powered platform for Kubernetes, Kubefirst, from its parent company Kubeshop. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.

title: Ed tech OS developer Sdui extends series A runway to €25 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Germany-based ed tech startup Sdui has extended its series A round to €25 million, after initially picking up €7 million in 2021.

title: Relex Solutions' fifth acquisition: Swedish supply chain platform Optimity
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Finnish supply chain automation and optimisation platform Relex Solutions has acquired Swedish competitor Optimity. The financials of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: Clean Food Group raises £2.5M for its oil and fat substitutes
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Clean Food Group (CFG) has announced £2.5M in funding following £13m raised in previous rounds. The injection of capital will be used to continue development of CFG’s sustainable oil and fat alternatives in the leadup to a planned commercial launch in 2025.

title: Uncapped secures £200M to expand its services to US and European entrepreneurs
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Uncapped, formerly known as a revenue-based finance provider, has secured a £200 million debt facility aimed at expanding its offer to US and European entrepreneurs and businesses.

title: WeCare raises $350,000 to develop lab-grown diamonds
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cypriot deeptech WeCare has raised $350,000 for R&D into the development of lab-grown diamonds.

title: Perci Health raises £3.4 million to expand its digital cancer support platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based digital cancer support clinic, Perci Health has raised £3.4 million seed funding to expand cancer support services.

title: Sentify raises $1.1M in Pre-Seed funding to unlock LLM insights
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sentify, a platform enabling users to extract actionable insights from large language model (LLM) products, announced today that it has raised over $1.1 million in an oversubscribed Pre-Seed funding round.

title: NEBRA raises $4.5M for zero-knowledge proof technology
author: Lucy Adams
summary: English crypto startup NEBRA has closed its $4.5M raise in a combined Pre-Seed/Seed Round Led by Nascent and Bankless.

title: PolyModels Hub raises £1.1M to digitise pharmacology
author: Lucy Adams
summary: English biotech software platform PolyModels Hub has raised £1.1 million Seed round by Marathon Venture Capital. PolyModels' thesis is that though investments in lab automation, AI, and robotics are increasing, pharma process development – all steps and protocols scientists follow to turn chemical compounds into safe commercial products – is typically characterized by archaic processes and lagging adoption of digital tools.

title: Dublin-based Solidroad secures $1.2M for enterprise SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Solidroad, an AI-powered platform for to hiring, onboarding, and training has successfully raised $1.2M. The funding round was led by Dan Kiely (co-founder of Voxpro), Jack Pierce (co-founder of Wayflyer), Ciaran Lee (co-founder of Intercom), Anne Heraty of CPL, and Louise Phelan, former PayPal executive. Their combined expertise and support underscore the transformative potential of Solidroad’s technology.

title: Polish healthcare SaaS solution eGabinet raises €548K investment for market expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Digital-first healthcare is gaining momentum with (depending on where you reside) online appointment scheduling systems, electronic prescriptions, and digital referrals. Today Polish healthtech startup eGabinet announced PLN 2.4M  (approximately €548,000) in funding.

title: Fractal Homes enters the second home co-ownership race with $30 million raise
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Fractal Homes has raised $30 million in a seed round aimed at what the proptech startup claims will reinvent second home co-ownership across Europe. The funding is earmarked to help the startup scale its operations within the UK ahead of a targeted expansion in the Middle East later this year.

title: ARX raises €1.15M for autonomous ground vehicles for defence and civilian first responders
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German defencetech startup ARX announced that it has raised a €1.15 million Pre-Seed round led by Project A Ventures.

title: Meatable's $35M investment boosts the future of cultivated meat
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today cultivated meat company Meatable announced it has raised $35 million in new funding.

title: Tandem Bank has acquired money-sharing app Loop Money
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based, Tandem Bank has acquired money-sharing app Loop Money for an undisclosed figure.

title: Noventiq strikes preliminary SPAC deal to list in New York
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-listed IT services firm Noventiq is making provisions for a dual listing in New York.

title: How iGaming's “Motivational Engineering” is transforming audience engagement
author: Julia Gifford
summary: With a business model that depends on returning customers and increased play time, Soft2Bet, a leading provider of online betting and gaming solutions, has invested their resources into figuring out how to keep their customers coming back for more. In fact, they've developed their own system, called MEGA – Motivational Engineering Gaming Applications – a blend of social gameplace and gamification.

title: London's Just Climate backs Swedish clean tech trio
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Just Climate, a London investment firm with bankroll for clean tech scale ups, is announcing three Swedish portfolio investments.

title: Unveiling Europe’s unsung heroes and heroines shaping the Metaverse future
author: Leen Segers
summary: On Monday, June 5th 2023, Apple entered the Metaverse or Spatial computing world by launching the Apple Vision Pro. Two days later, it was confirmed that Apple had acquired Mira, an AR startup based in Los Angeles, which specialises in creating lightweight hardware for Augmented Reality. According to Forbes, this acquisition indicates Apple’s interest in the highly profitable military market.

title: Healthtech Tonic App secures €10.85M Series A
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Digital health startup Tonic App has closed a Series A investment round of €10.85 million.

title: Ai Build raises $8.5M Series A funding for additive manufacturing software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today additive manufacturing software startup, Ai Build, has raised a Series A round of $8.5 million led by IQ Capital, bringing the company’s funding to  $13.5 million.

title: Heata is transforming the UK's household energy costs with waste heat reuse
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The last couple of years have seen Britons experience a rising cost of living, especially concerning home costs like rent and utilities. In an ideal world, homes are built to withstand changing temperatures, making residents less vulnerable to volatile energy prices.

title: Loopin raises £1.6 million to help companies to loop in to employee morale
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Bristol-based employee morale platform Loopin has announced it raised a £1.6 million seed fund round to further its platform and bring morale to the workplace. Its yet to roll-out is coaching platform to the public.

title: Berlin-based WAY secures €1.2M in pre-seed funding for IT-as-a-Service platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Today, Berlin-based device-on-demand/IT-as-a-service startup WAY has confirmed a €1.2 million pre-seed funding round.

title: Lazard partners with Elaia Capital to launch growth fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Asset management leader Lazard signed a strategic partnership agreement with Elaia Partners, who invests across different tech verticals.

title: Restaurant SaaS allO secures $5M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Restaurant software provider allO has raised a $5 million Seed funding round to continue scaling into additional cities in Germany and Europe. The company has partnerships with major companies like Google, UberEats, Wolt, Lieferando, Stripe and was a recipient of the Red Dot award in 2023.

title: Cabify partners with Polestar to expand its Spanish EV fleet
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cabify and Polestar have partnered to decarbonise the PHV transportation sector in Barcelona and madrid. Thanks to the collaboration between both companies, Cabify users will have at their disposal 100 Polestar vehicles, specifically the Polestar 2 Long Range Single Motor Plus model, which will be available in these cities, 50 in each of them.

title: Turkish startup Salus secures $4.7M for its personalised mental health platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today mental health platform Salus, announced it closed a $4.7 million Seed investment round, bringing its fundraising to over $5.5 million since inception.

title: “Social interactive banking app” Ruuky (aka pockid) files for insolvency
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Hamburg-based banking app Ruuky, also known as pockid, began insolvency proceedings last week. The three-year-old neobank was designed to target Gen Z customers with its “social interactive” features.

title: Stoïk raises additional €10 Million for European expansion in cybersecurity insurance
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Since raising €11 million in an a16z-led Series A round in June of 2022, Parisian SME-focused insurance and cybersecurity software provider Stoïk has today announced the raise of an additional €10 million.

title: Fishbrain nets $6M to enhance sports fishing app for anglers fishing for likes
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Stockholm-based sports fishing app for anglers, Fishbrain AB, has raised $6 million in its latest funding round. The round was led by Industrifonden and Lucerne Capital Management. Funds will allow Fishbrain to ‘enhance its technology platform and accelerate market penetration, solidifying its position as the go-to place for anglers’.

title: Cradlepoint acquires cloud security platform Ericom Software
author: Fiona Alston
summary: US-based telco Cradlepoint, part of Ericsson (Nasdaq: ERIC), has announced that it has acquired Ericom Software, which will fuel Cradlepoint’s strategy of building a full-stack enterprise security service optimised for 5G. No figure was disclosed in the deal announcement.
