title: Edinburgh's back in the sports tech game, as Fanbase raises £1 million for fans experience product
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Edinburgh's Fanbase has closed a £1 million round led by payment service and software provider SaltPay.

title: INSRD's adaptive insurance for emerging industries bags €500K Pre-Seed
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-based insurtech startup INSRD announced today that it has raised a €500K Pre-Seed round. INSRD is a startup that is participating in Cohort 5 of Earlybird Venture Capital's Vision Lab Program, which provides funding, mentorship, and network.

title: A case for no-code in Europe
author: Andrew Fenton
summary: European companies are facing more complex challenges than ever and grappling with significant business changes linked to rising inflation, geopolitical conflicts, climate change, and the energy crisis. Despite these disruptions, Europe has shown remarkable resilience to the challenging environment.

title: US banking licence not on Revolut’s “immediate roadmap” but is long-term ambition, says Revolut’s US boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Obtaining a US banking licence is not on Revolut’s “immediate roadmap” but becoming a US-licenced bank is its long-term ambition, according to the fintech’s US CEO.

title: Creative agency House of Poppins acquires social media leader The Tree
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based digital strategists House of Poppins have acquired The Tree, one of the most awarded social-first agencies in Europe. The acquisition will double the size of Poppins’ team and ensure further expansion of its social media offering.

title: Nanogence cements its future with funding for no-carbon building materials
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Nanogence, a Swiss-based building material innovation company, announced that it has secured an undisclosed amount of funding from a consortium of investors led by CirCap, alongside Planet First Partners, and the EIC Fund.

title: Circu Li-ion advances battery recycling with €8.5M Seed financing and EICA grants
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today European battery recycling startup, Circu Li-ion, a leading, announced the successful closing of a €8.5 million Seed financing round.

title: Caxton Payments acquires ParentPay’s pocket money app nimbl
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Caxton Payments has acquired the entire operating business and share capital of nimbl. nimbl is a pocket money app from ParentPay, and online payment service for schools.

title: Meet Europe's most groundbreaking innovators — EIT Awards 2024
author: Tech.eu
summary: Europe's largest innovation network is back with the 10th edition of its awards ceremony, the EIT Awards, celebrating the region's most groundbreaking innovators. The event will be held on Feb. 20th in Brussels' EGG for those joining in person, with remote livestreaming available.

title: Sweden appointed LP of NATO Innovation Fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Sweden has officially become a Limited Partner of the NATO Innovation Fund, joining 23 other countries to invest in advanced technology and science to enhance the defence, security and resilience of the allied nations.

title: Startup founded by CBE-winning fintech pioneer reports losses of £7.5M in 2023
author: John Reynolds
summary: A startup founded by a CBE-winning fintech pioneer has reported losses of £7.5m in 2023, with its overall losses now standing at £13.1m. Super Payments was founded by Samir Desai, a financial services trailblazer who co-founded Funding Circle, a pioneer of the peer-to-peer lending model. Desai, who launched Funding Circle in 2010, stood down as CEO of Funding Circle in 2021.

title: ERC System emerges from stealth with medical eVTOL
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Germany's ERC System emerged from stealth, unveiling an eVTOL designed explicitly for patient and casualty transport.

title: RespiQ awarded €4M EIC Pathfinder grant for COPD monitoring device
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today RespiQ, a Dutch healthtech company, announced that it has been awarded a €4 million Pathfinder grant from the European Innovation Council (EIC).

title: Qvantum takes on €41.2 million, Trouva trades hands again and more than €269 million was invested in European Tech last week
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 35 tech funding deals worth over €269 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Lightspeed leads $27M round backing Plan A to expand its carbon accounting software in Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Corporate carbon accounting software provider Plan A has raised a $27 million funding round to expand its team, further develop the capabilities of its platform and expand throughout Europe as it throws its main focus on building its French, UK, and Scandinavian markets.

title: Removing mirroring in VC: how to level the funding field for female founders
author: Fiona Alston
summary: A recent survey of female founders, by Pink Salt Ventures, threw up some pretty startling results. Buckle up, as usual, a piece on investment in female-founded companies might become 'uncomfortable' reading, for some.

title: How Zendesk for Startups program can help startups survive the funding winter
author: Guest Writer
summary: The global startup funding landscape has notably changed over the last year. We've seen venture capital firms become more cautious about their investment choices. Ask any early-stage founder.

title: CampX by Volvo Group launches incubator program to accelerate innovation in sustainable mobility
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: CampX by Volvo Group kicks off a new Incubator track in Gothenburg in Sweden this week. Early-stage startups with promising cutting-edge technologies are invited to collaborate to bring their new innovations to life, with help to scale tech and take it to market.

title: Cogna's AI-powered SaaS raises £3.76M to improve industry problem-solving
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, London-based Cogna announced it has raised £3.76 million to transform how traditional industries solve unique, difficult problems.

title: Qventures and Techstars co-lead $450,000 round for pet insurer Fluffy
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-HQed pet care app Fluffy recently banked $450,000 in pre-seed funds.

title: Top 10 European foodtech companies to watch out for this year
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: According to our Annual Report, in 2023 European foodtech companies raised over €700 million (€721.8 million) in some 150+ deals. Although this total isn't enough to put the sector among the top 10 most-funded industries, when it comes to the number of deals, at 154, foodtech takes 8th place and is well worth keeping an eye on.

title: Denmark's Scaleup Finance raises $8M to streamline startup financial planning
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Scaleup Finance has announced an $8 million Pre-Series A round to ‘solve the challenge of financial management’ for startup and scaleup companies.

title: Introw raises €1M to boost AI-driven sales solutions
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Introw, a Ghent-based startup leveraging AI to help sales teams find business contacts through existing partners, has raised €1 million. The fledgling company intends to use the capital to further develop its offer.

title: VisionAI raises €5M to help e-commerce merchants take on Amazon
author: Dan Taylor
summary: VisionAI, a Bielefeld, Germany-based startup using AI to provide e-commerce merchants with better search results and cross-selling opportunities, has raised €5 million in a seed funding round.

title: Factris secures €50 million for its SME financing services offering
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Amsterdam-based fintech Factris has received €50 million from Aegon Asset Management (Aegon AM) to cement its plans to bring its SME financing services into Estonia this quarter.

title: Practica Capital closes largest seed fund in Baltics at €80M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Vilnius-based Practica Capital has today announced the final close of its latest fund at €80 million. The firm’s third fund is more than twice the size of its predecessor and lays claim to the title of largest seed fund in the Baltics.

title: Maxburg Capital Management soars past €1B capital raised with Fund IV
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today private equity firm Maxburg Capital Management (announced the successful closure of Maxburg Capital Fund IV.This brings Maxburg's total capital raised to over €1 billion.

title: GoJoe raises £2.4M for gamified employee health and fitness app
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The health and fitness employee experience app, GoJoe, has raised £2.4 million.

title: Antler's Nordic Fund II attracts €5M investment from SmartCap
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: SmartCap Venture Capital Fund has invested €5 million in Antler's Nordic Fund II, strengthening its commitment to early-stage startups and innovative tech investment strategies.  The fund has also received anchor investments from the Export and Investment Fund of Denmark (EIFO) and Tesi from Finland,

title: Aonic acquires VR game developer nDreams in $110M deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Gaming conglomerate Aonic has acquired UK-based publisher and developer of virtual reality games nDreams in a $110 million deal. The move serves to further Aonic’s VR games market position, adding nDreams to a stable that already plays host to UK-based digital game and animation development studio Milky Tea, and Germany’s Exmox, a gaming-focused performance marketing network.

title: Answering the scalability quandary in quantum computing, Oxford Ionics raises £30 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As the name suggests, Oxford-based Oxford Ionics has raised £30 million in a Series A funding round aimed at accelerating the adoption of the startups' answer to the scalability problem facing the field of quantum computing.

title: Babbel expands language learning ecosystem with Toucan acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today language learning platform Babbel announced the acquisition of the Toucan browser extension for an undisclosed amount.

title: Satim secures $2 million to advance satellite SAR imagery software
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Satim, a Krakow-based startup that focuses on software aimed at automatic object detection, identification, and classification capabilities using satellite SAR (synthetic aperture radar) imagery, has secured $2 million.

title: FSN Capital snaps up German software maker Lobster
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Tutzing, Germany-based no-code data integration and digital process automation software suite maker Lobster has been acquired by Northern European private equity investment house FSN Capital for an undisclosed figure

title: Poland's Plenti raises €5 million for its subscription device hire service
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Poland's Plenti lets consumers rent top-line gadgets on demand rather than having to shell out on every new device. The company is announcing a €5 million late seed round led by 4growth VC to support growth, having also lured funds from Montis Capital, NIF and various business angels.

title: New PitchBook report - All In: Female Founders in the European VC Ecosystem
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: There is a significant number of researches dealing with gender inequalities in the tech sector. According to them, some progress and changes are notable. Thus, a 24 per cent capital increase in 2022 compared to 2021 was recorded within tech startups and scaleups in the UK with at least one woman co-founder.

title: Cyber threat advisory Amossys is hitching a ride with Almond
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: France-based cybersecurity auditor and consultancy Almond has acquired the entire shareholding of its Rennes-HQed peer Amossys.

title: Adamo Foods grills £1.5 million to bring the not-beef to market
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based food tech startup Adamo Foods has raised £1.5 million in a pre-seed investment round. The company is developing plant-based whole-cut meats using fermentation technology combined with mycelium.

title: Protembis raise €30M Series B for heart surgery device
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Medtech company Protembis have raised a €30M Series B round to support the enrollment of their PROTEMBO Investigational Device in clinical trials.

title: UK pettech startup Creature Comforts raises £7M to improve the veterinarian experience
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, UK pettech startup Creature Comforts announced a £7 million raise in Seed capital to redesign the veterinary care experience.

title: Ireland's Ekco acquires IT services company Radius Technologies
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Irish cloud and security service provider Ekco has acquired IT services company Radius Technologies. No financial details of the deal have been disclosed.

title: Key drivers for the innovation of the tech ecosystem – five year predictions from Techstars
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The tech ecosystem, by nature, is characterised by innovations, entrepreneurial initiatives, specialisation, investments, etc. When analysing it, we try to understand what characterises the best ones, why they stand out, what their plans are, and how they recognise which current opportunities they want to seize in order to create long-term benefits.

title: Traveltech Amadeus set to acquire biometrics company Vision-Box €320M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today traveltech company Amadeus announced it is acquiring Vision-Box, a leading provider of biometric solutions for airports, airlines, and border control customers for €320 million.

title: FYLD secures £12M funding for AI-powered field management platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK AI-powered field world management platform FYLD has closed a  £12 million funding round.

title: Visma enters the Croatian market with Moj eRačun acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Visma has acquired Moj eRačun, a leading provider of SaaS business tools in Croatia.

title: Orus Energy secures €2.2M to help decarbonise the power grid
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Energy flexibility platform Orus Energy, has raised a €2.2 million pre-seed round to help decarbonize the power grid.

title: Tech giants join Cambridge University's Founders initiative for startup acceleration
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today 100 leading tech entrepreneurs, investors and operators signed up to be experts for a new flagship entrepreneur initiative called Founders at the University of Cambridge, supporting and accelerating University startup founders.

title: College communication platform Clay has been acquired by Wyblo
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Clay, a Berlin-HQed startup whose communication tools allow colleges to foster student co-operation, avoiding "messy WhatsApp chats" around campus, is being acquired by its Italian ed tech peer Wyblo.

title: Estonia's ÄIO pioneers a greener alternative to palm and coconut oil with sawdust
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Mounting consumer demand, inflation, and sustainability objectives drive food manufacturers to reevaluate their ingredient choices. Oil is a crucial ingredient in many foods and cosmetics, and now an Estonian startup has found a novel alternative.

title: Rocket Factory Augsburg's €30M KKR investment boosts Europe's space industry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Rocket Factory Augsburg, a German launch service provider has secured a €30 million investment from Kohlberg Kravis Roberts & Co., better known as KKR. The convertible debt investment arrives on the heels of Rocket Factory Augsburg’s May 2023 successful completion of an upper-stage hot first test, and action the startup claims to be the first of its kind in Europe.

title: France's Volta Medical raises €36 million series B to help surgeons treat cardiac arrhythmias and fund more clinical testing
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Volta Medical is announcing a €36 million series B fundraise to lift its total investment to above €70 million.

title: Danish challenger bank Lunar takes on €35 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Weeks after revealing it was scaling back expenditures, Danish neobank Lunar has tapped its existing shareholders for a €35 million fundraising.

title: Payment platform Purse acquires ReachFive for enhanced customer experience
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week French payment orchestration company Purse announced its acquisition of customer identity and access management startup ReachFive. The financial specifics of the acquisition have not been disclosed.

title: HRtech startup Coverflex raises €15 million, takes Italy’s buoni pasto market
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Portuguese hrtech startup Coverflex has raised €15 million in a Series A funding round that will see the company launch its compensation solution in Italy as well as strengthen its position in Portugal.

title: New report: Female founders and female emerging fund managers prove resilient in challenging times
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: It wasn’t that long ago that we wrote that gender inequalities are still an issue that is very present in the European tech ecosystem. One of the issues surrounding gender inequalities among tech founders involves funding or the lack thereof, that goes to a female-led team.

title: Canva acquires UK creative software platform Affinity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Australian design platform Canva announced today the acquisition of Affinity, a creative software suite for professional photo editing, illustration, graphic design, and page layout created by UK parent company Serif.

title: Bisly bags €3.6M to expand intelligent building solutions in the Nordic, DACH and UK markets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Tallinn-based intelligent building platform Bisly has raised a €3.6 million funding round. The fresh capital will see the startup expand its solution, which creates energy-efficient buildings, further in the Nordics and DACH region and ramp up its efforts to tackle the UK market.

title: WSense raise €9M for underwater wireless communication 'harnessing the ocean's untapped potential'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Italian IoT startup WSense has developed a kind of wifi for under the sea. The spin-out from Sapienza University in Rome has raised a €9 million funding round which was led by SWEN Blue Ocean. CDP Ventures, RunwayFBU, Axon Partners Group, Katapult Ocean, CoreAngels Climate and Moonstone also got in on the investment action.

title: Zetta Genomics raises £1.9 million to scale its genomic data management platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Cambridge-based Zetta Genomics has raised £1.9 million in a Seed II funding round, to further scale its genomic data management platform XetaBase, ahead of a Series A raise next year.

title: Berlin-based Myosotis secures €8M Series A funding for digital aged care
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: TVM Capital Life Science today announced the closing of an €8 million Series A financing round for Berlin-based digital healthcare startup Myosotis.

title: Swisspod announce new €7M funding round for hyperloop transport
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swiss-American startup Swisspod Technologies, backed by Richard Branson, have announced a new fundraising round which they hope to close at €7M, having raised €200K already.

title: €500M for HR Path, Taxfix acquires TaxScouts, and global tech shapers Finland
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and over 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Alcemy raises $10M to advance cement decarbonisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cement and concrete decarbonisation startup alcemy has raised a $10 million funding scale its cement decarbonisation solution.

title: Tokenization: buzzword or mainstream adoption?
author: Philipp Pieper and Timo Lehes
summary: The crypto space has had a number of opportunities to reach mass adoption but has been held back by a series of high-profile failures. FTX was a pro-regulation exchange that promised a bright future for all until it collapsed after mismanaging investor funds. Similarly, crypto lender Celsius was brimming with potential until it went insolvent, leaving $1.3 billion in missing funds. Bad business practices have continuously eroded progress.

title: This Week in European Tech: Wattif raises close to €50 million, WNS acquires The Smart Cube and OptiBuy, Meta gets $400 million fine, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, the first one of 2023, our research team tracked 35 tech funding deals worth over €269 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Casafari acquires Targomo, giving location intelligence access to Southern Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Lisbon-based real estate data firm Casafari has acquired Berlin-based location intelligence firm Targomo, in an undisclosed deal. The deal will see the Targomo team continue to work from their Berlin office, while customers of the firm will now benefit from Casafari’s detailed real estate database.

title: Semiconductor supplier Renesas acquires 5G provider Sequans for $249 Million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Tokyo-based semiconductor supplier Renesas Electronics Corporation and Parisian 5G and 4G solutions provider Sequans have signed an MoU that will see the latter acquired in a deal valued at approximately $249 million.

title: Ownership of brand discovery platform Trouva trades hands again
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Trouva has been acquired again, this time with ownership changes hands from Next via its acquisition of MADE to Cambridge-based startup Re:store. Terms of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: The Tech.eu Summit: Here’s what you missed in 2022
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While it’s still three months and some change out, May 24th - just in case you haven’t already marked your calendar or bought a ticket, the second edition of the Tech.eu Summit is coming up faster than you think.

title: Identity verification platform Meo raises €1.67M for expansion into new sectors
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Meo (formerly NewBanking), the Danish end-to-end platform helping clients with risk assessment and continuous due diligence, secured €1.67 million, expanding its client base beyond the traditional banking sector to VCs and law firms.

title: Baking up deep hues, France's Ever Dye raises €3.4 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Taking inspiration from the Parisian artisan landscape, Ever Dye is working on dye products sans chemical agents to radically cut down on textiles carbon emissions.

title: SustainCERT raises $37 million to take climate impact verification platform global
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Luxembourg-based SustainCERT has raised a Series B round of $37 million which will enable the climate impact verification company to take its platform to a global audience. Its launching what it calls 'the world’s first climate impact verification platform' which will enable companies to bring credibility to their climate impact claims

title: SP Tech Solutions Secures funding for rail transport optimisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today rail transport optimisation company SP Tech Solutions has secured nearly €3 million new funding round from the Vinci HiTech fund.

title: European venture capital in 2023: Insights from PitchBook's Q3 report
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The new Q3 2023 European Venture Report published by PitchBook reveals that deal value within VC markets is set to end 2023 well below 2022, but signs of recovery could be evident.

title: Fortive acquires Germany's EA Elektro-Automatik in $1.45B deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Germany’s EA Elektro-Automatik has entered a definitive agreement to be acquired by NYSE-listed technology services conglomerate Fortive in a $1.45 billion, all-cash deal from Bregal Unternehmerkapital.

title: Ÿnsect raises €160 million, but closes Dutch production plant and cuts 20% of workforce
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based natural insect protein maker Ÿnsect has raised €160 million in a new funding round. According to the company, the new capital will be used to shift away from its current modus operandi of primarily animal feed to the more lucrative markets of pet foods and food ingredients.

title: Product managers rejoice! Version Lens secures Pre-Seed funding for PM co-pilot
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm startup Version Lens announced today that it has raised a Pre-Seed round for their co-pilot for product managers.

title: Kota partners with Vitality to expand its benefits software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Irish SaaS Kota, which provides automation software for companies, has partnered with health insurer Vitality to expand their benefits software so that companies and employees can manage their health insurance packages.

title: Trever raises €2.4M for asset management platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Trever, an institutional operating system provider for digital assets, has secured a €2.4M seed investment. Its software provides a compatible infrastructure and enables trading, transfer, andbookkeeping of digital assets.

title: Climate Hardware Playbook launched by Speedinvest, Planet A and Norrsken VC
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Leading European VCs Speedinvest, Planet A and Norrsken VC have joined forces to produce their Climate Hardware Playbook, a guide meant to address common issues founding teams face with fundraising, management, and product development.

title: We need to stop overlooking the cooling problem
author: Christian Hernandez Gallardo
summary: Summer this year was the warmest on record. In a 1.5 ◦C world, it is predicted that over 1 billion of the world’s population will be exposed to severe heat waves at least once every 5 years. Annual excess deaths due to heat are already averaging at 500,000 in 2021.

title: Sweden's WirelessCar achieves 10 million global sales for its connected car offering
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Sweden's WirelessCar has confirmed sales of vehicles equipped with its connected car technology have surpassed 10 million.

title: Astanor Ventures closes a second fund of €360M for a sustainable bioeconomy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Belgium-based Astanor Ventures, successfully closed its second venture fund at €360 million.

title: European tech companies are leading the fight against debilitating and chronic pain
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Did you know that chronic pain affects more than 1.5 billion people worldwide?

title: Making the heat pump the European urbanite's winter-long friend, Qvantum takes on €41.2 million fundraise
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Qvantum, a Swedish heat pump supplier that's trying to install more of them in urban apartments around Europe, has announced an SEK 460 million (€41.2 million) fundraise backed by Thomas von Koch, former CEO of EQT, and IKEA's investment arm Ikeasfaren. (source: Digital)

title: Health tech startups are developing a personalised approach to diagnosing and treating complex health conditions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Diagnosing and treating complex health conditions has plagued health professionals forever. In response, we’re in an era of personalised or precision medicine, an approach which endeavours to tailor preventative and treatment strategies to a person’s unique characteristics, such as their genetics, co-existing health conditions, and environment.

title: UK EV charging network has expanded by 30% in last 12 months, according to new data
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The UK's public-access charging network for refuelling electronic vehicles grew by around 30% last year, reaching a total of 37,000 by the end of 2022.

title: Video: A primer on sustainable venture capital investing with Elodie Broad (Balderton) and Kristine Nagle (Your Impact House)
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Tech.eu caught up with sustainability advisor Kristine Nagle and Elodie Broad, the recently appointed Head of Impact and ESG at Balderton Capital, to have a chat about what 'sustainability in VC' actually means, whether 'greenwashing' is a thing in that industry as well, and how investment firms can (should?) approach the implementation of ESG strategies internally and with their portfolio companies.

title: Oxccu takes flight with $22.7 million to fuel sustainable aviation fuel operation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: A research come commercial entity, Oxccu came from the hive mind of University of Oxford researchers, in the UK. The carbon-to-value company which converts carbon dioxide and hydrogen into industrial and consumer products - namely, sustainable aviation fuel - has raised $22.7 million in a Series A round. Funds will allow Oxccu to scale-up the technology, expand its facilities, and double its team in the UK.

title: 10 French startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In 2023 French companies raised €8.4 billion over 410 deals. According to our Annual report, France took third place among countries by the total raised amount.

title: Finnish influencer platform Boksi targets DACH region after €7M raise
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish influencer marketing and content creation platform Boksi has just completed a €7 million Series A funding round, its first closing was in late 2022.

title: Raffolux secures £1.5M investment in airtime-for-equity deal with UKTV Ventures
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today digital raffle operator Raffolux announced a £1.5 million investment through an "airtime-for-equity" deal with media company UKTV Ventures.

title: Irish confidential computing start-up Oblivious has raised €5.35 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dublin-based confidential computing start-up Oblivious has raised a Seed round of €5.35 million to bring trust between organisations where confidential data is exposed.

title: Kriya bags new £50M funding facility to power B2B credit transactions
author: John Reynolds
summary: Kriya, a London-based B2B payments fintech, has raised a new £50m funding facility to power credit transactions, as it looks to grow its B2B embedded finance credentials.

title: Luxury assets platform Konvi acquires Diversified and Fractible
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Luxury assets investment platform Konvi has acquired Diversified and Fractible, consolidating their market share among a shared customer base. Financial terms of the deal are undisclosed.

title: Venture capital’s great reset starts now - London Business School looks ahead to a year in tech
author: Guest Writer
summary: Gary Dushnitsky, Associate Professor Strategy and Entrepreneurship at LBS, says 2023 is a reset - not a collapse - in the fortunes of the tech sector.

title: Stanhope AI raises £2.3M for neuroscience-driven AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Neuroscience-driven AI startup Stanhope has raised £2.3m, spurring further development into ‘human-like’ AI that mimics the information-gathering processes of the brain. The round was led by the UCL Tech Fund alongside Moonfire Ventures, Rockmount Capital and angel investors.

title: This week in European tech: Beamery layoffs, NVIDIA's quantum play, and PAI closes €7.1B buyout fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €1.2 billion. We saw over 10 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: Sustainability scoring platform Redigo Carbon raises seed funding
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Polish-born, London-based ESG monitoring platform Redigo Carbon has attracted 1.2 million Polish zloty ($269,500) from Invento VC's Bridge Alfa programme, reports Poland's MamStartup.

title: RISORCE raises €12.5 million for a sustainable tyre recycling plant in Belgium
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belgian startup RISORCE (Renewable, Innovative Solutions towards Recycling & Circular Economy) recently raised €12.5 million investment to build a new end-of-life recycling plant in the province of Liège.

title: The real power of applying Artificial Intelligence to VC? Uncovering diamonds in the rough
author: Imran Ghory
summary: As investors rush to find the next big AI deal, they should pay more attention to the potential AI has to reinvent venture capital.

title: Ganymed Robotics banks an additional €15 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian computer vision software and surgical robotics technologies company Ganymed Robotics has raised an additional €15 million in a Series B round extension, bringing the total amount of the round to a healthy €36 million.

title: Coincover secures $30 million to continue making our digital assets safer
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UK-based Coincover has received $30 million in a round led by Silicon Valley-based Foundation Capital to further expand its digital asset security platform.

title: Europe's startups pave the way for a low-carbon, low-waste future for concrete
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Concrete is the most widely used manufactured material on earth. Each year, 32 billion tonnes of concrete are produced, delivering 2.9bn tonnes of associated carbon dioxide emissions.

title: Promoting fairness and sustainability in the electronics industry, Fairphone rings up €49 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based sustainable smartphone company Fairphone has raised €49 million in a new funding round led by new investor Invest-NL andexisting shareholder Quadia via its Regenero Impact Fund. The round also saw participation from existing backers DALHAP, DOEN Participaties, and PDENH.

title: Finland’s Fixably finds $10 million, launches refurb service
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Helsinki-based post-sales SaaS platform Fixably has raised $10 million in a seed funding round. Essentially, the startup’s MO is to provide a workflow management solution to retailers that helps them promote repairs over replacements, all the while retaining profitability.

title: ImpactVC ignites knowledge sharing drive backed by Northzone, Balderton, among 120 VC names
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A new European VC collective comprising 120 venture firms, including Northzone and Balderton, will attempt to disseminate industry knowledge on leveraging ROI and ESG value from impact-led investments.

title: 900.care raises €21 million Series A for refillable hygiene products
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Globally, industries and individuals aim to reduce their carbon footprint. However, vegan and natural goods are often more expensive than their alternatives or filled with ingredients from far flung places, resulting in a bloated carbon footprint.

title: Lillian Care raises €2.4M to develop hybrid primary care platform in Germany
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German healthcare startup Lillian Care has raised a €2.4 million funding round, this brings its total funding to date to €5 million. The fresh funding will see further development of the primary care platform which enables hybrid practices for general medicine throughout Germany.

title: Sega acquires Rovio in €706 million deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Sega Europe Limited and Rovio, best known for its Angry Birds franchise have announced an agreement that will see the former acquire the latter in a deal worth €706 million.

title: HireAra raises €527K Seed funding for AI-powered recruitment platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: HRtech startup HireAra announced today that it has raised a €527,000 seed round for their AI-powered candidate presentation platform for recruitment agencies.

title: Potential of B2B embedded finance “colossal”
author: John Reynolds
summary: The potential of embedded finance in the B2B world is “colossal” and can have a seismic impact like Klarna did in the B2C world, according to the boss of a London-based fintech, which has just struck an embedded finance deal with the UK's largest retailer of motoring and cycling products and services, Halfords.

title: Four Job Hunting New Year's Resolutions For 2023
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: It takes approximately five months, from interview to offer, to secure a new job, and according to online resume builder Zety, only 10% of job applications result in interviews, and job seekers need to send between 30-50 resumes to get hired.

title: UK indie horror game devs Cathedral Studios raises $6.66M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK indie games  devs Cathedral Studios announced today that it has successfully closed a Seed funding round of $6.66 million.

title: AI startup Artisan raises $2.3M to develop human-like digital workers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, AI startup Artisan announced that it has raised $2.3 million to build the first human-like digital workers.

title: How and why Euronext Corporate Services is leading the industry behind the industry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In 2016 the Euronext Group instigated a strategic plan to diversify and augment its exchange business beyond volume-driven activities. As part of this initiative, Euronext Corporate Services was established in order to provide clients with a range of services aimed at helping them thrive in capital markets.

title: Paris-based Quadrille Capital appoints three new Partners
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Venture capital and growth equity firm Quadrille Capital has added three new partners, Alejandra Duran Gil, Vianney Barre and Edouard Brunet, to its roster. All three have been with the firm since 2019 and join the upper ranks as the VC firm bids to ‘accelerate its global development in Europe and the United States’. The firm has €1.7 billion in assets under management. Four new Vice Presidents and four new Associates have also been appointed internally.

title: How 3D scanning has made ambitious energy engineering a reality
author: Mathieu Kerbiguet
summary: Fusion, the process that powers all stars in the universe, holds the key to solving Earth's growing energy crisis.

title: UK EV charging network has expanded by 30% in last 12 months, according to new data
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The UK's public-access charging network for refuelling electronic vehicles grew by around 30% last year, reaching a total of 37,000 by the end of 2022.

title: Holdbar raises $1 million for experience provider software UX
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Denmark-based leisure experiences admin platform Holdbar has confirmed raising $1 million of pre-seed funding from early-stage VC vehicle Founderment.

title: Delivery Hero exits stake in Deliveroo in deal valued at up to £82M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based food delivery company Delivery Hero is exiting its stake in rival Deliveroo in a move the company cites as a “commitment to disciplined capital allocation”.

title: UK's "first" on-demand medicines courier Healistic raises £1 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Healistic is thought to be the UK's first business-to-consumer pharmaceuticals delivery service. The startup has raised £1 million from unnamed investors to bring pharmacist-only medicines directly to the front door of UK patients, aiming to reach them within 45 minutes of their order being placed.

title: Woltair powers up with €20.5 Million funding to accelerate residential clean energy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Czech renewable energy company Woltair announced a €20.5 million funding. The company previously raised €16.3 million in September 2022.

title: Raylo secures £110 million in working capital, achieves B-Corp status
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based tech refurb/subscription platform Raylo has secured £110 million in a debt financing package provided by NatWest and Quilam Capital. As expected given Raylo’s vertical, the working capital is expected to be used to fund growth and product expansion. Since mid-June 2019, Raylo has raised in excess of £150 million.

title: Metyos raises €2.3M pre-seed to combat chronic kidney disease
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Paris based medtech startup Metyos has raised €2.3 million in pre-seed funding to develop biosensors for the 800 million people affected by chronic kidney disease (CKD).

title: FarmInsect's €8M funding boosts scale-up of insect-based livestock feed technology
author: Fiona Alston
summary: An agritech startup in Germany is using insects as a sustainable option for livestock feed. The aptly named FarmInsect has raised a €8 million Series A funding round which will see the commercial scale-up of the company and further development of its technology.

title: Smart Reporting receives €15 million from European Investment Bank to scale its AI-supported diagnostic clinical software
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Munich-based health-tech start-up Smart Reporting has announced it has be granted a €15 million venture debt loan from European Investment Bank (EIB) to develop its voice-controlled, AI-supported diagnostic clinic software and bring it to the US and Canada.

title: Angry Birds: The Rovio/Playtika deal that never was
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Earlier this year, we brought to you the news that Israeli digital entertainment developer Playtika (and “certain parties”) were in the running to acquire Finland’s Rovio, most noted for their Angry Birds franchise.

title: Confirmed: Angry Birds franchise developer Rovio in talks with Playtika - and others - about a takeover
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It would appear as though last week’s rumours concerning Finnish games developer Rovio, most noted for their Angry Birds franchise, are valid. However, what was perhaps previously unknown was that the ‘birds are shopping the offer with not only Israeli digital entertainment developer Playtika with an offer on the table but also undisclosed “parties”.

title: Spotlight CES: Spectricity unveils first multispectral image sensor for smartphones
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: You wouldn't necessarily think there's many more improvements to be made on the cameras found in some of the latest smartphones.

title: Last-mile mixed electric fleets could save €500M annually and cut emissions by 80%
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, a new study by EIT InnoEnergy, a body of the European Union, found that mixed electric fleets of e-cargo bikes and e-vans can save urban logistics providers significant costs compared to a 100 per cent e-van fleet operation and contribute to improving overall life quality in cities.

title: Carbonaide has first building blocks to carbon negative concrete as it secures €1.8 million in Seed funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finland’s Carbonaide has raised €1.8 million in Seed funding to kick start the manufacturing of carbon-negative concrete.

title: Miraxess locks down €2.5 million for consumer electronics offering
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: France's Miraxess in announcing a series A fundraise of €2.5 million (source) to further ameliorate its emerging range of consumer electronics, including its forthcoming Mirabook product that streams laptop workflows from the user's smartphone.

title: AI platform Skyqraft raises $3.8M to improve energy grid infrastructure inspections
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Swedish grid inspection company Skyqraft announced the closure of an oversubscribed investment round, securing $3.8 million.

title: Businesses need to wake up to the potential for AI as a force for good
author: Nigel Richardson
summary: The potential impact of AI has dominated recent conversations about the future of work and business. There are, for good reasons, concerns being raised about its development and the potential consequences of the speed with which AI has developed in recent years.

title: Resistomap raises €2M to combat global antibiotic resistance with intelligence platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today antibiotic resistance monitoring startup Resistomap announced that it has raised a €2M seed funding round.

title: Another €50 million on the table, as Inven Capital and EIB broaden ties
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Inven Capital, an independent venture firm allied to its 100% equity holder CEZ, the Czech energy utility, has launched the second phase of its clean tech collaboration with the European Investment Bank.

title: Challenger bank bunq reports first full-year profit, plans UK relaunch
author: John Reynolds
summary: One of Europe’s biggest challenger banks bunq has reported its first-ever full-year profit, as it gears up for its UK relaunch after submitting an Electronic Money Institution (EMI) licence application.

title: Bridging the gap between start and issuance, nature-based carbon projects financier Maya Capital raises €1.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While there’s certainly no shortage of carbon remove projects and associated startups and scaleups working on them, one area that’s been gaining traction is that of nature-based solutions, of NbS as the kids call it.

title: Payrails scaling its payment operating system for global platforms with $14.4 million Seed extension
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based payments platform Payrails has secured a Seed extension round of $14.4 million for its end-to-end operating system that spans the entire payment processing value chain. Funds will fuel a 'product roadmap to solve its customers' complex payment challenges and increase go-to-market capacity, catering to its strong customer pipeline'. So, it will fuel growth.

title: Next in the firing line, Glovo lays off 250 staff members
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Glovo has released 6.5% of its workforce, bidding an emotional goodbye earlier today to 250 of its workers.

title: Getir raising $500M at a dramatically lowered $2.5B valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Getir, the Istanbul-based rapid grocery service is raising $500 million at a valuation of $2.5 billion, according to a report filed by the ft’s Ivan Levingston and George Hammond. The investment would value the company at $2.5 billion a figure dramatically reduced from the company’s heady 2022 days when it was valued at $11.8 billion.

title: Nortech AI raises €2.5M for IoT solutions in maritime industry
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Norwegian-Portuguese IoT solutions startup Nortech AI has raised a €2.5 million funding round to bring its plug-and-play solution to maritime and other asset-heavy industries, reducing costs and the impact of those industries on the environment.

title: Jimini AI,  an AI co-pilot for legal professionals raises €1.9M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French legal AI company Jimini AI announced it has completed a €1.9 million Seed funding round to accelerate its growth.

title: ampere.cloud raises €5 million Series A for renewable energy management platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German climate tech start-up ampere.cloud has raised a €5 million Series A financing round which will help its plans for a European expansion.

title: EIC Fund takes stock, having pumped €331 million into deep tech startups since November
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: EIC Fund has confirmed making €331 million in investments since November, across 42 early stage deals in total.

title: FSN Capital snaps up German software maker Lobster
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Tutzing, Germany-based no-code data integration and digital process automation software suite maker Lobster has been acquired by Northern European private equity investment house FSN Capital for an undisclosed figure

title: Arrow Risk Management raises £2M for insurtech underwriting platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Arrow Risk Management, a specialist managing general agency (MGA) underwriting platform that provides brokers and carriers with real-time data across the insurance lifecycle, has raised £2 million in funding.

title: Destinus partners with the Spanish government,  flying faster towards its dream of speedy long distance aviation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This month Swiss startup Destinus gets closer to its aim to make long-distance flights fast. It has a highly ambitious plan for hypersonic green hydrogen-fueled aircraft to fly us from Sydney to Frankfurt in 4 hours and 15 minutes instead of 20 hours.

title: Boston's Action Fund for antimicrobial resistance has closed its first European deal, pouring funds into Swiss biotech BioVersys
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: AMR Action Fund, a bacterial resistance-themed investment vehicle armed with $1 billion to spend, has backed a series C round for BioVersys, a developer of antimicrobial products based out of Basel, Switzerland.

title: Northern Gritstone invests in C-Capture's unique carbon dioxide removal technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Northern Gritstone announced that it has invested in carbon dioxide capture company C-Capture as part of a funding round of up to £10 million.

title: This Week in European Tech: Mirakl bags €100M, Hopin hopped out and more
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €409 million. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 15 exits and M&A transactions.

title: Defacto's €10M Series A extension fuels plans for German market entry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Defacto, a Parisian fintech offering embedded B2B lending solutions, has secured an additional €10 million in an extension of a Series A funding round. The capital will be used to drive international expansion plans, particularly in the German market, and further refine and personalise the company’s offer with a more proactive approach.

title: Startup Survival: Navigating the Challenges of War in Ukraine
author: Alexandra Balkova
summary: Amid nearly a year of the ongoing war conflict in Ukraine, the country's technology sector has played a vital role in resisting Russian aggression. Ukrainian startups have supported the army in cyberspace through initiatives such as the IT army or Army of Drones while continuing to operate their businesses, implement projects, pay taxes, acquire new customers, and expand globally.

title: MGISS raises £600K for geospatial data mapping critical infrastructure
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today geospatial firm Mobile GIS Services (MGISS) announced that it has raised £600,000 from NPIF – Mercia Equity Finance.

title: Offering brands an NFT-based turnkey loyalty solution, Cohort raises €3.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Customer loyalty. Brands want it, and consumers want something for it. But beyond the tried and true, and quite frankly, somewhat now boring membership card or loyalty points that have become de rigueur, what’s a brand to do? Well, why not hop on the NFT train, even if they’re not really quite sure what that is?

title: It’s off into the wild blue Yonder as rewards credit card startup navigates £62.5 million deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based rewards credit card startup Yonder has raised £62.5 million in a Series A funding round. The company says that the new capital will be used to double its team size to expand into new verticals and launch in new UK cities.

title: Finbourne and Kreos Capital clinch £30 million debt facility
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UK fintech SaaS company Finbourne Technology has closed an up to £30 million debt facility from London-based lender Kreos Capital (source).

title: Sweden's H2 Green Steel secures €1.5B to build large-scale green steel plant
author: Fiona Alston
summary: H2 Green Steel has raised ‘about €1.5 billion’ in equity funding to fund the build of the world’s first large-scale green steel plant and Europe’s first giga-scale electrolyser.

title: Motatos' fight against global food waste: An inside look
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Motatos, the online discount supermarket selling food that would otherwise go to waste, has been changing the food retail game since 2014. By extending its operations beyond the Nordics into regions like Austria and Germany, the company has positioned itself at the forefront of the battle against one of the most pressing global issues – food waste.

title: Why fundraising in sextech is so painful, and 4 strategies to make it less so
author: Olena Petrosyuk
summary: Raising capital in sextech has never been a walk in the park. When it comes to sextech, investors sure like to talk the talk but not so much to walk the walk. In 2022, sextech startups raised a mere $275.8 million, which is less than their counterparts in the lingerie or pet tech sectors.

title: B2B BNPL player Mondu continues to makes waves as it enters UK market
author: Dan Taylor
summary: With the UK B2B e-commerce sector worth an estimated $200 billion, Mondu’s arrival at the table home that plays host and creator of Shepards Pie was nothing but inevitable. And so arrives the day, as BNPL for B2B transactions player Mondu expands to its fourth market with the UK, having experienced tremendous and rapid growth across Germany, Austria and the Netherlands.

title: Wood-en you know it, Sweden's Modvion clinches €11 million to deliver emissions-light wooden towers for wind turbines
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Sweden's Modvion recently closed on a SEK125 million (€11 million) funding. The round is backed by Vestas Ventures, the CVC wing of wind turbine producer Vestas, as well as the EU Commission's EIC Fund, Sweden's Almi Invest Greentech, Course Corrected VC, and Austrian CVC fund Symbia VC, among others.

title: Robots aren't representing us in court but here are 7 legal tech startups transforming the legal system
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Traditionally, lawyers and legal representation are conservative, slow, methodical, and expensive. But now legal tech startups are stepping up to the bar, using technology such as AI and machine learning, teleoperations, and apps to bring justice to more people than ever before.

title: graswald.ai raises $3.3M for its 3D content creation platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German 3D brand creation tool graswald.ai has raised $3.3 million with funding co-led by Lakestar and Supernode Global. graswald.ai transforms enterprise 3D content with a Figma or Canva for 3D platform that drastically enhances customer engagement through immersive visuals.

title: London's Playfair Capital returns for the hat trick, this time with $70 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Playfair Capital has announced its third fund at $70 million. The tertiary outing will continue to follow the firm’s low-volume approach, making only six to eight investments per year. In contrast to making 30+ investments a year, Playfair specialises in unearthing diamonds in the rough, as it were, supporting companies often found outside traditional tech hubs, as evidenced by

title: Swiss insurance industry-specialist Imburse Payments acquired by Duck Creek Technologies
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Boston-based listed company Duck Creek Technologies has acquired payments platform Imburse Payments for an undisclosed figure.

title: Advancing gene therapy safety: Broken String raises $15M for DNA break mapping platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based biotech firm Broken String Biosciences is building a platform that according to the company, accelerates the characterisation of novel genome editing technologies. The Next Generation Sequencing (NGS)-based DNA break mapping platform provides a PaaS (platform as a service) to ensure that the development of cell and gene therapies is safer by design.

title: Tomorrowland founder amongst investors pouring €1.4 million into BeerMate
author: Dan Taylor
summary: BeerMate has raised €1.4 million in new capital so that you and I never have to queue for a tasty brew at events ever again. The maker of automatic beer serving machines intends to use the fresh barley, hops, yeast, and water to tap international expansion plans, including a US market entry in 2025

title: Small but mighty: Preparing family-run SMEs for a digital future
author: Mark Barnett
summary: Small businesses are the driving force of the European economy; accounting for 99 percent of European enterprises, making up 52 percent of Europe’s GDP, and employing 85 million people. This week marks the European Commission’s annual SME Week, a chance to celebrate the enormous contribution these businesses make, but also an opportunity to problem solve and ensure they are supported in their evolution.

title: GV welcomes new Partner and Silicon Valley veteran Luna Schmid to London office
author: Dan Taylor
summary: One look at the career path of new London-based Partner at GV Luna (Dai) Schmid is a sight to behold. Over the course of a decade, she’s gone from an investment banking analysis at Margan Stanley to crafting private equity-esqu deals at Warburg Pincus, to rolling the dice hard with Softbank Vision Fund as Vice President, to another VP role with Summit Partners, and now, Partner at GV.

title: zick learn raises €500,000 for text-based microlearning expansion in Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Text-based microlearning platform, zick learn, has raised €500,000 in funding from Italian edtech investment firm Zanichelli Venture and some angel investors. Funds will see the Dublin-based start-up accelerate its growth across Europe, in particular throughout Ireland and the UK, and strengthen its team with some new hires.

title: Poland's Fungies.io raises $850K for no-code platform for the gaming industry
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Fungies.io is a no-code SaaS platform for the gaming industry. The start-up, which is based in Poland, has raised a $850K Pre-seed round. Investors in the round include Depo Ventures, Czech Founders VC, Necto Labs, CV VC, Outlier Ventures, Tatum, and StartupYard.

title: The gamer identity cycle and evolution
author: Philipp Gladkov
summary: Billion of players want to share content and their passion - games

title: Beyond Work raises $2.5M to build human-ai work platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Christian Lanng, CEO and co-founder of $2 billion enterprise Tradeshift is heading up a cracking team of founders including Joakim Recht, former Distinguished Engineer at Uber, Mikkel Bo Schmidt, former Head of Design at Tradeshift, Kate Kharchenko, Customer Success at Stack Overflow, and Malte Højmark-Bertelsen, former Head of AI and Data Science at KMD, and they are building what they are calling a 'human AI work platform' - Beyond Work.

title: Why women in tech have a three-year “experience gap” compared to men
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: In Europe, a lack of female participation in tech begins early.

title: This week in European tech: Nokia scales back, Volta Trucks unplugs, and EQT closes in on nearly €20B
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion. We saw over 10 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: Why ‘mattering’ matters in Gen Z staff retention
author: Arnaud Blachon
summary: With Gen Z making up around 20 percent of the global workforce and growing year on year, employers cannot ignore what this age group values most in the workplace. As a generation of entrepreneurial, digital natives, they are not typically swayed by a few elevated figures on a wage slip, nor the hollow ‘perks’ of pizza parties and beanbags in a modern office.

title: emma raises $6 million in Seed funding to hire engineers for no-code platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Luxemburg-based cloud management no-code platform emma has raised $6 million in Seed funding with an expansion in the US and new hires in the engineering team on the cards.

title: Dianosic brings home €4.7 million for novel nasal treatment to address allergies like hayfever
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Strasbourg's Dianosic has received €4.7 million to launch a phase 1 clinical trial of its novel allergic rhinitis treatment once its immediate in vivo study has completed.

title: Talent acquisition platform RAMP Global raises $1 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UK-based talent acquisition platform RAMP Global has received $1 million to scale up software development and product capacity.

title: Inflection AI co-founder Mustafa Suleyman joins Microsoft
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Mustafa Suleyman, the co-founder of Inflection and Google’s Deepmind, has been hired by Microsoft to lead Microsoft's consumer AI division, Microsoft AI. Inflection’s co-founder and Chief Scientist, Karén Simonyan, accompanies Suleyman in the move and will report to him.

title: Going with the Flowla gains the sales tool $1.3 million seed funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Sales software start-up Flowla raised $1.3 million pre-seed funding allowing it to hire talent and expand across Europe from its London base.

title: Venture capital’s great reset starts now - London Business School looks ahead to a year in tech
author: Guest Writer
summary: Gary Dushnitsky, Associate Professor Strategy and Entrepreneurship at LBS, says 2023 is a reset - not a collapse - in the fortunes of the tech sector.

title: Spanish fintech lender Payflow secures up to €20M growth capital in BBVA Spark deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Barcelona-based salary advance platform Payflow has secured up to €20 million in debt funding in a deal with BBVA Spark, provided through asset-backed debt facility management platform Fence.

title: UK-based Mindgard tackles security for the AI space with £3M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based deeptech AI security startup, Mindgard has raised £3 million in a seed funding round to accelerate growth as it launches its platform and expands operations in the UK. Investing in the round were IQ Capital and Lakestar.

title: Goldman Sachs and BNP Paribas lead Fnality's £77.7M funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Fnality, a London-based startup working on distributed Financial Market Infrastructures (dFMIs), specifically blockchain-based payments, has raised £77.7 million in a Series B funding round.

title: New accelerator aims to connect Visegrad 4 innovators and Ukraine's tech ecosystem
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Wolves Summit, the CEE startup networking enabler that launched a new regional deep tech accelerator in December, is announcing another accelerator today to connect Ukraine's tech ecosystem to counterparts in the Visegrad 4 (V4) bloc.

title: Orbital secures £5M to expand crypto and traditional payment capabilities in global companies
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based traditional finance and crypto solutions platform Orbital, has raised £5 million in an oversubscribed round. Orbital by name and orbital by nature, the fintech is a licensed provider for traditional payment and crypto payments for global firms, 'especially focusing on the business use cases for stablecoins in cross-border payments'.

title: German firm Bind-X secures €10M funding for sustainable industrial solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German firm Bind-X takes the dust out of, well, dust, using its sustainable biological binding of materials. The industrial biotechnology Munich-based start-up has just raised over €10 million in a Series B round.

title: The 5 things to remember when you’re looking for a co-founder
author: Coralie Chaufour
summary: Finding a co-founder is one of the most important things to get right when founding a startup. But it’s also one of the most difficult.

title: HSBC and Tradeshift launch joint venture for embedded finance solutions
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Copenhagen-born B2B fintech Tradeshift has garnered a $35 million investment from HSBC as the two sign a joint venture to launch a new business focused on the development of embedded finance solutions and financial services apps.

title: UK startup Shop Circle raises $120M for e-commerce tools expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK startup Shop Circle has developed a suite of back-end and customer-facing tools to accommodate growing e-commerce businesses. It has also recently launched a data-driven tech stack consultation program. Using AI and ‘hyper-personalised data-driven insights’, Shop Circle is helping brands to reduce costs and increase the conversion of site visits to sales all whilst delivering a superb customer experience.

title: Swedish startup Ankra secures Pre-seed funding for cloud automation expansion in UK
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swedish cloud infrastructure automation platform Ankra has raised a €1.1 million Pre-seed funding round. The round is led by SuperSeed and includes angel investment.

title: The next fintech unicorn will be a firm that completes the transition to cashless societies
author: Dr. David von Rosen-von Hoewel
summary: Europe is leading the charge towards cashless societies, with some of the lowest rates of cash transactions in the world.

title: CCP Games locks down $40 million via Andreessen Horowitz and others
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Best known for their EVE Online MMORPG, Reykjavík-based CCP Games has secured $40 million in financing via Andreessen Horowitz, Makers Fund, BITKRAFT, Kingsway Capital, Nexon, Hashed, and additional undisclosed participants. The capital will be used to enable the full-scale development of a new AAA title utilizing blockchain technology, set within the EVE Universe.

title: Fresh from luring €1.1 million, Madrid's Snab is growing its centralised B2B payments platform
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Madrid-based Snab has raised €1.1 million in pre-seed funds from investors including Silicon Valley accelerator Y Combinator.

title: Work and knowledge management platform Fibery raises $5.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cyprus-based Fibery has raised $5.2 million in a Series A funding round. The capital is intended to be used to further accelerate the startup’s development, with a particular focus on upping the sales and marketing headcount.

title: Banking-as-a-Service pioneer Solaris announces €96M Series F funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, German embedded finance platform Solaris SE announced the signing of its €96 million Series F round led by SBI Group and other existing investors. it brings the company's funding to over €450 million.

title: Videowise's eCommerce video platform grabs the attention of Slack Fund leading to $3 million Seed round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Bucharest-based Videowise has raised a $3 million Seed round to develop its video commerce technology stack further for omni-channel video shopping experiences.

title: Fentech raises €1.2M for its sales forecasting solution helping retailers fight inflation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, sales forecasting company Fentech announced it has raised €1.2 million, led by Elaia.

title: Irish startup Micron Agritech raises €2.7M to reduce unnecessary anti-parasite use on farms
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dublin-based Micron Agritech, an agritech startup that is using rapid AI-powered testing to reduce the overuse of anti-parasite treatment in animals, has raised €2.7 million in a new funding round.

title: Berlin's Nuventura raises €25M for SF6-free switchgear technologies
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based switchgear firm Nuventura provides SF6-free, medium-voltage (MV) gas-insulated switchgear (GIS) technologies to enable the transition away from SF6. SF6, or Sulphur hexafluoride, is the world's strongest greenhouse gas with 25,200x more global warming power than carbon dioxide - with dry air. According to National Grid, around 80 percent of the SF6 used globally is in electricity transmission and distribution.

title: Savings and investment app Chip hits quarterly profit as it begins latest crowdfund campaign
author: John Reynolds
summary: UK savings and investment app Chip has made its first profitable quarter, it says, as it kicks off another crowdfunding campaign.

title: Every end is a new beginning: Tech Nation CEO Gerard Grech reflects on the past decade, and what comes next
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Tech Nation will reach the end of its journey on 31 March, and after that it will be up to Barclays Eagle Lab to provide similar, perhaps complementary services to the UK tech community's startups and scale-ups.

title: Zeedz raises $1M Seed funding for its climate change fighting game
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today gaming company Zeedz announced a $1 million Seed round and the launch of the free-to-play (F2P) game, Zeedz, on Android and iOS app stores worldwide.

title: Double-digit million-pound losses at two European open banking startups, but revenues increase
author: John Reynolds
summary: Startup unicorn TrueLayer and Yapily, which has raised nearly £60 million in funding, are startups that are making a name for themselves in the increasingly competitive area of open banking.

title: UK government’s Future Fund scheme “imperfect” but “critical form of support” to Covid-impacted startups, say crowdfunding platforms
author: John Reynolds
summary: A controversial UK government Covid support scheme, which lent tens of millions to failed startups, was “imperfect” but represented a “critical form of support” to pandemic-scarred startups, say the scheme’s participating crowdfunders.

title: Fintech leaders review Web Summit speaking gigs following founder’s Israel “war crimes” claim
author: John Reynolds
summary: Fintech leaders are reviewing whether to fulfil speaking engagements at Europe's biggest technology conference, in light of controversial comments made by its founder over the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Zenobē secures £800 million investment from KKR and Infracapital for global energy expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: NYSE-listed private equity firm KKR has set its sights on gaining a substantial foothold in the UK's energy sector and is investing approximately £600 million into UK-based battery energy storage development firm Zenobē.

title: UK bike insurer Bikmo secures £3.4M funding for European growth
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, specialist UK bike insurer Bikmo, announced it had raised £3.4 million to drive European expansion in a Series A extension round. The insurer protects over 75,000 riders (from mountain bikers to triathletes to e-bike riders) in the UK, Ireland, Germany and Austria. Its API technology means it can deliver embedded insurance solutions through retail, manufacturing and other partners to integrate the product into their customer journeys to maximise conversions.

title: This week in European tech: Aleph Alpha goes big, Getir gets Fresh(Direct), and what's up with AI startups in France?
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1.4 billion. We saw over 10 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: eToro completes $250 million funding round at a valuation of $3.5 billion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: eToro, a London headquartered fintech, recently completed a $250 million funding round at a valuation of $3.5 billion.

title: Airbnb co-founder pours another €23.2 million into The Ocean Cleanup
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Rotterdam's Ocean Cleanup has lured $25 million (€23.2 million) courtesy of a follow-on donation by Airbnb and Samara co-founder Joe Gebbia.

title: Cologne construction tech startup Specter Automation raises €2.7 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Cologne's Specter Automation has raised €2.7 million in seed funds. The round is led by regional investor TechVision Fund, with participation from co-investors LBBW Venture Capital, xdeck VC, and multiple German/US angels.

title: Coinmart partners with Coinbase backer IDG Capital
author: Lucy Adams
summary: IDG Capital has announced a strategic partnership with Dutch cryptoplatform Coinmart including an investment of an undisclosed sum. The Chinese venture firm also backs leading cryptocurrency hub Coinbase.

title: OneWeb completes constellation with successful deployment of 36 satellites from India
author: Fiona Alston
summary: OneWeb has confirmed the successful deployment and contact of 36 satellites launched by NewSpace India Limited (NSIL).

title: Poppins secures €8M for children's neurodevelopmental disorder therapy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today healthtech company Poppins (formerly known as Mila) has announced a €8 million financing round led by Eurazeo alongside Verve Ventures, Allianz France and HEC Ventures. This brings the company's funding to €12.9 million.

title: Cardino raises €1M and launches new C2B EV auction site
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based EV marketplace startup, Cardino has raised a €1 million pre-seed round and launched its new online platform.

title: Opna raises $6.5M to boost global carbon project financing
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Opna, a London-based fintech that was until most recently known as Salt, has announced the raise of $6.5 million in a seed funding round. The capital will be used to increase awareness of the financing platform that focuses on providing capital to global carbon projects, as well as further develop the platform’s proprietary risk engine.

title: Retention and competition are the critical challenges to success in 2024 reveals Unreasonable Impact survey
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The end of the year always raises two important topics — the overview of the results of the year behind us, but also the expectations and challenges that the next year will bring to us.

title: Kinetix's emote SDK kit electro shuffles its way on stage
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: When it comes to digital self-expression, we're perhaps most familiar with emojis, the little indicators of joy, love, despair, pride, and comradeship that spice up our day-to-day interactions.

title: Par Equity £67M investment to accelerate innovation in Northern UK
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Edinburgh-based VC Par Equity announced the first close of £67 million led by Scottish National Investment Bank and British Business Investments.

title: Confirmed: Barclays Eagle Labs wins UK digital growth tender, will replace Tech Nation
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The UK government's digital growth services tender has been awarded to Barclays Eagle Lab, it has been confirmed, meaning British startups will lose existing provider Tech Nation's offering.

title: The end of an era as Tech Nation to cease operations as of March 31st
author: Dan Taylor
summary: “It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness, it was the epoch of belief, it was the epoch of incredulity, it was the season of light, it was the season of darkness, it was the spring of hope, it was the winter of despair.”

title: Embedded finance platform Solaris closes €38 million funding round to ‘strengthen governance and compliance’
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Embedded finance platform Solaris has closed a €38 million Series F round to ‘strengthen governance and compliance’ marking the next stage of growth for the company. The funding round was led by existing investors.

title: Healthtech takes centre stage at IFA
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Every year at IFA, healthtech is up front and centre, with health and fitness tracking embedding itself into all kinds of health devices, including watches and apps.

title: Future proofing coffee Amatera secures €1.5M for non-GMO breeding platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based biotech firm Amatera has raised €1.5 million Pre-seed round. The round was led by PINC (Paulig’s venture arm) and included participation from Exceptional Ventures, Mudcake, Joyance Partners, Agfunder and some angel investors including Nicolas Morin-Forest from Gourmey.

title: Here's why unicorn status eludes Europe's new social media networks
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today marks the launch of a new social network out of Portugal. Daily Crowds aims to generate content using a natural language search engine and a discovery and recommendation system for both online content and events.

title: Ponzi 2.0: The wild story of an investment into an Estonian startup that doesn’t exist
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Last week Hedonova, a Paris-based hedge fund, announced an equity investment of $16 million in Series A funding of an Estonian startup called Carbonomy. Where things get wild is that Carbonomy does not exist, and the funding round never occurred.

title: Taking on inflation, former Getir, McKinsey, Facebook, and Google execs found Cenoa, net $7 million in seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Aiming to help consumers that have felt the sting of inflation, mainly in emerging markets, technically Singapore-based, but with a majority of staff based in Türkiye, startup Cenoa has raised $7 million in a seed funding round. The capital raise is aimed at helping the company expand both beyond its core product as well as into new markets including Latin America, Africa, Southeast Asia, and Europe.

title: The end of an era as Tech Nation to cease operations as of March 31st
author: Dan Taylor
summary: “It was the best of times, it was the worst of times, it was the age of wisdom, it was the age of foolishness, it was the epoch of belief, it was the epoch of incredulity, it was the season of light, it was the season of darkness, it was the spring of hope, it was the winter of despair.”

title: Xaver unveils AI platform for life Insurance and pensions and secures €5M Pre-Seed
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German fintech Xaver unveiled its B2B AI platform for life insurance and private pensions today and announced it has secured €5 million in Pre-Seed funding.

title: Mixergy wants you to only heat what you need and is now armed with an additional £9.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oxford-based Mixergy has raised £9.2 million in a funding round aimed at supporting a new R&D facility. In addition to the continued development of its home energy and heat storage solutions, a portion of the raise will see the company ramp up international expansion efforts beginning with Portugal.

title: Generative AI startup Aindo raises €6M to expand team and further its synthetic data tech
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Italian generative AI startup Aindo has raised a €6 million Series A round led by United Ventures and included participation from existing investor Vertis SGR through the fund Vertis Venture 3 Technology Transfer.

title: Berlin-based Kenjo raises €8.8M to expand HRtech to Latin America
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based HRtech startup Kenjo has raised a €8.8 million Series A funding round led by Hi Inov, including participation from Lightbird and Innovation Nest and existing investors Redalpine and The Delta.

title: DriveX is making a fully digital vehicle registration system in Estonia possible
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Estonian start-up DriveX's AI-powered car inspection with damage detection platform is enabling digital registration for vehicles first time registered in Estonia. The process usually requires a trip to the Estonian Transport Administration but now vehicle's imagery can be uploaded with DriveX.

title: Bitwala CEO “zero” confidence that investor confidence is back behind crypto but thinks relaunched app will fly
author: John Reynolds
summary: Dennis Daiber, CEO of German crypto outfit Bitwala, says he has "zero" confidence that investor confidence is back behind crypto but believes the relaunched app is set for a return to its glory days.

title: Avicenna.AI collects €7 million series A for its AI-driven critical radiology screening platform
author: Callum Cyrus
