summary: London-based music cue sheet reporting and audio recognition service Soundmouse has been acquired by Orfium. While the financials behind the deal remain undisclosed, according to Orfium, the acquisition is set to “solve the entertainment industry’s most complex challenges” and “revolutionise digital music and broadcast rights management”.

title: Exotrail joins the growing list of European spacetech players as it lifts off with  a fresh $58 million to fuel space logistics
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In January, Swiss space junk cleanup service ClearSpace brought home €26.7 million in a Series A funding round, last week Franco-German reusable space capsule maker The Exploration Company packed €40.5 million of new fuel into its rockets in a Series A round, and now, French developer of electric propulsion solutions for small satellites Exotrail has announced a $58 million Series B round.

title: Berlin's Degura raises €2.2 million to digitise German employer-funded pensions
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Berlin-HQed company pensions fintech Degura has closed a €2.2 million seed round aimed at scaling its product offer.

title: French climate fintech Zero Fund raises €400,000
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: France's The Zero Fund recently obtained €400,000 of pre-seed funding for its software APIs that enable carbon visibility and offsetting of commercial transactions.

title: Airbnb co-founder pours another €23.2 million into The Ocean Cleanup
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Rotterdam's Ocean Cleanup has lured $25 million (€23.2 million) courtesy of a follow-on donation by Airbnb and Samara co-founder Joe Gebbia.

title: Coincover secures $30 million to continue making our digital assets safer
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UK-based Coincover has received $30 million in a round led by Silicon Valley-based Foundation Capital to further expand its digital asset security platform.

title: Danish challenger bank Lunar takes on €35 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Weeks after revealing it was scaling back expenditures, Danish neobank Lunar has tapped its existing shareholders for a €35 million fundraising.

title: Pitching a centralised OS for KYC/KYB compliance, Dotfile raises €2.5 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Parisian KYC orchestration startup Dotfile has picked up €2.5 million in its latest fundraise to give enterprises a single source of automation for running digital background checks.

title: APEXX Global raises $25 million to expand further stateside
author: Fiona Alston
summary: APEXX Global a global payments platform that specialises in offering a payment orchestration layer, has raised $25 million, closing its Series B funding round. Funds will aid further expansion in North America and product development.

title: New report shows three quarters of LGBTQ+ founders withhold their sexual orientation
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Three-quarters of LGTBQ+ UK startup founders (75%) refrain from disclosing their sexuality or gender identity, according to a new data report from the UK LGTBQ+ collective Proud Ventures.

title: After a 60% stock price drop, Silicon Valley Bank trading suspended
author: Dan Taylor
summary: After the parent company of Silicon Valley Bank, SVB Financial sent shockwaves through the market Thursday by announcing that it was seeking north of $2 billion in funding to shore up liquidity issues and triggering a run on the bank, trading has been suspended, with CNBC is reporting that the institution is now seeking a buyer.

title: France's HelloWork devises €50 million acquisition spree
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: HelloWork, a France-HQed provider of online job search, recruitment tools and skills training, is investing €50 million to conduct merger and acquisition activity.

title: Penta founder Lav Odorovic’s newest venture Relio raises €3 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Zurich-based fintech startup Relio has raised €3 million in a funding round aimed at supporting the launch of a digital payment account for business customers. The Swiss company is led by CEO Lav Odorovic, who previously founded Penta, a neobank for SMEs in Germany that has since been acquired by Qonto.

title: Exotrail joins the growing list of European spacetech players as it lifts off with  a fresh $58 million to fuel space logistics
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In January, Swiss space junk cleanup service ClearSpace brought home €26.7 million in a Series A funding round, last week Franco-German reusable space capsule maker The Exploration Company packed €40.5 million of new fuel into its rockets in a Series A round, and now, French developer of electric propulsion solutions for small satellites Exotrail has announced a $58 million Series B round.

title: Building the bridge between classical and quantum computing,  Quantagonia has raised €4.3 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Frankfurt-based quantum computer software developer Quantagonia has announced the completion of a seed round, which when combined with an early 2022 pre-seed round, brings the company’s total amount raised to €4.3 million.

title: Kinnu raises $6.5 million to use AI to flip the script when it comes to edtech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based “learning space” startup Kinnu has raised $6.5 million in a new funding round. Turning the tables on what we’ve come to know as edtech, Kinnu is employing an AI-powered ‘learning engine’ that shifts the curriculum away from the needs of the content creator and focuses them squarely on the learner.

title: Europe's best decade in tech – Reaching new heights and outpacing the US
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In conjunction with celebrating its 20 year anniversary, VC firm Creandum, together with Dealroom has released a new report, “European tech ascendancy - Unlocking a continentʼs innovation potential”, revealing that Europe has finally moved into a position to not only challenge the tech industry dominance of the US but has the potential to overtake it within the next 20 years.

title: Keeping the turbines turning, Latvia’s Aerones raises $30 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Riga-based robot-enabled wind turbine maintenance and inspection startup Aerones has raised $30 million in Series A round. According to the company, this fresh capital will be used to further up the number of field-deployed robot service teams, expand its presence in Africa and Australia, and bring new services to market, all the while growing its technical and sales functions.

title: With €160 million in LP funds, there's no Plan B, only Planet A
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A Berlin-based green tech venture firm, Planet A, has closed its inaugural LP fund with €160 million thanks to commitments from the likes of BMW and the German supermarket chain REWE.

title: In no way boring, spacetech startup The Exploration Company lands €40.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Franco-German spacetech The Exploration Company has raised a record €40.5 million in a Series A funding round led by EQT Ventures and Red River West. Building upon a €5.3 million seed round that was aimed at helping the company in developing, producing, and operating a modular and reusable orbital vehicle dubbed Nyx.

title: Not Optional campaign helps put €5 billion more into the hands of European startup employees
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Working for The Man. Right next to Benjamin Franklin’s words, “but in this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes,” it’s a fact of life. Unless of course, you are The Man. In which case, you’re working for the Shareholders, who effectively become The Man.

title: How Figma competitor Penpot is championing design collaboration and open source tools for cross-functional teams
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Penpot, the first open source, collaborative design and prototyping platform by Kaleidos, is on a mission to bridge the gap between designers and developers.

title: June 2023: Deals, exits, and beach blankets
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: With summer holidays on just about everyone's mind right now, the traditional funding news push was apparent over the course of June. The level of investments was higher by almost 35% compared to the month before, including outlier-of-the-year award nominee Mistral AI, which after just one month in business, secured a €100+ million deal. June also saw a few new unicorns crowned, returning the status perhaps back to its days of rarity and meaningfulness.

title: Bike Club's subscriptions showcase the power of the circular economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Bike Club, a 6-yo UK scale-up, shows that the future of bikes is circular.

title: The European tech ecosystem: H1 2023 Report
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Throughout the year we track various data points across the European tech ecosystem, and the mid-year mark is a great time to review numbers and highlight significant milestones and what the implications might be, as well as identify trends.

title: Investing in dual-use startups:  A case for European tech sovereignty
author: Uwe Horstmann
summary: The first step in solving any problem is to recognise that there is one. The war against Ukraine has been a painful reminder that we in Europe are too dependent on others when it comes to defense, energy, semiconductors, or any innovative digital technology.

title: Revenues at key worker portal Jobandtalent soared 90% last year
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Madrid's Jobandtalent achieved a 90% increase in annual revenue last year, generating turnover of €1.9 billion as its US business continued to take off, becoming its third largest revenue driver behind the UK and Spain.

title: Visible salary ranges encourage job applications for 91% of job seekers
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: What do we want? The salary, or its range, to be posted clearly on job listings, is what. This is the battle cry of 91% of job seekers, according to a recent piece of research. U.S.-based respondents to the survey said that having salary ranges in a job post positively affects their decision to apply––and that is consistently the case across industries and worker seniority.

title: European Investment Fund invests €25 million in Radix Ventures’ fund for deep tech CEE start-ups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The European Investment Fund (EIF) backed by the InvestEU programme is investing €25 million into Radix Ventures’ fund. Radix Ventures hopes to raise at least €50 million, and reach its first close by the end of the year - with a hard cap of €70 million.

title: UK-based QV Bioelectronics raises £2 million for potential brain tumour treatment
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: QV Bioelectronics, a Cheshire, UK-based medical device startup, has received £2 million in pre-series A funds.

title: GMG Ventures rebrands to Mercuri and closes a £50 million fund backed by British Business Bank
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based VC firm Mercuri, (formerly GMG Ventures) has closed a £50 million fund which will focus on ‘exceptional’ media-tech start-ups who are ‘reinventing traditional media models using artificial intelligence’. It says it plans to ‘make up to eight new investments a year with substantial provision for follow-on cheques’ and that ‘commitment to robust data governance and AI safety’ are priority.

title: Subscription and recurring billing platform Billwerk+ acquires competitor plenigo
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Having been acquired by Boston-based growth equity firm PSG in mid-2021, Billwerk+ is now digging into an acquisition of its own. The Frankfurt-based subscription management and recurring billing software solutions provider has announced the acquisition of competing firm plenigo. The terms and conditions of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: Humaans employee management platform simplifies HR and reduces costs for European Scaleups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: If I could use one word to describe the current tech landscape, it would be contradictory. Some companies are reducing their costs by shedding staff. In the meantime, others are scaling up, expanding their reach, and creating new roles.

title: StellarUp raises €500,000 to 'elevate' its HR SaaS solution 'to new heights'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Knowledge sharing and learning platform StellarUp is a SaaS solution which provides mentoring programmes, engagement and community to teams. Apparently, the sticky areas that StellarUp has smoothed out are ‘process and operational challenges leading to unsuccessful and un-engaging programmes’.

title: And then there were two: MVPR snags another former Edelman exec
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Former Edelman and Improbable executive Camille Oster has joined London-based PR and communications service MVPR, filling the role of Director of Operations.

title: Provider of predictive maintenance Viking Analytics closes €3 million series A
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Viking Analytics, an AI in predictive analytics startup from Gothenburg, Sweden, has closed its series A round at €3 million with the intent of expanding overseas.

title: Danish SaaS platform Kanpla raises €2.2 million to help canteens reduce food waste
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Founded by 21-year old entrepreneurs Peter Bæch and Jonas Gøttler,  Århus-based food management SaaS Kanpla wants to tackle food waste from public canteens.

title: Hawk AI is keeping tabs on would be money launderers and fraudsters, and raising $17 million in the process
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based Hawk AI has raised $17 million in a Series B round aimed primarily at furthering product development and ramping up global expansion plans. Much like its anti-money laundering and fraud prevention compatriots, the firm claims to, “ detect and prevent the financial crime that other systems miss”. Hawk AI has now raised a total of $27 million.

title: Irish start-up Recruitroo rises €1 million as it simplifies the global hiring process for UK and Irish firms
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Irish start-up Recruitroo is a recruitment and migration platform which simplifies the global hiring process for UK and Irish firms, by removing unnecessary barriers, giving companies access to talent worldwide. Primed to help reduce labour shortages in the construction, engineering, hospitality and healthcare industries, the platform uses AI and automation capabilities to process all documents and applications for employment permits and visas ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.

title: Federated AI startup Sherpa.ai completes inaugural product launch
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Today marks the official product launch of federated AI development platform Sherpa.ai, in a notable advance for automation that learns from multiple data sources without information ever leaving its original location.

title: Mobile banking shouldn’t cost a rocket: what businesses can learn from IKEA
author: Vitalis Kavaliauskas
summary: The demand for a mobile-first experience is at an all-time high, and the financial industry is not exempt from this trend. Despite the emergence of new mobile banking solutions, smaller financial institutions can still easily get stuck in juggling quality, speed, and price. This raises the question – why does mobile app development remain pricey despite years of active digitalisation, and what can be learned from IKEA's example?

title: Ready, set, pitch. The five reasons to participate in VivaTech’s Startup Challenges
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Viva Technology, is recognized worldwide as a powerful catalyst for business transformation, startup growth, and innovation for the common good. Since 2016, VivaTech accelerates innovation by connecting startups, tech leaders, major corporations, and investors responding to our world’s biggest challenges.

title: Sensei launches test-bed autonomous supermarket Dojo in Lisbon
author: Fiona Alston
summary: This week the 'future of supermarket shopping' arrived in Lisbon as Sensei launched its test-bed autonomous store.

title: Denmark's Uniify picks up €3 million to make financial customer onboarding a breeze
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Danish startup Uniify recently collected €3 million to simplify financial customer onboarding, providing digital tools to easily register users for things like credit checks and anti-money laundering.

title: With a fresh €15 million in hand, edtech MentorShow wants to school you
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based MentorShow has raised €15 million in new capital as it aims to consolidate its product while at the same time diversifying its offerings and ramp up international deployment plans.

title: Fintech’s growth potential in a bear market
author: Ronald Jan Schuurs
summary: At the start of the 2010s, experts were asking if Europe would ever produce a tech company with a billion-dollar valuation. As we enter 2023, the European tech ecosystem has produced nearly 150 unicorns, an incredible success rate that has been spearheaded by fintech success stories like Revolut, Checkout.com, and Adyen. For more than a decade, fintech has been the jewel in the crown of European tech.

title: Closing the gap between crypto exchange and traditional financial payments, Tap Global just floated to raise £3.1 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Tap Global, a Gibraltar-licensed crypto app that offers preloaded Mastercards and fiat bank accounts to its customers, has just went public in an IPO that raised £3.1 million.

title: Ghost job listings: what they are and how to spot them
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: Some of the biggest names in tech have been shedding staff numbers by the tens of thousands in recent weeks, yet you keep spotting job listings that give the impression these firms are still hiring across a range of sectors … confused? Welcome to the world of ghost job listings.

title: French-based VC firm Elaia welcomes Delphine Villuendas and Zeevi Michel to its partnership
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French-based VC firm Elaia has added two new partners to its team - Delphine Villuendas and Zeevi Michel. Elaia focuses 'on European digital and deep tech startups, from early stage to growth development'.

title: European deep tech deals raised $17.7 billion last year — report
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Europe's deep tech startups closed off 2022 having brought in around $17.7 billion, down 22% on the year but still 60% above 2020 trends, according to a new data report.

title: Dutch deep tech start-up Reyedar raises €3 million to commercialise its degenerative disease screening technology
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch deep tech start-up Reyedar, previously know as Reperio Medtech, uses eye-tracking sensors coupled with deep learning to detect early symptoms of age-related degenerative diseases such as glaucoma, parkinson’s, and multiple sclerosis. Early diagnosis is expected to improve the outcome of treatment and also health care costs.

title: Europe's proptech startups are booming as they transform the way we buy, sell, and rent our homes
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last few years, proptech has gone from strength to strength. We're seeing consistent growth in companies that have previously disrupted the traditional real estate industry.

title: Ventures Thrive ramps up CEE accelerator drive
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Applications have now opened for the inaugural cohort of CEE-focused deep tech accelerator Ventures Thrive.

title: Zenloop files for bankruptcy
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: German customer journey software startup Zenloop and its founding squad of ex-Flaconi (the online perfume outlet) pioneers tried their hardest to make the product stick. Sadly, and despite venture support at seed and series A stage, it wasn't to be and German media is reporting Zenloop will close up having already entered insolvency (source⁠ — Gründerszene.)

title: Instabee valuation may have fallen by a quarter
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The valuation of Stockholm last-mile delivery company Instabee has taken a sharp knock, at least in the opinion of its Swedish investor Creades.

title: Rider registrations land Barcelona's Glovo in hot water
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Regulators have fined Glovo, the Barcelona-based on-demand delivery service, handing down a €57 million charge for alleged infringements pertaining to its Madrid delivery riders' employment status. (source ⁠— El Confidencial.)

title: ProovStation raises €10.4 million, continues to scan for damage
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Lyon-based AI-assisted vehicle testing solution provider ProovStation has raised €10.4 million in a Series A funding round that will see the company develop a network of its vehicle scanners and expand internationally.

title: Consumer acceptance of AI in healthcare – are we ready for the future?
author: Guest Writer
summary: The headlines from global healthcare meetings such as the annual Healthcare Information Management Systems Society (HIMSS) are notable in their singular focus on artificial intelligence (AI) and its application across the care continuum. No fewer than fifteen headlines highlighted presentations on AI developments, new collaborations built around AI tools, and partnerships among health technology companies introducing new uses of AI in care settings.

title: Spotify slashes 6% of its headcount, blames spiralling OPEX pegged at 2X revenue
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Spotify just confirmed it's letting go 6% of its staff in a restructuring that also sees chief content officer and advertising lead Dawn Ostroff heading for the exit.

title: Europe’s quest for payments sovereignty: building home-grown challengers to fuel competition
author: Simas Simanauskas
summary: Visa and Mastercard remain the most prevalent payment options in Europe. Even though their usage varies across different countries, they have a solid footing among the consumers’ preferred methods to pay for goods. That said, for a long time Europe has been looking for ways to even out — or at least tip — the scales in their favor. So much so, that the European Union has been upfront about its intention to challenge the duopoly in the payments industry. Initiatives such as EPI (the European Payments Initiative), continuous push for open banking adoption, and, most recently, a new instant payments law proposal are propelling this quest further.

title: Seizing another chance to shake up manufacturing, Momenta targets $100 million for industry 5.0-themed fund
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: An industry 5.0-themed venture fund supported by the EU Commission is attempting to raise $100 million to bankroll fledgling industrial startups, including those based in the EU.

title: Iktos raises €15.5 million Series A round for AI drug discovery service
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French start-up Iktos has raised a €15.5 million Series A round fuelling its launch of its drug discovery platform.

title: Mundi Ventures calls up Rueda as general partner/CFO
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Delfin Rueda has been appointed general partner and chief financial officer of Madrid early and growth stage VC Mundi Ventures.

title: Ciao Italia! Founders Factory and Fastweb launch venture studio & accelerator
author: Dan Taylor
summary: For all the news that Tech.eu brings you, a shockingly small percentage (1.25 percent) of it pays mention to startups and/or tech news originating from Italy.

title: Digital trading platform for timber VonWood springs €2.7 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based timber trading platform VonWood has raised €2.7 million in a funding round. The new yew is aimed at accelerating the growth of the company, one that claims to “bring wood buyers and sellers together with the new online trading platform, without intermediaries” whilst being an intermediary.

title: At age 29, Dawn Capital’s Dan Chaplin promoted to Partner
author: Dan Taylor
summary: 2023 is starting out pretty well for Dawn Capital’s Forbes 30 Under 30 for Finance in Europe alumnus Dan Chaplin. Joining the firm in 2018, the fintech specialist was promoted to Principle level at the same time Mina Mutafchieva was raised to Partner in July of 2021. Now, just under a year and a half later, that Principle has been made a Partner at the B2B software investment house.

title: Leveling up with Atomico’s Hillary Ball and Andreas Helbig as both are promoted to Partner
author: Dan Taylor
summary: One look at the Venture Capital landscape, particularly that of the soldiers in the trenches, and it doesn’t take a rocket scientist to notice the trend of leveling up. In fact, perusing the Tech.eu archives, and VC appointments are far and few between to note an external party welcomed into the upper ranks.

title: GP Bullhound elevates German activity with two new branch offices: in Frankfurt and Munich
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The DACH presence of GP Bullhound is about to get larger thanks to establishing of another two German locations, in Frankfurt and Munich, complementing its national office in Berlin.

title: Targeting Nordic B2B SaaS, Monterro closes fifth small cap fund at €150 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Nordics-focused LP firm, B2B software investor Monterro had no issues recharging cash flow for its fifth fund vintage, reeling in €150 million for the latest vehicle, G1.

title: This Week in European Tech: Enpal bags €215 million, BioNTech buys InstaDeep in £562 million deal, Habyt merges with Common, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, the first one of 2023, our research team tracked more than 100 tech funding deals worth over €1.7 billion, and over 30 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Highland Europe launches new €1 billion fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Highland Europe has announced the close of its fifth fund at €1 billion. The London-HQ’d fund that focuses on investments in high-growth European internet, mobile, and software companies and have over €10 million in annualised revenues, plans to double down on this strategy with the new fund.

title: Crisp boxes up De Krat to offer meal box options
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Not quite as fast as it bloomed, but an undeniable trend, the groceries-to-your-door industry is consolidating. Whether it’s some players simply hitting the end of the runway and calling it a day or snapped up by those that do have financial reserves, the options are getting fewer and fewer by the day.

title: Corlytics absorbs ING spinoff SparQ
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Dublin-based regulatory risk intelligence provider Corlytics has struck a €5 million deal with financial services firm ING Group to acquire the latter's regulatory monitoring spinout SparQ.

title: Italian crowdtesting platform Unguess raises €10 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Italy-based product crowdtesting platform Unguess has raised €10 million+ in funds.

title: Metacore to the rescue: publisher acquires cancelled mobile games title Everdale
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Mobile games enthusiasts playing the village building simulator Everdale were left devastated a few months back when developers Supercell, responsible for some mega mobile hits like Clash of Clans and Brawl Stars, announced Everdale's beta test server was going offline.

title: VCs and PEs have not lost faith in long-term commitment, but tech companies should differentiate
author: Marcel van der Heijden
summary: This year is off to a challenging start for the startup ecosystem in Europe, according to Crunchbase. Startups raised $10.6 billion in funding, down 18% quarter on quarter and as much as 66% year on year as U.S. investors pulled out.

title: Threecolts announces £75.4 million raise and adds to its string of acquisitions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: This week London-based e-commerce platform Threecolts, announced it has raised £75.4 million to date after closing a recent Series A funding round.

title: France's HelloWork devises €50 million acquisition spree
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: HelloWork, a France-HQed provider of online job search, recruitment tools and skills training, is investing €50 million to conduct merger and acquisition activity.

title: Empowering a green & sustainable economy - ESG Fintech report
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: While the fintech industry continues to grow and evolve, in recent years a new breed of sector players has emerged. Moving beyond just the balance sheet, these companies are placing more and more focus on offering solutions to financial institutions and corporates aimed at facilitating and expediting their ESG targets.

title: Temasek leads €100 million round in atomic-level quantum processor builder Pasqal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based neutral atoms approach quantum computing startup Pasqal has raised €100 million in a Series B funding round. The quantum processor maker will use the new capital to further develop its research and development efforts to build a 1,000-qubit quantum computer in the short term and fault-tolerant architectures in the long term. Since 2019, the startup has now raised over €125 million.

title: Keeping the plastic bottles at bay, Wayout raises €6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based water-as-a-service provider Wayout has raised €6 million in a Series A funding round that will see the company further ramp up production of its container-sized water treatment facility, press forward with international expansion plans, and support a sustained recruitment drive.

title: Anything but normal, Supernormal phones in $10 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based AI platform that creates intelligent meeting notes, Supernormal has raised $10 million in a seed funding round that will see the company further expand its AI-driven offer whilst simultaneously upping the team headcount. Including this round, Supernormal has raised $12 million since late December 2020.

title: Studying hard in immersive VR metaverses, London's Gemba raises $18 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-based enterprise metaverse developer Gemba aspires to build virtual worlds for corporate training. It's announcing a $18 million series A raise led by New York investor Parkway Venture Capital. Raised at a $60 million valuation, this funding is expected to help grow Gemba's business in North America while also honing in on EMEA.

title: EGERIE raises €30 million to help quantify the financial impact of shabby cyber security
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Toulon-based cyber risk management firm Egerie has raised €30 million in a new funding round. The capital will be used to help Egerie further develop its automated data recovery technology while at the same time opening the doors to an insurer-specific reporting functionality as the company ramps up pan-European expansion plans.

title: "I pity the fuel", says UK-based EV rental subscription service Onto, as it clinches £100 million loan deal
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: An idea for driving electric vehicle adoption that has some merit is greater commercialisation of flexible ownership models. In UK-based Onto's case, this would involve more motorists opting to abandon traditional car ownership, or at least complement existing vehicles, by using a subscription service to electrify personal travel.

title: B2B BNPL provider Tranch secures $100 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Tranch, a London-HQed provider of immediate invoice finance to pay SaaS subscriptions and other B2B expenses, has raised $100 million in seed funds and debt to expand activity in the US.

title: Flemish SMEs need reliable cash forecasts, Monitr says it has a "do-it-yourself" automation tool
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Antwerp, Flanders-based startup Monitr wants to give SMEs better access to intelligent cash flow forecasting to strengthen the transparency of their books.

title: 3L Robotics to launch central Europe's "first" drone helipad for automated parcel deliveries
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Despite Czech rules that currently forbid urban parcel deliveries by unmanned aerial vehicles, Brno-based 3L Robotics expects to launch the country's first landing helipad for drone shipments in 18 months time.

title: UK-based QV Bioelectronics raises £2 million for potential brain tumour treatment
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: QV Bioelectronics, a Cheshire, UK-based medical device startup, has received £2 million in pre-series A funds.

title: Fractal Homes enters the second home co-ownership race with $30 million raise
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Fractal Homes has raised $30 million in a seed round aimed at what the proptech startup claims will reinvent second home co-ownership across Europe. The funding is earmarked to help the startup scale its operations within the UK ahead of a targeted expansion in the Middle East later this year.

title: Lapsi Health raises $3.7 million to use audio data from clinical stethoscopes to enhance remote patient care
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Lapsi Health, a Netherlands-based developer of audio-driven med tech and remote healthcare tools, has raised $3.7 million in what is being billed as an oversubscribed seed round.

title: VanMoof: The more they sell, the more they lose
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based developer and designer of urban e-bikes VanMoof is facing a financial conundrum. According to 2021 sales figures crunched by Dutch financial media outlet FD, the cost of selling a VanMoof bike is greater than that of the purchase price, resulting in a gross margin loss of €11.9 million, a figure up from a loss of €6.7 million just one year prior.

title: This Week in European Tech: Software AG acquired for €2.4 billion, Aleph Alpha rumoured to land €100 million, and Getir says adios to Spain
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our reseach tracked more than 105 tech funding deals worth over €831 million. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 10 exits and M&A transactions.

title: This Week in European Tech: SVB panic spreads to Europe, Railsr gets sold off, La Famiglia's fresh €250 million fund(s), and we celebrated #IWD2023
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Digital Village welcomes $4 million in round backed by BOLD, the VC fund of L’Oréal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-founded 3D immersive virtual worlds builder Digital Village has taken on $4 million in its first equity funding round. According to the startup, the capital is to be used to further enhance the platform’s capabilities, adding new tools to power 3D world development, avatar customisation, and virtual store creation.

title: Ecosystem Restoration Standard raises €5 million to launch first standard for restoration projects
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based climate-tech start-up Ecosystem Restoration Standard (ERS) is launching a standard to certify ecosystem restoration projects in the voluntary carbon markets after raising €5 million in seed funding.

title: EGERIE raises €30 million to help quantify the financial impact of shabby cyber security
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Toulon-based cyber risk management firm Egerie has raised €30 million in a new funding round. The capital will be used to help Egerie further develop its automated data recovery technology while at the same time opening the doors to an insurer-specific reporting functionality as the company ramps up pan-European expansion plans.

title: Keeping crypto taxes in check, Poland’s Cryptiony raises €500,000, eyes UK market expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Lodz-founded/London-HQ’d Cryptiony has raised €500,000 in a pre-seed funding round. The startup offers a crypto tax automation platform for individuals, traders, and tax professionals, and with the pre-seed money is targeting a market expansion into Europe’s largest crypto market with over 4.2 million users, the United Kingdom.

title: Gen Z-focused credit marketplace Prograd raises $2.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Prograd has raised $2.5 million in a seed round. The startup is out to help a younger generation understand finance, allowing users to establish financial goals and discover bespoke pathways to earning, saving, or borrowing their way to these goals.

title: Reclaiming data centre waste heat nets Qarnot €35 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Calling the Parisian suburb of Montrouge home, French startup Qarnot has raised €35 million in new capital. The company has tapped into a crucial problem facing our modern world, that of the tremendous amount of excess heat given off by data centres, and is ushering it back into heating systems.

title: Andreessen Horowitz leads seed round for Stockholm games duo at Seidr
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Sweden's Seidr wants to do multiplayer games for consoles and PCs that connect players regardless of which platform they're gaming on. Spearheaded by the Swedish development duo Adam Schaub (ex-GM of King and the Candy Crush franchise) and repeat gaming founder Marcus Jacob, the pairing have over 40 years of games industry experience.

title: Blue Monday is the most popular day to look for a new job
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: You might think compensation or company values are the most divisive catalysts prompting people to look for a new job.

title: When one bank branch door closes, another Wahed opens
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While online and mobile banking, neobanks, soaring rents, and oh yes, that pandemic thing have played their part in shuttering half of the UK’s high street bank branches, others see the opportunity in face-to-face engagement.

title: Using bespoke algorithms to dispatch medical transport faster, Ambler has secured a major French health tender
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: For quite a while mobility has generated investor buzz thanks to tech's ability to digitise resource allocation. Primarily digital tools like GPS, intelligent connectivity and other visibility products have made it far easier to track and allocate operating fleets.

title: Startups in Europe are solving the pain points impacting the solar panel roll-out
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The current challenge of climate change and the energy crisis in Europe have motivated governments to end the EU's dependence on fossil fuels. Countries are looking at gas alternatives like green hydrogen, tidal energy, and wind power.

title: European tech startups kicked off the year with a bang at CES 2023
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Consumer Electronics Show (CES) is over for another year.

title: Crowdcube co-founder Westlake stands aside; is replaced by two internal promotions made co-CEOs
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Darren Westlake, co-founder and CEO of UK-based fundraising portal Crowdcube, is standing aside to explore pastures new.

title: B2B BNPL provider Tranch secures $100 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Tranch, a London-HQed provider of immediate invoice finance to pay SaaS subscriptions and other B2B expenses, has raised $100 million in seed funds and debt to expand activity in the US.

title: Big moves in AI, Getir exits Spain, how US companies fare in Europe, and Henry Philipson from ESG_VC
author: Dan Taylor

title: ViridiCO2 raises £3m in Seed funding to develop sustainable chemical products from CO2 emissions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today London carbon utilisation startup ViridiCO2 announces a £3m seed funding round.

title: PneumoWave wraps up £7.5 million series A for lung monitoring device
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Glasgow, Scotland-based remote monitoring device startup PneumoWave closed £7.5 million in a series A round and is now looking to transfer into larger operational premises to prepare for its proposed 2024 regulatory submission.

title: Convenience giant Żabka Group seeks startups to drive innovation in retail with its Żabka Future Lab accelerator
author: Julia Gifford
summary: The retail industry is constantly evolving. Most game-changing advances relate to logistics, automation, and management and remain hidden from the public eye. Others, however, such as improving customer experience and the introduction of autonomous stores, have garnered much media fanfare and given a rare insight into the perpetual innovation that happens behind the scenes of your local convenience store.

title: Gold star for Polish edtech as Coding Giants raises €3.5 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Polish edtech scale-up Coding Giants has announced a funding round of €3.5 million from CEE-based investors PortfoLion and Nunatak Capital.

title: Tallinn's Roofit.Solar raises the roof in €6.45 million round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Tallinn-based Roofit.Solar has raised €6.45 million round in a funding round that saw further support from BayWa r.e. Energy Ventures and EdgeCap Partners.

title: Solar-electric, emission-free yacht maker Zen Yacht weighs anchor in €5.5 million round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Barcelona’s Zen Yachts has closed a €5.5 million Series A round provided solely by ocean, rivers, and seas transportation decarbonising specialist fund Ocean Zero.

title: Germany’s trawa raises €2.4 million to become the renewable energy supplier
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based trawa has raised €2.4 million in a pre-seed round aimed at helping the startup further develop its AI-based energy purchasing software. Specifically, trawa is targeting energy-intensive industries, offering cost savings of, according to the company, up to 20 percent per year.

title: Edgeless Systems raises $5 million for public cloud security
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German cloud security firm Edgeless Systems plans to revolutionise the public cloud security industry with its $5 million seed raise.

title: Digital Village welcomes $4 million in round backed by BOLD, the VC fund of L’Oréal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-founded 3D immersive virtual worlds builder Digital Village has taken on $4 million in its first equity funding round. According to the startup, the capital is to be used to further enhance the platform’s capabilities, adding new tools to power 3D world development, avatar customisation, and virtual store creation.

title: Northern Gritstone helps pour £3 million into decision intelligent startup Slingshot Simulations
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Slingshot Simulations, a UK-based digital twins and decision intelligence software company based on University of Leeds IP, is announcing a £3 million series A raise backed by regional academic investor Northern Gritstone.

title: Amazon/Meta-alum Ellam embarks on new mission with London climate risk platform Climate X
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Climate X has poached Monzo Bank's head of technical programme management, Andrew Ellam, to serve as its vice president of technology.

title: Keeping tabs on NSFW or otherwise content on social networks, Unitary raises $8 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Unitary has raised $8 million in new funds. Along the lines of what Checkstep and Bodyguard are doing, the startup uses contextual AI to automate content moderation and keeping the bad actors at bay.

title: Breaking stereotypes and developing future female talent: advice from a female Chief Revenue Officer in tech
author: Geraldine MacCarthy
summary: International Women’s Day (IWD) aims to celebrate the social, economic, cultural and political achievements of women – and there’s certainly no shortage of inspirational women to celebrate in the tech sector.

title: In conversation with GEP Dealmaker Martin Ring: Helping founders from all over the world scale their tech businesses in and from the UK
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Recently, we highlighted how the Global Entrepreneur Programme (GEP for short), one of the flagship initiatives from the UK's Department for Business and Trade, makes it easier for ambitious and innovative tech scale-ups to relocate to, and grow in the UK as they prepare to scale their businesses internationally.

title: Atomico buries $11 million bones in Digitail's backyard
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Romania-founded Digitail has raised $11 million in a Series A funding round that will see the company scale operations pawmarily across the US and Canada, all the while sniffing out global opportunities. The platform assists veterinarians in a manner of ways through the automation of repetitive admin tasks, allowing these professionals to dedicate more time to furry friends and less time to forms and figures.

title: Meet the rising female founders building the Metaverse
author: Sointu Karjalainen
summary: At FOV Ventures we believe that the Metaverse is a generational evolution of the Internet. It’s a fundamental shift in the way we think about building applications, services, and products that move beyond today’s static media on 2D screens and into more spatial, 3D and immersive environments that look and feel a lot more like the physical world.

title: 32Co raises £2.2 million in seed funding to upskill and support the clear aligner industry
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week health tech startup 32Co announced it had raised £2.2m in seed funding led by Balderton Capital.

title: Multi-channel messenger Unipile piles on €1.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian startup Unipile has raised €1.5 million in a first funding round. The multi-channel communications platform intends to use the capital to recruit 12 new staff members over the next 6 months to fuel an accelerated product development roadmap and rollout, all aimed at the US market.

title: French pharma Amolyt nets €130 million series C co-led by Sofinnova Partners
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Amolyt Pharma, an Ecully, France-based pharma startup working on rare disease treatments, has closed a €130 million series C round.

title: How US companies succeed and fail at European expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The rapid rise of the European startup ecosystem over the last few years has made European expansion an urgent priority for top-tier founders, and an attractive growth lever in a challenging economic climate.

title: Can investment in proptech startups increase housing supplies and meet CO2 reduction goals?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It might shock you that the built world — real estate — is responsible for a whopping 40% of annual global CO2 emissions. While we're always hearing about the evils of cars and flying, property emissions get far less attention.

title: Ordio raises €2.9 million for shift work software
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Cologne-based start-up Ordio has secured €2.9 million seed funding from Capnamic and Simon Capital.

title: From founding a startup to scaling the business in - and from - the UK: How the Global Entrepreneur Programme helped FinalRentals' founder land in Wales
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Recently, we highlighted how the Global Entrepreneur Programme (GEP for short), one of the flagship initiatives from the UK's Department for Business and Trade, makes it easier for ambitious and innovative tech scale-ups to relocate to, and grow in the UK as they prepare to scale their businesses internationally.

title: European tech startups – a long way off gender pay equality
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: When we talk about inequalities between men and women in the tech sector, we can’t skip mentioning the so-called „gender pay gap“. Ok, we know that these things about the gender gap in tech are changing over the years. Slowly, but as optimistic, these are positive changes, no matter how fast they happen. Although there is a long way off gender pay equity.

title: Berlin’s tech rental platform Grover appoints new CFO, hints at SPAC listing?
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based if-you-can-plug-it-in-we-can-rent-it-to-you platform Grover has announced that as of 1 April 2023 former Lilium executive Michael Andersen will be taking the reigns of CFO from an exiting Thomas Antonioli.

title: UK Government unveils £360 million plan to ‘cement the UK’s place as a science and technology superpower by 2030’
author: Dan Taylor
summary: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Science, Innovation and Technology Secretary Michelle Donelan have laid out a new initiative that will see in excess of £370 million being funneled into improving infrastructure, investment, and skills for growing UK tech companies, with “trailblazing” tech including quantum, supercomputing, and AI specifically mentioned in the government’s statement.

title: Catering to the tenant's every need, Chainels locks down €3 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: There can't be too many digital real estate startups out there who can lay claim to operating in 16 European markets, as well as launching an additional play in Latin America.

title: Shell CVC backs $15 million fundraise for Norwegian climate SaaS platform Chooose
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Energy company Shell's CVC unit is backing a $15 million financing of Norway-based fuel emissions calculations platform Chooose aimed at product enhancements, operational growth into new geographies and entering more verticals with its technology.

title: Relai raises $4.5 million to ramp up crypto platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swiss Bitcoin platform, Relai has raised $4.5 million to strengthen its grip on the crypto onramp market.

title: Stockholm’s got a new VC player as Node Ventures launches €70 million fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Having raised over two-thirds of a targeted €70 million fund (800 million SEK), Stockholm’s Node Ventures is officially launching its sector-agnostic fund today. The firm intends to focus on early-stage companies, offering initial tickets ranging from approximately €450,000 (5 million SEK) to approximately €2.2 million (25 million SEK).

title: Spareka fixes €11 million to help DIYers repair home appliances
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It’s a choice we’ve all faced - try and fix it, or just toss it and get a new one. When it comes to home appliances, this choice gets a bit tougher as they’re often higher-priced items and could have something as benign as a belt that needs replacing.

title: Coverflex stretches into the Italian market, acquiring buoni pasto and welfare platform EatsReady
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today European corporate HRtech startup Coverflex has announced its complete acquisition of Italian digital-only meal solution company EatsReady.

title: Helping brands including Dior and Burberry manage their metaverse storefront, London’s Emperia raises $10 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based virtual store creator that specifically caters to the fashion and art industries Emperia has raised $10 million in a Series A funding round. The capital is slated to help the fledgling company further develop its SaaS offer whilst simultaneously upping the team headcount.

title: Statement launches a card payment providers comparison site for UK SMBs, and bags a £1.5 million Pre-seed round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based start-up Statement has built a comparison site for small businesses to find card payment providers to suit their needs and budget - based on previous merchant statements. Founded by Ed Hardy (CEO, ex Worldpay), and Olivia Stannah (CTO, ex Citymapper), the platform launches today.

title: Italian unicorn Scalapay pays out as it acquires Cabel IP
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Italy’s first unicorn, Scalapay, a buy-now-pay-later provider, has acquired nearly 40 years in business Italian payment institution Cabel IP S.p.A. The strategic step aims at finalising Scalapay's deployment in Europe and supporting the launch of new products and services.

title: Crowdcube co-founder Westlake stands aside; is replaced by two internal promotions made co-CEOs
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Darren Westlake, co-founder and CEO of UK-based fundraising portal Crowdcube, is standing aside to explore pastures new.

title: Scriptic writes another $5.7 million into its Seed round as it expands its phone-first show and game content with generative AI
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based studio Scriptic (formerly ElectricNoir) has added another $5.7 million to its Seed round raking in a total Seed round of $8.2 million. The firm that develops interactive phone-first shows and leverages generative AI for its visual and script writing content, will use the funding to expand its content pipeline and create a community of creators via access to tools in a cloud-based creator suite.

title: Finland’s Exolyt raises €450K for viral insights platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish start-up Exolyt kicks off its funding journey with a €450,000 pre-seed raise from Helsinki-based B2B SaaS VV firms Trado Capital and Founder’s Edge.  "We are fortunate to find investors who have a robust entrepreneurial background, share our passion for creating something new, and have the experience of turning it into a success story,’’ says Henri Malkki, CEO and Co-founder of Exolyt.

title: No Yetis here as Yoti banks £10 million via Lloyds
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based digital identity platform Yoti has secured £10 million in new funds via Lloyds Banking Group. The new capital will be used to support the continued development of the company’s digital id technologies. Since early 2018 the company has raised £26 million.

title: Filtering the unfilterable: North West UK-based Evove raises £5.7 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Hailing from North West England, filtration membranes specialist Evove has raised £5.7 million in a new funding round that will see the company expand its manufacturing capacity through the creation of new facilities.

title: Expense management software maker N2F rings up €24 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: French expense reports, receipts, and mileage for accounting and reimbursements software provider N2F has raised €24 million in a growth investment round provided via PSG Equity.

title: Steady Energy has raised €2 million and wants to use a low-temperature, low-pressure nuclear reactor to heat your home
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Espoo-based Steady Energy has raised €2 million in a seed funding round to further its efforts of decarbonising the residential heating industry via nuclear energy. The VTT spinout intends to use the funding for further R&D work as well as build a full-scale mockup of a small-scale nuclear reactor-powered heating plant.

title: A coming of age: Cowboy welcomes Philips veteran Oliver Barleben as Chief Supply Chain Officer
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Building on nearly two decades of experience at Philips where he most recently served as Global Business Process Owner and previously held leadership roles including VP of Procurement and Head of Procurement Governance, e-bike maker Cowboy has seemingly scooped up a win with Oliver Barleben.

title: Italy’s Planckian has raised €2.7 million to develop quantum batteries
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Pisa-based startup Planckian has raised over €2.7 million in a pre-seed funding round aimed at developing solid-state energy technology governed by quantum mechanics.

title: Deloitte snaps up Munich-based venture client services provider 27pilots
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Munich-HQed 27pilots says startups "are the competitive resource of the future." Its founder and CEO, Gregor Gimmy, is credited with spearheading the venture client model, a product of the corporate venture universe that melds innovation capital with bespoke innovation resources to help best-in-class startups carve out a competitive advantage.

title: Estonia’s Vok Bikes raises €3.8 million to push delivery of its electric cargo bikes across Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Tallinn-based start-up Vok Bikes is supplying the last mile delivery space with its electric cargo bikes - it recently launched its new Vok XL model to the market which has a payload of up to 200kg.

title: Nine-month old Greenlyte Carbon Technology raises an additional €4.5 million, bringing its funding to €8 million
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Greenlyte Carbon Technologies (GCT), a leading Direct Air Capture (DAC) start-up from Germany, has announced a pre-seed extension round, raising an additional €4.5 million.

title: With a fresh €13.7 million in hand, Algorithmiq is poised to access the inaccessible in the world of drug discovery and development
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Finland’s quantum-computing-based software developer Algorithmiq has raised €13.7 million in a Series A funding round. Developing noise-resilient quantum algorithms specifically attuned to the drug discovery and development market, Algorithmiq says that it will use the funding to further advance its collaborations with pharmaceutical companies around the globe. Ultimately, the company is honing in on delivering a proof-of-concept that will make for "a useful quantum advantage".

title: 10 European robotics startups revolutionising the future
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: It wasn’t that long ago when the cinematic experience depicted robots replacing humans in the workplace. Needless to (thankfully) say, this hasn't been the case. Or at least not at the scale some scriptwriters would have us believe.

title: ValuesCo closes on $2.7 million to use tokens for the greater good
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: US-based ValuesCo has closed on $2.7 million to build community rewards ecosystems for brands and NGOs powered by Web3 social tokens, encouraging campaigners to align with the ESG issues they care most about.

title: Belgium's robo-advisor platform Easyvest raises €3.1 million to expand its team
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belgian robo-advisor platform Easyvest mixes the ease of technology with the experience of a human financial advisor - it takes the admin burden from the hands of its advisors - to offer its investors a more personalised service when it comes to index investing. It claims to have exceeded the €100 million mark in assets under management.

title: In drug discovery,  milk is the future of mental health treatment.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Persistent debilitating mental health conditions greatly reduce people's quality of life. Finding the right medication is challenging for those requiring pharmaceutical treatment, and even those that work to treat the symptoms may have adverse side effects.

title: Europe dominates in Climate Fintech funding despite overall funding slump in 2022
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: While 2022 saw a marked slowdown in funding almost across the board. However, according to a new report issued by Swiss VC firm Tenity, one outlier, in particular, was that of Climate Fintech. The firms' “Climate Fintech - beyond the Hype” analysed data from a total of 607 startups globally, and found that in 2022, all regions covered within the analysis showed increasing funding with Europe taking the lead when it comes to the total funding secured across the sector.

title: Offering automated private network assurance services, Prague's IP Fabric pings $25 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Prague-based network assurance services startup IP Fabric has raised $25 million in a Series B funding round. The company provides simplification, automation, and security features to private network operators.

title: E-commerce integration specialist Patchworks raises £4 million, picks up a new CEO
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London/Nottingham-based integration platform Patchworks has raised £4 million in new capital provided by Gresham House Ventures in order to move things full speed ahead. Since its first funding round in August of 2021, the company has raised a total of £8.8 million.

title: The Web3 data economy proves its value with monetised crowd sourced map data
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: We live in a digital machine economy, producing a treasure trove of data over our lifetime. When combined, the data creates a valuable commodity.

title: New report from ESG_VC and BVCA finds environmental agenda is lagging in startups
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: How the early-stage companies implement ESG within their work, and what are their strengths and weaknesses in this area, were just a few of the topics covered in the analyses conducted by ESG_VC and BVCA. The report titled “2023 Research and Trends – Turning Intention into Action” was created using the data provided by 450 startups backed by 16 venture capital firms including Lakestar, Baldeton, Molten Ventures, Highland, Beringea, and MMC.

title: Musictech startup Unhurd plugs in and counts off seven-figure raise
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based musictech startup Unhurd has raised an undisclosed seven-figure amount in a seed investment round. According to the company, the capital will be used to further build out its self-serve marketing solution for artists, management companies, and record labels. While no figures were given for this round, in August of 2021, the company queued up £250,000.

title: Fuel refuels with £100 million, shifts UK investments into high gear
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London’s Fuel Ventures has announced a new £100 million fund specifically aimed at supporting over 60 UK-based startups with pre-seed and seed round investments.

title: VCTs: The unsung hero of UK tech?
author: Stuart Veale
summary: To some observers, the news coming out of the UK over the past couple of months has not seemed particularly positive for the country’s large and growing technology industry. The imminent closure of Tech Nation, the re-evaluation of R&D tax credits, and even the failure of Britishvolt have led many commentators to accuse the UK Government of turning its back on a critical industry.

title: France’s Frst announce first close of new fund at €72 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian seed fund dedicated solely to French startups, Frst has announced the first close of its newest fund at €72 million. According to the firm, this makes them the largest of their kind with over €200 million in assets managed or advised.

title: inherent Group buys Toulouse-based SME cloud IT services provider Equadex
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Equadex, a French SME data server and cloud services startup, is becoming part of NY private equity firm inherent Group in an acquisition deal also supported by pan-European PE outfit Keensight Capital.

title: Germany’s Service4Charger tops up with €7.5 million from bp ventures
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German EV charging infrastructure and maintenance firm Service4Charger supplies all manner of charging infrastructure to private, public and commercial customers. It also prides itself on its host of “Mobile Heroes” who are in-house trained and digitally equipped electrical engineers that come running when you point your charging connector to the sky. Well maybe not, but they will attend to all your maintenance needs.

title: Ledgy dives into collaboration with SeaO₂ to help bring its pioneering oceanic carbon capture technology to life
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees capital markets tech platform Ledgy partner with startup SeaO₂ to help advance its oceanic carbon capture tech. And it might be the smallest funding amount we've ever covered. Here's why it matters:

title: German start-up Colonia Technologies raises €6 million for its commercial vehicle sharing platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German logistics start-up Colonia Technologies has developed a sharing platform for commercial vehicles. The B2B sharing model, founded in 2021 by Jakob Sadoun and Kaspar Filipp, was created to give logistics providers a marketplace to share their vehicles and manage their fleets more effectively. It has also just launched a new feature whereby it offers additional payment security via an external payments partner.

title: uWare robotics map what lies beneath the ocean with its autonomous underwater drone tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Belgian-Spanish startup uWare Robotics has secured €500,000 in seed funding from Semper Amplifi.

title: Swiss agtech firm Ecorobotix kills the weeds, raises the cash - $52 million in Series B round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Swiss agriculture tech firm Ecorobotix has raised $52 million in a Series B funding round. The capital will further fuel the company’s expansion plans, with a particular emphasis placed on the American markets.

title: Bonnet pops the hood on more charging locations with a ubitricity partnership
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based EV charging app Bonnet is giving its users more than 7,000 new locations on its app, by way of a new partnership with UK charging network ubitricity. The network, a wholly owned subsidiary of Shell, operates across the UK, Germany and France - it uses local infrastructure like lamp posts and bollards as charge points.

title: Beyond boxes and borders, Amsterdam’s employee relocation platform Settly raises €6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based HRtech startup Settly has raised €6 million in its first-ever external funding round. Along the lines of what Estonia's Jobbatical is working on, the modus operandi at Settly is to unburden employers looking to relocate employees internationally as well as provide an optimal experience for said team members.

title: Starship lands in Greater Manchester five years on from first UK deployment
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The autonomous delivery robots are taking to the streets of UK town of Sale, in Greater Manchester this week as Starship Technologies announces a new partnership with Trafford Council and Co-op.

title: UK-based Outdid has raised $2.5 million for its secure verification solution using zero-knowledge proofs
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based start-up Outdid is transforming identification methods with its private ID verification solution. In a world where ‘fakes’ are becoming a part of everyday life and identity thief is potentially lurking around every corner of the internet, along come Ana-Maria Pricop and Zvezdin Besarabov give us hope for a verified world.

title: Warsaw-based VC firm Inovo closes its third fund at €105 million to support start-ups in CEE
author: Fiona Alston
summary: A boost for the CEE region comes in the form of Poland’s early-stage VC fund Inovo Fund III closing at €105 million, a touch higher than the proposed €100 million. In the breakdown, €55 million comes from private LPs, with the remainder from global, regional, and local institutions, including World Bank’s IFC, EIF, and Poland’s PFR Ventures.

title: Advancing the future with ethical computer vision and human-centric AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: With the deluge of AI-driven tech, the recognise of its potential impact on people becomes ever more vital.

title: Estonian agtech start-up eAgronom has raised $5.5 million to plough into its carbon credit programme for sustainable practices in farming
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Estonian agritech start-up eAgronom is encouraging farmers to chose more sustainable farming practices by incentivising them with a carbon credit programme. It assesses the farms carbon footprint by green house gas monitoring. It is currently supporting farmers in seven markets including Spain, Poland, Romania and East Africa.

title: RTP Global goes big with new $1 billion fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Today, RTP Global announces its largest fund to date, totaling $1 billion in new capital. The historically early-stage investment VC intends to stick to this strategy, with $660 million pledged to new investments, and the remaining $340 million reserved for follow on activities.

title: UK’s Togather rebrands from Feast It and bags $8.5 million to bring event suppliers to one platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Originally known as Feast It, the UK-based event planning and suppliers platform has gone through a rebrand and has emerged as Togather with a nice $8.5 million fundraise in tow. Togather is planning to include a wider spectrum of services for planners on its platform with the extra runway.

title: Irish start-up Outmin raises €2 million and bags itself a(i) swanky new CTO
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dublin-based Outmin, an automated accounting and bookkeeping platform start-up, has raised €2 million in a round led by Fuel Ventures with follow-on funding from existing investors including MiddleGame Ventures and KellySan Enterprises Ltd.

title: UK fintech TreasurySpring raises $29 million to scale its cash investment platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based fintech TreasurySpring is a cash investment platform founded by Kevin Cook (CEO), Matthew Longhurst (COO) and James Skillen (CTO), for companies to access cash investment opportunities which are usually only reserved for large financial institutions.

title: Blue Monday is the most popular day to look for a new job
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: You might think compensation or company values are the most divisive catalysts prompting people to look for a new job.

title: French medtech Gleamer raises €27 million to escalate international expansion of its AI-powered medical imaging solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French medtech firm Gleamer has developed AI-powered medical imaging solutions for radiography - its extending its portfolio of solutions to CT scans and mammography.

title: Czech Republic has a new investment fund for AI start-ups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Prague-based AI Startup Incubator (AISI) has opened a new investment fund exclusively for AI start-ups called Look AI Ventures. It aims to raise €20 million which will be invested in early stage AI-driven companies.

title: Xilva raises $1.8 million and is fighting fake carbon credits by building the first market place for forest investments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Zurich company Xilva announced it has raised $1.8 million in a pre-seed round.

title: 🎙️ Founder and CEO of Dutch challenger bank bunq reveals possible new funding round, profitability landmark and rubbishes claims he’s a bad boss
author: John Reynolds

title: Voltfang raises €5 million to give new life to EV batteries with its energy storage solution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Aachen-based Voltfang, gives new life to near dead EV batteries with its AI-based software which evaluates battery longevity. It is helping to solve the battery recycling issue, and the energy transition, with its energy storage systems made from used electric vehicle batteries.

title: Fertifa raises £5 million expand to its reproductive health benefits platform for the workplace
author: Fiona Alston
summary: SaaS start-up Fertifa is in the employee well-being space, namely the reproductive, hormonal and sexual health space. The workplace platform advises and supports employees through reproductive issues and services such as fertility preservation, planning, IVF, menopause, contraception, endometriosis, PCOS, fibroids, STIs, surrogacy and adoption, as well as men’s sexual health.

title: Real-time payments infrastructure provider Volt recharges with another $60 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Building a real-time payments infrastructure via open banking protocols, London-based fintech Volt has raised $60 million in a Series B round. Available in the UK, Continental Europe, and Brazil, the new capital will see the company push further afield, namely into the APAC and Americas regions. Since early 2020 Volt has raised just shy of $90 million.

title: EU Commission commits €110 million to European Collaborative Cloud for Cultural Heritage
author: Dan Taylor
summary: European Commissioner for Innovation, Research, Culture, Education and Youth, Mariya Gabriel has made official a €110 million budget (until 2025) for the European Collaborative Cloud for Cultural Heritage initiative.

title: Helping the consumer product goods industry make sense of mountains of data, Interrodata raises £2.2 million.
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Lancashire-based enterprise analytics firm Interrodata has raised £2.2 million in a seed round. The company’s AI-driven solution is specifically targeted at the consumer product goods industry and aims to throw clients drowning in a sea of data a life buoy.

title: Thomson Reuters snaps up Cambridge-based media management firm Imagen
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cambridge-based media asset management firm Imagen has been acquired by Thomson Reuters, the parent company of news outlet Reuters, for an undisclosed figure.

title: Former iZettler’s set out to give the data game a Twirl, spin in $2.5 million in pre-seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based data infrastructure platform Twirl has raised $2.5 million in a pre-seed round. Founded in frustration with the status quo and born from experience and research, Twirl has earmarked the capital to move the needle, both in terms of the team size and onboarding of customers.

title: El Green Mall,  Europe's first digital sustainable retail marketplace shows the way forward for sustainable consumption
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: There are few tech stories I could write without mentioning sustainability on some capacity. From transport to software to real estate, researchers, founders, and investors are increasingly focused on greening the planet.

title: French VC firm Ring Capital announces final close of impact fund at €66 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French VC firm Ring Capital says its final close of its Ring Mission impact fund at €66 million, a nice bit above the initial target of €50 million, shows 'adequacy of our impact approach' and allows it to support start-ups even further and possibly increase ticket sizes - between €500,000 and €5 million.

title: US private equity firm Silver Lake acquires majority stake in Software AG at €2.4 billion, intends to delist the company ASAP
author: Dan Taylor
summary: US-based private equity firm Silver Lake says that it has acquired more than 63% of business process management, data management, and consulting services firm Software AG shares, and intends to delist the company following the close of a €2.4 billion takeover bid.

title: Isomer Capital announces first close of €250 million Isomer Capital III fund
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The UK-based private investment firm, Isomer Capital has announced the first close of its new €250 million Isomer Capital III fund, it’s filled one third of the fund quicker than it was expecting. The fund focusses on European venture capital.

title: London-based mental health and wellbeing platform Oliva raises €5 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based mental health and wellbeing platform Oliva raised €5 million in a round led by Molten Ventures and includes existing investors Stride VC and new backers Alumni Ventures, with angel investors including Kieran Flanagan CMO at Zapier.

title: Peter Thiel backs Italian crypto assets exchange One Trading in €30 million round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Milan-based One Trading has raised €30 million in a Series A round. The company, formerly operating under Bitpanda Pro, is now fully separated from Bitpanda and specifically caters to experienced traders, finance pros, and institutions with regulated and secure access to digital assets.

title: Bringing music personalisation to gaming, Stockholm's Reactional Music raises $2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based Reactional Music has raised $2.05 million in what they’re calling a Pre-Series A funding round. The new score will be used to further develop the startups’ technologies that enable any song or music to be generated in real-time around a user within a game.

title: Making cycling smarter, Madrid’s UNIT 1 pedals in $3.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Madrid-based/Wilmington, Delaware (presumably for tax purposes in the US) UNIT 1 has raised $3.5 million in a Series A funding round. The company, which began life back in 2015 as an innovation company for action sports, appears to be focusing on smart bike accessories, intends to use the funding to accelerate its cadence and expand the team and product lineup through increased R&D activities.

title: Unaric raises $35 million to make better use of the ecosystem for Salesforce software builders
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based Unaric is building its very own ecosystem within the extensive Salesforce ecosystem. Spotting an opportunity to consolidate independent companies built in the Salesforce ecosystem it has plans to acquire 30-40 companies in the next three years.

title: Deliverect acquires ChatFood expanding its digital food ordering solutions offering to include social media and QR ordering
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belgian online food ordering scale-up Deliverect, has acquired social media ordering, order and pay at table, and loyalty solutions firm ChatFood which is headquartered in Dubai. The deal will see Deliverect offer ordering through social media accounts and QR order and pay solutions in addition its online food delivery solution, through POS terminals, to its global list of clients in the restaurant industry.

title: Belgium’s Odoo raises €150 million to support the global growth of its open-source integrated business software solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belgian scale-up Odoo has raised €150 million in a strategic investment, from General Atlantic, to fuel the continuous global growth of the open-source integrated business software firm.

title: Squake raises €3.5 million to power carbon calculations for travel and logistic industries
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based climate tech start-up Squake calculates carbon emissions on travel booking sites and logistics software via its seamless API integration tool.

title: Medwing raises €44 million to help ailing healthcare sector hire and retain staff
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Medwing, makers of digital HR management tools for the healthcare sector, has raised €44 million in a Series C that welcomed new investors Hambro Perks and SVB Capital (yes, you read that right, SVB Capital) to the cap table alongside a renewed commitment from Quadrille Capital, Cathay Innovation, Northzone, Cherry Ventures, and Atlantic Labs. Since mid-2017 Medwing has raised approximately €72 million.

title: Mission concluded: Utrech-based Objectiv to shut down
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Utrech-based AI-powered analytics platform Objectiv has decided to close up shop. In other sign o’ the times, Objectiv CEO and co-founder Vincent Hoogsteder disclosed the painful decision via Linkedin citing, “...sometimes, it’s go up - or go home.” It would appear fo Objectiv, it’s time to go home.

title: Spanish insurtech startup Bdeo scans in €7.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Madrid-based insurtech startup Bdeo has raised €7.5 million in fresh capital. The company offers an AI-powered computer vision solution that facilitates the remote assessment of damages to vehicles and homes, thereby expediting claims. Alongside strengthening its market position in Europe and Latin America, the company intends to use the new funds to ramp up further expansions abroad.

title: Jotelulu raises €4M to empower IT companies selling cloud services to SMEs, driving cloud computing across Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Spanish cloud services distributor Jotelulu announces a €4M Series A funding. Jotelulu is a white-label cloud services platform that helps any IT company sell cloud services to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) competitively, under their own brand, and without relying on existing cloud infrastructure giants.
