title: Retail startups are creating new buying and selling economies through digital platforms
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: People like me are the reason for the decline of bricks and mortar retail. I don’t like going shopping.

title: London fintech Paddle goes for downsizing; lays off 8% headcount
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London fintech Paddle, valued at $1.4 billion as of last May's $200 million series D round, has been forced to dismiss 8% of its 350 or so staff to streamline its cost structure in the ongoing downturn.

title: London HR tech scale-up Beamery to lay off 12% of staff following unicorn valuation in recent fundraise
author: Robin Wauters
summary: One day, you're announcing that you've hit unicorn status, the next day you're telling your employees "around 12%" of current staff will be leaving the company shortly.

title: With 100 portfolio companies now under its belt, Co-Fund NI is fuelling Northern Irish innovation
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A Northern Irish co-investment vehicle has disclosed its 100th portfolio company.

title: CFOs are always one step behind. Here is why they should embrace automation to get ahead.
author: William Pontoppidan
summary: The future of the CFO is digital and automated. I think this is clear to anyone who runs a finance department.

title: French medtech Gleamer raises €27 million to escalate international expansion of its AI-powered medical imaging solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French medtech firm Gleamer has developed AI-powered medical imaging solutions for radiography - its extending its portfolio of solutions to CT scans and mammography.

title: UK solar solutions start-up Glowb gets a glow up with £1.2 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based start-up Glowb is offering simple solar energy and battery solutions for homeowners bringing 'trust, transparency and simplicity for homeowners, making light work of the whole process for customers'. It was founded in 2022 by Sarah Chapman and Colin Fraser. Chapman also founded and sold Brazilian commercial solar company Faro Energy.

title: Cognassist bags £4 million from Gresham House Ventures for enterprise market penetration
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based Gresham House Ventures has made a £4 million investment in UK firm Cognassist, the SaaS platform which supports people with hidden learning needs through research and a cognitive dataset.

title: Spotted Zebra lands $1.8 million to close the skills gap
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based start-up Spotted Zebra has raised $1.8 million in seed funding to help close the skills gap with its skills-based workforce management platform.

title: European Defence Fund pours $18 million into home-grown infrared sensing tech
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: An €18 million funding allocation from the EU's European Defence Fund (EDF) has been awarded to Grenoble-based startup Lynred and nine others to deliver next gen infrared sensor supply chains within European borders.

title: Amsterdam’s Farmless wants to rewild the planet, is turning renewable energy into food, and has raised €1.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based foodtech startup Farmless has raised €1.2 million in a pre-seed funding round. The fermentation platform is based on liquid feedstock made with CO2, hydrogen and an unspecified source of renewable electricity.

title: Danish fintech Flatpay raises €15 million to expand its 'flat rate' POS offerings, as it vies for unicorn status
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish fintech Flatpay prides itself on its flat rate offering of point of sale tech for businesses. In business a year the start-up has just raised its Series A funding round banking €15 million. It cites ‘contributions from both previous and new investors’ in the round, naming Seed Capital in the line-up.

title: The new Bolt 6 scooter knows when you are riding badly, and prompts riders to practice safe parking
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Bolt has unveiled its swanky new Bolt 6 scooter – soon to be seen in Lisbon, Riga and Tallinn where it will deploy its first 1000 units by the end of July 2023.

title: Marrying the best of French and Ukrainian innovation, Kyiv's La French raises €50 million for Ukrainian VC push
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A €50 million VC fund has been set up in collaboration with a startup association representing French ties to the Ukrainian startup community.

title: Kovalee raises €8m in Series A round with plans to double app publishing team
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French firm Kovalee, a mobile app publisher, announced a €8 million Series A funding round enabling a hiring spree. Kovalee aims to double its team by the end of the year.

title: UK's Material Evolution gets £15 million into the mix to kick the kiln to the curb and scale low carbon cement production
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Material Evolution makes low carbon cement from industrial waste streams. The Middlesbrough-based company, founded by Dr. Elizabeth Gilligan and Sam Clark, is kicking the kiln to the curb as its alkali-fusion process requires only ‘ambient temperatures’. With the cement industry currently responsible for 8% of global CO2 emissions you can see how replacing ‘energy-intensive kilns’ might just be the cat’s pyjamas.

title: Germany’s Patient21 raises €100 million to take its hybrid model of healthcare platform and outpatient clinics to new European markets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German healthcare company Patient21 has raised €100 million in Series C funding to further develop its software platform and expand from Germany into further European markets.

title: GP Bullhound report reveals European tech unicorns surpass $1 trillion mark amidst challenging times
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: GP Bullhound is bullish about the future. Revealed in their latest Titans of Tech report, "Building blocks for the next wave", the backers of Klarna, Spotify, and Revolut (to name but a few), examine company growth figures across the European tech sector in the year up to 31 March 2023 and offer up predictions on which startups are likely to achieve the coveted Unicorn status within the next 12 months.

title: Insider picks up Meta-certified conversational commerce tool MindBehind
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Turkish omnichannel marketing company Insider has clinched a deal to acquire Istanbul-HQed MindBehind's conversational e-commerce and messaging software.

title: Closing the gap between crypto exchange and traditional financial payments, Tap Global just floated to raise £3.1 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Tap Global, a Gibraltar-licensed crypto app that offers preloaded Mastercards and fiat bank accounts to its customers, has just went public in an IPO that raised £3.1 million.

title: Automated RegTech player CUBE has acquired its UK-based counterpart The Hub
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Two London-based RegTech startups are joining forces. CUBE , an automated "regulatory management" company,  is acquiring The Hub, whose AI allows regtech clients to scrutinise unstructured text data from thousands of online regulatory sources.

title: Deloitte snaps up Munich-based venture client services provider 27pilots
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Munich-HQed 27pilots says startups "are the competitive resource of the future." Its founder and CEO, Gregor Gimmy, is credited with spearheading the venture client model, a product of the corporate venture universe that melds innovation capital with bespoke innovation resources to help best-in-class startups carve out a competitive advantage.

title: Why accountants need technology to protect the next generation of talent
author: Paul Lodder
summary: The role of the accountant is changing. More and more firms are seeing a flux in the number of accountants leaving and joining the profession. At the same time, their roles are continuing to expand as trusted advisors, issuing more strategic support and offering advice rather than just ticking boxes.

title: Quantica adds €14 million to further push its 3D printing tech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based additive manufacturing startup Quantica has closed at €14 million Series A round. According to the company, the new capital will be used to further develop and produce its multi-material 3D printing offer.

title: BioNTech to acquire Instadeep in £562 million deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: BioNTech has announced a planned acquisition of London-based InstaDeep in a deal that will see £362 million in cash and BioNTech shares, excluding the shares already owned by BioNTech with InstaDeep shareholders eligible to receive additional performance-based future milestone payments up to approximately £200 million.

title: Hometree raises $46 million and acquires BeWarm to build its residential energy efficiency platform across Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based residential energy efficiency platform Hometree has raised a $46 million Series B funding round and has acquired green home improvement financing platform BeWarm. It will use new capital to accelerate its new renewable installation and financing business streams.

title: Value.Space raises €2.1 million giving a boost to its satellite-based insurance risk assessment tech
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The UK-based start-up Value.Space completed a successful and oversubscribed second close of its seed round investment, raising €2.1 million to accelerate growth. Participating in the round were Specialist VC, Superangel, Lemonade Stand, Inventure, BADideas.fund, Amalfi and Linnar Viik, the former IT-advisor to the Prime Minister of Estonia.

title: New Report: Europe is witnessing a record number of emerging founders
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Although investments dropped off a cliff in 2023 when compared to previous years, layoffs abound, and significant impact of socio-macroeconomic instabilities, from the perspective of new founders entering the market, Europe is on the right path.

title: Keeping plastic from entering oceans, CleanHub nets $7 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based ocean cleanup organising platform CleanHub has raised $7 million in a new funding round led by existing investor Lakestar and new backer Integra Partners. The round also saw the participation of Silence VC, 468, Übermorgen Ventures, Felicis Ventures Partner Dan Bartus, and BCG X’s Managing Director and Senior Partner Stefan Gross-Selbeck.

title: SME-focused insurance provider Superscript raises $54 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based insurtech startup Superscript has raised £45 million in a Series B round. The newest round of capital is aimed at increasing the company’s underwriting and broking capabilities while continuing to further develop its AI-driven offerings. Including this round, Superscript has raised $78.4 million.

title: London-based Peppy eyes US market in $45 million raise
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based healthtech startup Peppy has raised $45 million in a Series B round. The fresh capital for the gender-based personalised digital health platform is aimed primarily at supporting the startup’s entry into the US market.

title: Andera Partners backs $60 million series C for hypertension medtech SoniVie
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: SoniVie, an Italy and Israel-run med tech seeking to treat hypertension through the use of ultrasound, has closed a $60 million series C round to make headway toward its clinical and regulatory pipeline.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five - The Tech.eu Summit, pet tech, Revolut, Seedcamp, fake tans, and the AI of the Tiger
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It's all happening man! The Tech.eu Summit is coming up next week, and on a personal note, I can't wait to see and meet and have a beer with each and every one of you. No seriously, buy me a drink, I'll show you.

title: Making smart thermostats sleek and easy to use, Munich's tado° brings home €43 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Munich's tado° has been around for a while. Since launch in 2011, tado° has grown market share for its "consumer friendly" smart thermostats, designed to reduce friction by offering compatibility with as many as 95% of European home builds.

title: Vonovia backs smart residential property developer Gropyus
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: German real estate company Vonovia is investing in Austria-based sustainable homes developer Gropyus.

title: In the midst of a bear market, hrtech startup Welcome to the Jungle claws in €50 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based multichannel media company Welcome to the Jungle has raised €50 million in a Series C funding round that will see the guns not only aimed at Europe but additionally, the roses that are US shores.

title: Norway’s solar installation firm Otovo beams up to €120 million in debt and equity funding
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oslo-based residential solar and battery installations marketplace Otovo has secured up to €120 million in funding via a mix of debt and equity shares placement.

title: QDNL Participations launches €15 million early-stage Dutch quantum fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: 2023 is turning out to be the year that would have made Richard Feynman smile. The year that quantum took a quantum leap forward. From the UK’s Quantum Motion raising £42 million in support of its development of silicon quantum processors to Switzerland’s Terra Quantum welcoming a private equity investment, times might be tough, but the future is looking anything but bleak for quantum.

title: Ireland's Wayflyer renews $300 million debt line from J.P. Morgan and reaches $2 billion deployed
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Wayflyer has renewed a $300 million debt line from J.P. Morgan as it reaches $2 billion deployed to over 3,000 eCommerce businesses globally.

title: Supernova’s deep tech fund reaches its first closing at €75 million of a targeted €100 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Supernova Invest, a deep tech investment platform has launched its Supernova Innovation 3 seed fund, with a first closing of €75 million. This is its eighth fund and it's targeting €100 million in the coming months.

title: Oh for Faks sake, they’ve gone and raised €5 million to digitise pharmacies comms with suppliers
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French pharmacies have been digitising their comms with suppliers thanks to Faks’ platform. The Paris-based med-tech has been assisting pharmacies with after-sales operations, keeping all the comms with their suppliers in one place.

title: The Hague’s 4impact goes for round two, now targeting €100 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The Hague-based VC firm 4impact has announced the first close of their second fund which is targeted at €100 million. While the fund declined to confirm the exact amount already accounted for, a company representative commented, “We are well progressed towards our target.”

title: New Origin secures €6 million from PhotonDelta to build an independent photonic chips foundry in the Netherlands
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Enschede-based New Origin, a spin out from University of Twente’s MESA+ NanoLab, has secured €6 million in funding to fuel its build of an independent photonic chips facility. The funding is part of the contribution that the Province of Overijssel has made available to PhotonDelta for a national photonics programme.

title: The scaling of a start-up ecosystem - Helsinki's Maria 01
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Maria 01 is a thriving Finnish start-up ecosystem in Helsinki. The campus, based in a disused hospital, is a place for start-ups, VCs and investors in Europe, start-up ecosystem organisations, and larger tech enterprises to come together one roof, collaborate and grow.

title: hema.to raises €3.6 million to scale its AI software for blood cancer decision support across European laboratories
author: Fiona Alston
summary: hema.to, the German health tech bringing AI automation to the clinical analysis of blood data, has raised a €3.6 million seed round.

title: Stravito asks the right questions using Generative AI to foster greater enterprise insights
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm startup Stravito is today launching a new offering to enterprise search. Using proprietary generative AI allows users to ask full questions using everyday language and receive short natural language answers synthesised from various proprietary sources.

title: Music NFT platform anotherblock welcomes Stride, and second Swedish House Mafia member Axwell to cap table in €4 million seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based anotherblock has raised €4 million in a seed funding round. According to the company, after making “significant strides” in the past year, the new funding will be used to push the company further forward, on a global scale. Essentially what this means is that anotherblock has ironed out the wrinkles and now aims to take its methodology to a larger audience. Since early 2022 anotherblock has raised just north of €6 million.

title: Nory knows restaurants, raises €7 million in seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Dublin-based hosptech startup Nory has raised €7 million in a seed funding round. The company uses a healthy dose of AI-powered optimisation wizardry to help restaurants manage their workflow. Soup to nuts.

title: 20 startups pitching at the 2023 edition of the Tech.eu Summit
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: As you can see from the programme and speaker line-up, it's going to be one heckuva busy day in Brussels next week. We know many of you are joining us to gain insight from/rub shoulders with industry leaders, but we've also taken your feedback from last year on board, and are proud to welcome the next generation of leaders to share in the spotlight, both onstage and off.

title: Cracking the code: extracting maximum value from tech conferences
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Conferences are back! It's almost summer, and conferences, expos, trade shows, and summits – like our very own – are back in full force after a year of gradual re-enter post-COVID.

title: Last mile delivery – Spotlighting 7 European start-ups who are lowering, dropping or delivering goods to your doorstep
author: Fiona Alston
summary: As we are about to be treated to a ringside seat, next week, to a discussion on the race to doorstep delivery hosted by our very own Cate Lawrence we decided to introduce you to some of Europe's movers and shakers in last-mile delivery.

title: 10 European quantum computing startups approaching superposition
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Quantum computing is a technology that uses the laws of quantum mechanics and applies it to solving problems that are, well, otherwise unsolvable in the world of classical computing.

title: BMW i Ventures pumps $13 million into Bulgaria’s EV charging management platform Ampeco
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Sofia-based white-label EV charging management software platform Ampeco has received a $13 million Series-A capital injection led by BMW i Ventures, with the all-things-Bulgarian Launchub Ventures and Cavalry Ventures participating alongside a host of undisclosed angel investors. This raise now brings Ampeco’s total funding to $16 million.

title: Why developers are flocking to Web3
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: From leaps in quantum computing to advancements on the metaverse front (the jury is still out, I realise), the internet as we know it is poised to change exponentially in the next few years.

title: Edurino's digital education platform raises €10.5 million series A
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Building gamified digital learning apps "fit for the 21st century", Munich's Edurino raised €10.5 million in series A funds for its platform that introduces digital to kindergarten children.

title: From 'body leasing' to 'friendshoring': Romania's Accesa demonstrates the value-add in IT partnerships
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Accesa is a leading technology services company headquartered in Cluj-Napoca (Romania), with offices in Zurich, Oradea and Munich. Over the past 16 years, the company has managed to establish itself as an employer of choice for IT professionals.

title: This Week in European Tech: VC Brighteye closes €100 million edtech fund, Amazon may buy Ocado, Vestager goes for top job at EIB, Germany's latest unicorn
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €2.1 billion, and over 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: ‘The concept of the metaverse has been abused horribly over the last few years’ - Herman Narula will be putting the record straight at the Tech.eu Summit
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The metaverse has been receiving a bit of a bad rap over the last couple of years, largely because of 'that' Meta announcement which we are still waiting to come to fruition, and then headlines like Disney eliminating its metaverse division. Even as we type this the word, metaverse still gets flagged by spell check. Is there no belief in the virtual world people have been working so hard to create?

title: Atomico is increasing its presence in Europe with new local hubs in Berlin and Stockholm
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based VC Atomico is opening new offices in Europe with new local hubs in Berlin and Stockholm and an expansion to its Paris office.

title: 94% of UK businesses trust technology to make crucial decisions
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: A number of changes over the last few years have presented additional and very important challenges that have affected the work environment and development in uncertain and unstable macroeconomic conditions. Moreover, companies face additional pressures when it comes to the implementation and strengthening of ESG measures, the blistering pace of AI developments, and the overall acceleration of technological development.

title: Spanish fintech Embat raises €5 million to launch new features and accelerate its expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Embat is uncomplicating financial planning and treasury management for businesses. Founded by Antonio Berga and Carlos Serrano, who are ex J.P. Morgan executives, the platform is built with the digitising of the entire accounting and financial planning process for businesses, in mind.

title: Canadian pension fund invests $400 million in Northvolt ahead of potential IPO
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Canada’s Investment Management Corporation of Ontario has invested $400 million in Stockholm-based sustainable lithium-ion battery maker Northvolt via convertible notes ahead of a potential IPO. "This investment fuels our expansion efforts, allowing us to further extend our global footprint and drive sustainable progress in our mission to deliver the world's greenest battery," said Northvolt CFO Alexander Hartman.

title: Putting predictive analytics to good use in the food industry, Tenzo ties into $5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based hosptech company (and TechStars graduate) Tenzo has raised $5 million in a Series A funding round. According to the company, the fresh produce will be used to help the company continue the development of its AI-powered analytics for the food industry platform. Since mid-2016 Tenzo has raised north of $7.7 million.

title: BASF's Chemovator welcomes startups into its business incubator
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Startups wanting to make it big in industrial spaces like manufacturing, freight, and supply chain often struggle in the early stages of gaining market entry.

title: A word of thanks to our Tech.eu Summit 2023 partners
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Less than ten days to go before we kick off the second Tech.eu Summit with a bang.

title: There is a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow as Elkstone closes €100 million early-stage Irish venture fund
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Irish investment house Elkstone, has announced the Ireland Strategic Investment Fund (ISIF) has committed to anchor the final close of its €100 million early-stage Irish venture fund. With Enterprise Ireland also on board, the fund has already deployed over €10 million to date and aims to complete its initial investments by 2026.

title: HR DataHub raises £1.4 million for HR teams to give themselves a performance review by benchmarking themselves against competitors
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based HR tech start-up HR DataHub provides a comparison solution for companies to compare their performance in such things as pay and benefits, retention and recruitment, employee engagement, and diversity and inclusion, against those of their competitors.

title: Quanscient raises €3.9 million to help bring products to market faster with its quantum computing-powered solution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Quanscient, the Finnish cloud and quantum computing-powered multiphysics simulation technology provider has raised €3.9 million. The Seed funding came from Maki.vc and will be used to further accelerate product development and expansion.

title: Norway’s solar installation firm Otovo beams up to €120 million in debt and equity funding
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oslo-based residential solar and battery installations marketplace Otovo has secured up to €120 million in funding via a mix of debt and equity shares placement.

title: Denmarks Sparrow Quantum raises €4.1 million for its integrated chip for on-demand single-photon streams
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish quantum technology company Sparrow Quantum has raised €4.1 million in seed funding. The funding round was led by the venture capital firm 2xN and includes co-investment from LIFTT and the European Innovation Council (EIC).

title: brandXchange acquires health, fitness and leisure PR agency Aim
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London's brandXchange will expand its web 3.0 consultancy having today revealed it is acquiring the health, fitness and leisure-themed PR agency Aim Content Marketing and Public Relations.

title: Winnow winning the food (waste) fight with a $10 million raise
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Winnow estimates that in excess of $100 billion worth of food is wasted each year in the hospitality sector alone so the London-based firm developed an AI solution for the food sector to reduce waste in kitchens.

title: Supernova’s deep tech fund reaches its first closing at €75 million of a targeted €100 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Supernova Invest, a deep tech investment platform has launched its Supernova Innovation 3 seed fund, with a first closing of €75 million. This is its eighth fund and it's targeting €100 million in the coming months.

title: NineID raises $2.6 million to bridge the gap between digital and physical enterprise security
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today in Ghent, corporate security startup NineID announces $1.2 million in funding, successfully closing its $2.6 million seed round — (it previously raised $1.4 million in 2022).

title: Pick a voice, any voice: Voicemod unleashes “AI Humans” collection of real-time AI voice changers
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It looks like it’s audio’s turn to get the AI spotlight shined on it this week. ElevenLabs nabbed another $19 million in a Series A round and launched its “audiobook in seconds” feature, Gladia unveiled how it’s building upon OpenAI’s Whisper and compiling audio intelligence, and now Voicemod is dropping some of the most accurate voice-changing services this former professional musician has ever heard.

title: EasyTranslate is using generative AI to drill down to client-specific language models
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Earlier this year Copenhagen-based content creation and translation platform EasyTranslate raised €2.75 million in a funding round that was aimed at adding new functionalities to its marketplace for freelance translators, including AI-generated content capabilities.

title: Setting a blowtorch to web3 bugs, Berlin’s Blocktorch raises $4.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Blocktorch has raised $4.2 million in a seed funding round. Reflecting the growing maturity of web3 technologies, Blocktorch provides developers with an observability platform to help them understand the behaviour of their decentralised applications and root out errors before they become catastrophes.

title: Helixx's 'Factory in a Box' solution empowers global EV manufacturing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Many startups have tried to design and manufacture the next iteration of vehicles and struggled rising against materials costs and delays, increased software challenges, and design complexities. For every Tesla, Nio, Lucid, or Aiways, there's a graveyard of startups from Treser to Elio, Lightyear, and Sono Motors.

title: Backed by the likes of Nico Rosberg, Hyperline brings a fresh approach to billing software, raises €4 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian startup Hyperline has raised €4 million in a seed funding round as it officially steps out of beta testing and throws the doors open to the public. In contrast to existing billing software solutions, i.e. Chargebee, Recurly, Zuora, etc., Hyperline says it can reduce integration time by 10x and increase agility by eliminating the need to devote developers to building a customised billing tool.

title: Bolt 🩷's Starship, a Code Red, an iron fist at the EIB, AI a-plenty, Tech City, and it's Pollen season
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Shhhh. Can you hear it? Listen in. Very carefully. Yes, yes, that's the unmistakable sound of an ecosystem that's staring down a summer full of iced tea and days by the lake. Or, is that just me?

title: PitchBook’s insights into European Private Capital in the first half of 2023
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: With close to half of 2023 in the books, and keeping in mind the European private equity (PE) and venture capital (VC) predictions made at the end of 2022, PitchBook has published "2023 European Private Capital Outlook: H1 Follow-up“. The report provides an overview of how the outlooks are faring and what has changed in European venture capital (VC) and private equity (PE) in 2023.

title: Argentinian tech giant Globant plans to double down on Europe: A chat with Fernando Matzkin, who's leading the charge
author: Robin Wauters

title: FundMyPitch reaches £5.7 million in funding for start-ups and SMEs in its first year of trading
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK start-ups and SMEs have been supported to the tune of £5.7 million in funding via FundMyPitch during the funding platform’s first year in operation.

title: Luxembourg's Expon Capital has announced the first closing of its €20 million fund which backs Seed-stage digital start-ups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Luxembourg-based Expon Capital has announced the first closing of its Digital Tech Fund seed-stage fund, with €14 million. The fund which backs digital start-ups is Expon Capital's third fund to date, this time targeting €20 million – the other two funds were both at the €10 million mark.

title: World Makers raises $4 million ahead of its Deceit 2 launch
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based games company World Makers has raised $4 million to support ongoing and future development. The game studio is gearing up for the launch of Deceit 2 and is on a hiring spree across skilled areas like art, production, design and content creation.

title: Boost Capital Partners announces first close of its UX-focused fund at $30 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London has a new early-stage VC fund on the block, and this one is laying heavily into startups that focus on improving the user experience. Citing the interest to back companies working in “the real economy”, Boost will offer initial pre-seed or seed stage ticket sizes ranging from $300,000 to $750,000 (including follow-on capabilities) to companies working on improving health, wellness, education, sustainability, entertainment and finance user experiences.

title: Pale blue dot ups the ante, closes second fund at €93 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Malmö, Sweden-based climate tech VC firm Pale blue dot has announced the close of its second fund at €93 million. According to the firm, they are still actively making investments from the first fund, and are ironing out the final details of these tickets before officially uncorking the second vintage.

title: Former L'Oreal, Palantir MVPs join forces, take £1.8 million pre-seed for Sourcerie beauty venture
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Data is hardly the most glamorous word in the dictionary, but it does play an increasingly vital role in the delivery of new beauty products. It wasn't that long ago you'd struggle to get coverage for certain skin tones, and that's before even touching on permutations in skin care, where one person's cure can severely worsen another's condition.

title: UK’s Axle raises $1.6 million to flip the switch on energy use
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based, energy flexibility start-up, Axle Energy has raised $1.6 million in Pre-seed funding in a round led by Picus Capital with participation from Eka Ventures.

title: European edtech VC Brighteye closes second fund at €100 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Luxembourg-based European edtech VC Brighteye Ventures has announced the final close of its second fund at €100 million. The fund will provide capital to European edtech start-ups in their early-stages, investing in Seed and Series A rounds.

title: The 'ship' we were all waiting for - Estonia's Starship Technologies and Bolt have finally gotten it together
author: Fiona Alston
summary: In news that perhaps we were all kind of waiting to happen at some point, Starship Technologies, the autonomous delivery services, has formed a commercial partnership with mobility provider Bolt. The Estonian companies have occupied the same space for some time in Tallinn and finally we’ll see the option of a Starship robot delivering the goods on the Bolt Food app.

title: TradingHub partners with Summit Partners to fuel the growth of its financial insights platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based financial insights platform TradingHub has announced a minority investment of secondary capital by Summit Partners to fuel growth and its product offering. Financial terms were not disclosed.

title: Hype Collective markets itself just right as it is acquired by Gen Z influencer agency Bulla Co
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK start-up Bulla Co Gen Z influencer agency has announced it has acquired student marketing firm Hype Collective. No figures were disclosed but Bulla Co claims to have raised a 'six-figure' Pre-seed round of late so, well there is that.

title: Stirling Square Capital Partners has bought construction tech company Infobric from Summa Equity in £250 million deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Stirling Square Capital Partners has acquired construction tech company Infobric from Summa Equity in a deal that values the company at more than £250 million (according to Private Equity News).

title: Kitt's kitting out offices, going Stateside, partnering with Raise and has raised a $8 million extension
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based office design and management company, Kitt has raised $8 million in a Seed extension round as it opens an office in New York. It has also announced a new partnership with brokerage firm Raise to ‘offer a turnkey managed product offering to commercial real estate owners, with the objective of increasing the footprint of commercial office inventory in its marketplace’.

title: Sequoia Atlas - empowering founders by revolutionising talent recruitment in Europe's tech industry
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In today’s world, having the skills to find information is beneficial, but all the more so if you have a go-to location where all the info you seek is already gathered. Quite often, founders struggle in sourcing and recruiting the best engineers.

title: Confirmed: Andreessen Horowitz leads $19 million Series A round in text-to-speech AI platform ElevenLabs
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London/New York-based voice AI startup ElevenLabs has raised $19 million in a Series A funding round. A self-titled voice technology research lab, the company intends to use the $19 million to press forward with voice AI research projects and additional product deployments. According to Business Insider, the company's valuation is estimated to be in the neighbourhood of $100 million.

title: Digital out-of-home advertising network Hygh raises €21.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Zug/Berlin-based digital advertising network Hygh has raised €21.5 million in a hybrid debt and equity funding round. The company currently has 1,800 displays in place in seven major cities across Germany, and as part of the funding aims to ramp this figure up to 15 cities. Additionally, the company says it will continue scaling existing networks in Germany, Austria, and Switzerland (DACH region), and plans on entering new European markets.

title: Germany’s Wingcopter lands €40 million in new funding via the EIB
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Hesse-based unmanned eVTOL fixed-wing aircraft maker Wingcopter has received a €40 million “quasi-equity” investment via the EIB in order to ramp up production of its flagship flyer, the Wingcopter 198 as it carries on with global expansion and further innovation plans.

title: Ireland's Manna delivers Stateside as Coca-Cola swoop in with investment
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Irish start-up Manna has announced investment from Coca-Cola HBC and is expanding its drone delivery service to the US market.

title: Finnish startup Synergi launches a smart electricity platform to give home customers more power over their energy bills
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Finnish energy tech startup Synergi, announces the launch of its smart electricity platform, which will cover electric vehicles and most major home electrical devices.

title: Seedcamp's sixth session secures $180 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based VC firm Seedcamp has announced the close of its sixth fund at $180 million. The hexa-iteration will continue to bear Seedcamp’s signature early-stage, pan-European, sector-agnostic torch, and allow the fund to lead rounds ranging from angel and seed rounds with ticket sizes up to $1 million, as well as reserving a portion for follow on rounds up to Series B.

title: Cerbos takes the pain out of authorization and user permissions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: If you're looking for developer solutions, the best come from teams who saw a need for better software that could create their own pain points but also drive commercial business value.

title: French fintech Green-Got banks €5 million to grow its green banking platform in Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French fintech start-up Green-Got is bringing climate conscious banking to Europe. The neo-bank has raised €5 million – part venture capital and part crowdfunding. Funds will fuel a European expansion - Belgium is on the list - and will develop its offering of personal saving accounts and accounts for sole traders.

title: Hived is bringing a 'green' buzz to parcel delivery in the UK as it raises £10 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK- based sustainable parcel delivery network Hived is tackling the parcel delivery industry to deliver a greener alternative for businesses with its all-electric fleet, not just in last mile delivery but it has nationwide collection across the UK.

title: Einride hits the road in Norway with PostNord partnership
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Einride has yet another announcement as it takes to the highways in Norway in partnership with Scandinavian postal service PostNord. The freight mobility company provides digital, electric and autonomous technology and, of late, has launched its offering on the UK, UAE, Benelux and Germany.

title: Nitrogen helped take the world’s population to 8 Billion. Quantum computing will ensure it doesn’t destroy our planet
author: Francesco Ricciuti
summary: When it comes to the climate emergency, we dedicate too much focus to one culprit. There’s another offender that goes virtually unnoticed and it’s almost criminal: Nitrogen.

title: Corporate up-skilling provider Lepaya acquires Krauthammer to strengthen its hand in the European business edtech market
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch corporate up-skilling provider Lepaya has acquired Swiss leadership training provider Krauthammer in a deal which will see Lepaya establishe itself as the premier up-skilling and transformation company catering to the needs of large-scale corporate entities through senior management training.

title: Ripple shells out $250 million as it acquires crypto custody firm Metaco
author: Fiona Alston
summary: US-based crypto company Ripple has acquired Swiss crypto custody firm Metaco in a $250 million deal.

title: Dutch start-up Deeploy is putting 'transparency and explainability' in to AI as it raises €2.5 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch start-up Deeploy is an oversight software platform which allows machine learning model deployments in a transparent and explainable way. This company has just raised a €2.5 million funding round which will see the platform expand its offering and keep up to date with future European AI legislation.

title: Reward Gateway acquired by Edenred for £1.15 billion to 'strengthening its employee benefits value proposition'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Global employee engagement company, Reward Gateway has been acquired by French-based employee fintech firm, Edenred for £1.15 billion from funds managed by Abry Partners and Castik Capital.

title: Mitiga Solutions mitigating climate risks by raising €13 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Barcelona-based climate tech company Mitiga Solutions has raised a €13.25 million Series A round for its solution which predicts and prevents natural hazards from becoming disasters using high-performance computing, AI, and science.

title: Pensions fintech Smart gets wise to $95 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based fintech focused on the retirement savings market, Smart, aka SmartPension, has raised $95 million in a Series E funding round. The new investment will fuel the company’s ongoing global expansion initiatives, both organically and through M&A activity. Since mid-2016 the company has raised in excess of £220 million.

title: French start-up Greenbids raises €1.6 million to clean up digital advertising, and partners with Scope3
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French sustainable adtech start-up Greenbids is cleaning up the digital advertising space. A Scope3 report found that digital advertising generates more than 2.6 million metric tons of carbon per year, across five leading economies. It might be a somewhat surprising figure to some, so Greenbids is making its business to spread the word and provide a better solution.

title: Iceland's DTE raises $10 million to further fuel its real-time insights for quality control in metal production
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Iceland’s DTE, a platform providing insights to the metal production and manufacturing industry has raised $10 million in what it is calling a Series A2 round.

title: Your Guide To Tech.eu Summit 2023
author: Robin Wauters
summary: The second Tech.eu Summit is fast approaching and with only one week to go, it seemed like a good idea to put together some information to make sure you have the best possible event experience.

title: 50 million transactions in 24 hours: mintBlue breaks World Record in blockchain industry
author: Julia Gifford
summary: Scalability, security, and decentralisation – the "blockchain trilemma " states that you can only have two. But you may no longer have to choose, as proven by Amsterdam-based startup mintBlue's record-breaking transaction rate, which is sure to alter the playing field for the public enterprise blockchain industry.

title: C4T Raises €4 Million to digitise European customs declarations
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belgium's Custom4trade NV (C4T) cloud-based customs declarations platform has announced it raised €4 million which will support its growth plans in the UK and Europe, and fuel the development of new products and services.

title: Announcing the Tech.eu Summit 2023 agenda and full speaker line-up 💪
author: Robin Wauters
summary: The countdown has started: on 24 May we will be welcoming a ton of you to Brussels Expo for the second edition of our flagship Tech.eu Summit.

title: Ōura acquires Proxy and its 'wave to pay' tech
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish wearable tech company Ōura has announced it is acquiring US start-up Proxy in an all equity deal. Bloomberg reported that the deal valued Proxy at $185 million – quite the drop from the Pitchbook’s valuation of the identity tech company at $292 million in 2020.

title: Ukraine’s Osavul raises $1 million to fight the war on disinformation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: When Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine suddenly the internet was rife with disinformation about what was really happening in Eastern Europe. Ukrainian AI specialists Dmytro Pleshakov and Dmytro Bilash kicked into action to defend the reputation of their country, developing a solution to curtail the spread of disinformation - and so Osavul was born.

title: Mangopay adds another to the collection, this time acquiring Dublin’s WhenThen
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Payment infrastructure for platforms and marketplaces provider Mangopay is acquiring Dublin’s WhenThen, a payments technology company, which powers payment acceptance and automates payment operations for e-commerce players. This is Mangopay's second acquisition in less than six months, having snapped up Poland's Nethone in late November of last year.

title: German insurtech firm Thinksurance has raised $24 million to expand its digital commercial insurance platform in Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German insurtech firm Thinksurance has raised $24 million enabling it to continue to expand its platform. The platform is a digital insurance consultations solution for commercial and industrial clients - it 'enables insurance distributors to fully digitalise consultations and policy processes, allowing them to provide tailor-made insurance solutions for their clients with speed and accuracy'.

title: Circular Computing and BSI join forces to bring 'good as new' refurbished laptops to market
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This month, Circular Computing partnered with UK Stanadards body BSI to help bring recycled computers to the mainstream.

title: Sweden’s electric and autonomous freight mobility maker Einride enters UK market
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Having already expanded operations into Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands, Luxembourg, and Norway, the UK’s motorways will soon play host to Einride’s vehicles.

title: Only at the Tech.eu Summit: A place for Europe in the next space tech race
author: Dan Taylor
summary: On October 4, 1957, the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics successfully launched Sputnik, the first artificial satellite to orbit Earth. While the satellite sent a radio signal back to Earth for three weeks before its batteries ran out and remained in orbit for a mere 90 days, this one act forever changed the course of humankind.

title: We have lift off – Skyrora begins testing 3D printed rocket engines in Scotland
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Scottish spacetech company Skyrora will commence the testing of the updated design of its 70kN engine - engines were 3D printed using Skyrora’s Skyprint 2 machine which it claims will half the production time and reduce costs.

title: Hotel Manager checks in another £2.2 million to add to its Seed round and deliver 'memorable experiences for guests'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The UK-based hospitality tech start-up Hotel Manager has bagged an additional £2.2 million having previously secured a £1 million in December 2022, bringing a total Seed round to £3.2 million.

title: EU AI Act: Why implementing AI guardrails will unlock benefits for society
author: Kriti Sharma
summary: This week Members of the European Parliament (MEPs) are placing their vote on the adoption of the EU AI Act. As the world’s first law on AI by a major regulator, this is a pivotal moment that will shape how AI is developed in Europe and could serve as a blueprint for other regulatory authorities around the world.

title: MiCA is coming. What your business should do to be prepared
author: Uldis Tēraudkalns
summary: The Markets in Crypto-Assets Act, also known as MiCA, was finally passed by the European Parliament. While it still needs approval from the European Council, it's safe to say that this regulation will become a reality in no time.

title: Aiming to make ear and hearing health more accessible, TympaHealth raises $23 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based ear and hearing health assessment system company TympaHealth has raised $23 million in a Series A funding round. The company plans to grow the team size and expand its services in the UK and Continental Europe in tandem with a planned US market entry.

title: Swedish electric hydrofoil maker Candela goes all ahead full with $20 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based makers of electric hydrofoil watercraft, Candela have raised $20 million in a new funding round. The capital will see the company shift into high gear and begin mass production of its 30-passenger electric ferry in the company’s Stockholm factory. Founded in 2014, Candela has gone on record raising approximately $45.5 million since 2021.

title: "Funding secured": These are some of the investors you'll meet at Tech.eu Summit 2023
author: Robin Wauters
summary: When you're bringing the European Tech ecosystem together under one roof, that includes a lot of investors who are financing and guiding today's key actors (and keen to work with tomorrow's leaders as well).

title: Wingtra drones on about its new $22 million in funding as it carries on mapping the world around us
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Zürich-based provider of professional mapping drones, developer of fully autonomous flights software, and the WingtraPilot app, Wingtra has raised $22 million in a Series B funding round. The fresh cheddar will be used to accelerate operations on all fronts, according to the company. Founded in 2015, Wingtra has raised $41 million since early 2016.

title: The rockstars building a future worth getting excited about - Episode 1: Cells - the factories of the future with Stef van Grieken founder and CEO of Cradle.bio
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This episode is brought to you by Rows and Athletic Greens

title: 10 European insurtech companies that should be on your radar
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: As in every industry, the use of tech innovations in the field of insurance is common in order to create the most efficient business model possible (insurance + technology = insurtech).

title: Italy’s RBF player Viceversa adds €10 million to the coffers, hints at white label service
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Milan’s revenue-based financing fintech Viceversa has closed a Series A funding round that will see the company have an additional €10 million in working capital as it continues to support the growth of namely e-commerce and marketplace startups.

title: No longer lost in translation: Vidby bridges language barriers with AI-powered video translations and dubbing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last few decades, digital translation has brought people closer together than ever before by allowing them to understand each other's words, intonation, and context more easily.

title: April 2023: Deals, exits and the Tech.eu Summit on May 24th in Brussels
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Although last month we hoped to witness a positive trend in the growth of investments on the European technology scene, it seems that this was only short-term because already in April we see that this year will not be so easy either.

title: North Macedonia is the home of EIT’s latest innovation hub
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Great news for innovators in the Western Balkans today as the European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT) announced the launch of its first joint hub to be opened in Skopje, North Macedonia to serve the region.

title: 🎙️ The global startup ecosystem report, fun times for fintech, one big seed round, the EU votes to regulate AI, a16z opens up shop in The Big Smoke
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In case you weren't paying attention, a whole boatload of activity happened across the European tech scene this week. So much so that we had trouble whittling down what to discuss and what to let slide.

title: Storage Place raises £400,000 to open a new facility creating 40 new jobs in County Durham
author: Fiona Alston
summary: County Durham-based Storage Place Ltd (TSP) has secured a £400,000 investment to open a new facility locally and create up to 40 new jobs.

title: Spain's ID Finance raises €30 million in deal with UK's Kingsway Capital
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Spanish fintech ID Finance has announced it has secured an investment of €30 million allowing it to to focus on the Spanish and Mexican roll out of financial wellness app Plazo - with co-founder Boris Batine in the role of Plazo's CEO.

title: Y Combinator alum Rever revs up e-commerce returns with an additional €7.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Barcelona-based Rever has raised €7.5 million in a seed funding round. The Y Combinator alumni startup allows shoppers to return any e-commerce purchased product in two clicks and receive a refund in just seconds. According to the startup, the capital will be used to fund the company’s growth and global expansion plans.

title: How Agile product development methodology fueled Quadcode's growth
author: Rudolfs Millins
summary: Not so long ago, banking was a tedious undertaking that typically required physically going to brick-and-mortar banks, even for basic tasks. However, that has changed now – banking for customers can be a completely digital experience if they desire it.

title: B2B music streaming service Soundtrack Your Brand raises $15 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based “Spotify for Business” B2B music streaming service Soundtrack Your Brand has raised $15 million in a new funding round. Founded by former COO & Co-Founder Beats Music Ola Sars, the investment is aimed at turning the volume up on a go-to-market strategy that’s already resulted in 60% year-on-year revenue growth in 2022.

title: Verified’s done it again, this time it’s Pliance it has acquired
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Sweden's Verified, a compliance solutions company has acquired Pliance, a regtech start-up specialising in automated financial crime compliance. This news comes only a month after Verified's announcement of a €31 million investment from Verdane and its acquisition of digital identity verification company, Assently.

title: m3ter has raised $14 million to help software businesses with pricing
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The UK-based pricing operations platform m3ter has raised $14 million in Series A funding as it launches new analytics features and expands its U.S. presence.

title: Preventative measures as AERA Health raises €4 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Munich-based AERA Health, a preventive health-tech start-up has raised €4 million in pre-seed funding. The funds will see the rollout of AERA Health’s platform and some new hires to the team. AERA is now, stronger than rumoured, to be at a valuation somewhere in the (exact) mid 20's region.

title: Goldman keeps on keepin’ on with Raisin in fresh €60 million round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based fintech Raisin has raised €60 million in a Series E funding round that welcomed two new investors, M&G’s Catalyst, and an undisclosed financial institution.

title: Former Uber exec Steve Salom tapped by Switzerland’s ACE & Company, tasked with launching €150 million Swiss-focused fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Geneva-based investment house ACE & Company has announced the appointment of former Uber France, Austria, and Switzerland General Manager Steve Salom to the role of Partner. In addition to co-running the venture capital arm of the company, Salom is tasked with launching the firm’s newest €150 million fund.

title: Plexigrid raises €4.5 million to “flatten the curve” of energy consumption with its AI software solution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Spanish Plexigrid wants to tackle the surge of demand on electrical grids by increasing and decreasing supplies to make grids work more efficiently. The Gijon-based climate tech start-up has raised a €4.5 million in an oversubscribed seed round.

title: Reverion has raised €8.5 million for the production of its biogas power plants
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German climate tech start-up Reverion has raised €8.5 million to accelerate the production of its 100 kW and 500 kW biogas power plants. It claims its modular power plants can double the efficiency of electricity generation from 40 to 80 percent compared to conventional technology.

title: Viatu raises $1 million to bring sustainable travel options to customers in one search
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swiss sustainable travel company Viatu wants to take the hard work out of booking an adventure by utilising API and data-driven technology to save you having to book through various different sites for multi-day trips.

title: Calling all European tech startups! Apply now for a chance to shine at Tech.eu Summit 2023
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This year, we're dedicating space at the Brussels Expo venue to shine a light on Europe's top startups during the next Tech.eu Summit on 24 May 2023.

title: Finnish SaaS startup Videobot secures €2M to revolutionise online engagement
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Videobot, a Finnish SaaS startup, has raised €2 million in seed funding.

title: This Week in European Tech: Mistral's €105 million seed round, a16z lands in London, EU moves closer to regulating AI, Synthesia raises $90 million, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and over 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Allurity acquired Portugal's CloudComputing and Switzerland's Securix to strengthen its grip on European cybersecurity sector
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Allurity has continued its sweep of acquiring cybersecurity firms, with Portugal's CloudComputing and the Swiss company Securix, as the Swedish firm looks to assert dominance in the Europe. It has already added Swedish Arctic Group, ID North and Pulsen IAM, Danish CSIS and Spanish Aiuken Cybersecurity to its growing list of tech-enabled cybersecurity service providers.

title: After 11 fateful voyages at sea, Pirate Summit co-founder Manuel Koelman decides its time to scuttle the ship. Here’s why.
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Surveying today’s European tech ecosystem conference landscape is an exercise in exclusion. With a calendar that sees not enough room to swing a cat, the question is no longer which ones to go to, but rather, which ones are you going to let slide?

title: Andreessen Horowitz to open first international office in London
author: Dan Taylor
summary: US-based investor Andreessen Horowitz has announced that it will open its first international office in London later this year and amongst other activities, wants to work closely with universities throughout the UK to help foster blockchain activities and curriculum.

title: Game on for solopreneurs, as Wargraphs sells to M.O.B.A. Network for €50 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Bootstrapped French in-game features company Wargraphs has been acquired for €50 million. Jean-Nicolas is a solopreneur and has been building and running his offering for the past ten years.

title: Dutch EV fast-charging network developer Fastned raises €21.9 million to go even faster
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based fast charging infrastructure for electric vehicles developer Fastned has raised €21.9 million with the issue of new bonds. Investors have additionally extended €2.4 million worth of investments from earlier issues, ultimately bringing the total issued amount in this round to over €24.3 million.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five - The European EV revolution, the Baltics beyond borders, Kubernetes, Aiii carumba, and more than just groceries?
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Should anyone tell you that preparing for an event is a piece of cake, run. Run far and fast. In case you don't know what I'm alluding to, it's crunch time here at Tech.eu as we gear up for our annual Summit in just 12 days' time. We've got an incredible roster of speakers lined up, and I personally can't wait to geek out on the quantum computers and space tech panels I'll be hosting.

title: Bits Technology bites into €4 million to help fintechs strengthen their identity and AML processes
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based Bits Technology has raised €4 million in a seed funding round that will see the company further develop its API that allows fintech product builders to connect to multiple service providers and data sources for Know Your Customer and Know Your Business processes.

title: Valued at $2.75 billion, Istanbul’s Dream Games opens London office to support global expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Istanbul-based Dream Games has announced two key c-level appointments in conjunction with the opening of a new office in London. A descendant of the Peak Games lineage, Dream Games was founded just three years ago, and Dream Games has raised close to half a billion USD over the course of four funding rounds, and at last count, held a valuation of $2.75 billion.

title: Verified's been busy validating a raise and acquiring Swedish firm Assently
author: Fiona Alston
summary: B2B SaaS company Verified has announced it received funding from Verdane and has acquired Swedish firm Assently. No figures were given.

title: All smiles as Fire1 raises $25 million for heart failure recovery
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dublin-based medtech firm Fire1, has announced the close of a $25 million financing round to accelerate the development of its monitoring solution to improve outcomes for heart failure patients.

title: SNERPA Power raises €2.2M for energy decarbonisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, an Icelandic startup, SNERPA Power, raised €2.2 million in funding to accelerate the decarbonisation of the energy sector.

title: Valyuu raises €2.4M to fight electronic waste with circular economy marketplace
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Netherlands startup Valyuu announced a €2.4 million fundraising in a seed funding round led by Rubio Impact Ventures and Slingshot Ventures.

title: Revenue analytics and forecasting platform Kluster bunches $5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based revenue analytics and forecasting platform Kluster has raised $5 million in a Series A funding round. The startup intends to use the capital to continue product development as well as push further into the American market. Since 2020, Kluster has raised $6 million.

title: Ellie.ai, the 'Figma for data teams', bags €2.5M in seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Ellie.ai, a pioneer in product design and collaboration software for data teams, announced that it has secured a €2.5 million seed funding round.

title: Maximising the power of green startups: Insights from Rockstart energy fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Saving the world is no easy task, but that doesn’t mean there’s a shortage of established and upstart companies taking their best stab at it. For the incumbents, particularly those with large chequebooks to draw from, the capital powering the innovations to make these changes might be a bit easier (albeit perhaps with far more red tape) to come by; for startups, the story is a bit different.

title: A consortium by SiloGen and TurkuNLP develops Europe's largest open-source LLMs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week one of SiloGen, the large language model (LLM) arm of Europe's largest private AI labs Silo AI, launches a consortium together with TurkuNLP, a research group at the University of Turku, to develop a family of open LLMs, including the world's largest open source LLM.

title: Yayem raises $2 million as it launches its mobile app of experiences for hybrid workers
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Founded by Lindsey Elkin and Nicolas Buteau - who were early days Uber execs in a former life - Yayem is an experiential learning platform for hybrid professionals and teams - 'a global passport to enchanting spaces, epic experiences and personalised learning opportunities'.

title: Pitchbook: European VC fundraising is on pace for its lowest annual figure since 2015
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: It should come as no surprise that the consequences of global macroeconomic changes can be seen in all sectors and regions. These changes did not bypass the dealmaking environment in Europe, creating challenging and different conditions both for the companies and investors.

title: Finland's Solu raises €1 million, partners with Stanford and plans a pathogen DNA library to speed up the identification of antibiotic resistance
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish biotech start-up Solu has raised €1 million in funding to fuel the development and commercialisation of its product as it plans to builds an extensive pathogen DNA library.

title: Ecochain secures €3 million‎ to expand its team, bringing its LCA software to more manufacturers
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch climate software scale up Ecochain is providing data on the environmental impacts of products, to manufacturers, through its life cycle assessment (LCA) software - tackling industries such as packaging, construction, apparel, food and beverage, and consumer electronics.

title: BoomFi raises $3.8 million to make its next-generation payments solution common place
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based next-generation payments company, BoomFi has raised $3.8 million in an oversubscribed seed funding round continuing its growth as it continues to streamline the process of payments across the blockchain and traditional payment systems.

title: From photography to no code data analytics, Graphext raises $4.6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Madrid-based no-code data analytics platform Graphext has raised $4.6 million in a seed funding round led by Hoxton Ventures. The round also drew the participation of SaxeCap and Trajectory Ventures and is aimed at further accelerating the startup’s growth, namely by the continued development of its technological offer, and that of a recruitment drive.

title: Hello Tomorrow is bridging the gap between deep tech and entrepreneurship to foster world changing tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The last few years have brought a strong increase in scientific startups. They typically come with some distinct advantages – clever teams, initial hypotheses are proven, and ideas that have been subject to academic rigour and peer reviews.

title: Wayhome is opening doors as it raises £8 million to help people get on the property ladder
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The UK-based gradual homeownership provider Wayhome has closed a Series A equity funding round of £8 million giving it runway to forge further partnerships with mortgage brokers and lenders in the coming months - an important part of Wayhome’s continuing growth and expansion.

title: COMPREDICT's virtual sensors are changing the future of connected mobility
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's not every day that I stumble upon an innovation that completely upends my understanding of a particular type of technology. However, when it comes to this IoT offering, I am excited.

title: Two months after a €43 million round, smart thermostat maker tado° tacks on another €12 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich’s tado° has added another €12 million to an already impressive €43 million funding round announced just two months ago. The additional capital is aimed at turning up the heat on scaling efforts as it sweats profitability in 2023.

title: Simplifying client onboarding and risk evaluation, Sikoia raises $6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Sikoia (not to be confused with Sequoia, although you’d be forgiven in the pronunciation) has raised $6 million in a seed round led by MassMutual Ventures (MMV) with Coalition Capital and existing investors Earlybird and Seedcamp doubling down on their commitment.

title: Gener8's new app shows what data companies know about you and how you can keep your data private or monetize it
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today  Gener8 - a company that lets people take back control and earn from their online data - is launching a mobile app that allows people to see what data a company holds on them, then gives them the choice to earn from it themselves. It also raised £5.1 million in funding.

title: Travelshift secures $10M investment from GE to fuel AI-powered travel platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Travelshift, a Reykjavik-based online travel agency (OTA) has raised $10 million of capital from existing shareholder General Electric, raising the company's total funding amount to $30 million.

title: Confirmed: Founders Forum Group acquires Tech Nation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: After confirming reports late last month that Tech Nation was talking with Founders Forum Group about an acquisition, today, Tech Nation Founding Chief Executive Gerard Grech has confirmed that the deal is official.

title: Stroom raises  $3.5M to solve Lightning Network's Liquidity challenges
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Kyiv’s Stroom Network has secured $3.5 million in an oversubscribed Seed funding round.

title: EV charging platform Virta plugs into €85 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Helsinki-based electric vehicle charging platform Virta has raised €85 million in a new funding round. Comprised of a €65 million equity investment and a €20 million grant, the company plans to grow its charging transactions by a factor of five across Europe and the APAC region by 2025.

title: United Robots unveils new funding for autonomous industrial cleaning robots
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Deep tech startup United Robots today unveiled an undisclosed funding round.

title: UK start-up tem. raises £2.5 million to give competitive renewable energy prices via its AI- driven platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based renewable energy start-up tem. allows businesses for all sizes to purchase energy directly from renewable generators. Its platform matches renewable buyers and sellers based on their needs, via its AI-driven platform, and it claims its cutting costs by up to 10x compared to using tradition buying and selling methods.

title: Danish camera-sharing platform Wedio raises €1.25 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Danish camera-sharing platform Wedio has cobbled together €1.25 million in a seed funding round. According to the company, the capital will be used to expand to additional European markets.

title: Berlin's Nelly raises €15 million to fully digitise medical admin and payments
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German start-up Nelly, the fintech for the patient facing medical sector, has raised a €15 million Series A funding round to 'accelerate its growth in Germany, develop additional products, deepen its fintech capabilities, as well as to expand into new medical verticals and markets'.

title: Beyond Military Tech: Emerging trends in Ukraine's early-stage startup scene for investors to look after
author: Oleksandra Balkova
summary: More than a year into the war, many European and global investors are still considering how and where they can support the Ukrainian startup ecosystem. Much progress has been made, with various grant programs launched by governments and private entities, as well as special support programs for Ukrainian entrepreneurs.

title: Trezy secures €3 million to support SMEs reduce cash flow issues with its AI-driven predictive cash flow management platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Franco-Dutch fintech Trezy has a predictive tool which delivers smart forecasting of cash flow to SMEs. The firm is leveraging generative AI technology to further automate the administrative tasks of data analysis and insights.

title: Sweden's ClimateView raises €14 million to enhance climate action plans in cities
author: Fiona Alston
summary: ClimateView, a climate action tech start-up based in Stockholm, has completed a €14 million funding round to fuel development of its climate finance platform and to 'support cities in their climate investment planning needs as part of the EU’s innovative program - 100 Climate-neutral and Smart Cities'.

title: This Week in European Tech: French EV charging scale-up Driveco nabs €250 million, Ōura buys Proxy, Pale Blue Dot closes €93 million fund, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: HydRegen raises £2.6 million to clean up the chemical manufacturing and pharmaceutical industries
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Oxford-based biotechnology company HydRegen, has the potential to reduce the carbon footprint and operating costs of the chemical manufacturing and pharmaceutical industries. The spin-out from the University of Oxford is replacing toxic metal catalysts with environmentally and economically friendly bio-based alternatives reducing the temperatures and pressures required in chemical syntheses.

title: We need to make sustainability easier for Europe’s founders
author: Henry Philipson
summary: Reid Hoffman, founder of LinkedIn, has often said that “starting a company is like jumping off a cliff and assembling a plane on the way down.” Imagine if you were told that the plane also had to run on sustainable fuel.

title: AI-powered financial advisor Finanzguru guides in €13 million via PayPal Ventures and others
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Having reached profitability in 2022, Frankfurt am Main-based Finanzguru has raised €13 million in a new financing round that will see the company continue to drive profitable growth in tandem with further product development and geographic reach.

title: Taking on the hospitality sector talent shortage, Brigad brings in €33 million in Balderton-led round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian hosptech startup Brigad has raised €33 million in a Series B funding round. The startup that helps connect self-employed hospitality industry professionals with short-term assignments will use the new capital to further accelerate its growth in key markets across Europe. Since 2016, the firm has raised north of €50 million

title: What's the deal with deal flow in European tech? A data-driven interview with Orrick experts
author: Robin Wauters
summary: International law firm Orrick has analysed 500+ transactions it closed for European clients last year, with an aggregate value of more than $12 billion, and released a very comprehensive report based on all that useful data.

title: Is AI a catalyst for disrupting HR? Insights from Personio's latest report
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: There is a feeling that a day does not pass that we do not hear the comment on the impact of AI in different fields of life and work. To be clear, AI definitely has an enormous impact, but what is more important is if and how it is going to be used.

title: Building the operating system for tomorrow’s frontline teams, Manchester-based Zaptic raises $10 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In the early 19th century, the city of Manchester was a manufacturing powerhouse and hub of global trade. Often labeled as the world's first industrial city, the implementation of scientific advancements and industrial practices set in motion in Manchester would forever change the face of the production of goods. Perhaps by chance, perhaps not, some 200 years later, Manchester is still upholding the tradition of fusing science and industry in Zaptic, a company that is aiming to change the face of manufacturing again; this time, digitally.

title: Generative AI is an “absolute game-changer” and will be as revolutionary as email, say experts, but they caution it will take time for fintechs to reap the benefits
author: John Reynolds
summary: In this podcast, we chat with Alexandra Mousavizadeh, an economist who benchmarks banks’ adoption of AI, and Christian Trummer, the co-founder and CTO of crypto company Bitpanda, about the potential of AI.

title: The Global Startup Ecosystem Report 2023 shows a year of challenges but also growth and resilience in Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Global Startup Ecosystem Report 2023 (GSER 2023) launched today in Amsterdam.

title: A Climate Tech Supercluster is breaking down information silos and connecting ecosystems in the fight against climate change
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A new Climate Tech collaboration has launched today at London Tech Week, bringing together key Climate Tech hotspots across the UK and Europe to promote, develop and scale climate-critical technologies at speed and scale.

title: Black Seed launches fund to back black British startup founders, holds first close at £5 million
author: Robin Wauters
summary: We all know black entrepreneurs, like women, have a ridiculously lower chance of raising venture capital for their startups than white people.

title: SVB UK laid to rest as HSBC Innovation Banking rises to ‘unlock new possibilities for UK innovation businesses’
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London Tech Week is the chosen location for the unveiling of HSBC Innovation Banking – born for the ashes of Silicon Valley Bank UK (SVB UK), which HSBC purchased for £1 in March 2023, and it includes newly formed innovation teams in the US, Israel and Hong Kong.

title: Belgium's Enersee does a rebrand, raises €1.2 million and uses AI to decarbonise offices, hospitals and industrial buildings
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Enersee, the Belgian energy management software start-up formerly known as Eneos, has raised €1.2 million in Seed funding. The round was led by Peak.

title: Five tips on coming together while working apart
author: Jonathan Bevan
summary: Communication of company performance, direction and vision has never been more important for businesses. Typical ways of working have shifted since the events of 2020, with hybrid being the most common working structure according to Techspace’s The Scaleup Culture Report 2023.

title: Bit2me gets a bit to itself as the crypto exchange raises €14 million to 'drive forward in Latin America'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Spanish crypto exchange Bit2me has raised €14 million in a funding round led by Investcorp, with participation from Telefónica Ventures, Stratminds, Cardano, and YGG.

title: A deep-tech fund for the Nordics and Baltics - Voima Ventures launches €90 million fund
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Nordic early-stage investor Voima Ventures has announced its first closing with a new €90 million fund. The fund will focus on deep-tech and science early-stage start-ups in the Nordic and Baltic regions. Initial investment ticket size ranging from €200K to €3 million and beyond.

title: Sweden's Freshsound raises fresh funding to the tune of €2 million
author: Fiona Alston
