summary: Stockholm-based Freshsound’s licensing platform allows entertainment and advertising companies access to licenced music. It uses pricing algorithms and recommendation solutions to help creators quickly access sounds relevant to their content while supporting music creators to make money from their music.

title: Helping agri-food companies measure, report, and reduce greenhouse gas emissions, Sweden’s Improvin’ germinates €3.5 million in seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based climatetech startup Improvin’ has raised €3.5 million in a seed funding round. The investment will allow the company to further develop its agri-food industry-focused sustainability performance platform as it prepares to roll out its services to the German, Belgian, French, and Dutch markets.

title: Setting European founders up to win
author: Eileen O’Mara
summary: It’s a tough time for European tech. Inflation is still high and startup funding has slowed. We’re clearly in a different economic climate, and whatever happens, in the months ahead, tech entrepreneurs are adapting for leaner times.

title: Qualitest has acquired US-based quality engineering company Q Analysts
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based Qualitest, a AI-powered quality engineering company has acquired US-based quality engineering company Q Analysts.

title: Impress acquires Diamond Whites in €30+ million deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Barcelona-based Impress has acquired the UK’s invisible aligner brand, Diamond Whites in a deal reportedly valued at over €30 million. The acquisition will now see digitally-led orthodontics provider Impress, (aka smile2impress) add oral care, whitening products, and cosmetic dental treatments, as well as have its offer on tap across some 60 cities across the UK.

title: Tech.eu Summit 2023 update: 10 new speakers, and online press accreditation is now open!
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Here we go again, meet the ten latest speakers to join the line-up for the upcoming Tech.eu Summit.

title: 10 European Space tech companies whose orbiting improves life on Earth
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The term “space tech” refers to any technology that supports or enables travel to space or activities conducted in space. These activities can be conducted with the aim of researching the not-so-known space, but also with the aim of using space technology to improve our everyday life here on terra firma.

title: Despite slowdowns in the European tech ecosystem, Finnish startups reached a new record in 2022
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Finnish Venture Capital Association (FVCA) has released its report on the state of the Finnish startup and VC ecosystem, aptly titled “Finnish Startups and Venture Capital 2022”. According to the report, over the last couple of years, the amount that Finnish startups are raising continues to grow, highlighted by the fact that over the past decade, this amount has increased tenfold.

title: Ireland's EdgeTier toasts €6 million and announces the creation of almost 50 jobs in the next two years
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dublin-based customer experience solution, EdgeTier is using AI to improve customer experience in call centres. Its SaaS solution gives real-time insights on customer conversational data using natural language processing to monitor customer conversations across all channels, 24/7, in multilingual environments.

title: Mediatech start-ups could bag up to €1 million in funding as Raw Ventures 'spots a gap in the market'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Mediatech ventures are being handed the opportunity to meet with industry leaders and potentially bag up to €1 million in funding, from Raw Ventures and other investors, by taking part in the Global MediaTech Pitch Day in Germany, part of MediaTech Hub Conference.

title: Net neutrality: a runway for startups
author: Inés Moreno-Alonso
summary: The European Commission has launched an exploratory consultation on “The future of the electronic communications sector and its infrastructure”, where it makes clear its intent to make Content Application Providers (CAPs) contribute to the cost of telecom networks in the form of a Network Fee.

title: Invest in Europe report: Record fundraising in 2022 as long-term investors step up support for European private equity and venture capital
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Invest in Europe's “Investing in Europe: Private Equity Activity 2022” research has shown that 801 European private equity, venture capital, and growth funds raised 30% more in 2022 compared to 2021 (€170 billion in 2022 compared to €131 billion achieved in 2021).

title: Felix Capital becomes Europe’s first B Corp certified VC with over $1 billion AUM
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based venture capital firm Felix Capital has received its B Corp certification with a score of 100.1. In doing so, it becomes the first VC firm in Europe with over $1 billion in AUM, $1.2 billion to be precise, to achieve this hallmark.

title: Mediahuis adds EU policy news brand Euractiv to its card of European publications
author: Fiona Alston
summary: European media group Mediahuis has acquired Euractiv, the pan-European news brand, focused on EU policy.

title: Scaling with soul: startups that find their ‘true fans’ will win in the passion economy
author: Taavi Kotka
summary: Operating an early-stage startup comes with enough challenges – you wouldn’t think having too many customers would be one of them. In reality, however, plenty of startups suffer from too many syndrome: too many products, too many channels and, yes, too many customers.

title: Supply chain risk platform Prewave continues to makes waves with a fresh €18 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Vienna’s AI-powered supply chain risk platform Prewave has raised €18 million in Series A+ funding round to help clients including BMW, PwC, and Lufthansa predict, find, understand, and categorise risks within supply chains.

title: UK's ESG accounts solutions start-up Omnevue raises $3.1 million in bid to become 'QuickBooks for ESG'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Eastbourne-based software engine, Omnevue (formerly ESGgen), has raised $3.1 million in Seed funding. The company provides an ESG accounting solution.

title: 8 innovative Startups to (re)discover in Paris at VivaTech 2023
author: Dan Taylor
summary: A sneak peek at the startups pushing the boundaries of tech. Take a tour of the startups exhibiting in VivaTech Innovation Parks.

title: Digital onboarding platform Product Fruits harvests €1.6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Prague-based digital onboarding platform Product Fruits has raised €1.6 million in a seed funding round. According to the company, the capital will be used to further fuel the company’s growth as it ramps up and further refines its sales teams and processes. Since late 2021 Product Fruits has now raised just north of €2 million.

title: Cutiss has skin in the space game with new study on the International Space Station
author: Fiona Alston
summary: This week saw the launch of a skin cell study head into space. The research mission saw a SpacePharma micro-lab, containing an experiment by Cutiss, travel to the ISS on SpaceX’s 27th commercial resupply mission (CRS-27) for NASA.

title: Europe’s second largest neobank, bunq now eyes the US market, applies for banking license
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Having gone quietly and not-so-quietly about its business of servicing customers for close to a decade now, Europe’s second-largest neobank, bunq is now eyeing the US market and has filed an application for a US banking license with the FDIC (Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation) in the state of New York.

title: UK government unveils space tech initiative
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A total of 18 space tech projects are to be funded by the UK government in a renewed growth funding initiative announced yesterday.

title: BlaBlaCar aims to up the ante on short-distance carpooling, looking to acquire Klaxit
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian ride-sharing company BlaBlaCar has made public its discussions of an acquisition with home-to-work carpooling startup Klaxit. While the deal is yet concluded, the addition of Klaxit to BlaBlaCar’s lineup would shore up the latter’s dominance in both long and short-distance carpooling.

title: Add another fraud fighter for the financial services sector list as ThreatFabric nets €11.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based provider of fraud detection solutions and intelligence ThreatFabric has raised €11.5 million in a seed funding round. The company intends to use the investment to further develop its fraud detection technologies, specifically incorporating those of behavioural-based detection techniques.

title: Using AI to reduce sales teams’ admin work, Epicbrief raises €1 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Helsinki-based Epicbrief has raised €1 million in a pre-seed funding round. The company plans to use the capital to support the further development of its administrative tasks automation platform aimed at sales professionals.

title: Filigran locks In €5m funding to expedite global expansion in cyber threat intelligence
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French cyber tech startup Filigran announced it had raised €5 million in seed funding. Not bad for a company that only launched in October 2022.

title: Market Pay acquires Polish fintech Novelpay to fuel its growth as a pan-European payments platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Market Pay has announced it has agreed a deal to acquire Polish fintech Novelpay and its French subsidiary PAX France Novelpay.

title: Scaling up embedded fintech and establishing joint-ventures as a go-to-market strategy: A chat with Colendi CEO (and Tech.eu Summit speaker) Bulent Tekmen
author: Robin Wauters
summary: We caught up with Colendi co-founder and CEO Bulent Tekmen to talk about all things embedded fintech and banking-as-a-service, the challenges and opportunities of banking on joint-ventures as a go-to-market strategy and a way to attract and retain core users, and his plans to take the Turkish-born company into more areas and geographies in the near future.

title: Welsh customer experience solutions firm Vizolution has been acquired by Lightico
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Welsh firm Vizolution has been acquired by Lightico. The Swansea-based customer experience solutions company's offering  and customer base will compliment Lightico's vision of becoming a global leader in B2B2C Digital Completion for the financial services and telecom industries.

title: Effy raising the roof on home energy renovations with a fresh €20 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French-based home energy renovation firm Effy has announced a €20 million led by Felix Capital. The new funding will be used to invest in their proprietary software platform, build their consumer brand and to launch new products and services.

title: Luxembourg’s Salonkee books itself €28 million to grow its team and salon management platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Luxembourg-based salon management solution, Salonkee has raised €28 million Series B round as it continues penetrating the European market. Fresh capital will see Salonkee innovate, expand and grow its suite of management tools for hair and beauty salons across Europe.

title: 🎙️Moving at angel speed without the traditional VC formality: Solo GP Sarah Drinkwater and her new £10 million fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: On this Drive at Five editione speziale the omnipresent community builder/angel investor/and now Solo GP, Sarah Drinkwater sits in to discuss her newly announced fund, Common Magic.

title: Helping companies reduce employees' financial worries, Equip raises €2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based fintech startup Equip has raised €2 million in a pre-seed funding round. The capital will be used to further develop the company’s platform as it moves forward with its goal of making employer support of team members' financial stability and well-being the norm.

title: FERNRIDE raises $31 million to scale operations and advance its teleoperated trucking platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German autonomous trucking company FERNRIDE announces it has raised $31 million in Series A funding.

title: AccelerComm’s signal gets supercharged with £21.5 million funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Southhampton-based IP company AccelerComm provides solutions which enable optimal performance of 5G radio access networks. It is used to correct mobile transmission errors caused by noise, interference and poor signal strength - popular among mobile operators, telecoms equipment vendors and satellite operators.

title: Trucksters shifts into high gear with €33 million series B funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Madrid-based company Trucksters announced a €33 million Series B investment.

title: This Week in European Tech: British EV startup Arrival gets $300 million lifeline, Augmenta bought for $110 million, AI AI and AI, Via buys Citymapper, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €750 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Blockchain-based, AI compute protocol Gensyn raises $43 million in a16z-led round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Gensyn has raised $43 million in a Series A funding round. The company offers a blockchain-based protocol that connects buyers and sellers of compute power, offering a cryptographic verification system to provide proof that the machine learning work sent has been completed correctly.

title: Valutico raises seven-figure sum for its business valuation software, helping asset managers get more precise
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Vienna's Valutico raised a seven-figure amount to refine its business valuations platform and recruit additional engineers and delivery staff.

title: Nexoya sheers $5 million from Blacksheep for MadTech tool
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swiss-German start-up Nexoya has raised $5 million Series A funding for its marketing analytics tool. It plans to expand into new markets like Italy and the UK, and grow its team with the injection of funds.

title: illimity Bank secures €50 million via EIF to help finance Italian SMEs
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The European Investment Fund has provided Milan’s illimity Bank with two guarantees totaling €50 million. The deal aims to promote access to capital for Italian SMEs, particularly those operating in the sustainability, innovation, and digital transformation sectors.

title: Good vibrations as Productive Machines raises £2.2 million for machine tool AI
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Sheffield-based Productive Machines, an AI start-up has raised £2.2 million in Seed funding to expand the reach of its advanced machine tool process optimisation technology. A spin out of The University of Sheffield, Productive Machines is commercialising its The University of Sheffield Advanced Manufacturing Research Centre (AMRC) six-year research project to a fully-automated Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) product.

title: Anything but normal, Supernormal phones in $10 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based AI platform that creates intelligent meeting notes, Supernormal has raised $10 million in a seed funding round that will see the company further expand its AI-driven offer whilst simultaneously upping the team headcount. Including this round, Supernormal has raised $12 million since late December 2020.

title: Report: August 2023 has been the best month yet for European tech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Although August is traditionally a slower deals activity month, some companies and investors took the opportunity to surprise us all with some big numbers and big headlines. In doing so, August now goes on record as the busiest month of the year in terms of total amounts of capital raised, collecting €6.8 billion across 307 deals.

title: PhotonVentures, a spinoff from PhotonDelta, reveals €60M fund for photonics industry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Looking to further catalyse the burgeoning European photonics industry, Eindhoven-based PhotonVentures has revealed its inaugural fund, raising €60 million in its debut financing round.

title: Circus enhances AI-crafted culinary offering with Aitme's robotics
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Circus, a Hamburg-based foodtech startup founded by former Flink co-founder Nikolas Bullwinkel, has successfully completed the acquisition of Aitme, a culinary robotics startup based in Berlin. Through the acquisition, Circus is taking a significant leap forward by incorporating Aitme's cutting-edge kitchen robotics technology into its operations. Terms of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: ArK Kapital brings another €100 million aboard, now offering €400 million in financing as it expands to Germany
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based ArK Kapital has announced that it’s secured another €100 million in presumably debt funding from a rather secretive Swedish bank. Could this be the same operator that contributed €150 million back in July of ‘22? ArK is being rather tight-lipped about it, but the wording around the “who?” question was remarkably similar to the last time I asked.

title: London's Arda Biomaterials raises £1.1 million to help you drink your beer and wear it too
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based cleantech startup Arda Biomaterials has raised £1.1 million in a pre-seed funding round aimed at fueling the company’s continued development of transforming waste feedstocks into biomaterials to be used in the fashion home goods, and automotive industries.

title: This Week in European Tech: Enpal raises €430 million in debt funding, Improbable sold its defence division, Yttrium raises €403 million fund, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1.1 billion (debt and equity), and over 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe Europe.

title: 'Higher education institutions are not agile enough' - can edtech step in to fill the gap?
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The European edtech sector is having 'a main character moment', and while Covid played no small part in its rise to fame, the ecosystems in Europe and the confidence in the sector through VC funding are playing their part to keep the 'swagger' in the sector.

title: Trustly acquires SlimPay for €70 Million to expand into recurring payments
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Trustly, a Stockholm-based global payments method has Parisian recurring payment collection startup SlimPay in a deal worth €70 million according to Bloomberg.

title: LAVOIE's acquisition of VanMoof is a positive change for the future of premium e-bikes
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: E-scooter maker LAVOIE, backed by global technology company McLaren Applied, has announced that it is acquiring the VanMoof e-bike business.

title: Parisian mental health platform Teale secures €10M for international growth
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Teale, a Parisian digital mental health platform, has raised €10 million in a series A funding round. The capital is aimed at expanding the company's offering beyond its home borders as well as ramping up its current team of 20 to a robust 80 by 2024.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five with Fiona Alston, Cate Lawrence, Dan Taylor and Robin Wauters - Episode 25
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Post-SVB drama, this week might just go down as the week that the world woke up to AI, as GPT-4 dropped, Microsoft and Google unleashed the beast, and people both cheered and feared.

title: The Climate Choice captures $2 million for decarbonising platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based climate tech start-up, The Climate Choice has closed a $2 million funding round which will go towards the further development and expansion of its Climate Intelligence Platform.

title: EU Commission launches blockchain innovation programme
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The European Commission is launching a regulatory sandbox to foster innovative blockchain use cases.(source).

title: Austria’s Finmatics puts AI in the hands of accountants, raises €6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Vienna-based fintech startup Finmatics, not to be confused with the field of finmatics that includes financial analytics, trading algorithms, and machine learning, has raised €6 million in a Series A funding round.

title: You say Klimato, I say Klimahto, let’s just call the whole thing a €4.2 million raise
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based Kilimato has raised €4.2 million in new capital that will help the climatetech startup enter news markets including Germany, France, and the US as it aims to become the de facto solution for sustainability services within the food sector.

title: Rydes helps companies offer employees a monthly mobility budget, raises €3.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Rydes has raised €3.5 million in a seed funding round. The startup provides companies with a platform aimed at offering employees a monthly mobility budget in lieu of having to submit expense forms after the fact. The seed capital will be used to further develop the platform as well as expand to other markets outside Germany.

title: PentoPix is transforming film making, using generative AI to turn long scripts into digital storyboards
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: These days you can't move without hearing the words AI, Chat GPT, and Stable Diffusion. But rest assured, behind the hype are real-world use cases for Generative AI that, when used commercially, solve persistent industry pain points. And an industry embracing the technology is filmmaking.

title: The biggest mistake companies are making when it comes to hybrid work
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: Three years on from the start of the pandemic and it’s safe to assume hybrid work isn’t going anywhere.

title: Investors back AskUI's unique approach to process automation with €4.3M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German prompt-to-automation platform AskUI announced €4.3 million in seed funding.

title: Arrival parks €279.3 million but things aren't looking good, Augmenta acquired for $110 million, and more than €750 million was invested in European Tech last week
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €750 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Ireland has a new sustainability accelerator programme and everyone's invited
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dublin-based start-up and innovation hub Dogpatch Labs has announced it has partnered with the Irish government and industry partners to create a new sustainability programme 2050 with a view to make Ireland a leading global platform in sustainability innovation.

title: Dublin's UrbanVolt gains €26M investment for solar services, plans further European expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: UrbanVolt, a Dublin-based LED retrofit lighting, and solar panel provider to commercial rooftops company, has secured a €26 million investment from Instabox and Swappie backer, Verdane. The capital is slated to be used to fuel further expansion across Ireland and the UK as well as enter new Continental European markets.

title: The hot new job that pays six figures: AI Prompt Engineering
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: You won’t get a prize for guessing that search interest in the term “will AI take my job” has rocketed over the past six months. At the end of July 2022, search interest for the term was at 21, but by the end of April this year, Google registered a search interest of 100––its highest ranking––for the term.

title: Unsure about Venture Debt? Hear from experts on how it works
author: Daniela Raffel Torrebiarte
summary: Venture Debt is having a moment. European and UK-based tech companies raised €30.5bn from debt last year, almost double the amount raised in 2021.

title: Novatron Fusion Group raises €5 million for fusion energy production
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Novatron Fusion Group, a Swedish startup working in the field of fusion energy production, has raised €5 million in a seed funding round. This round was led by Climentum Capital, in a collaborative effort with Industrifonden and Santander InnoEnergy Climate Fund, with KTH Holding and EIT InnoEnergy continuing their support. Including a previous seed round announced late last year, Novatron has disclosed a total of €8 million raised.

title: OneID secures £1M for bank-verified digital identification in UK
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today OneID, the UK’s only provider of bank-verified digital identification services, has secured £1 million in new funding from ACF Investors.

title: Cargofive is modernising freight forwarding with intuitive logistics software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today logistics software developers Cargofive announced a  €1.8 million funding round.

title: French start-up elba raises €2.5 million as it plans to take its cybersecurity platform international
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based start-up elba, a cybersecurity platform for teams, has raised €2.5 million in its first funding round. elba will use the funding to expand internationally and invest in research and development.

title: Phytonics has come up roses as it attracts a seed funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German start-up Phytonics, has closed a seed funding round which will help launch its PV module 'anti-reflective' coating to the market. The figure is undisclosed but said to be in the low seven figures.

title: Zunder banks €40 million loan to deploy fast charging on Spain's trans-European transport network
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Zunder, a Spanish operator of "ultra-fast" EV charging infrastructure, recently inked a €40 million loan deal with the European Investment Bank to fund a charging network along Spain's section of the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

title: Blinto raises €10.6 million for machinery platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swedish firm Blinto raised €10.6 million as it looks to enhance its machinery selling platform technology and expand across European markets

title: eCommerce pricing platform BlackCurve raises £750,000
author: Fiona Alston
summary: BlackCurve, an eCommerce pricing platform has secured £750,000 in funding to expand in its core online markets, as well as further driving down its cost of sale.

title: Aiming to enhance the performance of quantum processors, US/Ukranian startup Haiqu raises $4 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Split between operations in Lviv and San Francisco, Haiqu has raised $4 million in a pre-seed funding round. The startup is focusing on building “careful software for clumsy machines”, i.e. a software layer that can optimise the current state of quantum hardware. The round is aimed at further supporting the startups’ R&D efforts as well as pressing forward with go-to-market activities.

title: Spectrm brings conversational AI to messaging apps with its no-code platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Spectrm, makers of a social media conversation automation platform, announced a $6.5 million funding round.

title: B2B payments platform Sprinque adds €20 million bounce to its step
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based B2B payments platform Sprinque has raised a fresh €20 million in debt funding via Avellinia Capital. According to the company, the capital will be used to further expand its pay-by-invoice solution throughout Europe with an ability to finance up to €200 million in transactions per year.

title: FirstPartyCapital invests in Adimo to revolutionise shoppable ads and commerce media
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Scottish company Adimo announced a strategic partnership with early-stage venture capital firm FirstPartyCapital (FPC), specialising in adtech, martech, and digital media.

title: UK job vacancies remain steady as advertised salaries return to their post-pandemic peak
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Since the beginning of 2023, we've heard about a lot of layoffs within European startups. So one would expect that there is a higher demand for the jobs, compared to the offerings. The fact is that the jobs are being filled quickly and that there is continued strong demand in the economy rather than chronic shortages and jobs going unfilled.

title: No Label Ventures - the new VC Firm for immigrant founders
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based No Label Ventures launched today. It’s a VC firm doing European pre-seed and seed deals with immigrant founders and supporting them with visa requirements.

title: Advancing spacetech: ReOrbit raises $7.4M in seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today ReOrbit, a Helsinki-based leading provider of software-enabled satellites announced the completion of an oversubscribed Seed funding round for US $7.4 million.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five - TIER, Getir, AI oh my! Lilium, and updates on the Tech.eu Summit
author: Dan Taylor

title: Five things I learned using our startup’s product - and why other VCs should do the same
author: David Smith
summary: A couple of years ago, our VC fund launched a platform where startups could upload their internal data and receive an in-depth analysis – the kind we do during due diligence – but it soon ran into problems. The dashboard was difficult for founders to navigate, and we wanted a simple way to give them the most important insights from their data.

title: Mimetrik Raises £2M for AI-driven dental technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today dental tech company Mimetrik raises £2 million in seed funding.

title: Climate impacts are coming, let’s get excited about the solutions
author: Margarita Skarkou
summary: Climate solutions are significantly underfunded and under-prioritised by both the public and private sectors. Currently, only an estimated 16% of climate finance needs are being met, with early technology readiness solutions experiencing the largest funding deficits. Barring serious changes being made quickly, according to the IPCC’s latest synthesis report, the world is now likely to overshoot the Paris Agreement goal of limiting warming to 1.5°C.

title: French API security platform Escape raises €3.6 million and plans to double its team
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French API security platform Escape has raised €3.6 million which will allow the company's plans to double its team’s size, hire international sales specialists and engineers and develop new security features.

title: MatchWornShirt chills as Web3 player Chiliz acquires 20% stake
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based match-worn and signed sporting memorabilia platform MatchWornShirt has received an undisclosed amount investment from sports blockchain Chiliz that will see the latter take a 20% stake in the former.

title: Commodities data firm Kpler hauls a pair of marine freight trackers: MarineTraffic and FleetMon
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Kpler's commodity intelligence platform will be expanded following its acquisition of the marine vessel tracker MarineTraffic and the latter's subsidiary FleetMon. (source).

title: Ahead of its full-year analysis, Atomico dissects the current 'State of European Tech' in intermediate report for 2023
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Pan-European VC firm Atomico has been busy lately, opening new offices in Europe with new local hubs in Berlin and Stockholm and an expansion to its Paris office, adding a new partner and promoting others to partner level, all within six months after delivering its annual mammoth report on 'The State of European Tech'.

title: SumUp appoints a new CFO, Hermione McKee joins the fintech from Babbel
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Global payments platform for SMEs, SumUp has announced the appointment of Hermione McKee as Chief Financial Offer, she joins the firm from language learning platform Babbel.

title: A new Dutch-based secondary investment fund Arcven Capital is born
author: Fiona Alston
summary: There is a new secondary investment fund in town, well in Amsterdam. Arcven Capital is a Dutch-based fund aims to reach a total fund size of €80 million. Established to support tech start-ups at seed and growth stage, Arcven Capital focuses primarily on secondary market investments in the EMEA region.

title: Munich’s Yttrium closes new fund at over €400 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based VC firm Yttrium, formerly known as Digital+ Partners has closed its second growth fund at €403 million. The firm intends to remain true to the first iteration of the fund (which closed at €349 million in July 2018) and will continue supporting European B2B software and technology companies. According to the firm, a particular emphasis is placed on those operating in the industrial and financial sectors.

title: MeetFrank recruits Compensation app to provide real-time salary data
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Estonian recruitment firm MeetFrank has acquired salary data app Compensation.app.

title: Context.ai secures $3.5M funding to improve user experience in LLM powered products
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today product analytics platform for large language model (LLM) applications announced a successful $3.5 million funding round.

title: Romania’s e-fulfilment provider Helpship acquired by Bulgarian e-commerce logistics company euShipments.com
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Bulgarian e-commerce logistics firm euShipments.com has acquired Romania’s e-fulfilment provider Helpship in a deal that will ensure new cross-border shipping services, faster transit times to to outlying countries in the region.

title: How the European Champions Alliance is helping scaleups maintain and foster innovation in Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The European Investment Bank estimates that around 75% of European high-tech companies in their late-stage development are acquired by non-European firms.

title: Ireland has a new sustainability accelerator programme and everyone's invited
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dublin-based start-up and innovation hub Dogpatch Labs has announced it has partnered with the Irish government and industry partners to create a new sustainability programme 2050 with a view to make Ireland a leading global platform in sustainability innovation.

title: Sequoia-backed Bento boxed up by Linktree
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Bento has been acquired by category creator leader Linktree in a deal described as “a symbiotic relationship — a collaboration between an experienced category leader and a driven, curious upstart.” Terms, conditions, and figures remain undisclosed.

title: This Week in European Tech: Cash-strapped Lilium is raising $250 million, Getir may end up buying Flink, HV Capital closes €710 million fund, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €467 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: ‘I genuinely thought that the playing field was even when I lived as a man’ – Caroline Farberger is now aware of the disparities in business
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Caroline Farberger will be joining the conversation on the Access Denied: The high-stakes fight for a level playing field in Europe and beyond panel at this year's Tech.eu Summit on the 24th May 2023.

title: EV owners can benefit electricity price fluctuations with tado° Smart Charging
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German provider of energy management solutions for residential buildings tado° launched tado° Smart Charging, for home charging stations.

title: 🎙️ Sex, Money, Creative Equity, Travel, AI, and Jeff - the Drive at Five - Episode 35
author: Dan Taylor
summary: With the team finally recovered from anything and everything that was the Tech.eu Summit, we're back guns a-blazin'.

title: Printful adds Warner Bros. Discovery, NBCUniversal and more to client roster via Snow Commerce acquisition
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Latvian-founded Printful has acquired American e-commerce company Snow Commerce for an undisclosed figure. The move is aimed at further upping Printful’s presence in the enterprise sector, as Snow Commerce is a managed service provider for clients including Warner Bros. Discovery, and NBCUniversal.

title: Olympus acquires UK AI endoscopy company Odin Vision in ‘up to’ £66 million deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based Odin Vision, a Cloud AI endoscopy company has been acquired by Olympus Corporation (Olympus) for up to £66 million. The deal will see Olympus acquire Odin’s entire portfolio of AI solutions, giving Odin’s technology reach worldwide.

title: Improbable lets defence division go to NOIA Capital for undisclosed sum
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Improbable has sold its defence division to Brussels/Dubai/Luxembourg-based/registered NOIA Capital for an undisclosed sum.

title: Nuclivision' nuclear medicine AI platform raises Luminaires funding
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: When the grandfather of nuclear medicine discovered its first active molecule in the 1930s, he was unlikely to have foreseen the impact for patient outcomes in the 21st century.

title: UKG to acquire Irish global payments provider Immedis from CluneTech in deal worth upwards of €550 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: CluneTech, an Irish-based tech firm, which owns a host of tech solutions focused on simplifying global business, has come to an agreement with U.S. multinational UKG, to acquire its global payroll provider Immedis, in a deal said to be worth over €550 million.

title: Restructuring lifeline over for Rockley Photonics as it emerges from Chapter 11 with $35 million fresh funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The Oxford-headquartered photonics-based solutions company Rockley Photonics filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Q1 giving it protection do a comprehensive financial restructuring of the firm. Today it announced that period is over and it has and emerged from the tremulous time with a solid footing of approximately $35 million of additional funding from its stakeholders.

title: Amplifi Capital lands £50 million to ramp up UK’s credit union sector
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Amplifi Capital has secured £50 million in a debt funding deal with M&G. The fintech behind brands My Community Finance and Reevo Money aims to use the new capital to provide credit products to an estimated 20 million underserved UK customers that are unable to obtain credit from traditional high street banks via its unsecured personal loans.

title: London's GetHarley builds on its solid foundation with $52 million funding for 'healthier skin' platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based start-up GetHarley is helping consumers get healthier skin with its global online gateway to ‘world-class clinicians’ and medical grade skincare products. It matches customers with its 1000+ growing network of clinicians to offer skin consultations hosted on the GetHarley platform.

title: Trusted by Klarna, Miro, Airtable, Figma, and more, French business planning platform Pigment picks up $88 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian business forecasting platform that deals with business strategy in real-time, Pigment has raised $88 million in a Series C round. The company aims to use the fresh capital to promote further growth, notably by embarking on a recruitment drive that will see team member numbers increase by 25% across enterprise sales, partnerships, and product teams increase. Since late October 2019, Pigment has raised $248 million.

title: BMW i Ventures shifts €15 million DeepDrive’s way
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based DeepDrive has received a €15 million investment from BMW i Ventures in a Series A funding round. The juice is expected to help the company kick industrial production of its radial flux double rotor motor into high gear as the company embarks on a sustained recruitment drive in order to meet the increasing demand for its EV-focused powertrain systems.

title: 40% of companies in first 2023 EIC Accelerator are female led
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The European Innovation Council has announced 32 companies have been selected to receive European Innovation Council (EIC) funding in equity and grant funding of which 40% percent have a female CEO, CTO or CSO.

title: After seven years bootstrapped, IntegrityNext takes on €100 million via EQT Growth
author: Dan Taylor
summary: IntegrityNext has raised €100 million via EQT Growth in a round that will see the company leverage its investors' expertise and connections in order to solidify its market position in Germany. Additionally, IntegrityNext aims to expand its product offer in order to meet upcoming European regulations including Germany’s LkSG and the EU’s CSRD.

title: Do humans still matter, or will AI take your job?
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: From banks relying on machine learning to automate online processes and ensure information is encrypted and safe, to phishing scams and companies turning to chatbots over humans to make customer service more efficient and cost-effective, there are myriad ways artificial intelligence can be used to streamline processes that we have been relied on to provide in the past.

title: Sodium-ion battery developer Altris secures €4.8 million, appoints new CEO and CFO
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Swedish sodium-ion battery developer Altris has secured €4.8 million in a bridge financing transaction, announced in conjunction with the appointment of Björn Mårlid as the company’s new CEO and Christer Berguvist as new CFO.

title: Portugal's Zypho is acquired by Ailaxis as it gives Seedrs investors a happy retreat with a 3.8x return
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Portuguese start-up Zypho, whose technology sits underneath a bath or shower and recovers heat from waste water, improving the efficiency of showers by 30-75%, has been acquired by water and energy management solutions company Ailaxis.

title: UK influence analytics company WeArisma raises £2.5 million to help brands optimise their earned media
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based influence analytics platform WeArisma has raised £2.5 million to establish its brand discoverability and earned influence analytical tool. The platform is like a social media search engine for brands showing them how well their influence ranks on popular media. WeArisma helps brands find out their Earned Brand Influence Value (EBIV).

title: Spanish startup Jeff never closed a €90 million round, hasn’t paid employees for nine months, and is now filing for bankruptcy
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Valencia-based entrepreneurship-for-all startup Jeff has voluntarily filed for bankruptcy according to a report first filed by Jesus Martinez at La Información.

title: Quinky digitises sex-ed for Gen-Z with a pleasure-packed gamified app
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Dutch sex-ed startup Quinky announces an early-stage funding round of €100k. The company aims to become "the Duolingo" for sex for Gen-Z folks over 18 years with a gamified sex education app.

title: Joining up journeys, Amsterdam's Transferz lures €6.5 million for transfer booking APIs that let travel agencies book reliable transport
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Netherlands-based transfer booking software company Transferz recently collected €6.5 million to continue its global growth trajectory.

title: What 2022 meant for VC – a necessary readjustment triggered by global events
author: Naureen Zahid
summary: Over the last year, the Venture Capital (VC) space has experienced enormous tumult. 2022 saw a sharp decline in start-up valuations and VC investment, especially within the growth stages; waves of layoffs; and the collapse of numerous businesses, including those that had previously seemed strong.

title: 10 European edtech companies that are reimagining how we learn
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: As individuals, the way we learn and acquire knowledge is unique. What works for one doesn't always work for another. That's why edtech tools provide a wide spectrum of possibilities and creativity in the process of creating individualised lesson plans and learning experiences, which through their adaptability should stimulate and boost the learning capabilities of everyone.

title: The future of insurtech is embedded, seamless, and effortless
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: I never thought much about insurance until I moved to Germany and discovered that if I lost my house keys, I would be required to replace a new front door key for every person in the building, which could cost thousands.

title: How can developers train AI models without violating copyright?
author: Victor Botev
summary: To build a large language model (LLM), you need hundreds of terabytes (if not petabytes) of training data. But where do you, as a developer, get all this data? And once you've built your model, how can you be sure that you don't get hit with a lawsuit if it turns out that you've unknowingly used copyrighted or inaccurate data?

title: Checking in with 'climate fintech' scale-up Doconomy: An interview with CEO Mathias Wikström
author: Robin Wauters
summary: We caught up with Mathias Wikström, CEO of Sweden's Doconomy, to learn more about its platform to measure climate and social impact in the financial services industry.

title: Chargetrip enroute to the US with €10 million Series A fund
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Amsterdam-based, Chargetrip has raised a €10 million Series A to fund its expansion into the US and to take its range prediction and EV routing technology in to the commercial fleets market.

title: Deep Render renders even deeper with a fresh $9 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based media compression algorithm maker Deep Render has raised $9 million in new funding. According to the company, if video content platforms (Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.) used Deep Render technology, it would save them billions a year in content delivery costs, while video chat apps (Zoom, MS Teams) could give consumers a higher video quality experience without additional costs.

title: HV Capital closes new fund at €710 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: When thinking about triumphant ninth works, Beethoven and Mahler immediately spring to my mind. And now it would appear that Munich’s HV Capital are lining up to have their go at this tradition with its ninth fund closing at €710 million.

title: Polish FEaaS Vue Storefront raises $20 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Vue Storefront, the Polish founded frontend solution for e-commerce platforms, has raised $20 million to enable rapid global expansion.

title: UK's graphene device manufacturer Paragraf acquires San Diego’s Cardea Bio
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Cambridgeshire UK-based graphene device manufacturer Paragraf has acquired San Diego-based Cardea Bio makers of a graphene biosensor.

title: Engineering Intelligence platform Spread butters up to $16 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Spread has raised $16 million in a Series A funding round. Since its founding in 2019, Spread’s bread and butter has been the automotive sector, however, the new capital will be used to further develop the platform’s capabilities as it expands into new industries.

title: Simplifying the process of linking data, simulations, and AI, Quaisr raises $3.1 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Quaisr has raised $3.1 million in a pre-seed funding round. The ​​Imperial College London and Alan Turing Institute spinout is building the building blocks of digital twins with a particular focus on the heavy industry space. The funding is expected to help the company expand its team size, focusing on business development and engineering positions.

title: This Week in European Tech: GetYourGuide gets $194 million, SellerX buys and raises, Spain's Jeff goes bankrupt, Monzo and Tandem hit profitability, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked 80 tech funding deals worth over €1.2 billion (debt and equity), and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Finland’s MVision AI raises €5.4 million for AI-powered Cancer treatment planning platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish scale-up MVision AI, a cloud-based software service provider for radiotherapy treatment planning, has announced it raised €5.4 million to scale its service globally.

title: ‘Revolut is growing at almost one million customers per month’ says Storonsky as Revolut hits over 30 million users
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based neobank Revolut has announced it has surpassed 30 million users which is good news for it but not so good news for those of us desperately trying to invite new friends and family on the platform so we can get our 'reward' of €40/50/60 when they start spending through the app - with rising numbers our opportunities are getting slimmer!

title: The Tech.eu Summit 2023 in images
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It never ceases to amaze me - a conference takes close to a year to properly plan and execute and then as soon as the closing remarks are delivered, it all seemingly packs up and ships out the door in a matter of hours. The same is true of family dinners and surprise birthday parties now that I think about it. But I digest.

title: Squaring the circle on recycled batteries, Germany's cylib extends seed round out to €11.6 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Aachen-based cylib recently secured an €8 million extension to its seed round, bringing its total for the round to €11.6 million.

title: Integrating ESG into the deal lifecycle
author: Guest Writer
summary: As the regulatory landscape continues to evolve, integrating Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) considerations for new investment deals has become an increasingly imperative consideration for private equity firms. The term ESG has become a regular feature in business vocabulary. It is no longer just a matter of abstract compliance for private equity but also a strategic imperative for driving value. Transparent reporting of ESG measures is crucial to ensure fairness and accountability, and positively impacts the deal lifecycle for all.

title: Social fitness app GoJoe bags a sports star and £1.2 million in its Seed round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based social fitness app, GoJoe announce a seed round of £1.2 million, add another sports star to its investor list and prepare to internationalise its B2B SaaS product.

title: With a spring in their step, Sprinque bounds forward with a fresh €6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based B2B payments platform Sprinque has raised a fresh €6 million in seed funding. According to the company, the capital will be used to further expand its pay-by-invoice solution throughout Europe. Since early 2021 the startup has raised approximately €7.8 million.

title: Sunmaxx takes in €3.3 million for combination PV-thermal solar panels
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Sunmaxx, a startup based out Dresden, has raised funds totalling €3.3 million to drive take up of its solar panels which use photovoltaics and thermal energy to simultaneosuly pump heating and electricity into distribution grids.

title: Weavr weaves in B2B open banking platform Comma
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based fintech Weavr has confirmed the acquisition of B2B open banking platform, Comma Payments - according to Weavr it's a first-of-its-kind deal within the world of embedded finance.

title: Peppercorn debuts insurance chatbot powered by conversational AI
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UK startup Peppercorn has confirmed a product launch in the insurance sector with its chatbot assistant driven by conversational AI, using natural language processing to answer common customer queries.

title: London-based financial literacy platform Beurzbyte raises £2.2 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-based retail investment education platform Beurzbyte is announcing its pre-seed fundraise, tying down £2.2 million from angel investors to deliver on its "video-first" educational and investment marketplace.

title: Planner 5D unveils an AI Design Generator that builds on Stable Diffusion to transform interior design in seconds
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: One needs to only glance at the startup news to see just an inkling of the flood of emerging companies using Generative AI to transform the digital landscape.

title: SMPnet raises $1.4 million as it puts the power back in to grid operators hands
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based SMPnet has raised a $1.4 million to bring its power grid technology to markets in the US and Europe. Currently with teams in Scotland and England, the real-time control software helps traditional power grids deal with 'untraditional' methods, including renewable energy, change in flows and storage. The company will use funds to accelerate business development and inject some energy into its marketing and business development efforts.

title: Looking at worn down rocks to capture more CO2, InPlanet closes out €1.2 million pre-seed
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Germany/Brazil-HQed InPlanet is looking at the use of enhanced rock weathering, a chemical reaction that could enable large-scale CO2 removal from the atmosphere.

title: Crowdtesting platform Testbirds lands seven-figure revenue-based financing investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based Testbirds has secured a seven-figure investment from Vienna’s Round2 Capital, a revenue-based financing provider. Testbirds says that the new capital will be used to further expand its customer base.

title: Green hydrogen can Jolt into action as Barcelona start-up raises €6 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Barcelona-based start-up Jolt is ‘revolutionising’ electrode production with its patented catalytic coating technology. It is making the manufacturing of electrodes more cost and energy efficient.

title: Bettermaps takes on the Titans, raises €200,000 in pre-seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oviedo, Spain-based digital mapping platform Bettermaps has raised €200,000 in a pre-seed round via sever undisclosed angel investors. The investment round is aimed at supporting the company’s continued growth, namely through the expansion of the sales and marketing teams, as it ramps up the customer acquisition phase of its journey.

title: UK's Cur8 raises £5.3 million in its bid to accelerate the carbon removals industry
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based Cur8 is in the business of curating the best carbon removal portfolios to help companies make the best decisions over how they spend their money solving the climate crisis. The founding team of Marta Krupinska, Dr Gabrielle Walker and Mark Stevenson are firm believers that carbon removal and decarbonisation at scale is the key to global industries meeting their net-zero commitments by 2050.

title: InsuranceGPT will take over your claims process thanks to Norway’s Simplifai
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Oslo-based Simplifai is bringing AI to the the insurance industry through what it is claiming is 'a world-first custom-built GPT tool', Simplifai InsuranceGPT. The AI automation solutions provider has developed a no-code large language model (LLM) trained specifically on information directly relevant to the insurance sector.

title: Beem beams in €20 million to help European homes better manage energy with its DIY solar panels
author: Dan Taylor
summary: French solartech startup Beem has raised €20 million in a Series A funding round (€7 million + €13 million, see below) that will see the company accelerate operations. In contrast to the number of solartech startups we’ve seen blossom across Europe in as many months, those that require a professional installation, Beem is offering consumers a DIY solar panel solution.

title: This Week in European Tech: EU and UK unveil new rules for Big Tech, Founders Forum Group acquires Tech Nation assets, Virta picks up €85 million, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: This German freight rail carrier has an automated system for loading truck wagons
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: A German rail freight operator has introduced new technology allowing freight wagons to be loaded from trucks onto railway carriers without entering via specialised loading terminals.

title: Unlocking the potential of iGaming businesses with GR8 Tech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: 2022 was an astonishing year in the iGaming industry, which includes online betting and gambling. And there are no signs of its growth stopping in 2023, especially in Europe – the largest iGaming market in the world. Accounting for 49% of the global industry market, Europe has become a real iGaming hub, mainly due to the nature of the industry regulations and how certain governments approach the sector's growth.

title: Europe kicks off new support measures to help (future) deep tech innovators scale up their businesses
author: Robin Wauters
summary: The European Commission kicked into gear a fresh initiative on Thursday to help 100 unicorns scale up to become Europe's deep tech champions and help achieve the EU's digital and green objectives.

title: Money for martech and adtech as FirstPartyCapital and Astus announce a primarily UK-focused partnership
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based early-stage VC FirstPartyCapital(FPC) and global corporate barter company Astus have announced a partnership which sees a new investment portfolio focus on accelerating adtech and martech solutions in the UK and around the world.

title: Talis brings the tally to $175 million with third fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The UK-based VC Talis Capital, which has invested in Darktrace, Onfido, iwoca, Pirate Studios, Luminance, Threads, Ynsect, and Oh MyGreen, has raised $175 million in its third fund to invest in both European and US startups from seed stage to Series A stage. Tickets will be issued up to $10 million, with average investments ranging somewhere between $2 million and $7 million. Talis reports that 50% of the fund is reserved for follow on investments.

title: Elyn’s try-before-you-buy service checks out as it raises €2.5 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French try-before-you-buy (TBYB) service Elyn has raised €2.5 million in a pre-seed round led by Headline and Sequoia’s Arc programme.

title: TextMagic has acquired Voog in a €1.1 million deal as it begins to build out a B2B SaaS products portfolio
author: Fiona Alston
summary: In an all Estonian deal, business SMS platform provider TextMagic AS has acquired website building platform Voog in an all cash deal worth €1.1 million. The deal marks the first acquisition by Textmagic as it begins to build out a portfolio of SaaS products, vying for the position of a market leader.

title: Removing the multiples, Ireland’s NomuPay nomz nomz on $53.6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Dublin-headquartered payment platform NomuPay has raised $53.6 million in a new investment round co-led by Finch Capital and Outpost Ventures.

title: Weev to install thousands of EV charging points in Northern Ireland with up to £50 million funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belfast-based EV charging points start-up Weev will begin the roll-out of thousands charging points as it secures up to £50 million in funding from Octopus Investments (part of Octopus Group).

title: Kuai Commerce closes in on Chinese e-commerce market with $2.4 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Kuai Commerce has raised $2.4 million in a pre-seed funding round. The startup, which takes its name from the colloquial term for the Chinese Yuan, will use the capital to further develop and launch its e-commerce solution aimed at helping Western merchants take their wares East.

title: Getting the scaries from DALL-E and ChatGPT, ElectricNoir launches generative AI-powered mobile game
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Mobile game studio ElectricNoir has a pretty intriguing product launch announcement today. It's debuting its latest horror-themed mobile game Dark Mode, following on the heels of its BAFTA-award nominated release, Dead Man's Phone. This time it has generative AI doing the artwork and writing some of the script's fear factor.

title: Belgian startup Cumul.io banks €10 million for low-code SaaS analytics platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cumul.io, a Belgian startup that bills itself as ‘the building block’ for dashboards inside other SaaS applications, has raised €10 million in a Series A funding round in order to “capture global demand”.

title: Aikido Security raises €2 million to help developers up software defenses
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Ghent-based Aikido Security has raised €2 million in a pre-seed round. Having completed an alpha version of the product, the funding is slated to  see the company further develop the features list alongside plans to grow both the team size and customer base.

title: Accel intends to SLAY it, leads €2.5 million pre-seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The Berlin-based social network aimed at promoting positive interactions for teens online through playful, social gaming experiences SLAY has raised €2.5 million in a pre-seed funding round. According to the fledgling company, the capital will be used to officially launch the app publicly,  further develop the platform and launch in additional markets, all the while supporting an ongoing recruitment drive.

title: What are durable skills and do tech workers need them?
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: Amalia

title: The Moke rides again as Kate launches through the acquisition of NoSmoke
author: Dan Taylor
summary: There are designers and manufacturers of automobiles, and then there are the French. With designs ranging from the iconic Citroën 2CV and DS, to the Renault Espace F1, to, well, just about anything Peugeot turns out, when it comes to cars, the French have always provided the world with a decidedly different take on four-wheeled transportation.

title: Swobbee snags another €2 million to take its battery rental operations and charging infrastructure to new markets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based Swobbee, a provider of rental batteries and battery swapping stations for urban mobility, has raised another €2 million in an extended Series A round.

title: Change Ventures updates Baltic Startup Funding Report, region growing but slowing
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Complimenting the Lithuania-specific data released today, Tallinn-based Change Ventures has released the February 2023 update of their semi-annual Baltic Startup Funding Report. The firm compiles data by tracking all venture funding round news in the region and after reaching out to founders in confidence gathers and tabulates valuation and other investment terms for pre-seed and seed rounds.

title: Estonian remotely controlled EV technology developer Elmo raises €2.6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Tallinn-based developer of tech for remotely controlled cars Elmo has raised €2.6 million in a funding round. Via the investment, the company plans to speed up the licensing of its remote control technology in foreign markets as well as expand the team size.

title: Finnish startup Montinutra transforms forest waste into sustainable personal care ingredients
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Most of Europe's forests are in Finland, covering over 70 percent of the land area. The forest industry plays a crucial role in the Finnish economy and now there is more emphasis on how renewable raw materials can replace fossil-based materials.

title: Climate X's digital twin of the world gives companies no excuse to ignore climate change
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Floods are the most common and most costly natural disasters in Europe. They are becoming more frequent due to climate change and have devastating effects, endangering lives and leading to heavy infrastructural and economic losses.

title: Qflow captures $9.1 million to further decarbonise the construction industry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based startup Qflow, aka Qualis Flow, has raised £7.2 million (~$9.1 million) in a Series A funding round. The new timber will be used to help the company build up its presence in both the US and Australian construction markets as well as press forward with UK operations. Since 2018 the company has raised in excess of $12.4 million.

title: Istanbul's WePlay Ventures has launched an acceleration program for gaming start-ups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The Istanbul-based gaming VC WePlay Ventures has launched, what it claims is, Europe’s largest game acceleration programme. The three-month programme will train game studios in game development and give them investment opportunities.

title: Dogpatch Labs has launched a new accelerator programme picking individuals over ideas
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dogpatch Labs, in the fair city of Dublin, are looking for 40 skilled individuals to join its matchmaking programme 'Founders' to create the next cohort of Irish co-founders – ‘focussing on people first and ideas second’. The group will be made up of 50/50 business backgrounds and technical/engineering experts.

title: Mobility data platform Vianova enters the UAE as it gets Abu Dhabi call up
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based mobility data platform Vianova is the chosen partner of Integrated Transport Centre Abu Dhabi, providing insights and data of micro-mobility usage across the city.

title: Quantum computer operating system builder Riverlane raises £15 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cambridge-based quantum engineering company Riverlane has raised £15 million in a Series B funding round. The new capital will help Riverlane continue work on its Deltaflow.OS solution, and according to the company is expected to see the company through to a cash flow break-even point. Since mid-2019, Riverland has raised approximately £34 million.

title: Woodoo raises $31 million to transform wood to the strength of steel
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based biotech Woodoo is using low-grade wood products and turning them into ‘premium high-tech materials’. It has raised $31 million to scale its technology platform - scaling from luxury goods to commodity building materials which it claims ‘outperform steel and concrete in strength, weight, look, and cost’.

title: Tech.eu Summit 2023: Announcing 10 new speakers, last chance to get early-bird tickets, and startups should apply now!
author: Robin Wauters
summary: A little over 40 days to go before the next edition of our flagship event on all things European tech startups and VC, and the Tech.eu Summit is shaping up quuuuuuite nicely thank you very much.

title: Can startups solve the urban housing shortage with co-living?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Plan a move to a new city; the first issue for many is not where to rent but what you can get. Urban migration is colliding with the failure of many cities to invest in an adequate housing supply to meet the number of residents. Or lax local laws mean higher yield Airbnbs smother the residential rental market.

title: Pitchbook's data is out, it says VC funding retreated a little last year
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Pitchbook's annual dataset shows that venture capital for European ecosystems was slightly lower last year, declining to EUR 91.6 billion from a record high of EUR 108.9 billion in calendar year 2021.

title: Penta founder Lav Odorovic’s newest venture Relio raises €3 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Zurich-based fintech startup Relio has raised €3 million in a funding round aimed at supporting the launch of a digital payment account for business customers. The Swiss company is led by CEO Lav Odorovic, who previously founded Penta, a neobank for SMEs in Germany that has since been acquired by Qonto.

title: More crypto beckons for German neobank N26
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Crypto trading is to be offered to N26 customers in five new EU markets, following the service's formal European launch last year.

title: Wallbox announces cost reduction programme, cuts 15 percent of workforce
author: Dan Taylor
summary: During an earnings call Barcelona-based publicly listed provider of residential and public electric vehicle charging and energy management solutions, Wallbox announced measures to reduce costs to “better align with its 2023 full-year guidance”.

title: Belgium's Whale raises €2.5 million to solve ‘leaky bucket syndrome’ issues in growing businesses
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The Ghent-based start-up Whale has raised €2.5 million for its knowledge sharing and employee SaaS platform. Funds raised will fuel the growth of the platform - and its recent AI integration - in Europe and throughout the US, while scaling its own team.

title: Huel on the hook with Advertising Standards Authority, again
author: Dan Taylor
summary: According to a filing initially reported by the BBC, Highland Europe portfolio company Huel has had an advertisement run on Facebook in August and September 2022 banned due to being misleading.

title: New Dealroom data reveals Lithuania's startup ecosystem growing 4x CEE average
author: Dan Taylor
summary: According to Dealroom data, the enterprise value of the Lithuanian startup ecosystem grew 16.8x between 2017 and 2022, 4.2 times the average for the CEE region, and reached a total of €9.5 billion.

title: Carbon accounting platform CarbonChain welcomes $10 million in new funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based carbon accounting platform CarbonChain has raised $10 million in a Series A funding round. As to be expected in a Series A round, the capital will be used to help the company scale, both in terms of developing new products as well as expanding its customer base and team size.

title: Period tracking startup Clue is bleeding staff and cuts its workforce by 25 percent
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The pain of maturation and profitability has hit another startup. Yesterday Clue, the creator of a period and fertility tracking app, announced a reduction in staffing.

title: Despite robust turnover, UK online auto marketplace Cazoo has scaled back sales projections
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: New York-listed, UK-based online car marketplace Cazoo has had to radically scale back projected sales volumes for the next 12 months, and will make redundancies in an effort to trim its cost base.

title: Voi takes the hit; valuation sinks 63%
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Swedish micromobility and scooter rental provider Voi has suffered a reduction in the value of its share capital, according to the latest information from one of its investors. (Nordic media originally provided a second figure for the valuation, but this couldn't be corroborated.)

title: Motovolt and eROCKIT take a tandem ride as the Indian e-mobility firms puts its faith in the German engineering with over €10 million deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: eROCKIT, the German mobility company producing electric push bikes that take on the persona of a moped or light motor cycle, this week revealed it has done a deal with Indian e-mobility company Motovolt. Motovolt has acquired a stake in eROCKIT AG and is investing €1 million in the German stock corporation, while investing €10 million in the construction of an eROCKIT production facility in India.

title: Britishvolt files to appoint administrators
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It's not been a few easy days for London-based would-be EV battery maker Britishvolt as reports are now arriving that after a mad dash to secure a last-minute buyer to hold off a collapse, the company is now filing to appoint administrators, a process that puts in place a statutory moratorium and allows a company some ‘breathing space’ that frees a company from creditor enforcement actions, while financial restructuring plans are prepared to rescue the company as a going concern where possible.

title: Ventures Thrive ramps up CEE accelerator drive
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Applications have now opened for the inaugural cohort of CEE-focused deep tech accelerator Ventures Thrive.

title: How European start-ups can capitalise on the accelerating data economy
author: Tom Henriksson
summary: To understand data is to understand technology. Data is at the heart of today’s tech-driven world. There is more of it than ever before and it is growing fast. By 2025, there is expected to be 463 exabytes of data created every day around the world – the equivalent of 212,765,957 DVDs per day. Businesses are increasingly prioritizing putting data at the heart of everything they do: one recent survey found 83% CEOs want a data-driven organization.

title: Natix raises $3.5 million to build Natix Network: a blockchain-based worldwide crowdsourced camera network
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Hamburg-based Natix Network, a decentralised network of cameras creating real-time maps of cities, has raised $3.5 million in Seed funding to launch its first mobile app Drive& and build its team while developing the network.

title: PropTech1 Ventures tops out at €44 million in first close
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based PropTech1 Ventures, who, as one might imagine specialise in proptech investments have raised €44 million in the first close of their second fund. The news follows September’s announcement of €30 million (of a targeted €100 million), in commitments from early launch partners.

title: All lit up in Times Square: Galdana Ventures raises third venture fund and hires Nasdaq billboard to get ad time
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Galdana Ventures, the venture capital unit of private asset manager AltamarCAM Partners, is unveiling its third venture capital fund aimed at raising above $700 million.

title: From founder to funder, Steven Barlett launches $100 million fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Most well-known as the youngest-ever investor to appear on the long-running BBC show Dragons' Den, Steven Bartlett has launched a $100 million fund aimed squarely at supporting the next round of European startup success stories.

title: Cleaning HR SaaS company Fortytools joins Zvoove Group
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: German HR SaaS company Zvoove Group has acquired Fortytools, a commercial cleaner SaaS startup based in Ahrensburg, Germany.

title: Frontline staff comms company Sona has bought mobile messaging app Yapster
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Sona, a UK HR software platform tailored to frontline personnel management, has bought the UK-based occupational mobile messaging app Yapster.

title: Dutch legal search platform Bluetick gets acquired
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Amsterdam-based legal search and context platform Bluetick was recently acquired by The Hague-HQed law specialists Sdu, a subsidiary of Europe-wide law services outfit Lefebvre Sarrut.

title: New Dealroom data reveals Lithuania's startup ecosystem growing 4x CEE average
author: Dan Taylor
summary: According to Dealroom data, the enterprise value of the Lithuanian startup ecosystem grew 16.8x between 2017 and 2022, 4.2 times the average for the CEE region, and reached a total of €9.5 billion.

title: Octopus Ventures helps Skin & Me dial it down with £10 million cash infusion
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Skin + Me, a UK-based teledermatology service that lets customers tend to skin disorders virtually, has raised £10 million of series B funds.

title: Centuro raises £3.3 million to expand its platform - helping companies expand to new markets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The world of work has changed, and coupled with the world becoming a much 'smaller' places - the chances are, if you are in businesses these days, you are either vying for a global reach or your employees are scattered further than your doorstep - either way businesses need to know the local regulations in foreign lands.

title: Bitwarden buys up passwordless authentication company Passwordless.dev
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Passwordless.dev, a Malmö, Sweden-based passwordless authentication startup, has joined forces with Bitwarden, an open source password management company based out of California, following an acquisition by Bitwarden closed recently.

title: London’s Soundmouse acquired by Orfium
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based music cue sheet reporting and audio recognition service Soundmouse has been acquired by Orfium. While the financials behind the deal remain undisclosed, according to Orfium, the acquisition is set to “solve the entertainment industry’s most complex challenges” and “revolutionise digital music and broadcast rights management”.

title: Bayer swoops Edinburgh university spinout Blackford Analysis
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Pharmaceutical giant Bayer has agreed to acquire Blackford Analysis, a strategic imaging AI provider to radiology labs that's worked alongside Bayer previously.

title: London e-bike sharing operator HumanForest cycles home £12 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based e-bike sharing startup HumanForest has raised £12 million in a Series A funding round aimed at solidifying the company’s market position. Since late 2020, HumanForest has raised £17.4 million.

title: With its fully automated fulfillment solution, Bratislava-based Brightpick extends Series B to $40 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bratislava-based robotic vision and intelligence maker Photoneo, the parent company of Brightpick has added $19 million to an already healthy $21 million Series B round bringing the total to $40 million. The capital is aimed at accelerating the pace of deployment and presence of its fully automated fulfillment solution in the ever-lucrative US market. Since its founding in 2013, the startup has raised approximately $53 million.

title: Cleaning up space debris, Switzerland’s ClearSpace closes €26.7 million round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Renes, Switzerland-based ClearSpace has raised €26.7 million in a Series A funding round. The injection burn is slated to help propel the startup in its continuing mission to keep space free of junk, and presumably operational objects operating.

title: 20 European tech start-ups making a difference this Earth Day
author: Fiona Alston
summary: It's Earth Day so we are highlighting 20 of the brilliant European tech start-ups who are making an impact on the climate crisis by doing what they do best - tech stuff.

title: CampX focuses on fintech as Volvo Group looks to cultivate more transformation in the transport industry
author: Fiona Alston
summary: CampX by Volvo Group says it has recently expanded its innovation focus areas to include financial technology, or fintech.

title: Keeping the turbines turning, Latvia’s Aerones raises $30 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Riga-based robot-enabled wind turbine maintenance and inspection startup Aerones has raised $30 million in Series A round. According to the company, this fresh capital will be used to further up the number of field-deployed robot service teams, expand its presence in Africa and Australia, and bring new services to market, all the while growing its technical and sales functions.

title: Debt refinance provider Anyfin raises €30 million
author: Callum Cyrus
