summary: PandasAI, a German startup that’s building a conversational AI assistant for data analysis, has raised $1.1 million in a Pre-Seed funding round. Operating as a solo organisation thus far, the investment is slated to help founder Gabriele Venturi to engage in a hiring spree in order to scale the business.

title: PASQAL, Pixel Photonics, and partners win EIC grant for a photonic quantum processor powered by neutral atom technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today a partnership between PASQAL, Pixel Photonics, Sorbonne Université, The Institute of Photonic Sciences, and Institut d'Optique Théorique et Appliquée has successfully won a grant from European Innovation Council (EIC) Pathfinder to build the essential foundations for a quantum computer powered by neutral atom technology.

title: UK quantum spinout Universal Quantum publishes new data
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Universal Quantum, a UK-based quantum computer developer, recently published new scientific data on its scalable trapped-ion quantum architecture for connecting quantum qubits across multiple computer microchips.

title: The Aioi R&D Lab Oxford builds an AI-future for insurance
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI company Mind Foundry announced a new research lab in Oxford, England, in partnership with the global insurance brand Aioi Nissay Dowa Insurance (ANDI) and Aioi Nissay Dowa Europe (AND-E), a wholly-owned subsidiary of ANDI.

title: Spain's Codee raises €5M to expand automated code performance testing platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Spanish software development platform Codee has raised a €5 million funding round. The round was led by Swanlaab Venture Factory and includes participation from existing investors Caixa Capital Risc, Unirisco, Xesgalicia, Armilar, and Kfund. The funding will allow Codee to expand its customer base and additionally fuel the continuous build of its platform for testing automated code performance.

title: Mistral AI raised €105 million, Wargraphs was acquired for €50 million, and more than €1 billion was invested in European Tech last week
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and over 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Barcelona-based inari raises $5.2M to expand its team and explore new markets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Barcelona-based insurtech startup inari has raised $5.2 million in a Seed funding round led by Caixa Capital Risc, through Criteria Venture Tech, alongside CDTI, a public organisation for technology development in Spain, and an undisclosed leading industry partner. The dunds will enable inari’s longer-term growth strategy which, according to the startup, involves the expansion of its teams in both London and Barcelona, the development of more features to add to its (re)insurance offering, and new market entries.

title: BioCorteX raises $5 million to unlock drug-bacteria interactions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based bio-tech BioCorteX has raised $5 million in Seed funding. The funds will be used to further develop the company's Carbon Mirror platform which is a computer simulation to understand drug-bacteria interactions which hopes to improve a person's response to treatments.

title: Building the go-to-market CRM engine, London's Attio recharges with $23.5 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: With its no-code CRM interface, London's Attio is attempting to address decades-old architecture without undermining actual business utility from the underlying customer data.

title: Field raises £200M from DIF Capital Partners to boost battery energy storage
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Founded by former Bulb Energy co-founder Amit Gudka, battery energy storage systems developer and operator Field has raised £200 million via Dutch mid-market infrastructure fund manager DIF Capital Partners. The investment is expected to be used to accelerate Field’s development and buildout of a 4.5 GWh pipeline of grid-feeding large batteries across the UK and Western Continental Europe.

title: Healthcare without borders - time for a cross european clinic
author: Aiva Strelca
summary: While many services are global, from Amazon to Netflix, healthcare has not been able to break through national borders. AIP Clinic is the first large international digital hospital that can provide medical services EU wide, and even beyond Europe.

title: talpasolutions breaks new ground as it raises a €15 million round to tackle other large machinery based industries
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Essen-based talpasolutions raised a €15 million Series B round to expand its digital fleet and operations management solution offering and move from mining into other industries such as construction and logistics.

title: Inven is taking the mundane out of M&A with a €1.5 million raise
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish M&A software start-up Inven has raised €1.5 million in Seed funding which will be used to build its team and increase customers, and further build upon the first version of its software. The funding was led by Lifeline Ventures.

title: Old office tech: the productivity killer
author: Ronan Copeland
summary: Europe has a productivity problem. The ECB estimates that labour productivity in the EU and major economies has been in a slow decline for decades which continues to this day.

title: Eyeing advances in underserved markets, Startup Wise Guys aims to raise €45 million and takes down €25 million early
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Fresh from executing 120 early-stage deals last year, Startup Wise Guys is shifting the dial to address underserved geographies, from CEE to sub-Saharan Africa. It's recently pulled in €25 million toward a €45 million call for its accelerator fund and promises at least 200 startups will benefit.

title: Why software engineering continues to be a safe career bet
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: If you work in tech, it’s hard to ignore the unrelenting headlines concerning mass redundancies that seem to be coming thick and fast on an almost daily basis.

title: Dutch start-up Billy Grace bags €2.3 million to power actionable digital ad insights with AI
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Billy Grace is putting AI powered tech in the hands of marketers, enabling them to get a better ROI on paid digital ads. The company was born out of frustration by Robin Friend, Mitch Voskuilen and Tjadi Peeters in 2021 when they struggled to find any decent actionable insights, they decided AI was the way forward.

title: Annika Falkengren joins Swedish tech lender Ark Kapital's board
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Ark Kapital has appointed Annika Falkengren to its Board of Directors. The lender, which secured over €400 million in non-dilutive capital provides European tech companies with access to up to €10 million founder-friendly and non-dilutive loans.

title: Digital-analogue quantum computing gets a boost with PASQAL's Qadence
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week quantum computing startup PASQAL announced the launch of Qadence, an open source Python library that streamlines the process of building and executing digital-analog quantum programs on interacting qubit systems.

title: EIB pours $27 million into Middle East Venture Fund IV
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The EIB has leveraged its newly-launched development finance wing, EIB Global, to finalise a $27 million anchor investment in the Middle East and Pakistan LP vehicle Middle East Venture Fund IV (MEVP IV).

title: Tech Nation weighs in one last time: Bubble burst or continued growth of the UK tech ecosystem - it’s up to stakeholders, investors, and the Government
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Tech Nation, the champion of so much over so many years has published its swan song, the Tech Nation Report: How to build a scaleup, and it's one not to be missed.

title: Fernride CEO Hendrik Kramer shares the significance of the autonomous electric trucking company’s $50M raise
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German autonomous electric trucking innovator Fernride announced a $19 million increase to its Series A funding, bringing the total round amount to $50 million.

title: Solo GP fund Anamcara goes for the knockout with $10.6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based solo GP-driven Anamcara has announced the launch of its pre-seed and seed-focused fund at $10.6 million. As you might expect for a fledgling fund, angel-sized tickets of approximately $200,000 will be issued to B2B startups deemed future game changers.

title: Elaia closes newest and largest fund to date at €200 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based VC firm Elaia has announced the close of its Digital Ventures 4 fund at €200 million, a figure up €80 million from May 2021’s number of €120 million.

title: Ireland’s Bluedrop Medical raises €10.5 million investment creating 25 new jobs this year
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Galway-based med-tech Bluedrop Medical has raised €10.5 million in an oversubscribed funding round and says it will create 25 new jobs this year.

title: Rotterdam's Helloprint now offers APIs to facilitate print design in every enterprise environment
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Rotterdam's Helloprint is launching an API software kit for the design of enterprise marketing materials.

title: UK's thymia raises $2.7 million to expand its AI approach to diagnosing mental health struggles through gamification
author: Fiona Alston
summary: thymia is taking an AI approach to diagnosing mental health symptoms and treatment plans through gamified AI tools. Using its proprietary data set which it claims is one of the largest in the world with over one billion data points collected from over 5000 individuals with mental health issues such as depression, generalised anxiety and ADHD, the UK health tech start-up claims its tool can give a ‘more objective and empirical’ mental health assessment.

title: Funds, founders and the future: A challenging year for tech investment?
author: Sam Nasrolahi
summary: 2022 saw the deepest slump in the value of new VC deals ever recorded. It is perhaps unsurprising, then, that the overarching narrative at the beginning of 2023 was one of ongoing pessimism, with many investors, journalists and academics predicting it to be the worst funding period for decades.

title: GotPhoto gets got by EQT Growth
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based GotPhoto, aka fotograf.de in its home market, has been acquired by EQT Growth for an undisclosed figure.

title: Cabify is taking a spin to new cities with $110 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Madrid-based International multi-mobility company Cabify has announced it closed a funding round worth $110 million to ‘accelerate its objectives’ as it drives expansion to more cities in Spain and Latin America.

title: Electrify Video Partners raises $85M from Capital D for YouTube channel investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week media startup Electrify Video Partners announced on YouTube that it has successfully raised $85 million in funding from private equity firm Capital D.

title: Berlin-based electric mobility subscription service provider Dance cycles in another €12 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based electric mobility subscription service provider Dance has raised €10 million in an equity and debt financing round led by existing investors HV Capital, Eurazeo, and BlueYard.

title: Orange Quantum Systems raises €1.5M for quantum chip testing innovation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Orange Quantum Systems, a Delft, Netherlands-based quantum technology startup and TNO spinout has announced the raise of €1.5 million in a pre-seed funding round.

title: Building microdisplays for mobile near-to-eye viewing devices, France’s Microoled raises €21 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Love it or hate it, want it or had it, AR/VR simply isn’t going away. Toss in the fact that Apple’s Vision Pro (again, love it or hate it or think it looks altogether creepy) has renewed interest, and Grenoble-based maker of microdisplays for mobile near-to-eye viewing devices, Microoled’s €21 million funding round seems to have arrived right on time.

title: Greenwood Power raises €5.1M for US production facility for its power and voltage sensors
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Greenwood Power manufactures power and voltage sensors for gas and air-installed local substations. Its patented products help reduce any destabilisation of the grids caused by production and demand fluctuations.

title: €1.25M investment in The Selection Lab reinforces future of objective hiring practices
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch candidate assessment technology The Selection Lab has raised €1.25 million in funding in a round led by Borski Fund and joined by a current investor Arches Capital. The funds will see the expansion of the company's tech and sales and boost marketing efforts.

title: Koios emerges from stealth with $550k pre-seed funding for voice-driven AI hrtech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Koios, a London-based hrtech startup has today emerged from stealth and announced a $550,000 pre-seed funding raise. The company is employing voice-driven AI algorithms to offer personality insights, thereby enabling managers and teams to work together more effectively, both in terms of time and cost.

title: Manufacture 2030 manufactures £5 million via Maven and Amati
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oxford-based Manufacture 2030 has raised £5 million in an effort to press forward with product development and close some deals. Similar to any number of carbon capture and/or GHG emissions reductions tools players on the market, Manufacture 2030 provides brands, corporations, and their SME suppliers with “the data, tools, and support they need.”

title: Akeneo acquires AI-driven platform Unifai to enhance product cloud offering
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French Product Experience (PX) firm Akeneo, has acquired fellow French AI-driven product categorisation platform Unifai in an undisclosed deal. The deal will enhance Akeneo’s product cloud offering ‘to further elevate product experiences for brands, manufacturers, retailers and distributors globally’ - described as the 'World’s First Intelligent Product Cloud'.

title: Kahoot! agrees to cash offer from Goldman Sachs, General Atlantic, and others in $1.72 billion deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Kahoot!, the Norwegian game-based learning platform has agreed to a voluntary cash offer of $1.72 billion from Goldman Sachs, General Atlantic, Kirkbi invest, Glitrafjord AS (a vehicle controlled by Kahoot!'s CEO Eilert Hanoa), and other undisclosed investors and management shareholders.

title: Backed by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and others, Belgian agtech firm Aphea.bio raises €70 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Working in the specialised field of microbial strains that improve plant nutrient uptake, Gent-based Aphea.bio has closed a €70 million Series C funding round.

title: Iteration X launches collaboration platform with a $4.7 million funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based start-up Iteration X, a collaboration platform, has raised $4.7 million in seed funding to keep working on product development and business development in the US where it has launched.

title: Germany's TeamDrive has absorbed its secure cloud peer Hornetdrive
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: With a feature list that incorporates end-to-end encryption, synchronising, and audit versioning trails, TeamDrive's cloud data storage and exchange has expanded following its acquisition of German peer Hornetdrive, which fulfils secure cloud needs of 50,000 organisations globally.

title: Italy's Leaf Space raises €20 million for expansion of satellite communications network
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Italian satellite communications network Leaf Space has raised €20 million in a Series B funding round. The capital will further propel the company’s efforts to establish a market-leading telemetry, tracking, command, and payload data transmission network for satellite operators.

title: Space Week ought to be every week
author: Volodymyr Levykin
summary: World Space Week has been an annual occurrence for over two decades and is observed by more than 95 countries. Since the United Nations General Assembly declared this week-long celebration, we’ve seen global interest in this sector skyrocket - pun intended.

title: Vonovia backs smart residential property developer Gropyus
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: German real estate company Vonovia is investing in Austria-based sustainable homes developer Gropyus.

title: Edited raises $15 million to accelerate merchandising experience platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based Edited, an AI-driven merchandising experience platform, has announced it has raised $15 million in funding to help accelerate its product development and to provide partnerships, and M&A opportunities to expand Edited’s value proposition to customers.

title: PE firm Keensight raises €2.8B, Fasanara launches €1B B2B e-commerce fund, and a whole lot more
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 100 tech funding deals worth over €1.9 billion. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 20 exits and M&A transactions.

title: Web3 engine platform Nefta raises $5 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Nefta, a UK-based Web3 in gaming and entertainment startup, announced raising $5 million in a seed round led by venture firm Play Ventures' Future Fund.

title: Berlin-based B2B BNPL platform Mondu makes way for $13 million more
author: Dan Taylor
summary: If you’ve been keeping tabs on the money flowing into Berlin-based Mondu’s coffers, the timing of today’s announcement of a $13 million extension to its Series A round bang on the money. Literally.

title: Perenna secures $52M to enhance the UK mortgage market with alternative offering
author: Fiona Alston
summary: It’s a new day, it’s a new dawn, it’s a new bank and it's feeling like it wants to improve the UK mortgage market. London-based Perenna has just bagged itself a further $52 million in equity investment funding to fuel the roll-out of its long-term fixed-rate mortgage products on its fintech platform.

title: Drive Co expands classic car-sharing community with Hagerty's DriveShare acquisition
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based online classic carsharing company Drive Co has acquired DriveShare, a car-sharing platform owned by automotive lifestyle and insurance brand Hagerty. DriveShare joins the stable of companies owned and operated by Drive Co, including BookAclassic, Vinty and Small Car Big City.

title: Public Transport is often too expensive or inaccessible. RideTandem raises £2.3 million to bus you to work
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Public transport is broken outside of big cities in many parts of Europe and the UK. It's expensive, unreliable and not available when people need it. Too often, passengers are left with two choices - car ownership or not going to work.

title: French medtech startup Kayentis raises €5 million to ramp up US operations
author: Dan Taylor
summary: French medtech startup Kayentis, a provider of digital data capture systems for clinical trials, has raised €5 million in growth capital. Previous backers Extens, LBO France, and the ubiquitous Bpifrance.

title: Partech takes minority stake in productivity and brand compliance SaaS company UpSlide
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Global investment firm Partech has taken a 30 percent stake in French productivity and brand compliance SaaS company UpSlide, for an undisclosed sum. As part of the agreement, Partech’s Omri Benayoun, General Partner, and André François-Poncet, Partner, will join the company’s board as non-executive directors.

title: Innovators are being 'hamstrung' by lack of fundraising knowledge — report
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Pioneers of early stage companies require better signposting to external funding, according to new research published by the UK's Venture Capital Trust Association.

title: Berlin-based textile upcycling startup Re-Fresh Global raises €1.1 million in pre-seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Offering a notably fresh take on upcycling, Berlin-based Re-Fresh Global has raised €1.1 million in a pre-seed round that will see the female co-founded company press forward with R&D activities. In addition to further refining the company’s process, which it calls a “smart-up urban microfactory”, the startup intends to ramp-up marketing and sales activities.

title: Béa Fertility raises £2.5 million to launch its at-home fertility treatment in the UK
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Béa Fertility is providing an alternative to In vitro fertilisation (IVF) and Intrauterine Insemination (IUI) procedures with its at-home fertility kit for those trying to start a family. This allows the user to perform Intracervical Insemination (ICI) with its Béa Applicator which places a cervical cap of semen at the cervix. This is then left there for an hour before removing. No hormone injections are used during this treatment.

title: LA Dodgers venture arm Elysian Park Ventures backs OnePlan as it Clippers in another $6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based OnePlan has raised $6 million in a new investment round led by Elysian Park Ventures, the private investment arm of the LA Dodgers Ownership Group, and New York-based Verance Capital.

title: Skelelton Tech raises €108M, EyeEm is acquired, and Bulgarian tech gets a boost from Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €993 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Hologate raises €8.3 million to expand its XR training solutions internationally
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based virtual reality and immersive media company Hologate has raised €8.3 million in a Series A funding round. The capital is aimed at expanding the company’s international presence, with a particular focus on Europe and North America.

title: A Fika with: Daniel Nathan, Founder and CEO of Homa
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Late last year, Paris-based game development company Homa raised $100 million in a Series B round aimed at supporting the company’s continued scaling efforts including investments in tech and data products, a sustained recruitment drive, developing and implementing new partnerships, and engaging in M&A activities as they continue to grow as the world’s leading platform for creating and publishing mobile games.

title: HotelRunner expands with PayPad acquisition and launches HotelRunner POS
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Türkiye-based point-of-sale provider PayPad has been acquired by hospitality and travel industry technology provider HotelRunner. The details of the deal have not been disclosed. PayPad’s POS product has been ‘revamped’ as HotelRunner POS and continues to serve its purpose in the hospitality sector.

title: Wood-en you know it, Sweden's Modvion clinches €11 million to deliver emissions-light wooden towers for wind turbines
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Sweden's Modvion recently closed on a SEK125 million (€11 million) funding. The round is backed by Vestas Ventures, the CVC wing of wind turbine producer Vestas, as well as the EU Commission's EIC Fund, Sweden's Almi Invest Greentech, Course Corrected VC, and Austrian CVC fund Symbia VC, among others.

title: London's VivaCity raises £7 million to fuel AI-driven traffic optimisation across North America
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London's VivaCity recently celebrated a pretty major milestone. Its road sensors driven by AI, which allow urban authorities to understand how transport is flowing, were recently triggered for the 20 billionth occasion.

title: Delta Partners and MiddleGame Ventures invest €1M in Irish insurtech startup Kayna
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Kayna, a Cork, Ireland-based embedded insurance infrastructure startup has raised €1 million in a Pre-Seed funding round. The investment will be used to help the company’s expansion efforts, both in the US and the UK.

title: Framer raises $27M in Series C funding round to scale no-code website builder
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Framer, an Amsterdam-based no-code website builder, has raised $27 million in a Series C funding round. Now having raised $87 million, the company intends to use the growth capital to further scale its product and commercial teams across both Europe and the US.

title: Neura Robotic takes AI cognative robots Stateside following InterAlpen funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German-based AI robotics startup Neura Robotics has secured an additional $16 million in funding from American firm InterAlpen Partners. The firm raised $55 million in a funding round in the summer to help with expansion to US and Japan.

title: Swiss autonomous inventory drone system maker Verity extends new funding to $43 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Zürich-based autonomous inventory drone system maker Verity has raised an additional $11 million in an oversubscribed Series B round, taking the rounds’ total to $43 million. The capital will allow the company to accelerate operations and meet the growing backlog of deployments. Since late 2015, Verity has raised approximately $74 million.

title: Connect Earth captures $5.6 million as it collects carbon data on financial transactions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based Connect Earth closed a $5.6 million Seed round as it plans to scale faster with its environmental data within Europe and support the company’s expansion into the US.

title: £512M raised so far by NCSC For Startups community as it brings five more into the fold
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The UK’s National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC), together with Plexal, has revealed the next cohort of startups from across the UK to the NCSC For Startups programme. Five new cybersecurity startups join the line-up and will be taken through the twelve-week programmes as they bid to solve the biggest cybersecurity challenges facing the UK.

title: Decently raises £500k investment with its AI-powered brain injury platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Manchester healthtech startup Decently announces a £500,000 investment.

title: Iteration X launches collaboration platform with a $4.7 million funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based start-up Iteration X, a collaboration platform, has raised $4.7 million in seed funding to keep working on product development and business development in the US where it has launched.

title: Estonia’s Redcurry adds €400K to the pot to feed its 'new money' global ambitions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Tallinn-based Currynomics Labs, the creator of ‘new money’ Redcurry has secured €400,000 in funding. Investors in the round include Ecosh Life, Impulse Generator Fund, Pasi Pohjala (FinBAN), Aleksander Denisoff, Asse Sauga, Dejan Mansfeld-Rupnik, and Markus Pejacsevich. The fresh funding will rocket Redcurry into its final stage of development before the real estate-backed digital currency becomes globally available in 2024.

title: Verified Xposure: How ID verification is reshaping the adult content landscape in the EU
author: Liudas Kanapienis
summary: Under pressure from child protection groups, governments across Europe are starting to tackle the issue of underage access to adult content websites, writes Liudas Kanapiensis, CEO and co-founder of Ondato. However, concerns about data privacy, censorship, and the exploitation of sex workers if sites are forced underground, make it essential to strike the right balance between protection and privacy in the EU.

title: Getmomo and VVBR team up to provide renters with an alternative to paying cash deposits for new tenancies.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Digital banking and real estate are great bedmates. Today Berlin real estate fintech startup  Getmomo announces a new partnership with Vereinigte Volksbank Raiffeisenbank eG (VVBR) to offer tenant underwriting, expanding its digital banking services.

title: Mario Götze backed Lanch raises €6.5M pairing food brands with creators
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based food delivery software start-up Lanch has closed a €6.5 million funding round, backed by Felix Capital, HV Capital and angels from the previous funding round including Mario Götze and André Schürrle. The fresh funding will help Lanch to bring its software tools to the masses.

title: Bosnian fitness tech start-up Rolla bags €6.3M Seed round supported by Mate Rimac
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Rolla, the fitness tech start-up from Bosnia and Herzegovina, and founded by serial entrepreneur Igor Krezic, has raised a €6.3 million Seed funding round - thought to be one of the largest Seed rounds in fitness tech in those parts.

title: The impact of 'How To Web' conference on Romania's tech scene
author: Robin Haak
summary: Last week, I attended the "How To Web" conference in Bucharest, marking my inaugural visit to Romania.

title: Show us your numbers: Why Europe must follow California’s lead in legislating diversity
author: Guest Writer
summary: This week, the State of California made it illegal for VCs not to declare diversity numbers for their portfolios.

title: Previa Medical raises €2.1 million to help treat life-threatening sepsis infections using AI
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Lyon's Previa Medical announced it had raised €2.1 million in seed funds for its certified early diagnostics device for sepsis, powered by artificial intelligence software.

title: In the mycelium revolution fungi roots are shaping the future of sustainable industries
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In the future, "meat" as we know it will be fundamentally different regarding availability and format.

title: Pencil Biosciences raises £5.6M to advance gene editing for rare diseases
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based gene editing and modulation tech startup Pencil Biosciences has raised £5.6 million in Seed funding. Designed to assist the transformation of the gene editing landscape in therapeutic solutions for those with rare diseases and cancer, Pencil Biosciences intends to further develop its platform.

title: Making awkward IOUs a thing of the past Estonia's Cino raises €1.4M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Estonian fintech startup Cino is solving the awkward moments in life, the ones where someone owes you money. The company says it is turning payments into a social experience. There will be no more ‘I’ll pay and you can reimburse me later’ moments, Cino links each person’s bank account to one virtual payment card so you all pay together.

title: Fly Now Pay Later, which has raised nearly $180M, stops lending and onboarding new customers
author: John Reynolds
summary: A travel Buy Now Pay Later firm, which has raised nearly $180 million, has temporarily ceased lending and taking on new customers.

title: Microsoft's $68.7B acquisition of Activision still in the game accepts UK's CMA
author: Fiona Alston
summary: It is game on for the Microsoft and Activision deal as a concession brings competitor Ubisoft into the fold. Today the CMA has accepted Microsoft’s concession that sees Activision’s rival Ubisoft buy the cloud streaming rights (outside of EEA) for all of Activision’s PC and console content produced over the next 15 years. Activision Blizzard is the gaming creator and publisher behind Call of Duty, World of Warcraft, Diablo, and Overwatch.

title: EverImmune secures €3.5M from Bpifrance to fund drug trial in cancer patients
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French biotech company EverImmune, has secured €3.46 million in funding from a Bpifrance, under the ‘Innovation in biotherapeutics’ scheme. The funding is a mix of subsidies and repayable loans.

title: Join climatetech changemakers as they pitch for green deals
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Anticipation is growing as one of the UK’s largest investor events for climatetech innovation nears, with Cleantech Venture Day taking place on the 10th and 11th of October.

title: After filing for bankruptcy, Europe's almost-instagram platform EyeEm acquired by Freepik
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Freepik, the EQT-owned audio and visual content provider, has acquired once Instagram challenger EyeEm. Through the acquisition, Freepik gains access to over 160 million photographs assembled by the EyeEm community since 2011.

title: Decoding Europe's startup investment scene
author: Andreas Schwarzenbrunner
summary: In the midst of an ever-changing economic landscape, Europe's tech scene stands at a crucial turning point. The choices we make today, as policymakers, investors, and industry leaders, will echo into the future, moulding Europe's position in the global technology stage.

title: Agomab Therapeutics secures €94.9M in Series C to advance drug development for Crohn's Disease
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Belgium medtech company Agomab Therapeutics announced the closing of a €94.9 million Series C financing round led by Fidelity Management & Research Company.

title: Data Talks and Data Driven Index, two promising analytics initiatives in the CEE region
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Andrei Popa, Director of Business Intelligence at Superbet Group - a leading company in the tech & entertainment industry, is the founder of Data Talks. Andrei initiated the Data Talks concept two years ago, aiming to create a much-needed hub and series of conferences for data analytics professionals across the entire CEE region.

title: Revalue Nature: Changing the face of carbon projects with $10M Series A fund
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based climate tech start-up Revalue Nature is taking a different approach to carbon projects – it is proving the tools to project developers to look at projects ‘from the ground up’ via its platform and its pipeline of global project financiers. The climate currently has connections in eight countries over three continents.

title: Surge in international demand spurs GITEX GLOBAL, Expand North Star to take over the city of Dubai at two mega venues
author: Tech.eu
summary: The surge in international demand has rallied the world’s largest tech and start-up event to scale even higher and bigger in 2023, spearheading a global tech takeover across two Dubai mega venues next month.

title: Skeleton Technologies raises €108M in funding round led by Siemens and Marubeni
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Estonian-founded fast energy storage firm Skeleton Technologies has raised a €108 million equity and debt funding round with investment from Siemens Financial Services (SFS) and Marubeni Corporation, including other investors.

title: Startup Wise Guys and Specialist VC invest in Lithuania's AskToSell's AI sales agents
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Vilnius-based AI platform AskToSell has raised a €100,000 pre-seed round to build its sales automation platform which deploys ‘superhuman-like’ autonomous AI sales agents in a bid to help SMBs scale without burning up all their runway on sales team and customer acquisition costs – something founders Laimonas Noreika and Karolis Januškas had already experienced their previous venture Ziticity.

title: Dock Financial completes full acquisition of Paydora Finance
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paydora Finance has been bought in full by Dock Financial. The Munich-based fintech was already the majority owner of Paydora Finance and this latest move will see the German startup integrate ‘seamlessly’ into the organisation.

title: Operations observability and incident management startup Flawless raises $2.2M in Seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Flawless, a distributed startup working in the field of operations observability and incident management, has secured $2.2 million in a Seed funding round. The investment serves to support to company’s global expansion plans.

title: Swedish deeptech Enerpoly advances in zinc-ion battery production with Vinnova grant
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Stockholm-based deeptech Enerpoly uses its patented technology to develop and produce zinc-ion battery cells and packs. The startup has been awarded a $600,000 grant from Vinnova, the Swedish Governmental Agency for Innovation Systems.

title: Indico leads €1.2M Seed round for Barcelona-based recruitment firm Workfully
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Barcelona-based recruitment firm Workfully has raised a €1.2 million Seed round. The round was led by Indico and included Pitchdrive, Secways and others. Funds will allow for continued product development and growth.

title: Capalo AI raises €500,000 for AI-powered energy storage optimisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Finnish energy tech startup Capalo AI has raised €500,000 in Pre-Seed funding this week.

title: Finland’s eniferBio blooms €11 million to ramp up fungal protein production
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Finland’s eniferBio has raised €11 million in a Series A funding round aimed at helping the company scale the production of its fermentation-process-derived protein powders.

title: Copenhagen healthtech startup Corti raises $60M in Series B funding
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Corti, a Copenhagen-based healthtech startup using AI to help healthcare providers deliver the right healthcare to patients at the right time, has raised $60 million in a Series B funding round. The investment is expected to help fuel the company’s growth, both in terms of the team size and client base. Since mid-late 2018, Corti has raised over $86 million.

title: Natural Cycles is the world's first birth control app cleared by the FDA to use Apple Watch data
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, the Stockholm developers of the world's first birth control app, Natural Cycles, received 510(k) clearance from the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for its use of wrist temperature data from Apple Watch.

title: EyeEm, once Europe’s challenger to Instagram, files for bankruptcy
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Back in the heady days of filters, film simulations, and Kodak-like borders, Android and iPhone users had two leading players they could choose from: Instagram or EyeEm. Pepsi or Coke, YouTube or Vimeo, Ford or Ferrari, you get the gist.

title: German fintech Monite grows its executive team with ex Marqeta, Mollie, and Atom Bank talent
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German fintech Monite is an API-first embedded finance company for B2B platforms to provide hassle-free finance automation for their clients. The firm has just newly included three new members to the executive team as part of its growth commitments. Monite plans to expand its footprint in the EU and UK while also expanding into the US market and beyond.

title: European Investment Fund puts €40M into female-founded climatetech fund Blume Equity
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The European Investment Fund (EIF) has invested €40 million in Blume Equity, a female-founded fund climatetech growth fund. This investment marks one of the EIF’s largest into a first-time growth stage fund.

title: Visma solidifies its footprint in Spain acquiring Quaderno
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Norwegian cloud software powerhouse Visma announced its acquisition of automatic tax compliance company Quaderno for an undisclosed sum.

title: Revolutionising urban housing: IMMO's tech-driven approach to the housing crisis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Most, if not all, UK and European cities are experiencing a housing crisis with a lack of affordable, sustainably designed urban housing to buy and rent. One company, IMMO, is looking at a novel way to merge investors and inhibitors.

title: OrdinalsBot raises $1M in Seed funding to improve ordinals infrastructure
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based ordinals infrastructure platform OrdinalsBot has raised more than $1 million in a Seed funding round.

title: CMR Surgical raises $165M for robotic-aided minimal access surgery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, surgical robotics business CMR Surgical announced that it closed an upsized $165 million fundraising round.

title: Previa Medical raises €2.1 million to help treat life-threatening sepsis infections using AI
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Lyon's Previa Medical announced it had raised €2.1 million in seed funds for its certified early diagnostics device for sepsis, powered by artificial intelligence software.

title: Renew Risk raises  £1.7M Seed funding for green energy risk analytics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week London-based clean-energy risk analytics company Renew Risk, raised £1.7 million in Seed funding to improve the financing, planning and insurance for renewable energy assets.

title: Goldman Sachs and Citi back Fleximize with £136M investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Fleximize, a UK-based SME lending fintech service, has secured £136 million in a new financing round. The securitised financing is aimed at helping the company redeem existing debt as it expands its existing operations.

title: Kamino Retail raises €1.25M in a Pre-Seed round for to aid retail media monetisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French start-up Kamino Retail announced it has raised a Pre-Seed round of €1.25 million.

title: Upvest partners with BlackRock following €30M funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based fintech Upvest has secured a €30 million funding round. Participating in the round is BlackRock alongside existing investors Bessemer Venture Partners, HV Capital, Earlybird, Notion Capital, ABN Amro Ventures, and 10x Capital.

title: Berlin's TransactionLink secures €5M for KYB product development
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based no-code platform TransactionLink has raised a €5 million Seed round. The round was led by White Star Capital and includes participation from existing investor Target Global and angel investment from existing and new investors.

title: Deasie raises $2.9M for data governance platform expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Data governance platform, Deasie has raised $2.9 million in a funding round closed just five months post-launch. European-founded by Reece Griffiths, Mikko Peiponen and Leo Platzer, and US-headquartered, the startup supports the adoption of language model applications.

title: Softbank-backed event ticketing platform DICE confirms layoffs
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Softbank-backed event ticketing platform DICE has confirmed a recent round of layoffs citing restructuring behind the move.

title: Finnish gaming company Spectarium secures €5M to make Myths a reality
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish cross-platform RPG company Spectarium has secured €5 million in Seed round funding. The round was led by Bitkraft Ventures and includes Delphi Digital and Framework Ventures. The fresh capital will allow the games company to scale its team and further develop its first RPG title Myths which is due for a soft launch next year.

title: Monday Merch raises €500,000 to expand its merchandise platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Rotterdam-based start-up Monday Merch has raised €500,000 in growth capital to fund its European rollout and allows it to grow its team. Funding came from Rabobank.

title: This Week in European Tech: Thales acquires Imperva for $3.6B, Field fields £200M, and more
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 75 tech funding deals worth over €656 million. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 15 exits and M&A transactions.

title: Dutch climate-tech IoT scale-up Sensorfact raises €25 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch climate-tech IoT scale-up Sensorfact has raised a €25 million investment round which was led by Blume Equity and included support from existing investors FORWARD.one, Korys, and SET Ventures. Funds will fuel the expansion into new markets as Sensorfact optimises its current product suite.

title: Digital health provider HelloBetter receives a €5M boost from HSBC Asset Management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Berlin digital health company HelloBetter announced a €5 million raise from HSBC Asset Management's Financial Technology Venture Capital strategy as a second closing to its A2 round announced in May.

title: Trusted by Dior, Armani, YSL and others, London's Odore secures $5M in seed funding
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based all things beauty marketing specialist Odore has secured $5 million in a seed round led by Fuel Ventures with participation from undisclosed existing investors. In the company’s previous pre-seed funding round announcement (at $1.35 million), investors included Blackfinch Ventures, SFC Capital, and angel investor and author Alister Esam.

title: French cybersecurity startup HarfangLab raises €25M Series A to further its European expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cybersecurity startup HarfangLab raises €25 million in Series A funding round to expand across Europe. Today, HarfangLab, a French cybersecurity company, has closed a €25 million Series A funding round led by Crédit Mutuel Innovation. MassMutual Ventures (CMI) also participated alongside Elaia, a long-standing investor in HarfangLab, having led the company's first €5 million funding round back in 2021.

title: Your affiliate marketing campaign is probably leaking money. ReferOn wants to fix it – here's how
author: Tech.eu
summary: Affiliate marketing has proven to be an incredibly effective way for businesses to expand their reach, increase sales, and generate revenue. This advertising model, in which third-party publishers promote a brand's products or services and earn a commission for conversions generated, continues growing in popularity – here's why.

title: Klarna scraps open banking brand Klarna Kosma
author: John Reynolds
summary: Klarna has scrapped its open banking brand Klarna Kosma after less than 18 months.

title: Checkout.com targets fast-growing ID verification market
author: John Reynolds
summary: Fintechs are currently spreading their tentacles, offering new products and services as they look for new revenue streams amid challenging economic conditions.

title: Orbem raises €30M to expand AI-powered imaging in food, construction, and medical sectors
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German deeptech firm Orbem is using AI-powered MRI technology to scan biological samples in food, construction and medical environments. For example, the non-invasive technology has been used to sex eggs. The culling of male-day-old chicks has been outlawed in some EU countries, and in-ovo sexing prevents this practice.

title: Kingspan's Louise Foody heads €20M venture fund and accelerator for constructiontech
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Irish-based international building materials firm Kingspan is backing covolve, a new Irish accelerator and venture fund, to digitise the construction industry.

title: Indico leads €1.2M Seed round for Barcelona-based recruitment firm Workfully
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Barcelona-based recruitment firm Workfully has raised a €1.2 million Seed round. The round was led by Indico and included Pitchdrive, Secways and others. Funds will allow for continued product development and growth.

title: Beam Global to expand into Europe with €10M acquisition of Amiga DOO Kraljevo
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Beam Global, a leading provider of sustainable solutions for electric vehicle charging, energy storage, energy security, and outdoor media, today announced the execution of a Stock Purchase Agreement to acquire Europe-based Amiga DOO Kraljevo, a Serbian manufacturer of specialised structures and equipment, including street lights, communications and energy infrastructure.

title: The Platform Group and fashionette AG to merge
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dusseldorf-based online luxury accessories vendor fashionette AG is to merge with its main shareholder online retail firm The Platform Group GmbH & Co. KG (TPG) which is currently active in seventeen sectors with platform and software solutions, including furniture retail, shoe/fashion retail, bicycle and machine retail and dental technology. The company will then operate under the name The Platform Group AG.

title: Ocean 14 Capital eyes €200M target after €30M boost, invests in Norway's Ava Ocean
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Luxembourg-based blue-economy specialist fund Ocean 14 Capital has netted another €30 million; €20 million investment from insurer and reinsurer, Convex Group Limited and €10 million from undisclosed family offices and high net-worth individuals.

title: Helping children reduce anxiety when it comes to surgery, Little Journey raises $3.1 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Little Journey has raised $3.1 million in a funding round led by Octopus Ventures. According to the startup, the new capital will be used to further develop their offering and gear up for international expansion.

title: Spanish package delivery and courier firm Paack closes a 'more than €40 million' funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: It has been reported that Spanish package delivery and courier firm, Paack, has completed a funding round of more than €40 million - it is suggested the funding is almost an even split of capital and debt funding. Reporting the news La Información said that Infravía Capital had ‘significant weight in the transaction’ – it was previously involved in a round which Softbank led.

title: UK-based Netcraft raises over $100 million and bags a new CEO as Ryan Woodley joins the firm
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based cybersecurity firm Netcraft has raised over $100 million from Spectrum Equity. The firm which provides cybercrime detection and disruption services via its smart SaaS platform will use the funds to drive growth and further global expansion.

title: Openvolt raises €1.5M Pre-Seed round for its innovative smart meter API
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Openvolt has developed a smart meter API to enable companies to accurately report carbon emissions, support property owners with the information needed to decarbonise their buildings and to enable ‘the growth of flexibility markets’. It is launching its Beta API, granting access to meter-level energy consumption data in the United Kingdom.

title: Berlin proptech start-up dao raises €1.5M to put AI in the hands of property managers
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based proptech start-up dao has raised €1.5 million in pre-seed funding. Involved in the round are investors Julian Teicke of wefox, Patrick Henning of luca, Dustin Figge of Homelike, and Gerald Schönbucher of Kaufland e-commerce.

title: CMR Surgical raises $165M for robotic-aided minimal access surgery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, surgical robotics business CMR Surgical announced that it closed an upsized $165 million fundraising round.

title: Partful raises £2.4M to scale its 'Exploding' 3D parts SaaS platform for manufacturers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Manchester-based company Partful announced it has received £2.4M in funding to accelerate the development of its 'exploding' 3D parts SaaS platform.

title: A survey of Berlin's thriving tech scene sheds light on average salaries
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin is known for its thriving startup and investment ecosystem. But how much will you earn is the question for many people considering a move to the German capital.

title: Molten Ventures launches new Irish focused fund for high-growth technology companies
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Venture capital firm Molten Ventures has launched an Irish-focused fund - with investment from existing Molten shareholder Ireland Strategic Investment Fund – the fund will focus on high-growth technology companies in the Republic. The first close of the new fund is €50 million with the scope for this to increase with participation from an additional syndicated partner. Molten’s commitment as a 55.5% LP is €27.75 million, with ISIF committing the remaining €22.25 million.

title: Former Virgin Money CEO's app Snoop now part of Vanquis Banking Group
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following reports first circulated by Sky News a few weeks back, the UK’s money management app Snoop has been acquired by Vanquis Banking Group.

title: Manchester's ProofID acquires Regatta, boosting identity and access management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Manchester Identity and Access Management (IAM) specialist ProofID announced that it has acquired identity governance and administration integrator Regatta Solutions Group for an unspecified amount.

title: Untangled Finance to tokenise private credit assets with $13.5M funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based fintech startup Untangled Finance has secured a $13.5 million fundraise led by Fasanara Capital. The multi-year strategic funding will see the company further develop it products, continue to grow and create an ecosystem.

title: Amsterdam-based Tidalflow raises $1.7M to compete in AI plugin market
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Making a splash with a $1.7 million fundraise Amsterdam-based Tidalflow has launched. The startup is ready to compete in the race for the crown of AI plugins, as OpenAI, Google and Microsoft head the line-up. Tidalflow's plugin lifecycle platform gives software firms the opportunity to ‘develop, test, monitor and monetise an instance of their product to be compatible with LLMs’. AI for all!

title: Tilak Healthcare scores €10M to gamify eye disease monitoring
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Tilak Healthcare, a pioneer and leading player in the field of ophthalmological digital health, has raised €10 million in a funding round led by Elaia and Cap Horn. This brings the startup's funding to €19.5 million

title: Italy’s United Ventures announces first close of new €150 million early-stage fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Milan-based VC firm United Ventures has raised €65 million of a targeted €150 million fund. The firm intends to invest in 15 to 18 early-stage European startups, offering ticket sizes ranging from €1 to €8 million.

title: Klarna and Spotify among Nordic tech companies contributing to environmental impact platform Milkywire
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Stockholm-based environmental impact platform, Milkywire, says that nine Nordic tech companies, including Spotify, Klarna, Avanza, Northzone, Mentimeter and BioGaia have committed to donate to its Climate Transformation Fund.

title: Berlin's ecoworks secures €22M for its eco-friendly retrofitting tech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based ecoworks has raised €22 million in a Series A funding round to automate the design process for retrofitting housing stock, thereby reducing CO2 emmissions. The new capital is aimed at further developing the startup’s technologies as it looks forward to breaking even by the end of 2024.

title: Germany's subdron raises €1.3 million to automate underwater inspections for biofouling and structural integrity
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German maritime start-up subdron GmbH has raised a €1.3 million pre-seed funding round which was co-led by xista science ventures and Faber, from its Ocean/Climate Tech fund, with participation from Saber GmbH. Funds will enable subdron to get cracking on the development and deployment of its underwater technology – making the inspection of underwater infrastructure, such as port facilities and ship hulls, for biofouling and structural integrity, autonomous.

title: Rocky Road Games raises $3M Seed round for social gaming network
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Reykjavik-based mobile gaming startup Rocky Road Games is aiming to nurture real-world social connections among players with its still-in-stealth platform. Founded by Thor Fridriksson, Vala Halldorsdottir, and Sveinn Davidsson, the team previously created QuizUp, a title that's garnered some 100 million users globally.

title: French firm Thales buys US-based cybersecurity company Imperva from Thoma Bravo in $3.6 billion deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French firm Thales says it has reached an agreement to buy US-based data and application cybersecurity company Imperva from software investment firm Thoma Bravo for an 'enterprise value' of $3.6 billion.

title: Calvin Ayre's Ayre Group acquires majority stake in nChain in $570M deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Ayre Group has taken a controlling interest in blockchain and web3 IP library nChain in a $570 million deal. Details of the deal involve an equity acquisition of nChain by the Ayre Group, an IP licensing deal for Ayre Ventures portfolio companies, and a line of credit.

title: Quench.ai raises $5 million to expand its team to support product and tech development of the AI-powered edtech start-up
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based AI edtech platform Quench.ai is aimed at professionals looking to learn in real-time. Through a series of short questions, it searches through a host of video learning content to offer the most relevant content for the user's needs.

title: SphereTrax is changing the tune for composers and musicians through ethical music licensing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: One of the harsh realities of being a composer or musician is you're always waiting to get paid; whether your music appears on the radio, in tv commercials, in film soundtrack or scores, or games, you can expect delays.

title: Rapyd expands global reach with $610M PayU GPO acquisition
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Fintech as a Service provider Rapyd carries on with its string of acquisitions, this time snapping up PayU’s Global Payments  Organisation (GPO) for a total cash consideration of $610 million.

title: Pandemic-era unicorn Hopin sells off tech assets to cloud communications giant RingCentral
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The pandemic era darling of any and all event organisers, Hopin has signed a definitive agreement with California-based cloud communications platform RingCentral to sell off its flagship Events platform and Session product. The terms of the transaction were not disclosed.

title: Chemify, a University of Glasgow spinout, secures $43 million in Series A funding
author: Dan Taylor
summary: University of Glasgow spinout Chemify has raised $43 million in a Series A funding round. The company provides pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and industrial partners with molecular design services and is the culmination of decades of chemistry research, robotics, AI, and conceptual advancements.

title: Edtech GoStudent raises $95M in funding for hybrid learning expansion in DACH region
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Vienna-based edtech GoStudent has raised a $95 million funding round – a mix of equity and debt capital. Involved in the round was Deutsche Bank, and investors including Left Lane Capital, DN Capital, Tencent, Prosus, DST, Coatue and Softbank Vision Fund 2.

title: BNP Paribas, HSBC & others fund Mirakl's €100M growth strategy
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian B2B and B2C e-commerce marketplace SaaS platform Mirakl has secured a €100 million revolving credit facility via a consortium of five financial institutions: BNP Paribas, HSBC, J.P. Morgan, Natixis, and Société Générale. The working capital is aimed at providing a growth mechanism, particularly in the areas of continued development of the company’s technology stack as well as financing the completion of ongoing acquisitions.

title: The Platform Group and fashionette AG to merge
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dusseldorf-based online luxury accessories vendor fashionette AG is to merge with its main shareholder online retail firm The Platform Group GmbH & Co. KG (TPG) which is currently active in seventeen sectors with platform and software solutions, including furniture retail, shoe/fashion retail, bicycle and machine retail and dental technology. The company will then operate under the name The Platform Group AG.

title: Carbon Equity raises €6M, making climate venture capital accessible
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch impact investing startup Carbon Equity has created a climate venture capital and private equity fund investing platform. It enables small ticket access to top climate venture capital and growth equity funds. Investors can back climate technology companies, from large-scale batteries to carbon-free cement.

title: Report: July 2023's biggest deals, exits and summer slowdown
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The beginning of the month brings us new data on the state of the European tech ecosystem. Although the “The European tech ecosystem: H1 2023 Report” showed us that in first half of 2023 the Europe is still behind 2021 and 2022’s numbers and by the end of the year it will be difficult to reach the level of investments of these two years; for better or for worse. However, the data for 2023, month over month, confirms that when it comes to the volume and the number of investments, no major deviations can be seen.

title: BirdsEyeView secures major investment for climate change insurance solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today BirdsEyeView, a European Space Agency-backed insurtech startup, has closed an investment round of an undisclosed seven-figure sum led by the European Space Agency, Big 5 Investors, InsurTech NY and ACF Investors.

title: Estonian startup Avokaado raises €1.2M for AI-upgrade to contract management
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Simplifying contract creation and management is no easy feat, but Estonian-based startup Avokaado is one of the legaltechs streamlining the process. By automating document and contract management the firm has garnered a user base of over 20,000 across the Baltics, Nordics, and the US - it includes BITĖ Group, TV3 Group, Radisson, Tele2, Coolbet, and Starship amongst that line-up.

title: AI-powered accident and disaster recovery platform Tractable picks up $65 million in Softbank led round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London’s developer of artificial intelligence-powered solutions for accident and disaster recovery Tractable has raised $65 million in a Series E funding round. The UK’s first computer vision unicorn intends to use the investment to accelerate its R&D capabilities. Since mid-2015 the firm has raised approximately $185 million.

title: Dutch edtech firm Lepaya secures $38M for AI-driven corporate upskilling
author: Fiona Alston
summary: European edtech firm Lepaya continues its dominance in the edtech market with a $38 million fundraise which will see the Amsterdam-based corporate upskilling provider make more investments into its AI tools to bring an AI coach to its members, adjusting and tailoring learner's content to their context and career level.

title: Getir keeps on gettin’ - now in talks to acquire German rival Flink
author: Dan Taylor
summary: According to a report filed by the FT’s Ivan Levingston, Istanbul-based Getir, who most recently raised approximately $500 million according to Business Insider’s industry sources, is in talks to acquire German competitor Flink.

title: Getir to pull out of Portugal, Spain and Italy in an ‘orderly manner’
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Turkish food delivery company Getir has said today that is getting out of Portugal, Spain and Italy. The Spain withdrawal has been one of the rumours about the start-up lately as some have suggested the company has been nearing bankruptcy.

title: How a Ukrainian investment firm helps software devs become founders
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: If there's one sector in Ukraine that embodies resilience, it's the tech scene. It not only employs people, but drives innovation globally across a multitude of sectors, from AI in game development to smart building tech, materials innovation, and bionic prostheses.

title: Italian startup CarpeCarbon to design DAC plant after €1.7M funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: CarpeCarbon, a Turin-based climatetech startup, has raised €1.7 million in a Pre-Seed funding round. Similar to Germany's Greenlyte Carbon Technologies, CarpeCarbon is the first Italian outfit working on technologies that use Direct Air Capture to remove CO² from the atmosphere and store it safely underground, and intends to use the investment to design the first Italian DAC plant in Piedmont.

title: Debt prevention platform SuperFi raises $1 million to launch pilot in London
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based debt prevention and management platform SuperFi has raised a $1 million Pre-seed funding round to help Londoners to manage their debt better. The round, which was facilitated on the fundraising platform Floww, was led by Ascension and also includes a grant from the Greater London Authority. The start-up has previously been backed by Antler.

title: Proxima Fusion extends Pre-Seed round, welcomes scientists from Stanford, MIT, and Harvard
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Proxima Fusion, a Munich-based deeptech startup working on developing fusion power plants has extended its Pre-Seed round to €7.5 million, welcoming a host of unicorn founders, family offices, and industry leaders to the table.

title: Bootstrap Europe acquires Silicon Valley Bank’s German loan portfolio for $64M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Growth debt firm Bootstrap Europe has acquired Silicon Valley Bank’s (SVB) German portfolio of $169 million loan commitments for $64 million from the US Federal Deposit Insurance Corp (FDIC). The loans are a diversified portfolio of technology and healthcare businesses backed by global top-tier technology and Venture Capital (VC) investors.

title: Yerevan to Silicon Valley: Armenia's blueprint for European startups eyeing US expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last year, numerous investors have mentioned Armenia as a place to watch, particularly for European startups looking for advice on how to scale to North America.

title: Pockit: The fintech app empowering low-income communities raises $10M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Fintech app for low-income and underserved communities, Pockit has raised $10 million in a growth round. Initially a prepaid card the UK-based fintech has moved its offering to include a ‘prepaid account’ from which customers can ‘send and receive money internationally, set up direct debits, deposit and withdraw cash in 27,000 stores across the UK, make online and in-store purchases, and even get an advance on their salary’. Phew, what can’t it do? It stresses it is not a bank!

title: Tilebox raises $1.7M to enhance space data management
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Austrian-founded space data platform Tilebox, founded by Laura Costa and Stefan Amberger helps companies to better manage and utilise their space data from on Earth or in-orbit satellites. Over $500 billion in projected revenue is predicted in the space industry by 2030-2040 – ‘effectively managing and leveraging data has become mission-critical’.

title: GoStudent launches a new VR offering backed by Meta with Meta Quest 2 donation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Vienna-based edtech company, GoStudent is making a move on virtual reality education. It is launching a VR offering which is is backed by Meta - the tech giant is donating Meta Quest 2 VR headsets to the platform to compliment its new VR offering.

title: A walk through hell: How Eastern Europe’s first solo GP venture fund Underline Ventures raised $20M
author: Bogdan Iordache
summary: When Russia invaded Ukraine, on February 24, 2022, our first closing was only one week old.

title: The missed opportunity of the EU AI Act
author: Nicole Büttner
summary: After prolonged negotiations, complaints, and political jockeying, the EU AI Act is finally here.

title: The environmental reality of audio and video streaming is high carbon emissions.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: As companies work to reduce their carbon footprint, there's one area they might not have thought about — their digital consumption.

title: UK's Huq Industries raises £4 million to expand its mobility data platform in Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK firm Huq Industries provides mobility insights to professionals in government, retail, real estate, and finance, giving data on footfall and visitor frequency via its insights platform. It has raised a £4 million funding round led by 24 Haymarket, including ACF Investors. The fund will further the growth of the company as it sets it sights on a European expansion.

title: KYP ai secures €17.5M to boost GenAI feature and global expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Cologne-based business productivity platform KYP.ai has raised a Series A investment round of €17.5 million led by OTB Ventures and includes existing investors 42CAP and Tola Capital. The funding will allow the German startup to promote and expand its latest feature of GenAI opportunity identification and will see the firm scale operations Stateside and continue the push for a larger customer base as it scales in Europe, India, Singapore, and China.

title: STATION F releases Future 40 list
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Today, Parisian startup campus STATION F has released its coveted Future 40 list, highlighting the most promising companies housed under its roof. The 40 startups are hand-selected, based on metrics and/or major milestones, with this fifth edition being powered by cloud-based data storage and analytics service provider Snowflake.

title: Frankfurt's QuoIntelligence gets €5 million to expand its team and provide threat intelligence to Europe and the US
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Frankfurt-based threat intelligence firm QuoIntelligence has raised €5 million in a Seed financing round. Funds will enable QuoIntelligence to expand its team as it vies for a larger bite of the European and US markets. The funding round was led by eCAPITAL Entrepreneurial Partners - which has cybersecurity firms VMRay, Tenzir, and Exein in its portfolio – and some private investors.

title: Italy's Nexi Group acquires 30% stake in multichannel payment firm Computop
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Milan’s Nexi Group carries on with its stream of M&A activities, this time snapping up 30 per cent of German multichannel payment processing firm Computop. The purchase price remains undisclosed, however the incoming funds are expected to assist Computop in expanding its range of services in the areas of point-of-sale and e-commerce in the regions covered by Nexi.

title: Restaurant management platform Last.app raises €5M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Last.app, a Barcelona-based hosptech startup founded by former Glovo team members Eric and Ivan Nikolic, has raised €5 million in a new financing round. The restaurant management platform intends to use the growth capital to continue product development, expand the team size, and plan for new market entries.

title: Revolut to offer “secret sauce” HRtech to “select” companies in new B2B offering
author: John Reynolds
summary: In recent years, UK challenger banks have looked to generate new revenue streams on top of their core banking and exchange offerings, as they look to better monetise their businesses in the race to profitability.

title: Klarna employees “shocked” after CEO gives speech appearing to liken pro-strike staff to rebelling pigs in Animal Farm
author: John Reynolds
summary: Klarna employees were left “shocked” after their CEO gave a speech addressing a proposed union strike, in which he appeared to liken pro-strike employees to the rebelling pigs in George Orwell’s Animal Farm, sources say.

title: London HRtech startup Beamery to cut 25 percent of workforce amid restructuring
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based hrtech startup Beamery is to shed 25 percent of its workforce Tech.eu has learned. The move is part of an organisational restructuring that aims to reduce the company’s total costs by 35 percent.

title: Armenian product validation platform Prelaunch.com checks in with $1.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Armenian-founded, product validation platform Prelaunch.com has raised $1.5 million in a seed round. The new funds are aimed at helping the company expand its reach, particularly in the US market, in tandem with fleshing out additional product capabilities.

title: Biotech start-up Epiterna gets €10M to increase the lifespan of humans and pets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swiss biotech start-up Epiterna, which was founded in 2022 by Kevin Perez and Alejandro Ocampo, has emerged from stealth and brought with it news of an investment by Prima Materia the firm founded by Daniel Ek (founder of Spotify) and Shakil Khan. The sum of the investment is thought to be €10 million.

title: Stockholm's MasterExchange lets fans invest in song royalties
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Helping consumers like you and I invest in future streaming royalties, Stockholm’s MasterExchange has raised $2.7 million in a funding round provided via San Francisco/Hong Kong-based Vectr Fintech, Pan Capital founder Claes-Henrik Julander, and Miniclip (now a Tencent property) founder Rob Small.

title: Berlin-based startup GlassFlow raises $1.1M for event-driven data pipeline development
author: Dan Taylor
summary: GlassFlow, a Berlin-based startup taking on the woes experienced by event-driven data pipeline developers, has raised $1.1 million in a Pre-Seed funding round.

title: Eastern Europe's first solo GP venture fund, Underline Ventures, achieves $20M target
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Underline Ventures, Eastern Europe’s first solo GP venture fund has announced today the final close of its first fund at $20 million. The vehicle is aimed at supporting some 20 early-stage startups established by Eastern European founders, offering an average ticket size of $500,000.

title: Tenity acquires startup accelerator Hackquarters providing startups with enhanced partner network
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Tenity, a leading fintech and insurtech innovation ecosystem and early-stage investor with hubs across Europe and Asia, announced an agreement to fully acquire Hackquarters, a long-established London and Istanbul-based startup accelerator and corporate innovation partner with a strong footprint in the fintech space. The funding was undisclosed.

title: Parisian fintech Aria brings down the house in €15M funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Aria, a Parisian fintech startup offering invoice financing and B2B payments solutions, has announced the successful close of a €15 million Series A funding round. The investment is expected to propel an expansion of the company’s deferred payment infrastructure offer, with a particular focus on SaaS operators.

title: French startup Le Fourgon secures €10M Series A to combat single-use plastic
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French returnables startup Le Fourgon, announces a Series A of €10 million. This brings the company’s investments to €17.5 million, including €3 million raised in crowdfunding earlier this year,

title: Tromero raises £1.5 million to make AI training and hosting cheaper through crypto mining
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based machine learning training and hosting platform Tromero has raised £1.5 million in a seed funding round led by BlueYard Capital. The startup will use the investment to assemble a team that will deliver a functioning beta version of the platform within the next 12 months.

title: Revenue based financing marketplace Levenue raises €8M, acquires Belgian fintech Cake
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Levenue, a Dutch revenue-based finance marketplace, has today announced the successful raise of €8 million in a Series A funding round and completion of the acquisition of Belgian fintech Cake.

title: Norwegian software giant Visma acquires Denmark's leading legal admin software maker iVISION
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Norwegian business software Goliath Visma has acquired iVISION, the company behind Legis 365, Denmark’s leading admin software for law firms. The financials of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: French pharma Amolyt nets €130 million series C co-led by Sofinnova Partners
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Amolyt Pharma, an Ecully, France-based pharma startup working on rare disease treatments, has closed a €130 million series C round.

title: micromobility.com pumps air into VanMoof's tyres as it emerges as potential buyer
author: Fiona Alston
summary: micromobility.com, the mobility US firm - with a large presence in Italy – has submitted a non-binding bid to acquire troubled Dutch e-bike firm VanMoof.

title: Sanofi offers up to $140M in new collaboration with Aqemia
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Aqemia, a Parisian deeptech startup that applies quantum-inspired physics and generative AI to the field of drug discovery has announced a collaboration with pharmaceutical giant Sanofi valued at up to $140 million.

title: Estonian clean energy production startup Efenco raises €4.5M for its "fire on turbocharge" technology
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Efenco, a Tallinn-based deeptech become cleantech startup, has raised €4.5 million to further develop its “fire on turbocharge” technology.

title: UK consortium awarded £1.38m for sustainable aviation fuel (SAF) project
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, a clean alternative fuel consortium of Carbon Neutral Fuels, io consulting, and Mission Zero Technologies has been awarded £1.38 million from the UK Department for Transport’s Advanced Fuels Fund competition for their “Advancing Sustainable Aviation via Power-to-Liquid and Direct Air Capture” project.

title: French revenue-based finance company Silvr secures €200 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian fintech scaleup Silvr has secured an additional €200 million in debt funding. The working capital is aimed at supporting further growth in the company’s home market of France as well as building upon the acquisition of German competitor Uplift1 earlier this year.

title: How the Amsterdam Dance Event shapes the global electronic music scene
author: Kayvan Nikjou
summary: Amsterdam Dance Event, also affectionately known as ADE, is the Slush of the electronic music industry. What started out as a weekend gathering of just over 100 individuals back in 1996 has grown in size, scope, and reputation, and today welcomes seasoned industry professionals, aspiring artists, musictech startups, and everyone in between from all four corners of the globe to the largest event of its kind anywhere.

title: French EV charging infrastructure builder Driveco drives home €250 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian EV charging company Driveco has raised €250 million in a new funding round. The investment is the largest to date in the EV charging point sector in France and marks the company’s second onboarding of capital.

title: Wirtualna Polska Holding Group acquires audiobook company Audioteka for €17M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Warsaw-based mobile and multi-language audiobook company Audioteka has been acquired by Wirtualna Polska Holding Group, in a deal worth nearly €17 million for 100% shares, Tech.eu has learned.

title: Austrian biotech HeartBeat.bio secures €4.5M for cardioid drug discovery platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Austrian biotech startup HeartBeat.bio has secured a € 4.5 million Pre-Series A round.

title: Finnish influencer marketing platform Boksi has acquired Monochrome
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Helsinki-based influencer marketing platform Boksi has acquired Finnish creative influencer agency Monochrome for an undisclosed figure as it expands its offering in Finland. The deal allows Boksi to offer customised influencer campaigns and content production in addition to its existing influencer campaign management services.

title: LocalGlobe leads £8 million pour into green building material Concretene
author: Dan Taylor
