summary: LocalGlobe has led an £8 million seed investment into Concretene, a product developed by the UK’s Nationwide Engineering Research and Development (NERD) in partnership with the Graphene Engineering Innovation Centre (GEIC) at The University of Manchester that aims to do more with less through better material.

title: Swedish analytics startup Steep raises €4M Seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Stockholm-based Steep has raised a €4M seed round for its business intelligence tools.

title: Moniti raises $450K boost for deskless team management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Polish startup Moniti has raised $450,000 (1.8 million PLN) to accelerate the development of our app for managing deskless teams.

title: Ecommerce One preserves its hold on the ecommerce sector as it acquires Makaira and Marmalade
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Ecommerce One has acquired e-commerce marketing suite provider Makaira GmbH and ecommerce consultancy Marmalade GmbH. Both companies were founded and operated by Joscha Krug. Krug will remain in his MD roles at both and whilst becoming a minority shareholder in Ecommerce One.

title: Amsterdam's Roboat raises €550K for autonomous boat tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Amsterdam autonomous boat tech company Roboat has raised €550,000 in funding from LUMO Labs and SHIFT Invest.

title: OpenFi secures £500,000 Pre-Seed for conversational AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Conversational AI platform OpenFi has raised £500,000 in pre-seed funding round. Led by Bijan Morvaridi with additional investments from Fortune Green Capital Ltd and Foundation Ventures Ltd, the funding will be used to expand the product team, build the second version of the platform, integrate with a UK financial institution, and work closely with the FCA on AI compliance.

title: “Without the UK we’re not in business”, says Pleo boss, as the Danish unicorn soft launches in US
author: John Reynolds
summary: "Without the UK we’re not in business”, says the UK boss of Danish expense management unicorn Pleo.

title: Playtika to acquire Azerion Youda Games portfolio in deal worth up to €150M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following the egg-on-its-face acquisition of Rovio that never was, Israeli mobile games and interactive entertainment house Playtika has signed a definitive agreement to acquire the Euronext-listed digital advertising and entertainment media platform Azerion's Youda Games oortfolio for an initial cash consideration of €81.3 million. Including an earnout based on the performance of the acquired business, the total consideration could amount to a deal worth up to a maximum of €150 million.

title: Carbon Maps secures additional €3M in Pre-Seed funding for food industry climatetech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Carbon Maps, a Parisian climatetech startup specifically catering to the food industry, has today announced the addition of €3 million to the company’s Pre-Seed funding round.

title: Finland: Sustainability and innovation for shaping global technology trends
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Fueled by a combination of world-class education, a strong culture of research and development, and government support, Finland has cultivated a dynamic environment for startups and established tech companies alike.

title: Altrove raises €3.7M for to develop rare earth alternatives
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Deeptech startup Altrove has raised €3.7 million in a Pre-Seed funding round led by Contrarian Ventures, alongside Emblem and strong angel investors like Thomas Clozel (CEO Owkin), Julien Chaumond (CTO HuggingFace) and Nikolaj Deichmann (3Shape).

title: NOLD raises €1 M Seed funding for its sustainable fashion resale platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today UK fashion resale peer-to-peer startup NOLD has successfully raised €1 million in Seed funding.

title: Female Foundry partners with Google for AI incubator
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Female Foundry has partnered with Google for Startups Cloud Program to provide eight female-founded companies going through its six-week Visionaries AI Incubator Programme access to Google resources.

title: UK edtech Grasp raises $4M to 'accelerate human learning'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK edtech start-up Grasp has raised a $4M Seed funding round. The round was led by Balderton Capital and will be used to hire talent in product, data science and engineering, as well as further develop the platform.

title: VDS brings together over 12,000 tech enthusiasts from 91 countries at the City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The sixth edition of Valencia Digital Summit has yet again exceeded all expectations by bringing together a staggering 12,000 professionals from 91 countries. This exceptional international turnout marks the second consecutive year that the event has broken its own attendance record.

title: Spain’s Top Doctors gets €8 million for its platform to access medical specialists
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Spanish medical platform Top Doctors has access to up to €8 million in 'non-dilutive' funding from Mars Growth Capital and Liquidity Group. This funding will help Top Doctors 'grow organically' as they offer digital services to medical teams and services in order to better meet the needs of patients.

title: Italian crypto exchange Young Platform cements French trading licence
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Turin-based crypto exchange and tuition service Young Platform has launched in France following news it secured an operating licence from the French financial markets authority.

title: Gendo secures $1.1M for Generative AI for Architects
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Gendo, a generative AI platform for architects, has raised $1.1M and emerged from stealth. Gendo's proprietary platform turns architectural designs into visualisations, as well as add and edit details from scratch based on text prompts.

title: Robotics startup Cartken raises $22.5M to advance autonomous navigation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German-founded robotics navigation software startup Cartken has raised $22.5 million in aggregate funding with the latest $10 million financing round.

title: Forestay II ILP secures $220M in second fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: VC firm Forestay has announced the successful closure of its second fund, Forestay Capital II ILP, securing $220 million in commitments.

title: Beyond Weather's AI-driven long-range weather forecasting bags €250k from LUMO Labs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: LUMO Labs today announced an investment of €250,000 in Vrije Universiteit (VU) Amsterdam spin-out Beyond Weather to further develop its AI technology for long-range weather and impact forecasting.

title: eAgronom raises €10M Series A2 round to boost sustainable farming practices
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: eAgronom, the Estonian agriculture-focused climate tech company helping farmers adopt sustainable practices has secured €10 million in its Series A2 equity round.

title: Pleo partners with HSBC
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Fintech Pleo has secured a €40M debt financing facility from HSBC Innovation Banking which will see the two companies provide some partnered services.

title: Investors in unicorn Pleo snap up secondary shares as valuation recovers after billions wiped off value
author: John Reynolds
summary: Investors in Danish spend management fintech Pleo snapped up secondary shares in the fintech unicorn earlier this year, as its valuation recovered “slightly" after billions were wiped off its value.

title: Seaya Andromeda, Southern Europe's first Article 9 climatetech fund raises €300M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Madrid investment firm Seaya has closed Seaya Andromeda — the first Article 9 climate-tech fund based in Southern Europe — at €300 million.

title: Kuva Space's hyperspectral camera tech attracts €16.6M in funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish Earth observation company Kuva Space has raised a €16.6 million Series A funding round which will see its team double in size, expand to the US market, launch of its AI analytics platform, and further development of the company's space tech.

title: Austrian startup develops life-saving rapid blood sepsis diagnostics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: One in five deaths worldwide is caused by sepsis, the body’s life-threatening response to a bloodstream infection.  The infection-fighting processes turn on the body, overshoot and result in the need for amputation or multi-organ failure.

title: Tree.ly secures €5M Seed for European carbon offset projects
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Carbon offset startup Tree.ly has secured €5 million Seed investment.

title: Finematter's €2.6M funding injection bolsters circularity in the jewelry industry
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, jewellery marketplace Finematter announced the successful second close of its Seed round, bringing the total raised to €2.6 million.

title: Former Qonto and Swile executives' startup Pivot raises €20M for European expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian procurement automation startup Pivot has today announced the raise of €20 million in a Series A funding round. Founded by former Qonto and Swile  C-suite executives, Pivot intends to use the investment to further accelerate its growth trajectory and continue European market expansion.

title: Decade Energy raises €3.6M to decarbonisation of logistics fleet
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Decade Energy, the French logistics electrification and energy management service provider, has raised €3.6 million in Seed funding to accelerate the decarbonisation of logistics fleets.

title: Dutch fintech Fero raises $3M to reduce checkout abandonment of online purchases
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch online payment solutions provider Fero Payment Science has raised a $3 million seed round from Coatue, Volta Ventures and Antler.

title: Highland Europe leads $22M funding for Wirepas' low-cost, low-energy scalable IoT networks
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Tampere-based IoT firm Wirepas has raised $22 million in a funding round led by Highland Europe with participation from Amalfi and IQT, and previous investors ETF Partners, KPN Ventures, Vito Ventures and Vesa Laisi.

title: Sweden's Done says job done on €630k for its vetted home repair job marketplace
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Swedish vetted home repair and improvement job marketplace Done has secured a fundraise of 7 million Swedish koruna (€628,900), courtesy of the state-owned venture capital firm Almi Invest, says local tech news source Digital.

title: KARRI raises £775K for smart walkie-talkie for kids
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: KARRI, a startup developing a smart walkie-talkie for children, has raised £775,000 in Pre-Seed funding.

title: Neural Concept raises $27M for ML-powered 3D product design software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Neural Concept, a provider of deep learning software for 3D product design of machines at Airbus, Bosch, General Electric, Subaru and F1, has raised a $27M round on top of its previously raised $11M.

title: Octopus backs Ocergy in an effort cheapen wind farm construction
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Octopus Energy's investment arm has closed a deal with Ocergy to expand floating offshore wind farms. Parties expect that the deal will help floating offshore wind farms around the world become more cost-effective due to Ocergy’s research capabailities and hyperlocal supply chain.

title: Squirro acquires Synaptica to integrate GenAI and data visualisation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Squirro, a leading Swiss-headquartered global SaaS platform specializing in enterprise-ready generative AI, search, and business insights, proudly announces its acquisition of Synaptica, a renowned US-based SaaS provider of enterprise taxonomy management and knowledge graph systems.

title: How VictoriaMetrics' open source approach led to mass industry adoption
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: One of the most compelling aspects of a startup is its ability to solve perpetual painpoints, especially in software development. A startup has found a novel way to get its software into the hands of thousands of developers, thanks to its open source status.

title: Teylor acquires creditshelf in a quest to dominate European lending
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swiss-headquartered lending platform Teylor has acquired the German SME financing platform creditshelf. The transaction is structured as an asset deal, whereby Teylor will purchase the key operating assets of creditshelf AG.

title: ISPTech raises €2M for green spacetech propulsion systems
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: InSpacePropulsion Technologies (ISPTech), a spin-off from the German Aerospace Center (DLR) has raised €2 million in Pre-Seed funding.

title: How MioMedia leveled up its (i)game with ReferOn
author: Tech.eu
summary: Today's affiliate marketing space is thriving. With an average 12:1 return on ad spend (ROAS) and 4 in 5 brands increasing their affiliate marketing budgets every year, the industry grows more attractive by the day for all involved parties.

title: German digital tax platform Taxfix enters UK market with TaxScouts acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German digital tax filing platform Taxfix has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire UK accountant-assisted digital tax filing company TaxScouts.

title: Kvantify secures €10M Seed funding for quantum computing powered drug discovery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Danish Quantum software startup Kvantify, has announced the successful closure of a €10 million Seed round.

title: Citibox raises €80M to expand smart mailbox network in Spain
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Spanish small mailbox startup Citibox has raised €80 million in debt funding, led by Growth Credit Partners (London) and CoVenture (New York), to expand its network of smart mailboxes throughout Spain.

title: Woola secures €2.5M funding to replace plastic with sustainable packaging
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Estonian sustainable packaging company Woola announced a funding round of €2.5 million.

title: Spanish edtech Bcas closes €17M round
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Edtech platform Bcas has closed a €17M round, spearheaded by MyInvestor and Actyus (Andbank Group’s venture debt fund). The capital will be used to reinforce Bcas’s position in Spain and expedite its international expansion.

title: Quantistry secures €3M funding for quantum-based chemical simulations
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Chemical simulation startup Quantistry has announced the successful closure of a €3 million funding round. The Berlin company has developed a holistic computational platform which integrates quantum technologies, physics-based simulations, and machine learning.

title: Reducing waste and decarbonising pharma supply chains SkyCell bags $57M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swiss-based firm SkyCell has raised a $57 million funding round. The investment was provided by M&G's Catalyst Fund and will see its temperature-controlled hybrid containers and technological solutions support pharma supply chains globally.

title: Parisian customer data company mediarithmics raises €7 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Paris-based customer data platform mediarithmics has collected €7 million in its latest funding round, bringing its total investment to €20 million.

title: Female founders in Europe to European investors: Hire more women
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: A new report published by Antler spoke to 43 women founders based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Sweden, and Norway about their recent experiences when interacting with angel and VC investors.

title: Intelligence provider FE fundinfo acquires fintech Dericon
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Financial data company FE fundinfo has acquired Dericon, a wealth management fintech.

title: Storyblok secures $80M for its CMS software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: CMS provider Storyblok has closed its $80M Series C round, bringing the total amount raised to $138 million.

title: Camion raises €2.7M for EV charging analytics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based Camion has raised €2.7M to scale the deployment of electric vehicle charging.

title: E-motorbike NOVUS aims to become the  Apple of mobility with fresh funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Germany mobility electric motorbike startup NOVUS announced funding this week, led by 468 Capital. The startup aims to redefine urban mobility and attract non-motorbike riders.

title: Permira to acquire majority stake in BioCatch
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Digital fraud detection and financial crime prevention startup Biocatch has announced that Permira Growth Opportunities II, a fund advised by London-based private equity firm Permira, has agreed to acquire a majority position in the Company.

title: a16z-backed ComplyAdvantage acquires US company Golden
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: ComplyAdvantage uses AI and machine learning to parse through a continuously updated database of entities to give clients the most accurate 360-degree view of financial crime risk. As clients respond to alerts, a feedback loop continuously enriches the insights ComplyAdvantage provides. The company has five global hubs in New York, London, Singapore, Cluj-Napoca, and Lisbon.

title: AI and data infrastructure dominate Runa Capital's annual open source startup index
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week international venture capital firm Runa Capital released the latest annual Runa Open-Source Startup (ROSS) Index, a regularly updated ranking of the top-trending open-source startups.

title: Madrid-based HRtech startup Shakers raises €6M to simplify team building
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Shakers, a Madrid-based hrtech startup looking to reduce the friction faced by companies when building external teams, has raised €6 million in a Seed funding round. The company aims to use the investment to up capacity to extend its client base, both domestically and internationally.

title: Cluby raises €2.9M to digitally connect restaurants and customers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Restaurant startup Cluby raises €2.9M to enable every restaurant to connect with its customers digitally

title: Nu Quantum raises £7M in Pre-Series A funding round for quantum networking
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Nu Quantum, a Cambridge-based quantum networking company, has raised £7 million in what the company is deeming a Pre-Series A funding round. Following the completion of 2020’s £2.1 million seed round, Nu Quantum says that the investment will be used to accelerate product rollout in conjunction with continued recruitment activities, as well as strengthening academic and corporate partnerships.

title: Greece fights wildfires with €20M investment in OroraTech detection and monitoring from space
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Greek Ministry of Digital Governance has announced a  €20 million investment in four thermal satellites and a wildfire system with the German thermal intelligence provider OroraTech.

title: Vertex launches $555M bid to acquire Swedish firm Pagero Group
author: Dan Taylor
summary: American tax and compliance automation software maker Vertex has launched a cash bid to acquire in full Sweden’s Pagero Group in a deal valued at $555 million. The per-share offer represents an approximately 71 percent premium to Pagero’s closing price on December 12, 2023.

title: Italian payments platform Sibill secures €6.2M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Milan-based fintech Sibill has secured €6.2M, which will be used to further developments of its payments platform. The funding was raised across two tranches.

title: Databricks invests in Mistral AI, integrating Mistral AI’s models into its platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, San Francisco data intelligence company Databricks announced a partnership with and participation in the Series A funding of French generative AI provider Mistral AI. Mistral AI has raised over €505 million in funding, most in its first year of commercial operation. Databricks and Mistral AI now offer Mistral AI's open models natively integrated within the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform.

title: Finnish startup Kausal secures funding to boost climate action plans in cities
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish climate action plan platform Kausal has raised €880,000 in a Seed funding round which includes investment from Innovestor and Zubi Capital. The funding will increase sales and marketing efforts in the DACH region and North America.

title: Vybe, the French challenger bank catered to teenagers, has been picked up by London's Twig, self-described "bank of things"
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-based Twig is carving an extended European presence for its circular fintech offering, focused around its integrated e-checkout service that lets e-retailers accept automated valuation tickets for pre-owned goods traded in by their customers.

title: The State of European Tech 2023: Consistent, long-term growth
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It's that time of the year when venture capital firm Atomico, in partnership with Orrick, HSBC Innovation Banking, Slush, and a host of data providers, releases its annual report on the State of European Tech.

title: Iceland's legacy banks face being "disrupted into oblivion" unless embrace fintechs, says top fintech boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Iceland’s legacy banks face being “disrupted into oblivion’ unless they embrace digital change and work with the country’s fintechs, according to a leading Icelandic fintech professional.

title: Berlin's Likeminded secures additional €1.5M for digital mental health solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based B2B digital mental health solution provider Likeminded has raised an additional €1.5 million to add to a previous Seed funding round. Earlier this year the healthtech startup closed a round of €5.9 million. It also acquired fellow Berlin mental health startup whylab.

title: The anthesis web: Anytype raises $13.4M to restore the Internet
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Offering a beacon of hope in an otherwise haze of sacrificed privacy, data, and control, Berlin-based Anytype has raised $13.4 million in a funding round led by Balderton Capital.

title: Coca-Cola backs Airhive’s direct air capture tech in 1000-tonne pilot
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Airhive has announced the close of its first investment round, which will support the delivery of one of the largest direct air capture (DAC) pilots in the world.

title: Bolt closes €220M revolving credit facility: a step towards IPO
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Bolt, the global shared mobility business, announced today that it has closed a debut €220 million syndicated revolving credit facility (RCF). Given strong demand, the RCF was upsized during syndication and oversubscribed. The company has previously raised €2 billion in funding.

title: AI-powered Sorted secures £1.65M to tackle global recycling crisis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sorted, a London-based recycling tech company has raised £1.65 million in Seed funding.

title: Acto raises €3.7M for sales decision intelligence platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: B2B decision intelligence platform acto, announced that it has raised €3.7 million in Seed funding today. Acto helps B2B sales teams tackle the challenge of data handling and decentralisation, which can lead to staff being overloaded with complex, difficult-to-understand and hard-to-process data.

title: University of Oxford, Imperial College London and the University of Cambridge led the UK in filing patents and startup spin outs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Research released this week by intellectual property law firm Mathys & Squire shows that patents are rising as universities seek to commercialise the output of their research programs.

title: Helsinki's HappySignals raises €12M for human-centric IT transformation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Helsinki IT management company HappySignals raised €12M.

title: Visma makes third acquisition of 2024 with MyCompanyFiles
author: Lucy Adams
summary: SaaS Visma has acquired MyCompanyFiles, a French document exchange platform for accounting firms. This is Visma's third acquisition in France this year in a continuation of its attempt to capture French market.

title: Swedish Hypertype scores €600,000
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Sweedish startup Hypertype, founded in 2021, has secured SEK 7M in a round led by ButterflyVentures and Bust. The company plans to expand and focus on marketing and sales of its AIservice that automates customer communication.

title: Metafuels raises €8M  Seed funding to turn green methanol into sustainable aviation fuel
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Metafuels, the Swiss developer of a sustainable aviation fuel compatible with existing aircraft, announced it has raised €8 million in Seed funding.

title: Thomson Reuters puts its hat in the ring to buy Sweden's Pagero for $627M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today brings the news that Thomson Reuters has offered to buy Sweden's Pagero Group for 6.4 billion Swedish crowns (about $627 million). In the deal, Thomson Reuters acquires 100 percent of the shares of Pagero Group for SEK 40 in cash per share.

title: The Earlybird gets the interview: A chat with seasoned VC investor Christian Nagel
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Dr. Christian Nagel is a co-founder and partner of Earlybird, a technology investment powerhouse with more than €2 billion under management.

title: Healthtech startup Aware launches publicly — now live in Berlin and Hamburg with Frankfurt opening soon
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following a successful private beta programme that involved some 2,000 participants, Berlin-based Aware, a healthech startup focusing on ridding the planet of chronic diseases via blood and health tests, is today officially launching to the general public in both Berlin and Hamburg. According to the startup, a testing facility in Frankfurt am Main is slated to open in the near future.

title: Harnessing startup innovation to support European healthcare staff
author: Guest Writer
summary: For many citizens across the continent, it may be easy to forget we’re recovering from a pandemic now we’ve entered 2023.

title: European startup funding down more than half at $45B in 2023
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Released today, Atomico's State of European Tech 2023 report highlights that total capital investment into the European tech ecosystem in 2023 is on track to reach around $45 billion, representing a decrease of more than half (55 percent) from the record year of 2021 (when the ecosystem reached over $100 billion for the first time), and around 38 percent compared to 2022 (with a total of $82 billion).

title: 'It's frightening how concentrated this industry is': Scott Galloway on Europe, new media and breaking up Big AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Crowned 'The Howard Stern of the business world' by The New York Times, Professor Galloway teaches Marketing at NYU Stern School of Business and hosts Pivot and The Prof G Podcast.

title: Montinutra's innovative use of forest sidestreams attracts €2M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Finnish biochemical company Montinutra announced it has raised €2 million in Pre-A funding led by Metsä Spring, a corporate venture unit of Metsä Group, with a syndicate of private investors also participating.

title: Ten European fintechs quietly going about the business of doing the business!
author: John Reynolds
summary: Founded — 2018, Sweden

title: ‘Scamdemic’-fighting Signicat acquires Icelandic SmartWorks
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Global anti-fraud software provider Signicat has acquired SmartWorks, an Icelandic company that facilitates e-signatures, in the hope of consolidating its reach among potential Nordic customers. The move is set to bolster Signicat’s digital identity services that verify and protect the online accounts and credentials of individuals and other businesses.

title: Nova Credit partners with Nottingham Building Society to transfer foreign nations' credit history
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Today, Nova Credit and Nottingham Building Society have announced a fintech partnership, merging their two products to enable newcomers to the UK to access and leverage their overseas credit history for the first time when applying for mortgage finance to buy homes in the UK.

title: PeppercornAI raises £3.25M to help insurance keep up with AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Insurtech PeppercornAI has raised £3.25M in a round from Wealth Club, EHE and Angels Invest Wales.

title: ThinkSono's AI ultrasound guidance gets £2.1M to enhance DVT diagnosis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-German medtech company ThinkSono has announced that it has secured £2.1 million in its latest funding round. The company has raised approximately £5 million to date.

title: UK's Pebble raises £5 million to roll out flexible childcare into more cities
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Childcare in the UK is a big problem, especially where it concerns working parents. A poll of more than 20,000 parents, executed by parenting advocate Mumsmet a couple of years back, revealed a third of them devoted a greater share of their budget to paying childminders or nurseries than they did on rent and mortgage bills.

title: NBG open new factory for cellulose production at commercial scale
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Nordic Bioproducts Group has opened a new facility in Lappeenranta, Finland in order to produce microcrystalline cellulose and other cellulose derivatives at commercial scale.

title: BBVA partners with OpenAI to utilize ChatGPT for market analysis
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Financial services group BBVA has partnered with OpenAI, allowing employees to use ChatGPT’s APIs for market analysis and decision-making.

title: London's Butternut Box nears unicorn status with latest £280M investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based direct-to-consumer dog food brand Butternut Box has raised £280 million in its latest funding round. The capital is expected to aid the company in furthering the brand’s presence in both Europe and further afield.

title: Hexa's new initiative aims to break the 'dead-end VC trajectory' for startups
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Only 15 days after the announcement of a successful raise of €20 million, today Paris-based Hexa launches a new initiative to fall under its purview, Hexa Scale.

title: Fintechs "thrilled" over spot bitcoin ETF approvals
author: John Reynolds
summary: Fintechs have broadly welcomed the long-awaited decision by regulators to approve the first US-listed ETFs to track bitcoin, seen as a landmark moment for the crypto industry.

title: TheyDo Secures $34M for journey management platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The journey management platform TheyDo announced an additional $34 million in funding today. Netherlands-based TheyDo was founded in 2019 out of the need for a solution to move beyond mapping customer journeys in large static documents to a live platform that enables a bias for action.

title: “Much, much harder” to launch a UK challenger bank today compared to 10 years ago, says Atom and Metro founder
author: John Reynolds
summary: It is "much, much harder” for a UK challenger bank to launch today than it was ten years ago, according to the founder of two of the most celebrated UK neobanks.

title: Aiming to harness solar photons to accelerate satellite propulsion, Paris-based Gama prepares New Year's ride on SpaceX payload
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Gama, a Paris-based New Space startup specialising in solar sails that could allow satellites to travel faster and enable more cost-effective missions to deep space, is expecting its first payload to depart for low Earth orbit from SpaceX's commercial launch facility in coming days.

title: 2023 is a tough year to work in tech but an influx of foreign talent and successful post-unicorn startup employees offers hope
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This year, Venture Capital firm Atomico released the ninth edition of its annual "State of European Tech' report. It offers many interesting insights into the state of employment in the European tech scene based on a detailed survey and in-depth interviews.

title: CARÁ Health raises €620K for prenatal and postpartum support
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: CARÁ Health has today announced the raise of €620,000 in a Seed funding round. The startup bridges the maternity support gap by providing mothers with a library of evidence-based information, curated product suggestions, targeted podcasts and masterclasses, and personalised support services encompassing prenatal care guidance, postpartum support, and expert advice on specific health concerns.

title: Zurich-based PriceHubble strengthens UK presence with WhenFresh acquisition
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Property data solutions firm PriceHubble, has acquired UK's residential property data firm WhenFresh to strengthen its UK offering in performance data solutions for real estate and finance. This marks its second UK purchase, having acquired Dataloft in March 2023.

title: Tech stack: Why going native sets you up for success
author: Matej Pfajfar
summary: For years, people have talked about technology reinventing banking and financial services. Most banking, fintech, or tech events will have a keynote or a panel discussion on the topic, and while the technology/opportunity of the day changes (we used to talk a lot about mobile, these days it is more about GenAI), the same message surfaces over and over: the transformation is indeed underway, but the sector’s ability to embrace technical innovation is at best uneven.

title: Pet health insurance provider Barkibu raises $5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Galician pet tech firm Barkibu has raised $5 million in a new funding round. Offering both pet insurance and a preventative services app, naturally complete with an AI-powered component, Barkibu intends to use the new funds to further improve and expand its services.

title: €42M funding fuels Stargate Hydrogen's green energy advancements
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Estonian green hydrogen company announces the successful completion of its seed funding round, raising €42 million.

title: German mental health platform neurocare raises €16M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: TVM Capital Healthcare has announced a €16M investment into Munich-based neurocare, a digital therapy platform for mental health treatment.

title: HawkCell raises €5M Series A for veterinary MRI plug-and-play tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, medtech startup HawkCell, a Lyon-based startup developing a unique MRI plug-and-play solution for veterinary use, announced it has successfully closed Series A funding. Currently, MRI technology for veterinary use is very limited. HawkCell has developed an innovative system incorporating both hardware and software solutions to augment animal MRI imaging.

title: EU's quantum tech Flagship pays dividends — Commission
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: The EU Commission has updated us on the quantum tech ecosystem around Europe.

title: goodcarbon raises €5.25M for carbon credits platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based goodcarbon has raised €5.25M for its long-term carbon credit portfolios.

title: Gresham House Ventures invests £6.3M in DDS divisions, ActiveNav and Actfore
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Gresham House Ventures has invested a further £6.3 million in data governance leader ActiveNav and cyber incident solutions provider Actfore, two divisions of Data Discovery Solutions (DDS).

title: Trans-FUR-ming a visit to the vet: Rex's journey to unleash a better user experience
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: I never thought visiting a vet would be such a funny experience. I walked into a clean, modern clinic that could have been a hairdresser. Lowlights and blonde wood. But there's free dry pet food, and water was easily accessible.

title: Hexa raises €20M, aims to launch 30 companies per year by 2030
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Back in 2011, Paris-based eFounders brought forth a novel approach to entrepreneurship, that of a startup studio. Not quite an accelerator, not quite an incubator, rather, the eFounders model is one centered around building companies in parallel and as a team.

title: Bitfinity raises $7M to advance Bitcoin and Ordinal assets' on-chain security
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Web3 infrastructure firm Bitfinity Network announced it has secured over $7 million in funding to advance its mission to establish off-chain infrastructure for Bitcoin and Ordinals (Ordinal Inscriptions, similar to NFTs).

title: Zendesk to acquire Berlin's Ultimate for AI customer support
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, US company Zendesk announced its plans to hire Berlin service automation company Ultimate to deliver a complete AI offering to help brands transform customer experience (CX) into a competitive advantage. With Ultimate, Zendesk will offer AI agents with enhanced intelligence that is not just reactive but proactive problem solvers, complementing human expertise.

title: AI is ready to solve really big chicken-and-egg problems
author: Imran Ghory
summary: As a data scientist-turned-investor who loves to dive deep into technical questions with founders and companies, what excites me most about AI is how it can bring solutions to real-world problems.

title: Volvo's former CTO Henrik Green joins the team at Einride
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Freight mobility company Einride has announced that Henrik Green will join its team as General Manager, Autonomous Technologies – Green brings with him nearly three decades of experience within the mobility sector including having held roles as Chief Technology Officer and Chief Product Officer at Volvo Cars where he 'played a pivotal role in the transformation of the company's product portfolio and technological advancements', in Volvo's transition to electric vehicles.

title: Poland makes case to be Europe’s next tech powerhouse
author: John Reynolds
summary: “One of the reasons I am so bullish on Poland is because Poland is where Israel was at in the mid-1990s," says Dominik Andrzejczuk, an entrepreneur-cum-evangelist for the Polish tech scene.

title: LabGenius secures £35M Series B funding for therapeutic antibody discovery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: LabGenius, a drug discovery company pioneering the use of machine learning for the discovery of novel therapeutic antibodies has closed a £35 million Series B financing round.

title: Springer Nature acquires Slimmer AI's science division
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based global academic publisher Springer Nature has acquired the science division of Dutch venture studio Slimmer AI. Financial details have not been disclosed.

title: Navigating Europe's new visa entry requirements
author: Claudia Gualdi
summary: Most travellers looking to enter the EU will soon need to obtain electronic travel authorizations before travel. The US, Canada, Australia, and South Korea already ask travellers eligible for visa-free entry to get pre-travel authorisations. It's important to clarify that an ETA is not an E-visa.

title: Ada Ventures report: 10x more LP capital goes to VC funds owned by men
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The report "Women in UK Venture Capital“ covers the gender breakdown of Venture Capital (VC) funds that receive Limited Partners (LP) capital was published by the venture firm Ada Ventures and supported by Diversity VC and Google Cloud. It’s a first-of-its-kind report and examines the gender breakdown of where Limited Partner Capital has been invested in recent years.

title: Symbe secures £1.2M Pre-Seed for AI-driven business case creation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Symbe, an AI-powered platform that helps sales teams win more deals by automating the creation of tailored business cases, has raised a £1.2 million Pre-Seed roundThe company has been founded by a trio of serial entrepreneurs. Martin Blinder (CEO) and Thomas Laurbjerg (CRO), who scaled digital healthcare company Tictrac before exiting in 2022, and machine learning expert Xavier Wilders, who founded SME budgeting platform Beyond Labs, which was acquired in 2023.

title: Nordics and Baltics "hotbeds" for fintech innovation, says Copenhagen Fintech CEO
author: John Reynolds
summary: The Nordics and Baltics are currently “hotbeds" for fintech innovation, according to the CEO of Copenhagen Fintech, Denmark’s fintech innovation hub.

title: DeepTechXL raises €110M, a boost for Dutch deeptech startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Venture builder DeepTechXL today raised €110 million through contributions from ASML and pension fund PME. The Eindhoven investment fund invests in young companies that focus on new, complex technologies such as photonics, complex mechanical engineering, semiconductors, and quantum computing. Since its founding in 2022, the fund has already invested in eight companies, including SuperLight Photonics.

title: UK Women tech founders are taking a bigger share – 24 percent capital increase in 2022 compared to 2021
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Many studies support the fact that there are numerous gaps between men and women, particularly when it comes to ICT. Whether it is the number of girls who receive a STEM education or when it comes to funding of women founders of IT startups and scaleups, the differences are vast.

title: APEX Capital nets second close of  €50M for athlete-driven venture fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sports-focused investment firm APEX Capital announced the second close of its €50 million Elite Performance Venture Capital Fund today.

title: 10 Italian startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: While traditionally known for its strengths in industries like fashion, automotive, and manufacturing, Italy is increasingly making its mark in the technology sector.

title: Turning up the heat on fast-moving consumer goods market research, Algori raises €3.3 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Madrid-based martech startup Algori has raised €3.3 million in a seed round. Offering fast-moving consumer goods companies ultra granular data, the investment will be used to further develop the startups’ data science tech as it scales business in Spain and eyes additional Western European market entries.

title: AI copilot LegalFly secures over €2M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Belgian legaltech startup LegalFly announced the successful completion of its Seed funding round, raising over €2 million.

title: Intel acquires French EV SoC and software maker Silicon Mobility
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bringing its “AI everywhere initiative into the automotive market.” industry titan Intel has announced the acquisition of French fabless silicon and software company that produces system-on-chip (SoC) solutions for EV energy management, Silicon Mobility.

title: HeavyFinance raises €50M to boost sustainable farming in Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Agricultural small and medium-sized businesses are being given a boost today under a plan by HeavyFinance, a marketplace that connects investors with European farmers. The company is raising €50 million for a private credit fund to help advance agriculture's decarbonisation in Bulgaria, Latvia, Lithuania, Poland and Portugal.

title: OpenAI-backed 1X scores $100M, a16z shores up UK insurtech, and over €2.2B was invested in European tech this week
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €2.2 billion and over 20 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: Gresham House Ventures  backs Ozone API with £8.5M for open finance API
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today growth equity investor Gresham House Ventures announced a £8.5 million investment in Ozone API, an open banking API platform founded by the team that designed open banking in the UK.

title: Become fluent in freedom: Mark Ukraine Independence Day by learning Ukrainian
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Learning a new language is hard — and often boring. There’s a variety of apps on offer, but all face the challenge of retaining users as well as providing education that transfers from the screen to real-life scenarios.

title: Doctolib acquires Aaron.ai, maker of AI-based telephone assistance
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French healthtech company Doctolib today announced its acquisition of  Berlin company Aaron.ai, maker of AI-based telephone assistance solutions for medical practices.

title: Blockchain startup Micapass tackles crypto money laundering with €240,000 investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Micapass, a Vilnius-based startup offering an on-chain AML compliance solution, has raised €240,000 in order to continue development of its KYC product for DeFi protocols and web3 users.

title: How new regulations and investor focus force startups to be sustainable from day one
author: Erik Kolehmainen
summary: Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) measures are here to stay, and from the regulatory side, the EU has shown they mean business. First, with the introduction of the taxonomy for sustainable activities, with last year’s long-awaited implementation of the Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation (SFDR) following, investors are under increasing pressure to justify their image as sustainable by proving it.

title: Video: Babbel CEO Arne Schepker on 'real' language learning, failing forward after a botched 2021 IPO, the AI hype cycle, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Babbel, the edtech company behind the eponymous popular subscription-based online language learning service, is not exactly a spring chicken anymore. Born back in 2007, the scale-up has - weirdly - picked up no more than $30 million in funding to date, despite running one of the biggest subscription-based language learning businesses on the planet.

title: Cin7 acquires Inventoro to expand analytics capabilities
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cin7, a provider of inventory management software, has acquired Czech Inventoro, which uses AI for sales forecasting and replenishment.

title: Salesforge's AI-copilots get  $500K funding to replace sales underperformers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: If you're working in sales and are underperforming — watch out. An AI-copilot could soon replace you by helping a far leaner team to seal the deals.

title: Power of AI is "happening right now" says Klarna boss, as AI-powered chatbot carries out work of 700 people
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO of Klarna says the power of AI is “happening right now”, after revealing data showing Klarna’s Open AI-powered chatbot handles two-thirds of Klarna’s customer service chats.

title: Nordic Science Investments launches a new era for academic deeptech spinouts
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees the launch of Nordic Science Investments (NSI), a VC fund aiming to propel research-based deep tech across the Nordics.

title: Scottish Systal Technology plants US base in Tampa, Florida
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Glasgow-based cloud provider Systal Technology Solutions is opening a new operations centre in Tampa, Florida, where new projects will be based as it expands commercial operations in North America.

title: Ciao Italia! Founders Factory and Fastweb launch venture studio & accelerator
author: Dan Taylor
summary: For all the news that Tech.eu brings you, a shockingly small percentage (1.25 percent) of it pays mention to startups and/or tech news originating from Italy.

title: Veloce Media Group sizes up to $50 million via GEM Digital
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following the launch of its blockchain utility and governance token, VEXT, London-based Veloce Media Group has received up to a $50 million investment to fuel continued growth. Comprised of gaming and racing platform Veloce Esports, and Extreme E outfit Veloce Racing, the Group has garnered over 35 million subscribers, nearly one billion monthly views across multiple digital platforms including YouTube and Twitch, and claims to be the world’s largest racing gaming media network.

title: Shifting roles, shifting priorities: Will legaltech continue its surge in 2023?
author: Leanne Aldrich
summary: Technology’s continued role in the legal sector has seemed a formality. Back in 2021, most firms had adopted some form of technology due to the pandemic. And as recently as August 2022, the UK government announced another £4m investment into its LawtechUK programme to modernise the sector. On the face of it, digitisation in the legal sector seemed to be progressing full steam ahead.

title: Cabify accelerates sustainable mobility goals with €15M loan from BBVA Spark
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Spanish mobility company Cabify was granted a €15 million loan from BBVA Spark to enable it to accelerate the implementation of its strategic plan, which is focused on driving sustainable urban mobility with profitable growth.

title: Smart thermostat Themo helps Finns earn money by participating in balancing the grid
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The smart thermostat cleantech company Themo today passed the requirements for Fingrid's Frequency Containment Reserve in Finland.

title: Tiamat's sodium-Ion  battery technology attracts investment from Stellantis Ventures
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Stellantis Ventures, the corporate venture fund of Stellantis N.V., announced strategic investment in Tiamat, a France-based company developing and commercialising sodium-ion battery technology.

title: Velocity Clinical Research adopts UK-based nmible's fintech for efficient patient stipend payments
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Nmible, a UK-based fintech startup focusing on the clinical research sector, has announced a strategic partnership with American biotech research giant Velocity Clinical Research.

title: Sony Innovation Fund adds $500K to Scriptic's Seed round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Sony Innovation Fund has topped up Scriptic’s Seed fund with a $500,000 investment bringing the company’s total seed round to a close at $8.7 million. The UK-based media tech firm's latest funding announcement was in June when it raised $5.7 million in a round which was led by BITKRAFT Ventures.

title: Language app Pratika raises a $35.5M Series A round
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Language learning app Pratika has secured $35.5M in Series A funding led by Blossom Capital.

title: Next stop, London: Tech.eu Summit elevates its game in 2024!
author: Tech.eu
summary: We're thrilled to announce that the third edition of the Tech.eu Summit is set to take place on May 16 and 17, 2024, at the prestigious Old Billingsgate venue in London.

title: This week in European tech: Monzo rumoured to be raising £300M, EA Elektro-Automatik acquired in $1.45B deal, the Tech.eu Summit, and more!
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €521 million. We saw over 15 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: By helping displaced Ukrainians learn a new language, Berlin's Babbel has taken its chance to make a difference
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: More than 500,000 Ukrainian users have registered for German, English and Polish language learning from Berlin-based Babbel, which put plans into action to create a free service for Ukrainians shortly after the war broke out.

title: Kinderheldin and keleya to merge into womens' health super-platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Femtechs keleya and Kinderheldin, both digital platforms that provide support for pregnant women and mothers, are merging to operate under the brand name keleya.

title: PAI Partners buys out Ardian's stake in Audiotonix for £2B
author: Lucy Adams
summary: PE firm PAI Partners has acquired a majority stake in UK-based Audiotonix, who supplies audio mixing products such as decks and soundsystems, while Ardian retains a minority stake and management of the company.

title: Yendou: The Salesforce for life sciences R&D teams, secures $1.3M in pre-seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Yendou, a Berlin-based startup that self-bills as Salesforce for R&D teams in life sciences, has secured $1.3 million in a pre-seed funding round. The investment will allow the startup to scale its clinical operations automation platform and meet a growing demand from pharmaceutical and biotech companies.

title: eComID closes €2.75M Pre-Seed to transform retail returns and sustainable shopping
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week retailtech startup eComID announced the successful closure of an oversubscribed €2.75 million Pre-Seed round.

title: roclub raises €4M for remotely operated diagnostics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: roclub has raised €4M for software that allows diagnostic imaging to be operated remotely. Speedinvest led the round with participation from FJ Labs, Better Ventures and strategic angels.

title: Branchspace receives £5M to enhance airline retail digitisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, growth equity investor Gresham House Ventures announces a £5 million investment into Branchspace, which works with airlines to enhance and transform their digital retailing capabilities.

title: Berlin-based ContractHero raises €2.15 million to ‘unlock efficiencies’ in contract management for SMEs
author: Fiona Alston
summary: ContractHero’s, B2B SaaS solution is taking contacts out of Google Drive or Sharepoint and into its smart contact management solution. It's enabling SMEs to fully realise the ‘hidden potential’ in their contracts by automatically analysing contracts and extracting key information – claiming its SaaS solution accelerates the contract digitisation process by more than 85%.

title: Michiel Boere swaps his UberEats for Remote work as he joins the team as CFO
author: Fiona Alston
summary: HR solutions company Remote has announced Michiel Boere as its new CFO. Boere joins the Remote team from Uber where he has held several positions, the latest being CFO of UberEats.

title: Andreessen Horowitz backs insurtech startup hyperexponential in $73M round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based insurance industry startup hyperexponential has today announced the close of a $73 million Series B funding round. The investment is aimed at supporting the company’s US market entry.

title: Landmine-detecting drone startup, Broswarm raises $100K
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Broswarm, a militarytech startup focused on mine detection, has raised $100,000 in funding. Broswarm is based in Vilnius, Lithuania, and was founded in 2023 by Ernestas Žvaigždinas, an exited founder, Karolis Žvaigždinas, a physicist specialising in machine learning programming, and Mindaugas Talaikis, an engineer.

title: ICO fines HelloFresh £140,000 for misleading marketing practices and data misuse
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Food box delivery service HelloFresh has been fined £140,000 by the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO) following an investigation that discovered 79 million emails and just over 1 million SMS messages sent by the company failed to meet regulatory requirements and violated the Privacy and Electronic Communication Regulations 2003.

title: Metris Energy's AI solar platform for commercial properties raises £2M Pre-Seed
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Metris Energy, the first AI-powered solar energy platform for commercial property owners, today announced it has raised £2 million in a Pre-Seed funding round led by Octopus Ventures and Aenu VC to transform how property owners assess, install, and monetise solar energy within their portfolios.

title: Enerpoly secures $8.4M grant for world's first zinc-ion battery megafactory
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today zinc-ion battery company Enerpoly announced it has been awarded an $8.4 million three-year grant from the Swedish Energy Agency, to establish the world's first megafactory to manufacture zinc-ion batteries.

title: Ex-Deepmind employees raise $220M for "AGI" model
author: Lucy Adams
summary: “H”, a global foundation model and “agentic” AI company, has thrown its hat in the ring as a challenger in the race towards “AGI” with a $220M Seed raise.

title: Tikehau Capital's €200M commitment to European cybersecurity
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian asset management group Tikehau Capital has announced the first close of a new private equity cybersecurity-focused vehicle at €200 million. According to the firm, this first close represents the largest vehicle of its type dedicated to digital security in Europe.

title: Helsinki-based AI knowledge management tool Wudpecker secures €330K in Pre-seed funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish AI-driven knowledge management startup Wudpecker has secured €330,000 in Pre-seed funding in a round which included investment from Trind VC, Accelerace and Sofokus Ventures. The funding round was initiated on the Node by Slush platform.

title: “We don’t have any intention to merge,” says CEO of Danish challenger bank Lunar following reports of a deal with Monzo
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO of Nordic challenger bank Lunar has distanced the bank from reports that it could merge with UK peer Monzo, saying “We don’t have any intention to merge”.

title: Turkish game developer Spyke Games secures $50M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Turkish mobile game developer Spyke Games today received an investment of approximately $50 million from Moon Ac:ve,  a company focused on game development.

title: Infogrid appoints new CEO and board members
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Infogrid, the SaaS which uses analytics to increase efficiency within real estate construction, has appointed a new CEO as it looks to scale.

title: Tapped by WB for the Barbie Selfie Generator social media campaign, Photoroom raises $43M in Series B round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Photoroom, a Parisian startup leveraging AI to put results traditionally reserved for skilled photo editors in the hands of any and all, has closed a $43 million Series B funding round.

title: Acuiti Labs receives investment for global expansion from Quilvest Capital
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Quilvest Capital Partners today announced its investment in Acuiti Labs, an SAP consultancy specialising in optimising the quote-to-cash process. The funding amount was not disclosed.

title: Terra One raises $7.5M for decentralised battery storage
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based battery storage startup Terra One has raised $7.5M in seed funding in a round led by PT1, an early-stage VC for real asset technology.

title: I4d Ventures raises €16M for Pre-seed fund supporting frontier technologies
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based I4d Ventures has raised €16 million for its Pre-seed fund. The fund will support ‘new frontier technologies’ like AI, climate, healthcare and computer vision.

title: Balderton report confirms founders deliver diminishing returns from ever increasing hours
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: To support founders and increase the chances of startup success Balderton Capital has launched a Founder Wellbeing and Performance Platform. The platform was created based on research among 230 founders as well as the firm's 20 years of experience investing in Europe’s entrepreneurs. The platform includes a tailored six-month health and nutrition program, peer-to-peer support, and on-staff executive support.

title: Estonian founded fintech Change secures €2 million to further expand crypto investment app
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Amsterdam headquartered crypto investment fintech Change Group AS have secured €2 million in funding from Swiss-based private equity firm Andromeda Capital Partners Suisse AG to further fuel its ambitions of being a major player in the market.

title: Quantum Systems raises €63.6M Series B becoming the first European company to raise over €100M on dual-use tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Munich AI-powered drone robotics company Quantum Systems announced the successful completion of its €63.6 million Series B funding round.

title: Naro raises $3M to transform company ETF and fund market
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, EFT fintech Naro announced the closure of their $3 million Pre-Seed round. Naro helps companies create their own investment products such as ETFs and index and money market funds without any operational or regulatory burden.

title: BBVA Spark backs Twinco Capital with €50M for sustainable supply chain finance
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Spanish green fintech Twinco Capital has secured a debt facility of €50 million from BBVA Spark. The facility will enable Twinco to support its customers in 'building sustainable and competitive global supply chains'. The firm also has debt financing relationships with EBN Banco de Negocios and Zubi Capital.

title: CardioSignal secures $10M Series A for industry-first smartphone tech for heart disease detection
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Medtech company CardioSignal this week announced the closing of $10 million in Series A funding.

title: UK startup Housr raises £1.5M of a planned round to tackle student housing crisis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Student living start-up Housr announced today that it has secured £1.5 million, 30 percent of a planned £5M round.

title: Capchase secures €105M credit facility for SaaS revenue acceleration
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Revenue accelerator platform for SaaS companies, Capchase, today announced it has secured a €105 million credit facility warehouse led by Deutsche Bank. This brings the company’s funding to over $1 billion in combined debt and equity financing since its founding in 2020.

title: Central Bank of Ireland approves Freemarket for European market entry
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based FX fintech Freemarket has been granted a payment institution licence from the Central Bank of Ireland enabling the company’s expansion to Europe. The B2B cross-border payments and currency exchange company now has market access to the entire European Economic Area (EEA).

title: Office space and services firm memox raises €2.8M for expansion in DACH
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Zurich-based meeting and conference rooms firm memox has raised €2.8 million in Series A funding to fuel further expansion of its office locations in the DACH region. The round was led by Swiss Prime Site and 41 Group and includes investment from others in the real estate, tech and investment banking sectors.

title: Open Finance is “most important thing” in financial sector, says Plaid’s new European boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Open Finance “is probably the most important thing going on in the financial sector right now”, according to the new European boss of US open banking firm Plaid.

title: Birdwingo raises €1.2M to teach European teens how to invest in the stockmarket
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Birdwingo is a New York and Prague-based fintech company that wants young people to invest for their future.

title: Polish startup ForActive secures over $1.6M for fitness payment and comms app
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: ForActive, a Polish company developing a payments and communication app for independent sports instructors, has raised over $1.6 million in a Pre-Seed round.

title: Making clean, scalable fusion power plants a reality: An interview with Proxima co-founder and CEO Francesco Sciortino
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Have a listen to our interview with Francesco Sciortino, whose deep tech company Proxima Fusion aims to build an entirely new generation of fusion power plants, using QI stellarators.

title: Greenlyte Carbon Technologies secures €10.5M for Direct Air Capture System
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Direct Air Capture startup Greenlyte Carbon Technologies (GCT) today announced the closing of a €10.5 million Pre Series A round.

title: FlexAI comes out of stealth with $30M Seed raise for increased compute
author: Lucy Adams
summary: AI compute company FlexAI came out of stealth yesterday with a $30M seed raise led by Alpha Intelligence Capital, Elaia Partners, and Heartcore Capital.

title: N-ink wins €1M from Voima Ventures Science Challenge for its IoT-transforming  conductive polymers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Swedish deep technology company N-ink was announced as the winner of a science challenge by Voima Ventures, an early-stage investor based in Helsinki and Stockholm.

title: London-based telco startup shaka rings up $1M in seed funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Officially leaving stealth today is London-based mobile telecommunication services provider shaka as the company announces a $1 million seed funding round.

title: Investors predict Europe's next unicorns at Tech Tour Growth
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: I recently had the pleasure of attending a Tech Tour Growth50 event hosted by Tech Tour in Paris. These curated European events allow startups and scaleups to meet key industry professionals and foster potential partnerships and funding.

title: Ukrainian-founded recruitment startup JobCannon raises $500,000 Pre-Seed investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, recruitment startup JobCannon announced a $500,000 Pre-Seed investment.

title: Mindfuel secures €3.75M Seed for data monetisation SaaS solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Data product management company Mindfuel, today announced the closing of a €3.75 million seed funding round led by Project A Ventures.

title: Keep an eye on 6 more European startups showcasing at CES this week
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: CES is an excellent place if you’re looking for innovative startups. And, as the final day of CES unfolds, anticipation for a celebratory beverage at an afterparty is palpable.

title: BUX CEO says he wants to protect neobroker from “too much" ABN AMRO influence
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO of a European neobroker startup recently acquired by Dutch financial services giant ABN AMRO says it’s his job to keep BUX protected from “too much influence from the larger organisation”.

title: Lithuania eyes European regtech glory
author: John Reynolds
summary: Lithuania is establishing itself as a European regtech powerhouse — a position the Baltic country hopes to cement by housing a new EU institution cracking down on financial crime.

title: OneStock raises $72M from Summit Partners to enhance omnichannel retail experience
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Toulouse headquartered OneStock announced a $72 million investment from global growth equity investor Summit Partners.

title: EQT Ventures leads €5M funding round for Irish-based employee benefits startup Kota
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Employee insurance and retirement benefits platform Kota, formerly known as Yonder, has raised a €5 million Seed funding round to see the Irish-based startup scale throughout Europe.

title: The Landbanking Group raises $11M in Seed funding for eco-fintech platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The Landbanking Group has raised $11 million in Seed funding. The round was led by BonVenture and André Hoffmann and included participation by 4P Capital, Vanagon, Planet A, the SUN Institute of the Deutsche Post Foundation and angel investors and family offices such as Prince Maximilian of Liechtenstein, Alexa Firmenich, Jan-Hendrik Goldbeck and Fabian Strüngmann.

title: Hiring across European tech startups is down nearly 40 percent
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: A new report on startup compensation, hiring, and growth rates published by hrtech Ravio reveals that hiring sprees at European tech companies are a thing of the past, and an increasing number of firms have shifted their focus towards retention.

title: Imec.xpand launches €300M fund for  semiconductor and nanotech startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Imec.xpand, an independent global venture capital fund, today announced the launch of a new €300 million fund to accelerate the growth of transformative semiconductor and nanotechnology innovations.

title: Seraphim Space launches second spacetech fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK-based spacetech VC Seraphim Space have closed their new fund Seraphim Space Ventures II LP (SVII).

title: Nostalgic photo-sharing app Lapse captures 100M memories monthly and raises $30M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Do you remember the days of travelling with a camera rather than using your mobile phone to commemorate your trip? For one founder, a decision to use a film camera rather than go digital resulted in a multi-million dollar business and a hoard of users.

title: Haiper emerges from stealth with $13.8M seed for video-generative AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week video-generative AI platform Haiper came out of stealth mode, announcing a $13.8 million seed round led by Octopus Ventures.This brings Haiper’s total funding to $19.2 million ahead of it, raising a Series A round in 2024.

title: Treefera raises $12M Series A for AI-driven environmental compliance solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Nature-based assert reporting company Treefera today announced a $12m Series A raise, led by AlbionVC. This raise comes just seven months after the company’s $2.2 million Pre-Seed.

title: ABB acquires Sevensense, driving the future of autonomous industrial robots
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, ABB announced that it has acquired Swiss start-up Sevensense, a leading provider of AI-enabled 3D vision navigation technology for autonomous mobile robots (AMRs).

title: Hamburg startup airfocus raises $7.5M for product management platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Hamburg-based startup airfocus closed a $7.5 million fundraising round, bringing the company’s total funding close to $15 million.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five - Your weekly European Tech recap
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Up this week:

title: Etc. rolls out digital platform for early detection of cardiovascular disease
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Etc., the digital and startup incubation hub of BT Group, launched the second phase of its NHS digital preventative remote care with a digital platform initiative designed to prevent, detect, and manage cardiovascular disease through early monitoring and pre-emptive intervention.

title: NeoTaste secures €21M in funding for restaurant discovery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Gastrotech app NeoTaste today announced the successful closing of its Series A funding round. The company has raised a total of €21 million, with €15.1 million secured as a Series A extension, adding to the €5.9 million raised six months prior.

title: London a fintech “behemoth”, says Plaid leader 🎙️
author: John Reynolds
summary: Last month, Singapore-based Nium announced that it had chosen London as its European HQ while US fintech Plaid has dual European headquarters in London and Amsterdam.

title: Siemens strengthens market position with Heliox acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Siemens AG completed the acquisition of Heliox, a technology leader in DC fast charging solutions, for an undisclosed sum.

title: SumUp raises €285M to expand payment products for small businesses
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today fintech company SumUp announced that it has closed a €285 million funding round led by Sixth Street Growth.

title: Imec raises €2.5B for advanced chip tech R&D pilot line
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Global R&D hub Imec Flanders today announced at its annual Imec Technology Forum in Antwerp (ITF World 2024) that it has raised a €2.5 billion investment to establish a new R&D pilot line for advanced chip technology and systems-on-chip.

title: London's Klu raises $1.7M for large language model application platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based large language model application platform Klu, has raised a $1.7 million Pre-seed funding round led by Firstminute Capital and included participation from a16z, Sequoia Capital, Craft Ventures, and Atomico and angel investors from Superhuman, IBM, Productboard and others.

title: The state of naturetech - Naturetech report 2023
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: To help and foster different initiatives with the aim to leverage nature and power the healthy ecosystem, but also to optimise infrastructure and safeguard a stable biodiverse future, Nature-based solutions play a crucial role. Their main goal is to encompass a range of actions designed to protect, sustainably manage and restore the natural or altered ecosystems, thus providing effective and adaptable solutions which will simultaneously enhance human well-being and support biodiversity.

title: ABN AMRO acquires Dutch neobroker BUX amidst cost-cutting measures
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following last month’s disclosure that the Amsterdam-based neobroker BUX had slashed 40 percent of its staff as part of cost-cutting measures and a retreat from the UK market, today ABN AMRO announced that it has agreed to acquire the company in full. Terms of the acquisition remain undisclosed.

title: Manchester startup Made With Intent raises £1.5M for eCommerce optimisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Manchester e-commerce startup Made With Intent has raised £1.5 million.

title: Uzbekistan's Tech Frontier: From Silk Road Legacy to Central Asia’s Silicon Valley Challenger
author: Tech.eu
summary: The Silk Road opened a dynamic commercial and cultural corridor between East and West which has in many ways defined the modern world. Uzbekistan stood at the centre of a global network of scholars, inventers, craftsmen and merchants, whose contact advanced our collective understanding of everything from science and medicine to philosophy and theology.

title: Dame Jayne-Anne Gadhia hits out at Anne Boden's criticism of Open Banking
author: John Reynolds
summary: Dame Jayne-Anne Gadhia, one of the City’s top businesswomen, has hit out at Starling Bank founder Anne Boden's criticism of Open Banking and said the technology will be transformative.

title: Startup founded by Amazon Alexa scientist looking to disrupt investment industry through AI raises $6.5 million
author: John Reynolds
summary: A Cambridge-based deep tech start-up founded by a former Amazon Alexa scientist called Theia Insights has raised $6.5 million as it looks to disrupt the investment industry through AI.

title: British Patient Capital invests $50.8M in Evolution Technology Fund III
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: British Patient Capital today announces a $50.8 million commitment to the third fund by Evolution Equity Partners, a specialist technology investor focused on cybersecurity and enterprise software companies.

title: Primetag secures €3.5M for its influencer marketing analytics platfom
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Portuguese data and martech company Primetag announced a €3.5 million co-led by Indico Capital Partners and Iberis Capital.

title: Glasgow is on a mission to become Europe’s largest Smart Things and IoT Hub
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This month sees the launch of a partnership between the UK Government, Glasgow City Council, and the Smart Things Accelerator Centre (STAC), which aims to make Glasgow into Europe’s largest smart things and IoT innovation hub.

title: Following government reforms, the UK is now the most attractive country in the G7 when it comes to employee stock options.
author: Dan Taylor
summary: With new government reforms introduced to the UK’s CSOP (Company Share Option Plan), the UK now finds itself in a highly competitive position when it comes to attracting the best talent in the world by offering employees a healthy financial stake in the companies they’re helping to build.

title: Patchworks receives £2M to boost e-commerce integration services
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London/Nottingham-based e-commerce integration platform Patchworks has added another £2 million in capital to its coffers; providing the firm with further fuel to drive innovation and the delivery of new features, as well as international expansion plans.

title: UK semiconductor sector gains access to €1.3B pot of funds from Horizon Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Good news for British semiconductor researchers, enterprises and startups, as the UK now has joined the EU’s ‘Chips Joint Undertaking’ This provides the UK semiconductor sector enhanced access to a €1.3 billion pot of funds set aside from Horizon Europe to support research in semiconductor technologies up to 2027.

title: Sir Elton John invests in Audoo's new $5M round for accurate music royalty payments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today musictech company Audoo secured a $5 million investment in its latest funding round, with investors including global music and business icons Sir Elton John and David Furnish, taking its total raised to $22 million.

title: Electric motorcycle producer STILRIDE pulls back the curtain on final design, reveals price
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Sweden’s STILRIDE has revealed the price and final designed of its electric motorcycle. Formerly known as the Sport Utility Scooter, the offering will henceforth be known as STILRIDE 1 (how much do you want to bet STILRIDE 2 is already in the works?) and will be available at a retail price of €15,000.

title: Europe’s AI dilemma: Protecting privacy without stifling startups
author: Gabriele Venturi
summary: How do we allow AI to do the incredible without delivering the terrible?

title: Belgian recruitment platform Jobtoolz acquires Hirehive
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Belgian-based recruitment platform Jobtoolz, announced its acquisition of Hirehive, an Irish Applicant Tracking System (ATS) provider.

title: Austria's competitive edge in AI: High living standards and rich talent pool
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London, Amsterdam, and New York are among the usual suspects when you discuss favorable places for setting up shop. They benefit from a well-educated workforce, a strong funding ecosystem, easy connections with other founders, and an attractive cultural scene.

title: Electric boat maker X Shore sees bow lift after €26.6 million raise
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based electric boat maker X Shore has raised another €26.6 million in a new funding round that sets a course to continue scaling its in-house production and accelerate US market growth.

title: AI marketing co-pilot Arcane raises $5M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI co-pilot for marketers Arcane announced that it has raised a $5 million seed round.

title: SumUp raises €1.5B in an oversubscribed round led by Goldman Sachs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees global fintech SumUp raise €1.5 billion from private credit lenders in an oversubscribed round led by Goldman Sachs.

title: Hyperjob raises €435k to bring marketing tactics to the recruitment process
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Riga-based Hyperjob has raised €435,000 in a funding round that will see the company launch a slew of new product features and continue its expansion across Europe and US markets.

title: Unseenlabs secures €85M for maritime surveillance tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Unseenlabs, a France-based company and global leader in maritime surveillance through detection and geolocation o signals from space, today announces the closure of a fundraising round of €85 million, bringing its funding to €112.5 million.

title: Swedish biotech Cellcolabs secures $8.7M for affordable stem cell production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Clinical-stage biotech company Cellcolabs today announced that it has raised $8.7 million, bringing its funding to $21.5 million.
