title: 10 Swiss startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Although Switzerland's startup ecosystem might not be the largest in Europe, it is widely recognized as one of the most innovative. Both government and private initiatives play a crucial role in supporting Switzerland's startup scene, offering various incentives such as tax benefits, funding opportunities, and accelerator programs.

title: Sateliot secures €6M for its 5G IoT nanosatellite constellation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Sateliot, the company launching the first constellation of low-earth orbit (LEO) nanosatellites providing 5G coverage for IoT, has secured €6 million in funding from Banco Santander.

title: Fitfck, the dating app for ‘fit as’ singles, launches with an OnlyFans connection
author: Fiona Alston
summary: This week London based start-up Fitfck launched its new dating app and we grabbed a word with, personal trainer turned tech start-up founder, Jamie Wykes-Hobday, after the launch.

title: THG and Maximo Group get it together in a ten year deal as 180 jobs are put at risk in Manchester with the closure of THG's OnDemand service
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Global beauty brands group THG PLC has announced this week that it will discontinue its OnDemand division - its print on demand solution - with Jon Robinson, North West Business Editor of Manchester Evening News reporting that 180 jobs are at risk. The paper also reports THG are closing cycling e-commerce site ProBikeKit.

title: Slovak software company Luigi's Box buys Czech competitor Persoo
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Slovak e-retail software company Luigi's Box announced the acquisition of Czech competitor, software company Persoo, for an undisclosed sum.

title: Tomorrow Things raises €1.5M for AI-driven digital twins
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI start-up Tomorrow Things has secured €1.5 million in funding to continue the development of an AI-powered Operating System for machines on the internet. Tomorrow Things is an intelligent automation platform that creates digital twins of technical assets.

title: MarketLeap's €1.5M funding boost to enhance global e-commerce operations
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Luxembourg-based e-commerce platform MarketLeap has raised an additional €1.5 million in Seed funding, taking its total funding to €2.6 million. The latest round includes Notion Capital, Kima Ventures and Motier Ventures, existing investor Expon Capital, and others.

title: Utimaco acquires data security solutions firm conpal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Aachen-based cybersecurity and compliance solutions platform Utimaco has acquired IT security solutions firm conpal GmbH.

title: This week in European tech: Flexible chips, Bitcoin rallies, and the EU AI Act stalls
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion and 10+ exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: "Lack of GenAI battle-tested scenarios" thwarting its use in financial products, says German fintech Solaris
author: John Reynolds
summary: Generative AI is playing a significant role in many industries, in some cases jet-rocketing productivity.

title: Belgian identity app itsme buys fellow Belgian multi-factor authentication firm nextAuth
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belgian identity app itsme has acquired the Leuven-based multi-factor authentication firm nextAuth in an undisclosed deal.

title: Metycle raises $5M in Seed round to expand scrap metal trading platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Metycle, a cologne-based trading platform for scrap and recycled metals has announced the successful close of a $5 million in a Seed funding round. According to the startup, the new investment will allow the company to expand to new geographies as it continues to further develop its technology and AI-based enhanced quality control measures.

title: April 2024 report: With €3.7B raised, year-over-year investment decreased 5 per cent
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: According to the Tech.eu database, European tech companies raised €3.7 billion over the course of April 2024 in some 320 deals.

title: Swiss no-code startup Viso bags $9.2M in Accel led round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: No-code computer vision platform Viso makes building and deploying vision-based enterprise applications quicker and simpler, taking something that might have taken months to build and reducing its timeframe to a matter of days.

title: Europe rising: Mistral AI's new flagship model outperforms Google and Meta and is nipping at the heels of OpenAI
author: Dan Taylor
summary: When talking tech and the giant, ubiquitous firms we all use daily — the vast majority are to be found outside of Europe.

title: PensionBee CEO Romi Savova to "divide" time between UK and US, as neo-pensions platform chases US glory
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO of PensionBee will divide her time between the UK and the US, after the neo-pensions platform yesterday (Monday) announced plans to expand into the US pensions market.

title: One Click LCA acquires Generative-AI maker Buildrz
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Environmental lifecycle assessment company for construction and manufacturing One Click LCA today announced its acquisition of Buildrz, French maker of generative AI software for real estate opportunity analysis and feasibility studies. Together, the companies will extend their offering and bring integrated feasibility studies, cost analysis, and carbon analysis powered by a generative AI to their users.

title: Rivero raises $7M for its payment simplifying SaaS solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Swiss fintech Rivero announced that it has raised $7 million in a Series A round.

title: Why now is the era of business resilience
author: Rodrigo Alier
summary: What happens to businesses when a crisis takes hold? For many, it’s not good news, with moves sometimes damaging the company in the long run – something we’ve seen plenty of in recent years with Covid, the cost of living crisis, and the majority of Europe on the verge of a recession. In the most extreme cases, we’ve even seen businesses strive to remain open amidst ongoing conflict – as they look to maintain a service that keeps consumers and employees connected to normality.

title: Velos Rotors snags $2 million to help its drone helicopter production take off in the market
author: Fiona Alston
summary: US-based, but with Greek origins (Xylokastro, specifically) drone helicopter start-up Velos Rotors has announced a $2 million Seed round by Marathon Venture Capital. Funds will help Velos further develop its drone tech and bring it to a level it meets market demand.

title: Sateliot's nanosatellite constellation connects IoT monitoring of US drinking water
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In a world where IoT seems ubiquitous, it's hard to imagine that large chunks of the world have no connectivity or, at best irregular, patchy, unreliable networks.

title: Dutch fintech Levenue expands portfolio with MidFunder acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Dutch financing company Levenue announced today that it has acquired MidFunder, a Zurich-based fintech that provides financing for companies with recurring revenue.

title: Estonian real-time soil insights startup Paul-Tech bags €1.4M to sow seeds in the UK market
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Tallinn-based agritech startup Paul-Tech gives farmers and land managers real-time insights to improve their soil management. The Estonian company has just raised a €1.4 million Seed round which will see it advance its product offering and fuel its expansion into the UK market.

title: Tapeeno taps in as UTC Group buys Wellet's Spanish arm
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Reading-based merchant services firm UTP Group has agreed to purchase the Spanish customer base from German company Wellet GmbH for an undisclosed sum.

title: Eligo Bioscience secures $30M Series B for its microbiome gene-editing technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees gene-editing company Eligo Bioscience announce a successful $30 million Series B funding round, led by Sanofi Ventures.

title: Zen Educate raises $37M Series B, the largest round in European edtech this year so far
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Zen Educate, an online marketplace that matches schools with the best available substitute teachers and teaching assistants, has successfully closed a $37 million Series B.

title: Belgian recruitment platform Jobtoolz acquires Hirehive
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Belgian-based recruitment platform Jobtoolz, announced its acquisition of Hirehive, an Irish Applicant Tracking System (ATS) provider.

title: Kleep raises €1.8M to reduce size-related retail returns with generative AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Paris generative AI start-up Kleep raised €1.8 million.

title: Urban Sports Club secures €95M investment for employee wellness expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Urban Sports Club has announced a €95 million investment round that will see the company further strengthen its employee benefits and wellness market position.

title: 10 Spanish startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In 2023, Spain's tech startup scene witnessed an unprecedented influx of investment. With €2.4 billion raised over 345+ deals, Spain takes a place among the 10 biggest countries in terms of the total amount raised.

title: Agritech xFarm Technologies merges with Greenfield and Spacesense to hone its Geospatial AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swiss-Italian agritech startup xFarm Technologies has announced its integration of Greenfield Technologies and SpaceSense, in the hopes of establishing itself as a leader in the key areas of regenerative agriculture and geospatial AI.

title: How Copenhagen-based startup Bucket helps product teams ship better features
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Every successful business, large or small, is, or at least should be, on the lookout to develop and introduce new features that add value to any number of products they offer. Ultimately, these new features should either further enhance the existing customer experience or draw in new customers.

title: AI martech startup Lakmoos raises €300k for market research simulation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Czech martech AI startup Lakmoos raised €300k Pre-Seed in funding from Presto Ventures.

title: Tquila launches its Paloma fund with $40m investment
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Technology and investment company Tquila has raised $40M for its Paloma fund, which will enable it to launch the fund and initiate investments in startups across a range of verticals and geographies. The fund is two-thirds of the way to its target of $60M.

title: Furbnow Secures £950k Pre-Seed Funding to Retrofit UK Homes for Energy Efficiency
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, UK climatetech startup  Furbnow announced a £950k Pre-Seed investment.

title: How to turn local products into global ones
author: Dmitry Kudrenko
summary: Twenty years ago, my friends and I achieved our old dream — to create products that would improve the world. In our case, it started with the tech sphere, an outsourcing company. From that moment, we knew we’d keep the ball rolling.

title: One Click LCA Secures €40M investment to decarbonise the world’s construction
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today,decarbonisation platform One Click LCA announced a €40 million investment.

title: Zymvol raises €1.3 million to spread enzymes everywhere
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Barcelona-based Zymvol wants to spread enzymes. Everywhere. From the pharma industry to the chemical and food industries enzymes, and the discovery and widespread usage thereof is big business.

title: Anaphite secures £1.6M for proprietary dry coating battery technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Bristol battery tech company Anaphite raised £1.6 million. This consists of £685k grant funding via the Investor Partnerships Future Economy programme and more than £880k committed by private investors, including Elbow Beach Capital, Wealth Club, Bristol Private Equity Club, and angel investors.

title: Vireo Ventures secures €20M from EIF for electrification tech startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today the European Investment Fund (EIF) announced that it is committing €20 million to the Vireo Electrification Fund I.

title: Magnotherm raises a cool €6.3 million to kick start mass production of refrigerators
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Darmstadt-based climate tech start-up Magnotherm has closed a €5 million Seed round to mass produce first sustainable refrigerator.

title: Scalable Capital secures €60M equity financing for its digital investment platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Scalable Capital, a digital investment platform in Europe, announced the closing of a €60 million equity financing. This brings the compay's funding to €326 million.

title: PitchBook's Q1 2024 European VC Valuations Report - Valuations, trends, and outlook
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Although it is very possible to see some changes by the end of the year, quarterly trends can set the tone for how valuations trend through the year.

title: Manufacturing IIoT platform Braincube secures €83M growth equity investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French manufacturing data software company Braincube announced it has raised €83 million of growth equity investment. This brings the company's funding to over €95 million

title: FineCell secures  €1 million from Metsä Spring for cellulose powder and hydrogels from pulp fibre
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Globally, the race to replace fossil-based ingredients in everyday products is central to many sectors. The chemical complexity of these products means that replacing ingredients requires a clear sustainability impact without compromising performance.

title: Lunar founder has "confidence" appeal against court decision will be successful
author: John Reynolds
summary: “Up to half of all cases are being turned over in the high court in Norway and we have had multiple second legal opinions now claiming that we also have more than 50 % chance of winning in the appeal. The initial verdict is difficult to understand.”

title: Biotech SeaBeLife awarded €1.5M to combat visual degeneration
author: Lucy Adams
summary: SeaBeLife, a biotech company developing drugs intended to block cellular necrosis, has been awarded over €1.5M for its SeaBeEYE project at the i-Nov 2024 innovation competition.

title: Fintech startup Embat raises $16M for corporate treasury management expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Embat, a Madrid-based fintech specialising in corporate treasury management, has secured $16 million in a Series A funding round that will drive continued international expansion plans.

title: Ukrainian SaaS startup Getpin secures $400K Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Ukrainian SaaS startup Getpin announced it has raised $400,000 in Seed funding from the Czech venture capital fund Presto Ventures.

title: Twinco Capital orders up $12 million to expand supply chain financing
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Madrid-based Twinco Capital has raised $12 million in an equity ($9 million) and debt ($3 million) funding round. Focusing on the fashion and retail industry, the female-founded startup offers working capital, particularly in the realm of supply chain financing, covering everything from the production cycle from purchase orders to final invoice payments. Since mid-2019, Twinco Capital has raised approximately $18 million in debt and equity funding.

title: Zunder banks €40 million loan to deploy fast charging on Spain's trans-European transport network
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Zunder, a Spanish operator of "ultra-fast" EV charging infrastructure, recently inked a €40 million loan deal with the European Investment Bank to fund a charging network along Spain's section of the trans-European transport network (TEN-T).

title: Explore your entrepreneurial side with CASSINI Challenges
author: Tech.eu
summary: In today's rapidly changing world, space has become an exciting frontier for generating revenues. When people hear "space business," they usually think of rocket launches and control rooms. However, there are many opportunities within the space industry that go beyond these initial impressions.

title: Cloudsmith secures $11M Series A2 for supply chain management software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cloudsmith, a Belfast-headquartered software supply chain management firm, announced $11 million in Series A2 financing.

title: Supply chain SaaS Nalanda acquired by Once For All
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Spanish supply chain risk and compliance management software platform Nalanda has been acquired by Once For All. Nalanda’s services will be integrated into Once For All’s larger product.

title: Moving beyond the primary metals trading market, Metycle raises €1.5 million to tackle recycled metals
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cologne-based trading platform for scrap and recycled metals Metycle has raised €1.5 million in an effort to homogenise and digitise the industry. The new ore will be used to further develop the platform and its operations, as well as instigate a recruitment drive that aims to assemble a team of approximately 20 industry specialists.

title: Smartschool's AI assistant tutor bags $1.5M Pre-Seed
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Smartschool, a Polish-US-founded edtech company headquartered in San Francisco, announced today that it has raised $1.5 million in a Pre-Seed round.

title: Digital pharmacy player Phlo snaps up UK arm of US-based unicorn Truepill
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London/Glasgow-based Phlo has acquired the UK arm of Hayward, California-based API-connected healthcare infrastructure provider Truepill for an undisclosed sum.

title: The UK government invests £45M in the public benefits of the quantum sector
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The UK government is today investing a total of £45 million in the UK's quantum sector - as part of its commitment to transforming into a quantum-enabled economy by 2033

title: Europe's original sustainability VC, ETF Partners, raises €285M in oversubscribed round
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: ETF Partners has announced the completion of fundraising of its fourth fund. The fund was oversubscribed at €285 million, compared to its target size of €250 million.

title: French Insurtech Orus to double team size after €11M funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French insurtech Orus has raised €11 million in a Series A funding round. The round was led by Notion Capital and VR Ventures/Redstone and includes Frst, Partech and Portage (who supported its previous €5 million funding round) and angel investment from Thierry Daucourt (Axa), Grégoire Rastoul (Leocare) and Albert Malagarriga Fandos (Elma).

title: Growing up with European tech: A decade of Tech.eu
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Today Tech.eu celebrates a decade of chronicling the development of the European tech community. In so much, I thought it most appropriate, and time-saving for me, to finally put down in words the answers and stories to the questions I'm most often asked about Tech.eu.

title: Pollen Careers raises £112,000 to diversify the job market
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Digital hiring and jobseeking platform Pollen Careers has raised £112,000 in Pre-Seed funding.

title: SaaS Payflows raises €25M Series A
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Payflows, an AI-powered SaaS finance platform, has raised €25M in Series A funding.

title: French billionaire Xavier Niel expands telecom empire with $1.26B Tele2 deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: French billionaire Xavier Niel is to acquire 19.8 per cent of Swedish telecom company Tele2 for $1.26 billion via Freya Investissement, an investment vehicle jointly controlled by French telecom group iliad and its Chairman and founder Xavier Niel through NJJ Holding.

title: Putting the gaming in iGaming — Soft2Bet's data-driven approach to gamification
author: Tech.eu
summary: The world of iGaming has often been associated with a one-size-fits-all approach, particularly as it relates to software and platform providers. Entangled by stringent regulatory demands and well-established, end-user expectations, B2B providers have historically struggled to push the envelope beyond adding new markets, games, payment options, and languages.

title: Nordic challenger bank Lunar raises €24.1M towards full-service banking goal
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Nordic challenger bank Lunar has made a significant stride in its financial journey, announcing a successful supplementary round that raised €24.1 million. This round, led by the bank's major existing investors, follows a two-part investment round in February that totaled €26.8 million, bringing the total raised in the past four months to an impressive €50.9 million.

title: Danish challenger bank Lunar trials voice-enabled AI-powered chatbot- voiced by CEO
author: John Reynolds
summary: Could an AI-powered voice-enabled chatbot answering a user's financial wellbeing questions voiced by a challenger bank’s CEO be the future of banking?

title: RYVER.AI secures  €1.3M Pre-Seed  to address bias in radiology diagnostics through generative AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today RYVER.AI, a Munich-based healthtech startup, secured a €1.3 million Pre-Seed round.

title: SaaS-based data protection startup Klarytee secures  £700,000 Pre-Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today cybersecurity startup Klarytee, has closed a £700,000 Pre-Seed funding round.

title: ikas raises $20M Series A for e-commerce expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: New generation e-commerce infrastructure ikas announced it has received $20 million Series A investment. ikas has developed an e-commerce platform that enables SMEs and entrepreneurs to open e-commerce sites without technical knowledge, making it possible to sell to the whole world by offering the opportunity to manage e-export processes.

title: ICT Hub Venture, TS Ventures, and Earlybird VC invest in B2B marketplace innovator, randevu.tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today ICT Hub Venture, TS Ventures, and Earlybird VC's Vision Lab joined forces to invest €325,000 in randevu.tech, a Berlin/Belgrade-based company transforming how enterprises build and scale B2B marketplaces and digital platforms.

title: Carbon-neutral courier Packfleet secures $10M for expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Packfleet, a tech-enabled carbon-neutral courier, announced that it has raised $10 million in Series A funding.

title: HomeCooks: from Facebook group to Seed investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: On March 23, 2020, in response to a rising number of COVID-19 cases, the government of the United Kingdom enacted a ‘stay at home’ order, a.k.a. the lockdown, that would change the lives and livelihoods of many.

title: Are regulators doing enough to prepare for AI’s impact on capitalism?
author: Tomas Navickas
summary: Lots of people are thinking through the implications of AI. Speculation ranges wildly, from the relatively trivial — “live” Elvis shows anyone? — to the end of humanity.

title: Cellugy raises €4.9M to reduce petrochemicals in cosmetics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Danish biotech startup Cellugy has raised €4.9M to replace petrochemicals in personal care products.

title: HV Capital leads $12.5M funding round for alternative lending tools provider kennek
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based fintech kennek has raised a $12.5 million Seed funding round led by HV Capital and includes participation from Dutch Founders Fund, AlbionVC, FFVC, Plug & Play Ventures and Syndicate One. The funds will allow kennek to grow its tech team and tighten its grip on the UK market while exploring European opportunities.

title: FineCell secures  €1 million from Metsä Spring for cellulose powder and hydrogels from pulp fibre
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Globally, the race to replace fossil-based ingredients in everyday products is central to many sectors. The chemical complexity of these products means that replacing ingredients requires a clear sustainability impact without compromising performance.

title: Unchained Robotics raises €5.5 M to unlock the future of automation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German startup United Robotics advanced its goal to make plug-and-play robotics accessible in industry with a €5.5 million raise. It brings the company's funding to €7.7 million.

title: Former Dyson engineer secures £1M for heat pump technology
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Bristol-based climate tech Nusku has raised £1M, including £700,000 from the UK government.

title: Turkish Midas raises $45m for retail investment platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Fintech startup Midas has raised $45m to enable retail investors in emerging markets to access crypto and mutual fund products. The $45 million fundraise was led by Portage and is one of Turkey’s largest ever Series A rounds.

title: Verdane's big bets on digital and decarbonisation: Edda III fund closes at €1.1B
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Norwegian private equity firm Verdane has announced the final close of its newest fund Edda III at €1.1 billion, a number that more than doubles the size of its predecessor, and according to the firm is significantly past its target size.

title: Finnish entrepreneurs launch Failup Ventures with €30M initial closing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Failup Ventures, a new globally operating early-stage venture capital fund, announced the first €30 million closing of its new early-stage fund of €50 million.

title: Localazy brings localised translation to brands in Poland
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Czech translation startup Localazy has expanded into Poland to enable businesses to reach their target markets through local languages.

title: The Tech.eu Summit London 2024 announces new speakers!
author: Lucy Adams
summary: With less than 3 weeks until the Tech.eu Summit 2024 kicks off in London, the time is nearing to polish up presentations, figure out which sessions are a non-negotiable and pinpoint who you need on your cap table.

title: Rolls-Royce partners with quantum computing startup Riverlane, and the NQCC accelerate materials discovery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, startup Riverlane announced a partnership with Rolls-Royce on a project to build computational tools to simulate large, complex materials on a quantum computer to aid in material development.

title: Algorithmiq's Aurora drug discovery platform validates scalable error mitigation at IBM Quantum Summit
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Algorithmiq, a Finnish scaleup developing quantum algorithms to solve the most complex problems in life sciences, revealed it has successfully run one of the largest scale error mitigation experiments to date on IBM’s hardware.

title: Recruiting platform StepsConnect raises €1M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: StepsConnect, a Milan based recruiting platform, has raised €1M in Pre-Seed funding from 40Jemz Ventures, Eden Ventures by IAG, Maggioli Ventures, Moffu Labs, GĔNĔRAS Corporate, Moonstone Fund, KF-Invest and Enzima12. Emiliano Maria Cappuccitti, Gianpaolo Naef, Massimo Cioffi, Dino Caprioni and Massimo Pagnetti - all angel investors who specialise in HRtech - also participated. The platform will prepare to raise Seed funding imminently.

title: Financial data enrichment services startup Triple raises $7.5M in Seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Fintech data enrichment services startup Triple has today announced the successful completion of a $7.5 million Seed round. Based in London, the startup intends to use the investment to continue the development of its fintech infrastructure services.

title: Estonian startup BotGuard OÜ raises €12M for web traffic control
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: BotGuard OÜ, an Estonia-founded cybersecurity software company has secured a €12 million Series A funding round. The company helps web hosting providers control traffic and protect their infrastructure from malicious threats.

title: Strong by Form raises $5.2M for an eco-friendly alternative to concrete and steel
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Strong by Form, a leading Spanish bio-composite technology company, is pleased to announce the successful completion of its seed funding round, raising $5.2 million.

title: How AR technology is empowering educators and students across Europe
author: Eirik G. Wahlstrøm
summary: Despite much talk about a revolution in Europe’s EdTech industry, very little has changed in Europe over the past decade — until now. We witnessed the transition from chalkboards to whiteboards to smart boards. But for the most part, traditional educational media, namely textbooks, have remained firmly in place.

title: Lassie's preventative pet insurance is now available in France
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Pet insurance company Lassie, today announced its expansion to France following rapid growth in Sweden and Germany.

title: UK's FourJaw raises £1.8M to boost manufacturing industry with IoT solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based IoT startup FourJaw has raised £1.8 million from NPIF – Mercia Equity Finance managed by Mercia and is part of the Northern Powerhouse Investment Fund, Mercia’s EIS funds and private investors.

title: Oxx closes second fund generation at $190M for European B2B SaaS companies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today ​​Oxx, a specialist investor in European B2B SaaS companies at the scale-up stage, has closed its second fund generation at $190 million.

title: Online-only insurtech Urban Jungle raise £11.2M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Insurtech startup Urban Jungle has raised £11.2M in its latest funding round led by existing investors. This round brings the total amount raised by the business to £43.3M.

title: Earlybird Health's ESG report one year on: how can VCs optimise for social impact?
author: Lucy Adams
summary: With €2 billion of assets under management across all fund streams, nine IPOs and 33 trade sales, Earlybird VC is one of Europe’s most active venture capital firms.

title: Last chance to grab discounted tickets for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: The clock is ticking, and the opportunity to snag discounted tickets for the much-anticipated Tech.eu Summit London 2024 is quickly running out. You have just three days left to secure your spot at this premier tech event at a reduced price!

title: Game-changers: The AI revolution in gaming
author: Barthélémy Kiss
summary: With AI making the headlines in 2023, you'd be forgiven for thinking that it materialised — out of nowhere — into tech and gaming just this year. The truth is, however, that AI has permeated the gaming industry and shaped video games since the very beginning. Until multiplayer games emerged from the neon-drenched arcades of the 80s, gamers played against AI opponents, like the paddle in the 1972 classic Pong. The capabilities of AI have snowballed since then, with recent developments ushering in the era of generative AI, which is set to fundamentally change gaming as an industry and a medium.

title: Investment firm Intuition comes out of stealth with €15M fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Investment firm Intuition has launched a €15M Fund to invest in startups ‘focused in consumer and culture’, which has closed its first round of funding. The firm has come out of stealth to announce the raise today and the capital will be awarded to over 40 startups with tickets between 100,000 and 500,000.

title: CIBC Innovation Banking invests in AI document processing platform Rossum
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: CIBC Innovation Banking announced today that it has committed non-dilutive funding to Rossum, an AI-powered transactional document automation platform.

title: GameTree raises $1.7M Seed funding to create safe spaces for gamers globally
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today GameTree, a gaming startup that unites gamers with new friends and games to play, has successfully secured $1.7 million in Seed funding.

title: Telness Tech raises €5M for US expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Telness Tech, whose software automates user interface design for telecommunications companies, has raised €5M in funding as it gears up for expansion into the US.

title: QuantumDiamonds raises €7M Seed funding for quantum sensing technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today quantum sensing company QuantumDiamonds announced the raise of €7 million in Seed funding led by IQ Capital and Earlybird.

title: Autonomo raises £2M Seed funding for checkout-free retail software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Checkout-free software company Autonomo announced it has successfully closed a £2 million Seed funding round today. The startup builds checkout-free software that enables retailers to convert existing stores into a cashierless shopping experience.

title: Global payments firm TerraPay raises $100 million to expand further across the LATAM and MENA regions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based TerraPay has closed its Series B equity financing round, raising in excess of $100 million in equity and debt financing, funding its proposed expansion further into LATAM and MENA regions.

title: Over €1B raised, 80+ deals, and new speakers announced for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and around 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Biotech Limula secures $6.8M for gene therapy
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Limula has raised a $6.8M seed round to lower costs of life-saving cell and gene therapy products.

title: ORCA Computing acquires GXC's integrated photonics division
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK quantum computing company ORCA Computing has announced the acquisition of the Austin, Texas-based Integrated Photonics Division of GXC.

title: Insights on a truly global scale: An interview with Rafal Modrzewski, co-founder and CEO of micro-satellite maker ICEYE
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Strap down for an interview with Rafal Modrzewski, co-founder and CEO of micro-satellite manufacturer ICEYE, recorded at the recent OTB Ventures Summit in Poland.

title: Why the 'cult of the entrepreneur' is leaving out climate entrepreneurs
author: Diane Gilpin
summary: We’ve been led to believe that the best entrepreneurs are those that bleed to show they're trying hard enough. That what matters most is making money and making it fast. But there are entrepreneurs that uphold different values. Climate entrepreneurs are deeply concerned by the climate emergency and realise the urgent need for solutions. Our motivation comes from protecting people and the planet as well as making a significant profit, but this purpose-driven position comes at a big cost — exclusion from traditional investment opportunities.

title: How a Slovakian startup transforms IoT with near-invisible, bio-compatible sensors
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: I attended the Sixth Sense Summit earlier this year, where I encountered some really interesting IoT tech that offers great promise for commercial IoT applications.

title: Munich's Smart Reporting secures €23M Series C for AI-supported medical software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Munich healthtech company Smart Reporting has successfully completed a financing round of €23 million, bringing its funding to over €60 million.

title: Parisian startup Bolero's approach to music rights royalties attracts €2M investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bolero, a Parisian music rights royalties marketplace startup, has secured €2 million in a seed round led by Dubai-based Web3 startup-focused XVC Tech.

title: The Emperor without clothes — Why do VC’s not deliver expected returns?
author: Pierre Suhrcke
summary: Venture capital has long been the lifeblood of innovation, providing startups with the essential funding they need to grow and scale operations. Yet, as we face ongoing uncertainty about the economy and interest rates, VC performance has been very disappointing. In this tough investment landscape, a number of challenges for VC funds have been brought to light and recent discussions within the investment community have raised questions about their effectiveness. It has become increasingly vital to investigate the ways in which their work must adapt if they will be able to produce good performance for their LPs.

title: The Tech.eu Summit London 2024 announces new speakers!
author: Lucy Adams
summary: With less than 3 weeks until the Tech.eu Summit 2024 kicks off in London, the time is nearing to polish up presentations, figure out which sessions are a non-negotiable and pinpoint who you need on your cap table.

title: Ovom Care secures €4.8M to personalise fertility care with AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Analytics-led fertility care provider Ovom Care has raised €4.8M in Seed funding. Ovom Care combines reproductive care with advanced AI solutions, using historical and real-time patient data to train algorithms that function as medical decision support tools supporting clinicians and embryologists making personalised decisions for the patient.

title: Hedepy closes €3.85M investment for its digital psychology and psychiatry platform
author: Cate Lawrence

title: London startup Phare Health raises £2.5M Seed for AI-driven hospital fintech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Phare Health, a London-based startup that is building fintech tools for hospitals in the UK and Europe £2.5 million Seed led by General Catalyst.

summary: Vectary, a design platform for creating and managing augmented reality (AR) assets, has announced the API release of its 3D no-code configurators. This allows other companies to design their own AR assets using Vectary's platform.

title: What Europe should do to identify tomorrow's billion-dollar startups today
author: Dr. Andre Retterath and Dr. Hendrik Brandis
summary: Innovation champions of the future create jobs, prevent the emigration of skilled workers, and thus ensure prosperity. To be able to identify and promote champion companies early on, artificial intelligence and data-driven approaches have become indispensable — but the difference is still made by humans.

title: Necture secures €7M Series A to optimise EV Fleet Management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: EV fleet management company Necture, formerly known as Ubiq, today announced it has secured additional funding, bringing its total Series A raise to €7 million.

title: The UK’s Climate Policy Radar and Chancery Lane Project named to Personio Foundation’s Impact Portfolio
author: Dan Taylor

author: Cate Lawrence

title: Europe accounts for 32 percent of global edtech deals in 2023

summary: In its fifth edition of the "European edtech funding report 2024" Brighteye Ventures provides an overview of the state of the edtech sector in Europe and provides context on a global scale.

title: ZeroQs raises €457K to expand smart shopping cart technology

title: Italian startup WeRoad raises €18M to scale millennial adventure travel

summary: WeRoad, a Milanese traveltech startup specifically targeting millennials, has secured €18 million in a Series B round. Operating in Italy, France, Germany, Spain, and the UK, the startup intends to use the investment to further develop and scale its offer, ultimately targeting a few more stamps in its passport, particularly that of the US.

title: EIC awards Riverlane £2.1M for quantum error detection
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cambridge-based Riverlane, a quantum startup developing error detection technology, has been awarded a £2.1M European Innovation Council (EIC) Transition grant backed by the Department for Science, Innovation & Technology (DSIT).

author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Vectoflow, maker of 3D printed flow measurement systems, is pleased to announce the completion of its Series A investment round, securing €4 million in funding.

title: This week in European tech: Big loans, US PE money moves in, and AI
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion. We saw over 10 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: Connected worker platform Zaptic lands industry connections via Hexagon's Sixth Sense Program
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: While Industrial manufacturing is at the forefront of digital transformation with IoT, additive manufacturing, AI, and automation, it's a challenging industry for industrial startups to gain traction within unless they come from the manufacturers they seek as customers.

title: HR tech unicorn Personio reshuffles Product and Technology department - 100 employees let go
author: Dan Taylor
summary: German HRtech firm Personio has confirmed a round of layoffs that will see approximately 100 individuals departing the company effective immediately.

title: Partners Group sells UK software maker Civica to Blackstone
author: Dan Taylor

title: Syntropic raises seven figures for light-based depression treatment

title: Investors back Callyope's AI tool for treating mental health conditions with €2.2M equity funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Callyope, an AI-based mental health monitoring company, announced a €2.2 million equity funding round.

title: AI-SaaS startup Frontnow raises €3.8M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-based tech startup Frontnow, which develops AI solutions for online retailers, has raised €3.8 million in its extended Seed financing round.

title: HeatTransformers has raised €15 million to expand its heat pump operations to Germany and the UK
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Utrecht-based HeatTransformers has raised €15 million in Series A funding to accelerate European heat pump installation by launching operations in Germany and the UK, and also increase its workforce.

title: Affiliate marketing software ReferOn surpasses 2.4 million registrations in its debut year
author: Tech.eu
summary: The iGaming industry reached a market value of $89 billion in 2023, thanks to the increasing prevalence of online gaming, the rise of mobile technologies, and the widespread adoption of affiliate marketing strategies.

title: Budapest-founded DiffuseDrive secures funds for advanced data generation tools
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Budapest-founded DiffuseDrive has raised undisclosed funding. Founded by Balint Pasztor, CEO, and Roland Pinter, CTO the company aims to solve the lack of data in AI-based computer vision development.

title: Danish-founded Ageras raises €82M for fintech acquisitions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Danish-founded fintech Ageras announced today that it has raised €82 million for new acquisitions in an oversubscribed private placement round that brings the company’s funding to almost €200 million.

title: The state of Insurtech Europe 2023 FY
author: Florian Graillot
summary: After a very specific year last year, a lot has been said about the state of VC investments and the startup industry. We, at astoryaVC, took a specific look at the European insurtech scene to highlight major trends at work in that space and anticipate what might come next regarding insurance innovation and technology.

title: January 2024 report: With €16.7B raised, year-over-year investment volume increases 255 per cent
author: Dan Taylor
summary: According to the Tech.eu database, European tech companies raised €16.7 billion over the course of January 2024 in some 326 deals.

title: UK SMEs can now bid for funding to train employees in AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The UK Government’s Department for Science, Innovation and Technology has that announced a pot of £6.4M will be made available for businesses to train their workforce to use artificial intelligence.

title: Raspberry Pi enlists support for a potential 2024 IPO
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today single board computer company Raspberry Pi gets one step closer to a London initial public offering (IPO) with its appointment of Peel Hunt and Jefferies to prepare documentation for a listing on the London Stock Exchange.

title: Challenger credit card Yonder snaps up nearly 10,000 paid members as free tier launches
author: John Reynolds

title: Northern Gritstone invests £2M in Floreon's sustainable bioplastics

title: Mixer Games has completed its bridge round at a valuation of $5M

title: Storytel to cut 13 per cent of workforce in bid for increased profitability
author: Dan Taylor

title: ArK Kapital gears up for US expansion, welcomes former Blackstone executive John McCormick as investor
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Today, Stockholm-based ArK Kapital has announced that John McCormick, former senior managing director at Blackstone, the world’s largest alternative asset manager, has invested an undisclosed sum in the company.

author: Cate Lawrence

title: Emerging from stealth, SAPI secures £7.5M equity fundraising for small business lending

SAPI – which stands for ‘Securities API’ – enables payment companies to offer business loans and other financing products to their clients, earning a revenue share while growing their payment ecosystem.

title: QA.tech raises €3M for quality assurance software

Carbonfact’s automated carbon management software tackles this issue with tools to help fashion companies measure, reduce, and disclose their products’ emissions in line with upcoming regulations, such as the EU’s Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD).

title: Peripass to equip 1000 sites with yard management software by 2030, following €7.5M funding
author: Cate Lawrence

title: UK law change allows patenting of key AI technology
author: Cate Lawrence

title: Ceartas raises $4.5M to detect AI-generated content
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Dublin-based anti-piracy startup Ceartas has raised a $4.5M Seed round, a follow-up to previous funding in 2021.

title: Final call for discounted tickets to the Tech.eu Summit London 2024!
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: In recent weeks, we've unveiled the first round of speakers who will grace the stage at the Tech.eu Summit London 2024, set to be held in the vibrant city of London. Scheduled for May 16th - 17th at the prestigious Old Billingsgate, this summit promises to unite the global investment and startup community for a dynamic two-day event.

title: A new government must collaborate with industry now for effective Buy Now, Pay Later regulation later
author: Iana Vidal
summary: A few weeks ago, the Labour Party published its long-awaited financial services review at its Annual Business Conference in London.

title: UK Energy giant OVO acquires EV charging app Bonnet
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today UK energy company OVO announced its acquisition of public EV charging consumer app Bonnet for an undisclosed sum.

title: RED horticulture secures $17M in Series A funding for dynamic greenhouse lighting
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today dynamic lighting company RED Horticulture closed a 17 million Series A funding round.

title: Fluid Topics raises €15M for GenAI-powered customer service
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Fluid Topics, a digital platform for automated customer service, has raised a €15M Series B round from Kennet Partners.

title: UK's Vectr7 to invest $25M in European climatetech startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Vectr7 Investment Partners announced today that it has secured a significant portion in initial commitments for its first fund to back early-stage climatetech startups.

title: SeeChange Technologies raises £8M for AI-driven retail solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today visual AI company SeeChange Technologies announced the closing of its series A funding of £8M

title: Iceberg Data Lab secures $10M Series A amid rising environmental regulation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, climate data startup Iceberg Data Lab (IDL) announced the first close of its Series A, raising $10 million.

title: Sustainable e-bike micromobility HumanForest secures £5.7M Series A extension
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, HumanForest, the parent company of e-bike operator Forest, has raised a £5 million extension to its Series A funding round, bringing its Series A total to £17 million.

title: GScan raises €3M seed to transform infrastructure maintenance with muon tomography
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the deep tech firm GScan announced it has raised a €3 million seed round from investors like Bolt founder Markus Villig, Japanese corporate venture funds, and existing angel investors.

title: HeatTransformers has raised €15 million to expand its heat pump operations to Germany and the UK
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Utrecht-based HeatTransformers has raised €15 million in Series A funding to accelerate European heat pump installation by launching operations in Germany and the UK, and also increase its workforce.

title: Driver interaction platform 4.screen shifts in €21 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Founded by three former BMW digital product specialists, Munich-based 4.screen has raised €21 million in a Series A funding round. In operation only since 2020, the new capital will be used to further develop the startup’s product offering and fuel global expansion efforts.

title: Behavio secures €2.25M in late Seed funds for brand measurement tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Behavioural brand measurement tech company Behavio has secured €2.25 million in late-Seed funding from Amsterdam-based Airbridge Equity Partners.

title: Monzo to top up funding round to £500m, says report
author: John Reynolds
summary: Monzo is reportedly topping up its recent fundraising round, with new investment from an early backer of Airbnb, bringing the overall funding round to around £500m.

title: Volt and Bumper collaborate to drive open banking adoption in UK car dealerships
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, global real-time payments platform Volt announced a partnership with Bumper, a payment platform for car dealerships, to harness the power of open banking and real-time payments so that consumers can pay for vehicle deposits, repairs, parts, services and even purchase vehicles outright.

title: Biomel secures £5.5M from IRIS Ventures for plant-based gut health products
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today plant-based gut health brand Biomel announced a £5.5 million investment from IRIS Ventures. Founded in 2017, the company is a UK market leader in plant-based gut health and produces a range of drinks, snack bars and powders from its manufacturing facility in West London.

title: Blue biotech firm FlexSea raises £2M for sustainable seaweed bioplastic production
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based blue biotech company FlexSea has raised a £2 million equity Seed round led by Indico Capital Partners, with the participation of RedRice Ventures, Btomorrow Ventures, Food Foundry, Vala Capital, ICON Capital, and Pente Capital.

title: Open Banking: where does responsibility lie — with financial institutions or the services layer?
author: Luke Massie
summary: Earlier this year, VibePay was contacted by the Open Banking Department of Starling Bank, with a message that puts fear into any emerging fintech start-up… “We’ve noticed a number of fraud attempts and we are cutting access to VibePay off for our users. Users of VibePay that have starling banks link will no longer be able to make or receive payments.”

title: Coliving specialist Habyt raises €40M Series C for global expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today coliving specialist Habyt has announced a €40 million Series C raise, bringing its funding to €80 million. Habyt offers flexible co-living, apartment rentals and hotels on a digital platform. It was founded in 2017 by Luca Bovone, and now operates globally.

title: Vivalyx raises €5.4M for new organ preservation liquid
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Vivalyx, a biotech company that produces a preservation liquid for optimal organ preservation before transplant, has secured €5.4M Seed round. This money will be used to finance the necessary clinical trials to achieve regulatory clearance and to start commercialization.

title: London-based regtech scaleup eflow Global secures £7M for market expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based regtech scaleup eflow Global has successfully raised £7 million in a Series A funding round that is expected to play a pivotal role in propelling the company's growth, with a strong focus on expanding its market presence in North America and the Asia-Pacific region.

title: CharitableBookings.com raises £5M to launch charity platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: CharitableBookings.com today launched its online SaaS platform with a premium offering, after raising £5 million from angel investors.

title: Freigeist Capital invests in BioThrust's bionic bioreactors
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees Freigeist Capital invest a seven-figure sum in the RWTH Aachen Spin-Off BioThrust.

title: Patch is patching up the UK high street and is now armed with a fresh £3 million to keep calm and carry on
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Take a stroll down just about any high street in the UK and you’ll notice a marked different façade. From sweet shops that used to play home to major retailers to flat-out boarded-up properties, the face of brick-and-mortar retailers has undergone a transformation over the past few years.

title: Q1 2024 shows a resilient quarter for European tech companies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: On paper, Q1 2024 looks like a good quarter for investments in Europe, which almost returned to Q1 2022 levels, albeit with a higher average ticket size.

title: Arm Holdings acquires minority stake in Raspberry Pi
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Softbank-owned Arm Holdings and Raspberry Pi have jointly announced a significant development in their longstanding collaboration. The former has acquired a minority stake in the latter, aimed at strengthening their ongoing partnership.

title: Simera Sense secures €13.5M for satellite earth observation solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Simera Sense, a provider of end-to-end optical solutions for the small satellite Earth observation industry, raised €13.5 million in its first growth investment round this week. The company, launched in South Africa and headquartered in Leuven, Belgium, offers a diverse array of 'off-the-shelf' high-resolution cameras ready for use by clients across the global small satellite industry.

title: MakerVerse raises €9.4 million to expand its on-demand manufacturing platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based MakerVerse has raised a €9.4 million Series A funding round to scale its AI-powered on-demand manufacturing supply chain platform.

title: qomodo raises £1.3M for advanced IoT cybersecurity solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: IoT cybersecurity company qomodo has raised a £1.3 million Pre-Seed funding.

title: Invest Europe's PE at work report: PE and VC-backed companies drive job creation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Job creation in PE and VC-backed companies rose by 7.2 percent in 2022, new data from Invest Europe reveals.

title: CitySwift secures €7M to enhance AI-optimised public transport routing platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Galway-based CitySwift has announced the close of its latest funding round at €7 million, bringing the company’s total funding amount to €14 million.

title: Monzo boss aims guns at HSBC and Barclays saying "consider" yourselves "challenged"
author: John Reynolds
summary: The boss of Monzo has aimed the challenger bank’s guns at UK legacy banking giants saying it aims to capture “hundreds of millions" of customers over time.

title: Esseco Group acquires majority shares in winetech company WATGRID
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today winetech company WATGRID announces that its majority shares have been acquired by an Italian multinational company, Esseco Group, which operates in the alcoholic beverage sector and wine products and services market,

title: Gilion gets a new CEO, Peter Thiel backs Monite, and €437M was invested in European tech this week
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €487 million, and around 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Statera Energy secures £300M in debt financing for green projects
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Statera Energy, a London-based energy company working in generation, battery storage, and hydro and green hydrogen projects, has secured up to £300 million in debt financing.

title: Gideon Valkin launches Andrena Ventures to power Europe's fintech spinoffs
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Gideon Valkin – formerly of Monzo, ClearScore and Entree Capital – has launched Andrena Ventures, a $12 million solo GP fund aimed at backing European fintechs at Pre-Seed and Seed.

title: Swiss car subscription service Carvolution secures €25M to expand fleet
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Swiss car subscription platform Carvolution has secured €25 million in working capital provided by Zuger Kantonalbank. According to Carvolution, the funds will be used to expand its fleet of vehicles and accelerate growth.

title: 18 European mobility companies join forces with a call to action for transport innovation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the EU Future Mobility task force launched a joint call to action, publishing a report aimed at propelling Europe as a leader in transport innovation.

title: Packmatic's digital one-stop shop for packaging supplies raises €15M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Berlin-based digital packaging marketplace Packmatic raised  €15 million Series A round.

title: Leadwind fund closes with a $250M commitment and first five investments
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Spanish investment fund Leadwind (from K Fund) has announced its final close with commitments up to $250 million. The initial aim was €200 million. Investors included in the gathering are Catalana Occidente, Estrella Galicia, Proeduca Summa, BBVA, Fond-ICO Next Tech and anchor investor Telefónica.

title: 10 German startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In 2023, German companies raised €9.1 billion over 757 deals. According to our Annual Report, these numbers put Germany in second place among European countries by the total raised amount.

title: Largest ever green loan in Europe: Northvolt raises $5B for expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Swedish battery manufacturer Northvolt announced on Tuesday that it has raised $5 billion to finance the expansion of both its original gigafactory, Northvolt Ett, as well as that of Revolt Ett, the company’s first recycling plant which is expected to begin processing its first materials soon.

title: Mahana Therapeutics acquires Berlin's Cara Care, expanding digital treatment for chronic conditions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, San Francisco company Mahana Therapeutics announced the acquisition of Berlin-based HiDoc Technologies, operating as Cara Care.

title: SMOK Ventures announces $25M fund for CEE region startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today SMOK Ventures announced a $25 million fund named SMOK II with plans to invest in 25-35 startups from the CEE region and diaspora.

title: VIVES IUF raises €70M to fund 10 science-based ventures
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today VIVES IUF (inter-university fund), a European high-tech early-stage fund, announced that it has raised €38 million in capital, bringing its total funding to €70 million. The European Investment Fund (EIF) committed €25 million alongside current and new blue-chip investors.

title: AI Safety Institute releases LLM safety results
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The UK Government's Institute for AI Safety has published its first AI testing results. Five leading models were screened to assess their cyber, chemical, biological agent capabilities and the effectiveness of safeguards.

title: Starling Bank's SaaS business can be bigger than the bank, says its boss, who has no ambitions to be a future Starling CEO
author: John Reynolds
summary: The youthful-looking boss of Starling Bank’s Software as a Service (SaaS) business has ruled himself out as a future CEO of one of the UK’s most famous challenger banks.

title: Veteran investor Anne Glover (Amadeus Capital) on Europe's chance to shine in deep tech
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Amadeus Capital Partners has been investing in technology-enabled products and services for nearly three decades. Founded by Anne Glover and Hermann Hauser in 1997, Amadeus has backed more than 190 companies and raised over $1 billion for investment to date.

title: Exoticca secures €4M loan from BBVA Spark for Latin America expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Traveltech company Exoticca has signed a €4 million loan agreement with BBVA Spark.

title: Monzo boss hails “Monzo magic” as UK challenger bank hits nine million plus UK retail customers
author: John Reynolds
summary: Monzo (today) said it has crossed the nine million UK personal current account milestone, saying it had hoovered up two million customers last year alone.

title: Revolut launches AI-scam feature to break scammers "spell"
author: John Reynolds
summary: Scamming is on the rise- be it ID theft, romance scams or Authorised Push Payment (APP) scams, where criminals dupe users to transfer money to a fraudster-controlled account.

title: Samphire Neuroscience secures  $2.3M Pre-Seed to launch menstrual health wearable
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week menstrual health gets a boost as medtech startup Samphire Neuroscience secured $2.3 million in Pre-Seed funding to launch Nettle, a medical-grade neurostimulation wearable.

title: VC Ventech makes strategic exit from Believe, announces launch of 6th fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ventech, an early-stage investor in French digital music company Believe, has sold its stake in the company.

title: London startup Climate Policy Radar raises $6.8M to leverage AI in climate policy tracking
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Climate Policy Radar, a London-based startup leveraging data science and artificial intelligence to track climate change policies and laws on a global scale, has today confirmed a raise of over $6.8 million in new funding.

title: Robinhood’s UK app gains users but lags behind Hargreaves Lansdown
author: John Reynolds
summary: Robinhood’s UK app is gaining users, but had only over half the estimated downloads of established rival Hargreaves Lansdown in February and March this year, new figures show.

title: January 2024 is turning out to be one flurry of activity after another for European tech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It's been a wild one out there this week. As one industry veteran said to me, "Wow there's a lot of news. It's like the industry switched it back on."

title: getpaid raises $6M Seed round tailoring B2B payments for marketplaces and platforms
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Giving businesses control of their online B2B payments, end-to-end payments solution for marketplaces and platforms, getpaid allows them to take charge of ‘payment splits, fees, and commissions involving multiple parties and geographies, while easily enabling payout timings with integrated payment and finance operations’. Marketplaces and platforms can scale their revenue and merchant base while increasing new service lines without increasing team size or internal complexity.

title: Empirical Ventures raises £8.25M for deep science
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Empirical Ventures, founded by alumni of Bristol spinout Ziylo, has raised £8.25m for its deep science fund, S/EIS. The firm wants to raise a total of £10M to provide more support to early-stage deep science startups.

title: Sleeptech Onera Health secures over €30M Series C funding for remote sleep diagnostics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Onera Health, a Dutch pioneer and leader in remote sleep diagnostic and monitoring solutions enabling clinicians to conduct sleep studies anytime, anywhere, announced the completion of its Series C financing round.

title: Micromobility operator Voi raises $25M and gains traction in new cities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, micromobility operator Voi announced that it had raised $25 million in an oversubscribed financing round. Additionally, the company has secured additional debt financing for vehicles.

title: BlueLayer raises $10M for carbon project development software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: BlueLayer, the end-to-end software platform for carbon project developers, announced today that it has raised $10 million across Seed and Pre-Seed investment rounds.

title: Global games publisher Kwalee expands reach with €1.5M investment in 8SEC
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Global games publisher and developer Kwalee announced today that it has invested €1.5 million in French mobile game studio 8SEC.

title: Pixevia's €1.5M funding boosts expansion of AI-powered stores in US and Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Lithuanian retailtech startup PIXEVIA announced today that it raised €1.5 million in new funding.

title: Capify lands £100M to provide loans to SMEs
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK-based alternative finance company Capify has today secured a £100M credit facility from alternative asset manager Pollen Street Capital.

title: Enterprise generative AI platform Orq.ai secures €2.3M in Pre-Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Amsterdam-based Generative AI platform Orq.ai has secured €2.3 million in Pre-Seed funding. Orq.AI is the first European all-in-one Generative AI platform for Enterprises to integrate with various Large Language Models (LLMs) and enable close collaboration across an organisation.

title: UK challenger banks see spike in alleged fraud cases as banks warn of "epidemic of scams"
author: John Reynolds
summary: Two of the UK’s most well-known financial startups have seen a spike in alleged fraud cases, amid banks warning of an “epidemic of scams”, new data show.

title: Healthcare sector attracts increased interest: Earlybird Health's new €173M fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Earlybird Health, the unit of Earlybird Venture Capital focusing on health industry investments, has today announced the final close of its latest fund at €173 million.

title: UK-Ukraine partnership boosts startups for dronetech innovation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When contemplating expanding your business, Ukraine may not immediately come to mind as a place of business.

title: The services industries of accountancy and law are now defined by AI
author: Frederik Pedersen
summary: It’s not a bad time to be Danish in 2024. Our Queen has just abdicated to make way for a new and younger King and in the business world we are known for much more than LEGO bricks and Carlsberg beer.

title: Firecell raises €6.6M Seed funding for 5G industrial solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Despite all the talk of digital transformation in French factories, barely 3 per cent of communications are wireless. Fortunately, 5G is here to help with a 5G solution that provides reliable, secure, high-performance stability and connectivity in demanding industrial environments.

title: 10x Banking founder Antony Jenkins says banking tech startup “on track” to triple client roster by 2025
author: John Reynolds
summary: The founder and CEO of UK banking tech startup 10x Banking says he has never lost his short a.

title: Crowdfunding platform Seedrs targets sport following restructure
author: John Reynolds
summary: Could Manchester United, Arsenal or Nottingham Forest raise money on a crowdfunding platform in the future?

title: Revolutionary Platform to Hire Tech Talents in Just 25 Days
author: Sargam Tiwari
summary: In a world where technology is always growing, companies need people who are really good with technology. But finding these people can be slow because there are so many choices. It's like trying to find a special piece in a big puzzle.

title: Ukraine's Trinetix plans LatAm expansion after $10M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Ukraine-founded product development company Trinetix announced today it has secured $10 million in funding from the Kyiv-based investment fund Hypra.

title: Ironic biotech raises €1M for plant-based proteins high in iron
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swedish startup Ironic Biotech has raised €1M Pre-Seed for its plant-derived proteins that allow iron to be easily absorbed into the blood. Ironic’s proteins are produced through precision fermentation and are used as ingredients in food or food supplements.

title: Delfos Energy's real-time virtual engineer software attracts €6.3M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Barcelona renewable energy software company Delfos Energy announced a successful €6.3 million Seed round

title: AI-powered HRtech startup Talentware secures €800,000
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Milan HRtech startup Talentware announced today that it has raised €800,000. Launched by 3 Bain alumni, Talentware has created an AI-powered SaaS platform to empower companies to engage, develop, and retain their talent using a skill-based approach.

title: The launch of Dutch Future Fund II offers a €200M boost for Dutch startups and scaleups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Invest-NL and the European Investment Fund (EIF) announced the launch of Dutch Future Fund II (DFF II). This investment agreement, building on the success of its predecessor, Dutch Future Fund I, allocates a minimum of €200 million in capital to Dutch venture capital funds.

title: Setmixer secures $760,000 seed investment for AI-assisted live music recording and mixing tools
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Setmixer, a UK-based platform that provides artists with the ability to record and mix their live performances with the precision of a studio session, has today announced a $760,000 seed investment.

title: Quantia raises $1.2M for e-commerce analytics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Polish sales analytics platform Quantia has raised $1.2m to provide companies with marketing capabilities across different channels.

title: Getir is exiting Europe and closing Gorillas as fast grocery delivery feels the chill
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The gig economy is taking a turn for the worse in Germany, with Turkish fast grocery delivery service Getir preparing to exit the country on May 15. The company also plans to withdraw from the UK and the Netherlands.

title: Cashplus Bank rebrands to Zempler Bank
author: John Reynolds
summary: When a fintech founder admits that the company’s name has “passed its sell-by date” then perhaps it’s time for a rebrand. This is the case with Rich Wagner, founder and CEO of UK SME bank Cashplus Bank.

title: Axiology's DLT securities trading platform lands €2M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Axiology, a DLT securities trading and settlement infrastructure has secured a €2 million investment round.

title: Tiger Global-backed Pento acquired by Israeli HR platform HiBob
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Pento, a Copenhagen-born now London-based payroll automation platform, has been acquired by Israeli HR and benefits solutions platform HiBob. The terms of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: Hands on with the Apple Vision Pro
author: Dan Taylor
summary: A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away…. yours truly worked with a startup nestled in the Austrian Alps working on, arguably, some of the very first mobile device-based augmented reality experiences. Wikitude went on to be acquired by Qualcomm and I went on to photograph just about every European tech conference you can think of.

title: Not Canva, not Adobe, Kittl's approach to graphic design attracts $36M investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Kittl, a Berlin-based does-design-better-and-faster-than-you-ever-could startup has today announced a $36 million Series B funding round. The $36 million follows an $11 million investment announced just one year prior.

title: 25 innovative tech startups from Scotland
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In honour of Rabbie Burns, widely regarded as Scotland's national poet, we're raising a glass of our finest wee dram and highlighting 25 tech industry startups that have ties to Caledonia.

title: Meatable submits dossier to hold the Netherlands' first legal cell-cultivated meat tasting
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today the Dutch Government announced an independent Expert Committee to evaluate cell-cultivated meat tastings, and it is a big step toward getting cell-cultivated meat and seafood on people's plates.

title: Switzerland's SoftwareOne rejects Bain Capital's lowered $3.5B takeover offer
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following months of discussions and a reported bidding war, the board of Switzerland’s SoftwareOne has rejected private equity firm Bain Capital’s offer that saw a proposed valuation of 18.8 CHF per share ($3.5 billion).

title: Cherry Ventures' new partner: Dinika Mahtani's impact on UK investment strategy
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cherry Ventures has today announced the promotion of operator-turned-investor Dinika Mahtani to the level of partner.

title: French VR therapy provider HypnoVR strengthens market hold with Oncomfort acquisition
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French VR-based digital therapy provider HypnoVR has acquired Belgian digital sedation company Oncomfort. The financials of the deal have not been disclosed.

title: Adon Health completes Pre-Seed funding for underserved therapies platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Munich healthtech company Adon Health, has completed its Pre-Seed financing round. The amount raised has not been disclosed.

title: UK SME manufacturers Invest £22M in tech with Made Smarter support
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week brings the news of a form of angel investing with a difference.

title: Swiss edtech Avallain acquires AI toolset TeacherMatic
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss edtech company Avallain today announced it has acquired the generative AI toolset TeacherMatic.

title: BeCause raises $1.9M for sustainability data management in travel industry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: BeCause, a Danish startup offering the hospitality, travel, and tourism industries a sustainability data management platform, has raised $1.9 million in a seed funding round.

title: Invest-NL invests €10M in Berlin-based VC fund Extantia Capital
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Dutch private equity firm Invest-NL has invested €10 million in Extantia Capital, a Berlin-based  VC fund. In so much Invest-NL joins LPs including  Anglo American, Toyota Ventures, and top-tier family offices such as the Piëch and Oldendorff families.

title: TapNation acquires AI-powered UAhero to boost monetisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, mobile games developer and publisher TapNation announced that it has acquired UAhero, an AI-powered user acquisition and monetisation platform providing automation thanks to advanced algorithms.

title: Glaut raises $1.4M for conversational survey platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Italian startup Glaut has successfully closed a $1.4M pre-seed round.

title: Sooma gets €5M boost to expand its tDCS at-home depression treatment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Healthtech company Sooma Medical today announced new funding of €5 million, bringing its funding to €7.5 million. Sooma offers Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation (tDCS) through its portable neuromodulation device.

title: Swedish firm Xensam takes on first ever external funding in $40M round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Xensam, a Swedish software asset management platform founded in 2016, has today announced the onboarding of its first-ever external capital in a $40 million growth funding round. The company aims to use the capital to invest in AI product development and expand operations in the US and Europe.

title: Evli Growth Partners Leads €40M Investment in Hospitality Startup Bob W
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bob W, a Helsinki-based better-than-a-hotel hospitality platform, has raised €40 million in a Series B investment round. The new capital is aimed at fueling further growth at the startup, now amassing in excess of €71 million since mid 2020.

title: Dutch medtech startup Amazec Photonics secures seed funding for clinical trials
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amazec Photonics, a Dutch medtech startup leveraging the power of, you guessed it, photonics, has raised €1.5 million in a seed funding round. The up start intends to use the capital to further develop its diagnostic devices suitable for clinical trials.

title: Naq raises €3M to boost healthcare compliance in UK and EU
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: European automated compliance platform Naq has successfully raised €3 million today to improve healthcare and medical compliance across the UK and the EU.

title: CEEZER gets a €10.3M funding boost AI-driven carbon credit platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Carbon credit platform CEEZER announced today that it had raised €10.3 million in funding in a Series A round.

title: Scotland’s Skylark Lasers bags £2.34 million to pipe into next generation quantum-enabled navigation systems
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Scottish photonics company Skylark Lasers, which specialises in the design and manufacture of single-frequency DPSS lasers has developed a ‘portable, near-infrared laser system that will be integrated into a miniature gravity sensor developed by both academic and industrial partners’.

title: Thema launches venture fund platform for first-time fund managers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Thema, a London-based, Pan-European-focused VC fund investor, has publicly launched its venture fund platform to support and provide capital to first-time fund managers to start their own venture capital business.

title: Mocean Energy's wave energy machine gets financial boost with £2.2M new equity and a £500,000 grant
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Scottish wave energy pioneer Mocean Energy has raised £2.2 million new equity alongside a £500,000 grant to drive the commercialisation of its wave energy technologies.

title: Poland's InPost acquires a 30% equity stake in UK logistics firm Menzies Distribution for £49.3 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: A relationship which began with Polish logistics firm InPost entering an exclusive logistics partnership with UK firm Menzies, earlier this year has turned into something a little more...with InPost acquiring a 30% equity stake in the UK firm for £49.3 million in an all-cash transaction.

title: Easop acquired by Remote to supercharge its HR SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Compensation SaaS Easop has been acquired by Remote, adding another string to the HRtech's bow: it will facilitate equity management for international employees.

title: Sequoia backs Coana to help companies manage security vulnerabilities in open source dependencies
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Coana, a Danish application security startup, and recent alum of Sequoia’s preseed and seed-stage catalyst Arc, has today announced the raise of $1.6 million in a pre-seed round.

title: Scotland's Cytomos bags £4M to expand its team, and biotech solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Scottish-based biotech firm Cytomos has raised a funding round of £4 million which was led by existing investors Archangels and includes participation from Old College Capital, Scottish Enterprise and new investor British Business Bank.

title: Berlin-based Layla is fusing social media content and AI to reimagine travel discovery
