author: Dan Taylor
summary: There was a time when the adventure of travel was inspired by the recanting of tales from far-off lands. In written form, novels once fueled imaginations and drove the desire to travel. Then came glossy travel magazines, specialised television shows, many, many, websites, and now today, social media and short-form videos lay claim to the source of travel discovery.

title: UK's Mintago raises $4.75M for employee financial wellness platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based financial wellbeing startup Mintago has raised $4.75 million in a Series A funding round. The platform is a tool for employees to gain better financial health as it offers pension help, financial advice, savings options and an AI money helper. It is also viewed as a tool for 'staff retention' for employers, suggesting financially healthier staff stay longer.

title: Paris-based TapNation raises €15M to boost mobile game publishing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Paris-based mobile gaming publisher TapNation announced a recent €15 million funding round.

title: X Shore navigates through the waves with €8.5M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Swedish electric boat company X Shore has raised €8.5 million (100 million SEK), bringing the company’s funding to over €100 million.

title: Top 100 Next Unicorns 2024 by Viva Technology
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Viva Technology released its 2024 "Top 100 Next Unicorns" list, an annual compilation of the 100 most promising scaleups in Europe with the potential to reach a valuation of at least $1 billion in the near future.

title: Multiverse Computing and Single Quantum secure $1.4M contract with the German Aerospace Centre
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Multiverse Computing and Single Quantum announced an industrial materials science research and development project under a $1.4 million contract with the German Aerospace Centre's DLR Quantum Computing Initiative (DLR QCI).

title: Dutch SME banking provider Finom bags “quite easy” €50m  Series B funding round
author: John Reynolds
summary: Securing a €50m plus funding round for startups has not been as plain sailing these days as it was a few years ago, amid a drying up of capital and challenging economic circumstances.

title: ReOrbit is leading the Space Internet of Things with software-centric satellites
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When you think of spacetech, you probably think of rockets and satellites built with the latest tech innovation — which will someday filter down to terrestrial use cases.

title: Continuum Industries raises $10M to accelerate infrastructure planning
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, AI infrastructure planning company Continuum Industries announced it has raised $10 million in Series A funding in a round led by Singular.

title: Welcome to the Jungle acquires job search platform Otta
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French branding and recruitment platform Welcome to the Jungle today announced the acquisition of London-based job search platform Otta for an undisclosed amount.

title: Octopus Energy's tech arm, Kraken, acquires Berlin startup Kwest
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Kraken, the tech arm of global energy and technology group Octopus Energy, announced the acquisition of Berlin-based tech start-up Kwest.

title: Detected's business onboarding platform attracts $2.5M further investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today business onboarding company  Detected announced that it has secured $2.5 million in its latest fundraising, bringing the company’s funding to $8.5 million.

title: Exploring the business perspectives of the iGaming sector with GR8 Tech
author: Tech.eu
summary: While the iGaming field is full of business opportunities due to the industry's continuous growth, creating smoothly-running iGaming operations is challenging, especially for newbies. GR8 Tech offers an all-in-one solution for this matter.

title: Why removing jargon From job descriptions is key to building a more diverse workforce
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: From SaaS to IoT, it’s safe to say that tech loves an acronym.

title: Agritech's time to shine: State of Foodtech 2024
author: Lucy Adams
summary: DigitalFoodLab has released its seventh annual report on the State of European FoodTech. Investment in the sector has once again declined — a 35 per cent decrease from 2022 and 56 from 2021 when investments reached their peak.

title: Instagrid raises $95M in Series C funding for portable battery systems
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Portable battery systems provider Instagrid today announced a Series C funding round of $95 million.

title: Matrixian Group's AI-driven real estate solutions attract another €1.5M from Pride Capital Partners
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Amsterdam-based real-estate solutions company Matrixian Group has raised €1.5 million in investment from Pride Capital Partners, this is in addition to the €2 million funding already garnered from Dutch investment firm.

title: “There is no entrepreneurial gene”, says top VC and author of Start-up Century
author: John Reynolds
summary: “There is no entrepreneurial gene, I don’t think,” says James Wise, partner at VC firm Balderton Capital and author of Start-Up-Century.

title: Denmark's Nordic Secondary Fund delivers €3.5M funding to Estonia's robotics logistics firm Cleveron
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Estonian startup Cleveron has secured €3.5 million in a funding round. The logistics startup was bought by fellow Estonian logistics firm Parcelsea earlier this year, which itself was bought by post and parcel firm Omniva around the same time. Cleveron’s latest investment round was led by Danish Nordic Secondary Fund according to BalticVC.

title: Cookie Information and Piwik PRO merge to give European marketers more control over their online data
author: Guest Writer
summary: Cookie Information, a consent management platform vendor, and Piwik PRO, a digital analytics suite vendor, are merging. The deal is backed by Kirk Kapital, Piwik PRO’s founder, the management team, selected employees at Piwik PRO, and the Export and Investment Fund of Denmark.

title: Prescriby raises €2M to bring addiction management platform to the US
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Icelandic-Canadian biotech Prescriby has raised €2M for its treatment management platform for addictive medication.

title: Dutch mobile and PSP firm TargetMedia to shut payments business
author: John Reynolds
summary: TargetMedia, a Dutch mobile and PSP (Payment Service Provider) business is shutting down its bank payments business, citing too much regulation and bookkeeping as the reasons for shutting up shop.

title: Deazy improves developer recruitment with Geektastic acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today developer team-building startup Deazy announced its acquisition of Geektastic, providing customisable, peer-reviewed technical assessments that generate deep technical insight to allow enterprises to identify the best developers quickly.

title: Oslo-Based startup Midio raises $660,000 for visual programming interface development
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Midio, an Oslo-based startup working on backend development via a visual programming interface, has raised $660,000 in a pre-seed funding round.

title: From the creators of PrivateGPT, Zylon emerges from stealth announcing a $3.2M pre-seed funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Emerging from steal, Zylon, a new venture from the creators of PrivateGPT, has secured $3.2 million in a pre-seed funding round. The capital will be used to develop further the platform's generative AI aimed at catering to small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs).

title: Parisian fintech Pennylane raises €40M at €1B valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Pennylane, a Parisian fintech startup, has announced the raise of €40 million in a Series C round that drew the support of existing investors Sequoia Capital and DST Global and sees the company become France’s newly minted unicorn.

title: Robinhood launches “awesome” UK share-trading app in fresh crack at market
author: John Reynolds
summary: US fintech star Robinhood is today rolling out its brokerage services in the UK, offering investors commission–free trading in thousands of US-listed stocks including Tesla, Amazon and Apple.

title: Concrete4Change raises £2.5M for CO2 capturing technology in concrete
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Concrete4Change(C4C), an advanced materials company that permanently captures and utilises CO2 by mineralising it in concrete, has raised £2.5 million in seed funding.

title: Safeguarding tomorrow: Navigating the crossroads of global AI safety
author: Rick Hao
summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has exploded beyond the confines of research labs, capturing the public imagination and concern in equal measure. This is not just the stuff of Hollywood thrillers, where AI often takes centre stage as a dramatic and potentially dangerous force. The real-world implications of AI's rapid development have become a pressing, global concern. Once the domain of science fiction, AI safety now commands serious attention.

title: Gotiva's platform digital content distribution and revenue platform raises €1.11M seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Warsaw graphic developer startup Gotiva announced that it has secured €1.11 million in Seed funding.

title: Why most ChatGPT startups will likely fail – and what to do about it
author: Alex Pavlov
summary: The words on every investor’s lips right now are ‘generative AI’. What we’re witnessing today is undoubtedly a watershed moment in technological progression. Since its launch in November 2022, ChatGPT has created a huge buzz - not only among the general public but also in the investment community.

title: BlaBlaCar secures €100M credit facility for growth ambitions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: BlaBlaCar announced today that it has secured a €100 million revolving credit facility to fuel its growth ambitions. This brings the company's funding to over €637 million.

title: €3M funding boosts tibo energy's global smart grid expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Dutch startup tibo energy announced that it has closed €3 million in Seed funding to grow its team and focus on international expansion.

title: Peter Thiel's Valar Ventures backs Berlin-based fintech Monite
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Think what you want of Peter Thiel, his actions, his beliefs, and other sundries, the 56-year-old billionaire has a business acumen bar none. And so when the VC fund he co-established, Valar Ventures, puts its financial backing behind your product, there’s bound to be a certain sense of well-deserved accomplishment to be had.

title: Bethnal Green Ventures announces first close of newest tech for good fund at £33M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Laying claim to the UK’s first B-Corp certified venture capital firm, it should come as no surprise that Bethnal Green Ventures is restocking the shelves of the deployable capital cabinet and now looking to back 100 new ventures over the next four years through its Tech for Good programme.

title: Austria's Storebox boosts Series B round to €67.5M for European expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The Austrian storage and logistics scale-up Storebox has received more funding to add to its Series B round. Originally reporting a €52 million fundraise in July 2021, the firm has confirmed the extension brings the round to a total of €67.5 million. Those involved in the round include existing investors Senger-Weiss Family Offices, Wille Finance, Kineo Capital, Urban Pioneers, ActivumSG, Hansi Hansmann and Markus Ertler, as well as Raiffeisenbank International.

title: Ensol receives €3M funding boost to make household solar energy more accessible
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Ensol, a Paris start-up specialising in photovoltaic equipment, has announced that it has raised €3 million from Otium Capital.

title: Klineo raises €2M to connect patients to clinical trials
author: Lucy Adams
summary: French digital health startup Klineo today announced that it has raised €2M for its platform which improves equity of access to clinical trials for cancer patients.

title: Inclusion in practice: Ada Ventures closes oversubscribed £63M Fund II
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Ada Ventures closes an oversubscribed £63 million second fund from institutional LPs. New LPs in Fund II include The Export and Investment Fund of Denmark (EIFO), The University Of Edinburgh, Molten Ventures, and Legal & General Capital.

title: Zetta Genomics secures additional £1.8M in seed funding for genomic data analysis platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Zetta Genomics, a Cambridge-based startup working in the field of, as the name implies, genomics, has announced a further expansion of its seed round with a £1.8 million investment.

title: Swiss VC fund Founderful nears 70 per cent capacity with $85M raised
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Founderful, a Swiss VC fund formerly known as Wingman Ventures, has announced that its newest fund, targeted at $120 million has reached 70 per cent capacity at $85 million.

title: Losses increase five-fold at Checkout.com’s UK business
author: John Reynolds
summary: One of the darlings of the UK fintech industry, Checkout.com, has reported a five-fold widening of losses of its UK business to $126m while revenue growth stalled, as it was hit by reduced consumer spending and higher inflation.

title: Sweden's Heatland Discgolf acquires European Birdies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Heatland Discgolf AB announced its acquisition of European Birdies for an undisclosed sum., alongside a pivotal manufacturing partnership with Sacci AB.

title: advastore sets new standards in e-commerce with autonomous fulfillment centre.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today advastore, a Munich-based e-commerce and logistics startup, emerges with the opening of its first fully autonomous fulfillment centre.

title: HiiROC's low-cost, zero-emission hydrogen production attracts repeat investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Cemex Ventures cements its stake in HiiROC, a startup with a novel proprietary process for low-cost, zero-emission hydrogen production.

title: Businesses need a rocket to reach the stars: Why core systems need a relaunch
author: David Lees
summary: The rise of new and exciting technologies may be distracting businesses from focusing on the core systems that really matter to their long-term success. Combine a preference for new tech with a longstanding oversight of vital systems like SAP, and businesses may experience declining growth potential, agility, and efficiency. Reversing these pitfalls requires proactive transformation and management of crucial elements of the IT landscape.

title: These are the fastest-growing open-source startups in Europe Q4 2023
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Now entering its fourth year of publication, each quarter Runa Capital tabulates figures gleaned from GitHub and releases the Runa Open Source Startup (ROSS) Index, a global tracker of the fastest-growing open-source startups.

title: London’s Stylib takes aim at design catalogues and product showrooms, raises £1.5 million in pre-seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As someone who’s currently in the middle of a home remodeling project, I can confidently say I now know more about kitchen cabinetry, engineered wood vs. porcelain tile, and what a Belfast sink is than any non-professional ever should.

title: Bavest raises €1.1M Pre-Seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German B2B fintech Bavest has completed a €1.1M funding round, and will use the funds and investors' strategic assistance to widen the customer base for its AI financial infrastructure.

title: Purpose Green secures €3.3M to decarbonise the building sector in Germany
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German climatetech startup Purpose Green has raised a €3.3 million funding round to expand its presence in the German market, further develop its offering and add more ESG, climate and building expertise to its team.

title: Painting a better picture of health: From faster delivery times to more accurate diagnoses, AI-powered medical imaging is revolutionising the future of our global healthcare system
author: Jens Dommel
summary: The “rise of the machines” has played a critical role in advancing medical research and improving accuracy of diagnostic precision for decades, transforming the way we monitor new and existing diseases. However, despite the advantages medical imaging has brought to the healthcare system – in early detection of diseases and non-intrusive examination – the stark reality is that long delays and shortages of staff continue to put major limitations on the overall quality of service for patients. However, until the integration of AI and cloud-powered medical imaging looks to have the answer, unlocking significant breakthroughs in patient care.

title: Polish SaaS startup Certifier bags $700K in Seed funding for digital cert tech
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Polish digital credential infrastructure SaaS startup, Certifier, has raised over $700,000 in a Seed funding round. Investors in the round include Movens Capital, FundingBox Deep Tech Fund, DEPO Ventures, and Black Pearls VC.

title: Traceless Materials raises €36.6M for eco-friendly plastic alternative
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Hamburg-based biomaterials startup traceless materials has raised €36.6 million in a Series A funding round. The startup intends to use the investment to scale the production capabilities of its plastic alternative beginning with the construction of a demonstration plant.

title: Ironman: the important lessons for business
author: Hanna Khrystianovych
summary: Ironman's preparation is a transformational change. Your body changes drastically, your lifestyle, and so much more. Usually, people come into triathlon at an age when there's a demand for transformation, for some kind of significant change in themselves.

title: €78M for Spain's reusable rockets,  Evolution Technology Fund III raises $50.8M, and a merger for xFarm Technologies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €676.7 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio backs SolarMente: a subscription-based P2P solar cleantech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Spanish-based cleantech SolarMente welcomes actor and advocate Leonardo DiCaprio as a new investor. While the investment details have not been disclosed, the company has raised over $57.4 million in funding.

title: Attention to all tech startups! Apply now for an opportunity to join the Tech.eu Summit London 2024!
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: Are you a budding tech startup looking to make your mark in the industry? We have an incredible opportunity for you! The Tech.eu Summit London 2024 is just around the corner, and we are thrilled to announce that we will be hosting a dedicated startup stage alongside the main event like last year.

title: Parisian startup Groover secures $8M to boost independent artists' careers
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Groover, a Parisian startup looking to level the playing field for emerging artists, has confirmed the raise of $8 million in a Series A funding round.

title: Helsinki-based Vapaus raises €15M to boost employee benefit bikes offering
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Vapaus, a Helsinki-based provider of mobility benefits for employees, has received €15 million in a debt facility provided by Norion Bank. The capital is slated to fuel market presence in Finland and expansion across Sweden.

title: Former OpenAI lead's startup Daedalus secures $21M in NGP Capital-led round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Led by former OpenAI technical lead Jones Schneider, Karlsruhe-based Daedalus has today confirmed raising $21 million in a Series A funding round.

title: Social Links invests $1M in Brightside AI to fight social engineering cyberattacks
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Brightside AI, is thrilled to announce the successful completion of a $1 million deal with Social Links, a technology investor in OSINT infrastructure.

title: Blackrock and HSBC back e-commerce fulfillment startup Huboo in £29M round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bristol-based e-commerce fulfillment platform Huboo has raised £29 million in new capital as it strives towards profitability.

title: Baltic startup Evergrowth raises €2M in pre-seed funding, one of the region's largest to date
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Evergrowth, a Vilnius-based platform offering an AI-driven account-based sales solution, has secured €2 million in a pre-seed funding round, marking one of the largest of its kind in the Baltics.

title: Recraft's AI graphic design tool secures $12M in Series A funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI graphic design generator Recraft today announced $12 million in Series A funding in a round led by Khosla Ventures and former GitHub CEO Nat Friedman.

title: London startup Juniper raises £1.5M for "dental insurance, but for your genitals"
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Juniper, a UK-based startup offering reproductive healthcare insurance as an employee benefit, has secured £1.5 million in a pre-seed funding round. The company intends to use the investment to support a pilot programme slated for later this year.

title: Accel-KKR invests in Aico's financial reporting software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Silicon Valley investment firm Accel-KKR has announced a majority equity investment in Aico, a SaaS platform for large enterprises. Juuri Partners and the management team continue as significant minority owners.

title: Inicio secures €1.5M funding to identify land for solar power development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French energy transition startup Inicio announced it has raised €1.5 million in Seed funding.

title: Porsche and Jaguar Land Rover's preferred EV installer, Evios, raises £4M in Series A funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Makers of EV-charging-at-home solutions, Evios has secured £4 million in a Series A funding round. The capital is aimed at expanding operations and growth of Andersen EV, an outfit Evios acquired in October 2022. It is the preferred at-home EV installer for Porsche and a preferred supplier for Jaguar Land Rover in the UK.

title: Kyiv climatetech startup Carbominer secures €1.5M EIC Accelerator Fund grant
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Kyiv carbon climatetech startup Carbominer has signed a grant agreement with the EIC Accelerator Fund, securing a €1.5 million grant and eligibility for up to €7.5 million in equity at later stages.

title: Hyundai partners with Norwegian startup Casi for European car subscription services
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Norwegian car subscription tech startup Casi announced its partnership with Hyundai Motor Europe. to bring the OEMs Mocean car subscriptions to European markets.

title: How AI is transforming female friendship
author: Ulrika Lilja and Claudia Gård
summary: If Sex and the City taught us anything — other than the importance of a great pair of shoes — it’s that having a group of supportive women by your side is crucial. But finding those all-important friends can be unexpectedly difficult, especially after education.

title: Bloom & Wolf raises €1.4M for silk flower subscription service
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Amsterdam-based luxury silk flower company Bloom & Wolf has closed a €1.4M pre-seed financing round. The round is led by CapitalT, with participation from Joanna Invests and angel investors.

title: Rolls-Royce, Riverlane, and Xanadu secure £700,000 for quantum computing development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Rolls-Royce, Riverlane and Xanadu secured more than £400,000 grant funding from Innovate UK to accelerate the development of applications that will allow quantum computers to model the flow of air through jet engines.

title: Lilli's AI-driven home care system bags £8.2M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Lifestyle monitoring company Lilli, today announced that it has raised £8.2 million in Series A financing, a 37 percent increase in its initial target. It brings the company's funding to £12.7 million.

title: Copenhagen-based logistics Startup Portchain raises $5M in new investment round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Portchain, a Copenhagan-based logistics startup, has today confirmed the raise of $5 million in a new investment round. The startup intends to use the capital to fuel a recruitment drive, further develop products and build upon and improve existing services.

title: Robotics startup 10Lines raises €1.5M for autonomous pavement marking
author: Lucy Adams
summary: 10Lines, an Estonian robots startup that builds and manufacturers autonomous line-marking robots, has raised €1.5M in Series A funding following its Seed round in July 2021.

title: Jow's bespoke menu app attracts $13M investment for US expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Jow, a Parisian grocery shopping and menu recommendation app, has announced the addition of $13 million in a Northzone-led Series A extension financing round. The additional capital will be used to support the company’s US market entry.

title: Spacegoods raises £2.5M to expand mushroom-based wellness products
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Spacegoods, a London-based D2C e-commerce outfit specialising in mushrooms and nootropics, has raised £2.5 million in a seed funding round.

title: 8 high impact startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The advantage of working as a tech journalist is that I have ample access to great startups doing interesting and often amazing things.

title: How Monumo's deeptech-generated design  is transforming electric motor design
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Monumo, a company with a world-first approach to redesigning electric motors, emerged from stealth, announcing it had raised a £10.5 million seed round from angel investors.

title: Enterprise staking platform Kiln secures $17M in for global expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, leading enterprise-grade staking platform Kiln announced it has raised $17 million in funding, bringing its funding to $35 million.

title: Edonia raises €2M for sustainable meat alternatives
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Plant-based foodtech Edonia has raised €2M from Asterion Ventures. Edonia’s protein ingredients are based on microalgae such as spirulina and chlorella, The fact that these products are not subject to the “Novel Food” category (food or food ingredients requiring French/EU authorization to go to market) enables it to commercialise its production more rapidly than other plant-based food producers.

title: Content curator Wakelet acquires online portfolio provider Bulb
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Manchester-based content curation platform Wakelet has acquired Bulb, a digital portfolio provider used primarily by teachers and job applicants. The acquisition puts Wakelet a step further toward its ambitions of expansion into edtech.

title: Q1 sees increased energy investment
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The energy transition is powering a recovery in European venture capital in the first quarter of 2024, according to Dealroom’s Europe Q1 report. European startups raised $13.7 billion in VC funding in Q1 2024, a 5% increase on the same period last year.

title: An In Depth Look at the World of Technology with Permus
author: Tech.eu
summary: Permus Blog, which is a guide in the world of technology and software, has clarified the path it has followed since its foundation and has provided up-to-date and accurate information to its readers by keeping up with the rapid changes in the technology world. Permus has transformed the website into more than just a news source over time and turned it into a full-fledged guide for technology enthusiasts and professionals.

title: Meet the 8 AI companies taking part in the Tech.eu Summit London 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: At the end of 2023, in our Annual report, we wrote about the impact that AI companies had in all spheres around the world. And we all know it's huge.

title: PLD Space raises €78M for mission launch and Europe's largest private spacetech infrastructure
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Spanish spacetech company PLD Space has raised €78 million in funding to advance its goal of launching the MIURA 5 mission by the end of 2025.

title: Harnessing the power of generative AI is the lifeblood of Europe’s sustainable future
author: Lauri Lehtovuori
summary: Three-quarters of the world’s €94 trillion in gross domestic product is made up of heavy industries, such as manufacturing, material production and extraction, and logistics. At the same time, generative AI is still a largely untapped opportunity for these traditional sectors.

title: 25 per cent of fintechs pitching top VC are AI-first startups
author: John Reynolds
summary: Around 25 per cent of fintechs pitching a top VC for funding are AI-first startups, according to a top VC.

title: SUBLIME Energy's proprietary biogas tech attracts €11.5M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Deeptech tech startup SUBLIME Energy today announced that it has secured €11.5 million in funding.

title: Closed Loop Medicine advances smartphone-enabled precision medicine
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the UK biotech company Closed Loop Medicine announced the publication of a peer-reviewed study in the Journal of the American Heart Association.

title: UK family investment app Nosso to shut
author: John Reynolds
summary: A UK family investment app, founded by one of the first employees of business bank Tide, is shutting down.

title: AI-powered debt management startup “breaking through challenges”
author: John Reynolds
summary: The founder of a UK AI-powered debt management startup came up with a filial-loving marketing slogan for inicio.AI while watching her 19-year-old “huge rugby player” son playing rugby recently.

title: How a Lisbon startup's AI forecasting tech outperforms Google, Amazon, and Meta
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Many companies are opting to create their own large language learning models (LLMs). It provides the ability for customisation and personalisation, control over improvements, and the means to right-size your models in response to your specific requirements, which can lower costs.

title: Revolut executive says the fintech is a "training ground" for future founders
author: John Reynolds
summary: “We don’t always want people to stay at Revolut forever", according to a Revolut executive, who said the fintech was a "training ground" for the founders of tomorrow.

title: NomuPay acquires payment solutions provider Total Processing
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Having announced the raise of $53.6 million in a Series A funding round in late May of this year, Dublin-headquartered payment platform NomuPay aims to accelerate growth through its acquisition of payment processing and gateway solutions provider Total Processing.

title: A showcase of Europe's impact-driven innovators – EIT Awards winners announced
author: Julia Gifford
summary: Winners have been announced for the 10th edition of the EIT Awards, which happened within the scope of the EIT Summit 2024 – the kick-off event for INNOVEIT.

title: The Games Fund backs Obelisk Studio with $2M for independent game development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Cyprus games studio Obelisk Studio announced it has secured $2 million from The Games Fund. This specialist early-stage VC fund invests in innovative video game developers and gametech companies.

title: Isomer Capital prepares for a VC exodus with new secondaries fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Isomer Capital has announced the first close of its new VC Secondaries fund. The fund was created to “capitalise on the high potential and limited liquidity solutions” seen in European venture capital.

title: Scayl comes out of stealth with its “fintech for fintech lenders” and €100M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Debt financing platform Scayl today announced its emergence from stealth. It has raised €100 million, which it will immediately make available for European fintech lenders.

title: MariaDB's financial rollercoaster: The plot thickens
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Earlier this week the board at Finnish-founded open-source database management system MariaDB confirmed that the company had received a non-binding proposal from K1 Investment Management to take the company private in a deal valued at approximately $37 million.

title: How GlycanAge is revolutionising preventative healthcare with $4.2M seed round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In a letter to French physicist Jean-Baptiste Le Roy dated 1789, American statesman Benjamin Franklin wrote, “... but in this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.”

title: Cultimate Foods raises €2.3M to develop fat ingredient for alternative meats
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cultimate Foods, a biotech startup based in Berlin's Biocube and Hannover, has closed its €2.3M seed round.

title: Former Sinch CEO Oscar Werner takes helm at growth financing platform Gilion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Gilion, the growth financing and analytics platform formerly known as ArK Kapital has today announced the latest development in its growth phase with the appointment of seasoned industry professional Oscar Werner.

title: How European startups can weather the storm with eight affordable technologies
author: Mindaugas Mikalajūnas
summary: There is a whole warehouse of obstacles facing European startups and smaller companies right now that can feel overwhelming. Economic instability, talent scarcity, digital disruption - how can startups possibly keep up?

title: French medtech AZmed raises €15M Series A for AI medical imaging software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French medtech startup AZmed announced today that it has secured €15 million in Series A funding.

title: How Tokyo plans to activate its startup ecosystem based on the 10x10x10 strategy
author: Viesturs Abelis
summary: Investment in startups in Japan has grown tenfold over the past decade, with startups raising a total of nearly 7 billion USD in 2022.

title: Blue Skies Space raises £2M to open up access to satellite data
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-headquartered Blue Skies Space has secured over £2M in funding that will accelerate the delivery of its fleet of satellites. The funding will enable it to launch its first stargazing satellite in 2025.

title: Belfast-based Amply secures £1.4M for AI-powered drug discovery platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amply, a Belfast-based biotech company, and not to be confused with Tech.eu jobs board partner Amply, has today confirmed the raise of over £1.4 million in grant funding. The startup intends to use the investment to further develop its AI-powered drug discovery platform.

title: Molten Ventures acquires 19 per cent of Seedcamp's third fund for €8.5M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London’s Molten Ventures has acquired approximately 19 per cent of Seedcamp’s third fund for €8.5 million.

title: Co-founder and CEO of embedded lender Fluro quits after 10 years
author: John Reynolds
summary: The co-founder and CEO of UK embedded lender Fluro, whose clients include Direct Line and GoCompare, is standing down.

title: Conscia acquires ITGL, spearheading entry into the UK and Ireland
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today  Conscia, a Danish provider of mission-critical IT infrastructure within networking, cybersecurity and cloud, announced it has acquired UK digital transformation company ITGL for an undisclosed sum.

title: Visa joins investment round in Finnish fintech Enfuce
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Centered around its card-as-a-service offer, Helsinki-based Enfuce has today announced an €8.5 million follow-on round. The investment is aimed at further bolstering the company’s presence in the Benelux, German, and French markets in 2024.

title: 8 impact driven startups worth following
author: Tech.eu
summary: For those who are planning to build an impact-driven business amid today’s AI boom, Europe has by far the most fertile environment with the highest share of impact funding (over 30 per cent) in the world.

title: Planity raises $50M in Series C funding for beauty industry booking platform expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Planity, a Parisian SaaS platform providing booking services for the beauty industry, has confirmed the raise of $50 million in a Series C funding round. The new capital will fuel a recruitment drive that will see the company nearly double its staff and progress with pan-European expansion plans.

title: Final Countdown for Discounted Tickets to the Tech.eu Summit London 2024! - Only 5 Days Left!
author: Lucy Adams
summary: 2000 tech enthusiasts, an iconic Central London venue and two days of unmissable programming. The Tech.eu Summit London 2024 is just around the corner and it’s your last chance to get your tickets at a discount before their 35% increase in just five days.

title: Alrik raises €1M Seed to streamline construction transport
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swedish operations software provider Alrik has raised €1M in Seed funding to expand further across Europe. Alrik specifically targets the construction sector with its software that enables supervisors to monitor fleet activity on a centralised system. Construction work accounted for 34 per cent of carbon dioxide emissions in 2021 with transport contributing one fifth of that figure; efficiency savings within the industry’s distribution channels can reduce carbon emissions drastically.

title: Think smart city innovations? Think InnoEX in Hong Kong
author: Krista Krumina
summary: Smart cities are finally taking form. From integrated public transport networks to smart grids for optimizing energy consumption, we increasingly see how cities are becoming technologically advanced.

title: Europe's most promising innovations to compete for up to 50,000 EUR at the EIT Awards 2024
author: Julia Gifford
summary: For 10 years, the EIT Awards have been honouring the region's innovations — and the talented entrepreneurs behind them — addressing the most pressing global challenges. The EIT Awards is one of the key initiatives of the EIT, the European Institute of Innovation & Technology, whose goal is to support and encourage the next generation of European innovators.

title: UK challenger bank Starling opts for Ovo man as CEO
author: John Reynolds
summary: Starling Bank, the UK challenger bank, has appointed an executive who “can take Starling into its next phase of growth", according to its founder. Starling has appointed Raman Bhatia, the CEO of energy supplier Ovo, as its new CEO.

title: Formerly Ark Kapital, now Gilion, sets sights on US market entry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As part of a move hinted at during the welcoming of former Blackstone executive John McCormick as an investor, Ark Kapital is gearing up for global expansion, and in so much, bringing the moniker home to port.

title: This week in European Tech: Fintech deals still dominate, the AI Summit, and Web Summit has a new CEO
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 55 tech funding deals worth over €734 million. We saw over 10 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: With more than €1B in AUM, Speedinvest announces final close of latest fund at €350M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Vienna-HQ’d venture capital firm Speedinvest has today announced the final close of its latest fund at €350 million — €50 million above target.

title: Mapon secures €3M bond issuance for fleet management solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Mapon, a company specialising in fleet management and asset tracking solutions, secured €3 million in funding today through a bond issuance that attracted both private and institutional investors.

title: Zeelo acquires UK-based school transport specialist Kura
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today transporttech company Zeelo, announced the acquisition of UK-based Kura, a specialist in school transportation and transport safeguarding software.

title: TORTUS secures $4.2M Seed Funding for clinical documentation automation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Healthtech generative AI startup TORTUS announced today $4.2 million in seed funding led by Khosla Ventures.

title: 2024 will be the year of the 3R - rates, recovery, and rationalisation
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: According to the new “European VC Valuations Report” published by PitchBook, 2024 will be a year of rates, recovery, and rationalisation (3R) which will shape the level and nature of activity in venture capital markets. This will come as a result of dynamic changes within macroeconomic conditions that have a significant impact, specially on financial markets.

title: Pubinno wins best beverage tech innovation award with its Internet of Beer
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees Turkish-US company Pubinno win the Best Beverage Technology Award at the World Beverage Innovation Awards 2023.

title: Introducing the VIP Pass: Enhance your experience at the Tech.eu Summit London 2024!
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: We are thrilled to announce the VIP Pass, an exclusive ticket option that will elevate your experience at the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 to new heights! While the regular ticket offers two-day access to the Tech.eu Summit London 2024, the “Tech.eu Night” party, and the Tech.eu Summit App, the VIP Pass provides even more privileges that will ensure your time at the summit is truly unforgettable.

title: Sastrify secures additional funding, acquires competitor Pengu to solidify market position
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Having announced the raise of $32 million back in late May of this year, Cologne-based Sastrify, which offers finance and other business units a platform to optimise the management and cost of the SaaS tools, reports a second closing of this Series B round.

title: Cayman Islands Court orders Oussama Ammar to pay €7M to The Family
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The Grand Court of the Cayman Islands has handed down a decision that orders Oussama Ammar and two of his personal companies, Hong Kong-registered Fabuleo Ltd and Aletheis The First Ltd, to pay over €7 million to the organisation he once was credited as having co-founded, The Family.

title: Bitcoin surges above $42,000 ahead of expected SEC decision
author: Dan Taylor
summary: The price of Bitcoin surpassed $42,000 early on Monday, its highest value in 2023, and a figure not seen in 20 months.

title: Collateral Good launches a HUGO BOSS-backed sustainable fashion fund with a €100M target
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Collateral Good, a Zürich-based climate-first Venture Capital platform, launched a new strategy dedicated to sustainable fashion financially backed by global premium fashion company HUGO BOSS.

title: How circular economy startup Bpacks is utilising bark to reduce plastic waste
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: We're literally drowning in a sea of plastic. While efforts are made to reduce the reliance on single use plastic, it relies on scalable solutions at a comparable price point. But now UK company Bpacks has found a way forward with sustainable packaging made from bark.

title: Ukrainian tech shows unwavering resilience two years after Russian invasion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Tomorrow, Saturday, February 24, marks the second anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: Tiger Global-backed Pento acquired, we go hands-on with the Apple Vision Pro, and close to €5B was invested in European tech this week
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €4.9 billion, and around 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: KKR takes Glasgow's Smart Metering Systems private in £1.4B deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Glasgow-based Smart Metering Systems (SMS) is to be delisted and acquired by KKR in an all-cash deal valued at £1.4 billion.

title: Liberis raises $112M debt financing to expand embedded finance solutions for SMEs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Liberis, a company creating embedded business finance solutions, announced it has secured $112 million in debt financing.Liberis is a pioneer in using AI and machine learning-powered analytics to power its embedded finance platform, providing personalised, flexible finance solutions to small businesses.

title: ISACA warns enterprises to be aware of AI use in applications
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The words on everyone’s lips at the recent ISACA Digital Trust World conference were Artificial Intelligence (AI). Digital risk enthusiasts from around the globe gathered in Dublin to discuss how to get on the front foot of AI and prevent bad actors from using the emerging deep tech as a tool of deception.

title: MessageBird founder says deluged with  "dozens" of responses after "once in a lifetime" opportunity for startups to be acquired
author: John Reynolds
summary: The founder of Amsterdam-based communications platform MessageBird says he received dozens of responses in just a few hours yesterday from companies wanting to be acquired after posting a “once in a lifetime” opportunity on LinkedIn.

title: European climate fintech show resilience amidst global downturn
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The “Climate Fintech Report 2024”, published by CommerzVentures, an independent Venture Capital firm, reveals that in 2023 European climate fintech investments are again dominating in funding compared to US counterparts.

title: Why Denmark is at the forefront of the quantum tech revolution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Few would argue that 2023 has been the year of AI. But it's not the only deep tech worth your attention.

title: It’s time for a European cleantech investment plan
author: Sofia Karagianni
summary: European cleantech companies have developed world-leading batteries, electrolysers, and supercapacitors, as well as near-zero carbon steel and cement technologies. This tech leadership could underpin Europe’s competitiveness, energy resilience and decarbonisation for decades to come.

title: UK's Pragmatic secures £182M for expansion of silicon-free chip production
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cambridge-based semiconductor firm Pragmatic has announced the first close of its Series D funding round at £162 million. The firm says that plans for a second close are underway with £20 million already allocated to key investors.

title: November 2023 report: A glimmer of hope and a glimpse of normality
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As we draw a line under November and head into the final month of 2023, the uptick in this month's performance numbers offers a glimmer of hope and a glimpse of normality.

title: Credit Suisse leads $65 million series B for Taurus's digital asset banking infrastructure
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Credit Suisse has led a $65 million series B round for Geneva-based digital asset custodian and services provider Taurus (source).

title: SaaS tool procurement platform Sastrify raises $32 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cologne’s Sastrify has raised $32 million in a Series B funding round. The platform helps finance and teams company-wide in optimising the management and cost of the SaaS tools they use on a daily basis. The new funds are slated to be used to help grow the company scale and grow its team numbers, with a particular focus on the US and European markets. Since late December of 2020, the company has raised a total of $55.2 million.

title: Jampy secures €1M Pre-Seed to raise the bar in pet wellness
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today pet-wellness company Jampy announced the successful closure of a €1 million Pre-Seed investment round.

title: Events industry specialist Rentman raises €20M, targets acquisitions
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Conferences, events, summits, whatever you want to call them, are essential to any industry. Whether it’s an industry-wide gathering such as the Tech.eu Summit, or a job role-specific gathering like ISACA’s Digital Trust World, these events serve as a common ground for learning, meeting, and networking.

title: Fermentation startup Farmless secures €4.8M Seed round for sustainable protein
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Farmless, the Amsterdam-based fermentation startup, has raised a €4.8 million Seed round, bringing the company's funding to €6 million.

title: Luminance's Generative AI-for-law raises $40M Series B
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Luminance has raised $40M for its Series B round. The company wants to make good on a prediction that has bounced around legal circles since ChatGPT's release: that LLMs will be able to take on much of paralegals' work.

title: 10 Ukrainian tech companies you should not let out of your sight
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Working in unstable conditions is never easy. However, these companies resist all the challenges they face. Here is the list of 10 Ukrainian companies to keep an eye on.

title: Six fintechs reshaping Europe's financial ecosystem
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Here at Tech.eu, we have access to an abundance of great fintechs improving the lives of both personal and enterprise customers.

title: QuantaMap secures €1.4M funding to enhance quantum chip production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Dutch quantum technologies startup QuantaMap has secured €1.4 million in early-stage funding to improve the production of quantum computer chips.

title: Berlin's Moss gathers a €50M debt funding facility from HSBC Innovation Banking UK
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based fintech for corporate credit cards, payments, and expenses Moss has secured a €50 million debt funding facility from HSBC Innovation Banking UK.

title: Embedded finance company Liberis takes on €30 million SVB UK loan
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Venture debt provider Silicon Valley Bank UK has awarded a €30 million loan to UK-based SME receivables finance provider Liberis.

title: Roro raises €1.5M for its new gaming studio by Toca Boca and Mojang veterans
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Gaming veterans from Toca Boca and Mojang are teaming up to build a new studio called Roro and have raised their first external capital.

title: Steadybit's chaos engineering platform attracts $6M in Series A funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Steadybit, a leader in chaos engineering, today announces that it has successfully raised $6 million in Series A funding led by Paladin Capital Group.

title: Koalaa's lifechanging soft prosthetics  raise $1.2M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today soft prosthetics startup Koalaa closed a funding round of $1.2 million.

title: Europe needs more scientists in VC to become a deeptech powerhouse
author: Ion Hauer
summary: Europe's deep tech sector has substantial technical talent and research leadership and is uniquely positioned for global impact.

title: ProvenRun secures €15M for cybersecurity in connected vehicles
author: Dan Taylor
summary: ProvenRun, a Parisian cybersecurity company specifically focusing on connected vehicles and smart devices, has secured €15 million in a Series A funding round. The investment is earmarked to accelerate the company’s development of automotive security products as well as North American expansion plans.

title: All eyes on Vargas and H2 Green Steel as €6.1 billion was invested in European tech last week
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €6.1 billion, and 5+ exits, M&A transactions, and rumours; all alongside a host of related news stories across Europe.

title: This VC firm wants to fund the best  night of your life
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: What is the best night of your life?

title: Food for Climate Report: 2022 was the most active year ever for European Foodtech & Agritech startups
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Today’s environment is affected by a number of impacts that we have to face including political and financial instability and climate change and its impact on sustainability, to name just a few. These impacts have a significant influence on our food system, making it vulnerable, especially if we have in mind a food crisis that happened between 2008-2012.

title: Why Denmark is a hotbed for healthtech startups and innovation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: If you are looking for a place where healthtech startups thrive, cast your eyes on Denmark, a country leading in digital innovation, healthcare and investment.

title: A new asset class for tech: Unleashing Europe's tech potential
author: Henrik Landgren
summary: In the fast-paced global arena of technology, Europe stands at a critical juncture. As China and the United States surge forward in AI, innovation, and space technology, Europe grapples with an identity crisis, torn between its democratic traditions and the urgent need for technological advancement. The time has come for Europe to challenge the current status quo in tech funding or forever play second fiddle to the global tech giants.

title: Bene Meat Technologies receives EU certification for cell-cultivated pet food
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week cell-cultivated meat company Bene Meat Technologies (BMT), became the first company granted European Union certification in the European Feed Materials Register for laboratory-grown meat for use in pet food.

title: Proptech Coadjute raises £10M from major banks
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Lloyds Banking Group, Nationwide, NatWest, and Rightmove have announced their £10M investment in London-based property technology startup Coadjute. This round propels Coadjute's total investment to £23M since its founding in 2018.

title: “Never too late and never too early” to launch a startup, says founder of one of Finland’s biggest fintechs
author: John Reynolds
summary: “It’s never too late and it’s never too early” to launch a startup, according to the co-founder and co-CEO of Enfuce, the payment startup and one of Finland’s biggest fintech.

title: Carthera secures additional €4.5M for innovative medtech to treat brain disorders
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, medtech company Carthera, a spin-off from Sorbonne University, announced an additional €4.5 million in funding to complement its Series B financing round, bringing the total raised to €42 million.  Carthera is a clinical-stage medtech company focused on developing innovative ultrasound-based medical devices to treat various brain disorders.

title: Trilogue talks resume on EU AI Act
author: Dan Taylor
summary: European lawmakers are set to resume trilogue talks between the EU Parliament, the EU Council of Ministers, and the European Commission, concerning the AI Act today following Thursday’s grueling 22-hour debate.

title: Stilride adds 3D printing capabilities to its arsenal via Adaxis partnership
author: Dan Taylor
summary: You might not (yet) have heard of Sweden’s Stilride, but if the ever-growing waiting list (as of last November it was at 135,000), stylish design, and now improved manufacturing process have anything to do with it, chances are you might need a neck brace after one turns your head.

title: Kost Capital's secret sauce is a food development Studio in the basement
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Officially pulling back the curtain today, Europe’s freshest foodtech-focused VC fund, Kost Capital says it has completed the first close of a targeted €25 million fund. While the firm declined to comment on the exact amount of capital committed, general partner Bodil Sidén remarked, “... but we are very happy”.

title: Munich-based car subscription provider FINN secures €100M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: FINN, a Munich-based car subscription provider has announced the close of a €100 million Series C funding round at a $600 million valuation.

title: The London Stock Exchange opens doors for Bitcoin and Ethereum ETNs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In case you’re under any illusions, crypto is back, and the London Stock Exchange (LSE) has given it a huge regulatory boost.

title: “It’s not about killing cards,”  says founder of  payments startup Banked, which is looking to ramp up pay-by-bank in US
author: John Reynolds
summary: “It’s not about killing cards,” says Brad Goodall, the founder of London-founded online payments startup Banked, which has just struck a partnership with US financial tech firm FIS, which he hopes will herald a surge in pay-by-bank payments in the US.

title: Jagex changes hands in $1.1B deal, Xensam says goodbye to 'bootstrapped', and over €745M invested this week
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €745 million, and around 8 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Berlin's Milano Vice dishes up $9M in Series A funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As legend has it, Frank Sinatra was such a fan of one particular New York City pizzeria that during a series of concert engagements in Los Angeles, the Chairman of the Board had a number of his favourite pies flown across the continent in his private plane.

title: Northvolt chooses Germany over US for new EV battery plant with €902M aid
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees the European Commission approve a €902 million German state aid measure to retain Germany as the location of Northvolt's new EV battery manufacturing plant.

title: EIB funds Protix's insect-based protein production expansion with €37M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The European Investment Bank (EIB) has announced a commitment today to support insect ingredient company Protix. It's helping the Netherlands-founded company expand its sustainable protein production through a loan agreement with up to €37 million in additional funds for its international roll-out.

title: Rodinia Generation raises €3M to fight garment waste with on-demand microfactories
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Danish startup Rodinia Generation announced it has raised €3 million Seed funding.

title: Expertum delivers 99.98 percent accuracy in facial recognition
author: Tech.eu
summary: Facial recognition technology has become an integral part of our daily lives. It plays a crucial role in verifying identities at airports and corporate offices, authenticating users for banking and transactional services, and granting access to our personal devices like smartphones.

title: Six tactics to help enterprise leadership teams navigate the first wave of Gen AI
author: Helena Prokhorenko and Tom Neuberger
summary: GenAI is disrupting the enterprise stack — from underlying compute to end applications — and the reverberations are being felt across industries. LLMs, trained on general datasets, demonstrate specialist capabilities that previously would have required years of domain-specific training. They can automate creative and analytical tasks, thereby significantly increasing worker productivity – particularly for low and medium performers.

title: Numi secures €3M Seed funding to advance cultivated breast milk
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French milktech startup Numi, formerly MUMilk, raised €3 million in Seed funding.

title: Sparxell secures $3.2M for sustainable plant-based pigments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Sparxell, the UK-based developer of high-performance, sustainable, plant-based pigments, has completed a $3.2 million funding round (comprising Seed investments, grants, and awards).

title: Focusing on quality over quantity: TechBBQ secures €4M to grow its Scandinavian tech conference
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Copenhagen-based TechBBQ, Scandinavia's largest startup conference, has announced it has secured €4 million to ‘further fuel’ its ‘mission of fostering innovation and collaboration within the tech ecosystem’. The breakdown of funding is Danish Industry Foundation has granted €2 million, The Novo Nordisk Foundation and Realdania have granted €670,000 each, The Danish Board of Business Development has given €335,000, HSBC Innovation Banking has given €268,000, and Copenhagen Municipality has provided a grant of €67,000 to an entrepreneurship program.

title: Spore.Bio raises €8M for real-time pathogen detection in FMCG factories
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today deeptech startup Spore.Bio announced that it has raised €8 million in Pre-Seed funding led by LocalGlobe to solve the critical health and safety challenges threatening the global fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) market.

title: Savings and investment app Moneybox to be full-year profitable for 2023 and beyond, as boss hails “milestone” year
author: John Reynolds
summary: The boss of UK savings and investment app Moneybox today hailed the startup's “milestone” year and said that the fintech will be profitable for the full year 2023 and beyond.

title: UP Catalyst secures €4M Seed investment for for first scalable green graphite extraction
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today UP Catalyst, an Estonian pioneer in sustainable carbon material production, successfully closed a €4 million Seed investment round.

title: Finnish AI governance startup Saidot secures €1.75M for safe AI implementation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish AI governance startup Saidot helps enterprises and governments unlock the benefits of AI safely through its platform. With clients like the Scottish Government and Deloitte the startup gives them the tools to evaluate and implement safety systems for their generative AI systems.

title: Helsinki-based startup Cactos secures over €26M for BESS investment
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cactos, a Helsinki-based battery energy storage systems (BESS) startup has raised over €26 million in equity capital as part of a larger €70 million investment project.

title: Flagstone secures £108M equity investment from Estancia Capital Partners
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today UK cash deposit platform Flagstone announced a £108 million equity investment by Estancia Capital Partners, a US financial services specialist private equity firm with deep expertise in the cash management market.

title: Using fungi to replace the meat replacement, Berlin’s Nosh raises €3.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based developers of traditional meat (and other sources of protein) Nosh has raised €3.2 million in a seed funding round. The startup will use the capital to press forward with R&D projects as well as gear up for mass production and intensify commercialisation efforts.

title: Cirplus secures funding for its recycled plastics procurement platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Europe's largest digital procurement platform for recycled plastics, Cirplus announced that it has secured a seven-figure funding round.

title: How Ukrainian startup OBRIO turned psychic reading and astrology into a thriving business venture
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: If I were choosing an industry for a Ukrainian startup to disrupt, I would select robotics, gaming, edtech, agritech, or miltarytech. I wouldn't pick astrology.

title: Oslo-based OTee secures €1.25M funding for industrial automation software
author: Dan Taylor
summary: OTee, an Oslo-based developer of industrial automation software, has raised €1.25 million in its latest funding round.

title: How to win €30,000 with your prototype
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Do you think you have what it takes to solve some of today’s most pressing issues using EU Space data and technologies? If your answer is an unequivocal ‘challenge accepted’, then the CASSINI Challenges are open for your prototypes and/or products.

title: Analytical Alley secures €700k for AI-based martech solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI-based Martech company Analytical Alley has secured €700k to help businesses plan marketing activities more profitably.

title: Georgian startup STORI raises $500K to automate branding and content creation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today STORI, a Georgian martech startup using AI to automate the branding and content creation process, announced that it has raised $500,000 in a Pre-Seed funding round led by technology accelerator fund 500 Global, with participation from a group of angel investors.

title: Startups should have a seat at the policy table, not on the menu
author: Guest Writer
summary: Startups can be at the forefront of economic recovery, job creation, and a more sustainable future. They are the most innovative actors in the economy and an economic force to be reckoned with. However, while they are the giants of the future, they are more often than not overlooked in policymaking.

title: Google joins Brewdog in support of Degen Distillery's NFT Initiative
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Degen Distillery, a London-based tech-driven maker of spirits, but also a whole lot more, has today announced that Google is joining the firm's existing partner Brewdog.

title: Where Startups Meet Investors: The Tech.eu Summit London 2024 Startup Stage
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: The Tech.eu Summit London 2024, one of Europe's most prestigious tech events, will take place in London on May 16-17. The Tech.eu Summit London 2024 is just around the corner, summit will feature a dedicated Startup Stage, providing a platform for startups to showcase their innovative solutions and connect with investors.

title: Money transfer app Atlantic Money launches in US and Australia but admits user numbers are not “headline-grabbing”
author: John Reynolds
summary: A money transfer rival to Wise and Revolut founded by Robinhood alumni is expanding to North America and Australia.

title: Ecobase secures €2.5M seed funding to unlock carbon finance for European landowners
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Ecobase, an Estonia-based developer of European forestry carbon projects, announced that it has secured over €2.5 million in Seed funding to scale up its pan-European afforestation/reforestation (ARR) program.

title: The stalled EU AI Act: Implications for mental health and equality
author: Rebecca Gorman
summary: Finalisation of the EU AI Act has stalled over the questions of whether and how to regulate foundation models and biometric uses of AI.

title: Mistral AI reportedly close to closing €450M deal at $2B valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While generative AI has been a long time in the making, its powers weren’t readily apparent to the general public until OpenAI’s release of ChatGPT just over a year ago.

title: DeepDrive and Continental partner to develop innovative EV drive-brake unit
author: Dan Taylor
summary: DeepDrive, the Munich-based startup with a decidedly different take on what drive units for electric vehicles can and should be, has today announced a strategic partnership with global all-things-mobility stalwart Continental that will see the duo develop a wheel hub drive with an integrated braking solution.

title: Finnish startup Hailia unlocks the potential of fish industry sidestreams
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Currently, in sustainability tech, there's a strong interest in using sidestreams — giving industrial or manufacturing materials that ordinarily discarded a second life by turning them into end-products such as oil, concrete, and plant-based leather.

title: "It's not easy getting a banking licence," says UK Baas startup Griffin, which bags $24m
author: John Reynolds
summary: “It’s not easy” getting a UK banking licence, says UK banking-as-a-service (BaaS) fintech Griffin, which has become a fully operational UK bank while bagging $24m in fresh funding.

title: Klarna moves to new London HQ billed as “world’s largest co-working space”
author: John Reynolds
summary: Klarna, the payments giant, has today moved into its new London headquarters, billed as the “world’s largest co-working space” with proximity to the river Thames so employees can conduct “walk and talk” meetings.

title: Holdbar raises $3.5M to digitise global experience providers and tour operators
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Holdbar, a Danish experience management software founded one year ago, has raised $3.5M from the likes of Toast founder Steve Fredette and Firstminute Capital.

title: The 41-year-old “old skool” founders wanting to shake up B2B trade payments
author: John Reynolds
summary: The co-founders of Berlin-based B2B trade payment startup Mondu are zwei vom selben schlag or, as we English might say, two peas in a pod.

title: Major investor in HSBC-backed Monese writes off its investment in money transfer app
author: John Reynolds
summary: A significant investor in Monese has written off its investment in the money transfer app, as the fintech looks to raise fresh funds to ensure its survival.

title: Episode 1 announces £76M fund for Pre-Seed and Seed-stage investments
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Episode 1, a London-based VC firm focusing specifically on early-stage investments, has today announced the close of its third fund at £76 million.

title: Open source e-commerce platform Saleor raises $8M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today composable e-commerce platform Saleor announced that it has closed an $8 million Seed extension round.

title: Meet the French company pioneering digital twins for cardiovascular surgery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last decade, digital twins — virtual or digital representations of a physical object, system, or process in real-time — have been used for real-time data monitoring, simulations, predictive analytics, and collaboration. Examples include climate risk forecasting, factory floor planning,  predictive precision medicine, and business process simulation.

title: Carlyle confirms sale of Jagex, developer of Runescape, to CVC Capital Partners in $1.1B deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Global investment titan Carlyle has today confirmed the sale of video games developer behind the successful Runscape franchise, Jagex, to CVC Capital Partners and Haveli Investments.

title: Finnish startup SpinDrive raises €3.8M Series A for affordable, energy-efficient industrial bearings
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, SpinDrive, a Finnish company providing affordable active magnetic bearings for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), has secured a €3.8 million Series A funding round.

title: Data navigation tool Supersimple raises $2.2M Pre-Seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Supersimple, a ‘self-service’ business insights platform from Talinn, has raised $2.2M in Pre-Seed funding. The capital will be used to accelerate customer growth and strengthen data searching algorithms.

title: Heura Foods' €40M Series B boosts plant-based foodtech development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Barcelona plant-based foodtech company Heura Foods has successfully closed its Series B, securing €40 million.The company was founded by activists Marc Coloma and Bernat Añaños in April 2017 to create solutions that render the current food system obsolete and accelerate the transition to a world where animals are no longer part of the protein production equation.

title: Fighting fashion industry waste, Türkiye-founded Myth AI stitches together $1.3M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It’s a fairly well-known fact that the fashion industry is rife with waste. With an estimated 92 million tonnes of textiles waste produced annually, the footwear and garment industries combined account for approximately 8 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions.

title: Italian startup Dreamfarm secures €5M investment for plant-based cheese alternatives
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Dreamfarm, an Italian startup specialising in plant-based cheese alternatives, announced a total investment of €5 million.

title: Solar Foods raises €8M Series B to develop food from air
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Finnish company Solar Foods has successfully concluded its Series B funding round, raising €8 million from retail investors in Finland.

title: Helio raises €4.9M Seed funding for sustainable cloud computing
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Zurich-based cloud computing startup Helio has raised a Seed funding round of €4.9 million. The round made up of both equity and debt funding, is led by QBIT Capital and includes Uebermorgen Ventures, seed+speed Ventures, Combination VC, Rockstart Energy Fund, ROI Ventures, Swisspreneur, and angel investment. The debt financing is provided by ZKB and secured by the Swiss Technology Fund.

title: Germany's GoodBytz raises €12M to combat skills shortage with robotic kitchen assistants
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German foodtech startup Goodbytz has raised a €12 million Series A funding round to take its robotic kitchen assistants across borders as an international expansion is in the cards in the future.

title: Making sure there’s plenty more fish left in the sea, BLUU Seafood raises €16 million to cultivate real fish without the cull
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Germany’s BLUU Seafood is a food biotech which is cultivating fish cells to produce fish products - leaving the actual live fish to go about their day, living their best fish lives, and not ending up on a plate somewhere. It is creating hybrid products, such as fish balls and fish fingers, which are blended with plant-based proteins.

title: Green hydrogen boost, £340M for Monzo, and €1.85B was invested in tech this week
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1.85 billion, and around 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Causa, the new cloud-native platform for causal AI deployment raises Pre-Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Causa, a UK-based startup providing a causal AI platform for development teams, announces a Pre-Seed raise of an undisclosed amount.

title: Taking AI to the AI fight: EQT Ventures leads Seed round for AI cybersecurity firm, Qevlar AI
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Qevlar AI, a Parisian cybersecurity startup, has raised €4.5 million in a Seed round. The investment will be used to engage in a recruitment drive and further develop its generative AI cybersecurity solution.

title: Steering into the industry skid, this cultivated meat startup raises an Uncommon $30 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cambridge-based biotech startup Uncommon has raised $30 million in a Series A funding round. Formerly known as Higher Steaks, the startup will use the investment to further develop its unique approach to lab-grown lunch, ramp up production, and begin what’s proven to be the Achilles heel of the industry: the dreaded approvals process.

title: Plant-based meat alternatives firm Umiami secures €32.5M in funding for US expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French foodtech company Umiami is ramping up its texturising technology, for plant-based food, in Europe and taking it Stateside thanks to its latest Series A funding round top-up. The firm has just raised an additional €32.5 million which will see it heighten the demand for its umisation tech in European markets, expand its meat alternative offering to the US and add John Hatto to the team as he takes up the position of Managing Director for North America.

title: Estonian core banking provider Tuum bags €25m as targets DACH and Middle East
author: John Reynolds
summary: Estonian core banking provider Tuum has raised  €25 million, as it looks to target new territories in the DACH region, southern Europe and the Middle East.

title: Cosmic Aerospace raises $4.5M for revolutionary electric aircraft development
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cosmic Aerospace, a US-European aerospace startup focusing on electric aircraft, has announced the raise of $4.5 million in a seed funding round. The capital is earmarked to help the company advance the development of its technologies that mark a new dawn in electric aircraft offerings — vehicles capable of flights up to 1,000 kilometres.

title: FabricNano is pioneering sustainable chemical production with cell-free biocatalysis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When the interviewee reached out to tell me about a kind of tech I’d likely never heard of, my interest piqued. And reader, they were right.

title: Eilla AI's AI-driven financial analysis platform raises $1.5M to aid investor decision making
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Eilla AI, a generative AI platform for financial decision-making in private markets, announced that it has raised $1.5m in Seed funding.

title: Onego Bio Secures $40M Series A for animal-free egg protein
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Onego Bio has completed its $40 million Series A funding round to drive the commercialisation and manufacturing of egg protein via precision fermentation. Onego's Series A funding is one of the largest A-rounds in the Nordics, bringing the company's total funding to $56 million.

title: Swiss insurance industry-specialist Imburse Payments acquired by Duck Creek Technologies
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Boston-based listed company Duck Creek Technologies has acquired payments platform Imburse Payments for an undisclosed figure.

title: Making mealtime safer, Inspectle Foods forks €400,000
author: Dan Taylor
summary: As a sizeable portion of the global population prepares for the upcoming holiday season, the gathering together of friends and family and sharing of a meal or two or several is undoubtedly on the agenda for many.

title: Vybe, the French challenger bank catered to teenagers, has been picked up by London's Twig, self-described "bank of things"
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-based Twig is carving an extended European presence for its circular fintech offering, focused around its integrated e-checkout service that lets e-retailers accept automated valuation tickets for pre-owned goods traded in by their customers.

title: Sustainability scoring platform Redigo Carbon raises seed funding
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Polish-born, London-based ESG monitoring platform Redigo Carbon has attracted 1.2 million Polish zloty ($269,500) from Invento VC's Bridge Alfa programme, reports Poland's MamStartup.

title: Miraxess locks down €2.5 million for consumer electronics offering
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: France's Miraxess in announcing a series A fundraise of €2.5 million (source) to further ameliorate its emerging range of consumer electronics, including its forthcoming Mirabook product that streams laptop workflows from the user's smartphone.

title: Parisian customer data company mediarithmics raises €7 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Paris-based customer data platform mediarithmics has collected €7 million in its latest funding round, bringing its total investment to €20 million.

title: Boston's Action Fund for antimicrobial resistance has closed its first European deal, pouring funds into Swiss biotech BioVersys
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: AMR Action Fund, a bacterial resistance-themed investment vehicle armed with $1 billion to spend, has backed a series C round for BioVersys, a developer of antimicrobial products based out of Basel, Switzerland.

title: Gamer Arena receives investment from DOMiNO Ventures for AI development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, the competitive gaming platform Gamer Arena received investment from DOMiNO Ventures.

title: un:hurd levels up artist marketing with strategic funding and AI-powered tools
author: Cate Lawrence
