summary: Artist marketing platform un:hurd announced that it has raised six figures in strategic funding to further the expansion of its suite of marketing tools.

title: Danish climatetech NitroVolt secures €750K for green ammonia production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Danish-based climatetech company NitroVolt raised a Pre-seed round of €750,000 from Swedish venture firm BackingMinds.

title: Foodomarket raises £9.5 million as it officially launches its B2B digital food marketplace in the UK and casts its net over the Atlantic
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Foodomarket is a B2B online marketplace where food suppliers come to sell quality produce and the hospitality industry comes to get the best of deals and produce. Foodomarket handles and guarantees payments for suppliers.

title: 10 female-founded unicorns to watch
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In their recently published report “All In: Female Founders in the European VC Ecosystem” PitchBook revealed the top 10 female-founded unicorns by most recent post-money valuation.

title: Colossyan's AI-text-to-video platform attracts $22M in latest funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Colossyan, a London-based AI-text-to-video platform, has announced the successful completion of a new funding round at $22 million. Led by Lakestar, the round saw participation from existing investors Launchub, Day One  Capital, and Emerge Education, with the capital allocated to further fueling Colossyan's product development.

title: Estonia offers a lifeline to UK startups stifled by regulatory hurdles
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, UK startups turn to Estonia in response to systemic blockages to innovation in the UK.

title: Cherry Ventures introduces executive coaching for newly-backed founders
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This month, early-stage venture investor Cherry Ventures introduced coaching as a core component of its investment model.

title: “It would be foolish to stop talking to investors” says boss of challenger bank for wealthy as undertakes back-to-back fundraises
author: John Reynolds
summary: The CEO of a UK challenger bank for the wealthy says it would be “foolish” to stop talking to investors in the current difficult fundraising environment, so it is undertaking back-to-back funding rounds.

title: Social travel app Stippl raises €575,000
author: Lucy Adams
summary: One year after its launch, Amsterdam-based social travelling app Stippl has raised €575,000 Pre-Seed to continue product development for early users.

title: Grwth Club launches consumer venture fund Grwth Ventures, with £5M cornerstone investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the team behind Grwth Club launched consumer venture fund Grwth Ventures, with a £5 million cornerstone investment from employee-owned media planning and buying agency MNC.

title: Fintech unicorn Qonto to acquire Regate
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, fintech unicorn Qonto announced its plan to acquire French fintech company Regate. While the financial details are undisclosed, the deal is expected to close in the next few weeks.

title: LocalGlobe leads £8 million pour into green building material Concretene
author: Dan Taylor
summary: LocalGlobe has led an £8 million seed investment into Concretene, a product developed by the UK’s Nationwide Engineering Research and Development (NERD) in partnership with the Graphene Engineering Innovation Centre (GEIC) at The University of Manchester that aims to do more with less through better material.

title: Ganymed Robotics banks an additional €15 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian computer vision software and surgical robotics technologies company Ganymed Robotics has raised an additional €15 million in a Series B round extension, bringing the total amount of the round to a healthy €36 million.

title: Making the heat pump the European urbanite's winter-long friend, Qvantum takes on €41.2 million fundraise
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Qvantum, a Swedish heat pump supplier that's trying to install more of them in urban apartments around Europe, has announced an SEK 460 million (€41.2 million) fundraise backed by Thomas von Koch, former CEO of EQT, and IKEA's investment arm Ikeasfaren. (source: Digital)

title: Infrared City secures €1M Pre-Seed funding for climate resilient design tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Infrared City, a startup spun out of the Austrian Institute of Technology, announced a successful €1 million raise in pre-seed funding.

title: The latest weapon against climate change is concrete
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Carbon removal is a hot topic in sustainability, with many companies involved in direct air capture. But now, a Dublin company is turning surplus concrete into a low-cost, carbon removal tool via a process called 'enhanced weathering'.

title: Revolut yet to file formal US banking licence application, over two years after saying it was submitting a draft application
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut has yet to file a final application for a US banking licence, over two years after saying it was submitting a draft application for a US banking licence.

title: Getsafe acquires Luko's German customer base, expanding its European reach
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Getsafe, a Heidelberg-based neo-insurer with its sights on capturing the millennial market, has acquired the German-speaking customer base of Parisian competitor Luko. In so much, the former gains the latter’s portfolio of some 50,000 policies, including Liability, Pet, and Home Contents insurance. The terms of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: Get a Drip extends its services from DNA-personalised vitamin IV drips to digital pharma
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last couple of years, I've noticed a new trend at several tech events and conferences: vitamin-dispensing IV drips.

title: UK-based battery software start-up About:Energy raises £1.5 million to establish its own lab
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based battery software solution start-up About:Energy has raised a £1.5 million Seed round with investment from HighSage Ventures, Vireo Ventures, Rishi Khosla, Plug & Play Ventures, and Electric Revolution Ventures.The funding will go towards establishing an independent laboratory for the uni spin-out. It also plans to expand the team, and gain more industry adoption of its platform The Voltt which was launched two months ago.

title: Uncovering the barriers: the realities of being a female founder of colour in Germany
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Visit any tech event in Germany and expect to find yourself drowning in a sea of white, middle-class men. I worked from a coworking space for three years here in Berlin. An African-American friend used to joke to me whenever they held a social event,

title: International Women's Day: progress made but "old values" persist in startups
author: John Reynolds
summary: It is “clear” that female representation in tech and financial services has improved but “old banking values” persist in startups, say commentators, celebrating International Women’s Day today.

title: Northzone Backs Solvimon with €9 Million for Advanced Billing Solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Utrecht bill platform provider Solvimon, announced it has raised €9 million in seed funding.

title: Gridcog's clean energy project assessment and simulation platform secures £3.3M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cleantech software startup Gridcog today announced it has secured £3.3 million in funding.

title: The Grover legacy: Ooodles raises $12M to combat e-waste and boost tech rentals in the SME sector
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Taking on the challenges of both IT spending and e-waste, UK-based tech rental firm Ooodles has raised $12 million in debt funding. The investment is aimed at helping the firm not only continue growth in its home market but also fuel international expansion ambitions.

title: Recare secures €3.2M for expansion of digital discharge management in Germany
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Healthtech company Recare today announced that it has secured €3.2 million to expand its marketplace for digital discharge management in Germany.

title: Marts raises €1.75M in Pre-Seed funding to streamline IT management
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Marts, a Copenhagen-based, self-described OS for IT management, has raised €1.75 million in a Pre-Seed funding round to further develop its offer.

title: Kubernetes is transforming software development into greener code
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It was once said that software is eating the world, but it's true when it comes to sustainability. The ICT sector is responsible for up to 3.9% of global emissions — almost as much as the airline and shipping industries. And this is before you start thinking about the energy resources around AI. More applications mean more code which has to be stored somewhere.

title: UK Government invests £200M in green Projects for zero-emission HGVs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, the UK Government announced a £200 million investment across four innovative green projects to roll out up to 370 zero-emission HGVs (heavy goods vehicles) and help lead road transport towards net zero. HGVs alone contribute 20 percent to all transport emissions across the UK.

title: IQ Capital raises $400 million for deep tech investment in UK and Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based deep tech VC firm, IQ Capital, has announced the final close of its fourth Venture Fund at $200 million (Fund IV), taking its assets under management to more than $1 billion. Meanwhile it also launched its second $200 million Growth Fund to primarily to provide follow-up funding to its successful venture portfolios.

title: Connected raises record €2M Pre-Seed for NB-IoT connectivity from space
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Connected, a Portuguese startup on a mission to make universal, standardised, and affordable Narrowband Internet of Things (NB-IoT) connectivity from space a reality, has secured its €2 million funding round, the largest Pre-Seed ever raised by a Portuguese-based spacetech startup.

title: Estonia's MyDello collects €1.25M to deliver its solution to Finland and the Netherlands
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Estonian-based international logistics platform MyDello has raised a €1.25 million Seed funding round. The round was led by Superhero Capital and includes participation from others including Jevgeny Kabanov and angel investors from previous rounds.

title: Munich-based SaaS referrals platform Cello has raised €3.1 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German firm Cello has raised a €3.1 million in, what it is calling, a preempted Seed round led by HV Capital and includes angel investment from Alison Pickens (dbt), Phil Chambers (Workday), Julius Göllner (ARRtist) and Patrick Andrae (HomeToGo).

title: Hyperjar's growth strategy: $24M funding for recruitment and expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Hyperjar, a London-based fintech offering digital payments, planning, and personalised rewards platform has raised $24 million in a Series A funding round.

title: GR8 Sportsbook – a high-quality response to the growing iGaming industry demand
author: Tech.eu
summary: Combining state-of-the-art technology with quality service support, GR8 Tech is known to be one of the go-to service providers for iGaming operators looking to scale and grow their businesses. The company was recently shortlisted for the prestigious SBC Awards in the Sportsbook Supplier of the Year and Live Betting Product categories and received a Sportbetting Provider of the Year nomination for the SiGMA Awards.

title: Phone Stolen? Nuke From Orbit raises £500K Pre-Seed to instantly protect your data
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today UK fintech Nuke From Orbit has raised £500,000 in a Pre-Seed round to take its product to market. The startup has developed a novel innovative approach to mobile phone security, and the protection of financial accounts and personal identifiable information (PII).

title: France's BeFC Bioenzymatic Fuel Cells raises €16 million to kick off its industrial phase
author: Fiona Alston
summary: BeFC says it 'makes electricity with paper and enzymes' -  sustainable paper-based biofuel cell and eco-friendly microelectronics. Its 'thin, light-weight and flexible paper-based biofuel cells are disposable, recyclable, environmentally friendly and economically viable'. Also, they are pretty cute to look at too.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five with Dan Taylor and Cate Lawrence - Episode 21
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Up this week:

title: Legitify closes €1.5M Seed funding for online notarisation solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Online notarisation solution Legitify today announced the successful close of a €1.5 million Seed funding round.

title: Corporate-offsite platform Naboo secures €7.5M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today the corporate seminar booking platform Naboo announced that it has raised €7.5 million.

title: February 2024 report: The ups and downs of an €8.5B month
author: Dan Taylor
summary: According to the Tech.eu database, European tech companies raised €8.5 billion over the course of February 2024 in some 338 deals.

title: OpenDialog raises $8M to boost conversational AI in regulated industries
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, conversation AI platform company OpenDialog announced it has raised over $8 million in a Series A round led by AlbionVC.

title: March 2024 report: decreased fundraising in a €4.4B month
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: According to the Tech.eu database, European tech companies raised €4.4 billion over the course of March 2024 in some 304 deals.

title: Unitary raises $15M in Series A funding round for AI-driven content moderation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Unitary, a London-based startup working in the field of visual content moderation, has raised $15 million in a Series A funding round. The company uses contextual AI to automate content moderation and keep the bad actors, e.g. NSFW or otherwise, at bay.

title: Parisian IT-as-a-Service provider Primo nets $3.4 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian startup Primo has raised $3.4 million in a seed round as it aims to solve the IT problems that have plagued SMB’s for nearly a generation. The company intends to use the majority of the capital to expand its engineering team as it gears up to provide a one-stop-shop for all things IT, including the management of apps, devices, security, and even people.

title: Here's what tech recruiters really want you to know this year
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: You’ve scoured job listings, run your CV through ChatGPT several times so it matches the job you’re applying for, and have years of experience under your belt so nabbing your dream job should be a doddle, right?

title: Lisam Systems broadens chemical and cosmetic compliance solutions with EcoMundo purchase
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Belgian company Lisam Systems, a global provider of Environmental, Health and Safety (EH&S) compliance management software solutions and services, announced that it has acquired French company EcoMundo for an undisclosed amount.

title: European Investment Fund and Invoier boost European SMEs with €58M support
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Great support for European SMEs was shown this week as the European Investment Fund (EIF) and Invoier signed a guarantee agreement worth up to €58 million. The deal is supported by the InvestEU programme,

title: London’s Noventiq calls it a day with LSE, to list on Nasdaq via SPAC
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based digital transformation and cybersecurity firm Noventiq has signed a merger agreement with special purpose acquisitions company Corner Growth Acquisition Corp in order to list on New York’s Nasdaq. The deal is expected to close in H2 of this year and provide the company with an equity market cap of $1 billion and an enterprise value of $800 million.

title: Finnish firm Tietoevry acquires US digital transformation company MentorMate
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish firm Tietoevry has acquired US-based digital transformation company MentorMate to strengthen its grasp on North America and grow its digital engineering capabilities on a global scale. Details of the deal have not been disclosed.

title: SEMRON secures €7.3M Seed funding for industry-first 3D AI semiconductor chips
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German semiconductor tech company SEMRON announced it has secured €7.3 million in seed funding.

title: Accel leads $21M funding round for UK-based eldercare platform Lottie
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based eldercare online marketplace Lottie has raised a $21 million Series A funding round led by Accel and includes previous backer General Catalyst. The search tool for those looking for the ideal later-in-life care, like care homes and retirement living communities, will use the fresh funding to enhance its suite of Found by Lottie suite of products in tandem with doubling the company headcount.

title: Mundi Ventures calls up Rueda as general partner/CFO
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Delfin Rueda has been appointed general partner and chief financial officer of Madrid early and growth stage VC Mundi Ventures.

title: French startup Ringover raises €20 million for enterprise communication platform, sets sights on US market
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based cloud communications provider Ringover has closed a €20 million Series B round. The new capital is aimed at stepping up the company’s R&D investments, particularly in the field of artificial intelligence.

title: This Week in European Tech: End of the road for Tech Nation, Fever fetches $110 million, Germany has a new €1 billion fund to back deep tech innovators, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €9.6 billion, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Lanistar CEO on Gavin Williamson, expansion and new funding
author: John Reynolds
summary: Sir Gavin Williamson, the former UK education secretary, was recruited by influencer-backed virtual card payment fintech Lanistar because of his knowledge of Africa, says its CEO.

title: Metomic launches ChatGPT data security to stop employees sharing sensitive data on the platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today data security company Metomic launched  Metomic for ChatGPT, technology that gives IT and security leaders full visibility into what sensitive data is being uploaded to OpenAI's ChatGPT platform by their staff.

title: Mistral AI partners with Microsoft, EQT's new €22B fund, and over €1.85B was invested in European tech this week
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1.85 billion, and around 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Berlin-based B2B payments fintech company Mondu secures €30M for continued European expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Mondu, a Berlin-based fintech startup focusing squarely on B2B payment services, has added €30 million to a debt financing transaction initially provided by Vereinigte Volksbank Raiffeisenbank (VVRB) in October 2022.

title: $45M for proptech's Soonicorn, Canva acquires Affinity, and over €568.8M invested in tech this week
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €568.8 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Ecoworks raises €40M for net zero standard climate-netural building renovations.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today climate-neutral building renovation company ecoworks announced one of the largest Series A rounds to date in the global construction technology sector with €40 million. This brings the company's funding to over €82 million.

title: Robots aren't representing us in court but here are 7 legal tech startups transforming the legal system
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Traditionally, lawyers and legal representation are conservative, slow, methodical, and expensive. But now legal tech startups are stepping up to the bar, using technology such as AI and machine learning, teleoperations, and apps to bring justice to more people than ever before.

title: Scaling startups showcase cutting-edge Industrial tech at The Sixth Sense Summit
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's difficult for a startup to penetrate an old-school B2B sector like manufacturing. Even a company spun out of a university, with scientific validation and peer review cred, can still need help with challenges like building relationships with C-suites and end-users, not to mention the ability to create a product at scale that's the right market fit.

title: Italian aquaponic firm The Circle secures €2.1M in latest funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Italian aquaponic agricultural company The Circle has raised a further €2.1 million in a round led by Opes Italia and Sparviero Holding. The firm has raised a total of €3.6 million as it has already acquired €1.5 million from Invitalia through the Smart & Start Italy - PON Enterprises and Competitiveness 2014 – 2020 program.

title: Hometree receives funding from Blackrock for further renewable energy acquisitions
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-founded Hometree has raised a debt facility from BlackRock, enabling them to buy renewable energy installers across the UK for the installation of energy-efficient boilers and other infrastructure in British homes.

title: HealthSage secures €3M Seed investment for open source AI healthcare platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: HealthSage has raised € 3 million Seed investment to enhance and scale its open generative AI platform, which is fully dedicated to healthcare.

title: London’s With Intelligence acquired by Motive Partners in £400 million deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based provider of data and intelligence to the global asset management industry With Intelligence has announced that Motive Partners has acquired a majority stake in the company. While the terms of the deal were not disclosed, the figure of £400 million has been reported originally by Sky News and confirmed by Axios

title: Isospec Analytics raises $1.9M for molecular analysis in diagnostics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swiss life sciences startup Isospec Analytics has raised a $1.9M Pre-Seed funding round led by Founderful.

title: NPHarvest raises €2.2M to recycle nutrients in rainwater
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Finnish NPHarvest has raised €2.2M for its nutrient catcher that recycles nutrients from wastewater. Geopolitical instability and increasing prevalence of extreme climate have put the spotlight on food insecurity and supply chain instability over the past five years. With this in mind, the NPHarvest’s treatment equipment separates and collects all excess nutrients from concentrated wastewaters, which can then be recycled and made into fertiliser to reduce wasting valuable nutrients.

title: Hormona bridges the gender data gap in hormonal health, going beyond baby making
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Despite 80 per cent of women struggling with hormone issues globally, hormonal health education (conditions, symptoms, solutions, mental health implications) remains under-discussed, underreported, and underfunded.

title: Agteria Biotech has found a way to reduce methane emissions from cows
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When Erik Engellau-Nilsson, Managing Partner at Norrsken Launcher reached out and introduced a company saying “I’ve never seen ONE company with the same realistic potential and opportunity to reduce 1 per cent of global GHG as this one. It's like Northvolt building 1000 giga factories or more”  you can bet my interest is piqued.

title: Cologne construction tech startup Specter Automation raises €2.7 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Cologne's Specter Automation has raised €2.7 million in seed funds. The round is led by regional investor TechVision Fund, with participation from co-investors LBBW Venture Capital, xdeck VC, and multiple German/US angels.

title: Hydrogen startup HySiLabs raised €13 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: France-based liquid hydrogen carrier developer HySiLabs has raised €13 million in series A funds.

title: Gran Turismo star Max Teichert’s Titan Academy raises $1 million to help gamers gain ground
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based, automated coaching for simulation game players startup Titan Academy has raised $1 million in a seed funding round that will help the startup further develop and expand its racing games-focused offer in tandem with fleshing out plans to expand into new verticals, beginning with football. Following a pre-seed round in early 2022, Titan Academy has now raised a total of $1.8 million.

title: Shields champions circular economy at MWC, with an equipment marketplace for telcos
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: As a tech journalist, my junk drawer has been home to a veritable graveyard of IoT devices – many of which became bricked due to a lack of planned obsolescence, as well as a bunch of mobile phones too old for security updates. I give what I can to people for testing purposes, but it's just a tiny part of a far bigger problem – e-waste.

title: Powerdot secures €100M funding for EV charging infrastructure expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Powerdot, a Lisbon-based EV charging point operator, announced on Thursday the successful closing of a €100 million funding round led by Antin Infrastructure Partners and Arié Group.

title: Midas Games secures $1M pre-seed investment from Ludus Ventures
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Midas Games received a $1 million Pre-Seed investment in a round led by Ludus Ventures.

title: Ayora secures $1.6M Pre-Seed for its AI-powered revenue decision-making platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Revenue management platform ayora, announced today that it has secured $1.6 million in a Pre-Seed round.

title: Water Kinetics secures £150K for Eco-Duo water recirculation system
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, plumbing startup Water Kinetics secured £150,000 investment from the British Design Fund for its innovative ‘Eco-Duo’ pipe-within-a-pipe water recirculation system. This system can help reduce carbon emissions and energy use while aiding safe pathogen levels within drinking water systems.

title: Lack of public awareness of climate crisis link to pension funds a “national scandal”, says Cushon boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: The lack of public awareness of pension funds being invested in fossil fuels or high-carbon industries is a “national scandal”, says the boss of NatWest-owned fintech Cushon.

title: Ostium Labs' $3.5M funding fuels launch of real-world asset trading hub
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based startup Ostium Labs creators of a decentralised non-custodial perpetuals exchange for real-world assets, has raised a $3.5 million Seed round. The round was led by General Catalyst and LocalGlobe and saw participation from SIG, DeFi Alliance, Balaji Srinivasan (former Coinbase CTO), Vessel Capital, and others.

title: Focus Group becomes a unicorn with new investment from Hg
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Focus Group, a provider of business tech to SMEs, today announced that it has secured investment from Hg, an investor in European and transatlantic software and services businesses. This partnership will support Focus Group's continued growth in the UK.

title: German partnership to bring together quantum and supercomputing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German quantum computer startup eleQtron and Forschungszentrum Jülich’s world-leading supercomputing centre are entering into a development partnership to make their trapped-ion quantum computer operational by the end of 2024.

title: EIC Scaling Club announces its first 48 European deeptech scaleups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today the EIC Scaling Club unveiled the selection of the first 48 European deep tech scaleups to join its curated community of standout companies, investors, corporate innovators, mentors, media firms and other industry stakeholders.

title: finmid raises €35M for embedded finance software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based SaaS finmid has raised €35M in early-stage funding for its embedded finance solution for B2B platforms that serve small to medium businesses.

title: From garage to global: new program fast-tracks Ukrainian defence startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A new defence tech initiative, the Defenсe Builder Accelerator, has launched in Ukraine. It's a four-month intensive training program designed for Ukrainian defence startups to secure the first investments and transition from "garage" production to creating a tech company.

title: 1991 Ventures launches £15M fund for Ukrainian and CEE startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today 1991 Ventures launched a £15 million fund to invest in untapped Ukrainian and Central Eastern European (CEE) startup talent with global potential to solve real-world problems.

title: Gridbeyond raises €52M Series C to connect the energy grid
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Gridbeyond, an Irish analytics and asset management provider for the energy sector, has raised a €52M Series C round to scale up its operations.

title: Climate tech startup atmio emerges from stealth to combat methane emissions
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Hamburg-based atmio emerges from stealth today revealing its operating system that’s taking on climate change, but not in the way you might think.

title: Ascension VC launches €19.8M institutional impact fund for Tech4Good startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Early-stage investment fund Ascension VC announced a €19.8 million first close of its new institutional impact fund, which will back talented founders leveraging technology to build more resilient societies. A second close of the overall £50 million (approx €58.36 million) will follow in 2025.

title: Work and knowledge management platform Fibery raises $5.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cyprus-based Fibery has raised $5.2 million in a Series A funding round. The capital is intended to be used to further accelerate the startup’s development, with a particular focus on upping the sales and marketing headcount.

title: This startup is closing the loop, turning cotton-PET blends into new textile fibres
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: We live in an era of fast fashion, where despite the best efforts of sustainability campaigners, people buy more clothes than they wear, resulting in them being burnt or ending up in landfills — according to EcoWatch, approximately 39.000 tons of unwanted garments are transported to the Atacama Desert annually, where they cover the dunes and cause significant environmental challenges.

title: Germany's Enviria targets commercial solar energy market with $200M BlackRock funding
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Frankfurt-based Enviria has secured over $200 million in a Series B funding round provided by the world's largest asset manager, BlackRock. The investment will provide Enviria with further support as it expands upon its existing 500 commercial and industrial solar projects across Germany.

title: Metaview raises $7M for AI hiring software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based AI hiring software company Metaview has raised $7M for its LLM-enabled software that automates summary and analysis of job interviews. The funding will be directed predominantly towards product development as well as hiring more engineers.

title: Klein Vision sells flying car tech to China
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Klein Vision's dream of a shape-shifting vehicle that goes from a road car to flying in the sky in minutes with only the need for a short landing strip is one step closer. The company is licencing its tech to Hebei Jianxin Flying Car Technology Company in China. While the financial details are undisclosed, the prototype cost $2.3 million to develop.

title: Hydrogen startups in the North West to receive £1.5M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Sustainable Ventures has partnered with independent technology innovation catalyst CPI in a government-backed effort to deliver £1.5 million of private investment to hydrogen startups in the North West of England. With plans to “transform Manchester into a European hydrogen hub,” its accelerator anticipates £5 million in commercial contracts for startups in the region.

title: Sweden's J12 launches Nexus, a new programme for European data and AI start-ups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swedish VC, J12 Ventures, has launched a six-week programme to support Pre-seed and Seed stage founders - Nexus for data and AI start-ups in Europe. Up to ten (7-10) founding teams will be chosen for the first cohort, each receiving up to a €1 million investment from J12. The first cohort kicks off in the autumn.

title: Schaeffler proposes €3.64B acquisition of powertrain maker Vitesco
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bavarian developer and manufacturer of powertrain technologies for sustainable mobility Vitesco has seen a 20.24 percent increase in its share price today following reports that the company’s largest shareholder, Schaeffler is offering to acquire the company at a valuation of €3.64 billion.

title: Prague startup Apify raises €2.8M for AI data mining
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Apify, a web data extraction platform, has secured €2.8 million in funding.

title: Buddywise's AI for workplace safety raises €3.5M seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Buddywise has today announced their €3.5M seed round to prevent workplace accidents in industrial spaces around Europe. The round was co-led by specialist AI fund J12 and Kvanted, with Soundcloud founder Eric Quidenus-Wahlforss also participating.

title: Robovision raises $42M to accelerate AI-powered industrial automation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI-powered computer vision, Robovision, has raised $42 million in its latest investment round, bringing its funding to $65 million. Headquartered in Ghent, Robovision's AI-powered computer vision platform offers an end-to-end, no-code solution for machinery manufacturers and production lines.

title: Superlayer raises $1.3 million to "supercharge" sales pipelines using AI
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London-based startup Superlayer  has raised $1.3 million in pre-seed funds to perfect its AI-driven sales workflow platform that enables deal pipelines to be qualified and deciphered in "seconds".

title: Intel’s deeptech accelerator announces its seventh cohort
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Intel Ignite, Intel's global startup accelerator program for early-stage deeptech startups, has announced the 10 startups who make up its seventh cohort, which will convene in Munich.

title: €1B+ for residential solar, investor Climate Hardware Playbook, and over €1.7B invested in tech this week
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 75 tech funding deals worth over €1.7 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Re:course AI lands $4.3 million for healthcare's answer to AI flight simulators
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Billed as medical training's very own AI flight simulator, Manchester-based Re:course AI has locked down $4.3 million in seed funds to build foreign market share for its "generative AI" tuition product.

title: From holographics to 5G black boxes: startups take centre stage at MWC/4YFN 2024
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The massive Mobile World Congress (MWC) in Barcelona is here again.

title: How Wagestream is empowering 3 million employees with financial services
author: Jeppe Zink
summary: Wagestream, the financial super-app for frontline workers, has signed up over 1,000 corporate customers covering almost  3 million employees. With over $250m in total funding to date, the company continues to stay true to its mission of bringing financial wellbeing to everyone by offering employees pay and spend tracking, flexible pay, financial coaching and more.

title: Throwing a lasso around the chaos of unstructured content, Instill AI ropes in $3.6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Images, video, audio, text, lions and tigers and bears, oh my! Hands in the air if, like me, there’s rarely a day that goes by when you’re not bombarded with such media. On an hourly or sometimes minute-by-minute basis. Yeah, I thought so.

title: Showpad co-founder launches Entourage, a venture studio and $30M early stage VC fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Entourage, a new operation launched by Showpad co-founder Pieterjan Bouten has confirmed the raised of over $30 million for its early stage VC fund.

title: Samplico secures $1.8M in funding to advance global expansion
author: Tech.eu
summary: Samplico, (better known as Denebunu in Turkey, its parent company) has secured $1.8 million to help brands tap the power of user-generated content (UGC) and uncover consumer insights. The investment will also be used to support the newly launched SaaS market research platform Sorbunu in the UK market.

title: Satgana announces €8M fund for early-stage climate tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Satgana, a global VC firm that will invest in climate tech startups throughout Europe and Africa, has closed its first round with €8M invested from more than 100 LPs in 25 countries.

title: Bank of America backs Impact X's mission to support underrepresented entrepreneurs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Impact X Capital Partners announced this week that Bank of America is investing equity in its IX Global I fund. The firm is a double-bottom-line venture capital firm headquartered in London, founded in 2019. The firm focuses on investing in underrepresented innovators in Europe, particularly women and founders of colour, in key sectors such as digital and technology, health, education and well-being, and media and entertainment.

title: No fly in the ointment here as Entocycle raises $5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Entocycle has raised $5 million in a Series A round that will see the company further invest in solutions that up the productivity and efficiency of black solider fly farms. Since early 2017 the company has raised $21.5 million and is playing a vital role in decreasing deforestation, overfishing, and food waste, all the while helping to improve food and feed security.

title: Offering brands an NFT-based turnkey loyalty solution, Cohort raises €3.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Customer loyalty. Brands want it, and consumers want something for it. But beyond the tried and true, and quite frankly, somewhat now boring membership card or loyalty points that have become de rigueur, what’s a brand to do? Well, why not hop on the NFT train, even if they’re not really quite sure what that is?

title: Jetson's $15M Seed round is a big step forward for personal eVTOL aviation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This month, pioneering aviation company Jetson announced the successful closure of a $15 million Seed round. The company makes the Jetson ONE, a first-of-its-kind commercially available eVTOL that you can own and fly for short point-to-point flights.

title: Lawhive raises £9.5M for legal AI platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Lawhive have raised £9.5M from Google Ventures following the launch of Lawrence, a Generative AI program that automates minor and repetitive legal tasks.

title: 3 European tech companies that are hiring right now
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: With tech layoffs coming thick and fast at the moment––this week both PayPal and HubSpot announced job cuts––the wider macroeconomic climate is having a knock-on effect on the stock prices and cash reserves of some of the world’s biggest technology firms.

title: A case for no-code in Europe
author: Andrew Fenton
summary: European companies are facing more complex challenges than ever and grappling with significant business changes linked to rising inflation, geopolitical conflicts, climate change, and the energy crisis. Despite these disruptions, Europe has shown remarkable resilience to the challenging environment.

title: Innovators are being 'hamstrung' by lack of fundraising knowledge — report
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Pioneers of early stage companies require better signposting to external funding, according to new research published by the UK's Venture Capital Trust Association.

title: Flatpay raises €45M Series B
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Danish fintech Flatpay, which provides payment software for SMBs, has raised a €45M Series B round two years after its founding in 2022.

title: 10 Poland startups that closed the biggest rounds in 2023
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: A new Endeavor study, Mapping Poland's Tech Sector - A Network Analysis of the Entrepreneurship Community” reveals that Poland is on track to become a globally competitive home for entrepreneurship. To explore the ecosystem, we have looked for the Poland startups that raised the most in 2023.

title: 35% of Northern Ireland's funding deals went to women-led startups last year
author: Lucy Adams
summary: 65 per cent of Northern Ireland's 72 funding deals last year went to startups with all-male executive teams, according to Catalyst’s Deal Tracker. Of all companies who received funding, 35 per cent had at least one female executive whilst zero had all-female teams.

title: Funding opportunity for B2B solutions from Mastercard Strive
author: Anan Abu Rmieleh
summary: Grants up to €500,000 for EU-based startups developing B2B solutions tailored for small business needs.

title: European startups lead the way in tech innovation at MWC 2023
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Another year at the behemoth Mobile World Congress (MWC) is over in Barcelona. Initially targeting mobile makers and telcos, the evolution of IoT means it now encompasses everything from mobility to wearable tech, smart cities and robotics. It also includes the sister event 4YFN (four years from now), which introduces you to thousands of startups and a plethora of side events.

title: Ukraine's Roosh X and Tiny Studio want to create cash cows, not unicorns
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Ukrainian firm Roosh X, based in Kyiv and London, and Canadian startup builder Tiny Studio launched an investment partnership to challenge private equity orthodoxy in Europe. The partnership will deploy tickets ranging from $500,000 to $10 million, targeting profit-focused tech sector companies with $5 million+ revenue whose aims to grow securely are currently unmet by traditional financing options.

title: Deezer CEO Jeronimo Folgueira resigns amidst positive financials
author: Dan Taylor
summary: French music streaming platform Deezer has announced the departure of its CEO Jeronimo Folgueira, citing his decision to resign a move that will allow him to “devote himself to personal projects”.

title: HSBC’s new FX app Zing off to a “slow” start, as Wise and Revolut estimated to be downloaded five and 30 times more
author: John Reynolds
summary: It has been hyped as the big UK fintech launch of the year so far, as banking juggernaut HSBC looked to take on fintech disruptors.

title: Oriole raises £10M Seed to reduce AI's colossal carbon footprint
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UCL spinout Oriole Networks, whose technology hopes to reduce the amount of energy needed to run AI data centres, has raised £10M — one of the largest seed rounds in recent years.

title: World Fund unveils record €300M fund for climate founders
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based World Fund will provide €300M to climate tech founders over the next few years, making its fund the largest climate-dedicated pool the continent has seen yet. The commitment marks a first foray into climate investing for many LPs, signalling strong belief in the sector’s resilience despite the continuing VC hesitancy that stems from geopolitical and economic crises.

title: Oakley Capital acquires majority stake in progressive lens maker Horizons Optical
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Oakley Capital announced that the Oakley Capital Origin Fund I is acquiring a majority stake in eyeglass maker Horizons Optical.

title: 2023 and 2024 are set to become strong vintage venture years: here is why
author: Alan Vaksman
summary: The industry is rife with speculation over what the next 11 months hold for venture capital and the startup scene. The drop in valuations in 2022, alongside prolonged economic volatility, had led many to conclude that this will be something of a barren year. Though we are unlikely to see the “gold rush” madness of 2021 any time soon, I disagree that 2023 will be a year of doom and gloom for the venture industry. Quite the opposite. There is strong evidence to support the view that both 2023 and 2024 will be years remembered for exciting startups and landmark VC deals.

title: January 2023: Deals, exits and a less than stellar start to the year
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Although it was to be expected, or at least hoped, that the beginning of the new year would bring some changes to the European technology scene, the data our research team tracked showed otherwise. The trend that was noticeable when we summarized 2022, with all the drops in the second half of the year, unfortunately, continued in the first month of 2023.

title: Sparking Entrepreneurial Success: How the CASSINI Challenges are Igniting Innovation
author: Tech.eu
summary: Space data holds immense potential to revolutionise our world, from improving the delivery of healthcare to preventing illegal logging, and enabling AR/VR-powered city planning. The possibilities are infinite.

title: Philips to slash 6,000 positions by 2025, 1,100 in the Netherlands
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Philips, the global technology company, has recently announced its plans to reduce its global workforce by 6,000 roles by 2025, with some 3,000 individuals receiving the pink slip before year's end. Specifically, the company cited 1,100 employees in the Netherlands will be impacted.

title: Next in the firing line, Glovo lays off 250 staff members
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Glovo has released 6.5% of its workforce, bidding an emotional goodbye earlier today to 250 of its workers.

title: It’s official: Spotify founder Daniel Ek takes on healthcare
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While the rumours have been widely circulated, it’s been officially confirmed that Spotify founder Daniel Ek is getting into the healthcare system business with his newest startup Neko Health.

title: TokenEx merges with fintech IXOPAY
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Data tokenization startup TokenEx will merge with payments platform IXOPAY to combine their payment optimisation software products and simplify users' payment journeys.

title: Culture Amp acquires Serbian people analytics company Orgnostic
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, employee experience platform Culture Amp announced its intention to acquire Serbian people analytics company Orgnostic.

title: Laurens De Poorter named as Kraken Ventures’ first European Partner
author: Dan Taylor
summary: San Francisco-based Kraken Ventures, the independent investment fund backed by Kraken Digital Asset Exchange, that's targeting early-stage companies and protocols across the crypto and fintech ecosystems has announced the appointment of Laurens De Poorter as its first European Partner. The move signals the firm's dedication to the European market.

title: This Week in European Tech: SoftBank's Arm picks US over London for IPO, Klarna reports $1 billion loss for 2022, HTGF closes €500 million fund, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 75 tech funding deals worth over €832 billion, and over 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Cyber threat advisory Amossys is hitching a ride with Almond
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: France-based cybersecurity auditor and consultancy Almond has acquired the entire shareholding of its Rennes-HQed peer Amossys.

title: Moonhub secures $1.4M investment for VR interactive training platform
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Moonhub, a London-based virtual reality interactive training platform, has today confirmed a $1.4 million venture round led by Danish VC Unconventional Ventures with existing investors Pi Labs and Ada Ventures continuing their support of the startup.

title: CEO Espen Digernes acquires bankrupt Swedish e-motorbike manufacturer Cake
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Good news today for e-motorbike company Cake.

title: Wellola secures €2.2M for digital patient management solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Digital health company Wellola today announced the successful closure of a €2.2 million funding round, bringing its total funding to date to €4 million.

title: Car solutions provider ULU absorbs Dutch connected mobility player iMoto
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Netherlands-based iMoto BV, a connected mobility company, has been acquired by London-HQed auto IoT solutions company ULU.(source - Silicon Canals.)

title: Mission Zero Technologies raises £21.8M for modular direct air capture tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today cleantech direct air capture (DAC) company Mission Zero Technologies announced it has raised £21.8 million in Series A funding. Since its foundation in 2020, Mission Zero has rapidly pioneered a versatile new direct air capture technology for any industrial use case, location, and scale.

title: Green PRAXIS raises Seed funding for natural asset management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Green PRAXIS, a startup that supports operators and infrastructure owners in managing natural assets, announced successful Seed fundraising.

title: TeamSystem snaps up Growens' email service platform in €70 million deal
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Italy-based TeamSystem, an enterprise software and training provider, has agreed a €70 million cash free, debt free deal to acquire the MailUp email and marketing suite from Milan-HQed Growens.

title: HyLight raises $4M for hydrogen-powered airship drones
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Hylight, a patented hydrogen-powered airship drone maker, has raised $4 million. It has developed a zero-emission way to inspect any infrastructure from the air. Previous solutions were either costly and polluting (helicopters), not precise enough (drone planes and satellites), or needing more flight autonomy (quadricopter drones). In the meantime, methane leaks alone account for 4 per cent of global greenhouse gas emissions and annual losses of $7 billion in the European and North American markets... and counting.  Equipped with a hydrogen fuel cell, the HyLighter is a cross between drone and airship technology. Like a drone, it is easy to control and transport. It enables precise data collection over long distances in a sustainable way.

title: Embedded finance company Liberis takes on €30 million SVB UK loan
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Venture debt provider Silicon Valley Bank UK has awarded a €30 million loan to UK-based SME receivables finance provider Liberis.

title: Promoting fairness and sustainability in the electronics industry, Fairphone rings up €49 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based sustainable smartphone company Fairphone has raised €49 million in a new funding round led by new investor Invest-NL andexisting shareholder Quadia via its Regenero Impact Fund. The round also saw participation from existing backers DALHAP, DOEN Participaties, and PDENH.

title: Amsterdam connectivity startup GNX lures funding
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Dutch investment firm Lexar Partners has put up an undisclosed sum for GNX, a Netherlands-based provider of connectivity and digital transformation services.

title: Raylo secures £110 million in working capital, achieves B-Corp status
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based tech refurb/subscription platform Raylo has secured £110 million in a debt financing package provided by NatWest and Quilam Capital. As expected given Raylo’s vertical, the working capital is expected to be used to fund growth and product expansion. Since mid-June 2019, Raylo has raised in excess of £150 million.

title: Bypassing the boys' club: UK startup Tangent levels the playing field for tech job applicants with $1.1M raise
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's a harsh reality that the world runs on warm introductions, from getting a meeting with a potential investor to finding customers or your next co-founder. But now, a UK startup is making it just that much easier for people to improve their lot in life.

title: The third wave of AI is here: Opteran's "Natural Intelligence" inspired by insect brains
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Here at Tech.eu, we get a lot of press pitches from startups working in AI — primarily generative AI. I'm always looking for something different, so my interest was piqued when I came across Opteran, a UK startup that has developed an approach to AI based on a decade of research into insect brains.

title: 10 Swedish startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: With €5.7 billion raised in total in 2023, Sweden took fifth place among the best-performing countries, as stated in our Annual report.

title: Contract drafting startup Henchman piles on another €6.5 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Following its seed round this time last year, Belgian legal tech Henchman has picked up another €6.5 million for its assisted contract drafting platform and now has a GPT-3 integration to further accelerate contract work.

title: Mendelian's rare disease case load AI secures £1.4 million grant award
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UK-based Mendelian is preparing further trials of its AI case-finding tool for diagnosing rare diseases at scale after being awarded $1.4 million from a national health innovation grant making body.

title: Prague-based SaaS platform Choice secures €2.3M investment for restaurant services
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Choice, a Prague-based B2B SaaS platform for restaurants, has secured €2.3 million in a new investment round, now bringing the company’s total amount raised to just shy of €5 million.

title: Heyflow bags $16M Series A for no-code conversion optimisation platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German 'no-code' tool maker Heyflow has raised  $16 million Series A in a round led by Singular, bringing the startup's funding to $22 million.

title: Backed by an all-star cast, product management platform Cycle dons the green jersey in $6 million round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Brussels-based Cycle has raised $6 million in a seed funding round that will see the company further its end goal of becoming the be-all-end-all reference when it comes to product management, think Figma for product management and/or GitHub when it comes to a living, breathing CV.

title: February 2023: Deals, exits and continued falling numbers
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: It's been a very slow start to the year, both in terms of the number of investments, but also the total amounts raised. The trend that started at the top of the year appears to be continuing through February 2023. Even though February is the shortest month of the year, the trend of lower investments compared to the first month, and in general, compared to the same period last year, is evident.

title: Swedish lender Froda says Klarna alumni key to growth as launches in Ireland
author: John Reynolds
summary: Swedish lender Froda says Klarna alumni have been key to its growth, as it expands into Ireland, its next new market. The lender, which makes around €60m a year in revenues, offers its white-label embedded lending model in markets beyond Sweden.

title: Greensphere Capital raises £66.3M for Gaia Sciences Innovation Fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, specialist investment advisor Greensphere Capital, announced that it has raised £66.3 million in conditional capital for its Gaia Sciences Innovation fund.

title: Ukraine is transforming to get foreign investments. Here is what we have done so far
author: Oleksandr Gryban
summary: Ukraine has taken incredible losses due to the unprovoked Russian invasion, of which death and human lives are the heaviest price the country pays. But each branch of the government works tirelessly to respond to the challenges and provide value to its citizens, allies, and partners. My team at the Ministry of Economy is tasked to attract investments in the country to secure Ukraine's soon recovery and transformation.

title: €200M for hydrogen refueling,  Hootsuite acquires Luxembourg's Talkwalker, and Dutch startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €846 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Quantexa reels in Dublin's Aylien to enhance language models in its decision intelligence platform
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London's Quantexa has acquired Aylien, a language processing software company based in Dublin, in a bid to empower its decision intelligence platform with enhanced unstructured data analysis and language modelling.

title: Microsoft and Seedrs launch new AI accelerator
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Seedrs, Europe’s leading private investing platform, has partnered with Microsoft to launch SERIES AI, an AI-focused accelerator for startups.

title: Romanian-founded Kubeark nets $2.8 million pre-seed to help software enterprises scale
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UiPath almunus Bogdan Nedelcov, who hails from Bucharest, co-founded New York-based Kubeark in a bid to "challenge the status quo" in scaling up software startups.

title: Oxford Instruments Nanoscience and Rigetti complete quantum computing project
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Oxford Instruments Nanoscience and Rigetti Computing have successfully completed a project to build and operate one of the first quantum computers in the UK, funded by the UK government’s Quantum Technologies Challenge.

title: Digital platform Healthkey raises £1.13M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Digital health platform Healthkey has raised £1.13M in a round led by Aviva Ventures.

title: Textiles cleantech Bcomp secures $40M funding for sustainable fibre composites
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss natural fibre composites company Bcomp today announced it has completed a $40M Series C investment funding round.

title: Meet the Gen Z founders rewiring the graduate job market
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based Huzzle has raised £1.43M in Pre-Seed funding for careers-focused social networking.

title: Early-stage dominance: Insights from PitchBook’s Q1 2024 European Venture report
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: While the first quarter of 2024 showed a mixed tone, with robust deal activity indicating a potential increase in deal value compared to 2023, exits demonstrated weakness, and fundraising displayed some resilience, reveals the new "Q1 2024 European Venture Report" published by PitchBook.

title: Nico Rosberg launches new $75M fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Rosberg Ventures, the VC fund founded by F1 World Champion Nico Rosberg, has launched a $75M fund. Rosberg, who is scouting for ‘Europe’s most entrepreneurial families’, has accrued a portfolio of 35 startups and scaleups so far.

title: Filigran's journey: From €5M seed round to €15M Series A in just six months
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Today French cyber tech startup Filigran has announced the completion of a €15 million Series A funding round led by Accel. The Series A arrives just six months after the startup secured €5 million in a seed round led by UK investor Moonfire.

title: 50 leading European climatetech founders and investors launch Climate Brick
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Europe’s leading climate tech founders and investors join forces to launch ‘Climate Brick’ – a new community committed to addressing the climate crisis through technology.

title: Homed-IQ receives  €1M investment for  at-home medical diagnostics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today medtech company Homed-IQ announced that it has received a  €1 million investment from Healthy Capital and private investors.

title: Trojan Energy raises £26M to boost on-street EV charging
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today on-street electric vehicle charging company Trojan Energy announced it has secured a  £26 million investment to facilitate its ambitious growth plans. This brings the company's funding to over £41 million.

title: Crosstown H2R comes out of stealth with its pioneering gas turbine decarbonisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Swiss climatetech startup Crosstown H2R comes out of stealth, announcing successful partnerships and funds raised. Founded in 2022, Crosstown develops decarbonation technology. The Crosstown Burner (H2R®) decarbonises gas turbines while ensuring international emissions compliance with ultra-low nitrogen oxide (NOx) capability.

title: IsomAb secures £7.5M for treatment of diabetic peripheral arterial disease
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today IsomAb — a University of Nottingham spin-out pioneering a new treatment for people with diabetes at risk of amputation — has raised £7.5 million in funding.

title: Zagreb’s insurtech startup Amodo snapped up by Cambridge Mobile Telematics
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Positioning itself as the world’s largest telematics service provider, Softbank Vision Fund and General Atlantic-backed Cambridge Mobile Telematics (CMT) has acquired insurance tech startup Amodo for an undisclosed sum.

title: Food sourcing platform Torg raises €2.7M Seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based B2B startup Torg has raised €2.7M for its Seed round for its platform that connects suppliers of food service products with buyers.

title: JENA Secures £1.2M Pre-Seed to empower UK solopreneurs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: JENA, a UK SaaS platform for solopreneurs, announced today it has secured £1.2 million in an oversubscribed Pre-Seed funding round.

title: Waymap secures £7M for navigation app that works indoors, outdoors, and underground
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, London-based deeptech navigation startup Waymap announced the completion of a £7 million funding round.

title: Weenat raises $8M Series C for meteorological sensors in soil
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German agritech Weenat has raised an $8M Series C round for its meteorological sensors that help farmers conserve water.

title: GoHenry co-founder hits out at UK education secretary over comments that financial services firms are London-centric
author: John Reynolds
summary: The co-founder of a UK children’s financial app with millions of customers and a geographically dispersed workforce, has dubbed the UK education secretary’s comment urging fintechs to “get out more” to attract staff as “really strange”.

title: Meet France's software giants
author: Lucy Adams
summary: 1. Contentsquare

title: Senoptica's food-waste-busting sensor technology gets FDA approval
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Global food waste continues to be a huge problem. According to figures from The World Counts, roughly one-third (1.3 billion tons) of food is wasted annually. And it's not just food leftovers that go to waste in our homes and restaurants; it occurs before the food even gets to our homes.

title: AmphiStar raises €6M to recycle waste
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Ghent-based Bioengineering startup Amphistar has raised €6M from European Circular Bioeconomy Fund (ECBF), Qbic III and Flanders Future Tech Fund (FFTF) to derive surfactants from waste.

title: Quantonation ventures closes €70M round to fund early-stage quantum startups
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Quantonation Ventures has closed its second early-stage fund dedicated to quantum technologies, Quantonation II, at €70M of its €200M target.

title: Qureight raises $8.5M for clinical trial imaging to accelerate drug development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Biotech company Qureight has today announced the close of their significantly oversubscribed $8.5 million Series A round.

title: Insurtech firm Insify adds Nico Rosberg to its slipstream and puts an extra €10 million in the tank
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Amsterdam-based insurtech firm Insify is putting the assurance of a swift painless service into insurance for SMEs.

title: Spendesk acquires Okko to integrate procurement into its SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: B2B SaaS Spendesk has acquired French Procurement company Okko, enabling them to integrate procurement services for customers alongside automated accounting services currently on offer.

title: Middle East conflict is “horrible” and could drive a new inflation scare, says Zopa boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: The Palestinian-Israeli conflict is “horrible” and will “continue to create concerns” across the world, including the investment community, according to Jaidev Janardana, CEO of UK fintech lender Zopa.

title: Groningen-based QDI systems raises €5M to advance quantum dots technology in medical sector
author: Dan Taylor
summary: QDI systems, a Groningen-based deeptech startup, has raised €5 million in a bid to scale its quantum dots technology for the medical sector.

title: £108M equity for Flagstone, Ada Ventures' inclusion in practice, and €672 million was invested in tech this week
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €672 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: rSIM tackles IoT access disruptions with world-first network switching
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: As Mobile Network Operators (MNOs) invest in upgrading their core networks away from 2G and 3G to 4G and 5G, periods of unplanned downtime have become more prevalent. They can leave customers disconnected for long periods in life-critical positions, disrupting health services and shutting down entire train networks.

title: A £3.75 million boost for Forefront RF from BGF to simplify smartphone design
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based Forefront RF has received a further £3.75 million in funding from BGF, who previously backed the semiconductor company in 2021. The fresh funds will help the company drive further growth globally.

title: Basemark raises €22M for AR-enhanced car cameras
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Basemark, which supplies computer vision software and AR to enable original equipment manufacturers to develop their own AR applications, has raised €22M in Series B funding.

title: Blackswan raises €760,000 to develop its simulators for space maintenace
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Blackswan Space, a Lithuania-based spacetech startup developing software products for complex space & defence missions, has secured €760,000 in Pre-Seed funding round.

title: Proton acquires Standard Notes creating a new era of privacy-first digital services
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today privacy and security company Proton announced it has acquired encrypted notes app Standard Notes, furthering their shared mission of building a better internet where privacy is the default.

title: Avenir raise $500,000 Pre-Seed to develop B2B wealth management software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Wealth management fintech Avenir has raised a $500,000 pre-seed round to provide businesses with software that scores businesses based on their sustainability.

title: This Week in European Tech: Quantexa scores $129 million, Nestlé buys big into Munich's Yfood, Paris bans e-scooters, Acorns buys GoHenry, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €761 million, and 10+ exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Volaris Group acquires Icore Solutions
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Icore Solutions, a SaaS platform that facilitates integration of bundled digital services, has been acquired by Volaris Group. Volaris is an acquirer who ‘buys and holds’ software businesses before they are bought by others.

title: Hootsuite acquires AI-powered social listening powerhouse Talkwalker
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Social media manager Hootsuite is acquiring Luxembourg company Talkwalker. Talkwaker develops consumer intelligence and deep listening tech that enables brands to drive business impact and revenue.

title: Viola Credit fuels Hokodo's growth with €100M debt facility
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today digital payment terms solution provider Hokodo announced a new €100 million debt facility from Viola Credit, a global credit investment manager focused on supporting the growth of the innovation economy.

title: “People are scared to say the wrong thing" says fintech leader, heading up new disability inclusion campaign
author: John Reynolds
summary: Leading UK fintech organisations are clubbing together behind a campaign urging the fintech industry to improve their disability inclusion efforts.

title: Turkey’s Fazla raises $6 million at $43 million valuation priming European expansion of its waste reduction company
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Fazla is a Turkish waste management company, reducing waste and waste-borne carbon emissions across the supply chain. The B Corp firm has successfully saved over 58,000 tons of food from being wasted and prevented 83,000 tons of carbon emissions, making a significant positive impact on the environment.

title: MixRift raises $1.6M for mixed reality casual gaming
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Mixed reality gaming start-up MixRift has secured $1.6M in Pre-Seed investment from leading investors, including Outsized Ventures, Underline Ventures, and SOSV. The backing will support MixRift in accelerating its efforts to develop and publish in-demand mixed reality titles.

title: DemoSquare secures €1.28M for its AI tech that helps businesses stay ahead of legislation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss AI startup DemoSquare has secured €1.28 million (CHF 1.2 million).

title: Meiro secures $3M Pre-Series A funding to fuel its global expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the customer data platform Meiro announced it has successfully secured $3 million in an oversubscribed pre-Series A round.

title: Supernovas – EIT's response to the lack of women in startups
author: Julia Gifford
summary: With only 2% of VC funding going to female-founded teams, and women making up just 13% of venture capital partners, women are undeniably underrepresented in the world of startups.

title: It's World Sleep Day, and these startups want to help you get better shut-eye
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's World Sleep Day, and I'm sure I'm not the only one feeling tired. I'm fortunate enough to get treatment from a sleep doctor, but I know most people face months-long waiting lists to access services.

title: All you need to know about H Tree, the new European 'deep biotech' fund started by Hoxton Ventures co-founder Rob Kniaz and healthcare expert Vanela Bushi
author: Robin Wauters
summary: A couple of weeks ago, word got out that Rob Kniaz, who co-founded European early-stage investment firm Hoxton Ventures in 2013, was on the verge of establishing a new VC fund focused on deep tech bets.

title: UK edtech unicorn Multiverse acquires AI intelligence platform Searchlight
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, UK tech company Multiverse acquired AI talent software company Searchlight to help businesses close skills gaps.

title: Estonian Viacurrent secures investment from Rockstart
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Rockstart, the early-stage accelerator and venture capital firm, has announced its latest investment in Viacurrent, an employee financial wellness platform based in Tallinn, Estonia. The investment, finalized on Wednesday, also saw participation from angel investor Kristjan N. Although the exact funding amount remains confidential, this strategic backing highlights Viacurrent's potential to revolutionize financial health for employees across Europe.

title: Weenat raises $8M Series C for meteorological sensors in soil
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German agritech Weenat has raised an $8M Series C round for its meteorological sensors that help farmers conserve water.

title: Monumo's innovative electric drive design gets a £750k boost from Innovate UK
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK deeptech Monumo, who is redesigning the electric drive unit, has been awarded £750,000 in funding from Innovate UK, part of UK Research and Innovation (UKRI).

title: Game On: 5 startups scoring big in sportstech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Tech has always been a critical component of sports—especially professional sports—encompassing everything from wearable tech to coaching, fan engagement, stadium management, streaming services, and decision-making.

title: Here's how Generative AI imagines 'European Tech'
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Product Hunt prompted me to check out UnPrompt this weekend.

title: European gamers spend less time playing games than the rest of the world
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: With the growth and development of technology, which have undoubtedly had an effect on non-traditional and media channels the media and entertainment industry has undergone significant changes, accelerated only greater in the past few years.

title: Neurovalens raises £2.1M and gains FDA approval for anxiety treatment wearable device
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belfast-based healthtech company Neurovalens announced today that it has received medical device clearance from the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA) to treat anxiety with its Modius Stress device.

title: Austria's Elevator Ventures unveils new €70M VC fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Austrian firm Elevator Ventures launched EV II, a €70 million VC fund investing in innovative Series A and B companies.

title: Saveggy raises €1.76M for plastic-free packaging
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Lund-based foodtech Saveggy has raised €1.76M for its plant-based vegetable packaging that the company hopes will replace plastic.

title: AI-for-greenhouse-growers provider Source.ag sprouts another $4 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based agtech startup Source.ag has raised an additional $4 million in a Series A extension funding round aimed at furthering the company’s goal of providing AI-driven products that enable greenhouse growers to produce climate-resilient foods. Since March 2022 the startup has raised $37 million.

title: 4 high paying tech roles for 2023
author: Aisling O’Toole
summary: Are you being paid what you’re worth? Recent research shows that almost half of tech workers feel they are undervalued and poorly paid for their contribution and skillset.

title: Riverlane raises $75M Series C for quantum error correction technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Quantum error correction tech company  Riverlane has raised $75 million in Series C funding, bringing their funding to over $122 million.

title: General Atlantic boosts AUM to $96B with Actis acquisition
author: Dan Taylor
summary: General Atlantic is to acquire infrastructure-focused buyout firm Actis, further expanding the private equity giant’s activities in the sector. The financial terms of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: Vawlt raises €2.15M for its secure, distributed cloud storage
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Long-term data storage startup Vawlt announced this week that it closed a €2.15 million round of funding.

title: March 2023: Deals, exits and some tentatively good news! (?)
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: With deal flows always having a lag between action and announcement, the beginning of this year was, slow, at best. However, as we enter Q2 there's been somewhat better indicators that the European tech ecosystem is alive and kicking.

title: Lots of action, but low figures - European tech's 2023 Q1 numbers
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: It shouldn't come as much of a surprise that the first quarter of the year is not exactly rose-tinted. Although March 2023 recorded a slightly higher volume of investments, compared to the previous months, the European tech ecosystem is significantly lagging.

title: Innovation in Europe: exploring the winners of the EIT Awards
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT) celebrates the entrepreneurial and societal achievements of its innovators. By highlighting ground-breaking innovations and the teams behind them, the EIT Awards inspire a new generation of entrepreneurs across Europe.

title: Multiverse acquires Danish edtech Eduflow to scale its tech apprenticeship operation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK founded tech apprenticeships provider Multiverse has acquired its first company, the Danish edtech training platform Eduflow. The acquisition will allow the unicorn to scale its operation.

title: Startups delivering cutting-edge solutions for industrial challenges
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Industrial tech has matured significantly since the hype-driven era of the mid-2010s.

title: Martech Userled raises £4M Pre-Seed for automated marketing campaign platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Martech startup Userled has raised £4 million in a Pre-Seed funding.

title: RoBoTec tackles food security with an automated solution to global plant production challenges
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Plant scarcity, a critical consequence of climate change, demands a radical overhaul of plant production. According to Friederike von Rundstedt, CDO and plant specialist at RoBoTec, we are at the beginning of a paradigm shift in how we produce plants, especially plants grown for food, medical purposes, and renewable energy.

title: From loneliness to connection: 6 startups redefining social interaction in the digital age
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Since the COVID-19 pandemic, we've seen a growing public health concern about loneliness and the difficulties of accessing significant, meaningful social connections.

title: Log My Care raises £3M to simplify admin for social care
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Log my Care, a London-based platform that enables care homes and social care to ‘go digital’, has raised £3m funding from existing investor Mercia Ventures. The round follows hot on the heels of its £3.25M Series A last year.

title: Data Virtuality acquired by CData
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Data connectivity provider CData Software has announced the acquisition of Data Virtuality, a global provider of data integration and management solutions. The terms of the acquisition are undisclosed except that Seed investor HGTF will sell its shares.

title: SC Ventures buys stake in Algbra to enhance its Shoal service
author: Lucy Adams
summary: SC Ventures, the venture arm of FTSE-100 bank Standard Chartered, has bought a stake in ethical and sharia-compliant fintech Algbra. The terms of the deal are undisclosed.

title: UK fintech investment up near threefold to $7.3bn in first half of 2024 amid global downturn
author: John Reynolds
summary: The UK has seen a near year-on-year tripling of fintech investment to $7.3bn in the first half of 2024, amid a global downturn in fintech investment. The figures, published by accountancy firm KPMG, show the UK fintech sector seeing signs of recovery, compared to the giddy heights of 2021.

title: Bulgaria: Tech growth amidst global competition
author: Tamara Djurickovic
