summary: The Bulgarian tech ecosystem thrives on a highly skilled workforce proficient in delivering sophisticated solutions across diverse sectors. Emerging technologies such as AI, cybersecurity, and blockchain are gaining prominence, bolstered by a supportive environment for startups and innovation hubs.

title: New Motion Labs secures £890K investment for drivetrain technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: New Motion Labs (NML), a developer of drivetrain technology for the mobility and industrial markets, has secured over £890,000 equity investment from the South West Investment Fund via the appointed Fund Manager, The FSE Group.

title: Berlin startup Pliant adds €8M to Series A round and secures €100M debt facility
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based startup Pliant has announced the addition of €8 million in funding to its Series A round, bringing the total to €33 million. Through the investment Molten Ventures now joins existing Series A investors SBI Investment, Alstin Capital, and Motive Ventures.

title: French cloud gaming company Gamestream raises €4.5M for global expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French white-label cloud gaming company Gamestream has today announced it has raised €4.5 million. Gamestream, launched in 2019, was created by co-founders Ivan Lebeau and Xavier Cavin. Its Cloud Gaming platform requires only three megabits of bandwidth.

title: July 2024's top 10 European tech deals you need to know about
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In July the European tech landscape experienced a wave of transformative transactions, underscoring the region's growing prominence in the global technology sector. This month saw a series of major deals, across various industries, reshaping the tech ecosystem across Europe.

title: UK Government invests £32M in 98 AI projects, boosting over 200 businesses and research organisations
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today the UK government announced it has supported  98 AI projects with a share of £32 million, benefiting over 200 businesses and research organisations, spanning a range of sectors including public services, driving efficiencies and reducing administrative tasks.

title: TBAuctions expands reach with Surplex acquisition: a win for the circular economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German B2B marketplace for used industrial goods TBAuctions has acquired Surplex industrial auction house Surplex.

title: Ukrainian sleep app Avrora sold to US firm with proceeds to help aid Ukraine's war relief
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ukrainian mobility app developer Boosters (from the Genesis ecosystem), which develops popular mobile apps including Promova, Manifest, and JustDone has sold one of its most successful products, the sleep improvement app Avrora.

title: Builder.ai keeps on building, now with a fresh $250+ million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Builder.ai has raised $250 million in a Series D round led by Qatar Investment Authority (QIA). The raise arrives hot on the heels of an undisclosed amount invested by Microsoft just two weeks prior, with the company stating that it’d now raised north of $450 million in total and that this investment round is accompanied by “an up to 1.8x increase in its valuation.”

title: Eleport acquires TurboVolt, expanding into Croatia and Slovenia
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Public electric vehicle (EV) public charging network Eleport is expanding into Croatia and Slovenia through the strategic acquisition of Austrian-based Charge Point Operator TurboVolt.

title: Standard Chartered backs digital transformation fintech platform United Fintech.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: United Fintech, a London-headquartered neutral Digital Transformation platform has received debt financing from International Banking Group Standard Chartered.

title: Monzo tops 10 million UK personal customer mark
author: John Reynolds
summary: Monzo, one of the UK’s most well-known challenger banks, has topped the 10 million personal customer mark in the UK, it announced today.

title: Revoize secures €458,000 Pre-Seed to transform noisy recordings into studio-quality sound
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Polish speechtech startup Revoize, has raised €458,000 Pre-Seed funding from AIP Seed and co-investor Marcin Żukowski.

title: EV charge point operator Powerdot raises €165M for European expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Portuguese EV charge point operator Powerdot has raised €165 million in green financing from ABN Amro, BNP Paribas, ING, MUFG Bank, Santander, and Société Générale to scale its ultra-fast power charging points.

title: $145M for Pigment's business forecasting, Easop acquired by Remote, and German startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 55 tech funding deals worth over €629 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Unwritten raises $3.5M to quantify climate risk for investors
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Unwritten, formerly Dovetail Finance, has raised $3.5M Seed funding to inform investors about how climate change will impact companies in their portfolio.

title: Board Intelligence secures funding from K1
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Board Intelligence, a UK-based board technology and advisory firm co-founded by Jennifer Sundberg and Pippa Begg, has raised a majority investment from software-focused investor K1. The funding will be put towards international expansion with plans for further add-on acquisitions, and allow the company to expand its AI offering. All of Board Intelligence’s employees hold equity in the business.

title: BMW i Ventures pumps $13 million into Bulgaria’s EV charging management platform Ampeco
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Sofia-based white-label EV charging management software platform Ampeco has received a $13 million Series-A capital injection led by BMW i Ventures, with the all-things-Bulgarian Launchub Ventures and Cavalry Ventures participating alongside a host of undisclosed angel investors. This raise now brings Ampeco’s total funding to $16 million.

title: German spacetech Dcubed closes oversubscribed Series A funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Dcubed, a German spacetech supplier, has closed its Series A funding, which was 26 percent oversubscribed.

title: Mytraffic acquires Geoblink, creating a new era in location intelligence
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today location intelligence and traffic analytics company Mytraffic announced it has acquired Geoblink for an undisclosed sum.

title: Ownership of brand discovery platform Trouva trades hands again
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Trouva has been acquired again, this time with ownership changes hands from Next via its acquisition of MADE to Cambridge-based startup Re:store. Terms of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: Alps Blockchain secures €105M from Azimut for global expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Italian company  Alps Blockchain,  a producer of computational power for blockchain and digital mining, has received €105 million debt financing from fintech Azimut. This brings the company’s funding to over €140 million.

title: osapiens secures $120M Series B for ESG compliance tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: ESG tech company osapiens has completed a $120 million Series B financing round led by Growth Equity at Goldman Sachs Alternatives. This brings the company’s funding to over $145 million.

title: VSParticle raises €6.5M for nanoparticle synthesis tech accelerating green hydrogen production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Nanoparticle synthesis and deposition tools provider VSParticle (VSP) has raised a €6.5 million A2 extension round led by NordicNinja  amd previous investor Plural.

title: AccountsIQ partners with IRIS to integrate payroll and HR
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Accounting SaaS AccountsIQ and IRIS Software Group (IRIS), a global leader in accounting, edtech, and human capital management solutions, will partner to provide an integrated suite of cloud-based payroll, HR and finance solutions.

title: Minoa secures $2.7 million to help SaaS vendors improve customer collaboration
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German startup Minoa announced the close of an over-subscribed $2.7 million pre-seed funding round.

title: Flo Health raises over $200M, becomes first femtech unicorn
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Women’s health app Flo Health has raised more than $200M in a Series C investment from General Atlantic, bringing its funding to over $275 million.

title: UK government not advertising on X, as Musk deletes “detainment camps” fake news story amid riots row
author: John Reynolds
summary: The UK government will continue to use Twitter/X for official communications but is not using the Elon Musk-owned platform for paid-for advertising it is understood, as the billionaire tech mogul continued his attack on Keir Starmer today.

title: Alternative fund manager ACE Alternatives secures seven-figure Seed raise
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Alternative asset fund service provider ACE Alternatives has raised a seven-figure seed round investment from industry veteran Bob Kneip. As part of this investment, Kneip will also assume the role of Chairman of the Advisory Board. The fresh capital is set to bolster ACE's market expansion and technological advancements.

title: Flo Health becomes 1st femtech unicorn, Outbrain buys Teads for $1B, and Germany's burgeoning defence sector
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €960 million, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Web 3-focused marketing agency Zebu Digital acquired by Flight Story
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based web3 and emerging technologies-focused marketing agency Zebu Digital and its accompanying event, Zebu Live have been acquired by Flight Story for an undisclosed sum. The acquisition will serve as a springboard for Flight Story to launch Flight3, a marketing arm specifically tailored to the needs of clients in the web3 and emerging technologies areas.

title: Tour operator Eurotrips secures €260,000 investment from Day 8
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ukrainian-founded tour operator Eurotrips today raised €260,000 in an investment from UK travel holding company Day 8. Day 8 has been creating travel projects since 2006. The holding includes Yacht Week, Ski Week, and Quarter Deck. Eurotrips is the perfect complimentary partner for Day 8.

title: Andreessen Horowitz-backed ElevenLabs raises $80M Series B for voice AI development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, ElevenLabs announced that it has raised an $80m Series B round co-led by Andreessen Horowitz, Nat Friedman (former GitHub CEO), and Daniel Gross and is joined by Sequoia Capital, Smash Capital, SV Angel, BroadLight Capital, and Credo Ventures to strengthen its position as the leader in voice AI.

title: Y Combinator-backed atla generates $5M in Creandum-led Seed round for AI safeguards
author: Dan Taylor
summary: With EU lawmakers embroiled in a nearly 24-hour debate over the bloc’s Artificial Intelligence Act, it seems perfectly timed for fresh-out-of Y Combinator startup atla to announce its $5 million Seed funding round.

title: Infinite Roots raises $58M in Europe's largest mycelium investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Infinite Roots, formerly Mushlabs, a leading German mycelium biotech company, today announced the closing of its $58 million Series B funding round, bringing the company's funding to $86.8 million.

title: Death of an accidental IT admin: Atomico leads $6.5M seed round in IT-as-a-Service provider deeploi
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Deeploi, a Berlin-based IT-as-a-Service startup, has raised $6.5 million in an Atomico-led seed funding round. Cherry Ventures, who supported the company’s €3 million pre-seed round renewed its commitment to deeploi as the startup begins the arduous scale-up phase of its journey.

title: Monzo, Starling and Revolut see drop in account closure complaints
author: John Reynolds
summary: The UK’s top neobanks have collectively seen a near-halving of customer complaints about bank account closures between 2022 and 2023, new figures show.

title: Six foodtech startups redefining our favourite foods for the better
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: All over Europe, food tech startups are using technology to improve how food is grown, produced, distributed, and consumed to reduce the environmental impact, improve animal welfare and ensure safe working conditions for growers.

title: How fintech and SaaS are solving the climate challenge
author: Guest Writer
summary: Climate tech funding in 2022 represented more than a quarter of every venture dollar invested in 2022 according to PwC’s State of Climate Tech 2022 report. This represents aggregate funds raised for climate tech since the start of 2018 of $260 billion, over which more than $52 billion has come in 2022. Climate fintech startups raised $3 billion in 2022, с. 3x vs 2021 according to data from CommerzVentures.

title: Rillet's AI-powered accounting platform attracts $13.5M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Spanish-US fintech Rillet today announces $13.5 million funding to build the next generation of accounting platform.

title: Arbonics secures €5.5M to grow its forest-carbon removal platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Arbonics raises €5.5 million to scale its forest-carbon removal platform to meet growing demand for quality carbon removal

title: ABH Optics raises €1M to develop the world’s thinnest and lightest eyeglass lenses
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Copenhagen eyeglass lens maker ABH Optics has raised €1M Pre-Seed funding.

title: Ariadne Secures $7 Million in Series A funding to transform commercial real estate with location data and crowd analytics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, German location data and crowd analytics provider Ariadne is announcing the completion of a $7 million Series A round.

title: Tset closes €12.7M Series A to expand its industrial carbon accounting software globally
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Carbon accounting software startup Tset has closed €12.7 million Series A round as it expands to new markets and industries.

title: AI therapy startup clare&me raises €3.7M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: clare&me, a Berlin-based AI mental health tech startup, has raised €3.7M in funding. Their chatbot is designed to be used in a clinical setting, as a conversational model which which patients discuss their mental health. The capital will be invested in the further development of the technology, in particular the fine-tuning of their "empathic" LLM, as well as the expansion of a second product for the automation of clinical anamnesis interviews in order to increase collaboration with clinics and thus the trust of end users expand. The software is designed to reduce waiting times and stigma.

title: How to influence fintech buyers - CCGroup research findings
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: According to a new report "How to influence fintech buyers" published by PR & marketing consultancy CCGroup, 70% of European financial institutions expect to increase investment in financial technology over the next 18 months, despite the challenging macroeconomic environment and wider economic downturn.

title: German medtech Protembis raises €20M for brain protection during heart procedures.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German Medtech Protembis has raised €20 million in venture debt financing from The European Investment Bank (EIB) to  develop a next-generation device for protecting the brains of patients who undergo certain heart treatments.

title: Meddenovo secures €1M Pre-Seed to unlock cyclic peptides' drug development potential
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Meddenovo Drug Design has completed a Pre-seed investment round, raising up to €1 million.

title: Definely receives £585,000 Innovate UK grant for AI legaltech development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK legal tech Definely has been awarded a £585,000 grant from Innovate UK to advance its development of AI-driven solutions for the legal industry.

title: Key trends in pricing for 2024 and beyond
author: Griffin Parry
summary: Over the course of 2023, the tech industry has experienced a paradigm shift where stakeholders are no longer solely focused on revenue growth, but are looking at revenue growth in combination with profitability. This has echoes of the not-so-distant past when tech firms evolved from focusing merely on user acquisition to having to deliver user monetisation.

title: Proptech Stairpay secures £750,000 in Seed funding
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Stairpay, a platform for shared housing ownership, has raised £750k in Pre-Seed funding, led by Fuel Ventures with participation from Heartfelt Ventures.

title: 15 startups awarded €1.8M to increase online trust with blockchain
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The European Commission (EC)’s NGI TrustChain initiative has awarded an additional €1.8M in grant funding to leading European startups to combat online misinformation and false identity in online spaces with blockchain-based technologies. The EC project is now announcing the 15 latest startup recipients of ‘democracy grants’ who will each receive up to €117,000 in grant funding. The winning recipients come from ten European countries and were chosen in a highly competitive selection process from 162 interested startups.

title: €3 million deployed into Berlin-based IT as a Service startup deeploi
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based ITaaS deeploi has raised €3 million in a pre-seed funding round. Emerging from stealth today, the company is supported by Cherry Ventures, with angel investors including the founders from Moss, Vay, Zenjob, and sennder participating in the round.

title: Elv.ai secures €500K to battle misinformation and hate speech online
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today internet safety startup Elv.ai announced a €500,000 investment,

title: Flink Robotics gets €156,000 kick to transform industrial robots in into dynamic workers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Industrial automation startup Flink Robotics has received €156,000 (CHF 150,000) from Venture Kick to enable robots to adapt to dynamic environments.

title: This Week in European Tech: Atomico expands across Europe, Infogrid lands $90 million, Zoom buys Workvivo, and regulators across Europe target ChatGPT
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €657 million, and around 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: VDS: Steve Chen, Randi Zuckerberg, and Juan Antonio Samaranch Lead Lineup of Top Speakers at Valencia’s Premier Tech Event
author: Tech.eu
summary: VDS, one of Southern Europe's most prominent international tech events, will take place on October 23-24, at the iconic City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia. Featuring a lineup of stellar business leaders from major companies and top venture capital firms, VDS is set to be an unmissable event for tech innovation professionals and enthusiasts alike.

title: Czech Republic: Engineering heritage meets digital future
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Czech Republic's burgeoning tech ecosystem blends historical engineering prowess with forward-thinking digital solutions. Prague, a leading hub in Central and Eastern Europe, not only fosters a diverse community of startups but also embraces a unique blend of creativity and resilience rooted in its cultural heritage.

title: European startups are unlocking the power of nanotech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Nanotechnology is a rapidly evolving field with the potential to transform science and technology. Its ability to manipulate matter at the atomic and molecular level opens up new possibilities for creating materials and devices with unprecedented properties and functionalities.

title: Cybervadis raises €7M to assess third-party cybersecurity risks and data privacy maturity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French cyber risk management platform provider Cybervadis has raised €7M in Series-A funding led by Zobito AB.

title: OpusFlow secures €1.7M for energy device installation software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: OpusFlow, a pioneering all-in-one ERP solution for sustainable installers proudly announces a €1.7M investment from Peak, a prominent B2B SaaS investor. OpusFlow is currently gearing up to further enhance its product offering and expand its market reach across the European continent.

title: UK startup plans to launch data collection satellites with SpaceX
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Blue Skies Space, a provider of space science data, has announced the scheduled launch of its Mauve science satellite for October 2025. The satellite will be launched on SpaceX's Falcon 9 rocket as part of the Transporter-15 rideshare programme and is being built by a consortium of European companies, including C3S and ISISPACE.

title: QuadSAT scaling new heights with €9 million funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish company, QuadSAT ApS, has raised €9 million in funding to scale up its operations, hire talent and increase its product range.

title: All eyes on Germany's burgeoning defence sector
author: Lucy Adams
summary: In recent years, Germany has seen a surge in defense tech startups, leveraging the nation’s engineering prowess and technological expertise. Here, we spotlight some of the most promising defense tech startups from Germany that are making waves in the industry.

title: Nextmol gets funds to drive the shift towards sustainability in the specialty chemical industry
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Nextmol, a pioneering spin-off company from the Barcelona Supercomputing Centre has announced the successful closure of its first funding round.

title: Barcelona's rise as a global powerhouse in game development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The stereotype of game development often paints a picture of programmers and graphic designers working in dark windowless rooms, in a Vampiric existence.

title: Why AI is not the silver bullet for financial services
author: François Bard
summary: Amid constant macroeconomic uncertainties, many financial services companies are hoping to do more with less this year. Many are reallocating resources, making staffing cuts, and finding new ways to boost productivity.

title: Melt&Marble awarded €2.76M by European Innovation Council
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Foodtech Melt&Marble have secured €2.76M in EU grants to support development and commercial launch of a new, highly sustainable meat-like fat for use in alt-meat.

title: Solaris CEO aims to instil financial discipline amid regulatory scrutiny
author: John Reynolds
summary: The German CEO of Berlin-based Banking-as-a-Service (BaaS) startup Solaris is an Anglophile.

title: Intel cuts 15,000 jobs as it struggles to keep pace with NVIDIA
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Chip-maker Intel will axe more than 15,000 jobs and pause "non-essential" projects, particularly within marketing and R&D, in an effort to revive profits to catch up with rivals such as Nvidia and AMD.

title: Kennet closes €266M fund for B2B SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Transatlantic growth equity investor Kennet has raised €266M for its largest fund to date, Kennet VI. Kennet has already begun to deploy this capital into B2B SaaS companies across Europe, including Screendragon in Ireland and the UK and Fluid Topics in France.

title: Amporin Pharmaceuticals secures €157K for degenerative disease treatment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss company Amporin Pharmaceuticals has received €157,000  (CHF 150,000) investment from Venture Kick to develop amyloid pore inhibitors to treat deadly degenerative diseases.

title: Digital-first will making lets you control your legacy after you die
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: No one wants to think about what happens when they die. Recent research reveals that only 35% of the UK adult population has made a will.

title: Real estate startup Epum raises $1.6M for urban zoning  and planning data platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Amsterdam real estate startup Epum has raised $1.6 million Pre-Seed funding.

title: Checkly secures $20M Series B for code error detection
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Checkly – the leading provider of synthetic monitoring powered by Monitoring as Code (MaC) and Playwright – has raised a $20 million Series B funding round led by Balderton Capital. Existing investors Accel, CRV, and Paul H. Müller also participated.

title: Swiss green aviation fuel startup Metafuels secures $4.9M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Zurich-based climate tech startup Metafuels and the Paul Scherrer Institute (PSI) has been awarded a grant from the Swiss Federal Office of Energy to construct an e-SAF pilot plant for the development of sustainable aviation fuel.

title: Prague’s Resistant AI has bagged another $11 million to prevent AI-driven attacks on financial systems
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Prague-based Resistant AI is fighting financial crime with AI. It has secured $11 million investment in a Series A extension from Notion Capital, this brings its total Series A round to $27.6 million. Its initial round saw investment from GV, Index Ventures, Credo Ventures, and Seedcamp.

title: UK's Luminous XR raises £1M for Extended Reality training solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK extended reality (XR) software startup Luminous XR has raised a further £1 million from the North East Venture Fund, supported by the European Regional Development Fund and managed by Mercia Ventures.

title: OW secures £2.2M for digital scent production
author: Lucy Adams
summary: OW Smell Made Digital (OW) has raised £2.2M in a pre-Series A funding round. Parkwalk Advisors, the UK’s most active investor in university spinouts, led the raise by investing £1.5 million. OW has also been awarded a £0.7 million grant from Innovate UK, the UK’s innovation agency, as part of its Investor Partnerships Programme.

title: Prague-based Phrase secures €12 million debt funding to 'capitalise on the high-growth AI market'
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Prague-based localisation and translation software provider Phrase has secured a debt funding facility of €12 million from CIBC Innovation Banking. The funding will be used by Phrase to further develop the next generation of AI-driven language tech.

title: Avast co-founder invests in Keboola's $32M Series A funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Keboola, a Prague-based data preparation platform has secured $32 million in a Series A funding round. The capital is aimed at supporting the company’s 2024 expansion plans that include Continental Europe, the UK, and the US.

title: LLM testing service Inspeq raises $1.1M to expand internationally
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Irish full-stack AI Ops platform Inspeq has raised $1.1M in funding for its Generative AI maintenance.

title: Robotics startup DELIVERS.AI valued at $36M as it raises fresh round
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Robotics company DELIVERS.AI has achieved a $36M valuation and raised a fresh funding round whose amount remains undisclosed. The Warwick, UK based company received capital from Japan Post Capital, Turkey Development Fund, Bulgaria-based Impetus Capital and Istanbul Technical University.

title: Tech, ethics, and the entrepreneurial spirit: A journey from social networks to impactful ventures
author: Lorenz Bogaert
summary: In my experience within the entrepreneurial industry, it can be easy to make your mark with the right concept and a dedicated motivation to succeed. My entrepreneurial journey began in high school and steadily gained momentum throughout my time at university. In April 2007, my spirited team and I founded Netlog, one of Europe’s pioneering social media networking sites which amassed over 50 million users worldwide.

title: Legaltech Litera acquires records management SaaS Filetrail
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Legaltech Litera has acquired Filetrail, an information governance and records management SaaS.

title: "How the heck can you build a multi-billion dollar business in Düsseldorf?" questioned VC
author: John Reynolds
summary: Düsseldorf might not seem the most obvious startup hub but the German city has all the ingredients for a startup to flourish, according to one of its offspring startups.

title: Bourgeois Boheme scores €6.5M for financial management platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Bourgeois Boheme has raised a €6.5M seed round led by investment firm Graphit Lifestyle. The company digitises family cash flow management and allows secure seamless high-value transactions by utilizing its proprietary security systems, which are enhanced by AI database analysis.

title: €70M  for circular fashion, €100M fund for CEE startups, and bringing Berners-Lee's web vision to life
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €685 million, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Beyond the Swipe: How Cosmic Latte has created safe and dynamic dating apps for the LGBTQ+ community
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When you think of successful Czech startups, dating apps might not be the first thing that springs to mind. However, Cosmic Latte is a Czech technology company that is developing dating apps Zoe and Surge for the LGBTQ+ community.

title: Over £80 billion went to Agritech in Europe in the last 20 years – will there be enough high-quality food for all?
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The United Nations predicts that by 2050 the world population will rise to almost 10 billion. With such a large number of inhabitants, in addition to issues related to education, living space, availability of basic services, etc., the question of how to provide a sufficient amount of food also arises.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five - All the European tech news fit to talk about. This week.
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Live and direct from the Tech.eu newsroom, it's been a short week, but topics abound.

title: Spanish edtech Masterplace raises $2M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Edtech Masterplace, has raised a $2M seed round to launch its AI-powered educational platform. This platform offers  content for students and empowers mentors to effortlessly create courses and content while simplifying student tracking and evaluation.

title: German VC Blockchain Founders Capital announce first close of €15 million in micro fund
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Germany-based Blockchain Founders Capital has announced the first closing of its €15 million micro venture capital fund. The fund will focus on early-stage investments in the web3 space.

title: Helping e-commerce merchants optimise online campaigns with AI and ML, Upp raises $10 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Upp has raised $10 million in a seed funding round. The company uses AI and ML technologies to help e-commerce retailers optimise ad spend, up product discover, and increase overall sales. The new capital is intended to promote further growth at the startup, including bolstering the team numbers, geographic expansion, and the introduction of automation features.

title: Bespoke ski holiday booking platform Heidi secures £5.6M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Bristol-based online tour operator Heidi has raised £5.6 million in funding.

title: Albion Capital brings home £80 million across six VCTs
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In early January of 2022, Tech.eu brought you the news that Albion Capital was on the hunt for £80 million to line the coffers of its six venture capital trusts. As of today, Albion has confirmed that it’s brought home the trophies.

title: Zeus Scooters swoops in and acquires fellow Irish mobility provider Zipp Mobility
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Irish mobility company Zeus Scooters has acquired Zipp Mobility, an Irish shared e-scooter and e-bike service provider, for an undisclosed sum.

title: Luxor Capital Group acquires bankrupt Volta Trucks: What's next?
author: Dan Taylor
summary: After filing for bankruptcy in October, today the administrators of Volta Trucks have officially confirmed speculations that New York-based hedge fund Luxor Capital Group has purchased the company outright.

title: Identity.vc launches €50M fund for LGBTQ+ founders
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Identity.vc has launched Europe's first LGBTQ+ venture capital fund, with €50M available to early-stage founders in the form of €250K to €1.5M initial tickets.

title: Zoom acquires Irish employee experience platform Workvivo
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Video conferencing platform Zoom is to acquire Workvivo for an undisclosed amount. The move will 'bolster the Zoom platform’s employee experience offering and give customers new ways to keep employees informed, engaged and connected'.

title: The big business of batteries, private equity's field day, and over €7.2B was invested in European tech this week
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €7.2 billion and over 15 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: Energy management platform Citron squeezes €20 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian proptech firm Citron has raised €20 million in an equity financing round that will see the company recruit some 200 individuals as it continues developing any and all solutions related to the digital management and optimisation of buildings resources.

title: Belgian AI sales assistant for salespeople on the go 'Donna' raises $1.6M Pre-Seed
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belgian AI-based sales assistant Donna, has raised $1.6 million Pre-Seed funding from US and European investors.

title: UK's Lovetovisit raises €3.8M to expand family-friendly travel platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cardiff-based travel platform Lovetovisit has raised €3.8m in VC funding to scaleup.

title: Ecop receives €8.5M EIC Accelerator funding for heat pump tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Austrian heat pump company ecop has been awarded €8.5 million in funding from the European Innovation Council (EIC) Accelerator.

title: Addionics raises $39M Series B for cost-efficient EV batteries
author: Lucy Adams
summary: EV battery tech startup Addionics has raised Series B funding round of $39M. The round was co-led by GM Ventures and Deep Insight, with participation from Scania, along with new and returning strategic investors.

title: Pension fintech Jarvis secures £1.8M to tell you when to retire
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Jarvis, a pension fintech that empowers employees to plan for their ideal retirement actively, has raised £1.8 million in seed funding in a round co-led by Ascension VC and Cornerstone VC, with participation from Tokio Marine Future Fund. The investment will support growth and product development as it integrates with the broader ecosystem of pension-related services.

title: Estonian Enty raises €700,000 Seed for financial SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Talinn-based fintech Enty has raised a €700,000 seed round.

title: Vacation proptech MYNE raises €40M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Managed co-ownership provider for premium vacation homes, MYNE, has raised a €40M Series A funding round in equity and debt financing.

title: Skippio secures €540,000 for queue management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Skippio, an Irish startup that has developed an innovative platform to enhance the fan experience at large-scale venues and events, has secured €540,000 in seed funding.

title: Atomico leads Dexory’s $19 million round as it keeps tabs on warehouses around the world
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based warehouse management solution Dexory has raised $19 million in a Series A funding round. The new supply of capital will be used to chain together a market expansion plan that includes the US, Central, and Northern Europe.

title: Spanish traveltech Directo raises $1M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Spanish-founded Directo has come out of stealth mode after raising $1M in seed funding for its travel price comparison software.

title: Liverpool's ULEMCo secures over £5M for hydrogen dual fuel solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: ULEMCo, a Liverpool-based company that converts commercial vehicles to run on hydrogen fuel, has raised over £5 million.

title: The Berlin-based startup school whose teaching methods date back to Socrates
author: John Reynolds
summary: "I was a small town kid from the south of Germany from a working class family,” says Fabian Kamberi, the co-founder of social gaming startup SLAY.

title: Resolve Ventures launches new Climate Impact Fund for Irish sustainability startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Resolve Ventures, an Irish development and growth capital fund management company, announced its new Climate Impact Fund, following successful support from the Irish Innovation Seed Fund.

title: OSCAR is transforming home services with €6M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Portuguese home services app OSCAR has just raised over €6 million. OSCAR instantly connects users to over 12,000 highly qualified technicians, from plumbers, electricians and cleaning professionals, laundry and even beauticians for manicure and pedicure services at home, while offering fixed prices for more than 150 services.

title: Greece: From ancient roots to modern heights
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Over the past decade, Greece has seen a significant increase in startup activity in diverse sectors, including fintech, tourism tech, agritech, healthtech, and creative industries, all supported by incubators, accelerators, and co-working spaces. This diversity reflects the country's ability to leverage its strengths across various domains.

title: Food waste fighting startup SIRPLUS files for insolvency
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The last few months have been challenging for startups and scaleups, and this month, Berlin impact startup SIRPLUS filed for insolvency-

title: UK's Allotrope Energy raises 'up to' $6.7 million to make batteries from trees as it enters a partnership with pulp producer Suzano
author: Fiona Alston
summary: British battery manufacturing start-up, Allotrope Energy has raised ‘up to’ $6.7 million from Suzano Ventures - the venture capital fund of Brazilian hardwood pulp producer Suzano. The investment is part of a $70 million corporate venture capital fund that was launched last year.

title: LillianCare raises €1.5M  to address Germany's physician shortage
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: LillianCare, a healthcare company dedicated to tackling Germany's critical physician shortage has completed a €1.5 million extension funding round.

title: Axle Energy raises $9M Seed to decarbonise the power grid
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based Axle Energy, has raised $9M (£7M) in seed funding. The seed round brings the total amount raised by the company to over $10M (£8M). The funding will be used to expand Axle Energy’s team and support the company’s continued growth across the European energy market.

title: 4D Medicine raises £3.4m for biomaterial platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK-based Biotech 4D Medicine, who develop biomaterial for a range of 3D printed implants and surgical devices, has raised a £3.4m Series A round

title: Onego Bio secures €14M from EIC Accelerator and investors for fermented egg protein
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Precision fermentation foodtech company Onego Bio, has secured €14 million new funding from the European Innovation Council (EIC) Accelerator Program and additional Series A investors.

title: Mobility giant sennder acquires European Surface Transportation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: sennder Technologies GmbH (“sennder”), the leading ​digital ​r​​​​oad freight forwarder​​ in Europe, has acquired the European Surface Transportation (EST) operations of global logistics provider C.H. Robinson, ​​one of the world’s largest logistics tech companies.

title: Portuguese seafood company Oceano Fresco secures €17M for sustainable aquaculture
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Portuguese sustainable seafood company Oceano Fresco, has closed a €17 million funding round.

title: UK-based Laundryheap breaks into LATAM with new acquisition
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Laundryheap, the world’s largest on-demand laundry and dry-cleaning platform, acquired Latin America (LATAM) market leader GetLavado.

title: 33% of Millennials and Gen Zs in the UK consider putting money in stocks and shares ISA
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Research about the intentions and habits of Millennials and Gen Zs in the UK in relation to investing and growing money over the long term shows that 1 in 3 (33%) are considering putting money in stocks and shares ISA (Individual Savings Accounts). The research by fintech Plum was conducted at the beginning of March 2023 and included over 1,750 individuals living in the UK.

title: Getir takeover talks close as Flink investors reportedly deliver €150 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: According to a report first filed by Handelsblatt, Berlin-based fast grocery service, Flink has raked in €150 million from existing investors including German supermarket giant Rewe at €50 million and Doordash at €30 million.

title: Monzo co-founder wanted challenger bank sold in 2020
author: John Reynolds
summary: A Monzo co-founder and many of its stakeholders wanted the challenger bank sold in 2020, it was said today.

title: Primary Portal secures £7.5M first stage Series A funding for digital equity solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Primary Portal, a digital platform that aggregates and digitises equity capital market processes for banks and asset managers, has completed the first stage of its £7.5 million Series A funding round.

title: Intelligent Fluids furthers the green revolution in cleaning for a sustainable future
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: As industries commit to the transition to carbon zero, there's no shortage of work tasks that need disruption. Take cleaning. While green cleaning has been available to home consumers for many years, it's a different story in the industrial space.

title: Eneryield raises Seed funding to predict power outages
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swedish energy tech spinout Eneryield have raised Seed funding of an undisclosed amount to prevent power outages in peoples’ homes by predicting faults. Will the fund, they will develop the product for market release.

title: Berlin-based SLAY raises $5M for social gaming expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin social gaming company SLAY has raised a $5 million Seed funding round.

title: Neobanks across Europe fatten up as VCs demand profits
author: John Reynolds
summary: Across Europe, the emergence of neobanks has been one of the landmark disruptions to financial services over the past eight years.

title: Valencia's Zeleros is determined to bring hyperloop travel to reality by 2030
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When I told friends I was visiting a hyperloop company in Valencia, the most common response was, "That's still a thing?!"

title: UK's eVTOL taxi plan: taking flight or just hot air?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the UK Department of Transport offers a plan to get closer to flying in electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOLs) aircraft. I can’t help seeing it as something of a wishlist.

title: Hardt Hyperloop locks in €12 million for the European Hyperloop Center
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch hyperloop company Hardt Hyperloop been given another vote of confidence for its hyperloop dreams as it secures more funding for its European Hyperloop Center project. The centre which is being built in Veendam in the Province of Groningen, in the Netherlands, will house a 420- meter-long test facility including a lane switch is currently under construction - construction of the hyperloop pipes and the foundations has already begun, and the first pipes will be installed by the end of the summer.

title: Trawa raises €10M to optimise SMEs' energy consumption and costs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-based renewable energy supplier trawa has secured a €10 million Seed round. The latest capital raise brought trawa's total to more than €12M.

title: Integra Therapeutics receives EIC Accelerator funds of up to €10.5M for gene writing tools
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Biotech Integra Therapeutics, creator of gene writing tools to make advanced therapies safer and more effective, has been awarded up to €10.5 million from the EU via the  European Innovation Council (EIC) Accelerator.

title: Encompass acquires Dutch startup CoorpID for enhanced KYC solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, real-time UK KYC company Encompass announced its acquisition of CoorpID and Blacksmith KYC from ING to develop a market-leading platform that solves the critical challenge of identifying and verifying corporate and institutional clients.

title: Indie Campers raises €35M to enhance RV rental experience worldwide
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Lisbon-founded global RV rental platform Indie Campers,has announced the successful completion of a €35 million funding round.

title: Shot Scope secures $8.5M for golf improvement tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Golf improvement startup Shot Scope has secured $8.5 million in Series B funding, accelerating its offering of acclaimed products and game-improving data to over 60 million golfers worldwide.

title: Ukrainian VC SMRK invests in proptech Prengi’s Seed round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: US-headquartered, Ukrainian founded, property and facilities management SaaS platform Prengi has raised a Seed round of $500,000 to expand its reach within the US, and expand further into Europe and the Middle East.

title: Alpine Space Ventures docks €60 million via the EIF, remains on course to close €160 million fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based Alpine Space Ventures has received €60 million via the EIF, surpassing €100 million in committed capital as it rockets towards a target size of €160 million. As the name of the firm implies, Alpine Space Ventures is a private space industry, or NewSpace, -focused fund, founded by former SpaceX, Starlink, and Mynaric exec Bulent Altman and seasoned investor Joram Voelklein.

title: Reshape Biotech advances global collaboration with $20M Series A
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Danish labtech startup Reshape has raised $20 million Series A.

title: Dutch startup HULO.ai secures €800,000 investment for AI-driven water conservation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week LUMO Labs and the Netherlands Enabling Water Technology (NEW) Fund invested €800,000 in Wetsus Research Institute spin-off HULO.ai.

title: Fractile secures $15M funding for better hardware for AI inference
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK AI chip company Fractile has today exited stealth and announced $15 million in Seed funding.

title: London unicorn Thought Machine cuts losses by a quarter as IPO remains long-term goal
author: John Reynolds
summary: One of the stars of the UK fintech scene, Thought Machine, has cut its annual losses by a quarter to £63m in 2023 while new deals boosted revenues to £48m. Unicorn Thought Machine, valued at £2.2 billion in its last funding round in 2022, provides cloud-based banking services for the likes of Lloyds, Standard Chartered and JP Morgan.

title: ZeFi raises €1.6M for behavioural analytics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Italian SaaS ZeFi has raised €1.6M for its ML-powered data analytics. Their platform allows businesses to analyse their interactions with their users.

title: SAVA's health monitoring microsensor raises $8M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: SAVA, the startup reinventing health monitoring with its real-time, affordable and painless microsensor – is emerging from five years of stealth today to announce it has raised $8 million in a Seed funding round led by Balderton Capital and Exor Ventures, with participation from Exceptional Ventures and existing investors, Sweet Capital and SOSV.

title: Fintech’s growth potential in a bear market
author: Ronald Jan Schuurs
summary: At the start of the 2010s, experts were asking if Europe would ever produce a tech company with a billion-dollar valuation. As we enter 2023, the European tech ecosystem has produced nearly 150 unicorns, an incredible success rate that has been spearheaded by fintech success stories like Revolut, Checkout.com, and Adyen. For more than a decade, fintech has been the jewel in the crown of European tech.

title: Xolo closes €8 million series A to deliver the promise of volumetric 3D printing
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Forged on the back of research conducted in Germany's largest science and technology park, Berlin's Xolo is trying to make headway on something of a holy grail for the 3D printing industry.

title: Uber's founding CTO is backing Qbeast's data lake engineering platform
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Barcelona Supercomputing Center spinout Qbeast has created an open-source solution to better align data lakes ⁠— server-side repositories of raw, unprocessed data — so they can be deployed later on for operational machine learning.

title: QuantWare debuts 64-qubit quantum computing processor
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Netherlands startup QuantWare is launching a 64-qubit processor that's based on superconducting circuits. Recently Tech.eu has explored various alternatives to superconducting quantum circuits, so it is worth weighing them against the QuantWare technology.

title: Stockholm's Grasp raises €1.9M for AI investment banking assistant
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm company Grasp, one of the world's first AI assistants for investment banks and management consultants, has raised €1.9 million from investors including H&M Chairman Karl-Johan Persson’s Philian Invest.

title: It’s anything but bunkum as bunq posts quarterly profit
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Founded in 2012 by serial entrepreneur Ali Nikam, bunq is racking up quite a list of trophies. It holds claim to being granted the first European banking permit in over 35 years, was bootstrapped for nearly a decade, and now claims to be the first EU-based neobank to report a quarterly profit.

title: Membion secures €5M for wastewater treatment tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German wastewater treatment company  Membion announced an investment of around €5 million led by TechVision Fonds (TVF) and DeepTech & Climate Fonds (DTCF).

title: Ondorse raises €3.8M to expand KYC solution in Europe
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Ondorse, a Parisian KYC solution, has raised €3.8 million in a Seed funding round. In use by fintech startups including Alan, Evy, and Piana, Ondorse intends to use the investment to further develop its offer as well as expand both the team size and European market penetration.

title: Carbon Maps cooks up €4 million to help the food industry reduce its environmental footprint
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While a number of carbon footprint mapping tools focus on general industry, Carbon Maps is zeroing in on what we eat. Specifically, the Paris-based startup is using mathematical models coupled with a healthy dose of AI to offer what the company is calling high-precision assessments of consumer products, ingredients, and raw materials.

title: Streamkap secures $3.3M for real-time data streaming service
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Real-time data streaming provider Streamkap has secured $3.3 million in Seed and Pre-Seed funding.

title: Bizay decided a four-day week was worth trialling; here's what it found
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Bizay, a Lisbon-HQed company merchandise design platform, says a trial run across its team of a four-day working week didn't negatively impact productivity and quality of work.

title: WireMock raises $6.5 million in seed funding for its API developer productivity platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: WireMock today announced that it has raised $6.5 million in seed funding for API developer productivity platform WireMock Cloud, the first API developer productivity platform.

title: CommerzVentures says climate fintechs kept their momentum last year ⁠— here's the breakdown
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Climate fintech companies continued to lure early-stage funds in 2022 despite a deterioration in private markets more generally, according to a new data report from venture firm CommerzVentures.

title: Energy tech Greenely secures €8M Series A
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Stockholm-based energy startup Greenely has closed its Series A round, raising €8M.

title: EIC commits €12.5M for Lightsolver's energy-efficient supercomputer
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Computing startup LightSolver has been selected for the European Innovation Council (EIC) Accelerator Program. The company will receive an initial grant of €2.5 million from the EIC Fund combined with a future equity investment of €10 million, totaling €12.5M. This recognition places LightSolver among 68 companies chosen from a highly competitive pool of 969 applicants.

title: European tech’s gender pay gap persists despite some pay equity progress
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: A new comprehensive report on pay equity within the European workforce was published by Ravio, an HR technology company that analyses real-time compensation and employment data for global tech companies.

title: atmio raises €5.1M for methane detection and remediation system
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Methane detection, remediation, and reporting operating system atmio, the operating system for effortlessly finding, fixing, and reporting methane emissions today announces that it has raised €5.1 million in a Seed round, bringing the company's funding to over €6.4 million.

title: Japanese corporations want to do business with European startups – here's how to get in on it
author: Dan Taylor
summary: From Fujifilm to Mitsubishi, major Japanese corporations are looking to boost their innovations, and they're looking to Europe to do just that.

title: Ittinsect raises €625,000 to commercialise sustainable fish feed, made using insects
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Rome-based insect aquaculture feed developer Ittinsect has raised €625,000 in pre-seed funds.

title: Report says Europe's AI industry's set to confound market expectations, generating 25% CAGR through to 2026
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: International Data Corporation recently published new forecasts for the European AI market, with the industry predicted to notch up a 25.5% CAGR from 2022 - 2026.

title: Using generative AI to turn team chatter into bullet points, Berlin's Spoke.ai raises €2 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Berlin's Spoke.ai recently began an open beta of its generative AI operating system for aggregating project deadlines, discussion and promotional work, allowing it to extract the important bits and reduce workday incursions caused by ill-timed Slack pings.

title: Malted AI raises £6M for cost-effective small language models
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Scottish startup Malted AI announced today that it has secured £6 million in seed investment, led by Hoxton Ventures and joined by Creator Fund and angel investors. This brings the company’s funds to  £7 million in total.

title: "Several hundred" job losses confirmed at Zalando
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: German e-commerce giant Zalando was confirmed to be the latest affected by widescale redundancies.

title: Amadeus Capital Partners and APEX Ventures orchestrate deeptech support with joint €80 million fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Focusing predominantly on early-stage deeptech startups hailing from the DACH region, Amadeus Capital Partners and APEX Ventures have joined forces and have announced a first close at €28 million of a targeted €80 million.

title: German startup Bloom introduces AI-powered roleplaying chatbots to its erotic audio platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: AI-powered roleplaying chatbots are now a thing, and before you go thinking this is an edtech feature, it’s not, these chatbots are here to roleplay your intimate fantasies. In saying that, this erotic audio content does actually have an educational element, for some.

title: From lights to labour, Beryl raises £2 million to open factory in Poole
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based micromobility firm Beryl has raised a fresh £2 million in new funds provided by Frontier Development Capital. The investment is slated to support the development of a new factory based in Poole, Dorset. Including this investment, since late 2012 Beryl has raised approximately £23.3 million and is backed by Entrepreneur First, Sir Richard Branson, Index Ventures, and British Business Bank to name a few.

title: Doconomy buys up Dreams Technology
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Climate tech startup Doconomy has acquired Stockholm financial wellbeing fintech Dreams Technology for an undisclosed sum.

title: Paleo chows down on €12 million, wants to put the mmm back in meat
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Plant-based foods additive maker Paleo (not to be confused with the dietary method of avoiding whole and unprocessed foods) has raised €12 million in a Series A funding round. The new capital will be used to help the company scale up its production of key ingredients for meat and fish alternatives through precision fermentation technology and move into a commercial production phase. Since early December 2021, Paleo has raised €14 million.

title: Backed by Jaguar Land Rover, UK/Ukrainian co-founded Carmoola drives home £103.5 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based “neo car finance” startup Carmoola has raised £8.5 million in a Series A equity funding round that also sees the accompaniment of £95 million in debt facility.

title: Source.ag ploughs $23 million following launch of its first greenhouse farming AI last year
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Amsterdam-based Source.ag said it has received $23 million in series A funding, closing out the round to bring its lifetime total to $35 million.

title: Quantum Motion computes new UK record with £42 million raise
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Eclipsing OQC’s £38 million Series A round announced in July of last year, London-based Quantum Motion Technologies has raised £42 million in a Series B round that will support the company’s continued development of silicon quantum processors. Specifically, a portion of the funding will allow Quantum Motion to work more closely with tier one foundries during the validation process as well as grow the team size by another 50 talents by early 2024.

title: Instacar has banked €55 million on the strength of its expanded services offering
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Greek car leasing platform Instacar is reported to have closed out €55 million in equity and debt funds as investors bought into its growth vision of melding flexible car rental with value-add services.

title: Esgrid secures €500K Pre-Seed funding for value chain sustainability tools
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Tallinn-based startup Esgrid announced that it has secured €500,000 Pre-Seed funding to build accessible value chain sustainability management tools, noting enterprise and financial sector clients among its customer base.

title: iGii secures £8.8M funding to boost nanomaterial production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Nanomaterial producer iGii has raised £8.8 million in new funding to accelerate growth.

title: Volocopter's series E round adds Sumitomo; Japan expansion on the radar
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Volocopter's series E round has just got larger with a funding commitment from Japanese trading company Sumitomo Corp, which is also coming on board as a strategic partner to bring Japanese VoloCity eVTOL aircraft into service by 2025.

title: Barcelona's Libre launches to pack the sweet smell of bacon into mushroom meat alternatives
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Libre founder Alan Ramos became intrigued by sustainable meat alternatives during a spell travelling the Far East.

title: Tencent galvanises fitness gaming studio Quell, helping it raise $10 million series A
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Quell, a UK gaming company focused on bespoke fitness experiences driven by its 'Impact' connected workout device, recently closed off a $10 million series A round led by Chinese tech giant Tencent.

title: Ukraine's Deus Robotics clinches $1.5 million seed
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Ukraine's Deus Robotics announced it has raised $1.5 million in seed funds. This investment was received from Ukrainian VC fund SMRK.vc in a further signal the country's tech ecosystem remains open for business, despite the fallout from Russia's aggression.

title: Amid war challenges, Ukranian sales engagement platform Reply.io grows revenues by 55 percent
author: Oleg Bilozor
summary: During the first month of the war, Reply employees were forced to search for safe locations due to the heavy shelling and occupation of many Ukrainian cities.

title: With no plan for disaster, here's how Ukrainian greentech startup Releaf Paper has continued to thrive
author: Oleksandr Sobolenko
summary: On February 24th, 2022 the situation at Releaf Paper company turned on its head. The war started. And that morning’s priority was the safety of our families and employees. It took about a week before we could think about how to develop business in wartime reality. Our production vendors suspended their activity, and the communications system was down, but we were more worried about these people rather than our materials left there.

title: Welsh distiller Penderyn issues 25 NFTs to accompany its 20-year-old whiskey
author: Dan Taylor
summary: At peak hype in 2021, it’s a fairly accurate statement to make that the world at large generally associated the phrase NFT with art. From Bored Apes to Damien Hirst torching 1,000 of his works and issuing 10,000 NFTs to accompany them, a complete and total comprehension of just exactly what an NFT is and does was rather sparse.

title: Oxford spinout Machine Discovery raises £4.5M for AI-powered simulation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Machine Discovery, a software company which uses machine learning technology to accelerate compute-intensive optimisation and simulation tasks, has secured £4.5 million in funding.

title: This Week in European Tech: MYFLEXBOX lands €75 million, Zopa buys BNPL firm DivideBuy, EIB introduces European Tech Champions Initiative, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €660 million, and over 25 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Galway-based Siren brings home €12 million EIB investment for its investigative intelligence platform
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Galway-based Siren has obtained a €12 million EIB cash ticket for its investigative intelligence platform, helping to keep people and assets safer by empowering law enforcement with joined-up data insights.

title: Ukranian health and wellness platform BetterMe supports the Ukrainian women's military with profits donations
author: Victoria Repa
summary: A year has passed since Russia invaded Ukraine and launched a full-scale war, the most destructive conflict Europe has seen since 1945. With the outbreak of war, Ukrainian businesses faced a considerable number of trials, and the pandemic against this backdrop seems like just a preparation for today's harsh reality. At the same time, Ukrainian businesses have joined efforts to donate to various military and humanitarian initiatives.

title: Despite the war, Ukrainian smart home startup i3 Engineering is growing in Europe
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Back in 2015 when electronics and telecommunications engineer Pavlo Tsiupka undertook the project of building his own house, as you might expect, he took a keen interest in energy efficiency technologies. Spending hours researching home automation systems he came to the conclusion that you and I might: the multiple systems from multiple manufacturers do achieve the end goal, but yeesh, what a process. Wouldn't it be much more enjoyable to have practically anything and everything all under one roof? With seemingly no devices at all? And herein lies the fundamental idea behind what is today i3 Engineering.

title: DirectID laps up €9 million funding to bring predictive analytics to credit risk management
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: UK-based DirectID has procured €9 million in funds from IKEA operator Ingka Group's investment wing.

title: One year later, Ukraine's Scalarr is fighting and standing strong
author: Inna Ushakova
summary: Never did it occur to me that I would need to uproot my life from everything that is familiar to me. My family, my community, my country…ripped to shreds and heavily attacked on a daily basis. Yet, our spirits remain whole, unwavering, and true; committed to our collective goal of victory over the enemy.

title: C-Suite lessons to learn from Ukrainian IT in crises
author: Vladimir Polo
summary: At first glance, the only thing the Ukrainian business has been doing for a year is trying to survive. At the same time, AcademyOcean, a platform for corporate training, interviewed 160 Ukrainian IT companies, and the results showed the opposite. Ukrainian firms opened new offices, created new products, and hired more people during the crises. They started investing in cybersecurity and employee well-being. Moreover, women started leading firms in the most difficult times for their companies. Back on February 24, all this seemed fantastic.

title: Vizcab raises a further €4.5M to boost carbon reduction in construction projects
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Vizcab, a SaaS platform that calculates the Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) to reduce the carbon impact of construction projects, has raised an additional €4.5 million in Series A funding, bringing their total round to €9 million.

title: Quantum Innovations raises near €10M for industry-first surgical sensor tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Polish medtech company Quantum Innovations has raised nearly €10 million in its second funding round.

title: Rotterdam's Eyk raises €650,000 to streamline data reports for omni-channel marketing
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Rotterdam-based marketing data analytics platform Eyk has raised €650,000 in pre-seed funds. The round was led by Goldfish with participation from Graduate Entrepreneur and angel investors.

title: Ukrainian CEO Alex Pasykov shares his thoughts on a difficult but rewarding year
author: Alex Pasykov
summary: It’s been a year since the unprovoked, illegitimate, and devastating invasion of Ukraine. On this anniversary of the invasion and resulting war, many people are sharing their memories and reflections, summarizing and reviewing this past year. Unfortunately, these reflections and summaries are not based upon their personal calendars of holidays, celebrations, milestones, and achievements,  but by this war instead.

title: Here’s how Ukraine's macOS and iOS developer MacPaw is overcoming war challenges
author: Oleksandr Kosovan
summary: On February 24, 2022, Russia started a full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Since then, some Ukrainian cities have been occupied by the enemy, some are under constant missile attacks, and some are hosting thousands of internally displaced people. However, despite ongoing attacks, chaos, and the inevitable loss and damage, many Ukrainian companies began recovering their operations just a few weeks after the Russian invasion began.

title: How Stripo, a Ukrainian startup, continues to operate during the war
author: Dmitry Kudrenko
summary: Since February 24, 2022, more than 20% of small and medium-sized businesses in Ukraine have had to close, and another 28% are on the verge of closing. A survey conducted by Tech Ukraine revealed that 90% of Ukraine's tech startups require financial assistance, even though the country had a flourishing tech scene with more than 2000 startups before the war.

title: Resenteeism is the new trend impacting the workforce
author: Guest Writer
summary: Given the seismic changes affecting the world over the past couple of years, it’s hardly surprising that a new lexicon has emerged to describe the ways in which employees have reacted to the ever-evolving landscape of work.

title: The experience of PR during wartime
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Some old dead white dude said that the first casualty of war is truth.

title: Wealth Club leads £4.5 million funding for fashion IP data platform Fabacus
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Bristol investment broker Wealth Club has invested £2.35 million from its EIS clients to lead a £4.5 million for London-based licensing data SaaS platform Fabacus.

title: Accel 2023 Euroscape: Generation AI — Apply Now!
author: Philippe Botteri
summary: You can now put your company forward for Accel’s 2023 Euroscape, the list of the top 100 SaaS companies across Europe and Israel. All information submitted is confidential and applications close on 6 October, 2023. If you want the chance to increase your company’s visibility across the ecosystem, Apply now!

title: Selfapy's digital self-service mental health platform nets €7 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Berlin-based Selfapy has secured backing from High-Tech Grunderfonds in a €7 million round intended to shore up domestic growth and kickstart European expansion of its digital therapeutics platform addressing multiple mental health disorders.

title: Capital 49 leads €9.2 million series A round for SME finance OS company Finway
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Germany's Finway clinched €9.2 million in series A funds led by Capital 49, the venture capital fund formed by the founders of Australian fintech company Airwallex.

title: Power to the people: WeFunder gives EU crowdfunders another port of call
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Not so long ago an investor could reasonably object to some of the processes inherent in European crowdfunding. The use of popular, open investment calls really got underway in the late 2000s driven by pioneering platforms in the US, like Indiegogo and Kickstarter, followed closely by peers sanctioned under EU rules, the likes of Crowdcube, Lendahand, others.

title: Sweden's Fyndiq is to be absorbed by Nordic peer Cdon in a €65 million deal
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Swedish e-commerce marketplace Fyndiq will become a subsidiary of the Nordics regional e-vendor Cdon, following agreement of an stock-and-cash deal worth SEK735 million (€65.6 million) that will see Fyndiq's investors own 40% of the newly-merged entity.

title: RTWH Aachen spinoff  HBOX scoops €2.3 million to address new pathways to treating respiratory patients
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Aachen researchers have devised a minimally-invasive medical kit said to exchange oxygen with carbon dioxide in the respiratory system's bloodstream.

title: Helping energy-intensive businesses reduce greenhouse gas emissions and energy costs, QiO raises $10 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Just outside the M25 and a half an hour's drive south of Windsor Castle, there’s an AI-driven startup that’s working on saving the planet. For all of us. Starting with providing energy-intensive businesses solutions that they can implement practically overnight that deliver rapid reductions in greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) and energy costs.

title: 10 Ukrainian startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Across all verticals, Ukrainian startups are at the forefront of innovation, creating commercial, scalable product offerings that solve real-world problems. Here are 10 Ukrainian startups to watch:

title: European hardtech VC emerges with €55M and has already backed 8 investments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Italy’s Rialto Ventures has secured funding for more than €55 million and is more than halfway deployed, with eight investments already completed.

title: One-third of trading on Robinhood’s UK app outside market hours, says UK boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: One-third of trading on Robinhood’s UK app takes place outside of market hours, according to Robinhood’s UK boss, who says he is “happy” with the response following its launch but declined to divulge customer numbers.

title: Resilient and resourceful: 10 Ukrainian startups fundraising during wartime
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When you're faced with issues such as displacement, insecure infrastructure and utilities, the safety of team members and their families, and the sorrow of war, funding for your startup becomes less of a priority. In the past year, numerous startups and investors have been compelled to relocate to different regions or countries.

title: The Tech.eu Summit line-up keeps growing stronger: Here are the 10 latest additions to our list of confirmed speakers
author: Robin Wauters
summary: The place to be on 24 May will be Brussels Expo, where amazing speakers from all corners of the world will join us on stage to assess the strengths and opportunities of the European tech ecosystems, and offer ways to meet their challenges collectively.

title: The second round of speakers for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 has been revealed
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: In the previous weeks, the first round of speakers for the event, scheduled for May 16-17 in London, was unveiled. The new speakers for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024, spanning a two-day event at the esteemed Old Billingsgate venue, are experts in the global entrepreneurship ecosystem.

title: Introducing the initial lineup of speakers for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024!
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: We are excited to announce that the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 will be held in the vibrant city of London on May 16th and 17th. This highly anticipated event will bring together global technology leaders and startups/scaleups from various corners of the world.

title: Netherlands and Luxembourg to get Funkey as Ghent startup collects €1 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Ghent's Funkey recently collected €1 million from financial services firm ING, PMV and five angel investors.

title: BTRY secures €153K for one-minute charging battery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss Batterytech startup BTRY has received €153,000 investment from Venture Kick to advance its one-minute charging solid-state battery.

title: Lemonado raises $1.4M for no-code platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sweden-founded no-code platform Lemonado has raised $1.4 million in Seed funding.

title: Loyi raises €425,000 Pre-Seed for gamified brand loyalty platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin loyalty program company Loyi, a brand of Enefty Technologies, has raised €425,000 Pre-Seed funding.

title: Marketing analytics platform Luscid secures $1.2M Seed funding
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The funding will be used to further develop Luscid’s proprietary technology and support market expansion as the business continues to grow at pace.

title: Briefly Bio raises $1.2M to tackle science's reproducibility challenge
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Science is in a reproducibility crisis. In preclinical research, it’s estimated that over 50 per cent of efforts to reproduce experiments fail, costing the industry over $50 billion each year.

title: Helping energy-intensive businesses reduce greenhouse gas emissions and energy costs, QiO raises $10 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Just outside the M25 and a half an hour's drive south of Windsor Castle, there’s an AI-driven startup that’s working on saving the planet. For all of us. Starting with providing energy-intensive businesses solutions that they can implement practically overnight that deliver rapid reductions in greenhouse gas emissions (GHG) and energy costs.

title: The UK tech ecosystem at the forefront of innovation and growth
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The UK tech ecosystem stands at the forefront of innovation and growth, embodying a dynamic landscape that blends tradition with cutting-edge advancements.

title: Unikbase's digital twins tokenisation platform raises €2 million led by Weber Investissements
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Parisian startup Unikbase closed a €2 million funding round led by Weber Investissements to protect digital twins of physical objects using Web3 tokens.

title: Cash App to exit UK as "deprioritises global expansion"
author: John Reynolds
summary: US mobile peer-to-peer payment app Cash App is exiting the UK, as it "deprioritises global expansion". Cash App, owned by Jack Dorsey’s Block, is popular in the US and has over 50 million monthly active users and boasts nearly $15bn in annual revenues.

title: Meatly receives world-first authorisation for cell-cultivated pet food
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Meatly has announced today that it has received regulatory clearance to sell cultivated meat for pet food in the UK, making it the first in the world to get authorisation for cell-cultivated pet food.

title: NcodiN secures €3.5 M for optical interposer tech to meet the needs of HPC and AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Optical interposer company NcodiN has successfully secured €3.5 million from Elaia, Earlybird Venture Capital, and OVNI Capital.

title: Net Zero 'least important motivation' for VCs, study finds
author: Lucy Adams
summary: ESG_VC, in partnership with Marriott Harrison, has carried out an investor survey of 91 VCs across the UK, Canada, USA, Australia, New Zealand, Africa, and Asia on their attitudes towards ESG initiatives.

title: Widespread Windows outage cripples businesses, airlines, the London Stock Exchange and broadcasters
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today sees a global IT outage that has spread across transport, and broadcasters and hit many businesses, who have been forced to take their businesses offline.

title: ZAKA unveils €15M 'Fund I'
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Prague and London-based ZAKA VC has established its first fund sized €15M and ready to support early-stage startups in the US and EU.

title: Evaro raises $1.5M Seed funding to help consumer brands offer pharma prescriptions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Evaro, a UK-based digital health startup providing AI-powered clinical and drug prescription services for minor conditions, announced it secured $1.5 million in Seed funding today.

title: Biotech consortium led by  PDC*line Pharma raises €8.1M for cancer vaccine
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Belgian clinical biotech company PDC*line Pharma and partners announced funding to develop a personalised therapeutic vaccine based on neoantigens for colorectal cancer.

title: Legal & General backs CyberSmart's £12.8 million round to fortify SME cyber perimeters
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: London's CyberSmart has closed a £12.8 million series B round led by venture capital firm Oxx.

title: Earthshot winner 44.01 raises $37M Series A
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Climate tech 44.01 has raised $37M Series A funding  for its mineralisation technology which aims to eliminate CO2 safely, permanently and at scale. The funding will enable 44.01 to continue to refine its technology, develop commercial-scale projects, and expand its deployment internationally.

title: Mundi Ventures raises €25M for LATAM-focused insurtech
author: Lucy Adams
