summary: The Agencia Española de Cooperación Internacional para el Desarrollo (AECID), will invest €25M euros in the management firm Mundi Ventures, with the agreement that it will be allocated to insurtech startups and in adjacent sectors that have an impact on the improvement and digitalization of the insurance sector.

title: AI due diligence startup bags £8M and says it will benefit from London's "laundromat" status
author: John Reynolds
summary: A London-based AI due diligence firm today (Wednesday) said it has raised £8 million and was hopeful that the new Labour government would give its business a positive bounce.

title: GenAI startup mika lands €800k for automated accounting
author: Lucy Adams
summary: mika, a Berlin-based generative AI startup, has just raised €800k in pre-seed funding. The investment will be used to automate accounting and tax filings for SMEs, alleviating the burden of bureaucratic challenges.

title: 13books Capital announces £121M Fund for fintech disruptors
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: 13books Capital is announcing the closing of a £121 million fund dedicated to fuelling the next wave of financial technology (fintech) disruptors. This fund continues 13books Capital's commitment to backing visionary founders reshaping the future of financial services.

title: British Business Investments launches new co-investment fund with Claret Capital Partners
author: Lucy Adams
summary: British Business Investments has today announced a further commitment to Pan-European firm Claret Capital Partners, with a new co-investment fund, to invest in high-growth technology enabled smaller businesses across the UK.

title: UK's Edit Cloud secures £2M for post-production collaboration platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK cloud-based editing platform Edit Cloud has secured £2m funding to empower collaboration in the post-production sector.

title: Enerpoly acquires Nilar's production line and dry electrode tech to boost zinc-ion battery manufacturing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm-based zinc-ion battery company Enerpoly has acquired former competitor Nilar’s end-to-end battery production line and process development capabilities, further enhancing its industrial competencies and promoting European-led innovation.

title: How #BreakingGrounds showcased Bulgaria's tech ecosystem to 250,000 investors and innovators
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Bulgaria is on the cusp of a digital renaissance, having established its first unicorn and with the share of the digital economy in its GDP projected to soar to 16% by 2025.

title: Bioniq scores $15M Series B for personalised vitamins
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based personalised supplement startup Bioniq has raised a $15M Series B funding round.

title: Delta Green raises €2.2M to pioneer household participation in grid balancing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Czech energy startup Delta Green has raised €2.2 million.

title: Study shows that software developers will use AI assistants by 2028
author: Kirstie McDermott
summary: If NVIDIA’s CEO Jensen Huang has anything to do with it, the future of software development is a democratic space where anyone can code.

title: Semrush acquires German SaaS company Ryte
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Semrush Holdings has acquired Munich-based SaaS company Ryte.

title: Restrictions on onboarding new customers lifted at UK fintech Modulr
author: John Reynolds
summary: UK embedded payments provider Modulr has had a temporary ban on onboarding new customers lifted but must give the financial regulator a warning when doing so.

title: Poor recruitment processes lead to UK tech talent shortage
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: When thinking about the disruptive nature of technology and its innovative changes and impacts that we have faced in the last century and even before, it is difficult to accept the fact that in today’s business landscape companies can face a shortage of tech-skilled talent.

title: European tech community Upscalers raises Pre-Seed funding for angel investing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today a community of founders, C-level executives, and VPs from leading European scale-ups and unicorns called Upscalers announces the successful closure of its Pre-Seed funding round.

title: Helsinki-based commerce experience platform Nosto raises $16 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Commerce experience platform Nosto has raised $16 million in a new funding round provided by Mandatum Asset Management Growth Equity that will see the company scale its personalised site search solution.

title: Grand Games secures $3M for AI-supported game building
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Grand uses AI to build up to 30% of each game’s codebase, and uses platforms like Midjourney to generate the art concepts for its products, dramatically reducing the time it takes to create and publish titles and allowing them to build, test, and iterate faster than their competitors. By shortening the feedback loop from the players, Grand Games aims to be the fastest learning and iterating company in the industry.

title: SEO startup raises $850,000 to help companies navigate AI-powered search
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Ecomtent, an AI start-up that helps sellers and retailers prepare for the AI-driven future of ecommerce search, has secured $850,000 in pre-seed funding. The funding was led by MaRS Investment Accelerator Fund (IAF), and includes Techstars x eBay Ventures, C-Suite Angels from Retailers, and Senior leadership from the Tech industry.

title: Wealthtech FINBOURNE Technology raises £55M for global expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: FINBOURNE Technology has raised £55m in Series B funding. The company provides investment management solutions and a cloud-native data management platform.

title: Magify secures €1M for data analytics and LiveOps in gaming
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Magify, a Cyprus-based Business Intelligence and LiveOps platform for game developers, has raised €1 million in funding from Steam Power Investments, founded by former executives of Melsoft. The new funding will support further product development, enhance AI features, and help Magify expand into new markets. This follows an earlier investment from Narwhal Accelerator in June.

title: Polish pet care startup Petsy secures over €1.1M from business angels
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Polish pet sitting and pet care startup Petsy has raised more than €1.1 million in funding from business angels.

title: Key Ward secures €1M for engineering intelligence
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin based Key Ward, a deeptech company in engineering data management and AI adoption across automotive, aerospace, and various other industries, has emerged from stealth mode with €1M in pre-seed funding. The round was led by Swedish venture capital firm Wellstreet, with participation from prominent industry leaders.

title: AI legaltech startup Leya secures $25M Series A to boost lawyer productivity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sweden's AI-driven legaltech startup Leya has raised $25 million in a Series A funding round, just two months after the company raised $10.5 million.

title: SAIZ secures €2.5M for analytics-powered garment sizing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: SAIZ, a RetailTech solution that leverages data analytics to personalise clothes sizing, has secured a €2.5 million seed investment. SAIZ will use the funding for product development.

title: Again raises $43M for turning CO₂ into chemicals
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Carbon utilisation company Again has raised $43 million in a Series A round co-led by GV and HV Capital.

title: Investing in European tech: Insights from GP Bullhound's annual report
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: For the tenth year in a row, the GP Bullhound published its annual report, analyzing and highlighting the growth trends in Europe's tech ecosystem. This year’s report “Titans of the Tech – Unrivalled era of A.I. led innovation for European Tech” highlights the resilience and growth of Europe’s tech sector, setting the stage for a new era of innovation and investment.

title: Zerops raises $500,000 Pre-seed for flexible developers' cloud
author: Lucy Adams
summary: "PaaS" (Platform as a Service) cloud provider Zerops has raised $500k in pre-seed funding for its hosting service where customers can for develop, deploy, and run applications.

title: UK STEM edtech Twin Science & Robotics secures £1.25M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK edtech startup Twin Science & Robotics has closed a £1.25 million investment round led by Soulmates Ventures, ​which includes APY Ventures, existing investors, and prominent angel investors.

title: Brineworks secures $2.2M for CO2 ocean extraction and low-cost green hydrogen production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Amsterdam-based startup Brineworks has secured $2.2 million in funding, led by VC firm Pale blue dot.

title: Clevergy closes €1.5M funding  for home energy management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Home energy software startup Clevergy announced today that it has successfully closed a funding round of €1.5 million.

title: European startups pack a small but impactful punch at IFA 2024
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: I've been at IFA the last few days, a consumer electronics tradeshow and Germany's answer to CES. This year, the show that brought you colour on two TV channels simultaneously and the N64, celebrated its 100th birthday.

title: Why is Transaction Cloud becoming the talk of the e-commerce town?
author: Tech.eu
summary: Transaction Cloud has swiftly become the whispered secret among digital product sellers, revolutionising the way they navigate the complex e-commerce landscape.

title: ZAKA unveils €15M 'Fund I'
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Prague and London-based ZAKA VC has established its first fund sized €15M and ready to support early-stage startups in the US and EU.

title: Ex-Tinder founders secure €15M Series A for AI legal platform Legalfly
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belgian Legal AI platform LegalFly, today announced it has raised over €15 million in Series A funding.

title: How Miros AI is solving the problem of product discovery in e-commerce
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A little while ago, I chatted with Estonian co-founder Heikki Haldre, chairperson of Miros AI, at the Latitude 59 conference in Estonia, who told me something that highlights the value of conference-facilitated networking investors.

title: Constructor headed for Europe following $25M Series B
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Constructor, a product discovery and search platform for enterprise ecommerce companies, has announced its European expansion plans in tandem with the close of its $25M Series B round which brings the company’s valuation to $550M.

title: Deverium secures €2M to tackle cross-border identification challenges
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Lithuanian deverium has secured €2 million in EU funding to develop an identity verification product. The aim is to establish a leading distributed, reusable digital identity platform that targets complex international identity verification challenges. The firms which invested are undisclosed.

title: CardiaTec raises $6.5M Seed for cardiovascular drug discovery
author: Lucy Adams
summary: CardiaTec, a techbio company decoding the biology behind cardiovascular disease, today announces securing $6.5m in seed funding. The new funds will allow CardiaTec to expand its platform and progress proprietary drug targets to the preclinical stage.

title: VC market in Czech Republic is "getting more professional", says fintech boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: The venture capital market in the Czech Republic is becoming more professional, according to the founder of a Czech fintech which has just appointed the country’s “biggest name in fintech” to its board. Startup Malcom Finance, which has rebranded from its previous name of 4Trans, has appointed Michal Šmída, the founder of Czech BNPL firm Twisto, to its board as a non-executive director.

title: Leya raises $10.5M for its AI lawyer assistant
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm legaltech company Leya announced it has raised $10.5 million in a funding round led by Benchmark with participation from Hummingbird, SV Angel, and Y-Combinator.

title: Luxembourg’s dynamic tech ecosystem
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: With its strong emphasis on innovation, ease of doing business, and strategic location at the heart of Europe, Luxembourg is positioned as a leading destination for tech entrepreneurs and investors looking to explore new opportunities and drive technological advancements.

title: CultureAI raises $10M Series A for tighter cybersecurity
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cyber risk management platform CultureAI has raised $10M Series A funding round to expand its team and global profile. The funding was jointly led by Mercia Ventures and Smedvig Ventures, with existing investors Passion Capital and Senovo also continuing their support.

title: Spectrum.Life raises €17M investment for digital health solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Irish healthtech company Spectrum.Life, who delivers clinically backed digital health, mental health and wellbeing solutions to organisations and their people, has announced a €17 million investment round.

title: Nutrition app Lifesum goes ultra-personalised with biomarker acquisition
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Nutrition app Lifesum plans to step up its personalised wellness offering with an acquisition of LYKON, a biomarker-based personalized nutrition company in Germany.

title: Signapse secures £2M Seed for AI Sign Language translation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Signapse, a generative AI Sign Language translation software company, today announced the closing of a new seed funding round of £2 million with £1.5 million from investors and £500k from the UK Government.

title: Glasgow-based Solasta Bio raises $14M Series A for green insecticides
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Solasta Bio, an agri-biotech company providing green insecticides, has completed a $14M Series A funding round to accelerate the development of its peptide-based, nature-inspired bioinsecticides – the first of their kind to be developed worldwide.

title: Adyen is now a “global financial technology platform”, says its high-flying EMEA boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: The USP of Dutch payments powerhouse Adyen is that (like Rome) it has been built by Adyeners, rather than built through acquisitions.

title: Doccla bags £35M, new €200M fund for digital clean energy startups, and  key trends and investment in August
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 50 tech funding deals worth over €266 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Draghi report sounds alarm on Europe's competitive decline
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, the European Union released a report about the future of European competitiveness authored by Mario Draghi, former Italian prime minister and president of the European Central Bank.

title: Royal Academy of Engineering launches £150M fellowship fund for UK climate tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The Royal Academy of Engineering has launched new Green Future Fellowships. It will award £150 million over the next five years to 50 of the best ideas and scalable technologies essential for reducing greenhouse gas emissions and for adapting to the impacts of climate change.

title: Outward VC announces first close of Fund II at £51M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based investment firm Outward VC has announced the first closing at £51m of its Fund II. The fund has received a cornerstone investment of £30m from the British Business Bank, which is deploying capital through its Enterprise Capital Funds programme, which has a strong track record in backing emerging, UK-based Venture Capital fund managers. A wide range of private investors are also participating in the fund.

title: Czech Gen Z mental health app Elin.ai raises €600k pre-seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Czech Gen Z mental health app Elin.ai has raised €600k pre-seed investment from Presto Ventures, BD Partners, and angel investors. In tandem will the raise they will publicly launch their native mobile app with core features for instant, real-time psychological support of its Gen Z users.

title: PhoreMost raises £33M to advance 'Drugging the Undruggable' research
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: PhoreMost, the UK-based biopharmaceutical company dedicated to ‘Drugging the Undruggable®’ disease targets, has completed an oversubscribed £33 million Series B investment round.

title: Belgian speed pedelec manufacturer Specter raises €2M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Specter, the Belgian manufacturer of speed pedelecs has raised €2 million in fresh capital.

title: Atomico completes largest ever fundraise of $1.24 billion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Atomico announced two new funds totalling $1.24 billion to support Europe’s most game-changing founders. This represents a more than 50 percent increase from its previous $820 million fund, Atomico V.

title: Artisan AI raises $7.3M to develop autonomous AI employees
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-founded Artisan AI, a startup building AI employees and software for enterprise companies, has raised $7.3 million in funding.

title: Form3 raises £60M Series C extension
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Form3, a leading British payment technology company, has raised a £60M Series C extension.

title: EasyTranslate acquires WorldTranslation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Copenhagen-based translation company EasyTranslate has acquired Nordic WorldTranslation, in a deal that allows them to combine their language expertise.

title: €2.5B for NanoIC pilot line,  ETF Partners raises €285M, and 10 Italian startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €4.3 billion, and 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: PQShield raises $37M Series B for post-quantum cryptography
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK cybersecurity company PQShield has raised $37m in Series B funding to accelerate the global adoption of post-quantum cryptography (PQC).

title: Formo raises $61M Series B for plant-based cheese
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German animal-free cheese company Formo has raised $61 million in a Series B funding round, bringing its total funding to $115.3 million.

title: Y Combinator-backed Cerrion raises $5 million in funding to boost AI Video tech in manufacturing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Zurich video AI startup Cerrion has raised $5 million in funding.

title: PLATMA raises $2M Pre-Seed for AI-powered no-code platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: PLATMA, the first Extreme no-code platform that leverages artificial intelligence to convert natural language into functional code, announced it has raised $2 million in a pre-seed funding round. The company is now valued at $20 million.

title: 8 months after founding, Capsa AI raises £1.7M for AI-driven private equity solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Capsa AI, a London-based startup transforming due diligence in private equity, has raised £1.7 million in Seed funding just eight months after its founding. In that time, Capsa AI had already become revenue-generating, managing over $30 billion across the US, UK, and Germany.

title: French biotech Abolis Biotechnologies raises €35M to boost microbial ecosystem engineering
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French company Abolis Biotechnologies has closed a  €35 million financing round.

title: Tiptapp's green mission for easier recycling gets a €1M boost
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Tiptapp, the Swedish go-to solution when you need help moving things in or out of your home, today announced €1 million in funding dedicated to expanding its marketing initiatives in Berlin and across Germany. This brings the company's funding to over €8.5 million.

title: Wingbits raises $3.5M for flight tracking software that pays contributors
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Wingbits, a Stockholm-based startup creating the world’s best flight tracking network, has raised a seed funding round of $3.5M.

title: HR startup Sloneek secures €3.6M for European expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Czech-Slovak HR startup Sloneek has raised €3.6M from a group of investors to fuel its expansion into Western Europe. It enables managers and HR professionals in both small and large companies to see their teams through data, foster talent development, and manage employee efficiency and motivation.

title: Spanish Kfund raises €70M for AI and cloud startups
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Spanish Kfund has raised €70M in commitments for its sixth fund. The fund manager plans to intensify its support for "high-impact projects" in southern Europe.

title: UK's tem. secures £10.5M for AI-powered renewable energy platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: tem., an AI transactions platform that enables UK businesses to buy energy directly from renewable generators for less than the cost of traditional fossil fuels, has secured £10.5 million in Series A funding, bringing the company’s funding to £13 million.

title: Players 1st raises €1.3M for golf club improvement platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Golf platform company Players 1st has raised €1.3 million in funding from Scale Capital.

title: Approveit raises $1M for payments software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Approveit, an operations and automation platform for businesses, has raised $1M from investors including 10vc, Verras Capital, Telegraph Hills Capital and many others partners and angel investors. The platform integrates a company's existing messengers and task managers for transparency and control over finances, auditing, reporting and other business processes in order to reduce approval time.

title: No tech firm can say “software is never going to fail”, says ethical hacker, amid CrowdStrike fallout
author: John Reynolds
summary: In the latest Tech.eu podcast, Edouard Beaucourt, head of EMEA for Pigment, the business planning platform and Rob Shapland, the security awareness trainer and ethical hacker, discuss the fallout from the CrowdStrike outage earlier this year.

title: Kinetix launches $1M AI-UGC Fund to boost game development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French game developer software company Kinetix has launched the AI-UGC Fund, a $1 million initiative designed to support game developers and modders in bringing generative AI technology directly to gamers.

title: From labs to the ocean: 6 next-gen blue economy startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The ocean covers over 70 per cent of the Earth's surface, providing a habitat for the largest ecosystem on our planet. But oceans are under threat from rising temperatures and sea levels, loss of biodiversity, overfishing, and coral bleaching.

title: Challenger bank Kroo bans crypto transactions, warning of "scams"
author: John Reynolds
summary: London-based challenger bank Kroo is banning customers from carrying out crypto transactions, saying cryptocurrencies are “increasingly being used by fraudsters as a way to scam people”.

title: Denmark: Europe's hub for tech innovation and collaboration
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Denmark's tech ecosystem thrives on innovation, collaboration, and sustainability. Centered in Copenhagen, it supports a diverse range of sectors including biotechnology, renewable energy, and digital innovation. The city's vibrant startup culture, bolstered by government support and strong R&D focus, attracts global talent and investment.

title: Berlin agritech startup Tupu raises $3.2M to advance urban mushroom farming
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based agritech startup Tupu has raised $3.2 million in a Seed round. The round was co-led by FoodLabs and Zubi Capital and included participation from Clear Current Capital, FoodHack, IT-Farm, Coast Cap, and angel investors including Roger Hassan and Gil Horsky.

title: En Carta Diagnostics secures €1.5M for rapid Lyme disease diagnostic kits
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: En Carta Diagnostics, a deeptech startup developing rapid Point-of-Care (POC) molecular diagnostics kits, today announces €1.5 million in Pre-Seed funding.

title: Web3 proptech Unlockit raises €1.4M Pre-Seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Portuguese payments platform Unlockit has raised €1.4M in Pre-Seed funding. The capital will be used to develop the platform further, to begin offering credit intermediation and to prepare expansion plans for offices in Madrid, Dubai and São Paulo.

title: The Exploration Company wins cargo contract from the ESA
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Leading commercial space company The Exploration Company has been contracted by the European Space Agency to develop a Low Earth Orbit (LEO) Cargo Return Service.

title: Morphotonics score €10M Series B for nanoimprint tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The funding will enable Morphotonics to scale its operations and supply chain, expanding its global customer base with a focus on Asia. The additional funds will also accelerate the adoption of large-area nanoimprinting as an industry standard in display production through new innovations.

title: Steerlab secures €1.7M to automate sales workflow
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Steerlab, a Paris-based AI startup, has raised a €1.7M pre-seed funding round to double down its strategy to build a cutting-edge AI platform that automates responses to Requests For Proposals (RFPs) and security questionnaires. This platform is designed to help PreSales and security teams enhance their efficiency, automate 80% of the time spent on responses, and maximize their success in winning more deals.

title: Enifer secures €36M funding for food-grade mycoprotein factory in Finland
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Finnish mycoprotein company Enifer has today announced the completion of a €36 million funding package that enables it to start constructing a unique food-grade mycoprotein factory in Kirkkonummi, Finland.

title: Biotech firm NanoSyrinx raises £10M for nano syringe delivery platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Synthetic biotech company NanoSyrinx, developers of nano syringes as a novel platform for targeted intracellular delivery of biologic therapeutics, today announced that it has closed a £10 million financing round.

title: Preqin and Measurabl partner to track properties' ESG compliance
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Preqin and Measurabl have formed a partnership to provide a global dataset of real estate carbon and energy metrics to private markets. The joint endeavour aims to provide transparency and accountability in ESG data for privately held properties and portfolios.

title: Vind AI raises €3M seed round to support global shift to energy from wind
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Vind AI, a AI platform for wind park design, has raised €3m in seed round led by Norrsken VC. The round includes participation from Spacemaker founders, Arkwright X and employees.

title: MirrorWeb raises $63M growth capital for compliance software expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Manchester-born regulatory and compliance scale-up MirrorWeb MirrorWeb has successfully raised $63 million growth capital from Mainsail Partners. This brings the company's funding to $68.8 million.

title: €300M for Baltic energy independence, Naplasol acquires Mycorena, and Octopus Electroverse is Europe’s largest consumer EV charging platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 35 tech funding deals worth over €455 million, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: French femtech Sonio acquired by Samsung
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Sonio, a medtech specialising in women's and children's health, has received official approval from the French Ministry of the Economy and Finance of the acquisition of 100 percent of shares by Samsung. The deal closes following the company’s second wave of FDA clearance in 2024 and with Sonio reporting and workflow solution operating in multiple sites across the US.

title: Purple Transform raises £4.5M for AI rail data analytics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Purple Transform, a UK-based AI rail data analytics business, has raised £4.5 million in a funding round led by Mercia Ventures via the Midlands Engine Investment Fund II and backed by Sure Valley Ventures.

title: August 2024's top 10 European tech deals you need to know about
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: August was the slowest month YTD, with over €1.9 billion raised in some 203 deals. This figure represents a decrease of around 60 per cent compared to the previous month (in July European tech companies collected €5 billion).

title: Ocean 14 Capital Fund champions the blue economy with €201M investment in ocean health
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Luxembourg-based Ocean 14 Capital Fund I, focusing exclusively on the multi-trillion-dollar ‘blue economy, ' has closed with €201 million to support its mission of funding sustainable solutions to improve ocean health. This brings the Fund to over €240 million.

title: Qblox raises $26M for its quantum control stack
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Quantum startup Qblox have closed a $26M Series A funding round to further develop its quantum control stack.

title: Biochar booms towards gigatonnes, but low-quality concerns cloud market growth
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Supercritical’s new report, "Boom or Bust? 2024 Biochar Market Outlook", finds biochar is carving a path to gigatonne scale but the flood of low-quality projects reiterates the need for more transparency from suppliers and ongoing due diligence by buyers.

title: AI concerns and workplace dynamics - findings from the Scaleup Culture Report 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: As the world of work goes under significant changes driven by different factors, such as technological advancements, shifting attitudes towards work, and global events like wars, pandemics, and climate change, these changes are reshaping the workplace environment, communication methods, and the use of AI tools. Younger generations have different perspectives on work compared to previous ones.

title: Iceland’s first unicorn will spur investment but don’t expect “floodgates” to open, says unicorn founder
author: John Reynolds
summary: Iceland boasting its first unicorn will spur investment in Icelandic startups but don’t expect the “floodgates” to open on a flurry of unicorns, says the unicorn's founder.

title: Resilience raises $25M to expand remote oncology patient monitoring
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Healthtech company Resilience, already deployed in more than 90 medical centres representing over 10,000 patients, has raised $25 million.

title: Osavul secures €2.78M Seed to fight disinformation with AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Osavul, a Kyiv AI-powered media intelligence company, has raised €2.78 million Seed funding.

title: NATO Innovation Fund announces its new investment team
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The NATO Innovation Fund (NIF) has announced its new investment team with experience that spans AI, energy and climate, quantum, materials, space tech and semiconductors. These knowledge sets will be used to “identify cutting edge startups, support leading founders, and help bolster the defence, security and resilience of allied nations.”

title: Avvio founder launches €5M fund for hospitality tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Hospitality software founder Frank Reeves has launched a €5M fund to support early-stage travel and hospitality start-ups in Ireland and the UK.

title: Brightflow SAS secures €16.5M for minimally invasive heart failure solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Brightflow SAS, a privately held pioneer in the field of long-term percutaneous mechanical circulatory support to treat end-stage heart failure patients has raised €16.5M in equity Series A funding.

title: Spanish IENAI Space raises €3.9M for small satellites
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Space mobility company IENAI Space has raised €3.9 million during its latest funding round. Together with previous investments, this latest round brings the total funding of IENAI to €7 million.

title: Swiipr raises £6M to disrupt airline compensation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Traveltech company Swiipr has raised £6 million in Series A funding to digitally transform airline disruption payments.

title: Bicycle Therapeutics scores $555M investment for disease prevention
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cambridge medtech Bicycle Therapeutics has raised $555M in equity financing via a private placement.

title: German Thryve secures €4M Series A to accelerate international growth
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Thryve, a specialized B2B health data integration and analytics company, raised €4M in a Series A funding round. Their API aggregates individuals' health status across hundreds of health trackers. The round was led by Belgium's Capricorn Partners, with participation from IBB ventures as well as the specialized digital health funds of CRB Health Tech of Spain and the German Carma Fund.

title: Cardboard raises €1.9M for SaaS subscription management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Oslo-based startup Cardboard has secured a seed investment of €1.9M to assist management of SaaS subscriptions across Europe. The funding round was led by Skyfall Ventures, with participation from co-investors includingRunwayFBU and Sondo. The primary target customers are startups, scaleups, and SMEs.

title: DC Connected raises €2.1M for AI-driven vehicle diagnostics platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German-based vehicle diagnostics platform DC Connected has raised €2.1 million Seed funding.

title: Neurodivergent-focused app Tiimo secures $1.6M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Tiimo, the planning and learning app for people who think differently, today announced the completion of a $1.6 million funding round, bringing their total raised to $4.8 million Pre-Series A.

title: Insurtech Korint raises €5M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: 18 months after its first funding round and the launch of its offering, Insurtech startup Korint has raised €5M led by Ventech, with continuing support from 360 Capital. This second round brings the total amount of funding to €7M. The first round in March 2023 enabled Korint to launch a powerful and innovative “Core Insurance Platform” SaaS that allows insurers and brokers to deploy new insurance products rapidly and massively.

title: C12 raises €18M for universal quantum computing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: C12, a French spin-off of the Physics Laboratory of the École Normale Supérieure in Paris which is developing a carbon nanotube-based universal quantum computer, has closed its second round at €18M.

title: Monument Bank latest challenger bank to sell "in a box" tech, as snaps up first client
author: John Reynolds
summary: Upmarket UK challenger bank Monument Bank is the latest challenger bank to offer its tech to third parties, selling its “building society in a box” tech to legacy financial institutions.

title: How Social Media is fueling a new wave of beauty entrepreneurs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When writing about emerging startups, I like to extend my reach beyond well-versed verticals such as software, SaaS, and AI as much as I can.

title: Lithuania's Unmanned Defense Systems secures €3.2M to advance AI-based swarm drones
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Lithuanian advanced swarm detection company Unmanned Defense Systems (UDS) today announced it has raised €3.2M to scale battlefield-tested UAVs and advance AI-based swarm integrations with contemporary battlefield management systems.

title: buycycle's US expansion: a case study in cross-Atlantic success
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: European marketplace for premium, pre-owned bikes, buycycle expanded its business to the US market one year ago, and it has been the company’s fastest-growing market to date.

title: GenAI can have "extraordinary" impact on financial education, says Monzo boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: The boss of Monzo today gave a resounding thumbs up to the power of AI, saying generative AI can have an “extraordinary” impact on financial education while machine learning can help stamp out financial crime.

title: Carmoola secures a further £15.5M investment to change the future of car financing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today car financing company Carmoola announced a £15.5 million equity investment. It follows an £8.5 million Series A round and £95 million debt facility in February 2023, bringing the company’s funding to £157.4 million.

title: Turkish fintech Colendi secures $65M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Turkish fintech Colendi has raised a $65M Series B round following its valuation at $700M. The round was led by Citi Ventures, the venture capital arm of Citigroup, with Migros Ticaret AS, Sepil Ventures, Re-Pie Asset Management, Finberg, and Hedef Holding participating. Existing investors also supported.

title: Retraced secures €15M for fashion brands' sustainability management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Retraced, a platform that enables fashion and textile brands to digitize and trace their supply chains, has announced the successful completion of a €15 million Series A funding round.

title: Mistral swings big, Italian founders in demand and Germany scores $273M for chips
author: Lucy Adams
summary: This week we tracked more than 65 tech funding deals worth over €2.2 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: SODA.Auto launches SODA V, empowering automotive OEMs to compete with Asia
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-based automotive tech company, SODA.Auto today launched its flagship product – SODA V, the world's first tool that covers all needs of automotive engineers from idea to certification to create software-defined vehicles (SDVs).

title: Cleantech for Europe: EU cleantech debt investment boom in Q1 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The new “Quarterly Briefing for Q1 2024”, published by Cleantech for Europe, revealed that over the past quarter, two significant key trends emerged: an unprecedented surge in debt investments fueling the growth of cleantech ventures, enabling them to pioneer groundbreaking projects, and the closest margin ever recorded in cleantech investment disparities between Europe and North America.

title: Faircado raises €3M to accelerate AI-powered resale shopping browser extension for the circular economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI-powered second hand shopping assistant Faircado, has closed a €3 million Pre-Seed funding round.

title: Polish MMI secures €7.7M for electric and hydrogen buses
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Polish company MMI has secured €7.7M in funding from the Vinci S.A. fund.

title: 6 startups transforming on-demand services
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The European on-demand landscape is undergoing a significant transformation, marked by both the rise and fall of prominent players.

title: Danish HRtech startup Zoios secures €1M for workplace leadership development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: HRtech startup Zoios has announced a €1 million Seed raise to turn poor managers into great leaders.

title: Volkswagen partners with AirConsole for in-car gaming
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The Volkswagen AG is partnering with the gaming platform AirConsole to bring its in-car gaming experience to drivers and passengers. In parallel to the ID.7, ID.5, ID.4 and ID.3 product lines (from ID. software 4.0), AirConsole will also be available for the new Passat, the new Tiguan, the new Golf and the new Golf Estate.

title: BBC invests £500,000 in virtual streaming
author: Lucy Adams
summary: BBC's investment arm BBC Ventures has invested £500,000 investment in Bristol-based Condense, a virtual streaming company.

title: Regtech CUBE acquires peer Reg-Room
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Regulation intelligence and change management provider CUBE has acquired its competitor Reg-Room. This acquisition furthers CUBE’s aims to consolidate an industry-defining regulatory compliance and risk platform and comes weeks after CUBE’s partnership announcement with Hg, an investor in European and transatlantic software and services providers.

title: Questions raised about portfolio of London VC firm backing Bolt’s proposed $450m fundraise
author: John Reynolds
summary: Questions have been raised about the London-based VC firm which plans to back US startup Bolt Financial on its proposed $450m fundraising at a $14bn valuation.

title: Monese founder says “very pleased” he can focus on just challenger bank after “difficult” time running two businesses
author: John Reynolds
summary: The founder and CEO of HSBC-backed Monese, a challenger bank-cum- banking tech platform, admits running two differing businesses within one business has been “difficult”.

title: BlockDAG and Borussia Dortmund announce $10M blockchain partnership
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Blockchain company BlockDAG has announced a three-year partnership with German football team Borussia Dortmund.

title: Copilot Capital invests in Danish pricing intelligence firm PriceShape
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Copilot Capital has made a majority investment in PriceShape, a fast-growing software company specialising in pricing intelligence and competitor monitoring.

title: CoreWeave partners with EcoDataCenter to host one of Europe's first large-scale NVIDIA Blackwell training clusters
author: Lucy Adams
summary: CoreWeave, the AI Hyperscaler, has announced a strategic partnership with EcoDataCenter, a Swedish company renowned for its sustainable data center solutions, to host one of Europe’s first large-scale NVIDIA Blackwell clusters in Sweden. This collaboration aims to significantly boost compute capacity across Europe, establishing one of the most sustainable and advanced supercomputers in the region.

title: Hospitality platform Nory secures $16M Series A
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Hospitality software provider Nory has raised $16M in Series A funding, taking its total raised to $25 million.

title: Octopus Electroverse becomes Europe’s largest consumer electric car charging platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Octopus Energy’s electric vehicle (EV) charging platform, with nearly 850,000 connected chargers, has become Europe’s largest for consumers.

title: Wazoku partners with NATO DIANA accelerator
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Wazoku has officially partnered with NATO’s Defence Innovation Accelerator for the North Atlantic (DIANA) to support the accelerator’s day-today operations.

title: Sidekick secures £8.5M for wealth management platform
author: Lucy Adams

title: The big work lie: Being indispensable won’t actually save your job
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: Has a manager ever told you they don’t know what they would do without you? Perhaps you’re always the first person to put yourself forward for tasks that don’t necessarily fall under your job description but enhance the performance of your team.

title: Startups focusing on profit sink into “zombie mode”, blasts online will writing startup boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Startups are guilty of falling into “zombie mode” by focusing only on turning a profit, according to the co-founder and CEO of a UK startup trying to shake up the death industry.

title: Sanofi forms cloud partnership with Benchling
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Benchling is working with Sanofi to transition from legacy R&D systems to a digital platform through Benchling R&D Cloud; this is an integral process to enable Sanofi's AI-powered R&D ambition. As a result of the partnership, its R&D teams are able to scale and accelerate groundbreaking research processes in just hours instead of weeks.

title: Araya closes Super Angel Fund at $10.9M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based Arāya Ventures has announced the $10.6 million first close of the Arāya Super Angel Fund - a community-powered fund which will invest in up to 60 pre-seed and seed stage founders across the next four years in health tech, fintech, climate, commerce and work. Fund investors include Bridgerton actress Charithra Chandran, former Credit Suisse CEO Phil Cutts and former Browns CEO Holli Rogers.

title: Manchester's Be.EV raises £55M to expand rapid EV charging across local communities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Manchester Electric vehicle charging network Be.EV has announced a £55 million debt raise from NatWest and the German KfW IPEX-Bank.

title: Vilnius-based Tingit secures €500,000 Pre-Seed for repairs marketplace
author: Lucy Adams

title: forward earth raises €3.2M for environmental data management
author: Lucy Adams

title: Nosh.bio opens new factory to ramp up protein production
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based Foodtech Nosh.bio will produce over 1000 tonnes of mycelium protein per year for alternative meat products thanks to a new factory in Dresden.

title: Cocogreen's supersoil technology bags King’s award
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Manchester Footech company  Cocogreen has achieved a King’s Award for Enterprise in International Trade, recognising its worldwide success in providing fruit and veg growers with a type of “supersoil” (made from coconut husks) that powers up crop growth and is used in a similar way to compost.

title: Banking tech startup 10x reduces annual losses by 7% to £55m as top executive exits
author: John Reynolds
summary: The UK banking tech startup founded by former Barclays CEO Antony Jenkins has reported a seven per cent reduction in annual losses in 2023 to £55.1m as its chief operating officer exits the startup.

title: Fintech market returning to stable valuations, says boss of Europe’s leading VC fund
author: John Reynolds
summary: The boss of Europe’s leading listed VC fund today signified that the fintech market was returning to more stable valuations after the market “largely lost its head” in 2020 and 2021.

title: Klarna could halve workforce to around 2,000 by leveraging AI
author: John Reynolds
summary: Klarna today (Tuesday) said that it could halve its workforce to around 2,000 employees by leveraging AI technology. The Swedish tech giant said its AI assistant was now carrying out the work of 700 employees, reducing the time it takes to fix problems from 11 minutes to two minutes.

title: Evergrowth merges with Apolo to combine sales intelligence
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Baltic sales platform Evergrowth has merged with marketing software Apolo Mktng, allowing the companies to combine their market intelligence and machine learning capabilities. The terms of the deal are undisclosed; in tandem, Everygrowth’s seed funding raise has increased from €2M to €2.5M.

title: myTomorrows partners with Pancreatic Cancer Europe to streamline clinical trials
author: Lucy Adams

title: Redalpine announces final close of largest-ever fund at $200M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Venture capital firm redalpine today announced the final close of its largest-ever fund, redalpine capital VII (RAC VII), at $200 million.

title: Benefits platform Pluxee acquires peer Cobee
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Pluxee have announced their impending acquisition of Cobee, a Spanish Employee Benefits platform. With this acquisition, Pluxee will deliver the first milestone of its targeted and disciplined M&A strategy as  part of its strategic growth plan. The transaction is subject to approval by Spanish regulatory authorities.

title: Phasecraft expands to US for quantum talent
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK-based quantum algorithms company Phasecraft is expanding to the US to widen its talent pool and customer base.

title: Dutch waste platform Seenons expands with acquisition of waste group Denmark
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Following the successful acquisition of Recycling Partners Belgium,  Dutch waste platform Seenons has acquired Waste Group Denmark.

title: Rivia raises €3M to handle data analytics for biotech companies
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swiss bio-analytics startup Rivia has secured a €3M Seed funding round led by Speedinvest. The funds will be used to hire new teams across engineering and client services,  and will also advance product development to fully harness the potential of integrated trial data and strengthen its position as the unified data platform for biopharma clinical trials.

title: Naplasol acquires Mycorena to boost the mycelium and alt-protein market
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Naplasol, a member of the VEOS group, has acquired Swedish mycoprotein company Mycorena. With this acquisition, Naplasol will enhance its mycoprotein product portfolio and plans to produce Mycorena’s mycoprotein, Promyc®, at its industrial facility in Bree, Belgium.

title: Otamiser secures $3M to scale hotel booking
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Belgium-based Otamiser has raised $3M for its software to improve positioning in search results on travel platforms like Booking.com, Expedia, and Airbnb.

title: Podimo acquires Dutch podcast production house Tonny Media
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Spoken audio subscription service Podimo has begun the acquisition process of Dutch podcast production house Tonny Media following a partnership between the two companies. They will remain operating as independent media houses, and will jointly combine their sales efforts and expertise.

title: Bisly raises €6.2M Series A for smart building
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Estonian Constructiontech Bisly has raised a €6.2M Series A round. The funding will accelerate Bisly’s ongoing expansions into Germany and the U.K.

title: Uber to integrate Wayve's autonomous driving software into its taxis
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Wayve, a UK-based provider of autonomous driving software, has announced a partnership with Uber which will see their software integrated into Uber's taxi network.

title: EIB steps up defence support with SME-friendly policies
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The European Investment Bank board has approved an updated definition of dual-use goods and infrastructure eligible for funding and has agreed to facilitate financing for defence SMEs by intermediating the transaction. Eligible projects under SESI will include military mobility, space, cybersecurity, green security, critical infrastructure, border protection, and other dual-use investments such as drones.

title: The programme for the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 has been revealed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: With less than 2 weeks until the Tech.eu Summit London 2024, it’s time to reveal what’s on the agenda so that you can pack it with a personalised itinerary that leaves you on with a whole new outlook and a head buzzing with ideas.

title: Sunly secures €300M to transition to energy independence in the Baltics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Estonian enewable energy producer Sunly has raised €300 million in debt financing to accelerate the construction of 1.3 GW of solar, wind, storage, and hybrid parks across the Baltics and Poland. This brings the company’s debt and equity capital from investors to €765 million.

title: The hidden costs of AI-powered legaltech: are foundational skills being lost?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: 90's film aficionados will recall a scene in the teen film Clueless where the protagonist Cher helps her lawyer father prepare for a massive legal court case during a big overnighter. Her task is to go through a mountain of printed documents with a highlighter - highlighting every time a name is mentioned. She muddles up the date-sorted piles, and chaos ensues.

title: Moveo.AI secures $2.6M to enable enterprises to build personalised LLM models
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Moveo.AI, a London-based enterprise conversational AI startup, has raised $2.6 million in seed funding. Eleven Ventures led the round with Uni.Fund and Charge.vc participating.

title: Baltic states continue to punch above their weight in startup funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today  FIRSTPICK and Change Ventures teams published The Baltic Startup Funding Report, a semi-annual publication of detailed data about funding rounds for startups in the Baltics, including companies with HQs elsewhere but with a dominant base in Estonia, Latvia, or Lithuania.

title: Robinhood amps up UK offensive with stock lending offer
author: John Reynolds
summary: Robinhood, the US investing fintech, is bulking up its UK offering by launching a product which allows its retail investors to earn income by renting their shares out.

title: Jobilla raises €6M in new funding for multi-language HR software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Jobilla, a provider of digital recruitment technology, has secured additional funding to continue its international expansion following the launch of new recruitment tools. The platform will reduce campaign setup and running time by at least half by automating time-consuming tasks like ads, landing page content and email drafts, and even more importantly, the processes where candidates are screened to find the right profile for a vacant position. The rigorously tested localization function produces native-level content in most languages to attract talent in markets where companies don’t yet have a strong foothold.

title: Rendesco raises £6M to replace gas grids with low-carbon heat
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Clean heat network developer and owner-operator Rendesco has raised £6M to rapidly expand its operations and further develop its products in the UK and Europe.

title: Cardiff's Medi2Data secures £2.1M funding for medical data tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cardiff healthtech company Medi2data has raised £2.1million funding under the Enterprise Investment Scheme (EIS).

title: Singapore's Leo Capital launches €25M fund for Nordic B2B startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Helsinki’s tech ecosystem is getting a boost with Singapore-based venture capital firm Leo Capital launching its Nordic headquarters to support regional B2B startups.

title: Slovenian SaleSqueze secures $1.5M for automated sales
author: Lucy Adams

title: AppleVis finds new home with Be My Eyes: a win for blind and low vision tech users
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Be My Eyes, the Danish-founded app for blind and low-vision people is acquiring AppleVis, the go-to online blindness website for accessibility advice on Apple and other technologies.

title: SET Ventures closes €200M fund for digital clean energy startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: European sustainable energy VC SET Ventures has closed its fourth fund at €200 million to back digital technologies which will facilitate the transition to a carbon-free energy system.

title: Earlybird VC exercises its "entrepreneurial spirit" with restructure
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Earlybird Venture Capital, one of Europe’s longest-standing venture capital firms with over €2B in assets under management, has announced an organisational restructure with flagship fund Earlybird Digital East spinning out as a separate entity.

title: Tech entrepreneur who ran for London mayoral builds "career guidance" product
author: John Reynolds
summary: A tech entrepreneur who ran to become the Conservative candidate for London mayor is building a product, which he says can “democratise access to career guidance”.

title: Wisnio acquired by talent assessment company Assessio Group
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Wisnio, a provider of talent assessment and development solutions powered by generative AI, today announced its acquisition by Assessio Group. Assessio is a leading provider of strategic HR solutions in Northern Europe and is trusted by organizations such as Capgemini, Rabobank, DHL, and Randstad. The acquisition is backed by Pollen Street Capital. With the addition of Wisnio, the Assessio Group is now serving over 2000 customers with a team of around 175 employees.

title: Elite athletes invest in analytics-powered nutrition app
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Hexis, which uses advanced analytics to optimise athletes’ nutrition plans, has raised a £1.6M Pre-Seed round. Hexis uses a “scientific carb coding system” which calculates and predicts an athlete’s needs with ongoing adaptation according to an athlete’s workout to optimise performance and accelerate recovery.

title: Stonal secures near €100M investment from Aareon for real estate data management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today real estate data management platform Stonal raised up to €100 million in a strategic investment by Aareon, a European provider of SaaS solutions.

title: Kiteworks acquires 123FormBuilder to bolster data collection capabilities
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Kiteworks, which delivers data privacy and compliance for sensitive content communications through its Private Content Network (PCN), has acquired 123FormBuilder, a provider of advanced data collection through secure web forms and form-driven private content workflows.

title: ATLAS Space Operations raises $15M in round led by NewSpace Capital
author: Lucy Adams

title: German fitness startup 7NXT expands reach with Buddyfit acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German fitness startup 7NXT, owner and operator of Gymondo and 7Mind, is acquiring Buddyfit.

title: Belgian e-bike pioneer Cowboy raises €5M, eyes profitability in 2025
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belgian e-bike manufacturer Cowboy has raised €5 million and is gearing up for profitability and accelerated growth in 2025.

title: Latvia’s emerging tech ecosystem
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: While still developing, Latvia's tech ecosystem shows promising signs of growth and potential.

title: Myceen secures €2M in grants for mycelium building materials
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Mycelium building materils provider Myceen is advancing a seed investment round of €1-1.5 million. The funding will be used for the company to transfer to a larger production space.

title: AccountsIQ raises €60M Series C for accounting platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: AccountsIQ has secured a €60M Series C round for its cloud-based acounting platform. The funding will be used to embed machine learning into their products and for international expansion.

title: Vay partners with PEUGEOT to unveil remote driving trial
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Vay, a German startup developing autonomous driving software, has partnered with PEUGEOT.

title: Dutch payments unicorn Mollie says UK/EU reset would be “greatly received” by payment firms and merchants
author: John Reynolds
summary: A Dutch payments unicorn has welcomed the prospect of closer ties between the UK and the EU, saying it would be “greatly received”.

title: Gorilla raises €23M Series B
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Gorilla, a technology company that enables energy retailers to gather and process vast amounts of critical data, has raised a €23M Series B.

title: Uniqkey Raises €5.35M to strengthen SME cybersecurity in Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Denmark-based Uniqkey has raised €5.35 million to scale its cybersecurity solution across Europe and make companies more resilient to cyber attacks and data theft.

title: Berlin edtech pioneer EIDU open sources code to boost global learning
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-founded Edtech social enterprise EIDU is transitioning to an open-source model. By unlocking its proprietary source code and making it freely available to and modifiable by third parties, EIDU aims to maximise collaborative development and ensure sustainable usage.

title: 8 European climate tech companies to watch
author: Amanda Kavanagh
summary: A series of monster funding rounds have boosted fintech and climate tech in particular, and revealingly, many founders are betting on success by taking on high-interest debt, rather than sharing equity with investors.

title: Global Payments snaps up UK payments firm Takepayments
author: John Reynolds
summary: US payment processing giant Global Payments has acquired a UK payments business called Takepayments, according to a Companies House filing.

title: e-mobilio raises €9.5M for expansion into European EV market
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Munich-based electric vehicle recommendation and buying platform e-mobilio offers drivers help to make the switch to electric mobility. The platform gives users an overall view of owning an EV, with its e-purchase advisor helping buyers with a range of services including finding the right charger, installation service, public charging, photovoltaics, electricity tariff, GHG emissions quota, and subsidies.

title: Investcorp closes $570M fund for cybersecurity and fintech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Investcorp has closed its Investcorp Technology Partners V (ITP V) fund at $570M, exceeding its $500M target. The capital will be invested in software, data/analytics, cybersecurity and fintech startups.

title: SumUp raises €1.5B, 300M fund for nanotech startups, and 10 Spanish startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €2.5 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Alerce acquires WeMob to strengthen logistics offering
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Alerce is acquiring WeMob, a leading provider of fleet management and telematics SaaS solutions in Iberia. WeMob’s management team will continue to lead the business.

title: Reonic raises €13M Series A for cleantech SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Reonic, a climate tech SaaS startup focused on enabling the deployment of sustainable energy solutions across Europe, today announces that it has raised a €13m Series A funding round. Led by Northzone, the round also includes participation from existing investors Point Nine and Puzzle Ventures.

title: CSIS Security Group acquires Security Alliance Limited
author: Lucy Adams
summary: CSIS Security Group (“CSIS”) is has acquired Security Alliance Limited (“SecAlliance”).

title: Swedish fintechs Juni and Froda join forces on embedded lending venture
author: John Reynolds
summary: Two Swedish fintechs are teaming up on an embedded finance offering, which kicks off in Sweden ahead of a European rollout.

title: Trace Space's plan for AI industrial software raises the founders $1.5 million — all without an MVP
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Trace.Space, makers of AI-enabled software for industrial and automotive product engineers and manufacturers, announced a $1.5 million pre-seed funding.

title: Doccla bags £35M for European expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Doccla, a provider of virtual ward and remote patient monitoring services, has raised a Series B funding round of £35M.

title: Echion Technologies raises £29M for niobium-based battery tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Echion Technologies, a Cambridge-based developer of niobium-based, fast-charging battery materials,  has successfully raised its Series B funding round of £29M. The round was led by specialist battery and energy storage technology investor Volta Energy Technologies, with participation from existing investors CBMM, BGF, and Cambridge Enterprise Ventures.

title: Hg acquires risk management platform AuditBoard in $3B deal
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Connected risk management platform AuditBoard today announced that it has reached an agreement to be acquired by Hg, an investor in compliance, risk, and accounting software for 20 years, in a transaction valued at over $3 billion.

title: Reverion raises $62M for carbon-negative biogas power plants
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Reverion, a German company building reversible, carbon-negative power plants, has raised $62 million in Series A funding, including non-dilutive funding.

title: How to keep the global growth engine going: A masterclass in scaling internationally from GetYourGuide, Atomico and Target Global (Tech.eu Summit video)
author: Robin Wauters
summary: Interested in tech startups and how to expand a business into multiple countries? Take 20 minutes today to get a masterclass in scaling internationally, recorded at the recent Tech.eu Summit in Brussels.

title: French medtech startup i-Virtual secures €3M for measuring vital signs through video selfies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today French medtech startup i-Virtual announced its second funding round of €3 million, bringing the company's funding to €6.1 million.

title: Dryad Networks "Internet of the Forest" secures €5.6M for its advanced wildfire detection
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week ultra-early wildlife detection company Dryad Networks announced the successful initial closing of €5.6 million in a convertible financing round, with a total round size of up to €10 million.

title: Biotech NADMED raises €3.5M series A for 'NAD' vitals testing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Finnish biotech company NADMED has raised €3.5M for its blood testing technology. The round was led by Finnish science-based startup investor Nordic Science Investments (NSI). Additional funding was secured from previous investors Voima Ventures and University of Helsinki Funds, from a number of private European investors, and a grant from Business Finland.

title: Berlin's Cloover raises $114M to boost renewable energy transition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin renewable energy Cloover has raised a $114 million Seed round to fuel the growth of its operating system. The company connects all relevant stakeholders of the energy transition — installers, prosumers, manufacturers, energy providers, and investors — through its software, finance, and energy solutions.

title: Sidekick Health acquires PINK! to bolster its femtech offering
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Healthtech Sidekick Health has acquired PINK!, a digital health company specialising in cancer support and women’s health. This strengthens its position in the digital therapeutics market. Terms are undisclosed. The teams will be combined.

title: 10 Irish startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Amidst a rapidly evolving technology landscape, Irish technology companies have demonstrated their power in solutions that have not only pushed the boundaries of innovation but also cemented their position as key players on the global stage.

title: Lithuanian startup HeavyFinance signs up 300,000 hectares in Ukraine for regenerative farming push
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ukraine is the breadbasket of Europe, producing one of the highest wheat yields in the world

title: Palm raises $6.1M to streamline enterprise cash management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Palm, a Sweden and Netherlands-based fintech created to streamline cash management for enterprise treasury teams, has raised $6.1 million in Seed funding.

title: Summa equity acquires majority stake in Fast LTA
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Thematic investment firm Summa Equity has acquired a majority stake in German FAST LTA GmbH, a SaaS provider of secure and compliant data storage.

title: UK's "first" on-demand medicines courier Healistic raises £1 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Healistic is thought to be the UK's first business-to-consumer pharmaceuticals delivery service. The startup has raised £1 million from unnamed investors to bring pharmacist-only medicines directly to the front door of UK patients, aiming to reach them within 45 minutes of their order being placed.

title: Aloha Browser want to eliminate annoying cookie banners while protecting privacy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: While their logic is sound, I find cookie browsers enraging. I use Brave Browser and consent-O-matic to ease the pain, but I’m still left with a situation that’s far from ideal.

title: Berlin headquartered Cloover secures €7M for renewable energy fintech solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based climate fintech Cloover has secured €7 million in Pre-seed funding. The round was led by 9900 Capital and includes participation from QED, Broadhaven Ventures, Index Ventures' Scout Fund, Centrotec and angel investors.

title: Entrepreneurial failure is “badge of honour” to US investors but in Europe failure means you’re toast, says dotcom boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: A high-profile English tech founder, who has sold businesses for hundreds of millions of dollars, says US investors see business failure as a “badge of honour” while in Europe failure means you can end up on the "scrapheap".

title: Roamless becomes Shorooq's first Turkish investment with $5M Seed
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Telecoms startup Roamless, known for its eSIM technology and pay-as-you-go model, has raised a $5M Seed round to bolster its international growth. The round was led by Shorooq Partners, a leading investment firm in the Middle East and North Africa, and is the firm's first venture in Türkiye.

title: Rows raises €8M to challenge Excel and Sheets
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cloud platform-based spreadsheet app Rows has raised €8M for to make data integrations faster and easier, continue to enhance AI features and expand its presence in its key markets.

title: Cradle raises $24M to expand Generative AI for protein design and engineering
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Netherlands biotech startup Cradle announced it has raised $24 million in Series A funding, taking its total funding to $33 million.

title: Tacto Raises €50M for AI supply chain solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Tacto, the German AI-based operating system for future-proof supply chains, announced it has raised €50 million.

title: DataSnipper's auditing platform raises $100M, achieves unicorn status
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today DataSnipper, the leading intelligent automation platform for audit and finance professionals, has raised a $100 million Series B, led by Index Ventures, at a valuation of $1 billion.

title: Paris-based Cure51 raises €15M in seed funding
author: Lucy Adams
summary: French biotech startup Cure51 has raised €15M to pave the way for effective cancer treatments by studying the people who live with the most dangerous forms of the disease. The round was led by life science specialists Sofinnova Partners with Hitachi Ventures GmbH, Life Extension Ventures, Xavier Niel and Olivier Pomel, CEO and co-founder of Datadog also participating.

title: DeepL soars to $2B valuation with $300M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Language AI company DeepL announced a $300 million investment at a $2 billion valuation.

title: Index Ventures leads £3M seed round for Worldover's compliance automation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Worldover, a London-based software developer that powers the frictionless launch of physical products across global markets has revealed today the raise of £3 million in a seed funding round.

title: Apolitical granted $5M from Google.org for government AI training
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Apolitical, the global online learning platform and community for public servants, has received a $5 million grant from Google.org to scale up its Government AI Campus program.

title: Kynda scales up mycelium with large-scale facility near Hamburg
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Foodtech startup Kynda, is constructing a large-scale facility near Hamburg for sustainable mycelium proteins in Germany.

title: Quantum computing startups will invest overseas if government shelves further tech funding, warns top UK startup
author: John Reynolds
summary: A leading UK quantum computing startup has warned the government not to shelve further technology funding, saying it will lead to startups shifting investment overseas.

title: PrintyMed spins a web of innovation with bio-friendly spider silk
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: One of the biggest trends in tech right now is material innovation, with the development of organic materials to replace their synthetic counterparts in everything from cosmetics to food to healthcare.

title: Cozero raises €6.5M for climatetech software: aiding enterprises in decarbonisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German climatetech software company Cozero announced it has raised €6.5 million in a Series A funding round.

title: Wakeo raises €18M for supply chain visibility and sustainability
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Paris company Wakeo announced its latest funding round, raising €18 million and bringing its funding to over €30 million.

title: Bistroo joins peaq ecosystem creating a new era for blockchain in food delivery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In a boost for real-world commercial blockchain applications, Dutch food delivery and takeout platform Bistroo has joined the peaq ecosystem.

title: Hivebrite secures $37M Series B to expand global community engagement platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today community and engagement platform Hivebrite announced that it has raised a $37 million series B funding round.

title: E-magy has raised €20.5 million for the production of EV battery materials
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch firm E-magy has raised €20.5 million in fresh funds to get cracking on industrial scale production of a silicon material for EV batteries, one that the company claims can increase the storage capacity of lithium-ion batteries, compared to today's industry standards

title: Sustainability startup Signol raises £2.5M to reduce aviation emissions
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Sustainability startup Signol, which uses behavioural science to reduce emissions in shipping and aviation, has raised £2.5m from leading industry-focused investors.

title: Belgium: Nurturing tech talent and entrepreneurship in the heart of Europe
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Strategically located in the heart of Europe, Belgium leverages its multilingual and highly educated workforce to foster innovation and entrepreneurship. The nation's tech scene boasts a robust mix of startups, scale-ups, and established companies across sectors such as fintech, healthtech, biotech, and smart cities.

title: Oxford Quantum Circuits raises $100M for quantum compute-as-a-service
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Oxford Quantum Circuits (OQC), a quantum compute-as-a-service (QCaaS) company, announced that Japanese VC fund SBI Investment, Japan’s premier VC fund, is leading OQC’s $100 million round.

title: UK e-money licence approvals up following 2022 “disaster”
author: John Reynolds
summary: Startups in the UK were today given a boost after new figures show a year-on-year uptick in UK Electronic Money Institution (EMI) licence approvals following the 2022 “disaster”.

title: Metroc raises €2M to bring clarity to construction projects using AI
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish construction tech company, Metroc, has developed a SaaS tool to assist construction firms as they seek out project opportunities. It combines public information from thousands of data sources breaking down the accessibility and value for its customers. It uses AI and has spent two years training the language model specifically for needs within the construction industry.

title: Multinational accounting simplified: Translucent raises £5M in Seed funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based accounting platform Translucent has raised a £5 million Seed funding round. The round was co-led by Chalfen Ventures and LocalGlobe. The fintech’s latest funding round comes hot on the heels of its £2.7 million pre-seed round which was completed less than six months ago. To date, the firm has raised a total investment of £7.7 million.

title: Goodwings raises $1.5M for climate-focused SaaS travel management platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish climate-focussed SaaS travel management platform Goodwings has raised $1.5 million in late Seed investment. The round includes funding from Global Cleantech Capital (GCC), JTB USA (a US subsidiary of JTB Corp) and existing investors. Goodwings says that having JTB USA as a strategic partner will help it 'expand its global footprint and drive significant growth in client acquisition and ARR'.

title: DREM plans to pump up the volume of heat pumps in Europe with €2M investment
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swedish heat pump platform DREM has gone and bagged another €2 million as Peak has come up trumps with the fuel to fund a European expansion.

title: Ramify raises €11M for premium wealth management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Paris-based Ramify, a wealth management and financial advisory platform, has raised €11 million Series A funding round. The round was led by 13books Capital, with participation from Fidelity International Strategic Ventures and existing investors Newfund, AG2R, Crédit Agricole and business angels. With the funding, Ramify will accelerate product development to serve its customer base of affluent investors in France.

title: Prague's Product Fruits secures $1.6M for AI-powered customer onboarding platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Customer onboarding platform Product Fruits has closed a second $1.6 million funding round in just under a year, bringing its total funding amount to $3.5 million.

title: Iceland: Tech innovations from the land of fire and ice
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Icelandic tech ecosystem thrives despite its small population, fostered by robust physical infrastructure and an innovative spirit born of necessity.

title: The EU invests €50M to help startups scale up alternative proteins
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The week the EU announced it will invest €50 million next year in helping startups and small businesses scale up the production of alternative proteins using methods such as precision fermentation.

title: Rocsys-Easymile partnership marks new step for autonomous EVs
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Hands-free charging for electric vehicles provider Rocsys has partnered with Easymile, who collaborates with blue-chip manufacturers to automise vehicles. The partnership will see Rocsys’ fully autonomous charging solutions introduced within the EasyMile offering.

title: Startups greening our wardrobes through circular design and sustainability
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last few years, the fashion industry has committed to sustainability in response to high demands from customers and investors.

title: Root Signals raises $2.8M for GenAI auditing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Root Signals, a startup based in Helsinki and Palo Alto specializing in generative AI (GenAI) measurement with "LLM-as-a-judge" techniques, has raised $2.8M. Root Signals helps businesses accelerate GenAI adoption by providing them with enterprise-grade tooling to comprehensively measure, control and monitor LLM applications.

title: Scandinavian tech giants like Spotify and Klarna "have fostered a new generation of entrepreneurs”
author: John Reynolds
summary: Scandinavia is home to some of the most celebrated tech companies in recent years: think Skype, Spotify, and Klarna. Cities like Stockholm and Copenhagen are also home to a new generation of startups creating waves across Europe.

title: Winamp is still whipping the llama’s ass
author: Dan Taylor
summary: There once was a time when Winamp’s catchphrase was so ubiquitous, you didn’t even need to hear it, just the opening tone, and you knew exactly what was happening.
