title: Venture Capital Trusts: Proving a pillar of support for UK's expanding startups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: No fear of VCTs suffering the downturn as the Venture Capital Trust Association (VCTA) published figures today that say the deployment of capital into early-stage startups grew 8% year-on-year to £664 million. Positive news compared to the UK venture capital figures which say funding fell by almost a quarter (23 percent) in 2022.

title: Danish fintech Ageras says hitting profit "huge milestone"
author: John Reynolds
summary: Danish accounting software fintech Ageras says it is a “huge milestone” hitting its first full-year profit as it gears up for a potential IPO.

title: Insurtech scaleup Qover raises $30 million to drive growth and profitability
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Brussels-based insuretech scaleup Qover,  has raised $30 million in a Series C round that is expected to fuel continued growth, support the development of additional partnerships, and ultimately, achieve profitability.

title: Former Tesla marketing lead Corinne Aaron joins Einride as new CMO
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Einride, the pioneering freight mobility company renowned for its digital, electric, and autonomous vehicles, has announced the appointment of former Tesla marketing lead Corinne Aaron as its new Chief Marketing Officer.

title: Swedish BNPL Klarna records further growth in European markets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swedish BNPL and shopping assistant Klarna today announced strong growth across Europe, with GMV up fourteen percent year-on-year in Q2, with that figure at 26 percent in the UK.

title: Qualifyze raises $12M to accelerate growth in healthcare supply chain compliance
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Frankfurt-based compliance company Qualifyze provides compliance solutions to the pharmaceutical industry which allows them to check the compliance of supply chains. It offers a digital platform which can manage audits end-to-end, capturing audit data at scale.

title: Schüttflix's €45M raise fuels construction industry efficiency
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German construction tech firm Schüttflix has raised a €45 million funding round which includes a credit line. Those involved in the round include new investors FJ Labs, DEVK Insurance and some family offices, previous backers Strabag, and the Hagedorn Group, and strategic partners IK Umwelt.

title: Quod Orbis acquired by Dedagroup to fuel global growth
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based cybersecurity Continuous Controls Monitoring (CCM) firm Quod Orbis has been acquired by Dedagroup, a leading Italian IT provider, as it expands internationally.

title: Translucent kicks off its funding journey with £2.7 million
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based accountancy and financial management platform Translucent has raised a pre-seed round of £2.7 million.

title: Swiss-based firm Andromeda Capital buys majority stake in Change Group
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch-Estonian investment fintech Change Group AS is being acquired by Swiss-based private equity firm Andromeda Capital Partners Suisse AG (founded by Ingmar Mattus, co-founder of cross-asset broker Tickmill) in an undisclosed deal.

title: Gamification's out, “Motivational Engineering” is in, and iGaming is leading the way
author: Julia Gifford
summary: “Gamification” was the “AI” of the 2010s. If you were a startup, you were thinking about how to gamify your platform to increase engagement. A decade later, many gamification systems are still based on the same, legacy technologies.

title: Circular retail trade-in program EALYX secures €1M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, European SaaS platform for circular retail EALYX announced that it has raised €880,000, which it will complement with non-dilutive funding to complete an overall raise of €1 million.

title: European cultivated meat startups in "valley of death", amid funding challenges
author: John Reynolds
summary: European foodtech startups trying to revolutionise the food sector through lab-grown meat are stuck in a “valley of death”, according to a non-profit that promotes cell-based alternatives to traditional animal products.

title: Revolut “aggressively doubling down" on B2B market
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut says annual revenues from its business accounts have topped $500m, as it launches an automated payment function which it says will help its business clients simplify bill paying.

title: Meniga raises €15M in Series D funding for digital banking solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, fintech startup Meniga announced that it has raised €15 million in Series D funding, bringing the company's funding to €55 million.

title: Idox Plc acquires UK geographic data provider Emapsite in £15.75M deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based software solutions provider ldox plc has acquired Emapsite, a UK-based geographic information systems data provider in a £15.75 million deal. The details of the deal are £15.75 million on a cash-free, debt-free basis, £14.75 million will be satisfied in cash upon completion payable from Idox’s existing financial resources, with £1 million cash payment paid within the next 12 months to cover warranties and indemnities.

title: NaaS to buy Swedish EV charging solutions provider Charge Amps for $66.4M
author: Fiona Alston
summary: EV charging services company NaaS Technology Inc. says that it is buying Swedish EV charging solutions provider Charge Amps for $66.4 million bagging 100 percent of the issued and outstanding shares. The move is a continuation of NaaS’ vie for global EV domination following its acquisition of Sinopower HK earlier this summer.

title: DICE secures $65M funding for global expansion in music ticketing
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following the confirmation of a restructuring of the organisation and subsequent round of layoffs, things are looking less dicey at London-based music ticketing platform DICE. Today the company officially announces a $65 million funding round led by MUSIC, the investment company co-founded by former ASCAP member of the board of directors, and independent music publisher SONGS, Matt Pincus.

title: Belong comes out of stealth mode with £2.95M — the largest Pre-Seed round raised by female founders in Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A new wealth-building platform called Belong has launched today, coming out of stealth mode after securing £2.95 million in Pre-Seed funding — the largest Pre-Seed round ever raised by female founders in Europe.

title: Raylo raises £5.2M in cash and media for equity deal
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based sustainable tech platform Raylo has raised £5.2 million, in cash and media for equity, in its latest funding round, led by Macquarie and Channel 4 Ventures. The startup is also gearing up to launch a crowdfunding campaign.

title: Co-creation platform Prospect 100 bags $750K in pre-seed funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: UK-based startup Prospect 100 has secured $750,000 in a pre-seed funding round to spearhead the development of its co-creation platform. This digital space facilitates the connection and collaboration between brands and creative talent worldwide. The investment is aimed at driving the platform's goal of becoming the go-to hub for co-creation, allowing a broader spectrum of brands to collaborate with creative minds across the globe.

title: Pet tech in Europe is pawsitively booming with investors lining up to play ball
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last few years, one trend in tech investment shows no sign of abating – pet tech. Early-stage startups continually expand and raise funds, with many acquiring other companies as they grow, while newly founded startups successfully raise millions in their first couple of years.

title: How hardware startups are pawsitively disrupting pet care
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Pets have firmly pawed their way into our families. In Germany alone, 34.4 million households own at least one pet, with cats at the top of the tree with 15.2 million fluffy felines in 24% of homes — a further 10.6 million own dogs.

title: Deeptech is one of Europe's most resilient sectors in 2023
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The third annual report on European deeptech prepared by Dealroom, Lakestar, and Walden Catalyst, shows that amid the difficulties faced by global startups, deeptech startups are taking the lead.

title: Proofs raises $2.6M to fast-track proof-of-concept phase
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Proofs, which uses AI models to accelerate the proof-of-concept phase in software sales, has raised $2.6M in pre-seed financing. The round was led by Earlybird Digital East Fund with support from Expeditions Fund, Step Function Ventures, RTP Global, and a number of angel investors.

title: Inato raises $20 million to make clinical trials more efficient and inclusive
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian startup Inato has raised $20 million for its AI-based data collection tool for the pharmaceutical sector from return and lead investor Cathay Innovation, return investor Obvious Ventures, and new investors La Maison and Top Harvest Capital. Since late 2017 the company has raised a total of $35.5 million.

title: Futraheat bags £700K and seeks industrial partner for heat pump pilot
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based industrial heat pump startup Futraheat has developed a 300kW industrial heat pump called Greensteam 360 which boosts low-grade waste heat up by up to 60 degrees, upcycling the heat back to the customer allowing them to save on their energy bills and carbon footprint. It says it can cut energy use by more than 80%.

title: “I had never heard of it” says investor in Monzo’s first-ever crowdfunding campaign in 2016
author: John Reynolds
summary: A young investor whose £1,000 investment in Monzo before it fully launched which is now worth around £28,000 said he’d never heard of the challenger bank at the time.

title: Countdown Begins: 30 Days to the Tech.eu Summit London 2024 – What to Expect
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: With just one month to go until the Tech.eu Summit London 2024, anticipation is building for what is set to be one of the most influential technology events in Europe this year. Scheduled for May 16-17 at the iconic Old Billingsgate, the summit will gather the brightest minds in tech to discuss the future of the industry and explore new business opportunities.

title: Swiss digital coaching platform FLOWIT raises €4.2M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss digital coaching platform FLOWIT has raised €4.2 million Seed funding.

title: Skarper raises £4.5M to convert push bikes to electric
author: Lucy Adams
summary: British start-up Skarper, backed by six-time Olympic cycling champion Sir Chris Hoy, has attracted £4.5 million in new investment, bringing total funding to £12.8M.

title: Beyond the grave: How deathtech startups are transforming what happens when we die
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A friend's mum died last week. She told me "I had no idea there would be so much paperwork."

title: Lithuania leads the future of women in tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When researching the startup ecosystem in Lithuania, one thing stuck out — the number of female-led startups.

title: Pathway bring real-time value to logistics through machine unlearning
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: There's a problem in machine learning you'll likely start hearing more about. No, it's not hallucinations. It concerns what happens when data that machines learn from is found to be false, inaccurate, or becomes outdated. Imagine the consequences of a legal case regarding the right to be forgotten.

title: Lithuania's thriving startup ecosystem is far more than fintech with thriving unicorns and changemakers aplenty
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Think Lithuanian startups and your first thought is fintech companies. After all, the country is home to over 280 fintech companies, so there are many reasons to call it the leader of fintech in the Baltics.

title: Finland’s CurifyLabs awarded €2.5 million from European Innovation Council
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish med-tech CurifyLabs has been awarded a grant of €2.5 million from the European Innovation Council (EIC) Accelerator programme to further its MiniLab technology.

title: Neobank bunq secures fresh €44.5M growth capital, reaching €100M this year
author: Dan Taylor
summary: It’s been a banner year thus far for the folks at neobank bunq. Just last week the firm announced that it had surpassed 9 million registered users accounting for over €4.5 billion in deposits, and today it revealed that it’s secured a fresh €44.5 million in growth capital. In total, the formerly bootstrapped bank has secured nearly €100 million this year alone, despite a noted market downturn.

title: Omnichannel comms platform Conversation24 raises €3 Million to power global expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Conversation24, a Rotterdam-based omnichannel communication platform, has raised €3 million to bolster its global expansion efforts.

title: Vesper's AI-driven agricultural commodity platform raises Series A funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Vesper, a leading Dutch agricultural commodity intelligence platform announced the close of a Series A financing round — the amount was not disclosed but the company raised €5 million in Seed funding in 2021.

title: Wholesale procurement platform Qogita emerges from stealth with €80 million Series B
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today wholesale procurement platform Qogita is emerging from stealth and announcing it has raised €80 million in Series B funding led by Dawn Capital, bringing the company's funds raised to €119 million

title: Code for conservation: AI's contribution to eco initiatives
author: Viktor Khodanov
summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has evolved into a global force, reshaping everything from healthcare diagnostics to predictive analytics in finances. Nevertheless, we rarely hear about the advantages of using AI in ecological initiatives.

title: Meatable is raising the steaks with faster manufacturing, culling the time is takes to send a cell-grown piggy to market
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today  Meatable announced it has reduced the time it takes to create cultivated pork meat to only eight days, with the highest quality muscle and fat cells, thanks to a differentiation process that can scale at pace with lower costs.

title: Faircado wins €1M in Slush 100 competition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: I’ve spent the last few days at Slush in Helsinki. There’s snow and lots of amazing startups — and of course, the infamous Slush 100 startup competition, where startups compete for a cool €1 million in funding.

title: The world’s biggest startup festival comes to Belgium with Leuven Slush'D
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In 2023, the Belgian startup ecosystem sees it big. The startup event Slush, the world’s biggest startup festival, is coming to Belgium in the form of Leuven Slush'D. Backed by the Helsinki-based organisation, Leuven Slush'D aims to immediately position itself as the "leading startup event" in Belgium.

title: Estonian SensusQ raises €3.8M for defence intelligence software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Estonian defence tech SensusQ has secured €3.8M from US-based New North Ventures and angel investors. This marks the first investment in dual-use technology for New North Ventures.

title: Data analytics provider Bridgewise raises $21M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Bridgewise has announced the completion of a $21 million funding round, bringing its total capital raised to $35 million.

title: Vandria raises $30.7M Series A for mitochondrial therapeutics development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Mitochondrial therapeutics company Vandria today announced the second closing of its Series A financing bringing the final amount raised to date to $30.7 million (CHF 28.3 million).

title: Dynamic technology environments calls for increased upskilling and training, according to cybersecurity experts
author: Cate Lawrence

title: A game-changing subnet launches on the Internet Computer to help devs build GDPR-compliant dApps
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today the Swiss not-for-profit DFINITY Foundation announced that a European subnet has launched on the Internet Computer Foundation (ICP), providing GDPR-aligned infrastructure for decentralised applications (dApps).

title: Kids pre-loved clothing platform Swoperz gets some love with £250,000
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swapping clothes with your family and friends is nothing new, sure, we have all been wearing someone else's hand-me-downs at some point in our lives - but now with the invention of the internet we can swap our clothes with complete strangers too! While this is a brilliant idea, we all know the perils of the internet, particularly for kids. Luckily two savvy parents, Charlene Hurlock and Vicky Fuller, came up with a cracking idea to allow their kids safely swap their pre-loved clothes with other kids via a secure platform - Swoperz.

title: Sailing towards sustainability: zero44 secures €2.5 million funding for CO2  management in the shipping industry
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Zero44, a Berlin SaaS startup for CO2 management of merchant ships, announced a successful funding round of €2.5 million this week.

title: Revolut to pause crypto buying for UK business customers
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut is pausing some of its crypto services for its UK business customers from early next year, amid a crackdown on advertising cryptocurrencies in the UK.

title: Acre surveys £6.5 million to up the exchange and complete the completion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London’s Acre has raised £6.5 million in a new funding round as it continues on its path of digitising and automating the home buying process on the intermediaries' side of the equation.

title: Italian business travel scaleup BizAway secures €10 million investment via illimity
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Italian traveltech scaleup BizAway has secured €10 million in a debt funding round. Going head to head with Barcelona’s TravelPerk, BizAway offers an “all-in-one solution to book and manage your business trips.” The company intends to use the investment for M&A activities as well as R&D.

title: Dripl's 'refillution' aims to eliminate 1 billion plastic bottles by 2030
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Belgian startup Dripl has secured €2.15 million in growth capital to strengthen its footholds in Belgium and the Netherlands as week as press forward with what the company is terming its 'refillution' across Europe. The investment is comprised of both equity and convertible loans and arrives via Faraday VP, The Source (Spadel Group), and existing angel investors, including GreenPark Investments founding partner Wim Vernaeve, Eat More Trees founder Jonas Mallisse, and Foodbag CEO Stéphane Ronse.

title: Delivery Hero shuts down tech hubs in Türkiye and Taiwan
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today sees another blow for European food delivery companies with Delivery Hero announcing that it will close its global tech hubs in Türkiye and Taiwan and adjust its headcount at its Berlin headquarters.

title: London fintech Curve has “strong potential” to hit profit in 2024
author: John Reynolds
summary: The founder of London-headquartered fintech Curve says it has a “strong potential” to hit profitability in 2024 after making “a substantial reduction in headcount” and improving margins across the board.

title: Türkiye’s largest VC, Revo Capital, plans $100M investment in regional startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Türkiye venture capital firm Revo Capital announced plans to raise a $100 million fund to invest in regional startups.

title: AI practitioners and investors provide an insight into 2024's technological landscape
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: 2023 was the year of AI. It captured the attention of the masses with platforms like ChatGPT — who reached 100 million users just two months after its launch — and Bard. The interfaces were simple enough that even your grandmother could use them.

title: This week in European tech: Atomico's report, Molten's move, and Monzo's last co-founder departs
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €1.1 billion. We saw over 5 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: UK startup Borderless tackles care worker shortage with £2.5M seed funding
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Borderless, a UK-based startup that’s taking aim at the country’s shortage of care workers has today announced a £2.5 million seed funding round. The startup offers care providers automated vetting and sourcing, one-click visa processing, and streamlined relocation management services.

title: Silo AI's new release Viking 7B, bridges the gap for low-resource languages
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Europe’s largest private AI lab Silo AI is releasing, together with the University of Turku’s research group TurkuNLP and HPLT, the first multilingual large language model (LLM) for all Nordic languages.

title: Contents carries on with the consuming, swallows up Scribox
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Milan-based AI-powered content generation startup Contents.com has acquired the more than a decade-old content marketing agency Scribox for an undisclosed sum. According to Contents, no reductions in Scribox’s staff are planned, and the company intends to maintain the latters’ established network of editors, journalists, and freelancers.

title: CinSOIL pioneers soil carbon sequestration for a greener agrifood sector
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: In the face of climate change, the agrifood sector is under increasing pressure to reduce its carbon footprint. CinSOIL, a deeptech startup, is offering a solution to help companies achieve this goal by accurately monitoring and quantifying soil carbon sequestration.

title: Gymondo's parent Company 7NXT expands into mindfulness with 7Mind acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today 7NXT, owner and operator of fitness platform Gymondo, is acquiring 7Mind to create an all-encompassing consumer digital platform for physical and mental fitness and wellbeing.

title: Players Fund adds top female athletes to its Venture Capital firm
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Players Fund, the UK’s first athlete-led venture capital firm, announced additional female athletes as new partners.

title: Kraken acquires Sennen to enhance renewable energy asset management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees energy industry software provider Kraken announce its acquisition of Sennen, a provider of advanced software for the delivery and operation of large-scale renewable energy generation.

title: This Week in European Tech: Builder.ai nabs $250 million, Onfido and Multiverse acquire, Moonfire's $115 million fund, Meta's €1.2 billion fine, and more
author: Robin Wauters
summary: This week, our research team tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €883 million, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: IBM to acquire Software AG's super iPaaS business for €2.13B
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Software AG announced it is selling webMethods and StreamSets – its Super Integration-Platform-as-a-Service (iPaaS) business – to IBM for €2.13 billion, subject to customary closing adjustments.  Launched in October 2023, Super iPaaS is an AI-enabled integration platform. It combines APIs, applications, data, B2B, and events integration capability, enabling innovation and driving agility, productivity and governance across the modern hybrid enterprise.

title: Food saving app Munch anounces Series A funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Munch, one of the largest food-saving apps in Central-Eastern Europe, announced its Series A funding round.

title: Elbow Beach Capital boosts investment in Munro Vehicles 4x4 EVs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today sees Elbow Beach Capital announce a further £1 million investment in Munro Vehicles, a manufacturer of all-electric 4x4 vehicles and Scotland’s only volume production car company.

title: Colendi receives regulatory approval for Türkiye's first digital deposit bank
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Türkiye/UK fintech Colendi has secured the green light from the Banking Regulation and Supervision Agency (BRSA) to launch Turkey’s first digital deposit bank.

title: AI-powered feedback management platform Magic Feedback raises  €1.2 M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Magic Feedback, a Copenhagen-based AI startup, announced today that it has raised €1.2 million for its platform that unifies and analyses user feedback.

title: Microsoft co-founder's venture arm contributes to Curve's £58M funding boost - Series C now at £133M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Curve has disclosed the addition of £58 million to its Series C funding round, now bringing the total to £133 million. The all-things-financial app intends to use the new capital to improve the overall customer experience, build upon its $1 billion Credit-Suisse-backed lending business, Curve Flex, and continue to forge and leverage new partnerships.

title: Bubty secures $1.9M Seed funding for better freelance recruitment and management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today staff recruitment and management platform Bubty announces it has raised $1.9 million in Seed funding.

title: Claid.ai  turns your crappy photos into masterpieces in seconds
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Before generative AI tools like Mid Journey and Chat GPT were household names for techies, Let's Enhance used the tech to solve a real eyesore— crap photography. (Founders, we love you, but gosh, we see a lot of crap photos at Tech.eu.)

title: Kamma raises £3.6M for geospatial tech advancing climate change solutions
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK property data and analytics firm Kamma combines its data collection and address-matching technology with analysis to provide the fastest routes to net zero. Kamma’s data powers climate change solutions ranging from ESG risk management and reporting to retrofit optimisation solutions.

title: Gerard Piqué's Kings League secures €60M for next-generation football competition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Kings League, a seven-a-side next generation football competition led by Gerard Piqué that brings together entertainment and sports, today announced a €60 million investment round.

title: Crescenta raises €3.5M in Spain's largest fintech Pre-Seed round
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Crescenta, Spain's first digital fund manager for private equity investment, expands its Pre-Seed financing round with €2 million.

title: Quesma's novel database gateway raises $2.3M Pre-Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, database gateway company Quesma announced a $2.3 million Pre-Seed funding round co-led by Heartcore and Inovo.

title: UP Catalyst secures €2.3M to create battery materials from CO2
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UP Catalyst, a producer of battery material production directly from CO2 emissions, has closed a €2.36M seed extension round. This follows the initial seed round raised last December which amounted to €4 million, bringing the total seed funding to €6.36 million.

title: From alternative protein winter to a level playing field for startups and investors
author: Simo Ellilä
summary: While all venture capital has taken a severe hit since central bank interest rates started to rise in 2022, investments in alternative proteins have been particularly affected.

title: UltiHash raises $2.5M  Pre-Seed funding for sustainable data storage
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today German data storage startup UltiHash announced it has raised $2.5 million in Pre-Seed funding.

title: Computing platform developer Signaloid raises £3 million in a seed round led by IQ Capital
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week computing platform developer Signaloid announced a £3 million seed round.

title: The next challenge for VCs: measure your portfolio’s science-based impact
author: Annu Nieminen
summary: Startups have a fairly nice reputation when it comes to impact and sustainability. They don’t usually have big nasty factories or harvest tobacco. They disrupt old ways of working and employ young people. They must be “impact superheroes”, right?

title: Five tech startup gifts for the ones you adore and the ones you secretly can't stand
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's my favourite time of year — mass consumption of food, gifts, and alcoholic beverages.

title: Moonfire ignites $115 million trans lunar injection burn with second fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Led by former Atomico co-founder Mattias Ljungman, London-based Moonfire Ventures has raised $115 million with its second fund and will continue to invest in European early-stage startups that intersect with Web3, AI and AR/VR, including fintech, future of work, gaming, and e-health.

title: Crypto giant Binance splits from UK fintech body
author: John Reynolds
summary: The UK division of the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange has split from an organisation comprising top UK fintech founders looking to foster greater collaboration between fintechs, government, and regulators.

title: Industrial edge platform Helin raises €3 million Seed round for seamles edger analytics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Helin, a Netherlands developer of an industrial edge intelligence platform, has successfully raised a €3 million Seed round from FORWARD.one.

title: Kosmik raises $3.7M Seed funding for desktop redesign
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week collaborative visual software company Kosmik announced it has raised $3.7 million in Seed funding.

title: Lithuanian medtech startup Sentante secures €6M  for its teleoperated robotics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Lithuanian medical device company Sentante announced the closing of a €6 million Seed funding round led by Practica Capital with the participation of the EIC fund.

title: DTE raises $6M in extended investment round for real-time intelligence from liquid metals
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, process and quality control company DTE announced it has successfully extended its current investment round by $6 million with participation from Eyrir Vöxtur, alongside existing backers, the European Innovation Council (EIC) Fund.

title: Green Eagle Solutions secures €6M for AI-powered renewable energy automation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Spanish startup, Green Eagle Solutions has closed a €6 million Series A round.

title: Frankfurt's leonardo.impact secures €555K Pre-seed funding for impact reporting
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Frankfurt-based impact reporting platform leonardo. impact has received €555,000 in Pre-seed funding in a round led by Hessian-based investor bmh and includes eight angel investors. The funding will allow leonardo. impact to grow its offering and fuel innovation as it seeks additional ‘impact measurement to create positive change for its clients’.

title: Bunq launches beefed-up AI chatbot 0.2 and confirms re-applying for US banking licence after withdrawal
author: John Reynolds
summary: Dutch challenger bank Bunq is launching what it’s calling the 0.2 version of Finn, its AI chatbot assistant, which it says now has beefed up conversational powers.

title: Link11 raises €26.5M investment for patented DDoS protection
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees IT security provider Link11 close another financing round with the Dutch investor Pride Capital Partners raising €26.5 million.

title: Swedish startup Exeger secures €35M loan from the EIB for Powerfoyle self-charging cells
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, the European Investment Bank (EIB) has signed a loan agreement of up to €35 million with the Swedish clean tech company, Exeger, which manufactures the solar cell technology Powerfoyle. The company has raised over €169 million, including €16.1 million Series B in March this year.

title: VividQ raises $7.5M Series A for spatial computing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Deeptech VividQ has raised an additional $7.5M in Series A funding, bringing the company’s total funding to over $30M. The round was led by Foresight Group LLP and included new investors such as GameTech Ventures, and NY-based Ruttenberg Gordon Investments (RGI), as well as existing investors.

title: Tech.eu's 2023 Annual Report, AI a person of the year, and €1.4B for the European tech
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Last week, we tracked over 95 tech funding deals worth over €1.4 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, and rumours; all alongside a host of related news stories across Europe.

title: Absolute Capital Partners provides  Unlimitd  with a €100M boost to accelerate European growth
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today revenue-based financing platform Unlimitd, a leading player in digital financing in France, announced a €100 million investment from Absolute Capital Partners (ACP).

title: Fintech Updraft closes a £272 million debt and equity round
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Updraft, a UK-based consumer lending fintech company, has announced the closing of a £272 million debt and equity round.

title: Investor EIP pumps €500M into Eni's Plenitude for renewable energy growth
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today investor Energy Infrastructure Partner (EIP) announced it is acquiring a minority stake in Eni energy transition company Plenitude. EIP will inject €500 million into Plenitude’s capital structure, with the option to increase its total investment to EUR 700m. Eni launched Plenitude in 2021. It combines renewable energy generation assets, retail services for homes and businesses and charging points for electric vehicles into a diversified platform.    Today, Plenitude operates nearly 3 gigawatts of installed carbon-free generation capacity and almost 20,000 charging points for electric vehicles, with around 10 million retail customers in Europe and operations in 15 countries worldwide.    By 2026, the company intends to double its installed renewable generation capacity to 7 gigawatts, bring its charging points to 30,000, and expand its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation to €1.8 billion, nearly three times its 2022 level.  According to Roland Dörig, EIP founder and managing partner:

title: Regensburg gets solar powered wireless e-scooter charging as Zeus launches pilot project
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The beautiful city of Regensburg in Germany is the home to Irish micromobility provider Zeus’s latest pilot project. It is launching solar powered wireless e-scooter charging after three years of being active in the city.

title: Doconomy secures €34M Series B to boost climate action in banking
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Doconomy, a fintech company providing banks with tools to drive climate action and financial wellbeing, today announces the closure of one of €34 million Series B funding.

title: Supercritical captures $13 million to scale its carbon removal marketplace
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based carbon removal marketplace Supercritical says that a recent funding round will ‘fuel new chapter of growth'. Businesses can purchase 'fully qualified' carbon removal credits through the platform - these credits meet the industry standard Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi).

title: Berlin-based Denario joins PandaDoc for enhanced payment solutions
author: Dan Taylor
summary: PandaDoc has acquired Berlin-based fintech startup Denario in a move that aims to further accelerate its growth into the leading all-in-one documents and payments workflow platform. Terms of the deal remain undisclosed.  100 percent of Denario team members are expected to retain their positions and will be added to PandaDoc's remote workforce.

title: Ventech expands presence in Nordics with new Stockholm office
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French-born Pan-European venture capital firm Ventech is embedding itself firmly into the Nordics by opening a Stockholm office. Already with an office in Helsinki, the firm has enjoyed the fruits of its labour in the Nordics with a successful exit with Swedish fintech Capcito, which was acquired by Fortnox in 2021.

title: Zendesk acquires Tallinn-based quality management platform Klaus
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Tallinn-based quality management platform Klaus has been acquired by customer service industry stalwart Zendesk. The move further bolsters Zendesk’s commitment to delivering a comprehensive AI-powered workforce engagement management (WEM) solution, with Klaus’ tech fulfilling the role of QA. The terms and financials of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: HEPHAISTOS-Pharma secures €4.3M Seed funding for cancer immunotherapies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: HEPHAISTOS-Pharma, a biotechnology company developing next-generation immunotherapies against cancer that target innate immunity to increase patient cure rates, has completed its €4.3 million Seed round to finance industrialisation and advance its lead candidate, ONCO-Boost, towards the clinic.  This brings the funding total to €10.3 million from investors and non-dilutive financing.

title: Papara's growth continues with T-Bank acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week Türkiye neobank Papara acquired T-Bank for an undisclosed amount. While the acquisition awaits regulatory approval, Tech.eu understands that the decision follows an agreement with Papara's shareholders, along with T-Bank, BankMed and Arab Bank.

title: Naked Energy secures £17M to supercharge expansion of heat decarbonisation solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Naked Energy has secured £17 million of new equity as part of a Series B first close to supercharge its global expansion and the adoption of its cutting-edge solutions to decarbonise heat.

title: Manta Ray EV is creating a shared economy as the AirBnB of EV charging
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A couple of years ago, I predicted we’d see a growth in peer-to-peer electric vehicle charging, where homeowners hire out their EV charger when they don't need it themselves in return for payment. Think of it like an Airbnb for EV charging.

title: Berlin's Root Global raises €8M to decarbonise global food system
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin startup Root Global has raised €8 million in Seed funding to help food and beverage manufacturers on their way to Net Zero.

title: Naobios awarded €1.7M grant for vaccine development by Bill & Melinda Gates foundation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Naobios, a contract development and manufacturing company that provides bioprocess development and production of clinical batches of virus-based products, announced that it has received a €1.7M grant from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to support vaccine development.

title: Berlin startup montamo has developed pioneering green energy training for migrant workers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Berlin-based start-up montamo has successfully closed a €2.1 million Pre-Seed funding round led by Project A Ventures.

title: Mistral AI moves the needle, BUX bought in firesale, and the Tech.eu Annual Report
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €1.4 billion and 10+ exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: BT Group to transform broadband cabinets into EV chargers
author: Dan Taylor

title: Veremark secures $3M for enhanced global background screening services
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Veremark, a UK global background screening company, has secured $3 million in a Pre-Series B round, bringing its funding to over $16 million.

title: Finnish start-up Vensum raises €3.8 million to develop software-controlled power converters
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish energy tech start-up Vensum has raised a €3.8 million funding round which will see it further develop its power converter technology.

title: How VOOL is solving the last-mile energy grid problem
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, almost all automakers aim to transition most, if not all, of their automotives to electric vehicles. However, the widespread adoption of electric vehicles contributes to an increase in overall electricity demand and highlights more significant vulnerabilities within the grid.

title: Exactly.ai secures $4.3M to develop GenAI for artists
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Generative AI start-up Exactly.ai has secured $4.3M for a generative model which allows artistic designs to be reproduced at scale and copyrighted by the original designer.

title: Swedish media management platform Mediatool fuels US expansion with a €7 million raise
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Swedish media management platform Mediatool announced a €7 million raise for its upcoming US expansion and that its opening a new office in New York in Q1 2024. It brings the company's funding to €9.5 million.

title: Matsmart-Motatos tackling food waste with €40M Investment led by Circularity Capital
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Circularity Capital led a €40 million growth capital round in Swedish company Matsmart-Motatos, a D2C e-commerce retailer of overstock dry foods and consumer products, with additional support from existing shareholders.

title: Giving the retail industry a fighting chance against theft, Everseen sees €65 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cork, Ireland-based Everseen has raised €65 million in a Series A funding round. The company provides AI-powered computer vision and automation services primarily to retailers, helping them keep an eye on inventory shrink, i.e. theft, and streamline overall operations. The new capital is aimed at helping the company further develop its technology offer and continue with expansion plans.

title: Pixis raises $85M in Series C1 funding for codeless AI infrastructure
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Pixis, a codeless AI infrastructure company focused on enabling brands to enhance performance marketing, has raised $85 million in its series C1 funding round.

title: DeepL secures unicorn valuation
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: DeepL, the Cologne,Germany-based deep learning in language translation startup that's giving Google a run for its money, today confirmed raising VC funds at a valuation north of $1 billion. (source TechCrunch)

title: Enabling voice-controlled payments, Turkey's Papara debuts accessible debit card
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Turkey-based neobank Papara is launching a new mobile-enabled debit card that allows visually impaired customers to hear the billing amount in retail stores using its voice point-of-sale terminals.

title: Asset management reporting SaaS Instinct Digital closes £5M Series A
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Instinct Digital, a software designed to streamline and automate key aspects of funds and investor reporting, has raised £5M in Series A funding, led by AlbionVC.

title: Floy's AI solution for radiology diagnostics secures €5.4M Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Floy, a Munich AI company empowering radiologists to deliver better diagnostics, closes a €5.4 million Seed funding round.

title: Optiml raises $4M Pre-Seed for ESG-compliant assets
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Optiml, a digital platform for Net Zero real estate investment and renovation planning, has closed a $4M pre-seed extension funding round. The round was led by BitStone Capital, and supported by KOMPAS VC.

title: Helsing raises €209M in Series B funding for AI Defencetech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Munich-based defence AI firm Helsing shared it has secured €209 million in Series B funding, solidifying its status as Europe's most well-funded defencetech startup and among the leading AI companies in the field.

title: Mistral AI confirms €385M Series A funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following last week's rumours of French generative AI startup Mistral AI close to closing a fresh €450 million investment deal that would provide the company with a valuation of $2 billion, the company today confirmed the figure at €385 million. Mistral AI declined to cite a valuation.

title: FantAstIque! French start-up Mistral AI raises a €105 million Seed round in its first month of existence
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Not a wet week in existence, French start-up Mistral AI has secured a Seed round of €105 million. The AI firm which was only set up a month ago, has reached a €240 million valuation as it (hopefully) becomes Europe's answer to Open AI

title: YouGov acquires KnowledgeHound, expanding data visualisation capabilities
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London headquartered research data and analytics technology firm YouGov has acquired KnowledgeHound, a Chicago-based data organisation and visualisation tool. The move by YouGov aims to further expand the capabilities of its data visualisation platform, Crunch. The terms of the deal remain undisclosed.

title: Aleph Alpha raises over $500M in Series B funding for European AI development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, German Generative AI company Aleph Alpha announced it has successfully raised more than $500 million in a Series B funding round.

title: 🎙️ The Drive at Five - The Tech.eu Summit wrap up, Flink holds Getir at bay, and AI believe in miracles
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Alright meow, listen up, because we've got a whole lotta content to recap and a whole lotta people to thank. If you missed us in Brussels earlier this week, you missed a day full of networking, great talks, and a party that saw music selections by our very own resident DJ, Mr. Robin Wauters.

title: HelloFresh SE announces €150M share buy-back: Key details
author: Fiona Alston
summary: HelloFresh SE has announced a buy-back in shares, up to €150 million, this also includes certain convertible bonds issued in May 2020. The share repurchase is based on the authorisation granted by the company’s annual general shareholders’ meeting on 12 May 2022.

title: EthonAI secures €15.3M Series A for AI-Driven manufacturing analytics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: EthonAI, a pioneer of AI-powered manufacturing analytics, today announced its €15.3 million Series A funding.

title: New investment fund welovefounders injects €35M into the B2B SaaS ecosystem
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees the launch of a €35 million investment fund with the charming moniker welovefounders.

title: Fourthline finalises €50 million to fight financial felons
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based fintech player Fourthline has raised €50 million in a new funding round that will see the company ramp up operations, ultimately seeking to become “the undisputed tech platform of choice to alleviate the compliance burden for European regulated institutions.”

title: Helping more creators find “riches in niches”, Creative Fabrica raises $61 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based social platform for crafters and designers Creative Fabrica has raised $61 million in a growth round, combining venture and debt funding. The new capital is aimed at further building out the platform’s designer network, an expansion of its creative generative AI toolset, and promoting a recruitment drive that will see the addition of senior talent on a global scale. Since 2019 Creative Fabrica has raised $68.5 million.

title: Dutch renewable energy investor Return secures a second €100M growth equity investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Dutch renewable energy investor Return announced that it has recently closed a second €100 million growth equity investment.

title: The Netherlands’ SMART Photonics beams in €100 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Eindhoven-based independent foundry for Indium Phosphide photonic integrated circuits, which provide small-scale integration and high performance combined with low energy consumption SMART Photonics has secured €100 million in new funds.

title: Permia Sensing secures £150K for precision farming techniques in palm plantations
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: London-based agritech startup Permia Sensing has secured a £150,000 investment from the British Design Fund.

title: “Trust will make or break an organisation” - Chris Dimitriadis (Chief Global Strategy Officer, ISACA)
author: Tech.eu
summary: We recently caught up with Chris Dimitriadis, an international authority on cybersecurity and digital trust, at the recent ISACA Digital Trust World conference.

title: Humans.ai acquires blockchain innovator Starfish Technologies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Bucharest AI and blockchain technology provider Humans.ai, has acquired Starfish Technologies, inventor of TensorChain and part of Home of Prodigy, in a cash and shares deal.

title: SkyNRG raises €175M for sustainable aviation fuel development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees Amsterdam's sustainable aviation fuel company SkyNRG raise €175 million in funding.

title: Dutch IT services provider Conclusion completes €410 million refinancing round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Utrech-based business transformation and IT services provider Conclusion has completed a refinancing round that will see €410 million of operating capital aimed at international expansion plans beginning with the expansion of existing operations in South Africa and Portugal, as well as strengthening its position in the Netherlands.

title: Alinia AI raises $2.4M for safe deployment of generative AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Alinia AI, an alignment platform that enables companies to safely and controlled deploy generative AI, guided by their policies and business, has raised $2.4 million in Pre-Seed funding.

title: Cultural perspectives on robots: Friends, servants, or children?
author: Rafael Laguna de la Vera and Thomas Ramge
summary: In Japan, intelligent robots are viewed as friends. In the USA and China, they are seen as servants. And in Europe, they are often perceived as enemies. Culture shapes how we use, build, and regulate technology. But technology is a global phenomenon. So maybe we are better served if we all look at robots with a new, common perspective — what if we perceived them as if they were children?

title: Insurtech startup Flitter raises €3.5M for expansion and profitability by 2024
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Flitter, a Parisian insurtech startup specialising in pay-by-mile car insurance, has raised €3.5 million in a Seed funding round. The new investment is aimed at helping the company make new key hires and doubling the team size to 40.

title: Sopht raises €3.3M for energy reduction SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Sopht, a French software provider that analyses and optimises a companies’ compute usage, has raised a €3.3M round.

title: Turkish fintech Sipay secures $15M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Sipay, a Turkish fintech offering offline and online payment services, wallet services and host of a modular platform, has raised a $15M Series A round, which will be used to advance product development and local and international expansion.

title: Cambridge Future Tech announce $5M for early-stage deeptech startups
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cambridge Future Tech has raised $5M to support deeptech startups between pre-incorporation and pre-seed stages develop their businesses to attract Venture Capital.

title: UK startups trailing on net zero and responsible AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The percentage of start-ups measuring their carbon footprint has increased from 16 to 28 according to new data from ESG_VC. Data was collected from 587 start-ups backed by leading venture capital firms including Atomico, Molten, Beringea, Oxford Science Enterprises and Astanor.

title: Empowering change: Venture and growth investing for sustainability and societal impact
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The European tech ecosystem reached a combined market valuation of €3.5 trillion in Q1 2024, more than doubling in value over the past five years. This growth has been largely driven by venture capital. Currently, Europe has over 2,400 active VC firms, and European VC-backed startups have created 6.3 million jobs. Nearly 200 active unicorn companies have emerged in Europe, fostering innovation and positive impact across various industries.

title: Vay roll out remotely controlled vehicles in Belgium
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Teledriving startup Vay has announced the coming rollout of its remotely controlled vehicles in Belgium.

title: UK wealthech backed by Tom Blomfield looks to crowdfund £1m
author: John Reynolds
summary: A UK wealthtech targeting the mass affluent and backed by Monzo co-founder Tom Blomfield is returning to the crowdfunding market, looking to raise £1m.

title: Northern Data Group partners with NVIDIA to launch accelerator
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German compute provider Northern Data Group has launched its AI Accelerator. With partners including NVIDIA, HPE, Deloitte, Supermicro, and others, the Accelerator has been designed to expedite developments in AI hardware.

title: French EV charging startup Gireve raises €20M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Mobility startup Gireve has raised €20M for its European expansion from Partech.

title: Healthtech startup Cryogenx raises £800,000 for life-saving cooling device
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: London-based healthtech startup Cryogenx has secured a £150,000 investment from the British Design Fund.

title: These are the trends tech workers need to know about for 2024
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: It’s safe to say 2023 hasn’t been the best year for tech (or the easiest year for tech professionals).

title: mimic raises $2.5M to challenge US robotics dominance with AI-driven humanoid hands
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: mimic, a Swiss startup, has raised $2.5 million in Pre-Seed funding to challenge US dominance and join the robotics race to be the first to market a robotic arm and humanoid hand combination using AI.

title: Reliant AI emerges from stealth with $11.3M to transform life science data analysis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Reliant AI, a provider of gen AI-powered data analytics software, came out of stealth with $11.3 million in Seed funding.

title: Practice makes perfect as Zurich's Simulands receives €10 million
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Simulands, a Swiss creator of simulation devices for cardiovascular medicine, recently obtained €10 million to give cardiologists sound training that's appropriate for the mission-critical nature of their field.

title: Cleafy raises €10M to enhance its digital banking fraud prevention
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Cleafy, a Milanese technology company specialising in proactive fraud prevention for digital banking, has secured €10 million in funding.

title: Bumper bags €46M, Coatue calls it quits with European office, and a CES preview
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week our research tracked more than 25 tech funding deals worth over €582 million and over 5 exits and M&A transactions on the other end of the spectrum.

title: Electra raises €304M in record-breaking equity fundraising for its EV charging network
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, fast-charging EV network Electra announces a fundraising of €304 million, entirely in equity, a record amount in the charging sector. The company has raised nearly €600 million in capital in 3 years to deploy one of the first charging networks at the European level.

title: AI customer assistant provider Neople secures €6M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Netherlands-based Neople has raised €6M for its chatbot customer service ‘assistants’. The company will direct the funding towards international expansion and build an AI-training centre in Berlin.

title: Plancraft raises €12M Series A for craft industry digitalisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Hamburg-based company Plancraft has successfully closed a €12 million Series A financing round.

title: Ukrainian Venture Capital Association kickstarts $300M Fund of Funds
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Ukrainian Venture Capital and Private Equity Association (UVCA) has officially launched the Ukrainian Fund of Funds (FoF).

title: AI hyperscaler CoreWeave invests $2.2B to open three new European data centres
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI Hyperscaler CoreWeave, the AI HyperscalerTM, today announced it will invest $2.2 billion to expand and open three new data centres in continental Europe before the end of 2025.

title: Innovation at the heart of Europe: Austria's tech renaissance and global impact
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Austria's tech ecosystem characterizes a collaborative community of accelerators, incubators, and coworking spaces that provide essential resources and mentorship to budding entrepreneurs. Additionally, with its strategic location, excellent quality of life, and highly skilled workforce Austria becomes an attractive destination for tech talent from around the world.

title: Coboworx secures €11.4M to provide robotics to SMEs
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German B2B robotics startup coboworx has secured €11.4M to help companies integrate robotics into their digital architecture without prior robotics expertise.

title: HRtech Carv secures $10M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Amsterdam-based Carv has raised $10M to offload admin from recruiters following the launch of its recruitment platform in March. With the Seed funding, Carv aims to accelerate its growth and expand the capabilities of its platform into different domains of the recruitment life cycle.

title: Dreamcraft Ventures launches €66M fund for SaaS and fintech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Dreamcraft Ventures has closed its €66M Fund II to invest in B2B software companies.

title: Lilium needs to raise $250 million, Tencent puts up $100 million at first close
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Publicly listed electric vertical take-off and landing jet developer Lilium has announced plans to raise $250 million. According to an SEC filing, historic backer Tencent pre-funded the purchase of $100 million in shares, as well as committed to pre-fund the purchase of an additional $75 million in shares, contingent upon Lilium being able to secure a matching $75 million via "equity, debt or grants from certain third parties".

title: Aeropowder secures £150K investment for feather-based thermal packaging
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: West London materials innovation startup Aeropowder has secured a £150,000 investment from British Design Fund.

title: Linio Biotech raises €4.2M for tissue regeneration skincare
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees Finnish biotech growth company Linio Biotech raise €4.2 million, bringing its funding to over €9 million.

title: iwoca secures £270M in debt funding to support SME lending
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, SME lender iwoca announced a new £270 million package of debt funding, bringing the company's total gross investment to over £1 billion since its founding in 2012.

title: BeyondMath secures $8.5M for multiphysics simulation platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: BeyondMath, a leader in advanced engineering simulation, has raised $8.5M in Seed funding led by UP.Partners with significant participation from Insight Partners and InMotion Ventures, the investment arm of JLR. This funding supports BeyondMath's ambitious mission to reshape engineering practices globally with its AI-driven multiphysics simulation platform.

title: A deep dive into the European 'buy now, pay later' (BNPL) market
author: John Reynolds
summary: “You shouldn’t be using BNPL to buy a pizza,” says the CEO of French 'buy now, pay later' startup Alma, taking a pot-shot at rival players in one of the hottest areas of financial services right now.

title: Dance bags some groovy new investors and hits 10k members
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Berlin-based e-bike and e-moped subscription startup Dance has reached a 10,000-member milestone, within its first year, across Paris, Berlin, Hamburg, Munich, and Vienna. With the successful growth comes a host of new investors in the firm. Financial details were not disclosed but stepping up to back the mobility enterprise are 4P Capital, Giovanni Domenichini (GDTRE), Carl Pei (Nothing), Alex Asseily (Jawbone, Lilium), Mads Fosselius (Dixa), Simon Hähnel (Andhim).

title: ArK Kapital brings another €100 million aboard, now offering €400 million in financing as it expands to Germany
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Stockholm-based ArK Kapital has announced that it’s secured another €100 million in presumably debt funding from a rather secretive Swedish bank. Could this be the same operator that contributed €150 million back in July of ‘22? ArK is being rather tight-lipped about it, but the wording around the “who?” question was remarkably similar to the last time I asked.

title: Climate risk quantifier Mitiga bags €8M Series A extension
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Barcelona-based data analytics startup Mitiga has raised an €8M extension to its Series A funding in a round led by Elaia. Mitiga will use the Capital for its European expansion as new regulation mandates the disclosure of climate risk for companies across the EU.

title: Healthtech  startup Spike secures $3.5M Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Lithuanian B2B data tech startup Spike has successfully closed an oversubscribed $3.5 million Seed.

title: StructureFlow raises $6M Series A for accessible data visualisation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based data visualisation platform StructureFlow has closed a $6M Series A funding round, which will be reinvested in product development and international expansion. The company has now received $15M in total.

title: Coreweave invests £1B in UK data centres
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Cloud provider Coreweave has announced that it will dedicate £1B to developing its UK operations. The company plans to open two UK data centres in 2024 and more in the coming years.

title: Austrian startup Hololight raises $12M to accelerate XR streaming for industrial applications
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Austrian extended reality (XR) for enterprise startup Hololight announced it has secured a further $12 million in funding to accelerate the development of its XR streaming platform, Hololight Hub.

title: CapitalG makes series A bet on Austrian/British AI assistant startup Magic.dev
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: CapitalG, the innovation fund linked to Google owner Alphabet, has invested in a $23 million series A round raised by Magic.dev, an Austrian/British-founded natural language AI assistant project for software engineers.

title: Ex-Slush leaders' startup Realm secures €1.7M for AI knowledge search
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Realm, a Finnish startup whose founders include ex-Slush leaders Miika Huttunen and Mikko Mäntylä, has raised €1.7M to help companies search their knowledge with AI.

title: Overcast HQ raises $1.2M to bolster video content management and business intelligence
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Dublin-based tech firm Overcast HQ has announced a $1.2 million bridging round to help the world’s largest brands and broadcasters manage terabytes of video content with AI and a suite of cloud solutions.

title: Neobanks across Europe fatten up as VCs demand profits
author: John Reynolds
summary: Across Europe, the emergence of neobanks has been one of the landmark disruptions to financial services over the past eight years.

title: Goldman and Co. aren’t sweatin’ $110 million in new round for Fever at $1.8 billion valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Just over one year since hauling down over $227 million in a Series E round, one that saw Fever obtain a valuation of over $1 billion, New York City-based, but with strong Spanish roots live entertainment discovery platform Fever has ordered up a new ticket in the form of $110 million.

title: Italian vertical farming startup Planet Farms secures $40M at $500M valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Despite funding for vertical farms all but dropping off a cliff, Milan-based operator Planet Farms has recently announced the raise of $40 million.

title: Spanish startup Jeff never closed a €90 million round, hasn’t paid employees for nine months, and is now filing for bankruptcy
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Valencia-based entrepreneurship-for-all startup Jeff has voluntarily filed for bankruptcy according to a report first filed by Jesus Martinez at La Información.

title: Strolll's neurorehabilitation platform partners with US' Cleveland Clinic
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Strolll, an augmented reality (AR) digital therapeutics software for neurorehabilitation in Parkinson’s disease, has announced a $3 million collaboration with Cleveland Clinic. Through an exclusive software license agreement, Cleveland Clinic will become a shareholder in Strolll.

title: Generative AI is bringing the biggest disruption to film making in 100 years
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: My interest is piqued when someone tells me that the most significant disruption in the film industry in 100 years is happening. And it's all thanks to generative AI.

title: Ascento raises $4.3M to launch Ascento Guard, an autonomous security robot
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swiss robotics startup Ascento has launched a new robot into the workforce. It is an autonomous security patrolling robot called Ascento Guard and its purpose is to fill the labour shortage of security guards – which has seen a 52 percent decrease in many countries.

title: Electra raises €304M in record-breaking equity fundraising for its EV charging network
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, fast-charging EV network Electra announces a fundraising of €304 million, entirely in equity, a record amount in the charging sector. The company has raised nearly €600 million in capital in 3 years to deploy one of the first charging networks at the European level.

title: Want to live longer? This Berlin startup aims to bring you back from the dead
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Think of human longevity startups, and you might think of companies focused on gene therapy, personalised medicine, gerontology, or treatment for conditions like cancer.

title: VanMoof: The more they sell, the more they lose
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Amsterdam-based developer and designer of urban e-bikes VanMoof is facing a financial conundrum. According to 2021 sales figures crunched by Dutch financial media outlet FD, the cost of selling a VanMoof bike is greater than that of the purchase price, resulting in a gross margin loss of €11.9 million, a figure up from a loss of €6.7 million just one year prior.

title: Nova Carbon raises €1.4M to make carbon fibre last longer
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Climate Tech Nova Carbon have raised €1.4M for technology that enables the recycling of carbon fibre.

title: Zenobē secures $522.7M to boost UK's electric bus rollout
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Zenobē, a provider of electric vehicle fleet and battery storage services, has secured an additional $522.7 million in financing to accelerate the rollout of electric buses across the UK. The company previously raised £147 million in debt financing in January,  bringing Zenobē's funding to over £1.9 billion.

title: HRtech Sesame raises €23M for global expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: HR software company Sesame has raised €23M from GP Bullhound and existing investor PSG.

title: Ponzi 2.0: The wild story of an investment into an Estonian startup that doesn’t exist
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Last week Hedonova, a Paris-based hedge fund, announced an equity investment of $16 million in Series A funding of an Estonian startup called Carbonomy. Where things get wild is that Carbonomy does not exist, and the funding round never occurred.

title: Procuretech startup akirolabs raises $5M Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today akirolabs, a Berlin-based procuretech startup, announced that it has raised $5 million in its recent Seed funding round.

title: Lithuania's HeavyFinance ready to play the field in Europe with €3 million Seed round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Vilnius-based sustainable agri-finance marketplace HeavyFinance has raised a €3 million seed round to fuel an expansion and double its head count.

title: EIC-backed Genomika gets €5M to 'expand the facilities' of the Lithuanian start-up
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Lithuanian deep-tech biotechnology company Genomika has bagged itself €5 million in funding. The EIC-backed start-up, which is based in Tech-Park Kaunas, says the funding came from ‘the EU, Switzerland and the UK to revolutionise genetics’ stating 'we are poised to revolutionise data storage, drive genomics advancements, and foster unparalleled collaboration among Europe's brightest minds'.

title: BIOPHTA secures €6.5M Seed funding for eye disease treatment tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: BIOPHTA, a preclinical biotech company developing technology for the treatment of eye diseases, has just closed a €6.5 million Seed round to bring its patented technology to clinical development.

title: CAST AI raises $35M Series B to optimise Kubernetes and slash cloud spend
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Miami/Vilnius-based Kubernetes cost optimisation platform CAST AI announced a successful closing of a $35 million Series B round.

title: Cutting Kubernetes costs in half, Cast AI nets $20 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Miami/Vilnius-based Cast AI has raised $20 million in a new investment round that will see the company further establish itself in the cloud optimisation space as well as build out new offerings.

title: Lithuania’s PVcase secures $100 million, aims to cut solar project design process from weeks to roughly 20 minutes
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Vilnius-based PVcase (PhotoVoltaic computer aided solar engineering) has secured $100 million in a new funding round. Aiming to streamline and homongenise the process for engineers working in the solar industry, PVcase has earmarked a portion of the new funds for continued M&A activities. Since late 2018, PVcase has raised $123 million.

title: Piclo raises new funding from EDP for energy asset trading
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Portuguese EDP Ventures has made an investment of an undisclosed amount in Piclo. Piclo’s software enables buyers and sellers of electricity capacity to trade. EDP Ventures co-led the funding round, together with existing Piclo investors Clean Growth Fund (CGF) and Future Energy Ventures (FEV) ahead of a larger round expected later in 2024 and the funds will be used for Piclo’s global expansion into new parts of the United States and Australia.

title: NordVPN's parent company, Nord Security, valued at $3B after latest funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Nord Security, the Vilnius-based firm most noted for its VPN service NordVPN, has taken on external funding for only the second time in its 11-year-long history, today announcing the injection of $100 million at a $3 billion valuation; a figure nearly double that of just one and a half years prior.

title: Charac raises £1.2M to alleviate operational burdens for pharmacies
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Charac, an NHS-integrated pharmacy app designed to lessen independent community pharmacies’ operational burdens, has raised £1.2 million in debt and equity financing.

title: SME Finance’s funding pot grows with an extra €100 million credit from Fasanara Capital
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The Lithuanian fintech SME Finance's pot got a bit bigger as it secured an extra credit of €100 million credit from London-based Fasanara Capital. The brings Fasanara's total commitment to the lending platform to €240 million.

title: Meatable can now transform cultivated cells into sausages in a record four days
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Reinforcing my view that the Netherlands is Europe’s frontrunner to get cell-cultivated meat to market,  Meatable announced this week that it has reached an important milestone in its efforts to produce cultivated meat at scale.

title: Meatly unveils the world's first cultivated chicken pet food
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, cell-cultivated meat company Meatly announced that it has created the world’s first cans of pet food containing cultivated chicken as the protein source.

title: Portugal's tech ecosystem: Innovation amidst tradition
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Amidst a backdrop of rich culture and scenic beauty, Portugal has emerged as a dynamic hub for entrepreneurial ventures, drawing in visionaries, investors, and talent from around the globe.

title: fundcraft raises €5M Series A transform asset management infrastructure
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: fundcraft, a provider of digital infrastructure for asset management, has raised €5 million Series A.

title: WeTrack proved a good bet for Foresight, providing ‘attractive return’ it was looking for
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based WeTrack, a sports and events management software platform, was successfully acquired last month by Momentus Technologies. Foresight’s Thames Ventures funds - previously managed by Downing LLP - first invested in WeTrack in 2015, and today it has announced the exit has given investors a 2.8x return.

title: Hamburg unicorn 1KOMMA5° raises further funds for carbon neutral energy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Hamburg carbon-neutral energy systems provider 1KOMMA5° confirmed closing an undisclosed double-digit million Euro deal with VC firm 2150. The company previously raised €630 million in funding and became a unicorn in June this year after less than two years in operation.

title: Lun giving heat pump installers the tools to get on with it, with €10.3 million raise
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish climate tech start-up Lun raises €10.3 million to ‘decarbonise European homes’.

title: Swiss start-up DePoly raises $13.8 million to scale its operations converting plastics and polyester textiles back to raw materials
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swiss start-up DePoly converts PET plastics and polyester textiles back to their main raw materials. The climate tech is reacting to the waste plastic issue where only clean plastics and sorted waste is recycled. Its energy efficient chemical recycling technology requires none of the ‘preparations’ before recycling products.

title: Scurri acquires HelloDone to streamline deliveries with GenAI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Delivery management platform Scurri has acquired HelloDone, the UK-based GenAI provider for retailers and brands.

title: Former Passion Capital's Malin Posern joins Project A to focus on UK, Nordic startups
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Malin Posern joins early-stage tech VC Project A to head up its London office as Partner and Managing Director. Posern will be returning to her Nordic roots as she concentrates her efforts on UK and Nordic tech startups.

title: Norwegian solar firm Otovo secures €40M to boost sales volume, targets profitability
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oslo-based residential solar and battery installations marketplace Otovo has raised €40 million in a private shares placement. The new capital is aimed at providing Otovo with a path to profitability by growing sales volume, optimising operational costs, and monetising subscription assets

title: Geneva-based Giano Capital launches a secondary market fund – a €50 million fund for later-stage companies in the European tech and digital space
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Geneva-based Giano Capital has launched a secondary market fund. The €50 million is dedicated to late-stage companies in the European tech and digital space. Founded by serial entrepreneur Alberto Chalon and Andreas Wiele, who is from a media and tech executive background, the fund will invest in up to fifteen European companies with ticket sizes ranging from €2 million to €25 million, 'including co-investments which will be offered to its Limited Partners to maximise returns'.

title: Logically acquires Insikt AI to boost intelligence operations
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Misinformation fighting company Logicallyl has announced the acquisition of Barcelona-based AI company Insikt AI today.

title: Swiss startup Tune Insight secures $3.4M funding for privacy-preserving machine learning
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today confidential collaborative analytics and privacy-preserving machine learning startup Tune Insight announced a $3.4m funding round.

title: Technique Solaire's €200M investment boosts solar and biogas infrastructure
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Technique Solaire, a French outfit engaged in the distribution of photovoltaic energy for individuals and businesses, has raised €200 million in a new funding round.

title: A/O's latest research shows investment in built world climatetech remains overall resilient
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, sustainable proptech VC investor A/O released its latest research paper— State of built world climate tech, which tracks core innovation trends throughout 2023.

title: What the state of investment in 2023 means for investors eyeing 2024 opportunities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This year, Venture Capital firm Atomico released the ninth edition of its annual 'State of European Tech' report.

title: Fidelity leads $52M funding for Greenly's carbon accounting tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French carbon accounting startup Greenly has announced a $52 million Series B funding round led by Fidelity International Strategic Ventures, two years after a successful $23 million Series A.

title: bNear, the virtual office keeping remote employees close to their workmates, raises €1 million in funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: German start-up bNear has raised 'just over' €1 million in funding for its virtual office solution which fully integrates with Microsoft Teams. The solution was developed to bring a virtual workspace to remote teams for collaboration, hangouts and a general 'in the office' vibe.

title: Calico Biosystems raises €156K for anti-cancer drug development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss medtech company Calico Biosystems has raised CHF 150,000 (€156,000) in funding from Venture Kick.

title: SCRYPT raises $5M to expand crypto asset services
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Crypto-asset fin services provider SCRYPT has announced it has raised $5 million. The firm is also pleased to announce that it has doubled its client book and seen trading volume increase 18 times year on year.

title: HRtech startup Coverflex raises €15 million, takes Italy’s buoni pasto market
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Portuguese hrtech startup Coverflex has raised €15 million in a Series A funding round that will see the company launch its compensation solution in Italy as well as strengthen its position in Portugal.

title: Belgium's Azumuta bags €2.8M for international growth of manufacturing process management solution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Ghent-based Azumuta is tackling manufacturing shop floor issues caused by poor process management. It offers a software solution that supports employees at different levels in the production process and offers the management team a better view of their company’s performance on the shop floor streamlining work instructions, training, and audits.

title: OneThird 'spoiled' in €2.75 million late seed funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Enschede-based OneThird announced it has raised €2.75 million in a late-seed funding round which will help scale its tech and enter new markets, supporting fresh food supply chains in Europe and the US.
