title: Gaming revenue growth platform SuperScale scales up with $5.4 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Bratislava-based revenue growth engine for the games industry SuperScale has raised $5.4 million in a Series A funding round. Having already established partnerships with EA, Big Fish Games, Google, and LEGO, the company intends to use the new capital to ramp up both its product lineup and geographic reach.

title: $522.7M for fleet electrification, €55M hardtech VC, and Europe’s 1st black solo VC GP
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 60 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Ability AI raises $1.1M for autonomous marketing AI agent
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ability AI, a Ukrainian-founded martech startup specializing in full-cycle paid marketing automation with the help of autonomous AI agents, announced today that it has raised $1.1 million in pre-seed funding.

title: Leeds-based photonic chip company Optalysys raises £21 million to unlock its Fully Homomorphic Encryption process
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Photonic chip maker Optalysys has raised a £21 million Series A funding which will see it ‘advance its Enable photonic computing technology to unlock a new form of secure processing known as Fully Homomorphic Encryption (FHE)’.

title: Investment metrics platform Bounce Watch's Pre-Seed funding brings its valuation to €2.5M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Amsterdam-based startup Bounce Watch, founded in November 2023 by Cem Ötkün and Sedat Yusuf Ergüneş, has successfully closed its Pre-Seed investment round, reaching a valuation of €2.5 million.

title: Belfast “hidden gem” for startups, says debt market analytics startup co-founder
author: John Reynolds
summary: London, Berlin, Paris, and Amsterdam might be the cities that most people think of as hotbeds of European startup culture.

title: Former Revolut product lead's startup, Apron, secures $15M for invoice solutions
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Apron, a London-based fintech that addresses the pains SMB owners and their finance teams face in the sorting, paying, and reconciling of invoices, has raised $15 million in a Series A funding round.

title: Aviation climate tech Estuaire raises €2.2M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Paris-based Climate Tech startup Estuaire, which offers a data platform for airlines, airports, and aviation financiers, has closed a Seed round of €2.2M, led by Climate Tech VC firm Satgana. The investor lineup includes Safran Corporate Ventures, XAnge, and AFI Ventures, the early-stage impact arm of Ventech.

title: Virta plugged into €85 million, Energy Dome closed €40 million, and more than €1.3 billion was invested in European Tech last week
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 95 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Enpal secured €430 million debt round, Pigment picked up $88 million, and more than €1.1 billion was invested in European Tech last week
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €1.1 billion (debt and equity), and over 20 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Valpas raises €4M Seed for pesticide-free bed bug solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Pest control startup Valpas has secured €4 million in Seed funding.

title: Dutch fintech Klearly raises €2.1 million and officially launches its payments app in the Netherlands
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Amsterdam-based payments app, aimed at SMEs, Klearly has raised €2.1 million in pre-seed funding and has officially launched its app in the Netherlands.

title: Most European AI founders had "no exposure to AI 18 months before ChatGPT", says European fintech boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Many founders of European AI startups “just want to make some quick money” and had no exposure to the space 18 months before the launch of ChatGPT, according to a European fintech founder’s withering assessment of the space.

title: Romanian FintechOS secures $60M for banking software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Romanian FintechOS has raised a $60M Series B round for its end-to-end financial product management platform.

title: From months to minutes: OASYS NOW streamlines patient recruitment for clinical trials
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Bringing new drugs to market is no easy task. 80 per cent of the clinical trials with patients are either delayed or cancelled because they cannot find the right patients in time. This means many potentially life-changing — or life-saving — drugs don't see the light of day because researchers cannot find patients to participate in the drug trials.

title: Estonia: A dynamic hub for technology and entrepreneurship
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Fueled by a forward-thinking government and a vibrant startup culture, Estonia has earned global recognition for its advancements in technology and digital governance. The country's commitment to digital transformation is evident in initiatives like e-Residency, which enables entrepreneurs worldwide to establish and manage EU-based businesses online.

title: Labour Party recognises fintech as one of "jewels in the UK PLC crown", says fintech VC fund boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: The Labour Party recognises fintech as one of the “jewels in the UK PLC crown”, according to the boss of Europe’s leading listed VC fund.

title: "This is the first of many minority funds,” says Europe’s first black solo VC GP
author: John Reynolds
summary: The first black solo general partner (GP) of a European venture capital firm says that more “minority funds” will follow suit.

title: Sirona Technologies raises €6M to boost direct air capture tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Direct air capture (DAC) startup Sirona Technologies has raised a €6 million Seed round.

title: Barcelona-based Sateliot launches satellites with SpaceX
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Barcelona-based spacetech Sateliot has announced that it will partner with SpaceX to launch four Satellites in July to enter commercial phase.

title: Viio secures €3.3M funding for its software license management platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Spend management platform Viio has raised over €3.3 million in funding.

title: Deloitte legaltech spinout Moonlit secures investment from Curiosity VC
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Cross-border legal research and monitoring platform Moonlit.ai today announced its successful spinout from Deloitte into an independent company and an investment from Curiosity VC.

title: Izix's sustainable parking platform receives €3M boost
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today proptech company Izix raised €3 million in equity to advance its space management solution for office parking lots and mobility.

title: Hive Technologies raises €28.2M for operations platform expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Operations platform Hive Technologies (Hive) has raised a €28.2 million Series A extension at an increased valuation.

title: Loyalty app backed by Lloyds and Barclays closes, leading to  46 redundancies
author: John Reynolds
summary: A loyalty app backed by Lloyds and Barclays is closing, leading to 46 redundancies.

title: Bridgepoint backs CMS platform LumApps
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Eurazeo and its partners have sold their stakes in LumApps, a CMS platform, to Bridgepoint Capital.

title: Climate X raises $18M to assess climate risk for property investors
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Climate risk intelligence company Climate X has raised $18M to accelerate its global expansion and help the world’s leading financial organisations price the impact of climate change across their physical asset portfolios.

title: Amsterdam's Yondr to develop major hyperscale datacentre in Malaysia with up to $150M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Amsterdam hyperscale data centre group Yondr has secured a loan facility of up to $150 million to develop Malaysia's largest hyperscale data centre campus.

title: Libattion secures €14M for upcycled EV battery tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Libattion, a Swiss company offering stationary energy storage solutions from upcycled electric vehicle batteries, has secured €14 million in funding.

title: Landytech raises £5M for portfolio management platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Investment management platform Landytech has raised £5M from CIBC Innovation Banking.

title: Char.gy raises €118.2M, Sidekick Health acquires PINK!, and Denmark's thriving tech ecosystem
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Vizzu raises $1.5M for data storytelling tool
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Data storytelling startup Vizzu has raised $1.5 million and is beta-launching its animated data storytelling tool.

title: OneThird 'spoiled' in €2.75 million late seed funding round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Enschede-based OneThird announced it has raised €2.75 million in a late-seed funding round which will help scale its tech and enter new markets, supporting fresh food supply chains in Europe and the US.

title: UK legaltech startup Orbital Witness offers world first "AI reliance" insurance for accuracy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-based legaltech startup Orbital Witness has announced a pioneering partnership with First Title Insurance, part of the First American Financial Corporation.

title: Balderton introduces parental support for founders
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Balderton is introducing parental support for founders, becoming the first VC firm to offer free access to Cooper Parenting.

title: MiddleGame Ventures launch third fintech fund with €52M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Luxembourg-based investment firm MiddleGame Ventures has announced the initial close of its third fund, which will focus on early-stage investments. The fund will invest in companies across legacy and emerging financial sectors, including adjacent deep-tech and cybersecurity sectors. The new fund is already active in the market.

title: German IoT startup Packwise secures funds to scale its industrial tech to North America
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Dresden-founded IoT startup Packwise has raised an undisclosed seven-figure amount to drive upcoming internationalisation to North America.

title: Purple Ventures launches €40M fund for early-stage software startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Czech VC Purple Ventures has launched a €40 million fund to invest in early-stage startups over the next four years.

title: C-Questra and RepAir Carbon launch EU's first onshore direct air capture and storage project
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: C-Questra, a Dutch carbon storage startup, has joined forces with US company RepAir Carbon to develop the European Union's first onshore Direct Air Capture and Storage (DACS) project in France.

title: Novo receives a €1M boost to accelerate building decarbonisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Berlin-based proptech startup Novo has announced a €1 million pre-seed funding round to speed up the decarbonisation of real estate at scale.

title: DTCP closes $450M fund for Series B to D
author: Lucy Adams
summary: DTCP, an independent investment management firm focused on digitization and automation, has closed its DTCP Growth Equity III Fund and an initial closing of its additional B2B early stage investment fund at a total amount of $450m. The fundraising follows predecessors DTCP Growth Equity Funds, GE I (launched in 2015) and GE II (launched in 2018).

title: Softonic secures its SaaS market with leader
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Softonic, the world's leading platform for secure software downloads, has acquired Appvizer, a platform specializing in B2B software recommendations. The acquisition allows Softonic to diversify its product and access a broader range of clients.

title: Crossbeam acquires French company Reveal
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Philadelphia-based ecosystem-led growth platform Crossbeam announced today that Reveal, the Paris-based nearbound revenue platform, would be joining forces with the company in an all-stock transaction.

title: Daytona secures $5M for open-source SaaS customisation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Croatian-founded Daytona, a platform that manages open-source development environments, has raised $5 million in seed funding. Led by Upfront Ventures with participation from existing investor 500 Emerging Europe, this new capital will enable Daytona to accelerate the expansion of streamlined development environments to developers. The company will use the funds for product development and hiring for new marketing, sales and engineering roles.

title: SkyCell secures $116M for medical supply chain management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: SkyCell, the Swiss-based pharmatech company, has closed its $116M Series D. The investment will be used to expand SkyCell’s global footprint with a key focus on growth across the US and Asia.

title: Family fintech app Bling raises $12M Series A funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin family fintech app Bling has successfully completed a Series A equity funding round, raising $12 million.

title: World's first contraceptive app, Natural Cycles, raises $55M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Natural Cycles, a women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, announced today the closure of a $55 million Series C financing round. This brings the company's funding to over $95 million.

title: Food retailtech Rohlik secures $170M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Czech food retailtech and online grocery company Rohlik Group today announces it has successfully raised $170 million in fresh growth capital, bringing its funding to over $780 million.

title: Synthflow raises $7.4M seed for AI-generated phone calls
author: Lucy Adams
summary: AI voice tech startup Synthflow AI today announced $7.4M in seed funding, led by Singular, with participation from existing investor Atlantic Labs and investors including the founders of Krisp AI.

title: MarketSizer raises €1M Pre-Seed to enhance real-time business intelligence platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Irish market intelligence platform, MarketSizer, has today announced the closing of its Pre-Seed funding, totalling €1 million. The platform provides SaaS companies with instant access to precise and actionable insights.

title: Turkish food delivery giant Getir raises $250M and restructures into two businesses
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Turkish food delivery giant Getir has received $250 million in investment led by Abu Dhabi wealth fund Mubadala Investment Co.

title: Cowboy shows compelling resilience in a turbulent e-bike market
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: I quite like a pun, and when the CEO of an e-bike company describes their year as "a hell of a ride", you know I am all for it.

title: Former Tesla engineer leads Belgium's first DAC technology climatetech startup Sirona Technologies
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Joining the ranks of European climatetech companies including Switzerland’s Climeworks and Italy’s CarpeCarbon, Belgium now has its first entry into the first of startups leveraging direct air capture technology to suck carbon out of the air in Sirona Technologies.

title: Vertus Energy raises €8.75M Seed for Waste-to-X biotech solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Industrial biotech company Vertus Energy has raised a €8.75 million Seed funding round.

title: Apheros raises $1.85M for metal foam cooling tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss deeptech deep tech startup Apheros today announced a $1.85 million funding round.

title: Resourcify raises €14M to expand waste management SaaS across Europe
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Resourcify, a Hamburg-based startup operating in the waste management and recycling arena has raised €14 million in a Series A funding round. The company intends to use the investment to further enhance its SaaS offering in tandem with expanding its footprint across the UK and Continental Europe.

title: Ghent-based Aikido Security secures €5M in seed funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Aikido Security, a Ghent-based outfit working on developer-friendly software security solutions has today announced the raise of €5 million in a Seed funding round. The investment will be used to onboard product, development, marketing, and sales team members, as well as continue to strengthen the company’s market position in Europe and North America.

title: Guide: What awaits us at the 3-day Tech.eu Summit London 2024?
author: Gözde Ulukan
summary: The Tech.eu Summit London 2024, which we have been waiting for a long time, is now only a week away. In these days when the countdown is accelerating, the excitement of all of us has increased considerably.

title: LiveEO secures €25M to analyse climate data from satellites
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Berlin-based LiveEO has raised €25M to leverage AI-powered satellite data for critical infrastructure and climate risk management.

title: TrusTrace joins the Trace4Value project, improving circular traceability in fashion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Traceability is fast becoming a regulatory reality in many industries, from construction to battery manufacturing, in an effort to increase sustainability and circularity, trace source materials, close material recycling loops, and formalise material end-of-life management over time.

title: Will EU blockchain investment and incoming EV battery passports finally commercialise blockchain mobility use cases?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Right now, two key priorities preoccupy the minds of automakers developing vehicles to take us from now into the future. Safety always comes first. But the second is the transition to all-electric vehicles and carbon reduction in line with EU regulations. And the secret weapon for greater vehicle sustainability just might involve blockchain technology.

title: Molten Ventures acquires Forward Partners in £41M deal, announces raise of £50M
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Molten Ventures has acquired London LSE-listed VC firm Forward Partners in a deal valued at £41.4 million.

title: Iris.ai raises €7.64M to enhance  its AI engine to accelerate scientific research
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Iris.ai provider of an AI engine for scientific text understanding, has announced iits latest funding round, raising €7.64 million.

title: Heex Technologies raises €6M for smart data filtering at the edge
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French startup Heex Technologies announced that it has raised €6 million this week.

title: Cowboy goes Dutch with its latest e-bike, the Cruiser
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Belgian e-bike company Cowboy has launched a new bike, the Cruiser - an answer to the request for a Dutch styled bike.

title: Cowboy brings AdaptivePower to its ebikes and shows why community building is critical to D2C sales
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Belgium ebike company Cowboy launched AdaptivePower, a technology that senses changes in the rider's environmental conditions in real-time, adjusting the power depending on the hill, wind or weight.

title: FirstVet secures €20M Series C for digital pet healthcare
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Pet healthcare company FirstVet today announced the successful close of a €20 million Series C funding round.

title: Prewave raises €63M to enhance supply chain sustainability and compliance
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI sustainability, risk and compliance platform Prewave has raised €63 million in its Series B funding round, bring this compay's funding to over €90 million.

title: London AI startup TitanML bags $2.8M launching AI-Powered LLM tool Titan Takeoff
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based AI startup TitanML has raised $2.8 million in a Pre-Seed funding round and launched its solution Titan Takeoff, an AI-powered tool to make large language model (LLM) deployment take off.

title: Visma's valuation skyrockets to €19B with new investments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Norwegian cloud software provider Visma announced multi-billion euro investments that bring the company’s value to €19 billion.

title: iwoca secures £200M debt facility to help bridge SME funding gap
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based small business lender iwoca has secured a new £200 million debt facility via Barclays and Värde Partners. The move arrives following an extension of its existing funding line provided by neobank Bunq's sole external backer, Pollen Street Capital in January of this year from £125 million to £170 million. The SME lender now brings its total debt financing to over £850 million.

title: Caresyntax raises $180M for AI surgery, $40M fund for early-stage crypto projects, and Romania's booming tech ecosystem
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 50 tech funding deals worth over €354 million, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Morphoses secures €2.1M in Pre-Seed funding for soft skills development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today London-based startup Morphoses successfully completed an oversubscribed pre-seed funding round, securing €2.1 million in investments.

title: Terra Quantum announces hybrid quantum computing collaboration with NVIDIA
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Terra Quantum, a quantum services company with headquarters in Germany and Switzerland, has today announced a collaboration with NVIDIA aimed at fostering the development of quantum-accelerated applications.

title: London-based property fintech LendInvest secures £500 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based online marketplace for property finance LendInvest has secured £500 million in Post-IPO debt financing from Chetwood Financial. The investment will serve as additional working capital aimed at accelerating growth.

title: Abound is bound to offer loans with £500+ million in new capital
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based consumer loans-focused fintech Abound has raised over £500 million in a new funding round. According to the company, this working capital will be used to “turbocharge growth of affordable loans” in the UK market. To date, the startup has raised approximately £540 million.

title: Sweden's QA.tech raises $1M for AI tool to speed up code testing
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Developers may just get some of their precious coding time back as QA.tech is using AI to speed up the code testing process. The Swedish startup’s SaaS tool has been designed to mock a real tester searching for any issues in webpage code. It can test features like the shopping cart, search functions, and cookies banners.

title: Founded by former Monzo growth specialists, Cordless raises $2.3 million to augment customer support teams with AI
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Cordless has raised $2.3 million in a seed funding round led by Fly Ventures, with Passion Capital, Entrepreneur First, and TrueSight participating alongside angel investors including Renaud Visage, (Co-founder of Eventbrite), Tom Blomfield (Founder of Monzo), Ian Hogarth (Founder of Songkick) and Eamon Jubbawy (Founder of Onfido).

title: Investors pour €500 million into Powerfield's solar park campaign
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Powerfield, a Netherlands solar company that develops, builds and manages "virtual power stations", connecting solar farms to external storage and EV charging, has clinched a €500 million structured equity and portfolio financing (source - Silicon Canals).

title: Spain's Banktrack secures €2M Seed round
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Banktrack, a Spanish treasury management software for SMEs, has extended its funding round to €2M.

title: Europe’s gender pay gap is 26 percent in the tech industry, where does your country rank?
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: From International Women’s Day to the EU’s Equal Pay Day, conversations surrounding the gender pay gap aren’t a recent development.

title: Lakestar closes $600M Funds, aims to strengthen Europe's innovation ecosystem
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, investment firm Lakestar closed its latest funds, Lakestar Early IV and Lakestar Growth II, for around $600 million to inject new capital into the next generation of European startups, bringing Lakestar's assets under management to €2 billion.

title: Insempra secures $20M Series A to advance bio-based alternatives in manufacturing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German biotech Insempra has successfully completed a $20 million Series A financing round.

title: Reactional and Hipgnosis join forces to bring sweet music to the gaming world
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swedish start-up Reactional Music and London-based Hipgnosis Song Management have announced a partnership which will see gamers have access to a large catalogue of global number one hits, to personalise their gaming experience.

title: UK startup CarCloud raises £425k in Seedrs investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK car finance platform CarCloud, has completed its Seedrs investment round, raising £425,000 and exceeding its £325,000 target.

title: myenergi secures another £30M for smart home energy solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, British smart home energy technology manufacturer myenergi, secured a £30 million investment.

title: Project 3 Mobility raises €100M for autonomous robotaxi development but progress remains unclear.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Croatian company Project 3 Mobility announced that it has successfully closed its Series A investment round, growing the total amount raised from private investors to €100 million.

title: Harriet, the AI assistant transforming HR teams gets £1.2M funding boost
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today HR AI startup Harriet announced it has raised a £1.2 million Pre-Seed round

title: Iceland's PLAIO raises €4.3M for AI-driven pharma supply chain solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Iceland-founded AI-assisted decision support platform for the pharmaceutical industry PLAIO has raised €4.3 million in an oversubscribed round.

title: SeaBeLife secures €1.2M to develop drug candidates intended to block cell necrosis
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French biotech firm SeaBeLife has raised €1.2 million in additional seed funding to fund the further development of its drug candidates for acute liver disease and eye disorders as well as allow it to expand its team. The company intends to hire ‘several high-level specialists’ as it looks to launch a trial in severe hepatitis next year.

title: 70,000 attendees to attend Web Summit but Monzo and Stripe execs absent from speaker lineup
author: John Reynolds
summary: Europe’s biggest tech conference kicks off today in Lisbon, welcoming tens of thousands of the great and good from the tech world, but fintech leaders and major sponsors will be missing, following the controversial comments made by its founder.

title: European startups tap into digital twin potential for real-world impact
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the last decade, digital twins — virtual or digital representations of a physical object, system, or process in real-time — have been used for real-time data monitoring, simulations, predictive analytics, and collaboration.

title: CarbonPool, the world's first carbon credit insurance company, raises $12M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: CarbonPool is set to be the world’s first insurance company with a carbon credit balance sheet. Today it announced the closure of a $12 million funding round.

title: Iceland's Flygildi emerges from stealth with a birdlike drone and a $2.2M Seed round
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Is it a bird? Is it a plane? Nope, it’s a drone that flies like a bird, and it has been developed in stealth by Islandic drone startup Flygildi. The UAV has been created with military action in mind but will also be available on the civilian market. With wings replacing the rotators, the patent-protected design that can be designed to mimic a wide range of avian species is called Silent Flyer, so we can only imagine these birdlike drones are indeed silent. They can carry surveillance equipment and small payloads.

title: Soleadify is now Veridion, with $6 million further to its name
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Soleadify, the Romania-based "firmographic" database operator dealing with over 80 million company profiles, updated weekly, is getting a brand makeover.

title: Romanian startup Creatopy raises $10M for creative ad production efficiency
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today creative automation platform Creatopy announced a $10M Series A from 3VC and Point Nine.

title: 1X to scale android production following $100M funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Norwegian AI and robotics company 1X has today announced the successful completion of an EQT Ventures-led $100 million Series B funding round that will see the company scale production and deployment of its androids.

title: Italy’s Mediobanca and Founders Factory launch venture studio and accelerator
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In yet another boost to the Italian tech ecosystem and following the announcement of London’s Founders Factory and Fastweb launch of a venture studio and accelerator focussing on smart home, cybersecurity, healthcare, edutech, and industry 4.0 startups, the folks from The Big Smoke are back at it in Italy, now launching a fintech-focused programme in conjunction with one of Italy’s largest investment banks, Mediobanca.

title: Freepik acquires Spanish AI image upscaler Magnific
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Design platform Freepik today announced its acquisition of Magnific, an AI image upscaler, enhancer and transformer tool.

title: Bag it, tag it, sell it to the merchant next door as Saclàb raises €1.6 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based marketplace for pre-loved luxury designer bags Saclàb has raised €1.6 million in a seed funding round. The dosh is aimed at scaling the fledgling company’s tech infrastructure as well as bolster HR and marketing activities as it preps for a US market launch.

title: Trampoline home decor secures $5M in Seed funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Trampoline, a cross-border B2B home décor brand announces the successful closure of its $5 million Seed funding round.

title: RDS brings its Seed funding to €13M  for its patented wearable monitoring solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, French medical device start-up RDS announced additional funding from Capital Grand Est, helping the company reach €13 million in Seed capital.

title: bp ventures invests £4M in Dynamon and enters a commercial partnership to utilise ZERO platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: bp ventures has made a £4 million investment in Dynamon, which provides software for commercial transport and logistics companies. The two firms have also entered into a partnership which will see Dynamon’s simulation and data analytics tools made available to bp pulse customers to help them to effectively manage their EV fleets.

title: Teton raises $5.3 million to build AI support for nurses
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Copenhagen-based health tech start-up Teton.ai has raised $5.3 million to expand its engineering and commercial teams to help roll out the product in Denmark and internationally.

title: Proxima Fusion captures a stellar €7 million raise to fund the design of fusion power plants
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Munich-based Proxima Fusion has raised €7 million in Pre-Seed funding to fuel the development of a high-performance stellarator in a step towards building a first-of-a-kind fusion power plant within the 2030s.

title: TravelLocal secures €9.7M Series B for sustainable, personalised travel
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today holiday booking and planning company TravelLocal announced it has raised €9.7 million in a Series B funding round.

title: Isometric raises $25 million and launches collaborative public science platform
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based Isometric is a carbon removal registry and science platform. The latter is being launched today and the registery is planned to launch in the coming months.

title: Dutch firm VSParticle raises €14.5 million to scale its material discovery innovation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: VSParticle began life as a long-term research project in TU Delft where Aaike van der Vugt (CEO) worked on it as a Master's student before collaborating with his professor Andreas Schmidt-Ott, co-founder and CTO Tobias Pfeiffer, and co-founder and COO Tobias Coppejans to scale the material discovery technology into an R&D tool for universities and organisations. The company was founded in 2014.

title: AI-powered legal copilot Robin AI secures $26M in Series B funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI-powered legal copilot Robin AI, announced that it has raised $26 million in Series B funding. This brings the company’s funding to $43.6 million.

title: Sano Genetics raises $11.4M to advance precision medicine clinical trials
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Precision medicine software platform Sano Genetics announced a $11.4 million raise led by Plural today.

title: Pexapark raises €20M in Series C funding round for renewable energy services
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Pexapark, a Zurich-based energy investment platform, has raised €20 million in a Series C funding round. The investment is aimed at further expanding the company’s market penetration as well as continued development of its PPA transaction advisory services.

title: Fintech on the lead again - HSBC Innovation Banking and Dealroom's UK Innovation Update
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In their latest UK Innovation Update – Q1 2024, HSBC Innovation Banking and Dealroom revealed that fintech is back on top as the UK’s most funded startup sector.

title: It’s official: Spotify founder Daniel Ek takes on healthcare
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While the rumours have been widely circulated, it’s been officially confirmed that Spotify founder Daniel Ek is getting into the healthcare system business with his newest startup Neko Health.

title: Sinpex's cloud-based AML software attracts €4M investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today business compliance and anti-money laundering (AML) solution provider Sinpex closed an oversubscribed financing round of €4 million.

title: Paris-based Impact+ raises €2 million to expand its greenhouse gas emissions evaluation platform for digital advertisers
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based sustainability tech start-up Impact+ is influencing the reduction of the carbon footprint in digital advertising through its platform which measures and evaluates the greenhouse gas emissions and electricity consumption of advertisers so they can make smart choices when running their campaigns.

title: Monzo, UK's largest digital bank, raises £340M for expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Monzo, the UK's largest digital bank, announced that it has raised £340 million in a funding round to boost its expansion plans.

title: SURGAR secures €11M for Augmented Reality surgical solution
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: SURGAR, a French startup developing augmented reality (AR) solutions for minimally invasive surgery, has closed an €11 million funding round.

title: Net Zero Company secures $5.5M Seed for blockchain-based carbon removal token
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm carbon removal company Net Zero Company today announced the completion of a $5.5 million Seed round.

title: Neura Robotics raises $55 million to enable expansion into the US and Japan
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Neura Robotics, a cognitive robotics company founded by David Reger in Metzingen, Germany, has raised a $55 million funding round which was led by Lingotto (owned by Exor N.V.), Vsquared Ventures, Primepulse and HV Capital.

title: peaq raises $15M for web3-enabled public infrastructure
author: Lucy Adams
summary: peaq has raised $15M to strengthen its web3 network, which enables communities to mobilise around improving physical infrastructure, as the company prepares for launch. Currently, peaq hosts 20 decentralized physical infrastructure networks (DePINs), decentralized apps that use tokens to incentivize people to crowdsource and build connected real-world infrastructure. The funding anticipates peaq's network launch after years of R&D.

title: Anima secures $12M in Series A led by Molten Ventures
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today care enablement healtech platform Anima, announced its oversubscribed $12 million Series A, led by Molten Ventures.

title: AutogenAI secures $22.3 million via Blossom Capital for large language models that streamline bidding process
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Just over a year since its founding, London-based AutogenAI has raised $22.3 million via Blossom Capital as it continues to develop its large language models technology. The fledgling company is specifically targeting the writing of bids and tenders for multi-million-pound contracts in the private and public sectors.

title: London’s carbon data provider Sylvera raises $57 million in Series B round, plans US expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London’s carbon data provider Sylvera has raised $57 million in a Series B funding round led by Balderton. The capital is earmarked to bolster the company’s engineering and product teams as it gears up for international expansion into the US market. Since late 2020, Sylvera has raised just over $95 million.

title: Italian firm Jakala boosts product offering with Roibox acquisition
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Roibox, a Riga-based provider of geospatial analytics for digital advertising, has been acquired by Italian business consulting and services firm Jakala. Financials of the deal remain undisclosed, but sources close to the matter indicate that Jakala has acquired a majority stake in Roibox at 53 percent.

title: UK’s Synthesia raises $90 million valuing the AI video creation platform at $1 billion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: London-based AI video creation platform Synthesia has raised $90 million in Series C funding round which will see it continue to simplify video production with the use of AI.

title: Liledu's eco-friendly toy subscription expands to UK with €500K investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Liledu, a Lithuanian-founded educational toy subscription service, is excited to announce a €500,000 investment to fuel its expansion into the UK.

title: Carbon13 invests in 6 climatetech startups through its venture launchpad
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Carbon13, the Venture Builder for the climate emergency Home, is today announcing new investments in six ventures through its accelerator, the Venture Launchpad. Each venture has received £120,000 Pre-Seed investment.

title: Better Stack unintentionally reaches profitability, adds $10M to continue growth
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Better Stack, a Prague-based startup that helps software developers ship better and more reliable faster, has announced the addition of $10 million in new capital. The investment will be used to continue the company’s growth, building upon its ‘unintentional’ achievement of profitability earlier this year.

title: Lithuanian startup CTO2B secures €1M for automated DevOps on any cloud platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: CTO2B, a Lithuanian startup offering a SaaS platform for automated DevOps on cloud infrastructure, today announced the close of a €1 million Pre-Seed funding round.

title: Eco-friendly nappy brand Peachies raises £1.4M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Peachies, the London-based premium nappy brand for contemporary parenting, has today announced the successful completion of its latest fundraising round, securing total funding of £1.4 million.

title: Refreshworks raises €750K to boost AI transformation in Dutch businesses
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Refreshworks today announced the raise of €750.000.

title: How to transform a company into a product-driven organisation — and why it matters
author: Guest Writer
summary: In the tech arena, it's common for companies to tout themselves as product-driven - whether that’s startups, scaleups, or large corporations. However, often this just means they rely on their product to function, rather than actively using it to guide their strategic decisions and drive long-term business success.

title: Invest in the future: BeTriton is the electric amphibious RV redefining travel
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Over the years, I’ve written extensively about new kinds of vehicles, including solar cars, autocycles, and aircars. Creating something novel is no easy task, and if successful, future vehicles will be unrecognisable compared to today's offerings.

title: Binit slashes household waste with gamified AI trash tracking
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Migrating to Europe taught me a lot about rules and recycling.  In Europe, we’re expected to separate our residential waste into paper, plastic, glass, and biowaste. Make an error (like pizza cartons into paper), and you’ll risk the ire of your neighbours knocking on your door and scolding you.

title: Medtech company CUREOSITY secures additional €3.8M for VR therapy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: VRtech Düsseldorf medtech company CUREOSITY has raised a further €3.8 million, bringing the company’s funding to over €8.4 million.

title: 10 Norwegian startups to watch in 2024
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Norwegian tech ecosystem has experienced significant growth and development in recent years, fueled by a combination of factors including government support, access to capital, a highly educated workforce, and a culture of innovation.

title: CUTISS skintech offers life changing hope for burn victims
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, I'm writing about a piece of tech that hits close to home. Back in Australia, when my mother was a child, she was severely burned in a kitchen accident from the knee down, resulting in not only severe pain but a lifetime of operations, dealing with severe ulcers, and wearing pressure garments.

title: Senior executive stands down from roles at card consolidator Curve
author: John Reynolds
summary: The finance chief at Curve, the card consolidator fintech which has raised more than £200m in equity, is leaving the role.

title: ScorePlay secures $5 million in seed funding to propel its AI-powered sports media athlete and club storytelling
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today AI digital asset manager ScorePlay announced it had raised a $5 million seed round.

title: NVIDIA partners with ORCA and PSNC in quantum push
author: Lucy Adams
summary: ORCA Computing and the Poznań Supercomputing and Networking Center (PSNC) have announced a collaboration with NVIDIA to accelerate the development of hybrid quantum-classical high-performance computing.

title: Rayon raises €4M for collaborative design tools in architecture and construction
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, collaborative design tool markers Rayon announced it has raised €4 million in Seed funding. Founded in 2021 in Paris, Rayon is a collaborative design tool for the architecture, engineering and construction industries (AEC).

title: Roundtable launches micro fund-as-a-service platform for easy VC fund creation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: European investor Roundtable today launches its micro fund-as-a-service product, aiming to enable any investor to quickly and easily launch their own VC fund.

title: VDS opens registration for its seventh global startup competition in Valencia
author: Tech.eu
summary: VDS has just launched the call for its international startup competition in Valencia. This contest aims to identify the world’s most disruptive startups that are developing innovative solutions to make a positive impact that transforms society and to connect them with the more than 700 investors expected at VDS2024, who collectively manage assets worth more than €30 billion, according to EY.

title: HRtech VEDA raises €17M for payroll-as-a-service
author: Lucy Adams
summary: CIBC Innovation Banking has provided €17M to VEDA, a German HR software and payroll-as-a-service provider.

title: Shilling launches €50M opportunity fund for growth-stage startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Shilling, the VC arm of Draycott SCR, has launched the Shilling Opportunity Fund.

title: Carbon counter Zevero acquired by Singaporean LEVELUP
author: Lucy Adams
summary: B2B carbon accounting startup Zevero has partnered with Singapore-based climate tech LEVELUP to expand their tracking of carbon emissions attributed to consumer products. The partnership featured a multi-million dollar deal but exact financial terms have not been disclosed.

title: VC and construction giants host construction sector’s biggest startup competition.
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: VC and Construction giants Cemex Ventures, Caterpillar, Dysruptek by Haskell, Ferrovial, Hilti, VINCI Group’s Leonard, NOVA by Saint-Gobain, Trimble, and Zacua Ventures are banding together to host the largest construction and cleantech startup competition to date.

title: Capital D closes Fund 2 with a further €156M to invest in innovative, fast-moving startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Private equity fund manager Capital D announced this week that it has  closed its Fund 2  with total commitments of €156 million, inclusive of the General Partner’s commitment.

title: This Week in European Tech: CVC made history with €26 billion buyout fund, Lithuania’s PVcase beamed in $100 million, and Motive Partners bought With Intelligence in £400 million deal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 80 tech funding deals worth over €1.2 billion. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 15 exits and M&A transactions.

title: Norrsken unveils €320M for "impact entrepreneurs"
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Norrsken VC has closed a €320m round to support “impact entrepreneurs”. The finalised total puts the fund among other European giants.

title: Accel's eighth fund closes at $650M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Accel has closed a $650M early-stage fund to support founders building companies out of Europe and Israel. Now in its 24th year on the ground in Europe, Accel’s eighth early-stage fund will build on the strategy of previous funds as the team continues to partner with transformative European and Israeli enterprise and consumer technology companies at the earliest stages. Accel wants to upend the 'VC winter' due to indicators of opportunity.

title: Skynopy secures $3.1M to simplify satellite connectivity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Skynopy, a Paris-based space startup specializing in satellite connectivity, announced that its fundraising of $3.1 million closed in only three weeks, just months after its creation.

title: Enspired secures €25.5M for trading platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Enspired, which offers offers trading-as-a-service on the short term energy markets, has raised €25.5M in Series B funding to accelerate the energy transition with power asset optimization.

title: Nanordica Medical raises €1.75M for  advanced antibacterial wound dressing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Estonian medtech company Nanordica Medical has raised €1.75 million to enter the market with first-in-class wound care products curing severe wounds.

title: Cylib raises €55M in largest-ever funding for European battery recycling
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sustainable end-to-end battery recycling firm cylib has raised €55 million Series A funding round in equity financing.

title: Lassie brings €23M home for pet insurance
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Lassie, the world’s first preventive pet insurance ecosystem - has raised €23 million in Series B funding.

title: Magic Lane raises €3M for navigation tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Mapping and location platform Magic Lane has raised €3M for navigation for micro-mobility, specialized vehicles, apps and platforms.

title: Omada raises €7.1M in Seed funding round for international expansion of sports prediction game
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Omada, a Bordeaux-based not-sports-gambling game, has raised €7.1 million in a Seed funding round. The game, titled as a ‘social prediction mobile game for sports fans’ intends to use the investment to fuel international growth following a two-year run that’s netted the game 300,000 monthly players in France and 1 million worldwide.

title: Daniel Ek's Neko Health raises €60 million to expand its preventive health care solution across Europe
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Swedish start-up Neko Health provides solutions for preventative health care using early detection methods. Its non-invasive medical scanning technology concept is designed to be a quick, convenient and affordable solution. It claims its offering has been in huge demand in Sweden -  when it first launched earlier this year in Stockholm, Neko Health sold out all the slots in less than two hours and has a waiting list of over 10,000 people.

title: Wayve bags $1.05B, milk peptides to treat depression, and 10 Irish startups to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than,65 tech funding deals worth over €2.9 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Northvolt's expansion to Quebec: CDPQ invests $150M to support construction of Northvolt Six
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Canada’s Caisse de Depot et Placement du Quebec (CDPQ) has invested $150 million in Stockholm-based sustainable lithium-ion battery maker Northvolt via convertible notes. The financing is aimed at supporting the realisation of Northvolt’s sixth gigafactory and first outside of Europe.

title: Amsterdam-based Crisp secures €35M, expects profitability by summer
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Crisp, an Amsterdam-based supermarket app, has raised €35 million in a Series C funding round. Having already banked €121 million since 2018, Crisp says that it intends to use the new investment capital to continue to “build a better food system”.

title: Weaviate raises $50 million for its AI native vector database and cloud service
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Amsterdam-based Weaviate has raised $50 million in a Series B funding round to expand its team and further develop its open source database and cloud service to meet demands from the AI application development market.

title: Agreena has a fresh €46 million to sow more seeds of regenerative farming
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Danish climate and fintech firm Agreena, has announced a Series B raise of €46 million to further scale its soil carbon platform.

title: Temasek leads €100 million round in atomic-level quantum processor builder Pasqal
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based neutral atoms approach quantum computing startup Pasqal has raised €100 million in a Series B funding round. The quantum processor maker will use the new capital to further develop its research and development efforts to build a 1,000-qubit quantum computer in the short term and fault-tolerant architectures in the long term. Since 2019, the startup has now raised over €125 million.

title: Cross-border payments specialist MODIFI banks $100 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Cross-border business payments firm MODIFI has secured $100 million in a debt facility via HSBC Innovation Banking UK. Helping businesses around the globe manage the complexities of global trade, MODIFI allows sellers to get paid instantly, while their Buyers have the option to pay later.

title: Pre-commerce platform Purple Dot secures $10M Series A
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based pre-ordering and waiting list platform Purple Dot has closed a $10M Series A funding round. The company enabling brands and retailers to sell products before they arrive at the warehouse in order to reduce risk to inventory, gather consumer data and optimise sales forecasting.

title: Serial founders raise €1.25M to streamline contract management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: The former founders of HRtech Prescreen have raised €1.25M for contract management software provider fynk. fynk allows users to create, check, draw up and analyse large numbers of contracts. According to Deloitte Consulting, companies worldwide are missing out on two trillion US dollars in additional added value due to poor contract management and outdated processes.

title: Ledger adds another €100 million to Series C round at €1.3 billion valuation
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Paris-based digital asset security firm Ledger has raised an additional €100 million in a Series C extension round. According to the company, the newest influx of capital is aimed at accelerating Ledger’s ambitions to “bring a new generation of secure consumer devices to hundreds of millions exploring critical digital assets and blockchain-enabled technology.”

title: Y-Combinator-backed Pythagora AI secures $4M for open source app development with AI
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Croatian AI developer Pythagora AI today announced the successful closure of a $4 million funding.

title: Verkor secures €2B for low-carbon battery gigafactory launch
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Verkor, the French manufacturer of low-carbon batteries has secured over €2 billion in a Series C funding round. The capital, comprised of a minimum of €850 million, a €500 million loan from the EIB, and French government subsidies totaling approximately €650 million, will be used to finance the launch of a Dunkirk-based gigafactory.

title: Jolt Energy jumps in to urban action after a €150 million investment for its ultra-fast charging network
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The Dublin and Munich-based company e-mobility company Jolt Energy (Jolt) has received  €150 million investment from InfraRed Capital Partners to bring its battery-buffered ultra-fast charging stations to urban areas across Europe and the US.

title: Isar Aerospace closes €155 million round, ignition sequence start, all engine running
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Munich-based spacetech startup Isar Aerospace has raised €155 million in a Series C funding round that will see the company continue to drive towards the liftoff of its Spectrum launch vehicle. To date, the company has raised approximately €324 million.

title: Munich’s EGYM takes on $225 million via Jared Kushner’s Affinity Partners as it eyes an IPO
author: Dan Taylor
summary: At a time of marked funding round slowdowns and diminished amounts, Munich-based fitness tech firm EGYM has raised $225 million in a Series F funding round. According to a report first filed by Bloomberg, the capital will be used to expand into more gyms, increase corporate subscriptions at its network of sports and wellness facilities and press forward with research and development projects, all the while progressing towards an IPO.

title: World experts in Artificial Intelligence will gather in October at Valencia Digital Summit
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Valencia Digital Summit (VDS2023) promises to be the standout event of the year for gaining insights into the current and future landscape of artificial intelligence, a transformative technology that has burst onto the innovation scene with vigour, poised to reshape the world as we know it and profoundly impact our social, economic and institutional well-being.

title: A new product-led angel investing syndicate has launched - Mozza Angels
author: Fiona Alston
summary: French-based product studio Mozza has launched its angel syndicate Mozza Angels which hopes to ‘elevate the product culture in the European tech ecosystem.’ A group of over 50 product operators make up the syndicate so far.

title: Gnosis invests $2M in UK digital wallet Zeal
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Gnosis announces a strategic partnership with Zeal, a UK digital wallet built to handle your whole financial life. The partnership aims to expand the accessibility of crypto to the everyday user.

title: BeAble Capital invests €174K in Ecogranular's wastewater treatment tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Spanish private equity fund BeAble Capital has invested €174,000 in Ecogranular, a spin-off of the University of Granada, whose technology aims to transfer wastewater treatment, reducing the water footprint and operating expenses and raising the quality of our waters.

title: Automating and optimising facilities and building management, London’s Infogrid raises $90 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: London-based Infogrid has raised $90 million in a Series B round. The new timber is expected to help the company expand, particularly in the areas of its dataset as well as upping the functionality of its building intelligence platform.

title: MetaGravity raises $9.5 million to bring low cost infrastructure to the metaverse
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Founded by serial entrepreneur Rashid Mansoor (previously Adbrain) and Tobin Ireland, London-based MetaGravity has announced it has raised a $9.5 million Seed funding round to scale its infrastructure layer support for the metaverse.

title: Quantexa raises a $129 million round at $1.8 billion valuation
author: Fiona Alston
summary: The UK-based Decision Intelligence (DI) solutions firm Quantexa has announced it has completed a $129 million Series E funding round with a $1.8 billion valuation.

title: Autonomous vehicle software Oxbotica drives in $140 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Oxford-based autonomous vehicle software Oxbotica has raised $140 million in a Series C round aimed at supporting the company’s deployment of its operating system in multiple commercial and industrial industries including agriculture, airports, energy, goods delivery, mining, and shared passenger transportation.

title: The European tech ecosystem in 2023: A Tech.eu annual report
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In line with greater global trends, 2023 was a tumultuous year for European tech, decidedly down from 2021 and 2022's heady days, and one marked by decreased valuations, a market correction to pre-pandemic levels, and the crowning of Tech.eu's person of the year.

title: DigitalFoodLab gives us a taste of the future of foodtech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Digital Food Lab released its sixth annual report on the state of FoodTech investment in Europe. The analysis spreads across several key verticals:

title: HRtech Anthropos raises $2.7M months after launch
author: Lucy Adams
summary: HRtech Anthropos has raised $2.7M for its employee upskilling platform.

title: How Maki VC is driving change in startup investments: a look at its 2023 Sustainability Report
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Helsinki’s Maki VC is a deeptech VC that invests in early-stage companies from their inception to Series Seed and beyond. It primarily focuses on the Nordics but selectively invests across Northern Europe, with investments in startups from Finland, Sweden, Norway, Germany, France, the UK, and the US.

title: Get ready for the Roundtable at the Tech.eu Summit London 2024!
author: Gözde Ulukan
summary: The Tech.eu Summit London 2024 is just days away! We have shared with you how our three-day conference will be with the detailed guide.

title: WASE raises £8.5M to boost biogas production with waste-to-energy conversion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK biogas tech company WASE today announced it raised over £8.5 million, including £2.4 million in non-dilutive funding.

title: Nosh.bio partners with Ginkgo Bioworks to develop animal-free meat alternatives
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Nosh.bio, a Berlin startup developing ingredients from fungal biomass for animal-free food products, announced a partnership with Ginkgo Bioworks.

title: Italian startup Mogu raises €11M for mycelium-based biotech expansion
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Italian mycelium-based biotech and biomaterials company Mogu has raised €11 million in a Series A funding round aimed at helping the company scale operations, further R&D projects, and open a new production plant.

title: Offering an AI-powered, human expert-supported digital CFO product, Numarics raises €10.2 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Zurich-based Numarics has raised €10.2 million. Already having acquired four companies this year, the AI-powered “business OS” maker wants to continue expansion across the DACH region through more M&A activities as well as develop its product lineup to broaden its range of services.

title: Sustainability dominated the foodtech landscape in 2023. Here's what it means for 2024
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Foodtech is one of the most relatable topics in my conversations with non-tech enthusiasts. The allure of trying edible insects and exploring vegetarian alternatives resonates widely.

title: Dryad's ultra-early detection system battles the most remote forest fires
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Every summer gets hotter, and stories of fires in places like Australia, Greece, and the US hit our news. Fires destroy ecosystems, damage the environment, demolish workplaces, homes, and local infrastructure, and cause the loss of wildlife and the death of animals and people, severely impacting a country's carbon emissions.

title: Access Legal acquires inCase to transform client communication and boost productivity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Access Legal, a division of the Access Group, has completed the acquisition of UK legaltech app inCase.

title: Finnish IoT company Haltian raises €22 million to expand its services in Europe and the US
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Finnish IoT company Haltian has raised €22 million in growth funding for its IoT software and sensor solutions, and services for real estate. The funding injection will fuel the company’s expansion in the US and Europe.

title: 2022 sees Europe's IoT startups smashing funding records – 10 fundraisers to watch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It's Mobile World Congress (MWC) time again, so it's a great time to be a journalist if you love IoT.

title: Corporate card and business expense management platform Mooncard raises €37 million
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian fintech firm Mooncard has raised €37 million in a Series C funding round. Offering a suite of tools aimed at helping corporate finance teams rest easier at night, the new capital will be used to fuel Mooncard’s expansion into new markets including Germany, Austria, Belgium, Spain, Italy, and the Netherlands. Since 2019, the company has raised just north of $75 million.

title: Cargofive raises €2.5M to boosts efficiency in freight forwarding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Portuguese freight forwarding company Cargofive announced the completion of an extended funding round, raising €2.5 million. This round saw the new participation of prominent venture capitalists Indico Capital and EIT Urban Mobility.

title: Bizay raises €18M to digitise $850B customisation industry
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today custom products platform Bizay announced an € 18 million Series C2 funding round.

title: These are the EU countries with the most successful companies
author: Amanda Kavanagh
summary: New research by global fintech group Plus500 reveals that France and Germany rank joint first in the EU for companies making the most amount of profit per employee.

title: Norsepower sets sail with €28 million for rotator sail power
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Norway’s Norsepower Oy Ltd. has raised €28 million in its latest Series C fundraising round to scale up production of its a mechanical sails for large ships.

title: UK insurtech startup Eleos secures $750K in Pre-Seed funding
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based insurtech startup Eleos has bagged itself $750,000 in Pre-Seed funding. The round was backed by Indico Capital Partners, APX, Fuel Ventures, and Magic Fund.

title: Apeiron Ventures launches €25M Seed fund for Gen Z and B2B innovation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Apeiron Ventures announced the launch of a new Seed investment fund focused on nurturing the Gen Z economy and B2B software across Greece, the Greek Diaspora, and Europe.

title: Credit repayment fintech Incredible raises $1m
author: John Reynolds
summary: A fintech which uses the latest open banking technology to help users repay credit card debts more efficiently has raised $1m.

title: Swiss carbon capture company Neustark raises $69M for European expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Neustark, a Switzerland-based carbon removal provider, has raised $69 million in a funding round to underpin its rapid scale-up in the carbon dioxide removal (CDR) market.

title: MeetingPackage secures $4.6M Series A for its meeting and event  booking software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, MeetingPackage, an all-in-one sales automation software specialising in venue and group bookings, has secured a $4.6 million Series A round.

title: CIRCTEC raises €150M for Europe's largest tyre pyrolysis recycling facility
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK recycling startup CIRCTEC has raised €150 million to construct Europe’s largest end-of-life tyre pyrolysis recycling facility in Delfzijl, the Netherlands.

title: Sunfire raises over €500M to boost European's green hydrogen economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German electrolyser manufacturer Sunfire announced today that it has raised €215 million in a Series E equity financing round, further complemented by a term loan of up to €100 million provided by the European Investment Bank (EIB).

title: HYDROGRID makes waves with $8.5M Series A for optimised, automated hydropower
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week sees Austrian scale-up, HYDROGRID successfully close $8.5 million in Series-A funding to fuel a wave of international expansion.

title: AI could automate up to 70% of work
author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride
summary: Ever since ChatGPT burst onto the scene in November 2022, much of the conversation surrounding generative AI’s impact has centred on job losses and whether automation could end up leaving humans redundant in various sectors.

title: Jamango! raises $2.5M for no-code game design
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Game creation platform Jamango! has raised $2.5 million to accelerate development ahead of launching globally later this year.

title: German greentech unicorn Enpal secures over €1B in refinancing for residential solar systems
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German greentech unicorn Enpal this week secured senior refinancing commitments of more than €1 billion from Barclays Europe, Bank of America and Credit Agricole CIB in two separate ABS warehousing facilities, as well as total mezzanine debt commitments of € 118 million from CPP Investments.

title: Seven ways to boost your tech salary this year
author: Aisling O’Toole
summary: Tech companies are constantly vying for the best talent, but it is also important to assess why a majority of workers in the industry still feel underpaid. Despite the average tech salary reaching six figures for the first time in almost two decades, almost half the workforce feel their salaries fall short, according to the Dice Tech Salary report.

title: UK citizen engagement platform Commonplace raises £2.1 million to ensure the built environment positively impacts communities
author: Fiona Alston
summary: UK-based citizen engagement platform, Commonplace, has raised £2.1 million to fuel its ‘continued expansion, enabling its growing client base to demonstrate the positive impact their work has on the communities they service’.

title: Satellite Vu views another £12.7 million in latest funding round
author: Dan Taylor
summary: British satellite startup Satellite Vu has raised £12.7 million in what it’s referring to as a Series A2 funding round. The company aims to monitor the temperature of any building on the planet in real-time from space and deliver insights into economic activity, energy efficiency, and carbon footprint alongside keeping tabs on defence and intelligence, and industrial activity.

title: How AI is helping proptech overtake fintech investment and green the Built World
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week a new report was published by sustainable proptech VC investor A/O PropTech exploring the use of AI technology in the built environment.

title: A/O to boost European and North American proptech startups with new €250M fund
author: Dan Taylor
summary: After raising €250 million and announcing the launch of its first fund in 2020, London-based A/O PropTech is back with its second iteration, now with a first close of €100 million of a targeted €250 million.

title: VentureWave laps up Funderbeam as it leads a $40 million investment deal - a 'game-changer' for venture markets
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Irish-based venture private equity group VentureWave, and Estonia's investment trading platform Funderbeam, have announced they’ve agreed a 'game-changing' deal as the dynamic funding entities join forces to offer a plethora of funding opportunities on a global scale. They are creating a global entity which will serve institutional and angel investors in venture deal execution and secondaries.

title: Revolut posts record profits as softens stance on London listing
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut today appeared to soften its stance on a potential London stock market listing, as the challenger bank tabled record profits in 2023.

title: Deeptech investor EMV Capital acquires Martlet Capital
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Deeptech investment firm EMV Capital has acquired the Cambridge-based seed-stage VC Martlet Capital, excluding its investment portfolio. EMV Capital will manage, on a discretionary basis, Martlet Capital’s £23.3M portfolio of investments across 53 companies within the deep tech and life sciences sectors. In addition, it has been appointed as investment manager.

title: Nord Security achieves $3B valution, Xavier Niel goes big on AI, and UK government scraps data ethics advisory board
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 90 tech funding deals worth over €684.7 million. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 10 exits and M&A transactions.

title: With $8M, Vega solves investor painpoints with a unified platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Startups are often told, “Don’t build products for yourself and your friends,” but now this wisdom is no longer absolute. And rich people are getting a lot richer by breaking the rules.

title: EQT Life Sciences and Sectoral lead $42M investment in medtech Phagenesis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Medtech company Phagenesis, which has developed a revolutionary neurostimulation system to treat swallowing dysfunction, has closed a $42 million Series D financing all-equity investment round.

title: Octomind raises $4.8M for AI-powered web testing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Six months after emerging from stealth mode, German software company Octomind has raised $4.8 million to transform web testing with generative AI.

title: Matter raises $10M to scale its microplastics filtration technology for commercial use
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Bristol-based start-up Matter has developed technology which removes microplastics from white goods in use, for example, Gulp works with a washing machine, to stop microplastics fibres from clothing getting into waterways and beyond. It provides solutions to capture, harvest and recycle these microplastics.

title: Banking-as-a-Service is a “dirty word” with US investors, says European fintech boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Banking-as-a-Service is a “dirty word” with US investors, according to the boss of a European fintech, which embeds financial services into the businesses of its B2B clients.

title: AxonJay raises €1.5M for deeptech AI assistant
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Deeptech startup AxonJay has raised €1,5 million in funding.

title: ValTech Lifesciences scores £130,000 for prosthetic heart valves
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Bringing together fluid mechanical and cardiovascular engineering research, Medtech startup ValTech Lifesciences received the final £1300 kick from Venture Kick to advance its development of a non-thrombogenic, durable heart valve prosthesis.

title: Outdoor adventure booking platform Mapo Tapo secures €1.15M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Italian traveltech startup Mapo Tapo has raised €1.15 million Seed funding.

title: Glyphic AI raises $5.5 million to build AI copilot for sales teams
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Glyphic AI is founded by former Google DeepMind and Apple engineers, Devang Agrawal and Adam Liska - it is building an AI copilot for sales teams to give insights to customer interactions and provide viable insights into sales pipelines. Today the London-based start-up announced it has raised a Pre-seed round of $5.5 million to fund the build.

title: British Design Fund invests £150K in Corryn Biotechnologies' wound care solutions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Medtech startup Corryn Biotechnologies has secured a £150,000 investment from the British Design Fund as part of a £550,000 Seed funding round that will support the development of its novel wound dressing technology, designed for the treatment of chronic and complex wounds.

title: Invizius raises £950,000 for dialysis treatment
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Invizius, an Edinburgh-based biotech developing breakthrough treatments for patients on dialysis, has raised £950,000 in a funding round led by Mercia Ventures and supported by Calculus Capital, Syensqo, the University of Edinburgh's Old College Capital and Scottish Enterprise.

title: Romanian edtech Youni raises €900,000 for AI-driven university admissions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Romanian edtech startup, Youni has raised €900,000. The startup helps students enter the world's leading universities by facilitating the admissions process through AI technology.

title: 6 startups fueling the future of influencer content creation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The advent of monetisation opportunities on social media platforms birthed a new class of creators and influencers who make their income from content creation and distribution.

title: GlassPoint receives $2.5M investment from MIG Capital for solar steam facilities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German VC firm MIG Capital has invested $2.5 million in cleantech company GlassPoint.

title: Credit repayment fintech Incredible raises $1m
author: John Reynolds
summary: A fintech which uses the latest open banking technology to help users repay credit card debts more efficiently has raised $1m.

title: Danish startup Self.io unveils smart massage robots for personalised wellness on demand
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Most people put a personal masseuse high on their wishlist if they were to become rich. What's not to like about a masseur on demand that knows your painpoints from too much time in front of a computer and can provide the panacea to the stresses of life?

title: "I don’t think we are going to see AI-produced Super Bowl ads yet”, says Klarna marketing chief
author: John Reynolds
summary: Klarna’s top marketing executive says viewers will have to wait to see AI-powered Super Bowl adverts, as he shed light on how the Swedish fintech giant is using Generative AI in its advertising and the technology's broader impact on advertising.

title: Startup Arcube takes flight, unlocking billions in airline ancillary revenue
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: How many startup entrepreneurs have you met who founded and exited startups while in their teens, then went on to found and bootstrap another startup while at university, raising $625,000 in profitable revenue with no investors while still being students? Oh, and their first client was Etihad.

title: The Hungarian tech surge: Where global investments meet local expertise
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Hungarian technology ecosystem is experiencing rapid growth and development, showcasing a wealth of strengths.

title: 14Peaks Capital closes first fund at $30M for the future of B2B SaaS
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Venture capital firm 14Peaks Capital has successfully closed its first fund at $30 million in capital commitments from a consortium of High-net-worth individuals (HNWIs,) limited partners (LPs) and family offices spanning Europe and the US.

title: SWEN Capital Partners confidently backs REGA's renewable energy ambitions in €60M fundraise
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Portugal-based renewable energy company REGA Energy Group has received full confidence from its existing investor SWEN Capital Partners as it completes a further €60 million funding round. The firm offers biomethane and green hydrogen as an alternative to industry leaders.

title: How Brighterly is addressing the US math education crisis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Your math abilities are likely influenced by your educational experience. Were you primarily taught to memorise mathematical concepts, such as multiplication tables, or were you encouraged to develop a deep understanding of mathematical principles? Did you like math? If you scored poorly, probably not.

title: Jump secures €11M Series A to expand freelance support across Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French HRtech startup Jump has raised €11 million Series A.

title: Nebius opens new GPU cluster in Paris, part of $1B European AI investment by mid-2025
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI infrastructure company Nebius today announced the launch of a new GPU cluster in Paris. This is part of the company’s plans to invest more than $1 billion by mid-2025 in AI infrastructure in Europe.

title: NATO-backed Ephos raises $8.5M Seed for glass-based photonic chips
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Ephos, a producer of glass-based photonic chips, has raised an $8.5M seed funding round and will open a research and manufacturing facility in Milan, the world's first dedicated to producing glass-based quantum photonic circuits. In addition, Ephos has received funding from the EU and NATO's Defence Innovation Accelerator (DIANA).

title: Unveiling impact Unicorns: Norrsken Foundation's annual Impact/100
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Norrsken Foundation has released its annual Impact/100 ranking, which shines a spotlight on the top 100 companies changing the world for the better, as selected by a hand-picked roster of world-leading VC firms, ​​including Lionheart Ventures, Molten VC, A16Z, BMW Foundation, and Katapult.

title: Quantum Systems closed €100M Series B for advanced drone technology
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Munich’s Quantum Systems announced the successful completion of an additional Series B funding round.

title: Pergamin raises $3M to automate company contract management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Polish startup Pergamin, which automates company contract management, has raised $3 million from OnDean Forward.

title: SET University and Hilltop Technologies launch SET Cyber Labs for enhanced cybersecurity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Ukrainian non-profit academic institution SET University and US-based startup Hilltop Technologies have launched SET Cyber Labs. This new cybersecurity startup provides 24/7 tailored solutions for businesses, non-profits, and academic institutions.

title: APRON raises $30M Series B for SMB payments tech
author: Lucy Adams
