summary: APRON, the business payments powerhouse, has raised a $30M Series B funding round to help more small business owners make it by digitising and simplifying the payments process, and bring greater security to these companies’ cash flow.

title: SeedBlink launches Raise Hub to simplify equity management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Tech investment and equity management platform SeedBlink has launched Raise Hub, a comprehensive digital suite that empowers startup founders to efficiently manage fundraising activities within their own network, leveraging SeedBlink’s robust equity management infrastructure.

title: Berlin-based Distribusion secures $80M for global ground transport accessibility
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-headquartered B2B ground transportation marketplace Distribusion has raised a heavily oversubscribed $80 million Series C funding round led by  TQ Ventures, with super pro-rata participation from existing investor Lightrock.

title: Platformatic raises $4.3M for Node.js application optimisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Italian-founded startup Platformatic HQ, the cloud-native Node.js application platform, raises $4.3 million in its latest seed funding.

title: Playfair Capital and top VC funds support female founders in Europe with remote office hours
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, investor Playfair Capital and 200 of the world’s leading venture capital funds launched its plan to hold remote office hours for more than 300 female founders from across Europe as part of the 12th edition of ‘Female Founder Office Hours’.

title: Spanish firm Acurio Ventures to invest €150M in early-stage startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Spanish investment firm Acurio Ventures, formerly named All Iron Ventures, today announced €150 million in investment commitments for its new investment vehicle, Acurio Ventures III.

title: French quantum computing powerhouses Pasqal and Welinq announce partnership
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, two French quantum computing companies, Pasqal and Welinq, announced a partnership set to bring new standards to the quantum computing industry.

title: Leia Inc. acquires Dutch company Dimenco, unifying 3D technology across devices
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Dutch-based display technology company Dimenco has been acquired by Leia Inc., a 3D display hardware and content services firm from the US.

title: Convergence secures $12M Pre-Seed for personalised AI agent
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Personal AI startup Convergence has raised $12 million in Pre-Seed funding.

title: Exakt Health raises €2M for the first digital sports physiotherapy certified as a medical device in Germany
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Health tech startup Exakt Health, which offers the first digital sports physiotherapy certified as a medical device in Germany, has raised €2 million Seed funding.

title: Challenger credit bureau Infact raises £4M, gets green light from regulators
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Infact has raised a £4M Seed funding round after securing FCA authorisation to establish a real-time credit bureau for the digital financial services market.

title: Wellness platform EGYM secures $200M of growth capital
author: Lucy Adams
summary: German healthtech EGYM has raised approximately $200M of growth capital at a valuation of over $1B from L Catterton, a leading global consumer-focused investment firm, and Meritech Capital, a leading Silicon Valley technology-focused venture firm.

title: PLOY: The video platform bridging the gap for Gen Z workplace recruitment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: By 2030, Gen Z will make up 30 per cent of the workforce, yet they don't have a professional network built around their form of communication: mobile video.

title: Revolut launches standalone investment app in Europe
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut is launching a standalone investment app in Europe, as it looks to disrupt the retail investor market and ramp up its efforts to be an all-encompassing financial super-app.

title: Qura raises €2.1M to build LLM-structured legal databases
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Stockholm-based legal tech startup Qura, founded in 2023, has raised a seed round of €2.1M led by Cherry Ventures and GP Sophia Bendz who will join the board. The funding round, led by Cherry Ventures and followed by senior Swedish lawyers and other angels, will be used to improve the platform further and collect more legal data.

title: ÄIO raises €6.1M to develop sustainable oils from wood and agricultural residue
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Biotechnology startup ÄIO has raised €6.1 million through venture capital funds Voima Ventures, 2C Ventures, SmartCap and Nordic Foodtech VC.

title: Pelikan Mobility raises €4M seed funding for commercial fleet electrification
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today commercial fleet platform Pelikan Mobility announced it has raised a €4 million seed round.

title: VARM secures Pre-Seed funding to accelerate home insulation and building decarbonisation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, insulation startup VARM announced a seven-figure Pre-Seed round of funding. The company is on a mission to drive household decarbonisation by making it faster, easier, and more affordable for homeowners to insulate buildings’ cavity walls and roofs.

title: ClaimSorted raises $3M to expedite insurance claim processing
author: Lucy Adams
summary: ClaimSorted, a company dedicated to simplifying claims processing for insurers, has secured $3 million in pre-seed funding. The oversubscribed round was led by Firstminute capital, with participation from YCombinator, Precursor Ventures, and Transpose. Prominent InsurTech founders also joined the round.

title: DeepOpinion Raises €11M for AI-driven disaster claims automation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: DeepOpinion, an Austrian startup specialising in enterprise agentic process automation, has raised €11 million in a Series A funding round.

title: Raycast raises $30M Series B to reduce context switching
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Productivity software company Raycast has raised a $30 million Series B funding round to reduce workplace context switching and improve focus. This brings the company's funding to over $45 million.

title: Enginsight raises €6M to boost cybersecurity for German SMEs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German cybersecurity startup Enginsight has successfully raised €6 million in a round led by UVC Partners. Among the co-investors is Carsten Maschmeyer, again investing in the startup with his seed+speed fund; bm-t beteiligungsmanagement thüringen GmbH, Talanx AG, Smart Infrastructure Ventures, and Brandenburg VENTURES GmbH.

title: Apolitical receives $2M Bezos Earth Fund Grant for climate change training for public servants
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-based global online learning platform and community for public servants, Apolitical, has received a $2 million grant from the Bezos Earth Fund to provide government workers with the skills they need to take urgent action on climate change.

title: Zefir raises €11M to speed up real estate transactions
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, proptech Zefir announced it raised €11 million in round.

title: With its neutral-atom approach, Welinq raises €5 million to scale up quantum computing
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Parisian startup Welinq has raised €5 million in a pre-seed financing round aimed at helping the company deploy its variety of connecting quantum computers based on the neutral-atom approach.

title: Wayland Additive raises £4.6 million to increase production of its electron beam 3D printing solution
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Huddersfield-based Wayland Additive Limited, an electron beam 3D printing manufacturer has raised £4.6 million in funding to increase its in-house production capability, expand its team and hire a COO.

title: Constructiontech FixForm raises €1.5M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: FixForm, a collaborative platform for building management and maintenance, has raised €1.5 million from a select group of Belgian investors. The funding will allow the founders to expand their solution and venture into new markets.

title: "Energy renovation school" La Solive raises €4M to facilitate career transitions
author: Lucy Adams
summary: French "energy renovation school" La Solive has raised €4M in a Series A funding round led by Partech, alongside Brighteye Ventures and business angels Thibaud Hug de Larauze (CEO of BackMarket), Vincent Bryant (CEO of Deepki), and Clément Delpirou (President of the IAD Group).

title: Lightyear's solarEV innovation secures strategic investment from South Korean VCs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Lightyear announced a strategic investment from two South Korean venture capital funds, Sunbo Angel Partners and Lighthouse Combined Investment. The investment amount has not been disclosed.

title: Lopay partners with fintech YouLend
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Lopay, a London-based payment processing app that focuses on faster payouts and lower processing fees, has announced a strategic partnership with YouLend, a global embedded financing platform.

title: Bio-Sourcing secures €12.5M from EIC Accelerator for biotherapeutic production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belgian biotherapeutic company Bio-Sourcing has been awarded €2.5 million in grants and €10 million in equity from the European Innovation Council (EIC) Accelerator.

title: Jet HR raises €12M in Seed to transform payroll in Italy a year after launch
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Just one year after launch, Jet HR has raised a Seed round of  €12 million, bringing total funding to €16.7 million.

title: Revolut hits 10m UK retail customer milestone, matching Monzo
author: John Reynolds
summary: Revolut said today (Friday) it had hit the 10 million UK retail customer mark, and that it had added nearly two million retail customers this year. Revolut has been slugging it out with UK challenger bank rival Monzo, which also has over 10 million UK retail customers, in a race to have the largest UK retail customer base.

title: German elderly healthtech Family.cards secures €1.2M Seed round
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Family.cards, a Brandenburg-based start-up that specialises in the development of simple digital accessibility solutions for seniors, has today announced a €1.2M seed funding round. The round was led by Brandenburg Kapital and OHA Osnabruck Healthcare 7 Ventures. Existing investors, Antler and Birdhouse, also provided funding.

title: Is AI the end of the shark tank as we know it?
author: Elin Bäcklund
summary: To say that artificial intelligence (AI) has had an upswing in 2023 is an understatement. While a lot of the focus has been paid to the likes of ChatGPT, DALL-E, and autonomous self-driving, there is a particular use case for AI that has yet to reach mainstream adoption: raising capital.

title: Invest-NL  backs PhotonVentures with €5M to boost Netherlands photonics industry
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: PhotonVentures has received an investment from Invest-NL and a group of new private investors, with Invest-NL contributing € 5 million.

title: Sono Motors secures investment from Yorkville for solar integration business continuity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Munich solar tech company Sono Motors announced the signing of investment agreements with YA II PN, Ltd. ("Yorkville"), which will enable the company to restructure itself, emerge from its self-administration proceedings that have been ongoing since May 2023 and continue its solar integration business until at least the end of 2024.

title: Gathr emerges out of stealth with a new platform supporting founders and investors
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Gathr emerges from stealth, bringing support & transparency to the founder and investor community

title: Bunq moves into stock trading, targeting digital nomads
author: John Reynolds
summary: Bunq, the Amsterdam-based challenger bank, is moving into stock trading, targeting digital nomads across Europe. Called Stocks, the retail investment product will initially launch in the Netherlands and France, and then be rolled out across Europe.

title: Can Sono Motors raise enough funds to manufacture its solar EV?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When a company starts a fundraising campaign for a yet-to-be-released solar electric vehicle (SEV) Sion with the hashtag #savesion, you know things aren't going that great.

title: Italian startup Lithium Lasers secures €3.5M funding for advanced laser tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Italian startup Lithium Lasers announced it has raised €3.5 million in funding,

title: French start-up Loewi raises €1 million to ride the refurbish electric bike market
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Paris-based Loewi refurbishes electric bikes, giving the used bikes a second life whilst ensuring there is a low priced market for those looking for a green transport alternative but can’t quite reach the relatively high price tag of a new bike.

title: Just Eat Takeaway.com commences up to €150 million share buy-back programme
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Following a filing for SEC deregistration last month, Just Eat Takeaway.com has today announced a share buy-back programme that could see the company repurchase ordinary shares in the amount of up to €150 million. According to the company, the initiative will be used to cover obligations under share-based compensation agreements or be cancelled in order to reduce issued share capital.

title: Flink raises $150M, Headline has €776.5M for growth-stage startups, and Ukraine's resilience in adversity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 85 tech funding deals worth over €1 billion, and over 15 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: Buycycle US expansion in response to demand for affordable pre-owned bikes
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A Munich-founded marketplace for high-value, pre-owned bikes, buycycle is expanding its business to the US market.

title: UK's Bike Club accelerates European expansion with acquisition of Spanish counterpart BICIRCULAR
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today  Bike Club, Europe's largest subscription provider of kids' bikes, announced a decision to acquire Bicircular, a Barcelona-based bike subscription platform for children in Spain.

title: Luna Systems partners with Segway-Ninebot to help shared micromobility vendors curb bad rider behaviour
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Dublin-based Computer Vision mobility safety company Luna Systems announced a global partnership with Segway-Ninebot to provide safety solutions to the shared micromobility market.

title: What trends are steering the mobility landscape right now,  and how will they accelerate this year?
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The future of mobility is fast evolving, thanks to technological innovation, climate change goals, and an effort to reduce car ownership. Here's the second installment  — check out Part 1 first — featuring the mobility trends that I anticipate will grab our attention in 2024:

title: Phacet raises €4M for SME-tailored SaaS
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Phacet, a pioneer in personalised artificial intelligence solutions for small and medium-sized enterprises has announced a Seed round of €4 million.

title: Berlin startup SIRIUS raises $4M for online music school
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Berlin-based music school startup SIRIUS has raised $4 million Seed funding.

title: Findable raises €9M to automate property sales admin
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Findable, an Oslo-based startup that automates building documentation using AI, has raised a €9 million Series A round. The round was led by Point Nine, with participation from KOMPAS VC, Construct Venture and Lake Eight. The funding will support its rapid growth, expand its operations into new markets and grow its team.

title: The next wave of successful tech startups will be inspired by design
author: Rea Stark
summary: What’s the most important appointment a tech startup will make?

title: September 2024's top 10 European tech deals you need to know about
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: According to the Tech.eu database, European tech companies raised €4.2 billion over the course of September 2024. Although this amount is almost two times higher than the amount a month ago, compared to the same month a year ago, the number decreased around 70 per cent (in September 2023 European tech companies collected €16.5 billion).

title: Electronic Based Systems are a strength of the Austrian electronics industry
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Electronic Based Systems are a strength of the Austrian electronics industry. A central location in the heart of Europe, an outstanding research landscape, and a high quality of living make Austria a go-to place for tech startups and established players alike.

title: The state of equity investment into UK university spinouts
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A report from Parkwalk, the UK's most active investor in university spinouts, asserts that spinouts will increasingly define much of the UK’s economic standing in the world, our levels of productivity, advancements in public services and the innovation that can help curb climate change.

title: Inbolt raises €15M to make industrial robots smarter with AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Inbolt, a provider of real-time robot guidance solutions, has secured a €15 million Series A round. The round is led by Exor Ventures, the early-stage investment arm of Exor N.V.. Exor is the largest shareholder of industrial groups such as Ferrari, Stellantis, and CNH industrial. This financing is also supported by Bpifrance and repeat entrepreneur Yann Fleureau, founder of Cardiologs. Existing investors MIG Capital (Germany), SOSV (US), and BNP Paribas Développement (France), are also investing in the round, taking the total raised by the company to €20 million.

title: German AI defence giant Helsing eyes $4B valuation in Series C funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: German AI defense company Helsing is reportedly in talks to secure €370 million in Series C funding, potentially valuing the company at a staggering $4 billion. The round is said to be led by US VC giant General Catalyst, according to Forbes.

title: Digital asset management platform Haruko raises $6M Series A
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Digital asset investment management platform Haruko today announced a $6 million Series A funding round as it expands into Southeast Asia and further consolidates its global presence.

title: Atlas Metrics has raised €5.2 million and is making the uncountable accountable
author: Dan Taylor
summary: Berlin-based Atlas Metrics has raised €5.2 million in a seed funding round that will see the startup expand its “all-in-one” ESG data management platform for companies. Alongside streamlining efforts to get all that carbon & co. under control, a portion of the round is earmarked for a recruitment campaign that will augment its existing 20-person team.

title: Spanish media-tech start-up Yuvod raises €4 million for further US expansion
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Yuvod, the product-as-a-service (PaaS) for video platforms, is eyeing an all American expansion continuing its success in Latin America. The PaaS provides OTT (over-the-top) video streaming platforms (think Netflix, Disney+ type platforms) to the hospitality, telco and sport sectors.

title: Jinko raises €2M for post-cancer care
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Jinko, a start-up dedicated to enhancing the quality of life for those affected by cancer, has raised €2M to accelerate the development of its personalized care services. This initial funding round was led by 360 Capital, with participation from AFI Ventures - Ventech's impact arm, and 10 business angels from the medical, entrepreneurial, insurance, and pharmaceutical sectors.

title: Stimy AI raises $425K for personalised math learning app
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Maths edtech company Stimy AI has raised $425,000 Pre-Seed investment.

title: QUBITRIUM secures $1.5M in Seed funding
author: Lucy Adams
summary: QUBITRIUM, a Turkish startup in the field of advanced quantum technologies, has secured €1.5M in seed funding from ACT Venture Partners.

title: Abrinca Genomics secures €159,700 for advancing microbial genomics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swiss biotech Abrinca Genomics has raised CHF 150,000 (€159,700) to advance the microbial genomics research market.

title: Over €84.4 million raised by European tech in the last week of 2023
author: Dan Taylor
summary: In the last week of 2023, we tracked 15 tech funding deals worth over €84.4 million, and one exit; all alongside a host of related news stories across Europe.

title: Reframe emerges from stealth with $5M raise
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Reframe, a startup dedicated to redefining the human-computer relationship, today announces it has emerged from stealth and raised $5 million in seed funding. The round was led by Primary Venture Partners, with Eniac Ventures as co-lead, with participation from Founder Collective and Operator Partners. Brad Svrluga from Primary Venture Partners is on the board.

title: Ferovinum secures £17.5M Series A for wine and spirits platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Funding and supply chain platform for wine and spirits businesses, Ferovinum, has completed an oversubscribed £17.5 million Series A funding round.

title: PACT raises £9m Seed to industrialise collagen biomaterials
author: Lucy Adams
summary: PACT has raised a £9m Seed round to advance the development and reach of pioneering biomaterials inspired by nature. This includes their inaugural material, Oval; a scalable biomaterial crafted from natural collagen.

title: Atomico's ins and outs, Sweden's Brite Payments secures $60M, and we remember Cowboy co-founder Karim Slaoui
author: Dan Taylor
summary: This week, our research tracked more than 75 tech funding deals worth over €521 million. On the other end of the spectrum, we saw over 20 exits and M&A transactions.

title: Advania UK expands IT Services with CCS Media acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Advania UK is acquiring 100% per cent of the share capital in CCS Media, one of the UK’s largest independent IT solution specialists.

title: Tuggs bags £1.1M for insect-based dog food
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Insect-based fresh dog food company Tuggs has secured £1.1 million in funding from several institutional investors and angels.

title: Wikimedia, DataStax, and Jina AI launch semantic search for non-profit AI developers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Wikimedia Deutschland announced the launch of a semantic search concept in collaboration with search experts from DataStax and Berlin’s Jina AI.

title: Resilience in adversity: Ukraine's tech ecosystem
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Ukraine's startup ecosystem has changed in the last two years, creating a landscape that is markedly different from the pre-conflict environment.

title: Berlin still “major destination” for attracting VC capital, says payments boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Berlin remains a “major destination” for attracting VC capital, despite lagging behind London, according to the boss of a Berlin-based payments startup which has just bagged sports brand Puma as a client.

title: AMD acquires Silo AI, SoftBank acquires Graphcore, and  €450M for defencetech Helsing
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week our research tracked more than 60 tech funding deals worth over €1.3 billion, and over 10 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: World Bank's IFC and Agreena join forces to close 'finance gap' for sustainable farming
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The International Finance Corporation (IFC), a member of the World Bank Group, and Danish climate fintech, Agreena have today announced a financial services partnership to advance sustainable farming across Eastern Europe.

title: Climate investor Blume Equity secures BPC capital for debut fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Growth climate-tech investor Blume Equity LLP has secures British Patient Capital and Queensland Investment Corporation as LLPs. BPC made a €25M commitment to Blume Equity’s Fund I.

title: Capmont raises €100M for early-stage B2B startups
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Capmont Technology – a venture capital firm investing in B2B technology startups across Europe and the US – has announced the launch of a €100 million fund, targeting companies solving industry-wide problems through pioneering technology.

title: Privado ID and Disco.xyz merge for a new era in multichain digital identity
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Barcelona digital identity platform Privado ID, formerly Polygon ID, today announced a merger with Disco, a pioneer in multichain verifiable data and reputation management.

title: Stockholm's Flower acquires Arise's battery project: a boost for Swedish energy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Stockholm energytech startup Flower is now acquiring one of Sweden’s largest battery projects. The project, which is a Ready-to-Build 40MW / 80MWh BESS site being developed by the renewable energy actor Arise, will support the Swedish energy system.

title: Zevero raises $7M to bolster carbon accounting
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Zevero, a global carbon accounting platform is proud to announce its inaugural seed funding round. The investment was led by Spiral Capital, with participation from East Ventures and several angel investors. This first raise marks a milestone of Zevero’s ability to grow global sustainability impact.

title: One Click LCA acquires ENVI-met
author: Lucy Adams
summary: One Click LCA, a provider of construction and manufacturing sustainability software, announces its acquisition of ENVI-met, the world’s premier microclimate simulation software. The strategic acquisition combines One Click LCA's comprehensive environmental impact assessments with ENVI-met's advanced urban climate modeling, creating a powerhouse solution for decarbonization and climate-adaptive urban design.

title: Battling the data brokers: How Incogni helps individuals minimise their digital footprint
author: Viesturs Abelis
summary: Cyber threats are rising, with cyberattacks having more than doubled since the pandemic. Companies are facing growing security concerns as malicious actors see increasing opportunities in global digitalisation. However, it's not just companies that need to be cautious. According to the 2022 Annual Data Breach Report by the Identity Theft Resource Center, the number of identity crime victims has gone up nearly 41.5 per cent from 2021.

title: Novakid acquires Lingumi to expand into AI tutoring
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Novakid has acquired UK-based EFL app Lingumi in a landmark deal. The partnership will bring hundreds of thousands of users to Novakid, advancing the mission to make high-quality English education accessible to young learners.

title: Vsim, founded by ex-Nvidia duo, raises $21.5M
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Simulation startup Vsim has raised $21.5m in a seed round led by EQT Ventures with participation from Factorial Fund, Samsung Next, Tru Arrow, Xora (a fully owned subsidiary of Temasek), IQ Capital, Koro Capital, Concept Ventures, Lakestar Scout Fund, Carles Reina. This follows a pre-seed fundraise led by Concept ventures in 2023.

title: Genie's open source web framework for Julia programming language attracts $1.2M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today Barcelona-based open-source startup Genie announced that it raised a $1.2 million Pre-Seed round.

title: Deep-tech Muybridge secures €8M to commericalise its imaging platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Deep-tech Muybridge secures €8M to commericalise its imaging platform. The round, led by Swedish VC firm Fairpoint Capital and supported by existing investors RunwayFBU, Idekapita, Vikingstad Invest, and several angels, marks a pivotal moment in the company’s journey to revolutionize the camera industry by turning cameras into software.

title: Sasha Astafyeva and Don Hoang exit Atomico amid new market reality
author: Dan Taylor
summary: While Atomico is in the final stages of completing two new funds that are 30 percent larger than their predecessors, securing $1.1 billion of a projected $1.35 billion fund, Tech.eu has learned that as a consequence of the new market reality of longer fundraising and deployment cycles, both Sasha Astafyeva and Don Hoang have left the firm.

title: Seaya Andromeda acquires majority stake in Zyclora, Spain's top refurbished bicycle retailer
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Seaya Andromeda, a €300M Pan-European climatetech growth capital fund, has acquired a majority stake in Zyclora/ Bike Ocasión, Spain’s leading refurbished bicycle omnichannel retailer and a major player in the European market. This acquisition aims to accelerate the company’s growth and broaden its presence in strategic European markets.

title: S.Lab secures $100,000 from Google for biodegradable packaging
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: S.Lab, a producer of eco-friendly packaging solutions, has received $100,000 in equity-free funding from Google along with ongoing mentorship, product support, and Cloud credits, as part of the Google for Startups Ukraine Support Fund.

title: Sort A Brick secures €1.15M to expand AI-powered LEGO sorting
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Sort A Brick, a Lithuanian startup, has secured €1,150,000 to scale its AI-powered LEGO brick sorting service, with plans to launch in Germany by 2025.

title: Arkion raises $4M for its energy infrastructure inspection platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Swedish grid inspection company Arkion (formerly known as  Skyqraft) has raised $4 million, bringing its funding to over $10 million.

title: Wegrow secures €7M with a platform that stops companies from reinventing the wheel
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Software startup Wegrow has raised €7 million in a Series A funding round.

title: Shariah-compliant digital bank Ethos looks to shake up industry
author: John Reynolds
summary: A swathe of digital banks targeting specific demographics have sprung up in recent years. In the US, examples include Greenwood, focused on serving black Americans; Cheese Financial, aimed at the Asian community and Majority, serving immigrant groups. Daylight, an online banking provider focused on the LGBTQ community, shut down in 2023.

title: DeepDrive raises €30M Series B for EV motors
author: Lucy Adams
summary: DeepDrive, a high-tech electric motor company, has raised a €30 million Series B funding round. The round was led by Leitmotif –an independent venture capital firm, active in both the U.S. and Europe dedicated to decarbonisation investments – with participation from all existing investors, BMW i Ventures, co-pace – the corporate venture unit of Continental – UVC Partners, and Bayern Kapital through the Wachstumsfond Bayern.

title: €170M fund for spacetech unveiled
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Alpine Space Ventures, a firm dedicated to early-stage investments in the European space sector, today announced the final closing of its first fund with a total volume of €170M.

title: Multi-billion-dollar-valued US fintech Plaid appoints internal exec as new European boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Plaid, the US multi-billion-dollar-valued open banking firm, has restructured its senior management team and appointed a new European boss.

title: Czech digital factory PARTORY receives  €1.25M for global expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Czech digital factory PARTORY has secured a €1.25 million investment from Jet Investment's new fund to develop its software platform and expand into foreign markets.

title: AMLYZE raises €2.35M in Seed funding to fuel next growth phase
author: Lucy Adams
summary: AMLYZE, a RegTech company transforming the anti-financial crime landscape for banks, FinTechs and Virtual Assets Service Providers (VASPs), has raised €2.35M seed funding round. This allows AMLYZE to extend its services to larger corporate and institutional clients.

title: Finnish Biotech startup Uute Scientific's natural approach to atopic dermatitis
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Finnish biotech startup Uute Scientific has published a study on a new supporting treatment for atopic dermatitis based on natural microbial exposure.

title: Slovakia: A rising star in the European tech landscape
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Slovakia's tech ecosystem is rapidly evolving, characterized by a burgeoning startup scene, a highly skilled workforce, and significant government support. Major cities like Bratislava and Košice are emerging as innovation hubs, attracting both local and global tech companies, thanks to cost-effective talent and a strong engineering base.

title: Northvolt VC backer “optimistic” about its future, despite laying off 1,600 workers
author: John Reynolds
summary: Northvolt, the Swedish battery giant, has been given a vote of confidence by one of its VC backers, which says it's “very optimistic” about the startup, despite it recently shedding 1,600 workers.

title: Empowering freelancers in the growing global gig economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Freelancing has become a mainstream form of employment for many people (including myself). Once relegated to side hustles, it has witnessed a global surge due to technological advancements, flexible work arrangements, cost-saving measures for businesses, the increasing popularity of remote work, and a growing preference for independent work styles.

title: Tensor Ventures launches €50M Fund: A boost for quantum, biotech, and climatetech startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week, Tensor Ventures launched a new €50 million fund. The fund aims to give investors access to the most attractive deep tech startups in the Czech Republic and beyond in sectors such as quantum technologies, biotech, security tech, Software 2.0, energy, and climate tech.

title: Luminar Ventures closes second fund at €65M, focusing on AI and fintech in the Nordics
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Luminar Ventures has announced the final close of its second fund at just over €65 million. The Seed capital fund is looking to invest in startups hailing from the Nordic region and is sector agnostic, but says it will have a distinctive leaning towards AI, sustainability, and fintech.

title: Alesi Surgical raises £5M for smoke management tech in operating theatres
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK surgical tech company Alesi has raised £5m in a funding round led by Mercia Ventures, which also included existing investors IP Group and Panakès Partners.

title: Lapsi Health's sound diagnostics device Keikku receives FDA Class II clearance
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Healthcare startup Lapsi Health has announced that its newest innovation, Keikku, has received FDA Class II clearance, setting the stage for its US launch.

title: Iona Star LP announces £22M first close of new AI and data fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI and data venture capital fund Iona Star LP has announced the successful £22 million first close of its new fund.

title: Exein raises €15M for device-level IoT security
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: IoT security company Exein has raised €15 million in a Series B round, bringing their funding to over €23 million.

title: Eleven Ventures backs women's health platform Vivian Lab
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Women’s digital healthcare startup Vivian Lab has completed its first funding round.

title: LimoLane raises €35M to expand its premium mobility offering
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Italian mobility company LimoLane has raised €35 million.

title: Niels Vejrup Carlsen launches Final Frontier: Denmark's first aerospace and defence VC Fund
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Final Frontier, a new Nordic venture capital fund specialising in space and defence technologies, has launched.

title: IW Capital launches £30M growth fund to back UK SMEs
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Growth investor IW Capital is to launch a £30m fund backing UK SMEs following the successful completion of a management buyout. Existing Director and established deal maker Tariq Attia becomes CEO, with experienced entrepreneur and private equity investor Alan Armstrong becoming Chairman.

title: Quantum computing will have its “ChatGPT moment” in the next 18 months, says quantum boss
author: John Reynolds
summary: Quantum computing will have its “ChatGPT moment” in the next 18 months to two years, according to the CEO of a UK quantum computing startup.

title: Syklo acquires Elastopoli, providing a major step forward in the circular economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Finnish Circular economy company Syklo has bought 100 per cent of the share capital of biocomposite company Elastopoli.

title: Translation-X secures €160K for Autism Spectrum Disorder research
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Biozentrum University of Basel spin-out Translation-X has received a further CHF 150,000 (€160,000)  from Venture Kick to address an unmet medical need in autism spectrum disorder.

title: Podimo acquires Danish advertising agency Podads
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Podimo has acquired Danish podcast agency and advertising platform  Podads, to create better growth opportunities for podcasts and bolster podcast advertising in the market.

title: Fuergy raises €16 million to bring intelligent energy storage to more Slovakians.
author: Callum Cyrus
summary: Energy usage algorithms are increasingly working under the hood in consumer-side consumption grids, bringing clean tech efficiencies that also spare their operator a penny or two. The squeeze on global energy supplies is giving rise to further demand for smart energy tech products.

title: Language AI leader DeepL establishes US tech hub, targets Fortune 500
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Language translator DeepL today announced its continued momentum and investment in the US with the opening of its first US Tech Hub in New York City.

title: Ameba raises $7.1M Seed to bolster global supply chains with its analytics platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Ameba, an AI-driven platform helping companies manage their complex supply chains, has today announced a $7.1M Seed round led by Hedosophia. Leading European early-stage investor Visionaries Club reinvested, having led Ameba’s pre-Seed round, and Anamcara also participated.

title: The struggles and concerns of mothers in Venture Capital
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A new report from WVC:E shares the untold stories of mothers in venture capital.

title: Norwegian drone logistics company Aviant high as a Kyte as it launches delivery service and bags €1 million for medicine delivery
author: Fiona Alston
summary: Aviant is a Norwegian drone start-up based in Trondheim. It has just launched a drone home delivery service Kyte which is expected to cover a radius of over 30 kms carrying such items as groceries, ready meals and light medicines - ordered via the Kyte app.

title: ContextSDK bags $4M Seed for  Edge AI in mobile app development
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Mobile app development company ContextSDK, has raised $4 million in Seed funding.

title: Robinhood beefs up EU crypto offering with crypto transfers
author: John Reynolds
summary: Robinhood, the US fintech, is beefing up its EU crypto services by offering its customers the opportunity to deposit and withdraw more than 20 cryptocurrencies, including Bitcoin.

title: Visma strengthens HR tech offering in Chile with acquisition of Rex+ Group
author: Lucy Adams
summary: With the acquisition of Rex+ Group, Visma extends its HR portfolio in Latin America and strengthens its position and relevance in this market.

title: HERO software secures €40M Series B for tradespeople SaaS platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: HERO Software SaaS platform for trade SMEs in the DACH region, has closed a €40 million Series B financing round.

title: Peratech raises $31.5M for tactile sensing and haptics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Peratech, a provider of force and haptic-based user interfaces, has raised $31.5M which will be used to accelerate profitable revenue growth in proven products.

title: UK SME digital bank Zempler Bank says rebrand costs hundreds of thousands of pounds
author: John Reynolds
summary: UK SME bank Cashplus has this week officially rebranded as Zempler Bank, in a brand overhaul which the bank says has cost hundreds of thousands of pounds and was two years in the making. The bank made the change, because the name Cashplus, launched in 2005, had become outdated for a digital bank in an increasingly cashless age.

title: Legaltech startup Fynk secures $3.5M for AI-driven legal tools
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Legaltech startup fynk has raised $3.5 million to bring AI-driven legal workflow tools to non-legal teams

title: Adtech Magfi raises $1.1M in round led by Eleven Ventures
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Magfi, a SaaS that enables simultaneous advertising across Telegram and Discord communities through machine learning and AI technologies, has secured $1.1M in Seed funding. The round is led by the Bulgarian-based fund Eleven Ventures, renowned for its investments in unicorns like Payhawk. Svetozar Georgiev from Eleven Ventures will join the Magfi board, bringing valuable expertise to support the company's growth.

title: Carmoola completes £100M debt deal with NatWest to lower second hand car rates
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK-based fintech Carmoola car finance, has made a major new debt deal with NatWest, worth £100M.

title: RIVRS raises  €4M for UGC video game creation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: French start-up RIVRS, specializing in the creation of UGC video games, announces its first round of funding of €4M. Exclusively led by Pléiade Venture, this financing should enable it to multiply the creation of games on Roblox, Fortnite, Minecraft and other platforms, as well as prepare its international expansion.

title: “We are starting to see interest from continental Europe,” says startup looking to shake up banking industry
author: John Reynolds
summary: A UK startup founded by a former Barclays Bank CEO which provides banking technology for JP Morgan’s UK digital bank says it has not seen as much growth across Europe as it wants but it’s “starting to see quite a lot of interest” across the continent.

title: $55.5M growth round to boost Submer’s "greener" datacenters
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Submer has raised $55.5M led by M&G. The investment comes from its £5 billion purpose-led Catalyst strategy, with Barclays Bank Ireland PLC acting as the placement agent to Submer. Among existing investors, Planet First Partners and Norrsken VC reinvested alongside M&G, and together with Mundi Ventures, reaffirmed their support as strong backers of Submer’s strong financial position and growth potential.

title: Finnish climate tech secures €1M to decarbonize industrial heat
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Finnish climate tech startup, TheStorage, has secured €1 million in funding from 2C Ventures and Superhero Capital to address one of the largest challenges in green transition – decarbonizing industrial heat.

title: German unicorn Solaris "on the right track", after job cuts and axing major parts of business unit
author: John Reynolds
summary: German unicorn Solaris has been through “some tough times” but is “on the right track", after making job cuts and writing off the value of one of its business units, says its CEO.

title: UK challenger bank Starling stung with £29m fine over “shockingly lax” screening checks
author: John Reynolds
summary: One of the UK’s top challenger banks has been fined £29m by the UK financial regulator for “shockingly lax” financial screening controls.

title: UK unicorn Zilch plans to boost headcount by 150 to 450 as says on target for full-year profit
author: John Reynolds
summary: London-based Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) fintech Zilch said today (Thursday) it plans to increase its UK headcount by 150 to around 450 staff, as it says it’s on course to make a full year-profit.

title: Irish HRtech startup Wrksense raises €825k Pre-Seed
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Irish AI-driven HR tech startup Wrksense today announced that it has raised €825,000 in Pre-Seed funding to fuel its global expansion and product innovation.

title: Reform RX raises $5.1M to level up personalised pilates
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Reform RX  has secured $5.1M in funding, led by Clarendon Fund Managers - the equity fund manager for the Investment Fund for Northern Ireland.

title: Circuland raises €750k for green construction tech
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Circuland, a London-based pioneering startup focused on enabling circular economy practices within the construction industry through Digital Material Passports, today announced the successful closure of a €750k pre-seed funding round. The round was led by Apeiron Ventures with participation from Astylab Ventures.

title: Voliro's $12M capital boost for advanced industrial inspection drones
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Drone aerial robotics company Voliro has secured $12 million in Series A funding. This new funding brings Voliro’s total capital raised to $22 million and will accelerate the company’s mission to make industrial inspection, maintenance, and repair work at height safer, more efficient, and cost-effective.

title: SuperLight Photonics Secures Seed Investment from Hamamatsu Ventures
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: SuperLight Photonics, a pioneer in cutting-edge laser technology, today announced the strategic investment of Hamamatsu Ventures to drive long-term synergy in laser innovation.

title: WhiteBridge raises $500,000 for AI-powered reputation management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: WhiteBridge, an AI-powered platform specialising in online reputation management and digital footprint platform, has raised $500,000 in a pre-seed funding round led by FIRSTPICK, with participation from Scalewolf, First Degree, and Nectolabs.

title: Secure Spanish growth with ICEX Invest in Spain: Rising Up
author: Lucy Adams
summary: It’s a pivotal moment for Spain’s tech ecosystem as scaling capital pours in and business leaders rely on the country for transcontinental links. Madrid and Barcelona have become globally renowned as their high proportion of STEM talent fuels new ventures. As a result, new entrants face more competition than ever.

title: MELIUS Cyber raises £500,000 for cyber risk detection platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: MELIUS Cyber, a Newcastle-based company whose platform helps businesses to detect cyber risks within hours,  has raised a further £500,000 from the North East Venture Fund, supported by the European Regional Development Fund and managed by Mercia.

title: RTDT Laboratories raises CHF 150,000 to optimise wind turbine fleet operation
author: Lucy Adams
summary: ETH spin-off RTDT has raised a preliminary funding round for its hardware-software solution, Aerosense. This sensor system gathers aerodynamic, acoustic, and structural data from turbine blades, which is then analyzed using RTDT’s advanced methods to provide comprehensive aero-acoustic and structural assessments of wind turbines. These insights enable better turbine control, improved design, and more efficient maintenance, ultimately boosting the performance and profitability of both individual turbines and entire fleets.

title: Top global AI leaders to gather in Valencia for the 7th edition of VDS
author: Tech.eu
summary: Top global AI leaders will gather on the 23rd and 24th of October for the seventh edition of VDS in Valencia. The international tech event organized by Startup Valencia will analyze the challenges and opportunities of artificial intelligence and its transformative impact on society. The event aims to address the market demands created by this technology, which is revolutionizing every aspect of the world: development, integration, application, and investment.

title: Sweav launches first Private Equity community in the Netherlands
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Following the successful establishment of a community of over 250 professionals specialising in strategy and mergers and acquisitions, Amsterdam-based startup Sweav is now launching the first private equity (PE) community in the Netherlands.

title: Glovo becomes the first industry app to merge social media features with food discovery
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: It takes a lot of bravery to fly in a motley crew of journalists to Barcelona to showcase the release of an app feature pilot. We're busy, easily distracted by the newscycle and a touch snarky.

title: Harmonic Security raises $17.5M Series A for zero-touch data protection
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Joint London and San Francisco-based Harmonic Security has secured $17.5M in Series A funding to bring its “zero-touch data protection” capabilities to enterprises. Total funding has now reached more than $26M since the company launched in October last year with enterprise customers already in double figures.

title: Neuphonic raises £3M fo text-to-speech Voice AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Neuphonic, a UK startup redefining human-AI communication with the world’s fastest text-to-speech technology, has raised £3 million in pre-seed funding. The round was led by Moonfire VC, one of the top 10 data-driven VCs in the world, based on the percentage of engineers in the team, with participation from Tiny VC, Salica Oryx Fund, and Cur8 Capital.

title: Germany-based startup A4ord offers a solution to appointment scheduling woes
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: A4ord, a Germany-based startup, announced today the launch of its online marketplace catalog to address challenges in the European service industry. The online booking platform is designed to solve the problem of easily finding and booking the most popular services for consumers.

title: Crypto "not a focus" for Checkout.com, as it concentrates on e-commerce and fintech partners
author: John Reynolds
summary: Crypto is a “not a focus” for European payment processor Checkout.com, which is continuing to concentrate on its core e-commerce and fintech partners, says one of its bosses.

title: Pocuter launches Kickstarter for Spectra smartwatch: A blend of high-end features and maker possibilities
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Pocuter Inc, renowned for the success of Pocuter One — a coin-sized microcomputer, today launches a Kickstarter campaign for their newest innovation - the Pocuter Spectra smartwatch.

title: Open source platform Edgee secures Pre-Seed funding for data transformation
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Open source edge computing platform Edgee has raised $2.9 million in pre-seed funding from Serena and VentureFriends to accelerate its mission of transforming data collection and application performance through edge computing.

title: The fintech funding landscape: Top 10 seed deals of 2024 so far
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: In the first three quarters of 2024, fintech companies have demonstrated remarkable resilience and innovation, raising nearly €9 billion across over 344 deals.

title: Constellation Technologies & Operations secures €9.3M for satellite internet access
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Constellation Technologies & Operations, a startup developing a constellation of satellites to empower telecom operators to deliver high-speed, low-latency internet access from space, has secured €9.3 million in funding.

title: AI startup Runware sets record inference times, raises $3M funding
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: UK-founded AI workload startup Runware has raised $3 million from A16Z’s Speedrun, LakeStar's Halo II, Lunar Ventures, Begin Capital, Zero Prime, and others.

title: Health tech and life sciences lead the way for UK VC investment in Q3
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Health and life sciences is one of the fastest growing sectors for UK venture capital (VC), according to new analysis from HSBC Innovation Banking UK and Dealroom. Homegrown startups in the health and life sciences sector collectively raised $2.3B so far in 2024, including nearly $1 billion in Q3 alone. This marks the highest investment in any UK sector this quarter, placing health and life sciences in joint second place with enterprise software and behind fintech for the year to date, up from fifth in Q2.

title: AviLabs secures €8M to reduce airline passenger disruption
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Iceland-based Frumtak Ventures has led an €8 million investment in AviLabs whose technology, Plan3, is redefining how airlines handle these challenges.

title: Q3 2024’s Seed deal boom: Europe’s top tech startups to watch
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Tech.eu Q3 2024 Report reveals that European tech companies raised €11 billion across 891 deals during the third quarter.

title: node.vc Closes €71M fund for Nordic entrepreneurs
author: Lucy Adams
summary: node.vc, a Nordic early-stage venture capital firm led by veterans of leading startups and scaleups (including eye tracking scaleup Tobii and Tobii Dynavox and video game pioneers Paradox Interactive), has closed a €71mn fund, to double down on building an ecosystem for entrepreneurs.

title: BPF invests €50M in Indico VC Fund II
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Banco Português de Fomento (BPF), manager of the Capitalization and Resilience Fund (FdCR), announced today an increase from €35 million to €50 million in the Indico VC Fund II, managed by Indico Capital Partners.

title: Sony and Raspberry Pi's AI camera offers a new era of economical intelligent vision sensing tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today, Sony Semiconductor Solutions Corporation (SSS) and Raspberry Pi announced the launch of their jointly designed AI Camera.

title: LyondellBasell acquires APK: a move towards circular economy
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Rotterdam company LyondellBasell (LYB) today announced it became full owner of APK AG in Merseburg, Germany.

title: Top Swedish VC writes off investment in Walgreens backed VillageMD
author: John Reynolds
summary: A top Swedish VC firm has written off its investment in the troubled Walgreens-backed US clinic business VillageMD, amid “heightened uncertainty” about its future.

title: Formality raises €8M in first round to simplify contract management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Formality, a platform dedicated to intelligent contract management for clients and suppliers, has announced today that it has raised €8 million.

title: 20VC's 3rd Fund skyrockets to $400M, backed by MIT Investment and RIT Capital Partners
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: 20VC, the London-based investment firm run by Harry Stebbings, announced today that it has raised its third fund, sized at $400 million - to be split between Seed ($125 million) and Series A ($275 million). Today’s announcement marks a 2.5x increase in fund size from 20VC’s second fund of $140 million in June 2021, at a time when many are struggling to fundraise.

title: INSHUR's digital rideshare insurance attracts a further $19M
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Embedded insurance provider for the on-demand economy  INSHUR has raised $19 million in its latest funding round, bringing the company’s funding to  $78.5 million.

title: Dexory raises $80M in Series B for robotics and data Intelligence
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Robotics and data intelligence company Dexory  has successfully closed an $80 million Series B funding round.

title: Wazoku powers One Big Thing: empowering UK civil servants to drive change
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The UK Government has launched One Big Thing, an innovation programme that aims to inspire civil servants to make small, impactful changes that spark innovation across departments.

title: Mountside Ventures pioneers VC accelerator programme for early-stage managers
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Accelerator and early-stage advisory firm Mountside Ventures has announced their inaugural VC accelerator programme to empower emerging VC managers,

title: Pan-European cybersecurity giant Conscia expands with PlanNet21 acquisition
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Conscia, a pan-European provider of cybersecurity and networking solutions for mission-critical IT infrastructure in large organisations has acquired PlanNet21 Group (PlanNet21 Communications Ltd, Agile Networks Ltd, and eCom Solutions Ltd), a g provider of cybersecurity, networking, and managed services operating in the Irish and UK markets.

title: Last week recap: European tech companies raised over €956M, around 73% collected by 10 biggest deals
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: Last week, we tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €956 million, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe.

title: AMBOSS acquires Novaheal to strengthen its position in the German nursing market
author: Lucy Adams
summary: AMBOSS, the leading medical knowledge and learning platform in Germany, has announced its acquisition of Novaheal, an EdTech startup that developed an innovative platform for nursing education. This acquisition positions AMBOSS as a comprehensive digital partner for the two largest healthcare professions – physicians and nurses – providing them with professional tools for education, training, and daily practice.

title: UK crypto outfit Ziglu buys retail arm of Gibraltar-based crypto payments firm
author: John Reynolds
summary: A UK app founded by a Starling Bank co-founder that allows retail investors to buy cryptocurrencies is to acquire the retail arm of a Gibraltar-based crypto payments firm, as it extends its footprint across Europe.

title: Shiftmove acquires Optimum Automotive
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Shiftmove, a German-Swiss platform for fleet management software, is acquiring the French digital fleet management platform Optimum Automotive.

title: UK-based Surfboard acquired by customer intelligence platform Dialpad
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Dialpad, an AI-powered communications intelligence platform has comenced the strategic acquisition of Surfboard, a workforce management company, the appointment of longtime board member Jen Grant as Chief Marketing Officer (CMO), and the addition of veteran Security leader Atit Shah as the company’s first Chief Security Officer (CSO).

title: Monzo launches transparent blue expense cards, as Monzo Business tops 500,000 customers
author: John Reynolds
summary: Monzo is launching a subscription plan to help its business customers simplify their expense administration as the UK challenger bank tops 500,000 business customers.

title: Tebi, founded by Adyen alumni, secures €20M to boost retail and hospitality SMEs
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Tebi, an all-in-one financial platform for independent hospitality and retail businesses, has raised €20 million in funding.

title: AI-startup Briink raises €3.85 million to help ESG teams verify and benchmark their sustainability data
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Briink, a Berlin-based AI startup dedicated to empowering ESG and sustainability teams, today announced a €3.85 million Seed funding round. The round was co-led by EquityPitcher Ventures and 13books Capital, with participation from existing investors Merantix, seed + speed Ventures, and notable angel investors.

title: Zerve raises $7.6M Seed to streamline developer data workflows
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Zerve, the data science and AI development platform that empowers code-first data teams to cut cycle times by up to 9x, announced today that it has raised a seed round of $7.6 million.

title: Fundcraft partners with PE platform Moonfare
author: Lucy Adams
summary: UK-based Moonfare, a digital platform for private equity investing, will go live using fundcraft’s fund administration infrastructure.

title: EIB invests €34M in Vay's Teledriving tech expansion in Europe
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The European Investment Bank (EIB) is lending €34 million to German teledriving technology startup Vay to help it develop its operations in Europe.

title: Energy services startup Hometree raises £50M mezzanine facility to lead UK home decarbonisation
author: Lucy Adams

title: VDS unveils cutting-edge agenda for its seventh edition on October 23-24 in Valencia
author: Tech.eu
summary: VDS has announced the agenda for its seventh edition, which will take place on October 23rd and 24th at the City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia. Under the theme "Embracing evolution: Invest in the leaders of tomorrow," this edition will analyze how the current technological revolution is positively impacting society through the voices of leading figures in the global innovation ecosystem.

title: Fraggell partners with D2C brands to expand into US e-commerce
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Digital marketing agency Fraggell is celebrating substantial financial, commercial and geographical growth after scaling dramatically within both the UK and US eCommerce and retail markets and increasing its revenue fivefold.

title: Nuclera raises $75M Series C for eProtein discovery system
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Biotech Nuclera has raised a  $75 million Series C financing round. This brings the company’s funding to over $140 million.

title: $267M for remittance firm Zepz, Slovenia’s tech landscape, and  key trends and investment in September
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: This week we tracked more than 70 tech funding deals worth over €926 million, and over 5 exits, M&A transactions, rumours, and related news stories across Europe. In addition to this week's top financials, we've also indexed the most important/industry-related news items you need to know about.

title: Flip acquires The Bot Platform to merge their HR capabilities
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Flip, an app for frontline employees, has today announced its acquisition of The Bot Platform, an enterprise software solution that helps HR and communication teams supercharge the way they work using bots, automated workflows, and AI agents.

title: Banked makes Aussie acquisition and calls for big brands to get behind US account-to-account payments
author: John Reynolds
summary: The co-founder of Bank of America-backed online payments startup Banked has called on big brands to support account-to-account (A2A) payments in the US.

title: Restaurant platform Buyers Edge acquires Parsly for its analytics prowess
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swedish-based Parsly, an AI-powered platform that analyzes purchasing data to help restaurants save time and money, is acquired by Buyers Edge Platform, an US technology company in the restaurant industry. The acquisition enables Parsly to continue developing its platform and expand further into Europe and to the US.

title: Boost for blind navigation: Lighthouse Tech's smart eyewear gets €160k funding boost
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Switzerland-based Lighthouse Tech has received a further CHF 150,000  (€160,000)  from Venture Kick to bring its innovative smart eyewear to market.

title: Omnea raises $20M for AI-powered procurement and supplier risk management
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Omnea, an AI-powered procurement orchestration and supplier risk management platform, has raised $20 million in Series A funding to make procurement painless and give companies greater control over their spend.

title: Vendorvue raises €1.4M for automated compliance software
author: Lucy Adams
summary: With €1.4 million in new funding, SaaS Vendorvue plans to enhance its AI-driven platform, grow its team, and expand across Europe.

title: 1s1 Energy secures $1.4M Seed funding for green hydrogen production
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Green hydrogen production tech company 1s1 Energy today announced the successful completion of a $1.4 million Seed funding round.

title: Munchfam secures €600K to reduce the restaurant failure rate
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: 80 percent of restaurants fail within five years. Munchfam has secured €600K to change this

title: Belgian startup StriveCloud raises $1.5M to enhance digital customer loyalty and retention
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Belgian gamification software startup StriveCloud has raised $1.5 million to increase customer retention and loyalty from digital applications.

title: Round Treasury secures $2.1M pre-seed to simplify treasury management
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Round Treasury, a banking and treasury platform, has closed a $2.1M Pre-Seed funding round. The investment round was led by Passion Capital (early backers of Monzo, Tide and GoCardless) with participation from Tiny VC, Ascension, Samos Investments and Entrepreneur First. The round also attracted support from prominent fintech figures, including Darren Westlake (founder of Crowdcube), Simon Taylor (11FS), Pranav Sood (GM of Airwallex), and former executives from Stripe and Starling. Several of Round's early customers also participated as angel investors.

title: Synergi raises $2M Seed for the future of virtual power plants and energy flexibility
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Finnish energytech company Synergi has raised €2 million Seed funding.

title: Turkish startup Paket Mutfak raises $2.7M for cloud kitchen software expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Turkish cloud kitchen software startup Paket Mutfak has raised  $2.7 million, bringing its funding to $8.5 million.

title: Dutch insurance analytics company Onesurance raises seed round led by Curiosity VC
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Onesurance, the leading company in AI solutions for the insurance industry, announced its seed investment led by Curiosity VC. The amount is undisclosed.

title: FaceUp raises $3M to scale HR platform globally
author: Lucy Adams
summary: FaceUp, an anonymous reporting platform fostering a speak-up culture within professional and academic environments, has closed a $3 million late seed round.

title: BMLL secures $21M for investment analytics platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: BMLL, an independent provider of, historical Level 3, 2 and 1 data and analytics across global equity, ETFs and futures markets, has raised raised $21m with Optiver as the lead investor.

title: Boryszew Group S.A.  boosts EIT InnoEnergy's green industrial future with new investment
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Today EIT InnoEnergy welcomes Boryszew Group S.A., a global player in the automotive and metals industries, as its newest shareholder.

title: Exploring Slovenia’s tech landscape
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: The Slovenian tech ecosystem is rapidly emerging as a hub of innovation, driven by a strong focus on research and development, a skilled workforce, and government support.

title: How UP Catalyst's circular carbon solution challenges Chinese dominance
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: When you think of tech around carbon emissions, you probably think of carbon capture and storage. But we're currently seeing the rise of novel technologies that turn CO2 emissions from pollutants to be captured and stored into physical ingredients with the potential to become a valuable resource in the circular carbon economy.

title: Swedish unicorn Trustly says IPO “not around the corner”, despite appointing IPO-experienced CFO
author: John Reynolds
summary: Swedish payments unicorn Trustly says it's unlikely to IPO in the next 24 months, despite yesterday appointing a CFO who oversaw Deliveroo’s listing in the UK.

title: The big league: The most funded European fintech companies of 2024 so far
author: Tamara Djurickovic
summary: European fintech companies are at the forefront of innovation, transforming the financial landscape across the continent. With a rich ecosystem of startups and established players, these companies leverage technology to enhance financial services, making them more accessible, efficient, and user-friendly.

title: Belgium's tech ecosystem maturing: key findings from the 2024 State of Belgian Tech Report
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Syndicate One, Bain & Company and Sofina have joined forces to conduct data-driven and qualitative research into Belgium’s maturing technology startup and investment ecosystems.

title: Investor duo launch new healthtech VC firm
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Digital health investors David Buller and Laurent van Lerberghe have announced the launch of KELES. This new venture capital firm will focus on making digital health growth investments across Europe, with the aim of bridging the gap between startup innovation, international scaling and global impact.

title: STAC Invest Syndicate offers £150k boost to Scottish 'smart things' startups
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: The Smart Things Accelerator Centre (STAC) has lined up an investment fund and partnered with the National Robotarium to support the next generation of “smart things” entrepreneurs in Scotland.

title: Albatross raises €3M formation round to drive user engagement
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Swiss AI startup Albatross today announced a €3M funding round led by redalpine, with participation from Daphni. Albatross is set to transform user engagement across eCommerce, media, and online marketplaces with AI-driven personalization, unlocking unprecedented conversions and revenue growth for businesses.

title: RedTrack raises $3.2M to equip media buyers with analytics
author: Lucy Adams
summary: RedTrack, an AI-driven analytics and automation platform for media buyers, has closed a $3.2M Series A funding round. The round was led by LeadVentures with participation from InstaVC, IronWolfCapital, and angel investor Balazs Gandera.

title: WithLess secures €3M to help businesses save on unused software
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: WithLess, the innovative startup that eliminates wasted time and money in the acquisition and management of enterprise software, has secured €3 million funding.

title: Blecon raises $4.6M to enhance Bluetooth’s potential for commercial IoT deployments
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Blecon has raised $4.6 million Seed funding, advancing its mission to unlock the full potential of Bluetooth Low Energy for IoT Connectivity.

title: Electronic excellence to return to Hong Kong with Electronics Fair Autumn Edition
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Hong Kong has long been a nerve center in the global electronics ecosystem, bridging East and West with its strategic location, world-class infrastructure and proximity to manufacturing prowess.

title: French fintech Kriptown raises €4.2M for blockchain-based SME stock exchange
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: French fintech Kriptown has secured €4.2 million Series A funding to build the first European stock exchange dedicated to SMEs, under the European DLT Pilot Regime, allowing for the creation of financial markets built on blockchain technology.

title: forward earth raises €4.5M to expand AI-powered environmental management platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: AI-powered environmental management software company forward earth has raised €4.5 million in Seed funding.

title: Generare raises €5M to scale the discovery of new medicines and molecules hiding in microbes
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Generare, a biotech uncovering the next generation of medicines and high-value molecules hiding in soil bacteria, has raised €5M in Seed funding from Teampact.ventures, Galion.Exe and EU-backed VIVES Partners, to bring its “discovery factory” to life. Synbioven, Saras Capital and Better Angle also participated among a host of renowned business angels.

title: Edtech Revyze raises $6M for GenZ social learning app
author: Lucy Adams

title: Vonovia and Founders Factory invest in WALLROUND's energy-efficient home renovation platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: WALLROUND is the first startup to receive both capital and expertise from the joint PropTech Venture Studio of Founders Factory and Vonovia, bolstering its growth ambitions.

title: Save YouTube videos: 2 solutions that work
author: Tech.eu
summary: Ever been stuck on a long journey with no internet and a dying data plan?

title: Building Radar secures $7.2M to expand its sales software internationally
author: Lucy Adams

title: Lovable raises $7.5M for GPT Engineer
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Lovable, a platform aiming to allow anyone to create software, has closed a $7.5M pre-Seed funding round. The round was led by Hummingbird VC and byFounders VC, top Nordic funds and angel syndicates, as well as Deepmind angel operators, prominent founders of global AI companies, angel investors Mattias Miksche  and Bjarke Klinge Staun, Shopify’s Siavash Ghorbani Voi’s Fredrik Hjelm, and Creandum co-founder Stefan Lindeberg.

title: Kodano Group secures €9M to accelerate international expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Kodano Group, one of the leading sellers of optical products in Poland, has secured €9 million from the Vinci Da Gama Fund, managed by Vinci S.A. The Polish manufacturer and distributor of lenses and eyewear frames has a retail network of over 100 own and franchise optical stores, and in recent years has strongly focused on expanding its e-commerce model in the CEE region. The raised capital will be used to accelerate its expansion into European markets and enhance the development of its laboratory, where optical lenses are produced.

title: Lightdash raises $11M Series A for open source self-serve data analytics platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Open source business intelligence platform Lightdash has raised $11 million Series A to accelerate the adoption of self-serve data analytics for modern teams.

title: Perlego raises $20M to scale up its edtech with AI
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Perlego, a subscription-based digital library providing unlimited access to academic titles, has secured $20 million in the latest funding round led by former Tesco CEO, Sir Terry Leahy. ITHAKA, the company behind JSTOR, the digital library of academic journals and books, has also supported Perlego on its mission to provide accessible learning materials.

title: Paebbl raises $25M to supercharge carbon storage in the built environment
author: Lucy Adams

title: AgTech xFarm raises €36M to accelerate geographic expansion
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Xfarm Technologies, an agritech that helps to digitalise the agri-food sector and make it more sustainable, has raised €36 million in a Series C funding round.

title: sallea secures $2.6M for its 3D Scaffolds for cell cultivated meat
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Foodtech startup Sallea is today announcing a $2.6 million funding round to help manufacturers of cultivated foods accelerate the production of premium whole cuts like steaks and fillets without animal farming.

title: Basecamp Research raises $60M Series B to fuel AI advancements in life sciences
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Basecamp Research, an AI company dedicated to solving the most pressing challenges in the life sciences today announced it has completed a $60 million Series B financing led by Singular, bringing its funding to date to to $85 million.

title: Fintech Zepz scores $267M to expand cross-border payments platform
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Zepz, previously known as WorldRemit, a leader in the money transfer sector, has successfully raised $267M to expand into African markets.

title: Presto Ventures and Czechoslovak Group launch Presto Tech Horizons Fund targeting dual-use tech
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Venture capital firm Presto Ventures and Michal Strnad's industrial and technology group Czechoslovak Group (CSG) have launched an investment fund Presto Tech Horizons.

title: Starship Technologies raises $90M for autonomous last-mile delivery expansion
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Estonian delivery robot company Starship Technologies announced today that it has raised $90 million, co-led by Plural and Iconical.

title: Amsterdam startup Sparqle secures €1.2M for sustainable delivery platform
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Amsterdam delivery platform startup Sparqle announced the successful completion of a €1.2 million investment round.

title: DefendEye launches fully autonomous dual-use drone
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Krakow-based startup DefendEye has launched what it calls the world’s first fully autonomous dual-use drone, designed to support rescue and defence operations.

title: Robinhood launches delayed margin trading in UK
author: John Reynolds
summary: US investing app Robinhood is today (Monday) beefing up its UK offering, adding a form of trading in which investors borrow money to make bigger trades. Robinhood, which disrupted the US investing market with commission-free trading, said it’s launching margin trading “with some of the most competitive rates in the industry”.

title: Satellite wildfire detector OroraTech raises €25M Series B
author: Lucy Adams
summary: OroraTech, a company using thermal satellites and AI to predict and prevent wildfires, has raised a €25M investment, backed by the European Circular Bioeconomy Fund (ECBF).

title: Vivid Mind allows doctors to test for dementia by the sound of a patient's voice
author: Lucy Adams
summary: Warsaw-based Vivid Mind has produced a short voice test that leverages artificial intelligence (Ai) and leading-edge sound processing technology for early detection of dementia. Initial results have shown to have a high degree of accuracy with minimal false positives. The non-invasive Vivid Mind screening test has the potential to address one of major challenges of the dementia issue which is to significantly boost the percentage of senior adults who get tested from the current 20% level in the US to more than 50 percent. This one move could save millions of life years by enabling a proactive lifestyle approach involving among others, diet and other wellness changes in the US alone.

title: 72 new companies join the EIC Scaling Club, which aims to turn 20% of its members into unicorns
author: Arden Papucciyan
summary: 72 scale-ups from 24 countries across Europe have been selected to join the European Innovation Council's (EIC) Scaling Club – an exclusive community of 120+ most promising deep tech scaleups from the region. The newcomers to the Club were announced at the Scale 100 Forum, a community event held on 21-22 October in Athens, Greece.

title: Opteran's neuromorphic software offers a  new era for autonomous space robotics
author: Cate Lawrence
summary: Opteran, the natural intelligence company has announced its work with  Airbus Defence and Space with support from European Space Agency (ESA) and the UK Space Agency will test the Opteran Mind, its general purpose neuromorphic software, in Airbus space rovers.

title: Resurge Growth Partners launches €120m Venture Equity Fund
author: Lucy Adams
summary: London-based Resurge Growth Partners has launched its new “venture equity” vehicle designed to bridge the critical gap between venture capital and private equity for high-potential European and Israeli scaleups. Resurge will invest over €120m via the vehicle over the next three years, with nearly half of the capital already committed from the founding GPs and a leading family office.

title: The importance of network when scaling
author: EIT Urban Mobility
summary: As our urban centers continue to expand, we face significant challenges related to mobility. European cities “...take up only 4% of the EU’s land area, but they are home to 75% of EU citizens” according to EU Mission: Climate-Neutral and Smart Cities. Startups and entrepreneurs are playing an increasingly vital role in addressing the challenges which continue to emerge from this shift. This role takes many shapes depending on the issue in sight.
